text: DELICIOUS! forgot to take a before picture but as you can see it was amazing. We got 2 kinds of ribs, brisket & chicken and literally every single one fell straight off the bone! Sides were all good. Cornbread before & sugar donuts after. Will definitely be back.
Clothes code for a BBQ place?! Puh-leeze! BBQ isn't considered as gourmet cuisine. It's a fucking barbecue place! Owners are pathetic.

Just finished a terrific dinner at this great barbeque restaurant.  From the sangria, frozen lemonade and cornbread to the baby back ribs, mac & cheese and coleslaw, it was all excellent.  Service was friendly, portions were generous and food was out very quickly.  The free take away bag of sugar donuts was a wonderful end for a delicious dinner.  Even at 5:30 on a Sunday night the restaurant was full and a reservation helped us to be seated promptly.

I wanted seafood & my hubby wanted steak. I found this place off my phone & it had good ratings. Let me say. The service was very good. We ordered & we had no long wait! (really fast) The food was GREAT. The atmosphere was cool & the service was on top of it. We will be back.

Awesome place!! The outside patio was great and the food even better. I had the baby back ribs they were perfection fall off the bone. My gf had the rotisserie chicken and she couldn't stop eating. We'll definitely be back!!

This place is really awesome ! My buddy and I were here for the first time today. I wasn't too sure about it at first but the service here is GREAT! 

I had their pork baby back ribs with mash potatoes and beans.. If you like ribs you have to try these ribs they were really really good! (Ask for a side of the BBQ source) 

Our server was on point with everything super friendly! I give her a 10 :) 

We also got 10% off our bill for checking in using the yelp app so make sure you do that for the discount ;)

AZ BBQ Skeptic officially converted!  I've long been unconvinced of 'good' BBQ in AZ.  I've tried them all and not been impressed to say the least.  I'm kind of spoiled with good BBQ and a bit of a snob because where I'm from, Texas, BBQ is a religion; much like chili and football.  But alas!  I have found BBQ, very good BBQ here in AZ, at Bobby Q's.  We ordered a platter of beef ribs, brisket and pulled pork.  It was properly 'Texas' sized too!  I can't even tell you how tender the beef was because my description will not justify it.  I will tell you, the VERY thick, juicy and tasty meat literally fell off the VERY large bone when simply picked up from the plate.  The pulled pork was just as good but that's not hard to mess up.  The real BBQ gauge for me was in the brisket.   And again, I must confess, no description of mine will get even remotely close to how heavenly it truly was.  It far exceeded my expectation and I'll just say, the bar I set was very high!  So, I'm a fan of this BBQ as long as it stays as is, where is.  I'll close by saying the mac-n-cheese rocked and my incredible dinner finale of peach cobbler would have made my Granny proud!   This is truly a "don't miss" eatery!
this place never fails to amaze me! great atmosphere and service and the food is unbelievable. the catfish is amazing!

One of the worst restaurants I have ever came across the service was horrible and the mangers have no class nor customer service on how u treat ur customers we came from an angel spring training game and had 1 drink at the bar we sat for 30min until we finally asked where our drinks were and was told we were not being servered cause we were intoxicated witch was false we were told to leave cause we asked questions on why were weren't being servered not only were we treated unfairly for no reason  they profiled us for no reason..I will never go back and the most horrible service and experience EVER..they need to train there managers and employees on how to treat there customers WROST PlACE EVER

Fast on refills, even provided a to-go cup when requested.
Ordered the 3 meat platter and received large portions.  Baby back ribs and brisket were tender.  Chicken was just a little dry in some areas.
Servers and cashiers coordinated very well for a party of ~20 people.  All food was delivered at approximately the same time.  Checks were split without problems.
Fresh, complimentary cinnamon doughnuts were super tasty.
Best BBQ food I've had in a long time. Jason, our server, was knowledgeable and very pleasant. Overall a great place for dinner.
Great BBQ food...have to try the Brisket it's soo tender, melts in your mouth. Great decor, chill ambience. Our bartender Chelsea was very nice and attentive.

The food was amazing!!! Be sure to try the brisket, pulled pork and mac & cheese! You can't go wrong with whatever you order. Great experience...highly recommend!! Can't forget our awesome waitress...Ashlynn!!!

What a great BBQ dinner. We ordered the Hog Heaven and bread with queso dip, and both were spot on. The Hog heaven was enough for 3-4 people and with just the 2 of us, we ended up taking a lot of leftovers and enjoyed them a lot for the next few days. The grilled corn, coleslaw and mac and cheese went perfect with the BBQ. I liked the memphis more than the baby back (they were a bit on the dry side), and the chicken was super juicy. The surprise package was the sausage which my wife absolutely loved (she is not much of a sausage fan - so that says a lot). 

Definitely recommended if you're a local or visiting from out of town.
Exceptional food and atmosphere we will come again bbq and smoke flavor great the prime rib was the best . We sat in the patio loved it.

I am not a big BBQ person but talk about comfort food at its finest! Bobby Q had the best ribs and pulled pork I've ever had. I cannot wait to bring my dad here!! Can't think of a better restaurant pick for Father's Day!
And those donuts, what a yummy surprise!
Our server Jessica was awesome and the food is unreal. Ribs are best ever! The corn, potatoes and cornbread are great. Atmosphere is comfortable and prices are reasonable!

Wow...this restaurant is amazing. We were visiting from California and were looking for some good BBQ. We found this place on yelp, read the views, and decided to check it out.  The service was great, the waiters were friendly, thoughtful and very knowledgeable, and really went the extra mile in providing my large group with great customer service. 

The food was spectacular, made to order, served hot, and good portions. The ambiance was good as well, exhibiting warmth within a family-friendly atmosphere. 

The only downside to our experience was that we live in California, so we could only visit Bobby Q's when we travel to AZ.

For those wanting some of the best barbeque in the United States, try this place out!

Bobby Qs is the best great decor fantastic food! The ribs are to die for sand the corn bread is so darn good. 
Been to the Mesa and Phoenix locations.
It's now one of my favorite places.

The best BBQ I have ever had!! My husband is a rib lover and said he has never had ribs like these... not to mention they have great staff!! Chelsea our waitress was great never had to ask for a refill!! Thanks!!
First time here it's an awesome place.. food is amazingly good.. service is outstanding.. a must place to eat.

Holy Moses! Best BBQ in a looonnnggg time!! The cornbread is so good you don't even have to put butter on it! Fun atmosphere as well! oh...must say they have the best mac and cheese ever!!!  pulled pork...amazing, prime rib....scrumptious, roast beef...heaven! My family really loved it!

Lived in TX for 53 yrs and never thought I would find a better BBQ/Steak restaurant.   Just moved to Arizona.  Food was great. Wait staff was awesome.  Can certainly understand why a reservation was needed.

Excellent bbq joint! The brisket is incredible, but so is everything else. Love that I've never had bad service in all the times I've been here either...their servers are obviously very well trained. My family and I are proud to put this place in our regular rotation.

I'm sad it's taken me over a year of living just down the road to finally make it to Bobby Q.  I think it was because I moved from Florida, where BBQ is delicious and cheap, and I was reluctant to "splurge" on pulled pork at a place like this.  

The ambiance is fantastic, you feel great walking in.  The last star was left off for service, which I wasn't a huge fan of.  We were attended to just fine, but I wasn't a fan of our waiter's demeanor.  He didn't seem to know the menu well, which is a shame because it isn't huge.  I kind of felt like he was reading a script, emphasizing the whole "smoked for 18 hours" thing, which rubbed me the wrong way.

But aside from the waiter not being invited to my Christmas party, the place was great.  The food was really delicious, and well worth the money.  I believe that with an appetizer, any 2 people could easily share any entree.  

I do have to say this - if you go, do NOT skip out on the banana dessert.  OUT OF THIS WORLD.  I am a freak for banana pudding, but this treat is on a whole new level.  It was thick and custardy, cold and delicious.  The best part was the crust, which was almost granola-esque.  I've never had anything like it, and doubt I ever will... until I go back to Bobby Q for some more!

Ask for Chelsea the waitress! She was so great! She made us feel so welcome! The food was seriously... Unreal! Coming from the east valley, I've always gone to joes bbq which has always been "good". But bobby q is different ball game all together. Puts all other BBQ places to shame!!

Best beef ribs ever. All the meats were tender and really flavorful. The sides were amazing as well. Even the corn, which is usually not a great side choice at restaurants, was delicious. 
Service was good. Everyone was friendly and explained the cooking process and the food well.
Good stuff and priced well. I would definitely come back. Guy next to me had the Cajun shrimp. I was in the mood for BBQ but this peaked my interest...maybe next time.

This place was awesome. I don't eat/like steak very often and tonight ordered the ribeye.  It was 14 oz of goodness. I couldn't finish it all but I'll be eating it for lunch tomorrow. Tyler was our server and he did an excellent job making my party feel at home. Everything tasted lovely. I will be here again.
So I live 5 minutes away from here I drive by everyday to work so we finally decided to give it a go the food and service was excellent!  Will definitely be back!

I was super excited to try this place because I always heard good things about it, but was actually very disappointed during my visit. This place is jam packed on a Friday and Saturday night, but I will say their service is pretty responsive and fast to get the food out. I only got salad so I'm not going to get into the food part since it will be biased. However, the night got turned upside down when I initially got my check and saw they charged me 15 dollars for a 12 dollar salad! Side note, this place is way pricier than I expected a BBQ place would be. Anyways, I told the gentleman about the salad upcharge and he seemed like he didn't believe I was overcharged and he was like " let's look through the menu together." Hello I'm not a little kid, you don't need to be condescending. Anyways, he saw that I was correct on the price and he changed it, blaming their system for generating that amount. I wonder how many people got overcharged for that salad without anyone saying something?? I still wonder if they even updated their system... anyways, not a huge issue until I got overcharged at the club/bar portion AGAIN ON THE SAME NIGHT!! This is when my nostrils began to blow smoke out of them... we went into the club which basically to get in you have to sign your name on a paper, get your picture taken, your photo id is scanned, and donate an arm and a leg(jk about that part), never seen that in my life, so strict for such a run down club... then we go to the pay section and find out it's 12 dollar coverage fee!! For a ghetto club, are you kidding me... I give them my card, and they act all quiet and don't tell me anything, all of a sudden they don't give my card back the guy escorts me downstairs without informing me what was going on... I was low key thinking I was going to be an interrogation room not knowing what I possibly could have done wrong. He still has my card in his hand and gives it to the bartender and then leaves still saying nothing to me. Worst security escorter ever! Then I get my card back from the bartender and I ask what is going on and he tells me that they don't take card at the front so I had to go down to the bar to pay the cover... I then look at my check and find out I was charged 30 dollars (15 each) for the cover when I'm told it was 12 each at the front!! The bartender apologizes and says he will get us a drink on the house... FYI the drink was the worst crap I've ever had in my life... at this point I wanted out and talked to security about my experience.. he says that I probably won't get a refund but I can go talk to the general manager. Literally the general manager finds out we want a refund(after only being there for 5 minutes) and he doesn't even bat an eye before saying of course, give these girls a refund. I want to thank him for being an intelligent person, but I hate to say that his staff are complete dim wits who should find a new job or receive better training on how to treat people.

TGIF meets BBQ = Bobby q.  Disappointed and misled by the yelp reviews - was expecting 4 star quality food but instead got lukewarm Cajun shrimp, bland pulled pork and corn that was covered in butter. Its only saving grace was that the meat was cooked right as others have said, but they lacked a real BBQ sauce to bring out the meat.

I was in town for a day and stumbled upon Bobby Q's.  Never heard of it but what a pleasant surprise.  The service was fantastic.  Our waitress was right on top of things and very friendly.  I had the rib eye with baked potato and grilled corn.  I'm a picky eater but I must say, "everything was perfect".  It's a shame I won't be in Phoenix anytime soon because this is definitely  a place I would visit again and again.

Excellent ribs and sides - the mashed potatoes were amazing. To be honest, I was completely shocked to find this place off the 17 this spring watching Spring Training. Don't let the part of town dissuade you.  Friendly and knowledgeable service, good margaritas, and really good pre-dinner bread.

Growing up in the Midwest where good ribs are not hard to come by, I would put the rack of baby backs I had at Bobby Q's right up there with some of the best I've had.  Will definitely go back when I'm visiting Phoenix again.
Nobody leaves disappointed.. unless they're trying to count calories.  Service staff is yummy, and that counts for something in my book too!
Excellent BBQ. The baby back ribs, awesome Mac & Cheese and great service by Austin will keep me coming back.

Went to Bobby Q on 7/5/2015 after seeing them on the morning news. Ordered the Whole Hog Heaven platter with Baby Back, and St Louis style ribs, Brisket, and Pulled Pork. Food looks good but that is about it. There was no smoke flavor. Brisket tasted like pot roast with BBQ Sauce. The rub on the ribs tasted good along with the regular sauce but that was about it. Food tasted like it was cooked in an oven then finished on a grill/smoker where the smoke did not penetrate the food.

Having read the high reviews of this place, I've been wanting to make the drive over from the East Valley for a while now to give it a go.  Not only were we more than impressed, it's definitely now on the list of must-have BBQ, even if it is a 45 minute drive away from us!

First off, I was looking forward to the cornbread since so many people have commented on it.  It was right on par - I even caught my picky 8 year old licking his plate to get all of the crumbs, which is a first.

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese, my husband had the sausage and brisket with mac and cheese and fries and my son ordered the mac and cheese as his entire meal (notice a theme).  Soooo many people have commented on their mac that I made sure to mention it and we all ended up ordering it and loved it.  Even though it was absolutely fantastic, that wasn't the highlight.  My pulled pork sandwich was the best I have ever had and I finished that thing off without it ever being put down.  The meat was fall-apart tender and the sauce was a perfect blend of flavors for me (oh look, now I'm salivating again).  My husband loved his sausage and brisket and is already working on figuring out what he is going to order the next time.

Then there's the staff, everyone was extremely friendly and made you really feel welcome.  Our server (Victoria?) was very sweet and perfectly attentive.  Overall though, the place just really made you comfortable.

I would be remiss if i didn't mention the 'Thank Q's' doughnuts.  What a fun idea!  They are just the finishing touch on a great meal, great service and great experience!

Amazing barbeque, wonderful warm atmosphere and one of the best eating experiences we have ever had. We were here two nights ago and ordered smoked sausage, brisket, shredded pork sandwiches and BBQ eggrolls. Every (literal) thing was delicious from the homemade pecan cole slaw to the light barbeque sauce (which acts as showcase for the food, rather than "hiding" behind the sauce at Bobby Q's). 

Our waitress Cristin took a real interest in telling us what special things the owner had collected and curated in his travels while developing his own barbeque style. The staff very much love working here and have a lot of respect for the food and for the patrons enjoying their food. They were so sweet and considerate to have given us beignets to bring home for our game night. 

We are from out of town but I cannot highly recommend Bobby Q's enough, and we will DEFINITELY be returning next time we are in Phoenix. Just a perfect place all around from the warm atmosphere to the stellar barbeque. And we lived in Memphis for many years and KNOW barbeque. Great job and keep up the good work.

Bobby Q's has excellent barbeque with a great atmosphere, service, and happy hour specials.  I went with a large party (18) co-workers from all over the country and everyone was extremely satisfied with their selections. The ribs and slow cooked brisket and pork were delicious and the selection excellent.  Their desserts were delectable as well (I had the chocolate cake).

So, we went back. And it was awesome.

We went on a weeknight, and, true to my review, I went whole hog, (no pun intended), and ordered a 2 Meat Barbecue Combo plate - the sausage link, and beef brisket. My boyfriend, ever steady, ordered the Prime Rib. 

Now, I don't really eat red meat. I mention this in a lot of reviews, and that mention is usually followed by "...but this time, I did, and I loved it." So, I guess I do actually eat red meat now. Wacky. Thanks, Yelp, for contributing to the decay of my health and the fatty deposits inside my arteries. Do you even get fatty deposits in your arteries? Don't mind me, I'm just flaunting my lack of basic anatomical knowledge on the internet. Anyway, the beef brisket was awesome, and the sausage link was truly one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten. Really! I loved it. Tasty and smokey and sweetly tinged with barbecue sauce. The corn and the shoestring fries are still hanging out in the "delicious" zone, and my boyfriend once again wolfed down his prime rib like a champ. He also tossed out a compliment to his side of macaroni and cheese, saying that it was "really good." From him, that is a ringing endorsement.

Our server was sweet and efficient, and not at all obnoxious. A+, Sawyer! You were great.

The little bag of Thank-Q doughnuts was adorable...we didn't get those on our first visit, and, even though we were completely stuffed, we appreciated the gesture and somehow found the digestive strength to scarf them down on the way home.

Thanks for a wonderful night, Jason. Your customer service is out of this world.

So, the boy and I were dissapointed that they were out of the St. Louis AND Baby Back ribs. Bummer. When he then stated that he wanted steak, I acquiesced and ordered the Ribeye to share (even though I really wanted some bbq!) with mashed potatoes and roasted corn. When our food arrived, I was delighted by the tender, flavorful piece of beef. The sides were bountiful and oh so tasty too. I don't know how I managed to get a few tastes of the mac n cheese, cornbread, french fries & the warm doughnuts - but I did. Everything I tried was on point! I think my son enjoyed it too. (He thanked me repeatedly as we walked back to the car for taking him here.) Will mos def make it back to Bobby Q when I'm back in town.

My only time to the restaurant was a nice experience.  I loved, absolutely loved, the Q-rolls - they are the best!  The starff was super-friendly, and our server, Trisha, was just delightful and had great personality.  The only area lacking was the salad dressing ... I tried both their Caesar and 1000 dressing, and neither of them were tasty.  So, another order of Q-rolls!

Oh my God!!! Best food and service ever. I'm here in Phoenix on a business trip. Found this place on Yelp, the ratings are true!!!! Definitely a five star... It's sad that I'm writing this review after only having my appetizer and their Delicious cornbread. I'm waiting for my entrée now but I can  only imagine how good it would be!!!!!! So glad we came here
Food was out of this world!! We had a hard to please group, but everyone left more than satisfied. The wait-staff was also excellent!

Because of the great reviews, I went of Bobby Q's for lunch with my sister for the first time. I have to say that I have always loved good BBQ and I was very impressed with the service, the atmosphere and the food!! The BBQ sandwich that I ordered was absolutely delicious! I will definitely be back for dinner to have some Ribs! I highly recommend them if you LOVE BBQ!
Dan Harper and I have gone many many times here it's his go to when he has company in town

This place is wonderful! I am not a fan of BBQ, but this is just absolutely delicious. Even their chicken strips have a homemade batter! Super tasty! Love the complimentary corn bread and donuts as you leave!! Will definitely be back! Just wish there was one closer to North Scottsdale. But it is well worth the drive!!!

When we got seated, we waited about five minutes for our waitress to come by. Usually this is pretty typical anymore so really didn't think anything of it. However, the manager came over herself and apologized and offered appetizers on the house!! Super impressed with the quality of service.

Honestly, with the state of BBQ in this city I almost gave this a 4-star review. Nice smoke flavor, but had a steam-table quality to the meats (like they had been sitting in a warmer for a while). No bark with the pork and no smoke ring on the brisket, which made me wonder if the meat was really smoked for 18 hours as advertised. However, the sausage had nice snap, good spice, and smoke, so at least that was legit...unfortunately, a real BBQ joint needs better brisket/pork (did not try the ribs) to get a high rating.

This place was a good value, nice service, and satisfying food. I'll try the ribs next time, but my search for real barbecue in the valley continues.

Dropped by during a road trip after finding this place on yelp. Our family of 5 (all adults) ordered 1 hog heaven ($44) which included 2 ribs (we chose St. Louis and baby back),  2 meats (chose sausage and brisket), 3 sides (chose veggies, corn, and fries), and corn bread.

Pros:
- great service. Drinks were refilled before we even came close to running out and food was served within 10 minutes of ordering. The manager also came by to see how we liked it.
- open decently late (10 PM)
- Meat was FANTASTIC. Fall off the bone tender; no knife needed.
- Sauce on the meats were delicious. The perfect degree of sweet and not at all sour.
- CORNBREAD. Best I've had. Good enough to be a dessert.

Cons:
- the complimentary cinnamon doughnuts were an awesome touch at the end that I was really looking forward to; unfortunately ours came a bit stale. But because we were late diners (10 pm) and everything else was so great, I won't hold that against them.

We went to pleasant lake cruise and selected this place for a late lunch. It's a nice place and food was very tasty. They gave more than we can eat. Best rib combo, soft, succulent and savory meat. We do recommend this restaurant to others.

One of the best places I have ever eaten. Definitely a place where you want to stop for awesome bbq fix. Excellent service. Warning: pork ribs will melt in your mouth. staff meet you with courtesy. Excellent outdoor place for good eating and socializing. The best recipe for a great night sleep!

Must try by far the best barbecue you could ever eat will not be a disappointment!!!!!!!!!! And a shout out to our awesome waitress MARA she was absolutely incredible drinks where never empty and always checked on us !!! So glad our friend told us to come try this place...

Busy busy place!  Even though it's a busy place wait has never been longer then ten minutes. Stuff is super friendly and attempt. Food is great comes in big portions. Really Love there corn biscuits. Definitely a must try!

My favorite BBQ joint; ever! Great food, service, atmosphere. And best of all the price is fair and they take reservations! Have been there 3 times in the last 3 weeks and it has been perfect every time.

They don't need my help.  Outstanding barbecue, outstanding service, and more food than I could possibly hope to finish.  If you order the Whole Hog, I recommend splitting it between three adults unless at least two of the people in your party are NFL linemen.  Cornbread, wedge salad, beef and baby back ribs, pork, and brisket, top sirloin steak.  All outstanding.  A must-visit for anyone who enjoys barbecue done right.

I really liked this place and it was really good except for my ONE rib that for some reason tasted like it was cooked on or near a piece of fish. I am not sure why that is but I was so hungry I didnt even want to complain but the rest of the ribs were fine. They forgot one of my side dishes as well, by the time i had noticed I was so full it probably wouldnt have even eaten or taken it home. The cornbread was amazing, the doughnuts at the end were a pretty good touch. The price is a little bit on the higher end to go as often as one would like, but thats ok. Maybe sometime soon we'll go back and

The food is ok, but the service is terrible. I dined here with my family, when the clumsy waitress brought our food, she knocked ketchup over all over me and my shoes. She didn't even offer to provide a credit on the bill for the inconvenience. I took my clothes to cleaners and fortunately it came out. However, I took my $300 leather shoes to to get cleaned, and the oil from the ketchup and left a big stain in the leather. 

I called the restaurant to speak to a manager. No return call.
I drove back up to the restaurant to speak to a manager, a week later. She GM wasn't in, and the Asst. Manager said she has no authority to do anything. (Well why are you an Asst. Mngr). She said she would have the manager call me the next day. It's been 2 weeks and still no return call.

I was staying at a hotel about .8 miles away as I was going to the Fiesta Bowl, and I noticed that they had an ad about delivering food to the hotel. Then I started reading the small print. Does not include tip, tax, $3 set up charge, etc. I decided to go there so I called. I told the girl where I was staying, lots of one way streets, etc. and asked for directions from my hotel. Lots of um's and ah's and she then asked me to wait until she got someone else on the phone. I almost hung up and then another dizzy girl picked up and she started stammering and stuttering without any clear directions, until she told me to wait until she got someone else on the phone, and I said, "never mind" and hung up. I went to the front desk at the hotel and the woman there gave me clear directions in about  2 minutes. I was on the phone with the two dingbats for about 15 to 20 minutes. I drove over and it took about 5 minutes to get there. I walked in and the restaurant was packed, so I went into the lounge to see if I could order in there. As I was walking about, I received "hard" looks from the guys on duty there, bouncers I guess. I looked at the jerk, turned around and went to the reception area and asked one of the young ladies how long it would take for a table for one. She said about an hour and a half. I asked her if she was serious and she said "yes", so I left. When I got back to the hotel, I tried to order take out without success. Even though it was before 9PM and the order form said that they delivered up to that time, they said they were not delivering. I gues it was because it was New Years Eve. When I went to the office to look for another restaurant, I met some UConn fans, and as I was talking with them about Bobby Q, they said that Bobby Q wasn't that great when compared to a few CT barbecue places or some Southern places they visited in Charlotte during another bowl game. The famous cornbread did not live up to its rep, so I felt better. Then, they asked if I wanted to try some of their food. They had a bunch of leftovers, that they weren't going to eat, and I had a microwave in my room. Like them, I wasn't impressed with either the food or the famous sauce. More hype than good food, an incompetent wait staff, and nasty looking guys in the lounge does not look like a good time to me. Sorry Bobby Q.

I love Bobby Q!  My family and I went here for dinner with my cousin and even though we were still full from our lunch, the food here still tasted great.  So great that we finished everything despite our very very full stomachs.  We had the ribs, mac and cheese, their eggroll appetizer thing, and tri tip.  Everything was really good.  And they give you complimentary fresh and warm donut holes!

Every time I go to Bobby Q's will get great food but the staff does seem a little detached like we're busy and really could you go away till another time also although the food is excellent it is also quite expensive so I would go back but I can only afford to do it once a year and I wish that I could find the perfect time where the staff isn't quite so upset that they have more customers

Great atmosphere,  impeccable customer service,  fantastic food,  what more can you ask for? Even the manager on the floor stopped by each table to see how things are going.  10% off entire bill for first time yelp customers too. This place is a winner and I'll be back

The service was very fast and courteous. I didn't have to wait a long time to be seated. Our server jason was very pleasant and prompt. Our food came out at a great timing and was still warm. I had the pulled pork sandwich and it's amazing. They're strawberry lemonade is also nicely made.

It took me awhile to get around to trying this restaurant, and after eating their food I was kicking myself for not trying it sooner.  I had a number of coworkers that told me it was great, but it was hard for me to believe there was good barbeque in Phoenix, AZ.  (I lived in the South for a while, so I have had "real" barbeque.)  Their food is absolutely delicious, and having gone back a few times I have tried a number of different items!  Make sure to try their mac and cheese!

OK--so I eat out 6 nights a week. Life on the road. I have eaten in 1000's of places and yes, I could have my own food show on TV. I remember Bobby McGee's (or however it is spelled) and it was cute and fun. Nothing great... I read the reviews on Bobby Q's and so I had to try this joint. Well, you were right. This place is excellent. Sketchy area in PHX but excellent food. the Q Rolls were awesome and the BBQ sauce was a great topper, The Whole Hog Heaven platter is huge and plenty for 3 hearty eaters. The ribs (beef, St. Louis and Baby Back) were excellent, brisket tender and the chicken perfect! I don't mean to gush, but seriously... it was that good. So thats the food, now lets talk service.. Holy Guacamole... Whoever runs this joint, needs to become the main go to person for an entire industry! The service was freakin' awesome. Our waitress, Bailey, was absolutely phenomenal. She couldn't have been better and the place was packed! 2 managers came over to our table to check on us! not 1 but 2!! this place is BY FAR well worth the trip and the cost (which wasn't bad at all). Don't forget your donuts because you won't get to dessert!

Awesome BBQ goodness!

Bobby Q's is right off I17 and was easy to find for us out-of-towners. The parking lot is huge and when we went it was really quiet.

The interior has a bit more of an upscale vibe to it, not like an old traditional bbq place. The service was good and they give you mini-doughnuts at the end.

We ordered the whole hog platter to share amongst the two of us and it was definitely enough food. I don't think it'd be enough food for three hungry people, but definitely two. We had the brisket, pulled pork, beef ribs and st louis ribs.

The mac & cheese was delicious. It was creamy, cheesy and amazing. Definitely worth getting. The garlic mash potatoes were also very good, but not as mouth watering as the mac & cheese. If I had to do it again I would just have the three sides as mac & cheese, it was that good.

All of the meat was tender - the meat feel right off the bone of the ribs and we could cut the brisket with our forks. It was delicious with the smoked flavour and sauce they put on. Unlike other places they do put some sauce on it, which is how I prefer it. It's not overpowering and drenched in sauce to prevent you from tasting the actual flavour of the meat though.

Price wise it was a little higher than other restaurants (Seems to be $18-25 per person) we had been to, however the quality of the food is well worth it. Unfortunately we were too full to try the dessert, but that's OK because there's nothing wrong with filling up with meaty goodness.

really good aged steak dinners.  good sides, excellent service.  
foofoo drinks, meh.  But I have never been disappointed by the steak. Big Fan!!!!

I been coming here for around 6years.  The food is soooooo good I highly recommend any of their steaks and ribs. The side dishes are bomb and their corn bread and donuts are to keep coming back from them. The place is really nice but I usually do take out. Matias at the take out cashier is great he always make sure the order is right and the everything is in there he also organizes the bag so nothing trips over on the way back home.

Honestly everything here was awesome. I'm from Ohio, so it was a one time stop, but I would definitely be coming back if I was from here. Beer was good, cornbread was good, barbecue was awesome (brisket was delicious) and the mac n cheese was to die for! And to top it all off, they send you on your way with a little bag of donuts, too cute. The atmosphere was really nice, especially outside. And the wait staff was extraordinarily friendly and did a great job. They deserve all 5 stars.

THE BEST BBQ PLACE I'VE FOUND IN PHOENIX!! OMG! I can't wait till the next time we have another family outting. Everyone in my family was happy with their food. From the prime ribs to the baby back ribs to the kid's mac and cheese to the shoe string fries and to the pineapple martini... EVERYTHING WAS A TEN TEN TEN TEN! On top of everything else, yelp gave me a 10% discount for checking in! WINNING!!! I'm super excited we gave this place a try!! LOVE IT!!

Once again this was a hit! So delicious  .. This was my husbands first time because he wasn't able to go last time and he was speechless (in a good way) We had Kristen or Kristin and she was amazing too! Thank you guys for great service and great food

*Parsons Family*
The pulled pork is amazing.  Sit at the bar with bar with Chelsea and Tony.  They are funny and great with  bourbon suggestions.
Absolutely amazing! By far the best bbq I ever had. Great service, great restaurant and great food. Can't wait to come back tomorrow!
Great food! The wait is worth it. I order the whole hog for my family of 4 and we always walk out with enough food for a meal later.
This restaurant is consistently great. Their brisket is the best I have ever had! I usually sit at the bar, and both Brian and Jason are amazing!

We just started eating here last week. I guess it used to be a Bobby McGees before and these guys bought them out. Anyway, we had just picked up a friend from the airport and were on our way home. He asked if there were any good bbq places here. Since we didn't know of any, we looked on yelp. 
We got here very late, so they were about to close the kitchen. However, the lounge/club was about to open. They told us that it would be loud, once the club opened up. We didn't mind it and decided to stay. 
We all ordered food and drinks. I ordered the full plate of bbq brisket, coleslaw and mashed potatoes. We also ordered some appetizers. Everything was great. I loved the corn bread so much that I asked for more. The Sangria was good too. 
Everything is priced right and the portions are fair. Try it out; it's worth it. 
By the way, we stayed at restaurant after the club opened. Let's just say it wasn't like the food. I would never come here for the lounge/club--food only.
We're taking our friend back to the airport tonight, and we are going to have dinner here again. I hope to have a good experience again.
Amazing food and service. Our waiter Travis was phenomenal!!! He was attentive, recommendation was spot on, finished with a cinnamon donut treat!!!

Excellent BBQ and we had outstanding service on a Sunday evening.  This was a recommendation from the local wine bar & were very thankful she sent us this way

We ordered the combo with baby back ribs, brisket, & pulled pork.  Everything was tender, no fat, and both the regular & spicy sauces were very good.  Mac-cheese was PERFECT!  We were too full for dessert, but managed to enjoy the Thank Q's (just wait-finger licking good) we got with the bill.  A must when in the Glendale area.
How can this place be out of beef ribs? They should be well stocked. Also phone ordering service is sub par.

Rude staff. The manager is a self important moron who believes that his word is God's law. The bouncers are rude for no reason, and even when it was clearly before the time that covers get charged, they charged a cover. Never go here.
Phillip was great and helped us so much for our first time here! All the food was great!! Highly recommend the Mac and cheese!!!

The was by far the best "lucky find" I've ever ran across. We were in Phoenix  for a couple nights and happened to be in a hotel just down the street.  When we drove past on Friday night and saw the crowd we decided on this place for our Saturday night dinner out.  WOW!!!!  Amazing staff who always had smiles.  Our waiter  Jason was awesome.  Honest and helpful when we told him our preferences. Always attentive and just a downright a pleasure.  I only wish I lived closer so I could explore more of the menu.  Prime rib and rib eye steak were excellent and cooked to order perfectly, sides were fabulous, desert was superb.  The Bobby-Q roll appetizers  are amazing!  Even the lemonade is made fresh from real lemons. This place is a must if you're in Phoenix!

Just a great experience! 
I went here for some Good-Bye beers with my wife and parents on their last day in Phoenix. We went at about 6pm on a Sunday and were shocked by the Awesome Happy Hour Deals they had!!! $3 beer specials, $3 Fireball Shots, $0.99/6 wings, and they had a grill set up in the outdoor lounge area where they were serving up $1 Burgers, Dogs, Steak Tacos! 
Our server Amethyst was great! So attentive, made sure we were never thirsty. My dad had a Bacon Wrapped Hot Dog and loved it! I went for the Steak Tacos that were hot off the grill and amazing. Seriously the best steak taco I have had in Phoenix! Simple and delicious made with great steak! Fresh toppings bar set up next to the grill. My Mom went for the BBQ Wings, and of course I stole a couple from her! 
I can't speak for their Full Restaurant Menu packed with Meat Goodies, but after our great experience here we will for sure go back! 
I personally can't wait to try the Smoked Prime Rib! I have never seen that done before, it has to be amazing! 
Great job! Thanks for the awesome service Amethyst! I wish I had asked about your schedule as I'd like to go back when you're working!
A Great place to meet out of town family, have delicious food and Ice Cold beer & BBQ.

This is the BEST BBQ place that I've found in the PHX area.  Everything I've tried here is amazing.  The BBQ sauce is the perfect blend of tangy, sweet and smoky.  Ribs are amazing.  Baked beans are awesome.  Corn bread is incredible.  The service is always top notch.  Ambiance and setting is really cool.  

You can't go wrong at Bobby Q.  Try it.  You will be going back every time you are in the mood for BBQ.

We have been coming here for several years.  They never disappoint!!  The best BBQ!! I get the chicken. My husband loves the Beef Brisket and pulled pork.  Their corn is a must!!  They have Full bar including specialty drinks.  Great service and fantastic ambiance.  Inside or on the patio! We come here every time we are in town!! Family night or date night!!

Heard good things about this place so decided to check it out.

The services was friendly. 

Their corn bread was delicious. Rotisserie chicken was more like chicken jerky. But Ribs were to die for. Brisket was moist and flavorful. Best side dish tonight would be Mac n' Cheese. 

Won't recommend their drinks though. Lemonade was disappointing, Sangaria was watery, and Appletini had no flavor. 

Over all, I will visit again, and will be smarter with what I order next time.

Best ribs. Pecan coleslaw is to die for as well. This is where I always come if I want unparalleled too quality BBQ. Service and staff are always on point and friendly. I usually go for the platter and get a little of everything.
Came here for the first time. Food is outstanding and so is service. A new bartender named Daniel, knew his stuff. All the bartenders were great!

This was a great place to stop for bbq!! My son loved the ribs and my daughter liked the pizza. I had a salad special order with help from Tommy the waiter. He was very nice and we got lots of attention. Clean, comfortable and watched the Olympics while we ate! Thanks Tommy and Bobby q!

This is the absolute best place to eat in the Phoenix area.  Owensboro Kentucky boasts great barbecue but this restaurant surpasses the flavors that I enjoyed as a resident of Kentucky for 59 years.  Great selections, attentive wait staff, and pleasant atmosphere are the attributes that keep us visiting this wonderful place.  The meat selections are varied and cooked to perfection.  Side items are exceptional.  From the cornbread to the finishing touch of freshly made cinnamon donuts, you will never be disappointed with your dining experience.

Carla R. , Buckeye AZ
We had the brisket, baby back ribs and pulled porked. All smoked to perfection. Our waiter, Jason, provided an amazing dining experience!  Two thumbs up for Bobby Q's.

I must say this BBQ restaurant is great. I just moved here from Cali and I was feeling sad because that means no homemade Que for the holiday. I looked this place up and I'm glad I visited. Great customer service and the food was all yummy!!!

I have been here several times now and this is hands down the best BBQ I have ever eaten in my life! The meat is SO tender and delicious and the sides are heavenly.  Any appetizer is amazing- I love the Q Rolls!  Basically, you have to go here to understand!

This chain is our favorite barbecue restaurant in Phoenix. The food is consistently very good.  Our waiter was very good and they offer a few cinnamon donuts to take with you for your sweet tooth. We think their wine is overpriced however. We ordered a house Cabernet and was shocked that it was $16 a glass when we got the bill!!!  Do not order wine!
Visiting from Albuquerque and happened upon Bobby-Q....excellent food snd service. Cornbread was great and the brisket was perfect! Must try when in Phoenix.
Food was only moderately good. Definitely not worth going back. If not for atmosphere and nice waiter I might have complained.
Best place in Phoenix! Came here for lunch and dinnet! Atmosphere nice, service great and food is amazing!

This place serves very good BBQ and the service is up to the task.  The ribs are wonderful as are the burgers and kids meals.  It's nice to have a "go to"  BBQ joint in the valley.  Hope you all enjoy the food, atmosphere, and service as much as we do.

This is likely the best BBQ to be found in the Phoenix metro.  It's far and away better than anything to be had in southern California and comparable to the mid-range places in more BBQ-centric parts of the U.S.  In Phoenix, that puts it at 4 stars and I'd give it 5 if I didn't have such a great experience at another BBQ joint a month before in another state.

Bottom line: if you desperately need a BBQ fix, you could do a lot worse in Phoenix and if you are a little less desperate and just looking for some good BBQ, you will still leave satisfied.
We ordered Smokehouse burger, full rack of baby back rib and catfish Poboy. All excellent. Great experience.
Great place, I will be coming back but if you wanna eat here make sure you call ahead for reservations or you will be waiting about a hour to eat...

Good BBQ, Service was great and atmosphere was wonderful! I wasn't impressed with the cole slaw that a lot of reviews raved about... But the little donuts they give you when you leave were yummy! Kind of has a weird entrance, but over all we enjoyed our date night here.

Awesome food! The Q rolls are AMAZING!
The meat on the ribs falls off of the bone! Huge servings... guaranteed to be taking some home!!
We have been twice. Once the service was great and our recent experience the service was slow. Wanted more drinks but she never came by.
Some of the best bbq that I have had in Arizona.  It was worth the trip.  Just moved from Colorado and didn't want to wait in line for 45 minutes.  No lines sat down immediately.
Like a little slice of good southern bbq dropped into the Arizona desert... Huge portions,  very well balanced sauces, and awesome happy hour specials. I'll definitely be back.
Bobby Qs is a place I trust for great food. Tonight was no exception to that. Come here for the best in town ribs and corn bread.

Love bobby q but if you're coming around dinner time it's best to make a reservation otherwise the wait for walk ins could be 1 hr long. The food is delicious and the service is very good too. My favorite spot for some ribs.

Sunday afternoon the 4 of us arrived at Bobby Q. My elderly Aunt and her older sister and another friend makeup our dinner group. We were greeted and seated right away. There were two walkers in the group but no problem as the aisles were plenty wide and there was room to store them nearby.

Ashely was our server and while she was taking our beverage orders I mentioned "Yelp" for our discount, very nice! She also gave us seperate checks without a complaint,a very professional and a delightful person.

My Aunts had never heard of Yelp and thought they would have to exclaim "yelp"! to get the discount, very funny!!

I orderd the onion block which arrived quickly, the only better one we had tasted was the one from Tona Roma's now closed on Bell Rd.

I ordered the St Louis Ribs and they were sensational. I have had ribs all over and the "smokey" quality was the best and the amount of sauce perfect. The fact that they were hanging off the platter was very nice as well. My sides were a baked potato and grilled vegetables. The potato was large and piping hot, I "hot potatoed" myself twice, just the way I like. The veges were generous and delicious.

Two of the ladies orderd the Baby Backs Ribs and the comments were very positive. They ordered a variety of sides which were all well received. 

One misstep was that a side of Mac and Cheese was received instead of the Pecan Slaw. No problem, the young man who brought out the plates returned with the desired slaw and more of the popular corn bread within a minute.

All in all, a great meal! All of us took heavy boxes home and the "Thank You" donuts were cute.

Amazing everything. Visited on a Monday during lunch time. There was no wait. 

Great customer service from wait staff. Waters were always full and didn't wait long for anything. 

MUST TRY the St. Louis Ribs and sausages. 

The brisket can be slightly dry. 

Recommend coming for weekday lunch prices since prices can be on the high side for dinner/weekends, but I feel like it's worth it.

Came in here for dinner while staying in North Phoenix. Seated immediately (even though it looked busy!), waiter was friendly and made great beer, wine, and food suggestions. We ended up splitting a platter with St. Louis ribs, beef brisket, and smoked sausage with Mac and cheese and a dressed baked potato on the side. Scrumptious! Finished with a surprise bag of fresh homemade cinnamon donuts. If it wasn't so far from my home in the east valley I would definitely return!

Wow! Great food, great service! I loved his place and definitely will return. I suggest making a reservation otherwise the wait could be long but still worth it! We had reservations and seated within 10 min. I overheard the hostess telling other patrons the wait could be 45 min. I had the smoked chicken and it was delish. The cornbread was pretty good too, nothing like mom's but for a restaurant probably some of the best I had. The Mac and cheese was ok. Highly recommend if you have a taste for some bbq!

Amazing!!!  Great atmosphere and service. Lunch platter is a CANT MISS. 
Homemade mac and Cheese side is amazing

Steak and Crab? Yes, please.

For 15 bucks? Whhhhaaaaa? Hell yes! 

These are questions my friend asked, when she wondered if I wanted to go to Bobby Qs the other night. Honestly, I did not get my hopes up, and prepared myself for a rough ride home. Yes, in case you are wondering, I have had some bad experiences with Seafood.

We decided to sit on the patio and were promptly attended to. I ordered a bloody mary, the rest beers. The bloody mary was freaking tasty. Spicy and tasty. 

We all ended up ordering the Steak and Crab special. I ordered a Caesar to start with. The Caesar was good. Nothing amazing, but solid.

Then there came the Crab. Half a snow crab, with an 8oz Steak and a side of roasted corn. As I started drooling, my stomach did a backflip from excitement. The crab was awesome! Not chewy or fishy tasting. The steak was great as well, and the corn was nice and smokey.

The only negative...the server was a bit forgetful at times. Honestly, once the crab and I had our moment...I no longer cared..

Directions say address is N 27th Ave.  Don't believe it.  Regardless of which direction you are coming from, exit I-17 at 207, Dunlap Ave., and go south on the west frontage road.  When 27th splits off stay on the frontage road and the place is just ahead.  We had the whole hog, which is two half racks of ribs, two platters of meat, and three sides.  We fed three and still took a box home.  The baby back ribs were succulent and tasty, and the St. Louis ribs were almost as good, but the brisket was to die for.  Not the best BBQ I have ever had, but clearly the best in Arizona.  I will go back when I am in Phoenix.

My wife and I came to dinner for our weekly date night.  Our waitress forgot to ring in our appetizer. Unprovoked the manager came and immediatly appolagized gave our appetizer and dessert for free. the whole hog heaven is the best Bar B Q we have ever eaten incredible service!!!!

Yummy in my tummy!! My boyfriend and I came here because of all the great yelp reviews, I mentioned Yelp and got a 10% discount :) Jeffery was our server and he was awesome!! We are from San Diego so we were curious to see if Bobby Q's is up there with Phil's.. I still think Phil's has the best baby back ribs but Bobby Q's pulled pork and beef brisket tasted amazing!! Try Bobby Q's you will not be disappointed!!

My wife and I really enjoyed this place.  There was a great buzz and energy level.  The waitress was friendly and helpful.  We shared 4 different kinds of their BBQ meats, and they were all delicious.  The brisket was fantastic.  We also shared 4 sides and they were all terrific; the corn was really great.

Yeah, yeah, yeah, the name of this joint leaves something to be desired. I don't eat a lot of BBQ because most of the places in San Diego aren't very good. Man, did this place set the bar(bq) high for future BBQ spots.

I had the half slab of spicy bbq ribs with potato salad and mac and cheese. The amount of food that they brought out could have fed three of me- I can't imagine how much food they give you with the full slab. The ribs were incredibly tender and fell right off the bone. The SAUCE was amazingly delicious. I can't even describe it other than that it was so good that I wanted to order a pitcher of it and pour it over everything. 

I am a total potato salad guy and this potato salad hit the spot. Perfect blend of ingredients. The Mac and Cheese was just otherworldy with the amount of delicious cheesey gooeyness that it was. All in all I think I gained 30 pounds just from eating half of the meal.

Even if you don't order a dessert, they end your meal with some homemade mini doughnuts (yeah I spelled it out)! It's a perfect treat even if you have to take them home to eat them. Heat them back up before you do. 

I will definitely go back here next time I visit Phoenix.

We were in the area and decided to Yelp our dinner location. This place came up at the top of the search with over 500 reviews, you know we had to see what all the fuss was about. Coming down 27th street we thought Google Maps was getting us lost. There was no way a bomb BBQ joint was next to all these apartments. Well once we passed the last apartment building on the right, we saw Bobby's. The building was not impressive from the parking lot, not to mention we were parked behind the restaurant. I thought rusty shack = good food. I was glad I stuck with my instinct. 
We turned the corner and could instantly smell the smoker putting in work on slabs of ribs and brisket. Inside the decor was modern and clean. After seating we were greeted quickly and with a smile. I could hardly listen to what she saying because my eyes were fixated on the 40 chickens rolling in the rotisserie oven. We ordered the Hog Heaven plate for three of us, while my son had the smokehouse burger. Let me just say this is plenty of food for a family of 4. Four choices of meats with three sides. I highly recommend the baby back ribs as one of the meats. If you have no teeth, you can still chew these. My mouth had an orgasm when I bit into them. They were so tender, there was no knife needed to separate them. The brisket, St. Louis ribs, and chicken rounded out the plate. Mac and cheese side dish is a must! So creamy and the cheese was outstanding. You can tell that time was taken to prepare our meal that came out quickly. The cornbread was oven hot and was perfectly cooked with a hint of crunchiness on the edges. I had the Bobby Q Ale for my drink and it was a solid choice. It was very bold and complimented the BBQ sauce that was all over my fingers. Visit this place in the near future, hopefully your experience is as good as mine. This spot moved into the first priority when dining out in Phoenix.

Mark,
You asked what the favorite food was - I think my personal favorite was the veggies, believe it or not!  lol

Everything truly was awesome, and thanks so much for it all...   Did I mention that they also provided plates and plasticware!

Great BBQ! Very tasty! I would definitely recommend this establishment to anyone that likes licking their fingers!!! 

There you go!
Fantastic barbecue. Hands down the best in the Valley, and this coming from a born & bred Midwesterner that is used to blue ribbon Kansas City BBQ.
Great Barbeque!! Atmosphere is a bit loud. Food was delicious and hot.
Great BBQ! the Babyback ribs, just fall off the bone! The place had a great atmosphere, great service and great food. Would highly recommend!
Love their mac n cheese! Best BBQ spot in Phoenix

I've been here twice, and both times I got the St. Louis style ribs because they were so good the first time. My fiance also got a similar dish when we went back, because his brisket was amazing. Macaroni and cheese is also amazing. Corn bread, roasted corn, and other sides are good but not outstanding. The free donuts at the end of the meal add a nice taste of sweet without going overboard on a huge dessert. One time my sister got the pizza, which looked like it could have come frozen from a supermarket. I'd say stick with the BBQ meats and you can't go wrong!

What a test of a business - we were here Sunday and came back tonight. My husband requested it for his birthday. Again, great service. This time Kody was our server and did a fantastic job! Jo the manager was fantastic! Thank you again!

We had a set reservation for 3:45PM on Mother's Day. As you can imagine, it was quite busy with families celebrating Mother's Day, so we were thankful that they took reservations.

They do request a 15 minute grace period to seat you after your set time, which was told to us when we called to reserve a table a few days prior. We arrived and checked in. We checked with the hostess at 3:45 and she reminded us of the grace period. We waited and waited...30 minutes later, we checked again and we're told we were coming up on the list. After another 20 minutes, we checked again only to be told they "forgot" about us and then seated us immediately.

The manager, Laura, came to the table to apologize for their mistake. She was the BEST! She was friendly, sincere, and assured us that she would take care of some of our bill due to their mistake. 

The waitress was great, food was beyond delicious, and even another manager stopped by the table to see if things were all good. We got the bill and our appetizer was taken off. We paid, tipped and left the restaurant.

We were in the parking lot when Laura chased us down to talk about our bill. She said it wasn't taken care of enough to make up for the inconvenience we experienced when we arrived. She voided the charge and gave us a great discount. We were shocked and so grateful for the exceptional customer service displayed by Laura and her staff. Thank you for making our Mother's Day dinner great!!

Took the family (2 adults, kids:2,3, & 6). Ordered the big sample platter $35 i think, and it was enough for all of us. 2 different kinds of ribs, 2 different kinds of beef, and slow roasted chicken plus 3 different sides. The food was great. You could argue that other places make a single type of BBQ better but as a whole sample of BBQ, it doesn't get better than this. The portions of the side dishes could be bigger. We got there before 6pm and had no wait... once we left though, there were lot's of people waiting.

Their bar was rockin'. They have happy hour 'till 6p. Apparently this is the spot for drinks after work. Lot's of hot looking women. I will definitely be back, either with the family or with friends for the bar.

After reading the bad reviews I noticed a trend... they were written mostly by out-of-towner's that compare this place to joints in St. Louis and such. If you're some kind of a BBQ snob, of course you've had better... get over it. The BBQ is better than you're going to get at most full service restaurants that happen to have BBQ on the menu. As for those that complained about occasional bad service... have you seen the wait for a table after 6pm? Obviously they're doing something right. People have bad days sometimes.

First time at Bobby Qs! Four of us went for a birthday dinner last . We had the baby backs, sirloin steak and prime rib. Also baked potatoes, coleslaw and corn (buttery roasted corn shaved off the cob). And of course the corn bread and donuts. Everything was DELICIOUS! I was skeptical about getting the prime rib because at many places it can be really fatty and you end up not getting much meat. Not here! The waiter (Josh) assured me it was a lean cut of meat, and it was! Very tender and flavorful. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the ribs were tender with not too much sauce. (The ribs were not "mush" like other reviewers have said.) They also treated us to a piece of yummy banana cream pie as a birthday treat (the crust was thick and nutty) - tastefully presented with no annoying restaurant staff choir. It was very nice. 

All that being said, the outside of the building and the inside don't match. We used to go to Bobby McGees so I did sort of expect the old Bobby McGees atmosphere - with old bathtubs and mismatched furniture... it was a goofy, fun place back in the day. Now the interior is just nice. Not that that's bad. 

Oh, and we mentioned Yelp and got a 10% discount. :)

THE BEST MAC AND CHEESE! The best everything and even the donuts they give you to go are amazing! A little pricey for some BBQ food but worth it, I just wish they'd give you a little more meat on the meat plates.

Food good, service good.   Annoying that there is a huge sign on the side of the building that has a giant spelling error. "Catering for every occassion"


Spelling errors show lack of attention to detail. 
Other than that, great restaurant.

After a 6 hour drive I was ready for some BBQ and yelp directed me to this spot a few miles from my hotel. I am somewhat critical when it comes to BBQ, having spent 8 years working for a Knoxville based company and then 2 years working for a Dallas based company, it is hard to beat those areas for pulled pork, baby back ribs and brisket respectively. 

I was pleased by most of what I ordered here at Bobby Q. The pulled pork was tasty, the sauce was agreeably flavorful, the baby backs were flavorful, although perhaps a little too tender, I did not have to pick them up to eat them, the meat fell off the bone. They were probably boiled to get this preparation, but they were yummy either way. The potato salad was exactly the kind I like in my BBQ joints. The mac and cheese side was just ok, not bad, but not the best thing on the plate. 

Overall it was a good meal for  BBQ west of the Mississippi and I would go again if in the area. Service was attentive, and the place itself was quite a nice spot to eat. Recommended.

I have been here on several trips to Phoenix. I usually order the brisket because it is about the best I have ever had.  This time I had the boneless fried chicken and it did not disappoint. Great service and great food. Don't miss out on this restaurant.
We are from KC. When we moved here we thought we would be without great BBQ. Then we found Bobby Q's. It's as good or better than anyplace in KC, delicious . Best meats any where!

First time in the house. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. They even gave us a free order of the Q-Rolls (there was a mixup in the kitchen, so they gave them to us). 

The atmosphere is nice and comfortable with plenty of room between tables. There is even a small patio for cooler nights.

The food was good. I really enjoyed the Q-Roll stuffed with brisket and served with their chipotle sauce. I sensed that the portions would be large, so my partner and I shared the 2 rib entry (St Louis & Baby-back). The rancho beans had their own distinctive flavor without the beans being over-cooked. The same could be said of the steamed veggies. Corn bread is served with every meal and presented in a nice round Pattie; and it taste liked corn BREAD as opposed to cake.  My 4 star rating came because I felt that ribs were a little too salty.

The next time I come in I will still opt for ribs, maybe a steak. I may enjoy a cocktail with Q-Rolls as well.
Friendly welcoming atmosphere. Pulled pork was great. BBQ sauce was sweet but a little watery.
One of my favorite places to eat some good barbeque. This place has been there for years. The staff is very nice and professional. Friday nights turn into a club and well you just can't go wrong..
This place is just so racist, I can't deal with that manager and how he treats people who don't look like him.

My husband and I ate here for dinner 8/10/13. This was not our first time eating here and it will not be our last time either. We love the smokehouse burger, best burger ever. And the potato salad is amazing. With the suggestion of the awesome server (Sierra) that we had, I ventured to the mac n cheese as my side. WOW! That mac n cheese is so freaking creamy and cheesy, but it is not over kill either. I still nibbled on my husbands potato salad, but I am such a fan of it that I could not resist. They also have cornbread here before the meals, now I do not like cornbread so it did take me a couple visits of my husband telling me to try it before I actually did, and now I am mad that it took me so long and look forward to it every time!! 
The smokehouse burger is simply amazing! SO flavorful and juicy and deliciousness on a plate with bacon and cheese and BBQ sauce! LOTS of goodness all in one. 
We have never had a bad experience here, everyone is always in such a good mood and so willing to be a team and help each other so when I say that Sierra was simply wonderful, I am also complementing the entire staff :) 
Now for dessert....they bring out fresh house made (which everything here is house made) hot donuts! Save room because if you take them to go you are doing it wrong! YUM! I cannot wait to go back and eat there again.

Friendly, very fast service on a weekday night.
Quite decent cornbread (reference Houston's/Bandera's for the Benchmark cornbread!).
Good, tender pulled pork.
Grilled corn tasty, a bit greasy.
Grilled veggies fairly fresh, but meh.
Nice decor.
Overall, not bad a'tall.
Oink.
The beef brisket is awesome!!! Shay, our waitress made our dinner so fun!!

I loved this place. It was the first time, but I bet I will be going there again. The food was amazing and the server was very nice and attentive. The restaurant has the rustic country vibe, which totally is impressive. The menu had lots of options. And at the end of it all, u walk away with a bag of fried corn breads.

I loved everything about this place.  It's not fine dining, but then it's BBQ.  Funky yet genuine decor with a touch of elegance here and there.  Very attentive staff.  We all had the Smokehouse burger since a burger was what were were after.  It was juicy and perfectly cooked with crunchy onions and bacon and cheese.  Pretty perfect when you want a heart stopper.  The waiter forgot to order our appetizer of onion block (or whatever they call it), which was a blessing since the burger was huge.  Still the manager showed up moments later to apologize for the oversight and offer us a free dessert.  I love those extra customer service touches.  If I lived in Phoenix, I'd go back here regularly.

Love this place always clean. I highly recommend this place and everything is very delicious. Best BBQ in town by far! I have been here more then once and every time is as good as the first time or even better.
Im about to go eat a burger right now. Excellent bbq.. but im in the mood for a burger. One of the best secrets about this place is the late night tacos!
Amazing ribs the best I have ever had!  Delicious, great sauce. And I had a watermelon drink which was also delicious. Certainly a place to visit in Phoenix.
Had the Pulled pork sandwich, amazing. Have been here two other times. Brought my wife and daughter. They were equally pleased. The waitress was top notch as well. I will be going back here often.

6 of us felt like bbq on Labor Day was an appropriate way to officially celebrate the end of our summer but didn't want to deal with the actual hassle of cooking.  Bobby Q hit the spot. We started with the hot wings--all drummettes--kind of standard hot wing fare. 

We all shared the "whole hog" platter which consisted of 2 slabs of ribs and 2 different bbq meats. They ran out of baby back ribs (booooo...) so we got the St. Louis ribs and the beef brisket and sliced bbq pork.  All very good stuff. The meat was tender and flavorful. I particularly liked the brisket. The waitress said that the "whole hog" would feed 3-4 people so we ordered the fried catfish as well.  I guess she meant 3-4 HUGE people, because it fed 6 of us and we still had leftovers (4 guys and 2 girls). The catfish was also good, not overcooked. We shared 4 sides: mac & cheese, mashed potatoes, grilled veggies, and roasted corn. The sides were quite satisfying, but not outstanding. 

We all ordered the fresh lemonade as a beverage--good but too sweet so I had ask for unsweetened ice tea to balance it out. Again, we were all too stuffed for dessert. 

Miss C and I agreed that we would definitely come back and take advantage of their happy hour specials--1/2 off margaritas, doubles for the price of singles, and 1/2 off apps--Tues-Fri from 4-8 pm.
Best all around bbq place in the city! Excellent service, very friendly wait staff, nice ambiance and great food! Love their mini donuts! Go here, won't be disappointed!

When you walk in it feels very welcoming. The staff there is wonderful. Our server was on top of everything they were very quick at refilling our drinks and getting us anything we asked for. The food came out really fast which was surprising. I was highly satisfied with the quantity and quality of our food . The bbq ribs are to die for! I live over an hour away from this place, but it's worth the drive !

The restaurant lost our reservation but they made up for it by giving us the private room. We had a party of 10 and throughout the evening our waiter, Chandler, kept checking up on us and our drinks were never less than halfway empty. The food was amazing and the service was fantastic!
Foods very average.....for the price wasn't worth my time. The atmosphere was nice but over all. Overage food for larger than needed prices.

This is a great casual restaurant that is fun for couples as it is as easy for families. Always has great drinks and barbecue. Must tries are the frozen banana dessert and rolled taco brisket appetizer!! Always a fun place, quick service and great food.

Stopped in for a business lunch and it does not get any better. Was visiting town on business and the client suggested the venue. This joint hits on all cylinders. Greeted and seated promptly. Friendly but not intrusive server who was always there at the right time. Great corn bread to start. Had the BBQ chicken sandwich and shoestring fries. Delicious. Also, the five you a mini sugar donut made onsite with your bill. OMG best part of the meal. Leaves you with a great taste in your mouth. Pun perhaps intended or not ;)

Great service and the manager actually stopped by
Get the steaks and ribs 
I haven't had better

Went here on a Wednesday night. Waited 20 minutes to be seated. The atmosphere was killer and the server was very nice but my $35 steak that we waited 30 minutes for was WAY overcooked. They were also out of blue moon draft. I imagine I just caught them on a bad night  but I don't think I'll be coming back.

My friend and I ate here as our last meal before flying back home to SF and OH MY. She said it was the best meal of the trip and I had to agree. The meat was just fall-off-the-bone-oh-so-good!! The mac n cheese was good and goey, and full of cheese. I absolutely loved the fact that they gave us donuts after our meal and it was fresh because it was hot when given to us. Highly recommend this place!!!

Loved the foods (baby back rip & St. Louis style ribs) and Q-rolls with nice treat of corn breads. 
Q-Lada was one of best drink I had. 
Plus the server was very nice and pleasant.

This place has a really great selection of BBQ. We tried a sampler and it was all very good. Portions are very big. We ate at the bar, but we were serviced by one of the best bartender/waitress that I have ever seen. Thanks Sarah! I will return on my next trip to Phoenix!
I love this spot. Great food fast service any desert you choose  will satisfy  your pallet the atmosphere  alone is super duper.

Well deserved high rating!

Like:
Brisket - soft & juicy, smoked for 18 hours!
Rotisserie chicken
Mashed potatoes
Baked potato
Pale Ale craft brew
Ambiance 
Customer service

Wish:
More craft beer selection (porters, stouts)

You and your family should stop if you are looking for a quality meal.  Their BBQ brisket was the best I've ever had. Our server Jessica was very kind and attentive. At the end of the meal they gave us wonderful donuts.

Best bbq I have ever had and trust me I try a lot off bbq places. We were her for my sons baseball Junior Olympics and this place was recommended to us. We tried it the very last day and let me tell you, We will be going back every single time were in Arizona. We had the 49 dollars platter that came with 2 different types of ribs, chicken, tri tip and 2 sides. AMAZING!!!! the corn  bread is also the best and at the end they bring you this little donuts. This place is a must.

Bobby-Q had amazing food!!! We visited from San Francisco, Bay Area and this was wonderful. We ordered the q rolls for appetizer and it was delicious! The whole Hog Heaven is perfect for a family of four to five. All was good, but the St. Louis ribs were just a little too salty. We also found a hair in our mashed potatoes. However, the service is excellent and all the waiters are very amiable. In addition to the feast, they treated us with fresh donuts that were delicious. Overall, a 5-star amazing restaurant with top-notch food. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. It is literally barbecue heaven.

Found this place through Yelp because Pappadeaux's was packed and I wanted a Poboy! Our server Chelsea asked us if it was our first time there, and was excited to tell us they age their meats and slow cook them. My bf and I weren't sure what we wanted for an appetizer, so Chelsea recommended Q-pops. They were mouth watering beef brisket taquito type appetizers with BBQ sauce and chipotle sauce. The Mister ordered the Pulled Pork Sandwich with Grilled Veggies and I got my Catfish Poboy with Potato Salad. Everything was so delicious!!! They also give you cornbread, which tasted sweet. I cannot wait to come back and try out the rest of the menu!

We came across this place while searching for a place open late on Sundays, and we're glad we did. The food was excellent, the service was hospitable, and the atmosphere was perfect. Will definitely make sure I return the next time I'm in town.
This is the best BBQ in the Phoenix area. Q rolls are awesome and are waiter Garrett was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us great service.

Deeeee-licious!!!!  It's always a treat to come here and they never disappoint.  Their southern fried chicken is such a treat.  Their BBQ is amazing.  And even their salads are worth mentioning.  We take guests here often - ok only special guests - but they always leave satisfied and wanting to come back on their next visit.  Great service and usually always get a stop-by visit by the manager - evidence they care about their service and food!
Being from the southeast. This is the best tasting I have found in Phoenix and west of the Mississippi. the meat is smoked just right and the portions are great.

Don't go there if you are vegetarian, but if you like meat, that's the place to be!!! I came for the weekend to play some golf. Found the place on Yelp and went there for dinner on Friday night. Went again for lunch on Sunday..:). The service was fast, good, even when the waitress forgot one item (maybe she didn't believe that we can eat that much...), still it was much better than other places.
I had the Cajun shrimps and prime rib on Friday. Sides: Corn and coleslaw. Was great. Sunday was even better: the three meat combo: Texas ribs, st. Louis ribs and beef brisket. Same sides. Didn't eat until Monday...So if you are in Phoenix and love smoke house don't miss it!!
And yes, clean restroom!!!

Absolutely the best barbecue I've ever had!  Brought my father here on his visit from Texas and he agreed.  My husband had the beef brisket and I had the pork and coleslaw sandwich so we could try both and both were amazing!  Will have to make this a new favorite spot!
We were here on Friday and back again today love this place our server Garrett was on point
Food excellent smoke house burger is my favorite sides of sweet potato fries & or macaroni & cheese save ur cholesterol counting for another day or place. Cheese cake for dessert
Super busy at lunch time, but we had made a reservation. Food was really good but the mac and cheese is really rich, a bit too much. The BBQ was top notch and I would come back again.

This place is seriously just...AMAZING. The staff treats everyone with the utmost respect, everyone is extremely friendly, & the food is just magnificent. Seriously...just go. Just go there right now. Stop reading this & GO.
Good spot. Great appetizers.  Brisket was great.  A bit pricy.  The atmosphere is a bit confusing with a club attached...but once you get past that pretty good stuff here.
This place is a no brainer for BBQ!!! Food is always delicious and service is great . Every time I'm in town, I always make time for Bobby Q..

Coming from the midwest, I was used to eating at many different bbq places.   There were a lot of mom and pop bbq joints.  Some great, some not.  So glad I tried bobby q.   Quality and very tasteful.   I have had  the brisket, sausage, and ribs.   All excellent.   Great ambiance.  Great service.   Great donuts to go.   Cant wait to go back!

Best BBQ we have ever eaten. We got the big combo platter, and expected to like a couple of the options (you can choose up to 4), but we loved everything - beef ribs, brisket, pork, and St. Louis ribs. The Mac and Cheese was to die for, very cheesey, almost too cheesey. It was our first time there, so we were so pleasantly surprised when they handed us the WARM donuts as we paid the bill. Really delicious.

The best bbq restaurant I have ever been to.  The food and service provided was phenomenal.  I am a big fan of bbq and have tried it all, this was one of the best I have had.  We ordered the whole hog heaven to sample a little bit of everything.  It was delicious and cooked perfectly. We will definitely be a long time customer at this place.

I worked here for quite sometime... I can honestly say this is one of the cleanest, tastiest, and most affordable "just past casual" dining you will ever encounter. There is literally no bad item on the menu; however, I can honestly say the Smokehouse Burger, BBQ Brisket, and Mac and Cheese outdoes the rest of the menu. The atmosphere can be a little dark, but creates a more private experience. Service is some of the best I have ever encountered.

Oh. My. God.

This place has THE BEST ribs I've ever had. I really popped in here on a whim and was blown away by the food. I went on a Sunday and got $10 off the sharing platter. This place has the nicest cornbread muffins too, but really everything is delicious. I went to grab the half-rack of ribs and the bones just fell out of the meat.
