At the half-way point I had to stop myself because I'd end up pigging out. I got the rest to go but honestly this was the best cue I had in all of the USA.
The food was awesome. Our server was the best. I believe her name is Alexis. Wish we lived closer, we would be here more oven.

Every single time I come here, it's a fantastic experience. My boyfriend and I make it a point to take our family and friends here when they come to visit Phoenix. The venue is so charming and the staff is always friendly. If you have any issues, they are always very quick to make it right. Plus, their food is out of this world! The Q rolls are a perfect appetizer and their meats are great! Definitely a must try if you're visiting Phoenix.

There's Famous BBQ, and there are Pit's along with several other places coworkers and the like have dragged me to. Let's face it, when it comes to BBQ everyone has a different take, and I don't like the overly sweet, globs of sauce thrown on at the last minute, in spite of claims it been smoked for hours. I'm not that big on loud country music and I don't want to go to a Ho- Down. I'm hungry; I want real ribs with meat on the bone. Good portions, albeit, I'll order the full rack of St Louis style ribs next time. The Rib's here do fall off the bone; they have a sultry smoky flavor. Corn Bread that is probably the best you can get and Beans, we'll I might work on those, but I come for the Ribs. Bobby Q is easy to see with its big sign visible from I-17, but might not be the easiest to find the first time, once you drive into the private parking area, I feel better. Safer, it's good to read there is security, but I haven't noticed them. Then again, I go for dinner.
This is the only Rib place that makes my mouth water; the Rib's are deeply smoked and taste like someone cared because they have a passion for RIbs. The service has been just right, every time I've been there, and not too long waiting for the check. I don't mind spending time in a restaurant, but when the plate is clean I like to go. My wife can have her BBQ Chicken, but I'm there for the Ribs. Other places, I'll think about and might eat, but these are the only Ribs in Phoenix that I won't say no to or have reservations about.

We tried this place a couple of weeks ago and were very impressed.  It's probably the best BBQ we've had in Arizona for sure and maybe one of our favorites of all time.  The sauce is excellent, the meat is tender and full of smoky bbq flavor.  We had the Sunday special which came with lots of different types of meats like pulled pork, ribs, brisket and chicken.  It was excellent.  The side of corn was tasty too as were all the sides.  This will be one of our new frequent places to eat!
This is one of my favorite places to eat in the world!  Great food, great service!  Try the the q-rolls!
Our office gets Bobby Q's catering for meetings, and everyone loves it. The barbecue is great. My favorite is their yummy macaroni and cheese.

My hubby & I aren't the biggest BBQ fans but Bobby Q is definitely a fav of ours! I have been here a few times for lunch with my dad & the engineering company I used to work for would always order it in for lunch meetings. Last night I wasn't in the mood to cook dinner so I called in a to go order & used my $50 gc I got for my bday, thx bro!

I ordered the following for the Mr. & I: q-rolls (app), smokehouse burger (no bbq sauce-add mustard) with shoestring fries, half rack of back baby ribs with mac & cheese & potato salad & for dessert their homemade mud pie. Oh & it also came with 4 pieces of cornbread & I bought a bottle of their BBQ sauce. 

The q-rolls were so freakin good, the chipotle dip that comes with is delish! My hubs said his burger was just ok but loved the fries. My ribs were fall off the bone tender & the mac & cheese was yummy. I didn't have room for the potato salad, but I've had it before & it's always good. I have to say their cornbread is so amazing, possibly the best I've ever had! The mud pie was just ok, the cookie crust had a weird taste & they used vanilla & chocolate ice cream, I prefer it with mocha. My hubby however, thought it was very good. 

We'll definitely be back whenever we have a craving for some delicious BBQ!

I love this place! I always get the Catfish Poboy because it is so yummy! Their BBQ is so tender and the meat just falls off the bone. I never liked corn bread until I had theirs! It is so buttery and soft. Yum!

Eh, brisket was dry till i soaked it in bbq sauce which was pretty good, if you are going to recommend a dish it should be good not dry and chalky.  Service was good, place was nice, especially the outside patio, shudda had the steak
Great service and absolutely delicious food & BBQ all around.  Already looking forward to my next visit

My husband and I have been eating here for years and it is absolutely the best BBQ in town!  We have taken several friends and family there and the staff and management are top notch.  Don't waste your money anywhere else Bobby Q's is the place to go!!!

BEST RIBS I HAVE EVER HAD! No joke. The amount of ribs you get for the price is insane. They also give you free donuts at the end as a go home treat. And those things are like crack to me. You MUST eat here if you love BBQ and live near phoenix.

This is the best restaurant in Phoenix. I LOVE it so much. It is a bit pricey, but the food is fantastic and the servers are great. Their happy hour is actually pretty good as well. I've tried several drinks and never been disappointed. The environment is so unique and fun. After you've eaten more than you can handle they also give you free donuts! Amazing place.
OH my is all I have to say!  The food here was the best!  If I lived in Phoenix I would be in trouble cause I would be here all the time!  Wait staff was friendly also.

Costs were acceptable even minus the reduction, but it did give me incentive to drive a bit further than I normally would for dinner. OH WHO AM I KIDDING, I was going to attempt this area anyways. I adore BBQ, and Bobby Q's does it right! My son discovered the sausage to be overly hot, but they did warn us when he purchased, so he ended up eating my meal and I took his. Extremely great things all around... BBQ beans were great, the cornbread was wonderful and did not fally to bits like it did at Thee Pitts Again, and service was spot on. Definitely worth a return trip!

Best BBQ I've ever had. Amazing appetizer! Strongly recommend the Q Rolls!!! Also the meal was fantastic. The sauce was the perfect and sweet. Also to top it off they give amazing donuts at the end. I don't have one complaint.

VERY good food at reasonable prices.  We had a large party so we made a reservation.  The waitress was agreeable to dividing up the checks.  Menu large and varied, but not overwhelming.  Great drinks, too!  I recommend this restaurant to everyone.

Great food and great service, Jessica, our waitress was especially efficient, friendly and helpful. Loved the pork sandwich .. One thing esp nice was the patio. It's nice to be outside without car and road noise. Highly recommend.

Bobby Q is my favorite place and they came through for me as usual. They have delicious food, great service and delicious food. Did I mention the delicious food?!  I love Bobby Q!  By the way, they also have a great happy hour that includes a dance floor and food!

I am a Phoenix local and pass Bobby Q just about everyday in my way to work and think that I should stop for a bite sometime. Well, I finally did and it was AMAZING! I went with some coworkers of mine and the service was extraordinary! I was a little nervous when we showed up and there was a full parking lot but it took no time at all until we had our lunches relieved to our table. I would highly recommend the Q rolls, they were so good! They also have great lunch specials! The cornbread and donuts they give you too at the beginning and end of the meal is fantastic. I cannot wait to go back!

This place was amazing! My husband & I were visiting from out of town. This restaurant was next to our hotel. The sign outside said "voted best in U.S." which peaked our interest. We love BBQ! We asked the front desk clerk about it & she said it was so good that she would recommend that we make a reservation because it was always so busy. We made our reservation & got there 15 minutes early & were seated by our reservation time. Everyone was extremely friendly! Our server, Justin, was polite & attentive. We ordered the giant platter that came with 4 choices of meat, a half pound each, & 3 sides. We ended up with the brisket, pulled pork, beef ribs & St. Louis ribs. Our sides were potato salad, pecan coleslaw & vegetables. Everything was delicious! My favorite was the brisket. The pulled pork literally melted in our mouths! The ribs were good but not the best I've had. The sides were delicious as well. The ambiance was very rustic & causal, just my kind of place! Prices were reasonable for what we got. The platter, a beer & glass of wine came to $66 after tax AND we had leftovers. Next time we visit Phoenix we will definitely be going back!

Great place if your looking for some good ol' comfort food. The ambience is fun. The cornbread is really good. Good enough for the wife to forget about her so called diet. If your debating on coming here stop it just get your butt in here! I always try different items on the menu and so far I haven't been disappointed

I have absolutely no idea how this place has so many great reviews. We were in the mood for bbq one recent Saturday night and the place we wanted to try only stayed open until 7, so we found this place on yelp and decided with so many great reviews, we should give it a try. 

Let's just say the cornbread was the highlight of the meal and I've had better cornbread. We ordered the Three Meat Combo and chose the St. Louis Style Ribs (they were out of the Baby Back Ribs), the brisket and the pulled pork. For our sides, we got the mac & cheese and the ranch style beans. The beans were good and the ribs were just ok. The mac & cheese was definitely not up to par. The brisket had so much fat on it, it wasn't even edible and I had to drown the pulled pork in bbq sauce to eat it.

Minutes after we were given our food, they asked if we wanted boxes, and then came back a few minutes later and did the same thing. Not good service. Also - I was excited about the free mini donuts they give you to go. But - they're so bad, they're not even worth eating.

Pretty sure we won't be coming back here.

Well I was very excited to try this place based off of reviews and recommendations from friends. All I can say is meh. The food was extremely bland from the cornbread to the cloe slaw and even every meat on the sampler platter everything lacked any kind of flavor. This was extremely suppressing based on all of the raving reviews this place has. Maybe the cooks had an off day. There were two exceptions though the Mac and cheese was hands down the best I have ever had at a BBQ place and the Q rolls were amazing. Service was okay, but there was one thing that really made me uneasy about the place while eating I was watching the bar back cutting limes. First he wasn't wearing any gloves which is gross seeing that those limes go straight into drinks. But he then cut himself on the slicer, I could tell by his expression, he looked down at the cut and then continued to slice more limes. This really disgusted me so I decided to tell a manager. She came right But when I told her what had happened I really felt like she could care less. When we were finished talking she didn't even go remove the limes from the bar but went off to do something else. The food was definitly a dissapointment especially for the $50 price tag but again everyone has an off day, but I definitely won't be back because of what I witnessed and how little was done to fix it.

I'm giving Bobby Q an extra star in this update to my previous review, because although it has its share of hits and misses, it is, in fact, as good as it gets in Phoenix for great barbecue. I love barbecue. It is a hobby of mine. When I get stuck on something and want to know what it should look and taste like, I go to Bobby Q and am almost never disappointed. Most recently, this happened with beef brisket. I'm going to upload a picture I took of Bobby Q's brisket because seriously, if you look at it and don't want to immediately die from desire, then you just don't like barbecue. If I had anything bad at all to say about Bobby Q, it would be that sometimes their meats can be slightly overdone but this is not the norm. Their quality control, considering how much food they must serve to keep up with the demand, is astounding.  Their prices are too high, but of course, you're paying for the almost Disney-esque atmosphere. Their sauce is absolutely delicious (although it should be noted: they don't understand what "spicy" means). All in all I really can't say enough good things about this place. Go look at my brisket photo. Seriously.

I got the tasting platter (or whatever it's called for $13) and chose the Pork, Ribs and Brisket with a side of pecan slaw.

I didn't expect a feast, and wasn't disappointed. the portions were what one would expect from a tasting platter: 4 or so small ribs, several forkfuls of pulled pork and 3-4 pieces of brisket. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the slaw. That thing had me pleasantly chowing down for more time than any of the meats I chose. 

How was the meat: the pulled pork was EXCELLENT. It was tender, juicy, and had just the right amount of BBQ sauce. The brisket was a bit on the lean side, but had enough help from the great house BBQ sauce to push that one through. When you got brisket that had a bit more fat to it, it would just melt in your mouth (that's the way brisket should be!). The ribs (St. Louis-style) were as good as everyone on here hypes them: the meat can be pulled off the bone with little to no effort. I don't recall how smokey the ribs were, but I liked them regardless and noted that the house wasn't trying to use rib-meat as a thinly-veiled vehicle for BBQ. The ribs were lightly sauced, and the strength of the preparation was, in no way, not masked by said sauce.

For dessert, my table order a 1/2 order of the banana pudding, and a full order of the mud-pie. We *loved* the banana pudding (it's more like a banana custard atop a pecan-crumb crust), but couldn't find it in ourselves to enjoy the mud-pie. Our waitress was gracious enough to take the pie back and bring us a full order of banana pudding! What a gal!

Simply put: if I'm back in/around Phoenix and am craving BBQ, I will not hesitate to come back here and get either a pulled pork sandwich or a full rack of ribs.

We have dined here at least 15 times, since we eat out at least 4 times per week. We have not been back in over 2 years, due to issue below:
The Good:
-Servers
-Brisket
-Ribs
-Salmon
-Shrimp
-Cornbread (love the corn kernals...please add a few more?)
-Cole slaw (PLEASE add a few more pecans!)

The Bad:
-Pulled Pork (for years it tastes like natural gas grill--sorry, but that's accurate and I am a paid "taster")

The Ugly:
-We have not been back, since one visit, our Guest who bought us drinks while standing around waiting for a table was highly over-charged for cocktails!  
Charged $14.00 for a glass of St. Michel Reisling ($7 to $8. for a bottle at any super market)  Also charged $14. for a well-drink and $9. for a bottle of Bud Light!
We should have asked for the manager right at the moment, but as good restaurant goers, we let it go in a busy environment.  

I phoned a few days later to be treated very poorly and found that " I must be mistaken"
I have phoned about a year later (because I would like to go back but my partner will not) and the prices were lower than we paid that night.
Perhaps this was a dishonest bartender, taking advantage or perhaps prices have since been reduced.
Nevertheless...with an issue like this, you would THINK that someone would care enough to at least be courteous, let alone offer compensation...although, we never usually accept compensation. 
However...Bobby Q's doesn;t care...they are busy enough.

Oh well...I miss the place...but RoadHouse at Metrocenter just a mile away, gets all of our BBQ  business now.

I was in Phoenix for a NASCAR race earlier this year and went to this place. Wow, I don't know where to start!!! Our waitress Stacy or maybe staci was awesome!!! All of the food was amazing but you must try the q rolls!!!!
Had the pulled pork, brisket and ribs. Their meat is slow smoked so it's very tender and very good. Nice atmosphere and great service also!

AMAZING!!!! The food is so good! It was freakin' delicious. We had the hog heaven with St. Louis, chicken, brisket, and baby back with three sides. OMG it was incredibly juicy and tender and tasty. They offered us different sauces. We went with the Carolina sauce. 

And the service was spot on. Everyone greeted us and was super friendly. These folks know "customer service". They made you feel like they're so happy you chose to come to their place.

Bobby Q is now at 32nd St and Camelback in the Safeway Plaza! This is by far the BEST BBQ IN THE ARCADIA\BILTMORE area!!!! The BRISKET literally melts in your mouth and no need for a knife it's so tender!! So far I've also had the prime rib and ribs and they were EXCELLENT! The servers are friendly and super attentive. Come in and Bob may be there to personally greet you and welcome you to BBQ heaven!!! I LOVE GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE!!!!

Not only does this place offer life changing BBQ... The service is always top of the line! They even give you a fresh doughnut with your check. 

Only Downside: There are a few tables with crazy bright lights. They need to dim those puppies!

This place rocks! The food really is great and the atmosphere is so fun. We tried the catfish, salmon, roasted chicken and the pulled chicken sandwich. Everything was excellent, maybe the salmon just so-so. The service was OK. Don't order dessert! Free homemade donuts for everyone!! Free cornbread as a starter, too.
Ordered for Thanksgiving to supplement our traditional meals. Stood in line for about 45 minutes but so worth it! Mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, beans = yummy! Definitely will visit again!
Don't come in parties of 7 I had to wait an hour while parties of 3 to 4 were being seated ahead. If they can seat small parties put tables together obvious solution.
Great wood fire grilled sirloin steak and loaded baked potato, sat at the bar and the staff was very accommodating and attentive. Definitely worth a visit.

This is one of the best BBQ places I have ever been to.  The baby back rib meat falls off the bone.  The sides were tasty as well.  Be hungry when you come, but be prepared to wait a bit if you didn't make a reservation.

Delicious barbecue, we had 4 meats platter that we split with three people.  The pulled chicken is amazing, the brisket tender and juicy, the ribs succulent and flavorful, best barbecue around.  The sides were delicious as well, mac & cheese was great, mashed potatoes did not disappoint, ranch beans aren't anything special but they tasted good.  

Service was great, waiter was attentive to our needs and accommodated a last minute switch after already putting in the order. Atmosphere is good, not too noisy/quiet, the lighting could be improved though, a single bulb above the table barely allows you to see what you are eating, though the food wasn't there long enough to be seen:)

Highly recommended to someone looking for great barbecue ribs, chicken, brisket, etc.

Outstanding food. Make sure to wear stretchy pants because you will walk out of this restaurant 10 pounds heavier. One of the best BBQ places I've ever tried. I highly suggest making a reservation because it can get busy in there. I've gone with friends and we share the "Whole Hog Heaven" which gives you the opportunity to try 4 different meats on their menu plus 3 sides. But the best part is defitnitely their bbq sauce so make sure to ask for extra because they will gladly give it to you! Their roasted corn is my favorite side dish and the mac and cheese is really good too. 

Also, try the Q-rolls as a starter. The chipotle dip is delicious! And make sure to get an order of the cornbread too..you won't regret it!
First time there tonight. Great quality food and attentive service. Definitely going back soon.

I didn't try their food but the drinks did not dissapoint! We definitely had fun, the music was great and the staff was on top of it! As far as price goes I do think its reasonable compared to other places we have been to!

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place before. I'll keep it short... food, atmosphere, service, all awesome. If you like BBQ or steaks, definitely hit this place. Just don't do it on a night I'm going, sometimes it gets very busy. :D

If you're in the Phoenix area definitely make this a must have dinner trip! We had to wait no time at all and were seated very quickly. Our server was Nicole and she was literally the best server we have ever had. She made sure we were attended to and had a great personable conversation with us. The food was amazing as well. We had the pulled pork sandwich and the BBQ chicken sandwich which were both perfect. We are from the east coast towards the south so we have had our fair share of BBQ and this was by far the best we've had. The mac and cheese was great and we both got it as our side. For dessert we got the death by chocolate which once again was amazing. To top it all off they brought us little donuts as an end of the meal treat and they were so good we had to force them down as we were so full but they were just so amazing! We were checked on once again by two gentlemen who were hosting and both were amazing and made sure or experience was good. Both were extremely personable. Overall an amazing establishment and made our trip to Phoenix even better! We will definitely be back in the future!
Bobby Q did not disappoint. Our server and the manager blew us away with their amazing service!!
I was very satisfied with food and service. Their burgers are amazingly good. They served corn bread when we got seated and it was very good.

Found this place on yelp and so happy I did! We're from California so we wanted to find a local place to eat. Delicious food, fun environment, and great service. The manager came to each table to say hi and to make sure everything was great. Coming back here tonight to bring my sister and her friends before heading back to California. A must try! Q rolls were yummy. Complimentary corn bread was delicious. Prime rib and ribs we ordered were so tender. Can't go wrong with any of the sides. All were tasty. Fresh hot Donuts are a nice treat at the end too! A+ in my book!!

Had a great dinner at Bobby Q's, tonight, as always the food was amazing, especially the mac and cheese and I must say our waiter DEAN was awesome! He explained all the specials offered suggestions and when our food was served made sure to check and see that it was cooked to order, which it was! Definitely recommend Bobby Q's, great atmosphere, great food and great staff!

I'm from out of town and came in here for lunch and to watch some football on a Sunday. We ordered the Q Rolls to start which were delicious and then out came the cornbread which was amazing! Then my pulled pork sandwich came out with coleslaw. I requested the spicy BBQ sauce and while the taste was great, it literally had no spicy-ness to it. The coleslaw was okay; it didn't really have any flavor. We also ordered the ribs and they were very good. They were meaty and it fell right off the bone. Then as we were leaving we got a to go bag of yummy, cinnamon sugar, mini donuts! I thought that was a really nice touch. I would definitely recommend this place and if I'm ever back in town, I will go back.

My first review! I felt obliged to sign up (and do this), since I found Bobby Q via Yelp (tonight) in the first place. We enjoyed ribs and pulled pork, the food was just right. Not Memphis mastery, but a solid effort. The BBQ sauce was especially good--all our sides were fresh (especially the pecan cole slaw, which can easily get "soft" by 10pm depending on the establishment. They started the meal with good (sweet) cornbread. Overall nice and clean atmosphere--the manager asked if we were okay several times. We got free tiny cinammon donuts at the end, a nice touch-. I left stuffed, $40 even (without tip) for two. Note that they provide a 10% Yelp discount--smart choice, I wish them the best.
Great atmosphere, great service, great food! I love BBQ and I very impressed... I would highly recommend Bobby Q!

Eat here all the time!  Favorites include BRISKET!!!

Try the Loaded Potato, Meatloaf Special on Thursdays (a little spicy), BBQ Chicken Sandwich is a great option.  Mashed potato and Mac/Cheese are best sides.

Looking for the lighter side, the Avocado Salad with BBQ Vinagrette is awesome!
This place is amazing. Better than Dillon, better than famous Dave's. The best barbeque.

If your a true BBQ lOVER as I am this is the one to visit! I've had the ribs, pulled pork, and brisket and it's all good. I've drive out of my way and don't mind passing other by on the way. A little pricey but we'll worth it, I'll definitely be back again and again two thumbs up

Amazing. Service almost makes me wonder if they've been professionally trained, they're so efficient and attentive. Starting cornbread was surprisingly moist and tasty, and main meal sides all had just that one extra touch to make it better than average (ex. pecans with the traditional cole slaw, extra garnish on potato salad), with the roasted corn especially good. Steak, chicken, and shrimp were delicious (steak especially so, best I've had in a while). We came in less than an hour before the restaurant closed and service and quality of food didn't drop at all. A great restaurant experience and would recommend.

Tried their pulled pork and chicken at Scottsdale BBQ festival and decided to go to their restaurant. Still think that chicken was the best and the ribs coming as close 2nd. Don't think the pullpork was that good - a little dry when we have it. The beef brisket was average.

One of my favorite (actually only American dish I like :) Barbecue. Bobby Q - is so good. sometimes you have to wait for 20 - 30 mins in peak hours but you can hang out at a bar until you get your table or eat at the bar. Food is so good. Never failed taste  - always busy even though it is in old housing neighborhood. Service is excellent - manager always comes around to ask for taste of food and service. Very well manged and you can taste good old Barbecue. Deserts are good too. Sunday special is something you want to try if you have four people.

Bobby Q has the best bbq food. It will not disappoint you.

It is in a tricky location and is somewhat confusing to get to, but, when you get there, there is plenty of parking and the food is so good. The mac and cheese, potato soup, mash potatoes, ribs, salmon, and bbq hamburger are my favorites.. 

The place is pretty dark inside and it has a nice dinner atmosphere.

If you haven't tried Bobby Q's and you are in the mood for some real slow cooked bbq, give Bobby Q's a try.

My wife, son (7) and I went to lunch here during a weekday. It was busy but not crowded and we were able to get a table right away. The waitress we had was excellent, she was knowledgeable, very attentive but not annoyingly so. I got pulled pork platter and my wife got the pulled pork sandwich. Both of these were excellent. The portions were a good size, and the corn bread was very good as well. My wife ordered the lemonade to drink, which she said was great and couldn't get enough of. My son ordered the cheeseburger and was not too impressed, although he is a picky eater sometimes. Also, when leaving, they give you a couple of mini sugar doughnuts as a treat that they make fresh at the front of the restaurant.

Have been back two time since. This place is just amazing. Service is always way above and beyond. This time Riley was our server and he did an amazing job. Portions are always good, flavors are amazing, and service is prompt and non-intrusive. What more could you want from a restaurant?

Wow this BBQ is the best!!! I had searched for this place on the Internet because I had been here years ago and it was a themed restaurant  .....Bobby McGees where the wait staff was dressed in character. When we arrived we were told that they quit doing that 8 yrs ago ;( They told us we would not be sorry if we stayed and they were right. It was by far the best BBQ ever!! Melted in your mouth. I told them I was looking on yelp to see if others loved them too and that they did!!! Then our excellent friendly server told us we got 10% off for mentioning yelp!! Wooo hoo icing on the cake.

My office tends to go here often for lunch. I have gotten the fish all every  time i have been there. The fish is fabulous. It is a different type of batter than you usually get. The fries that come with it are the shoe string type and quite good. The table gets corn bread which is my favorite. I might just only eat the corn bread next time. 

On occasion, the wait staff has not been as prompt as I normally care for. I waited almost 15 minutes once for vinegar for the fish and chips. Sometimes they are slow to refill drinks. It is usually when it is a small party that I have had slower service.

What a great BBQ, and more restaurant. The food is fantastic, the service outstanding, and yes, the desserts are to die for. This is a great lunch or dinner spot and we really enjoy meeting friends for a meal.

Took previous reviews and had the Brisket sandwich... Very good! Beans- loved them!! Corn bread yummy as well. Alicia our server was so sweet, friendly and accommodating! Definite place to visit again

This food here is soooooooo good.  The Q-rolls are my favorite, and I love the cornbread.  We eat here at least once every 6 months, and the pulled pork is just so delicious, last night I felt like a whole pig was on my sandwich (I certainly felt like a pig after devouring every scrap of it).  That made me very happy because even though it was really too much food, the last 2 times we ate here the portion was much smaller.

We had really wonderful service (Zac) and there was a table having a party that just kept growing (I think eventually 18 people arrived) and no service suffered because of it so bravo to everyone for being able to handle a full restaurant and a huge group of people while not ignoring the rest of the patrons.

I am not a bit BBQ fan but this place is fantastic! I didnt want to go here but my friends talked me into it. I am very surpised that I loved the food. The whole place smells amazing. Everything I have ever ate here tastes delicious. They even give you little donuts before you leave. 
Friday nights they have a buffet and a DJ and music to dance to for happy hour.
I'm from Texas where the B-B-Q is the best .Bobby-Q  rates on top with the best  B-B-Q  in Texas .Yeah ,Way to go ,and the Staff is excellent .Thanks for a great evening. Linda
Food and service, xlnt.  Eat here.

This place has amazing cornbread, I'd go just for that. In fact, you should go at least once just to try it. 

Service was really slow and unattentive, but it's a popular place so that was expected. I got the ribs but they didn't even come off the bone that easily. it was obvious they were cooked fast, not a proper slow and low. We had a few sides to sample, but they werent anything to note. 

It's a fun, lively place but I won't be making a habit of it as there's better rib options out there.
Coming from Florida with a lack of everything, this is outstanding BBQ and our service was great too!  No complaints. First visit and will definitely be back!!

I was so disappointed. This was not the first time they put in the small beef rib in this meal namely jumbo texas beef rib. This meal cost $27 before tax which was supposed to contain 4 jumbo beef ribs. But they put in this small size of beef rib which caused the dish was not value for money that we paid. This is not the first time. I will stop buying from this restaurant.

I've driven by this spot so many times on the 17 and finally decided to look it up on yelp.  Based on the mostly rave reviews my boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot.

First off I was really excited about the mac n cheese since so many people said it was amazing.  I was severely disappointed and agree with another reviewer who said it tasted like velveeta.  I'm convinced that's exactly what it was.  The beans tasted like watered down canned baked beans.  Okay, now that the bad is out of the way let me tell you about the good.

We ordered the Q rolls as recommended and we weren't disappointed.  Both sauces were tasty.  We couldn't decide on what to get so we went with hog heaven to try a bit of everything.  We chose the St. Louis ribs, the beef ribs, brisket, and pulled pork.  Our sides were mac n cheese, beans, and roasted corn.  We had to ask for cornbread.

The cornbread was good, on the caky side but still good.  The roasted corn was very good, I recommend it.  The brisket and pulled pork were definitely up to par.  I grew up on both.  They weren't quite my dad's, but still worthy of recommendation.  Both ribs were fall off the bone.  I hadn't has St. Louis ribs before and I wont get them again.  They were on the spicy side, which I personally don't prefer.  The beef ribs were very tasty and I would order them again.

After waiting for some boxes we started to look around at the other tables.  The baked potatoes look awesome, stuffed to the hilt of goodness.  They also had vegetables.  No mac n cheese or beans in sight.  We'll definitely follow suit next time.

All in all we were pleased with the experience.  The main food was done right and the restaurant and atmosphere was great.  The service was definitely to our liking.  The 10% off from yelp was also a bonus :)

We are both huge fans of honey bears and their sauce, although as of late the ribs haven't been fall off the bone.  We are considering buying honey bears' sauce and getting Bobby Q's beef ribs to go without the sauce.

We drove 30 min to B.Q. this past Saturday evening 7:30ish our first visit.The place was jumping & we were starving we happily gave our name to the young hostess and asked how long does she think it will be - about an hour & a half - ok. So we left and got a quick snack to hold us over down the street . We returned  30 min later & the place was half empty  with the same hostess at the front had called us twice. Where did 1 1/2  hour wait go? No big deal.

So by this time we forgo the dinner idea and ordered  cocktails and a couple brisket sandwiches along with the sides. "" WOW"  Wheres the beef ?  It sure wasn't on our table it looked more like an empty Mcdonalds bun. The sides were good along with the tad of beef. Table service was A+ and triple A+  to the nicest lady flr mgr who was working hard helping out on the tables...... Sweet idea with the donuts...
 
Big disappointment - over $40.00 bucks &  no beef.  Sorry for the ding.

Came here for dinner tonight for the first time in a few years and it was just fantastic. Our server Jonah was super helpful with all of our questions and made the night great! We ordered the Hog Heaven to split and it was amazing. Can't wait to come back.

Hands down. AMAZING BBQ. Dinner started with delicious cornbread. Then we split the combo platter which was very large for $13 and had ribs, brisket, pulled pork, corn and the nice waitress even brought us out some cole slaw and Mac and cheese to try. Delicious!!!  The waitress was extraordinary. I saw drinks being brought out in real pineapples. At the end they even bring you out a bag of hot fresh donuts. This place is YOWZA good. Total bill was a measly $15. LOVE!

What can I say that you don't know about this place? It's been reviewed over 50 times...  I had been dying to try it as I love a great pulled pork sandwich and everyone was telling me how great they were here!

Well, I was not disappointed.  The pork was tender with great flavor, overflowing off the bun, creating a sticky BBQ mess (which is just the way I like it!) I went for the ranch beans instead of the fries, and while you don't get a lot, they were very good.  I skipped the corn bread and little dessert donuts (didn't need the carbs) but everyone else loved them. 

I'm still looking for the best BBQ pulled pork sandwich in Phoenix, but this is the leader so far!

Came here yesterday (first time) for lunch. We had 4 people and we all LOVED our selections plus the appetizer we shared!!!
The server, Sam, was great; ambiance wonderful and the food was fabulous!!!
Excellent experience - we'll go back for sure

Best barbecue in phoenix! Love the brisket oh man the prime rib is so tender just like the ribs they practically fall off the bone. Did I mention the roasted veggies potatoe salad chicken wings I could go on and on about this place but you gotta check it out for yourself I know I will  be back.

My family went here on a trip up to Flagstaff and are now ruined on barbeque. The prices were very reasonable, the portions big, the flavors fantastic, and the draft beers thirst-quenching. I don't think I'll ever have ribs that good again. Our server and the bartender were very attentive. If you must go here, be sure to mention Yelp for 10% off your order. We had the Whole Hog Heaven ($38) and Q-Rolls ($9), which were more than enough for four people. The Amber Ale, available in 21 oz glasses, is a good pairing. The ambiance is noticeably better than Chilli's, but not pretentious. Stopping here was a highlight of our trip.

Wow what a pleasant surprise this place was. The food was great, and the service was outstanding.
4 stars for the restaurant. I would go back again.


The bar in the back was a little weird of a set up, the rules were hilarious, I thought it was a joke at first, but no, it  made you wonder what kind of clientele they dealt with. The service was good. I didn't care for the vibe in bar though..left after one drink.  I wouldn't go back.
The only complaint about this place is I will never be able to eat ribs anywhere else again and be happy. Nirvana for smoked meat. We loved it!!

Excellent! My wife and I were pleasantly surprised with this hidden gem. Ordered a combination plate...hog something. Two ribs, two meats, and three sides. Meat was so tender it melted in your mouth. WOW! 

If your ever in Phoenix stop by and have a the best meal experience ever! Price and food portions were perfect! Service was great everyone made sure that you were taken care of...trust me if you want a great meal come and get it! 

We're from California and would definitely stop in again while passing through.

Great job!

Brisket, pulled pork, St. Louis ribs, beef ribs, pea can coleslaw, potato salad and veggies.

There is good and bad in my review. Ultimately I do not regret going here but I feel obliged to pass on the whole story.

So we were going to be in Phoenix for a few days for my son's birthday. Bobby Q was one of the restaurants that came up as a recommended place to eat. I was told when I looked them up on Urban Spoon that if I mention them that I would get 10% off, so I figure "hey why not?" I mention it to the waitress when we arrive and when we get our bill and nothing was done. Though 7 or 8 bucks really won't make or break me, if they think coming out a few bucks ahead is worth having that advertised on a site like this then I simply think that's a foolish way to conduct business - draw people in with a deal and then back out on it. That being said I did like the food there. It wasn't the cheapest meal but it also wasn't outrageous (I think about 70-80 for my wife, son, and I). We went with the one offer that was like $40 for a couple of different types of ribs, sides, and other meat products. We were honestly quite full and agreed our health would take a major hit if we were to eat like that on a regular basis. Pretty cool décor in the place. I'd rate it higher but it does bug me with their false offers. Honour it or take it down. If you go in with that knowledge you'll probably more or less enjoy your dining experience.
The smoke house wasn't as good as I thought it would be. Q rolls a must have, and the brisket was too die for.

This is my reliable date night restaurant especially when in the mood for good BBQ. Experiences have always been fantastic that have led my fiancé and I will be to book Bobby Qs for our rehearsal dinner. 

Considering our last visit and how busy it was our waitress Ashlynn was incredibly hospitable and everything exceeded our already high expectations.

Got in late from California Sunday night and went straight to Bobby Q's.  Had the prime rib/catfish combo.  The menu said it could feed two and it was right on!  My husband is healthy, so he ordered veggies for sides -- I was craving the mac and cheese and mashed potatoes I saw going to another table.  Anyway, the manager came over and knew we were tired and just wanted to eat and go, so he threw in a dessert -- anything we wanted!!!  I got the apple cobbler and good thing I got it to go because had I known it was that good, I would have ordered 2 so I wouldn't have to share with my husband.  I will definitely be going back when I return to Phoenix.

My boyfriend and I went to Bobby Q's last night for the first time because a friend recommended them.  We chose to sit on the patio which was a great choice as we had a pretty quiet meal. The mister's and the fans kept the area nice and cool even though it was close to 110 out.

We were promptly greeted by one of the best waitresses I've ever had the pleasure to be served by. She did her best trying to gently upsell us as is expected at restaurants these days, though she was far from being pushy. 

The food was a little expensive in my opinion which is the reason for the 4 stars, though I probably would have gone 4 and a half because it truly was some of the best barbecue you could have.  Not a long wait either! 

All in all it was a great experience, but as a warning, try and beat the dinner rush or you'll end up waiting for a long time. It's a pretty popular place.

This is some seriously good barbecue.  I had the two meat platter and I chose baby back ribs and chicken.  My sides were mac and cheese and ranch beans.  The ribs were meaty and fall-off-the-bone tender, slathered in a tangy sauce.  They were pretty impressive.  I love smoked chicken when it is done right, and this was top notch.  The bird was well-seasoned, smoky, and still maintained edible skin on the outside.  The mac and cheese was great, I could probably eat a whole portion of it for dinner.  The ranch beans were good, but rich, a little bit goes a long way.  I was very pleased with my meal at Bobby Q.  Thanks!

Great atmosphere, very good bbq, crappy location, and Blue Moon on tap!

Service was great, but we were there on a fairly slow Tuesday night.

I'm new to Phoenix from Michigan and was really craving some bbq ribs.  I started to go to Famous Dave's, but saw the good reviews on this restaurant and decided to go here instead.  I got the baby back ribs & St. Louis style ribs w/mac n cheese.  Everything was delicious!  The ribs were seasoned just right and it was literally falling off the bones.  It was much better than Famous Dave's ribs.  It is a little more expensive, but it's well worth it.

1st time here. We drove through lightning and hardcore rain but it was definitely worth it. Waitress was nice, the manager came by to check on us and the food was very very good. We are visiting from CA and we will make sure to eat here next visit. Complimentary cornbread with sweet butter, yum!

Horrible experience... My boyfriend and I came here the other day had to wait not even 5 minutes to be sat. The server came a few minutes later and seemed like he was nervous and new.. A little awkward but overall was nice. He got our drink order and we ordered some appetizers. The fries were delicious the wings on the other hand were just ok.. We decided to share a 12oz WELL DONE  "filet mignon". It took about 45 minutes for our food to come out and the server kept apologizing for the wait and said  it was being "cooked to perfection". Which was ok since we ordered it WELL DONE. The steaks finally came out and they were nice enough to split the plates for us. I cut into my steak and it was not even close to well done.. Too too pink.. We were upset because it took so long we were hoping it would Atleast Come out properly.. My boyfriend cut into his and it was slightly pink.. So he gave me his steak but both steaks weren't the way we asked... We told out server and he didn't offer to take our steaks away until a manager came by and the manager said we were gonna get some new steaks... They brought out the "new ones" but it was clearly the same ones just put on the grill longer... 
No flavor at all and very tough to bite into , if we're spending $20-25 on a steak we have some decent expectations.. My boyfriend and I didn't eat much of the steak the manager had to take a second look deciding if he should take the steaks off.. They gave us 9$ off.. 
Disappointed completely. 

One star for the fries and the delicious corn bread..

Bobby-Q's is a western family-friendly restaurant that serves a variety of barbeque goodness but they are mostly famous for their steak and their BBQ ribs. The restaurant has subdued lighting with lots of activity of people enjoying themselves with friendly servers. You have the choice of enjoying the bar setting, the dance club as well as sitting down and enjoying the amazing food. Bobby-Q has a well-designed menu that is easy to understand with reasonable prices for their amazing food.

Full disclosure: I'm a vegetarian.  What's that you say?  A vegetarian?!  What the heck is a vegetarian doing reviewing a BBQ place?  Settle down folks, I come in peace!

I have found myself at Bobby Q's a couple times now for my husband's work holiday party.  As I'm sure you could guess, this is likely the last place I would consider going, as I don't eat meat and I certainly wouldn't expect a bbq place to cater to my diet. :)  But I have to say it is probably one of the most vegetarian-friendly, meat-centric restaurants I have ever been to - is that a thing?  (Sorry Bobby Q's if I'm ruining your rep)

If you are a vegetarian and somehow find yourself here, you can definitely survive - in fact, you can actually really enjoy your meal. There are a few salads on the menu and also a bunch of great side dishes that you can assemble (tapas-style) to create a tasty vegetarian meal - my favorite combo is their baked potato (sans bacon), roasted veggies (super tasty) and the mac and cheese (seriously good).  In addition to the salads and sides there are several starters on the menu that will work as well as some a-la-carte items.  

The staff there are great and they are super accommodating - no eye rolling when you say, "I'm vegetarian, can I order a bunch of sides?" just a friendly, "Sure, what would you like?"  

And for all you meat eaters, check out the rest of the reviews - Bobby Q's clearly knows what they are doing.  Both times I've been there they are packed and its clearly a popular place.
If your coming to Phoenix you must eat here and be sure to ask for Amanda she is the best waitress in the place

If your into all things smoked or BBQ this place it the place for you! The b.b ribs are fall off the bone delicious! Love the ambiance, low lights, and country music! 
Don't worry about not getting dessert. They give you complimentary freshly made doughnuts. Yummy x100! 
Lunch time is the best time. love the wait staff! Good job you guys.

Some of the best BBQ I've ever had. And I've been to Kansas City. Low and slow cooking. Beautiful smoky flavor. The ribs were meaty and tender. The brisket was moist and beefy. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. The cornbread was warm and tender and sweet. The mac and cheese was flavorful, not pasty. The fries were thin cut and crispy. What a great meal. We took some of it home and it was just as great the next day. The only thing I was disappointed in was the beans. They tasted like vinegar. They really need to do a BBQ bean which would go with everything else. I forgave them when they gave us a little bag of freshly made doughnuts. Just the right thing to end the meal. So go! Take your kids, your relatives and friends. This is some good eats!
Had dinner there last night for a group of 7.  All of our entrees were great. Ribs, ribeye steak, brisket and all the sides were delicious. Stacy was our server and she was awesome!
Had to be the 1000 review for this. It's delicious! It's expensive yeah but it makes up with it with the taste. It's a classy joint. The baked potato is delicious and I love the barbecue sauce!

At a basketball tournament needed to eat between games, found Bobby Q nearby.  We walked into restaurant with a group of 12.  There was no problem seating us.  We had 3 waiters, all amazing!  Food came out quick and was soooo delicious!  Managers stopped by often to make sure everything was good.  Definitely will return.  Highly recommend!!!

Made a reservation on line for a Friday dinner, and arrived to a very packed parking lot but they had someone at the entrance assisting in the lot and we quickly parked and were at our table within minutes.  The server quickly took our order and was very helpful.  My 3 meat dish (sausage, chicken and Brisket) was excellent as was my wife's rotisserie chicken. Leftovers made a great lunch the next day.  The server was attentive and brought us our check promptly.  The gratuity guide at the bottom of the Bill is a bit tacky, but the Food and service is great!  We will be back.

Went to Bobby Q's for dinner with some friends and have mixed reviews about their food.  

I had their Burger and it was 5+ stars!  It was a mouth fun fest from start to finish. The meat was smokey and very tasty.  Well done, but I was OK with that. The sides of Mac and Cheese were some of the best I've ever tasted and their seasoned fries were awesome!

My friend had their pulled pork sandwich and it was 2-3 star rating. It was bland tasting and needed lots of their BBQ sauce for flavor. Their coleslaw was also missing a flavor punch, so he added some hot sauce to help it out.  The donuts were "meh" a little too greasy and needed the tons of sugar.  Why make them if they are just "meh", your cornbread is much better!  

Looking forward to trying their ribs, surf & turf and banana cake on my next visit!

this is my fisrt time to visit Bobby Q?Travis is so nice and patient?he severed us very well. With his help I could order the most delicious food there though I am a foreigner. My husband loves the restaurant too.

GREAT BBQ place in Phoenix...my colleagues and I went here one evening for some dinner and everyone had nothing but nice things to say about them!  I ordered the hot links with coleslaw, and mac and cheese and everything was absolutely delicious and bursting with flavor.  The hot links were awesome, full of spice and a large enough portion to feed two people, I'd say.  The sides were good portions as well and plenty for one person.  I would definitely return during my next visit to Phoenix.  Thank you Bobby Q's!
Best BBQ i've tried......and the building/ location was awesome.

Amazing food and great to work with!! I use them for catering every once in a while, and will be using them more in the future. Make sure you try the brisket and sausage! The baby backs are also incredible!!

Great food, great value, great ambiance, great service!  Loved it!  The delicious donuts that came with the bill were to die for!  If Phoenix didn't suck so bad, I would consider moving here to be closer to Bobby Q!
Great bbq!  They have the creamiest, sinful mac and cheese around!  The restaurant has good ambiance, we order take out from here quite often.  Must try it out!

Had the two meat combo with pork ribs and brisket. Had mac and cheese and grilled veggies for side. You have to get the Q-rolls which were phenomenal. Cornbread on point. Sooooo good. Gave us little cinnamon sugar donuts at the end. The service was best I've had in the valley. Amazing! Definitely will be a repeat customer. Will was the best server!
This is my third time here, the food and service has always been great.  Every visit, the manager makes it a point to swing by to see how they can improve their service. Great place!
I'm not generally a brisket fan, but I always go with the server recommendation. So glad I did!

First off, two warnings.
 
Do not visit this place if you are on a diet.  
Seriously, you will gain 3 pounds before you get back to your car.
No amount of good intention will save you.
 
And do not expect to enjoy this amazing BBQ restaurant if you are a strict vegetarian.
I mean, whut fer?

I read a few "reviews" for Bobby Q that made me wonder why the writers chose a very well known down-home style BBQ emporium, and then expected that the experience would mimic a Chez Souci foo-foo eatery. Huh? 
Whatever!

First off, make a reservation before arriving!  
Everybody in Central AZ knows this awesome joint, so you will not be lonely.
 
Or, if you enjoy having a few drinks before dinner just show up, leave your name at the desk, and taxi on over to the Adult Beverage area. 
Lots of fun folks to talk to while waiting, so its painless. 
They serve appetizers at the bar, if you need a head start. 

Crazy crowded it was - a tour bus with 49 people pulled up as we arrived. 
Even so, we were seated at a table within 40 minutes.

Another warning: 
If you are having a main course dinner, remember that the hot chow rockets out of their kitchen in 5 minutes flat (being a rotisserie and pit BBQ place, most of it is ready and waitin'). 

The servers are all super friendly and most efficient. The warm corn bread and butter hits your table immediately.

What's waitin', you ask? 
Well just about anything you ever saw Barbecued, that's what. 
Incredible slabs of ribs. Fantastic pulled pork. Amazing brisket. Chicken like you wish Mom could have made. Corn served country style (you'll see what I mean). 
 
The huge stack of food (for any meal ordered) will blow your mind and stretch your belt. Even if you arrived hungry as a bear, you can expect to walk out with a plate of leftovers (and house-made corn bread).
Believe me on that.

Yep - you will get messy (they provide wet naps) and will have to deal with some degree of consumption guilt on the ride home.  
BUT ITS WORTH IT!

I came here by myself while on a business trip and I absolutely LOVED this place. I was seated right away at a booth near the bar, and my waitress was extremely friendly and helpful while I tried to decide what to order. 

I had the Bobby Q's Amber Ale, which is brewed specially for them. If you like ales, this is definitely a good one and goes great with the barbecue. For dinner I decided to go with the smoked pulled pork, mashed potatoes, and mac and cheese. It came out so quickly I was sure they were bringing me someone else's order! Literally five minutes after I ordered it was at my table, piping hot. 

It was easily the most tender pulled pork I've ever had, and the BBQ sauce was just perfect. The mac and cheese wasn't be best, but it was still pretty delicious. The cornbread that comes with it was also great with a pat of butter. 

After I paid the check, the waitress came over with a little bag of fresh cinnamon sugar donuts which I devoured, even though I was completely stuffed from my meal. Definitely thinking of coming back here again while I'm in Phoenix!

Took the family out for BBQ. We decided on Bobby Q's. 
First visit, Really great food.and super service, we arrived and the BBQ smoke smell just tells you it's gonna be good.
We had a party of  6 adults and 4 kids. Everybody got, just what they wanted, prime rib, rib combos, bugers and catfish. the food was terrific. That alone was worth the trip from Chandler.
The service was the best I can ever remember, the waiter Cody was like Houdini. He would show up before you even thought of what you needed, very personable and made sure everybody got exactly what they wanted and kept the drinks  full all meal. This guy was a super star, and I'm really a grump if my glass is empty.
He made a great meal a fantastic meal. The corn bread was a real kid pleaser and the  mac & cheese disappeared as fast as it arrived. 
We are planning to be back soon with some friends and hope Cody is working.
Well Done... Well Done!

Truly the best BBQ Catering in Arizona. I have used them several times for anything from a Company Christmas Party to Birthday and Graduation Parties. Prices are reasonable and the service is great. Best tasting brisket ever and I haven't had anyone at any of the parties they have catered that hasn't loved the mac and cheese and cornbread!

Love this place!  Ugh the bad experience (see my review) at Red River BBQ was the most disgusting BBQ and over all worst experience. So my husband made it up to me by bringing me here to Bobby Q's. 

The Q'lada drink was great! The brisket was so moist and flavorful. Pecan coleslaw Yum!!!!

Service is very attentive and the management exceptional!!!

Best BBQ I've ever had!!! The food was just as good as the service. The manager Taylor was superb! We had a grumpy toddler and he did everything he could to make her happy. The environment was great too!!! Can't wait to come back!!

My boyfriend and I were just looking for something good to eat close by. We stumbled upon this awesome place. It's very good! We got the hog heaven since we wanted that bang for your buck kind of deal! It's so worth it... Sooooo much food, we are still eating left over from last night! The only thing is that the sides could have been a little bigger (it feeds up to four ppl). Besides that everything was great! The service , the food, and the overall experience WAs exactly what we like! We will definitely be coming back and totally recommend!! Yummmmmm , I don't remember the last time I left a restaurant and had that big of a smile on my face .

I loved the fact that upon seating I was served with some really good, off the chart corn bread.  I ordered the brisket, pulled pork, Mac and cheese, and ranch beans. The protein was super tender and savory. I personally enjoyed the brisket more. The Mac and cheese was creamy and cheesy just the way I like them. The ranch beans were on the sweeter side but some good beans all together. When the receipt was brought to me for payment I received complementary donuts which I thought was so awesome. They sure know what to do to get clients crawling back in.

My friend and I personally felt like the server we had didn't want to be on the job so that was unfortunate.

My wife took me and my parents here to eat on  father's day and the food was awesome as usual. The negative first...our. 5:30 reservation turned into a 6pm seat time...but what can you expect on a day like this. Positive...our waiter Justin was amazing. As busy as it was Justin was extremely attentive and very well  versed in the menu (and he is relatively new there). In addition, his conversational skills are such that it made for a relaxing and enjoyable evening. Thank you Justin!!!

Baby back ribs were delicious! I love this place, definitely coming back!! It was a busy Friday night but it's worth the wait. Corn bread is an excellent appetizer. We even got donuts to go. I'm very impressed with Bobby Q!

Fantastic. We had the rib combo (beef and baby backs) with baked potato, mac-n-cheese and Cole slaw. Beef ribs were spectacular and rich. Baby backs were really good. Cole slaw was the best I have had at a restaurant, loved it. Dessert was "Death By Chocolate". I died and went to heaven. A layer of creamy ice cream sandwiched by a scrumptious Texas sheet cake with a homemade chocolate sauce. Really a nice experience. Hot donuts on the way out! We fought over how many we each had on the way home. Love keeps no record of donuts.

I have to say I'm a tough critic and this place did nothing but impress. The service was excellent.  Cody was friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu and stirred us in the right direction. The food was amazing you can tell they cook the meats slow and low. All and all a good find for us.
We will be back.

I occasionally enjoy BBQ but it needs to have a great smokey flavor, good BBQ sauce, and not a lot of fat incorporated into the meat. Bobby Q delivers! It looks like a dive bar on the outside but the inside has a very nice atmosphere. The tables are spacious, it's very clean, and they play good country music :) Even better, our waitress provided exceptional service.  I had the beef brisket sandwich with a side of macaroni and cheese. The beef brisket was so tender that it falls apart and the mac and cheese was an indulgence that was worth the calories! I enjoyed the spicy BBQ sauce on top of my sandwich. It has a nice kick but isn't too spicy that it takes away from the flavor of the brisket. My husband had a combo rib plate (baby back ribs & St. Louis ribs) which he enjoyed a lot. He liked the St. Louis ribs a bit more than the baby backs because they were meatier and not as marbled as he had expected. He also loved the mac & cheese and the garlic mashed potatoes. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Rishad, our server, was very attentive and helpful. The food was very tasty and "deeeeee-licious", according to my wife. I would come here again any night.
This is a great, casual restaurant experience. The food is delicious, the meat is tasty and tender, and the restaurant ambiance is perfectly fitting.

Tried this place out today, was craving a pulled pork sandwich.. Overall the place was okay, it was nice inside and had a cute set-up.. Service was eh.. 

First the hostess could not answer any of our questions about happy hour.. we asked if it was just in the bar area.. had no clue, sat us in the main dining room and then told our waitress.. Apparently it was one of those restaurants were happy hour is in the bar only (which I really don't understand).. anyway our waitress said she'd give us happy hour prices, but didn't understand that we also wanted to order dinner, (people don't eat dinner in the bar?).. Maybe it was new-training staff day or something.. 

We were given cornbread to start which was good, but just crumbled in your hand.. then my friend got the Poboy Catfish sandwich, not impressed, said it was so freaking dry the fish and everything.. I had better luck with my pulled-pork sandwich.. However, it was a huge mess to eat, which I understand that just how it is, but I had no silverware to try and help.. I got fries on the side and I love fries, eat them all the time.. but these were covered with grease, not just your normal greasy fries but had enough they created a puddle, just too much for me.

Overall the food was okay (say no to the catfish).. I would go back for another pork sandwich but with a side of potato salad instead

Thanks Yelpers, this was my first time eating here & it was Delicious. The mac & cheese is a must try, the corn bread was very good and the meat was tender & seasoned perferectly.
And, at the end of your meal, they give you a bag of warm fresh donuts. Thanks Bobby Q for making our final meal in Phoenix wonderful.

I thought the ribs were very good. The meat was falling off the bone. The ribs are not dry rub. They are smoked in BBQ sauce so they are not as flavorful as dry rub ribs. We had the roasted veggies which were bland and the roasted corn which was soaked in a pool of butter. The pulled pork sandwich was pretty good. 
Great service and very friendly.
Went for the first time tonight and the service and food were AMAZING.!!!  Our waiter Hal was outstanding.  Would come back in a heartbeat.

We had about 15 people joining us for a celebration at Bobby Q and the food was not worth the price.  I ordered a pulled pork bbq sandwich. The sandwich was very dry and almost half way eaten they finally brought us some BBQ sauce. We all had separate checks and they just automatically put a 18% gratuity on all of the bills. So some people tipped twice.  We where not happy and won't be returning.

Bobby Q never disappoints.  They serve the best chocolate martinis and I have  one or two every visit.  I usually order steak or BBQ combo. Tonight I tried the fried chicken with mashed potatoes/gravy.  Another winner.

Just don't understand the ratings here. Service was excellent. But food was just okay. Brisket and Baby Back Ribs were way overcooked. Brisket was like baby food consistency and tasteless without the sauce. NO smokes ring and no smokey flavor. Weird for a place that says that they smoke their meats on premises with mesquite wood. The grilled vegetables were basically raw with no seasoning. Mash potatoes were good. Ranch beans were good. My wife liked the cornbread. But overall was just okay food wise when considering the main attraction is the BBQ itself. Again service was awesome and she was tipped well for that and not the food. Ambiance is good but I tend to rate places on food and overall experience and the meat brought it down. Much better BBQ places around but perhaps just none in this area.

First time here at Bobby Q and it was pretty decent.  Like the other reviews that loved the mac and cheese, so did my daughter.  The meat portions could have been a bit larger, but the brisket and sausage tasted fine.  Our waitress was great and very helpful as it was our first trip.  First of many, to be sure.

Just ate here today and this place is great! The brisket is delicious and moist and the ribs are a smokey fall off the bone delight. I strongly suggest the Q-roll appetizer to start and the corn bread is off the chain. I had potato salad and its eh average. The mac and cheese is freakin awesome as well. All in all as a bbq lover this place is in my top 3 bbq places in phoenix. Somewhat pricey but you definitely wont be dissapointed.
The food here is so good! I'll definitely be coming back. The service is great also. The apple cobbler is delicious.

We had the "whole hog". With back ribs, beef ribs pulled pork and brisket.  Simply the best.  I am always is search of the best BBQ and I think we found it last night.  Some pretty cool cocktails as well.
Good food, good atmosphere, good time. Tried a little of everything and liked it all. The best items were the baby back ribs and mashed potatoes.
This is a great place to take out town guest. The food and atmosphere is great. Prices are above average but matches the quality of food. Best BBQ in Phoenix

Got the Whole Hog Heaven with my family, they ran out of the beef ribs but we still enjoyed two types of ribs, meat and three different sides. With the meats, the beef brisket is for sure one of the best! This is such a great platter for a good price if you've a group of 4/5. I'd definitely recommend this place(: And their cornbread is absolutely amazing! Light, fluffy and buttery (: Lastly, the service was magnificent (our waiter's name is Hunter) and we even got these cute (and delicious) donuts before we left.

Seriously.  I seldom give 5 stars, but it deserves at least this much.
If it wasn't for the location and the super scary after dinner club scene, I would go every.single.day.

Truly one the best BBQ places in greater Phoenix.  My mouth is watering as I'm thinking about the Hog Heaven special.  In fact, my puppies mouths are watering too.  Decent prices, giant selection.  One of those places where the early cowboys of the SW would appreciate.  
 
If you are a cracker family, I suggest going super early, like super early bird special early , like when the snow birds come out for the senior special early, because after dusk, the whole place transforms into a pulsating super loud, super dicey Mexican Dance Club, and the blue hairs are sure to have a coronary attack after indulging in such a  lipid laden meal as they attempt to make their way out of the Club.  
 
Ah the sacrifice for decent BBQ....
The St. Louis ribs were amazing, and the corn bread is to die for.

Drove from extreme east Mesa with out of town company and can say, not worth the drive. I've bee to Sysco type restaurants that had better pulled pork. Should of went to Scottsdale like originally planned. This place may be good for a quick lunch but dinner with a crowd, not so much. Beer chose was good, quantity was good but lacked on quality for the price. I ordered the 3 meat planning on leftovers work well. But one of the friends at the table ordered the 1 meat meal for $18.00 and chose brisket. He had less brisket than I had (assuming I got a 3rd portion) and it was grizzly. I shared with him and foregone the leftover ideal.
This restaurant has the best beef brisket. Not to mention the staff is great and the area is amazing. New in town and this place just aided in my love for AZ.

We have been here a couple of times now. Everytime we drive into Phoenix for fun or just picking up friends from the airport my husband and I make it a mission to bring them here. From the outside it looks a little shaggyish kind of a place,but the inside decor is very nice. We have yet to be disappointed or else we wouldn't keep coming back. I've had pretty much all the style of ribs and whatever the flavor they're all falling of the bone. The rotisserie chicken is excellent not to mention there corn bread mmm, we always ask for extra corn bread to go and just toast it a little the next day with some butter and holy goodness all over again.

First time to come here since the name change many years ago. We ordered the whole hog heaven. It was high quality meat. Corn bread was delicious. Service was great. They even gave my son a free dessert. Manager stopped by several times to check on us and was super friendly. We will be coming back for sure. Did not try one but the hamburgers from the table near by looked big.

AMAZING FOOD! So yummy. I suggest the pulled pork sand-which and their shoe string fries and pecan coleslaw. And YOU have to get the Q Rolls for an appetizer!! Also don't forget to try their lemonade :)

BOBBY Q's - I never knew how much I loved BBQ until I ate here. Now I will crave it.

Ended up here for a friend's birthday. The restaurant is big and airy and laid out well. They can pack them in but not like sardines. The tables are nicely spaced out and for such a big place, it has charm and is comfortable. The hostess desk rocks - friendly and efficient. We had a reservation for 7pm on a Wednesday, in the summer. I can only imagine how busy it gets on a weekend in prime season...so plan ahead and make a reservation. And GPS how to get there, if you've never been or are new to the valley. Running on the frontage road near I-17, it's easy to end up on a wrong street. Then again, once you've been here once, you'll never forget how to get back. Follow your gut instincts...

 The prime rib looked so delicious that I had to order it (great prime rib is harder to find than you'd think). But everything I tasted was out of this world:

House Salad (I love this kind of classic salad! For a perfect dressing - combine the dijon and herb vinaigrettes)

Corn bread (ask for honey with the butter)
Prime Rib (medium rare, naturally)
Brisket
Mac and Cheese
BBQ pulled chicken (I have never liked BBQ chicken before eating Bobby Q's - DELISH!)

It was a taste bud bonanza.

**They were out of the Mississippi mud pie (which I am such a fan that not getting to sample theirs could plummet a rating but everything was too good for anything other than 5 stars). So we sampled the cobbler - yum.

The service was friendly, cheerful, competent and pretty much perfect. 
**I will mention that as a group of adults, our meal came a little quicker than was ideal. But Bobby Q's is popular for a reason and the service is so competent that knowing that, I will just order a little slower/staggered, when I return with adult friends. 

Families with kids - you will not have any problem feeding your kids in a timely manner. I imagine the service is perfectly paced for families.

And as if all that isn't wonderful enough, they give you a bag of the best cinnamon dusted mini donuts to take with you!!!  They are as good of donuts as Cafe du Monde serves beignets. Only problem, I couldn't eat another bite.

So diners - here's my final tip - store the bag of donuts in your fridge, overnight and then reheat in the microwave (still in the paper bag) for 30 seconds. Have with your morning coffee. You're welcome.

Bobby Q does everything so well that I can not wait to go back. I'll starve myself for a day or two, before I do. Go hungry. It's amazing.

I took a long hiatus from yelping and now I'm back with a vengeance!  See the great thing about yelp and people actually taking the time to write reviews is how I came across Bobby Qs in a recent road trip to Az.  

Hands down the most decadent, tender, fall of the bone, flavor packed ribs I've ever had.  Second favorite was a tie between the brisket and sausage.  Got one of the meat combos and basically everything was on point and memorable.  Service was excellent--very attentive, drinks and water glass were never empty.   

Easily 5 stars in my book!

Keep on BBQing, Bobby Q!

We've been here twice and the food is amazing! My son is a picky eater and he loved the chicken tenders and French fries. First time I just had the Caesar salad and my husband got their famous burger. He talked me into having a bite of his and it was the best burger I've ever had.    
The second visit, we got the family dinner. We got baby back ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, Mac n Cheese, potato salad, and fries. They bring you corn bread when you sit down. All of it was delicious. I was really surprised. They give you some donuts when you leave. The service was good and the food is great. You won't be disappointed here. We will go back often :)

Everything about this place was on point. From the outdoors decor, the friendly greeters and servers, to the varied menu choices!!
The ribs were soooooo juicy, well-seasoned and tender. The meat had just the right amount of fat, making every bite flavorful. The side dishes were all also very very tasty!
I will definitely come back here!!

Traveling from Minnesota this was our first time to Bobby Q. This is one of the best barbecue restaurants we've visited. We had the Crispy Sweet Onion Block as a starter and then a combo course of Grilled Top Sirloin & Half Rack of Baby Back Ribs with sides. Bobby Q is a steak & ribs joint where you really want to clean your plate but you'll have to settle, like we did, for bringing some of your dinner home for tomorrow! 

The food & drink here is fabulous and the service superb. If you appreciate great barbecue Bobby Q should definitely be on your epicurean list.  And, the Thank Q treat when you leave is a nice surprise.

So, this is our fifth time here.  The food is so great.  This go 'round we split the smoasted chicken with a side of brisket. Yep, you can add meats a la carte.  The brisket was just $7 and was quite a large portion.  In fact, we had enough left over for lunch for one the next day.  What a deal.  I must say that the chicken was so delicious.  Moist and slightly smoky but not so much that it took away from the flavor of the chicken.  We sat at the bar and every bartender was great... special shout out to Savannah, Chris, and Ben who always make us feel welcome and appreciated.  Thank you!

Best BBQ chicken since my Grandma. Meat is king

Great noise level (keeps crying from being annoying)

It must be good when I can't stop thinking about their homemade lemonade and their q-rolls. It's what dreams are made of!!! I came here for my graduation lunch about 4 months ago and I just requested to go here for my birthday as well! I can't wait to see you again Bobby Q!!

Dinner was delicious, the hubby and I split the whole hog and everything was tender and yummy.  We had sausage, brisket, baby back ribs and St. Louis style and the sides were delicious as well, the Mac and chz, beans and fries, yum

Very friendly staff. Food was excellent. The meat on the baby back ribs fell right off the bones. Serving size is huge, full rack of ribs can serve 2. The portions for sides were big too. Mac and cheese could of been a meal by itself. Overall, great dining experience.

Bobby Q's entrance off 27th Avenue is subtle and in a quiet area and one of the first things you notice pulling into their lot through the small driveway flanked by bushes is that the place (and its lot) is huge.  It's obvious from its construction, that this building has been here a long time and the massively tall trees in the parking lot confirm that.  I actually parked in an "adjacent" lot next to the main one and had a decent walk to the restaurant's entrance around the corner.  The much larger bar facing the lot is NOT the entrance to go through to access the restaurant.

Before meeting my date here, I took a look at the menu and had a mild sticker shock.  The prices are not unreasonable for a Valley restaurant; but being that we usually eat in $ or $$- restaurants, it was quite a bit more than what I'm used to.  The important question, however, wasn't whether the prices were "high", but whether food quantity and quality justified them.

We started out with drinks.  I had the Strawberry q Lada ($9.00), which was quite delicious, with the strawberry and piña colada blending very well together.  While waiting for dinner, they also brought cornbread for each of us with butter, which was also quite good, though had it been hot instead of lukewarm,it  would have been excellent.

My date ordered the half baby back ribs with cole slaw and baked potato.  In her case, this was very much worth the $20.00 ... and I frankly can't imagine what the "whole" for $6.00 more would have been like!  For out came what I can only describe as half of the brontosaurus ribs they used to dump on Fred Flintstone's car; an overflowing bowl of cole slaw and a potato almost as big as the half-ribs.  I ordered the "smoasted" half chicken and can only say, that presentation is everything.  It didn't seem close to half a chicken to me; but since it was served in cut up pieces and on a large plate, that might be the reason why I thought otherwise.  For sides, I had the fully stuffed baked potato (still huge) and the grilled vegetables, which, I can honestly say, should have been double the amount while the potato could've been half the size.  Since my date picked out the restaurant, it was obvious it was a favorite place for her and her husband.  As the "newbie", I was very impressed with the taste and while my plate didn't seem to be overflowing like hers, it was more than enough and worth the price.  Before tip, my tab came out to $27.08, including tax.

Service is prompt, friendly and attentive (perhaps a bit too attentive, when you're trying to talk).  Interestingly enough, once the credit card was run, the waitress, who had constantly been checking on us throughout the meal, left us to talk in peace with only an occasional server interrupting to see if we wanted more water or Diet Coke.  Though the restaurant is nowhere near as big as the annexed bar, it is pretty roomy with dark, wood colors and a very high ceiling.  

DIABETIC ALERT:
------------------------
