A glance at the menu will tell you that this place is pork and beef heavy.  There are only two chicken dishes and its obvious by what comes out, that chicken is not their specialty.  A diabetic will have a very hard time eating "healthy" here.  The more serious you are about watching what you eat, the more problems you're going to have navigating the menu.  This place should more likely be considered "a-once-in-a-very-long-while" treat.  Looking around tonight, most of the patrons had waist sizes that wouldn't surprise anyone coming here.  For the most part, only the wait staff was thin/proportionate, though not always.  While the food is very good, the staff hospitable and the atmosphere welcoming, this restaurant would probably elicit a big frown on your doctor's face, if he knew you came here ... and probably give HIM a heart attack, if he heard you came here regularly.

Honestly I hadn't been here since the name change however, I was very happy to return.  There was three of us and we all wanted similar things however we all had a hard time deciding. The waitress was great at making recommendations and  getting us what we wanted. We all agree the whole hog is the way to go. The manager even came by to check on us. Great place we will be back

Biz partner and I were running around today and needed to hit up something along I-17 to grab a late lunch. I've seen the place a million times and love BBQ, but after 4 years in AZ, have never been here! Sucks, because it seems I was really missing out. The place is huge, decor is very sharp and the smokey smell off BBQ throughout the place was a good sign! The service was on point...quick drinks and refills, very attentive and friendly. What a shock! 

Upon sitting down, we received 2 small cakes of cornbread (free) which was a nice filler. I had the BBQ brisket sandwich and my biz partner had the pulled pork sandwich. We both agreed the meat was tender and flavorful. The buns are slightly toasted, so the sauce doesn't get soaked in the bread. The server asked if we would like additional BBQ sauce...I said no, but wished I would have. Although the meat is very tasty, I did find it a little light on sauce (and the sauce is good stuff). After we finished our sandwiches, the server brought 2 little cinnamon/sugar donuts for desert in a small brown bag (fresh, hot and also free!) Very good way to end a good meal. We both agreed, this will definitely be a place added to our rotation as traveling throughout the city!!!

Wow!  My friend recommended this place. Beautiful venue with courtyard seating. Awesome burgers and it looked like lots of other menu items were attractive.  I'd come back in a minute as it's a new favorite!

We ordered the myriad of meats platter, and it was so much food we couldn't finish it just the two of us. The flavor of the meat was super delicious so was the barbecue sauce. The beer and cocktail menu was just the right size and had great options. The vibe and ambience is very cool and unique. A little bit of a corporate restaurant feel, but I like all the different size tables and chairs and the lighting was very nice at night.
The service was great and very attentive, they were helpful and polite. She boxer our food, which is always nice, and gave us epically delicious, fresh cinnamon sugar mini donuts at the end. Loved them!

The ribs are awesome! Fully cooked and delicious, meat fell off the bone! The corn beard was money and best part of meal! This is a real bbq spot! If your in the mood for some really good ribs or bbq stop by and try it! Nice staff and clean place
Lunch today at Bobby-Q. Service great, BBQ Chicken sandwich great, just didn't care for the string fries. They taste good just too dang hard to get them from the plate to your mouth -

Drove from Las Vegas to Phoenix to catch a concert. My sister and I wanted a good meal before we headed out of town and saw this place on Yelp. We were a little concerned with the area but we are so glad we decided to stop and eat here. The atmosphere was amazing. Sat on the patio and it was comfortable and had a ton of character. The food was delicious and really reasonably priced. The service was as great! I totally recommend this place!

Best BBQ I've ever had so far. We did the triple combo with baby back ribs and beef ribs and brisket. All super tasty. Meats are tender and juicy. And they were so sweet they split the triple combo in two plates for us with a lot of fries on each plate. Cornbread is very soft and good as well except that the butter tastes a little bit different.
Wanted to try but they refused to seat us, even on the patio, because we had a dog with us. Obviously not a dog friendly place unless u have documents to show them the dog is a service dog.

It was OK.  But sub par to a home smoker.  I could hardly tell the difference between the ribs, pulled pork, brisket or chicken.  Overly flavored and over smoked. 
  But their ribs are better than the Texas road kill.

Three couples had dinner on Sat. night.  The restaurant was extremely busy and very noisy.  The service was good and the waiter very pleasant.  I know it's rated #1 for barbque, but we've had better elsewhere.
We had a wonderful absolutely delicious dinner here tonight - not to be surpassed by our exceptional server Christin. Thank you for taking such good care of us Californians.

Amazing food great service awesome surrounding 
I recommend the drink in the pineapple  and the ribeye

We went to celebrate birthdays and this place does not disappoint. One couple had the Whole Hog..ribs falling off the bone..brisket moist n tender with a smoky flavor. Prime ribs for others..cooked perfectly and a mouth watering filet that you almost didnt need a knife for. Generous helpings on the sides. Deserts..tried three and only one couple ate all of theirs..the mud pie. Attentive staff and the manager checked on us three times. We cant wait for the east side location to open. We drove from Queen Creek. Well worth it.

Servers from other restaurants should come here and eat on their day off and take notes.  It's how service should be done.  5 star every time.

5 stars for cornbread.  mini doughnuts.  smokehouse burger!!

The food was great. The service was good until we were asked if we wanted boxes about 15 minutes after our meal was serviced and we were still eating our dinner. This has happened to us twice, the last two times we've came here for dinner. We are here to enjoy our dinner and have a couple of cocktails. If you are out of tables set of some table in the other room for a few hours at dinner time or place a sign on the door that says "Take Out Only".

The service is outstanding!

The food is mouthwatering!

He usually has the ribs...I usually have the prime rib, both are delicious. I love how the corn is served, slices of the corn cob with tasty bites of corn left to nibble. The corn bread is a good as a dessert...sweet with kernels of corn within.  We have made it to dessert once. The sub zero banana cream pie is divine. The portions are huge and there are always leftovers to take home....plus the extra little treat they give each customer!

One of these days we'll try something else on the menu, but for now....we love ordering the same meal each time.

We were on our from the airport to Sedona and it was the time for lunch. We didn't have much time to look for a restaurant so we decided on Bobby Q since it was close to freeway. The restaurant has huge parking lot and seating inside and outside. Waiter explained that they smoke the meat right at the back of the restaurant. We ordered it and it was delicious! I wish the would be place like this near my house!

They couldn't make two of the cocktails I requested. Strangely, the Mesa location can make both of them. I also asked for large portions of Mayo when we ordered our food. I had to almost beg for more Mayo. Because 1/2 tablespoon of Mayo just wasn't enough. I'm unhappy because they did not listen to me at all. Shame son them. Fair warning all!

Best bbq ever. I had the combo plate of baby back ribs and catfish. This was plenty of food to share. I'm not a catfish connoisseur so I found it kind of bland but the ribs were amazing. Best I have ever had. The Mac and cheese side and the cornbread was awesome too. The atmosphere is great and service was excellent. 

Also as a side note if you go to the lounge side on Friday nights they have a free buffet with 2 drink purchase. Not as extravagant food as the restaurant but the price is a great deal.

If want a lot of food in a friendly and casual atmosphere, this is the place. I had a half a BBQ chicken w/ Mac and cheese and cole slaw. It was more than enough food. Mixed with cold beer, a table outside, and quick, friendly service, this is a great casual meal.

Last night I joined 4 friends and brought my girlfriend to eat at this restaurant for the first time. Before we got to order, the server was placing our water cups in front of us. The next moment surprised my whole table because the waitress mishandled a water cup and all the water in one cup fell onto my girlfriend next to me. I was so caught off-guard that I didn't even realize that half of my dress shirt got caught in the splash zone too. My girlfriend was just wearing a one-layered sweater so she didn't really have an option to change. As a result, apologies were given and as the waitress handed us napkins, she smiled and told my girlfriend "you still look good though." Everyone at the table had an easy-going personality, so we just shrugged off the situation. Thinking about what happened, I would not be surprised if someone else would go nuts about getting soaked before the appetizers came. 

Now onto the actual food. To the recommendation of my friends who have been here a handful of times, I ordered the fried chicken with mac & cheese and thought it was a great dish. The breading had a great crunchy texture and every bite of the chicken was tender and moist. The biggest recommendation we had was to try the beef brisket, so my girlfriend got that. We both shared our plates with each other, and I thought the brisket had a great smoky flavor to it. The beef was so tender that you could easily slice through it with a fork. Although the mac & cheese tasted really good, I felt that it was a little too heavy for my own tastes. I can't complain about any of the other sides because they all tasted great and were seasoned well. 

My girlfriend still liked the restaurant because the food was great and the décor/layout of the restaurant seemed nice. Having been to many barbecue restaurants dispersed throughout California, I thought the restaurant was fairly priced and the food was top-notch. By the time we got to our check, I asked my girlfriend if she was still wet, and she said "yeah a little." It would've been nice if management stepped in and gave us a cookie to turn her frown upside down, but our waitress was probably too embarrassed to tell the manager anything. Would I come again? Probably, but I'm not sure when because I usually only eat out for special occasions or social gatherings.

This was my first time going to bobby q's tonight with my gf and I will never be back again. Upon arrival the door was covered by two guys whom were both ridiculously rude. They looked at me wearing a pair of fitted jeans and said they were too baggy. As I said before my jeans were fitted! I'm not a high fashion person but I do have a pretty good idea of trends and My style is probably above the normal clientele.The fake ass bouncer at the door had baggier jeans then me and also let others with baggier jeans then me in. Mind you I was only there to spend time with my girlfriend and her sister who was in town, so I would never consider going to a low class dump on my own. At that point it became clear why I wasn't allowed to enter, was due to me being a young black man. I called the bouncer and manager out on it and they couldn't even look me in the eye when I called them out. I'm not someone who goes around pulling the race card bc I've definitely had to work my way up in the world and career wise , where I'm the single person of color in the room. This was down right bigotry exercised at the expense of what was supposed to be a nice evening with family and friends . I will say i did use some foul language which was simply reflective of how I was treated. I hope the owner would address this matter (clearly mgmt is not apt to)as the big board of rules they had up front was clearly targeting of one culture/race of people. I work to hard to earn my money and then be disrespected by two a-holes who couldn't even look me in the eye. Give me an answer!

I can't imagine it better.  Always multiple friendly faces to greet you, and excellent service.

The onion brick is a must.  I've never been a fan of cornbread, yet I can't stop eating theirs, it's so delicious.  The BBQ is always perfect.  The sides are awesome - great beans, great coleslaw.

My daughter ordered the kids pizza - not expecting much, turns out is the best kids pizza I have EVER encountered.  Great presentation on a square piece of butcher block, and it was really good! 

We all eat ourselves into a food coma, we can't even touch the cute doughnuts at the end.  I love the atmosphere and lighting as well.  I'd like it to be my living room...dinner's ready....
Hands down the best steak joint in the valley. Fast service, great tasting steaks, ribs you name it. Little pricy but well worth it.
Fantastic baby back ribs and brisket, and the onion loaf starter is not to be missed. Great vege sides for the non-carnivores.

Three meat combo!!! I honestly don't have time to smoke 3 different kinds of meat and whip up Mac and cheese for my Sunday lunch.

The Cadillac margarita was ok but made from a mix.  They had several draught beers here too.

The brisket, baby back ribs, and BBQ chicken were delicious!!! The runner even brought out extra BBQ sauce for us which I recommend since they don't put much on the meat when they serve it.  The ribs were fall off the bone, smoky, and charred. The brisket was tender, and my dining companions favorite thing of the meal.  The BBQ chicken was a little pink which is common for on the smoking process and tasted amazing.

Our service was attentive and a manager checked in with us and thanked us for visiting.  For lunch for 2 with 1 drink each it was about $70 before tip.  We had a lot of leftovers which made it a good value!

My family and I decided to visit last night.  This was my third time and their first.  What can I say that has not already been said in previous reviews.  We knew to arrive early on a Saturday (4pm) with reservations for 4:15.  It was just starting to become busy with about 50% tables filled.  Our server was AJ.  Very knowledgeable and attentive.  Made excellent recommendations. We started with those little Q-rolls.  A meal could be made of those alone but we restrained ourselves.  Egg roll type dough wrapped around BBQ beef with Chipotle and bbq dipping sauces.  Yum.  
    My family had beers.  Not a beer drinker myself but they have a good selection.  I had the frozen lemonade which was excellent.  Only change I would make would be to leave the sugar off the glass rim because it falls off and makes everything sticky.  Not enough paper napkins at the table to dip into the water glass to try to clean up the sugar mess.
   Main meals were outstanding.  Between the 3 of us we had sausage, brisket, fried catfish, and 3 orders of baby back ribs.  All were fall off the bone, tender and flavorful.  The catfish was a crispy breaded boneless fillet, perfect size. Extra BBQ sauce was brought to the table by AJ.  Spicy and mild.  Combining the 2 brought on an extra depth of flavor.
   Our sides were cole slaw, mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, ranch beans.  All were excellent, especially the mac and cheese which had a nice little kick to it.  At this point we decided if we didn't stop, we would need help getting out of the restaurant.  But we could not leave without those little bits of heaven, hot donuts.  Fresh off the donut machine they are a perfect ending to the meal.  Did I mention leftovers?  We took enough home for all of us to have 2 more meals each.
      Staff is very attentive.  Managers visit each patrons table to meet and greet.  Staff very friendly and upbeat.  Seem to genuinely enjoy working there.  100 best restaurant award well deserved.  Congratulations.

Not just a dinner but an experience!

Just got back from Texas and had a ton of bbq.  Then I took my wife out for bbq and steak.  To my surprise it was some of the best bbq I've ever had.  Super tender ribs where the meat falls off and packed full of flavor.  Hands down some of the best bbq i've ever had.  My wife loved her steak.  We went to a high end steak house in Scottsdale and it easily beat it out with its flavor and tender cut.  I now recommend it as a must stop for great foot.  The service was phenomenal too.  I had mojito's which were so delicious and they didn't skimp on the alcohol.  Thanks Bobby Q for an awesome dinner experience.

Wow. I'm a big fan of BBQ and I have to say that this place quickly became one of my favorite place around the town. Ordered baby back and spare ribs and sausage- their ribs were so tender and tasty. Highly recommend spare ribs, aka St Louis style ribs. Meatier and juicier cut of the two. Highly recommend it. Their sausages were great also- it wasn't fatty at all. Their corn bread was like eating a price of a sweet cake: sweet and a ton of flavor. No need to order a dessert- just ask for extra corn bread. :) highly recommend this place to anyone!

Wonderful experience! The ambiance of the patio is warm,  welcoming,  and comfy. Just what I was looking for to enjoy the weather and a sangria (which was quite strong, not as fruity as I've experienced elsewhere.  I ordered the baby back ribs and was delighted. The BBQ sauce was not as spicy as I usually like,  but was delicious in its own way.   While the roasted corn side wasn't what I expected,  they were happy to offer a different choice . I chose the mac & cheese which was heaven! Finished the meal with a half order of death by chocolate.  The cake layers were incredibly delicious,  the ice cream layer less so. Definitely a new favorite!

I called to see if they had a complimentary buffet on Fridays and what time.  They used to have one and it was very good.  But I haven't been there in a while.  Was transferred to the bar I guess.  I was told it should start at 4pm.  When I arrived at the front I asked about a complimentary buffet and they looked bewildered.  I was directed to the bar where about six employees in the same T-shirts were sitting.  "I asked if they had a complimentary buffet today"  It was Friday at 4:20pm.  The bar was completely empty.  Zombies may have been able to answer that question. But these moronic employees were incapable.  Duuuhhh!  Management? DO YOU HAVE YOU HAVE A COMPLIMENTARY HAPPY HOUR ON FRIDAYS AND WHEN DOES IT START?  Let your employees know!!!!

I ordered the Sunday Family Feast and everything was amazing.  They forgot to include the brisket but it was super busy, so no complaints...mistakes happen, it's the way they make for them that counts and Joana the manager certainly hit the mark.  She was so apologetic and I got my brisket and some extra for my trouble.  I live a short distance away and it was no trouble at all.  We had plenty to eat with leftovers, so the missing brisket didn't cause any problems.

Thank you, Joana and Bobby Q's!!!

Started off with us asking where our waiter was...and after that, service was impeccable. The manager came to our table, apologized and comped us dessert. Our server was great with recommendations, came to our table often and again request was readily filled. Definitely decided this is our new dine in spot. Best bbq. Soft, succulent, savory meat. 

Side note. Got a doggie bag worth of treats on the way out. #NewFavoritePlace

On a business trip and was craving prim rib. Yelp reviews took me to this place for the first time. I had the prim rib with baked potato and corn. The food was very good and the fresh homemade lemonade made it even better!
The girl who served my table ( Monique)was very nice and she made a great suggestions on food.
They also have them insane donuts that they made fresh and they were so good
If I come back to Phoenix anytime I'll make sure I eat at this place at least once !
Thank you all the people at Bobby Q!

Bobby Q's catered my wedding and I can't believe the number of compliments I got on the food. Bobby Q's was OUTSTANDING. The appetizers went so fast I never even got one! The caterers were really professional. My only issue was that we were not allowed to change our numbers after the wedding was 2 weeks out (We tried). -- Most caterers allow you to change up to 48 hours before the event. This would've saved us a TON of money as we had several people cancel on us at the last minute. We had more food left over than we knew what to do with, and it was a lot of money wasted.

Went here for graduation. Food is good, but service is sometimes hit or miss. I am partly disappointed that I was promised a separate room for my large party, but was placed in basically the center of the dining room.

The BBQ is quite good though and I'd go back purely for that reason.

Corny decorations aside, the food isn't that bad, but not necessarily great. there are about three or four things that are amazing, but seeing as i'm a recently converted vegetarian i haven't had most of  those in a while, the best meat option is by far the ribs. End of story. But the vegetarian options (i.e. fish) aren't really that great. Another Con- the food takes forever! As i mentioned before, the decor is extremely corny and makes it feel like a chain restaurant. Pros include fabulous service/waiters, free donuts, AMAZING sides, and the fact that i feel really popular in there because it is always packed. Overall its a fun place, but nothing special.
It's a little pricy for it to be one of our regular spots but for a fun time out when we have friends or family visiting it is great.

We came here because I wanted to try something different. This place had very good reviews on Yelp so I thought I would give it a try and I'm glad I did. Bobby Q had really great food, service and an all around great experience.

As a GM of a Bar/Restaurant it was a delight to see my Bartender have passion for Bobby Q's. When  asking the different questions about the menu she was right in it and gave great detail. I truly believed that she knew what she was saying! Thank you Ciara for your great personality. Even the other waitress kept asking me, "Isn't she the greatest?", yes she was!

Brought my sister-in-law visiting from CA here for her bday on Saturday. Everything we had from ribs, chicken, beef brisket to sides and drinks was VERY good.  We made a reservation and walked right in.  I wouldn't go anywhere else for BBQ in AZ.  Ambiance is good.   I totally recommend this place.
Great food, my wife loved the beef ribs and I enjoyed the Smoasted Chicken.  The cornbread was great, only negative was the shoestring fries.  I will go for the baked or mashed potatoes next time.

Visiting my sis in Phoenix and she brought me here to eat. It was delicious. Portions were generous and prices very reasonable. The outside dining area was very cozy. The staff very attentive and gracious. Definitely a winner in my book.

I came when they closed but they were very courteous, patient and nice in explaining the offerings there and made me a really good dinner to go. The food was amazing. Fresh and tasty. Nice people working there.

My family and I have recently discovered this place. The service is okay, but management is great. We always get a platter that they offer which allows us to try a variety of meat and sides. My preschool daughters are very picky but loved the pulled chicken. I am not a fan of the pulled pork but the St. Louis ribs are incredible and the meat falls off the bone!! The macaroni and cheese is extra, extra cheesy and delicious. The cap to the meal is the fresh donuts they offer at the end, leaving no reason to purchase dessert. To wash it all down, nothing beats their strawberry lemonade served in a frosted glass. Oh my!!! We love it.  It has been challenging to find good barbecue in AZ and this is definitely really good and worth trying.

FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER I WISH I COULD LEAVE 6 STARS. 
We are foodies. 
We eat out more than 10 times a week. We KNOW restaurants! 

Once in a while, you just are so impressed. 

5 stars for parking 
5 stars for speed of service. Our crew of 2 adults and 2 kids was seated instantly.  

5 stars for menu options 
5 stars for having a kids menu 
5 stars for speed of the food coming out. 
5 stars for the wait staff 
5 stars for Quantity of food. (We SPLIT a meal and took so much food home!) 
 Our to go container was OVERFLOWING.
This place was AMAZING!!!  I ordered the pulled pork and it was soooo tender.  This is the best BBQ I have ever had.

I'm not from Arizona and didn't know how to go around the city. I picked this place to celebrate my graduation. They were very accommodating for a party of 6. Service was not bad. A few missing items that got resolved right away. Portion size was good to share. Quality of food was norma, nothing special. Bar drinks were ok. Parking was easy, the lot was big. Comparable to Lucille's BBQ ribs from California.
Great food and service! We had whole hog to share for three people and we had leftovers. Service, food, price and ambiance five stars.

BBQ restaurants can sometimes be overwhelming with all the choices. Luckily we were sent the one and only Chelsea as our server! She clearly has enthusiasm for her job and an outstanding attitude. She was on point for all three parts of our meal. The brisket was delicious. If I could have, I would have ordered all burnt ends. The meat was juicy and tender. The babyback ribs, flavorful and moist. The appetizer course would have been a great main course. The Q rolls were like brisket lumpia with BBQ sauce or chipotle mayo. The apple cobbler for dessert was just the right combo of sweet and tart. 3for3. Either Chelsea is lucky or she's a Bobby Q's savant. I'd go with the latter.

As we neared Bobby Q's from the rear entrance in the dark, my wife and I had to assume it was the popular bbq place by the glowing Christmas-style lights adorned on the roof and beer signs on the side of the roadhouse-inspired building, as there aren't any signs to notify potential customers of it's presence from that entrance.

Upon nearing the building on foot, I was impressed with all of the outside seating available, complete with an outside bar and several TV's.

We were promptly seated, as it didn't appear very busy for a Saturday evening.  The hostess and waitress were very friendly and knowledgeable.  Soon after ordering our drinks, we were given two pieces of cornbread, which were tasty and not just regular square, dry cornbread that comes from the box.

Soon after we each ate a piece of cornbread and had consumed some our drinks, we couldn't believe it when our order arrived so quickly!  (I've had to wait much longer at Dairy Queen for food).  I got a half rack of St Louis-style ribs, which were very good, but a little more expensive than other places charge, but worth it for the quality of service and cleanliness of the restaurant.  The macaroni and cheese didn't disappoint us. It was very cheesy and pleasing to the taste buds. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they give a ten percent discount when you check-in there on yelp, which is always an added incentive.

After finishing our meal, we were given a couple of "Thank Q's,"  which are their freshly made small doughnuts that are a nice little complimentary dessert.

Overall, I was impressed with the restaurant and plan on returning there.  I would definitely recommend it to friends, or anyone who wants to have a good time with a large party.
Would give more then 5 stars if possible. ASK FOR PHILLIP!!! customer service is spectacular.  I am the pickiest eater and think everything is spicy. This food was phenomenal.

Make reservations!  We got there at 6 pm on Sunday and had a 45 min wait.  It was my sons birthday so we didn't mind the wait.  We were seated and our server was right on top of getting out drinks. She took our order and  45 mins later our food finally came.  I watched other tables that had been seated after us by 20 mins receive their food long before ours ever came out.  Our server did finally come to tell us there had been a mix up and the manager would be out to explain and offer dessert for our inconvenience.  I figured another server had taken our plates. or Our ticket had been lost.  The place was mobbed so I do expect some inaccuracy.  The manager did come over and asked "How is everything tasting"  and before we could empty our mouths to speak I put my thumb up and she did an about face and left.  It took 2 hours to get a table and food and less than 10 mins to eat.  We told the server the manager didn't even give us time to respond.  The manager came out and offered us dessert at no cost.  In the end our  entire meal was on the house.  I didn't expect that but they obviously wanted us back.    I'm sure we will give it another try because the food was exceptional..Although the grilled veggies were too greasy and over cooked.
Great food, huge portions, great service too!! Yum yum!! Fantastic donuts! Stopped in from out-of-town and highly recommend it!!

Had a service issue when I visited earlier this year.  Taylor more than corrected the issue.  Called me several times over the last few months to make sure I was coming back so he could correct the issue.  Such a rarity to have someone intentionally provide such great customer service.  And the food is outstanding!  Highly recommend the brisket which you can cut with a fork!  We brought friends who had not visited before and now they have a new go-to place!

BBQ Chicken sandwich was too dry. Baby back ribs were good, brisket was so-so. Yummy cornbread. 
Customer service was excellent. 
Park in the back if you're going to take your food to-go.

Great Customer Service! Great Food! 
Did take-out while in town, food was ready in the time they said customer service was great, got back to the room, noticed what I thought was an incomplete order, so I called and talked with Taylor (The Manager) who assured me he would take care of it. 
We preceded to devour the BBQ that we had, which was f-ing great! After we were done I ran down to Bobbies (just around the corner) to get what I thought was missing from our order. Only to find out it was my mistake 
Regardless of it being me that caused the confusion Taylor wanted to make sure I was a satisfied customer and insisted on a couple appetizers "on the house" I was so full I refused and he still insisted on getting me a Gift Certificate! I will be back!

it's been too long since I have eaten here, I need to go back again sometime soon because, hands down, this is the best barbeque restaurant that I've been to in Phoenix.  I was pleasantly surprised, it surpassed all of my expectations and I'm not even a big "bbq" type person!  now that's saying a lot!

This place is BBQ heaven. I've lived in Texas and North Carolina and I won't claim the mantle of a BBQ connoisseur, but I've had a lot of BBQ in my life. Meat and sides were all great. Atmosphere and service to match. You can debate whether Little Miss BBQ has the edge in the brisket game--it's a close call. But this place clearly has the overall edge--a place you can sit down, get a drink, and relax over great food. My girlfriend and my daughter both loved it, too. Oh, and hot cinnamon donuts with the check was a great finishing touch. I'll be back.

I have not been here since it was Bobby McGees....a lot has changed.  With high reviews, my husband and I decided to give it a try.

First we got the "Q" rolls for an appetizer....AMAZINGLY delicious!!!  Then came little corn bread cakes from heaven!!  I ordered the 2 ribs plate and my husband got the 3 meat plate.  The food here is amazing!!  The meat is juicy and tender, BBQ sauce is delicious and the side dishes are to die for!  Must try the mac and cheese...its heavenly!  

I can not wait to go back.

We love love love this place. It is truly the best barbecue in the valley ! Just had the ST. Louis ribs this week again and we are never disappointed. The roasted corn is TO DIE for !! We tell everyone about Bobby Q's! (The only thing I would change are the fans hanging from the ceiling. We never sit under a table where the fans are because they look very unstable and like they're going to fall) we frequent as much as we can.

Baby back ribs & corn bread = Amazing 5/5.
Atmosphere = Splendiferous 4/5.
Hospitality = Friendly 4/5.

Way to go Bob Sikora!   I used to work for Bob at Bobby McGee's during the 80's and early 90's.  Bob has always been a top notch operator with high standards.  Tough guy to work for...but he is a restaurant genius!  Bob has always loved BBQ and he went to school and found the best recipes from the south.   I ate here way back in 2005 and anytime I am back in Phoenix this is a must do for BBQ!  This as good as it gets!!!
Awesome food and service. Cool place for drinks especially in the evening. We have been there twice already. Planning to go and eat there again.

A must go spot if traveling for business and wanting to experience a "local" restaurant. Food is incredible, service terrific, atmosphere fun. Bar is first come first served if it's busy. A don't miss place to eat in Phoenix.

Everything we had was amazing! From the corn bread to their signature Q rolls and even the salad! I had the BBQ pulled Pork with ranch beans (they contest with my father in laws famous beans) and my husband had the smokehouse burger with shoestring fries! Everything was so wonderful!

Haven't been here since the Bobby McGee days, gotta say it didn't disappoint. Food was amazing as well as the service. Our server accidentally messed up our order but the manager Jo comped the entire meal.  Now that's service! Although out waitress Alena made a mistake she too was amazing and took great care of us. I'll be back for sure. Thanks Jo and Alena.

New to Arizona from Texas and I know Bar B Q, not many places here that I have eaten at that the food was good, I was really surprised that the food here was very good, not Texas quality but very tasty, I will be back
Everything at this restaurant is So good. Get the ribs,mac and cheese, and mash potatoes and you will be sooo happy and sooo satisfied.

They have the best macaroni and cheese around! Usually I'm not too crazy of Mac n cheese but I could eat this for days. Its creamy and cheesy and has little bits of crisp baked parts. It's delicious.. A must try. Ribs were delicious and the mini donuts at the end were a cute touch.

The food and service here are great! I'm from Tennessee and we're really serious about our BBQ, but this is some of the best I've ever had. The beef brisket is crazy good. Plus you get free mini cinnamon sugar doughnuts with the check.

First time and we loved it. There were 4 of us and we shared the hog heaven platter. So much food, it was priced right and the flavors were amazing. One complaint was the size of the sides that came with platter. They were not big enough to share, we ended up ordering another side and we're shocked at the price of that single side.
But overall we would definitely recommend and will go back. 
We especially liked the spicy bbq sauce, the pecan Cole slaw, the brisket, and the baby back ribs.

Wow. First of all, the complimentary cornbread from the start was sublime. They don't just give you a lil slice per person. No. They bring you a lot and then ask you if you want more. Next, the PPS's (PULLED PORK SAMMY) we ordered came out hot, fresh, and ready. The meat was thicc but tender at the same time. I have never been so content with a PPS. Best in the valley. I tried some of Mary's mashed potatoes and I had an immediate verbal reaction: "Flavor". Then, to our surprise, Colton offered us even more cornbread. Of course, we accepted. AND THEN, Colton brought out the COMPLIMENTARY BAG of cinny sugar donuts (free of charge)! Colton was the best server in the west: treated us right, big smiles, and plenty of BBQ and fun. In conclusion, Mary and I thought that Bobby Q was so far the highlight of senior year.

The security is very rude and disrespectful,  so are most of the managers.  I don't recommend anyone of color to go there because they are racist and they discriminate!!! This wasn't the first time it's happened to myself and a few others in line.  They say no flats on ladies night yet all the Hispanic chicks were flat boots, yet when my sister had them on they turned us away! DISCRIMINATON! !!!!! Who ever own this place needs new security, management ASAP or they will loose a lot of business. As long as your popping bottles they don't care.  Smh, the Damn food isn't even that great! If you're looking for a good time this isn't the place.

possibly the BEST bbq I've ever had! 
First of all the portions are huge! my boyfriend and I thought shared a whole hog heaven would be perfect for us, but we barely finished half of it! their meat is so well cooked, the rib meat falls right off the bone and the brisket melts in your mouth like cotton candy. The mash potato as a side dish is a must too! The complementary cinnamon donut are also a delight, as full as you will be after the meal, you will definitely have stomach for those little donuts! 
The staff here are very professional and friendly.Our waitress was very helpful in answering our questions on the menu and checked up on us every so often to make sure we are satisfied with everything. Great restaurant!!
Excellent the Brisket was to die for.  Server was very good and explained everything since it was our first time there but it will not be the last.

This was an amazing BBQ place. Coming from a native Memphis boy with a Texan for a father... This place ain't have bad!!

Ashlynn KILLED IT and gave us the best service we have had at any place in recent memory.

Best best BBQ spot in town! The service is amazing. One of my coworkers ordered the catfish poBoy and they misunderstood and brought her the catfish dish. Not only did they replace the dish right away, they let her keep the extra side dish and they comp'd the entire meal. They only charged her for the amazing raspberry sangria we both ordered. I had the brisket sandwich and beans and it was mouth watering. Would absolutely be back and recommend to anyone !

Truly the best restaurant bbq I've ever eaten.  I do not give 5 stars unless it is truly deserved. ;) I'll be honest, I first went to Little Miss Barbecue today but I didn't want to wait in line and not even know if they would have what I want to order by the time I get to the front so I looked for a highly rated bbq restaurant close by.  I wasn't excited to drive 15 minutes more but I decided to take a chance and I am so glad I did. Bobby Qs is amazing BBQ! The ambiance is impress a date worthy. The food is delicious. Our waitress was so nice and her service was on point. We ordered the Q rolls as an appetizer and a three meat combo with mac & cheese and potato salad. Every bite was delicious.  So I had to try the banana cream pie for dessert. It was all to die for. I wanted to call "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" or "DDD" and tell them they missed one! The St Louis ribs are perfectly seasoned, fall of the bone, smoky deliciousness. The brisket was juicy, thick cut, with just the right amount of bark on it. The pulled pork is tender and delicious. The sauce was just as good as the meat. The menu prices are similar to other BBQ restaurants of this caliber. I definitely recommend giving Bobby Qs a try

One of the few places I can honestly give a 5 star review. I got the meat sampler platter with Mac and cheese. Every piece of meat was tender and had the best Bbq flavor. Mac and cheese was also on point. And to top it off they give you donuts when you leave. I would recommend this place to anyone. Except a vegan.

We were here visiting colleges from California. I was told this was a great place! The food was delicious! Best BBQ I've had. We also got the brisket roll appetizer! Yummy....it was the best. The cornbread and donuts at the end. Yummy too.  I would recommend this to anybody in the Phoenix area!

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. The service was good and the food was ok, but it's just another ordinary BBQ joint in my opinion. I ordered the baby back ribs and brisket combo...unfortunately the ribs were dry and the brisket was chewy. I should have listened to the waiter when he said they're known for their aged steaks. If it's brisket you want, go to Rudy's BBQ.

This was the best BBQ  brisket i've had in ages, very juicy not the least bit dry.  as other have mentioned the mac and cheese is outrageously good, soooo creamy.  better than many homemade recipes. go for the chipotle brisket app too.
Fantastic place!!!  Some of the best BBQ in the city.  It used to be Bobby McGees years ago. But what they've done to the decor and the food is outstanding!!!
This place rocks! Great BBQ, friendly, knowledgable, professional waitress, food was served piping hot. The roasted corn was also excellent. The only downside was no burnt ends.

Kinda disappointed... Since I'm traveling close to 3 hours to/from here... Brisket is a must! Why I was told it's not ready..., ugh! My favorite dish. 

Don't get me wrong, the food is great, but darn it!

This place was amazing!! We had a group of 25 and they set up our tables in the patio area. We had 2 waiters and they were very attentive and best of all split the bill for each family. The manager was great he made sure everyone's meal was what they expected. You are given complimentary corn bread that is to die for. We ordered the Q-Rolls, BBQ ribs and the pulled pork sandwich they were all delicious. At the end they give you warm mini cinnamon donuts so save room for some dessert.
I think this is the best BBQ in Arizona!!! I go to Texas all the time so I have had some great BBQ and I think that Bobby Qs is just as good if not better than Texas BBQ.

This place is a joke, or Yelp is!!  I drove all the way down from Anthem to eat on a Saturday night cause the yelp has they're hours posted as open till 11pm on Saturdays got there at 10:10 an was fold the kitchen closes at 10:00 on Saturdays. Even if its Yelps fault the management is still at fault for not updating or correcting hours.

This was my first visit ever to celebrate graduation for my masters degree, and everything we had was delicious. Two of my family members really liked the complimentary corn bread and took some extra home. I had the ribeye with the side order of shrimp, both amazing, especially the sauce on the shrimp and the temperature of the ribeye was perfect. One of my friends who had been there previously ordered a salad she had there before that was no longer on the menu, so they accommodated her request. But unfortunately they didn't have avocado or forgot it on her salad, so they comped it and also gave us free dessert. One of the managers came by a few times to check on us and made sure we were ok with everything else. Overall we had a great experience despite the avocado-less salad, and my friend was still happy with her meal, especially the Q-rolls she made sure we tried!

The ribs are the best! I ordered the three meat dish. The Mac and cheese side is a must try here. The staff is very friendly and quick to respond. Overall this is one of the best BBQ restaurants I've been too. Will come again if in the area.
If I want to have the same food with the same quality and ambiance in SF it would cost me 100+. The bill came as 40 something total! highly recommended!

Amazing brisket and fantastic pulled pork. Wife loved the ribs as well. You have to get the mac and cheese for the sides......best ever! Even though you will be full, enjoy the freshly made doughnut holes immediately, so good. With water/soda, we usually spend $25-35.

This place was really great. We were seated almost immediately by a friendly hostess and then greeted by our waitress (Jordan). The food came out in under 10 minutes of us placing our orders and had a nice presentation to it. The beef ribs were flavorful, tender, and packed with meat. I feel like this is where most BBQ joints generally fail, but the side dishes complemented the main entrees well.  To wrap up the meal we ordered the bread pudding. Perfect combination of sweet and savory. Not a fan of the raisins, but I'll live to fight (eat) another day. I would definitely recommend this place.

I don't know where to even begin about this place. It's fantastic! We were looking for a "fall off the bone" rib restaurant. We started a Google search and landed on Bobby Q. I've been in the valley for 20 years and have passed this establishment many times a week, but never ventured inside. I can't believe all that I've missed out on all these years. The restaurant is really cool looking and has an outdoor patio. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation or you're be drooling waiting for a table if you can get one. We had a reservation last night and there was a line out the door of 6 people a head of us. When you go, ask to be seated in server Carissa's section. She is a spunky young gal who knows her stuff. She made valuable recommendations and has a winning personality. She will even sing for you!  She was every bit worth the 25% tip we left. The food is outstanding. I recommend the 2 rib dinner and get the Baby Back and St. Louis ribs. I was there for the BB, but the SLRibs were out of this world. We ordered a couple of dessert, but the warm donuts Bobby Q gives you at the end took the cake. All in all, eat at this establishment!  Carissa, we'll see you soon enough.

If you are looking for good BBQ, look no farther. I recommend this place to everyone I know that lives in or will be visiting the Phoenix area. Make a reservation before you go as there is always a large number of people waiting to be seated. The whole hog heaven is enough to feed our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids under 12). Delicious.

Food is always great! I love their pecan cole slaw & the corned beef brisket. The cornbread tastes like I make at home (Krusteaz from costco).  Kinda pain to find if your heading there for the first time. Head up the 17 til Dunlap & then head back down the road next to the freeway to get to it. It's worth it. Prepare to bring home leftovers. We do every time. About $40 for two to eat (drinking water). Desserts are huge, can order half desserts. Free dessert on your birthday, still embarrassing to be sung to....

The meat was really good, some of the best brisket I've ever had. But the prices are pretty high and the portions are small to average . The service was outstanding and the donuts at the end are a nice touch.

Our first time here, we decided to stop and have dinner here before heading to the illumination light show and it was delicious!! Definitely will come back again. The food was fresh and very tasty and all American!!!

I had to really think about this place for it's review. This was my first time visiting this place after smelling the BBQ every time I pass it on the freeway. I was so excited to try the food so I checked out there menu online and notice that it was expensive but within reason for bbq. A friend and I arrived at the place, got the menus and I notice the prices were more then the online price. Anyway I ordered the brisket sandwich and mashed potatoes and my friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich and Mac and cheese.  We also order there Q Rolls which is brisket wrapped in flour tortillas and deep fried.  The Q Rolls were good, they gave us 6 rolls that were about 3 inches long $12, my brisket sandwich $14 with one side had more bread then meat. I was very disappointed in the serving size for the price. Not even a 1/2 pound of brisket. They gave me more mashed potatoes then sandwich.  As for the taste, it was ok. No real flavor on the brisket and the spicy bbq sauce was not even spicy and was too sweet. I wished I've taken a picture of my food but it wasn't even photo worthy.  Our total bill for the Q Rolls, brisket sandwich, pulled pork sandwich with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes came out to be $47. I would not recommend this place if your looking for bang for your buck and awesome bbq. This place was just ok. I won't be back.

This is a fabulous place!! It's one of the best BBQ places me and my hubby have tried in our entire lifetime. Ribs are smokey and just so tender and delish! Wings are damn delicious with a bbq and buffalo sauce! The food was 5 stars and the service was 5+. Eric was really nice, brought our food in a timely manner and was very attentive. Jason, the manager, was greeting guests and made you feel right at home. He offered great suggestions on the menu and made our dining experience just amazing with a free dessert (packed to-go). 

We will definitely drop by this place again. Even fly from Cali just to eat some more yummy BBQs.

Hands down best BBQ I have ever had!!! Thanks to yelp we found this place while we were on vacation in Phoenix. I had the brisket and it was verrrryyy good. The pecan slaw was also very good. To top it all off, our server gave us some cinnamon donuts to take with us.  

The service is excellent as well! Our server was very friendly and, knowing we were from out of town, provided a brief history of the restaurant. All other staff seemed very friendly, always smiling. Wish I didn't live so far away from here; I'd eat here all the time! Place is so good it will be a deciding factor to return to Phoenix.

Not the best barbecue I have ever had, but I am a snob, so there you have it.
This is a great place to go with a group of people, or with family.

I wouldn't suggest coming here on a date or for girls night.

The baked potato was not special, but the beer is nice and cold, and they have options that aren't going to break the bank.  Plus the full plates are EASILY share-able.
This was one of our favorite eating experiences ever! The food, atmosphere, service and special attention from the manager was incredible. There aren't enough stars for this place.
Baylee was our server and the manager said she was new, we had excellent service along with great BBQ! Plus the portions are huge, definitely left overly full :)

My wife and I wanted some beef ribs so we googled places in Phoenix. Bobby Q came up so we decided to try it. People this place is worth the visit. Their menu was loaded with good apps and barbeque. We tried a variety of items which was amazing. Our waiter was knowledgeable about every question I had for him. Not only was he polite but he also took care of every need we had. Thanks to the owner for making me believe there are still good restaurants left out there. We will definitely visit again.

I love their bbq! I passed by this restaurant for years on the 17 before a buddy of mine tried it and said it was the best bbq he's had in Phoenix. I went with my family and everyone loved it! Their ribs and chicken and chicken fried steak are fantastic. Really nice atmosphere. I love this place.

This place is excellent. It sets a real benchmark and standard for how every restaurant should operate. The manager came out and introduced himself and checked on our satisfaction. Our drop dead gorgeous waitress Christine was very friendly and polite. What a doll. All waitresses and front house staff in this world should learn a thing or two from this establishment!  Bobby Q is a great place to visit!

I consider myself a BBQ connoisseur, traveled to many places in search of some of the best BBQ places, I know Texas, Kansas City, Memphis, and North Carolina are the BBQ capitals of the US.  I would say Bobby Q's is more like Kansas City style than anything else.  They drown the sauce all over the meats, in which hides the true flavors of the smoked meats.  I have heard about this place many times, and finally gave it a try since my co-worker raved about this place, and said it was voted as one of the best in AZ.  In which, I respectfully disagree BIG TIME.  That honor would go to Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix.  I would say even Rudy's, Joe's, and Famous Dave's is far superior.  So let's get into my review.

I came to this place on a Saturday afternoon with my wife and my brother.  We noticed the building off the I-17, it felt older and had a BBQ smell about it, in which I enjoyed.  The dining room was dark and  had an older feel to it.  We decided to sit outside.  One thing that I did notice is the chairs are very old and falling apart.  I had to move some chairs around cause a few of them had BBQ stains on them.  Anyways, I'm at a BBQ joint, so I don't let that stuff bother me, it's almost to be expected.  We ordered the Hog Heaven and fried chicken dish.  The Hog Heaven consisted of half a rack of spare ribs, 2 beef ribs, some pulled pork, and prime brisket.  It also came with 3 sides in which we ordered shoe string potatoes, mac and cheese and a baked potato.  There was also corn bread for the table.  My wife enjoyed her fried chicken dish, but thought the sides were a little bland and mashed potatoes could of used more butter and salt.  My experience  with the Hog Heaven was just ok.  When enjoying BBQ, I normally don't like ribs completely falling off the bone, and the pulled pork was completely doused with sauce, and the brisket was extremely tender.  I'm not trying to be a BBQ snob, but I like "competition style" BBQ.  Ribs should be tender, but hold up.  You should be able to take a bite and not completely fall off the bone, and the same with brisket.  It should be able to pull it apart and be tender and moist on the pallet.  The brisket completely fell apart and was too covered with too much BBQ sauce.  We were served two beef ribs, but one barely had any meat on it, (See Picture).  For 50.00 for the Hog Heaven, I truly didn't feel it was worth the price.  The sides were ok, but how hard is it to screw up fries, and a baked potato.  The mac and cheese was good though.  Overall, our experience was ok, nothing to rave about, but I'm glad I had a chance to experience Bobby Q and see what all the fuss was about.

In conclusion, I'm more of a sauce on the side kind of guy.  I truly enjoy BBQ and enjoy the smoked flavor and the tenderness of the meats.  The sauce should be on the side and help accentuate the meat, not completely covering the meats.  Why smoke BBQ for 6 to 15 hours if you are just going to ruin the flavor?  In the area, there aren't a lot of great BBQ places, but I would give this place another shot, I would just order the sauce on the side.  I love's Joe BBQ in gilbert, but I've had a bad experience, where the meat was a little dry, so I would give this a try again.

I get a lot of flack for it from my family from St. Louis, but this is my favorite spot for BBQ. I particularly like the spicy sauce. The corn bread is also quite good. I've been there a few times for dinner and go with my brother for lunch about once a month and have never had bad service.

The atmosphere and decor are great and you immediately smell the slow cooking meat as you enter the door. Highly recommended.

Wow!  We were returning to Sky Harbor airport from Williams, and wanted to grab something near I-17.  Reviews were good for this place, and we were not disappointed.   We were seated within five minutes (although they originally said 15-25 minute wait), and our server was there almost instantly.  Since we couldn't take leftovers with us, he recommended that the three of us split the three meat combo, and that was perfect!  We got the baby-back ribs, brisket, and pulled pork.   While the pulled pork was just OK, the ribs and the brisket were wonderful (our daughter, a rib snob if there ever was one, pronounced the ribs as being the best she'd ever had)!  The pre-meal cornbread was decent (a bit crumbly), and the free cinnamon-sugar mini-donuts after the meal were tasty, if a bit over-sugared.   We also ordered two sides: the baked potato with all the fixings was good, and the mac & cheese was close to incredible (never thought I'd put the words "mac & cheese" and "incredible" in the same sentence, but there you go).  All through the meal, our server checked on us every five minutes or so, and was always there with iced tea & soda refills, extra sauce, and so on.  And we were in and out in less than 30 minutes (usually I don't care, but with a flight to catch, that was important).   Wish these guys were closer to Boise -- I know we'd be regulars!

If you're in a hurry, might want to call ahead for reservations.   As busy as they were on a Sunday afternoon, I suspect that they are a madhouse at peak hours.
Great food! Great staff! The free corn bread and donuts are a crowd pleaser! My favorite dishes are the pulled pork and the BBQ burger. Their BBQ sauce is exceptional!
Great food, fantastic service (thanks Kristi M).  The weekly special prime rib sandwich is worth the wait!  Great BBQ chicken, too.

2nd time at this BobbyQs location. Had the 2 meat combo with brisket and pulled pork.  Both had good smoke flavor and were moist and tender.  Food was very good (but not great) and portions were smaller than the first time. Serving size is reasonable but I'm a big guy and they're expensive for BBQ.  Lunch for 2, with a drink each, was $70. Don't get me wrong, I'll go back; but this trip wasn't a 5 star experience.
Came here last night. It was amazing! Best service in the whole entire world. Great food! Great atmosphere! Delicious cornbread and donuts.

This is my new favorite barbeque place in AZ. The whole hog platter was great from the ribs to the tender brisket. The sides were excellent too.  Loved the hot home made BBQ sauce also. The drinks and beer were awesome! Love that it's a locally owned Restuarant. Will be back for more.
Mitch was our server. Was a super awesome experience. Recommended just the right amount of food. Favorite was the St. Louis ribs.

Our last stop in Phoenix before returning to reality and I was craving some ribs, Bobby Q was a suggestion I'm so glad I opted to go for.

 First of all the building itself is very southern style and includes a trough like waterfall on the back patio with a unique water fountain that is really fun. 
 While waiting to be seated I asked about a fryer like contraption which was for their COMPLIMENTARY churro like donuts and was surprised with two to start our dining experience!
 Love that the manager himself sat us and attended to us a couple times, for customer service oriented was the impression I received, as well as the fact that everyone including our server introduced themselves. 
 Scott was kind enough to offer some suggestions as well as provide another COMP that being their cornbread muffins. O.M.G they are seriously worth the trip  in itself. Just a bit sweet and buttery with a slightly crisp top.

 I ordered the St Louis style ribs with a side of spicy BBQ sauce and baked potato. They truly fell off the bone, super flavorful from the mesquite smoking and the sauce while not unique was very good. The baked potato was good, cooked just a bit too long, however hubby had the gravy which I used a bit for the potato and it was amazing. I suggest asking for the baked potato, if not going for mashed, to have with gravy.
 Hubby had the fried chicken and side of fries with gravy on the side. The chicken was EXTREMELY moist and the batter once fried was light and crunchy. We have concluded however that unless it's KFC or a restaurant in the South we aren't going to get much flavor from the batter itself. However that's what the gravy is for and it was extremely good, I believe sausage based minus the actual meat. The shoestring fries were good but not specially seasoned like we get at our favorite Tucson BBQ joint. 

 We were going to order the mud pie for dessert however they were sadly out. 

Truly amazing even with the minor drawbacks, I would done here monthly if we're in Phoenix..

I travel to Phoenix quite a bit for work.  My cousin-workers and I go here every week when we are in town.  I love the brisket, baby back ribs and pulled pork.  Two of my coworkers split the Hog Heaven and could not finish it.  The cornbread and the donuts that they give per & post meal are an added bonus.

This is my fav place for ribs. The Mac n cheese is awesome (the closest I have found to my own and I am a southern cook) lol. 

Sometimes it is a bit of a wait as others know about the great food. Service is super friendly and management is hands on, in a good way.  I would highly recommend Bobbi Q's. 
We WILL be back.......often.
The perfect burger. Awesome BBQ! NEVER a bad meal!
Outstanding barbecue brisket, Austin was our server and his suggestions were on the money!  Great food and relaxed atmosphere makes for a great experience!

Staff was super fast and friendly.  Kids loved being on the patio with misters and a waterfall made from an old steam engine.  Manager showed us around and checked in on our order.  Cornbread was yum. Caesar salad was fresh and crisp.  Ribs and smoked chicken with mashed potatoes and Mac/cheese also hits! Kids enjoyed the frosty lemonade.

Half baby back with mac/cheese and grilled veggies for $16.   Good house ale. They put sugar in the cornbread (a sin in Southern states) but it was good too.  The server brought us a small bag of fresh/hot mini-sugar donuts at the end to take home.  I can't eat them but they sure smelled great.  Service was excellent.  My faith in Phoenix BBQ was restored.  After a three day trip to AZ for business, this was my second BBQ meal.  The first one was the worst of my life but this was great.

Been here many times and it's really good.
 The pulled pork is very moist and tender and my wife's babyback ribs were awesome,  not a rib fan but ate some and really liked them alot. The Q ROLLS are usually really tasty but this visit they were overcooked and super greasy, I should have sent them back as they always make things right at Bobby Q's. So what would have been a 5 star visit is a four star due to the bad Q Rolls, but if you bring any dissatisfaction to their  attention they are right on it. excellent customer service
The most amazing BBQ I have ever had. Our server Samuel did an amazing job.  I Cannot wait till this opens in Mesa.
Yummy! I come here for their beef ribs and their rib eye steak.  Atmosphere and service is great!  Their pineapple mixed drink is the bomb.

I would consider myself a pretty good judge of BBQ and Bobby Q was some of the best I've had.  The St. Louis ribs were fall off the bone tender and incredible.  Brisket, tender and flavorful.  Cornbread?  Scary addictive.  My only complaint would be that the Mac and Cheese tasted like it was out of a Kraft box.  Guess you gotta cut costs somewhere.

I think a good judge of who knows their shit on BBQ on yelp is whether someone like Joes Real BBQ or not, apologies if you think that place is good but it just isn't worthy of the praise it gets.

omg!!!! i had the most wonderful experience at baby's steak and lemonade. first of all, service is an a+, everyone there is wonderful. the food is  awesome, i had the crispy philly mix and i loved it, my husband ordered a chicago style hotdog, and my kids loved the pizza puffs and homemade hamburger. im for sure coming again. everything was hot and fresh and my kids adored all the lemon decor, not to mention the fresh squeezed lemonade icees  top off the meal.

This use to be the old Bobby McGees (a classic for bringing dates when I was in High School - it's still the same owner) Cornbread (Good), had the sampler plate with Ribs (Great), Brisket (Good), Sausage (Great), also sampled the Mac n Cheese (Excellent), Coleslaw (Good), Beans (Ok), Potato Salad (Good) & Corn (Great) - and even though I didn't get dessert she brought me some fresh mini Doughnuts (Great). My server, Ciara was Outstanding!!

i had some amazing corn bread with the pork...beans on the side. This place kicks ass. The food was on point and the service was automatic. my drink got filled before i could ask. Extra napkins brought right on schedule.  Lots of waiters an waitress...and great place to eat. Hate it because its there and not here.

Hands down best BBQ in Phoenix that I've tried. Split the Hog Heaven with my partner and we left with enough for lunch the next day. Will definitely be back when craving BBQ again. 

Also- atmosphere was amazing, from the customer service to the overall dining experience. The manager was walking around- taking orders, refilling drinks, getting drinks, and bussing tables. One of the best restaurant managers I've ever seen and experienced.

I have been here several times before but today was the first time I have eaten here. I love the happy hour buffet on Fridays. The cornbread served at the beginning was excellent. I had the pulled pork sandwich and macaroni and cheese as the side. The pulled pork was great but I didn't care for the mac and cheese. The pasta was overcooked and mushy. The fries were great though. Thr donuts at the end were really good too. Our waitress was very friendly and made sure we had everything. I would definitely go back!
Always great food - never disappointed! Great service but come ready to wait at least 30 minutes for a table. Come hungry too!!

so overpriced. didn't have dinner... just horrible  under poured drinks..  everyone was so busy trying to look sophisticated standing around saying nothing.. just vacuous! the kicker is this  hollywood type screen with logos that your supposed to take a selfie or pose in front of.. like its the pork destination station!
Look like prostitutes and old people finally got a big night out!

This used to be Bobby Magee's (spelling?) and we used to come here as kids! Same owner, different concept. They cure their meats in house and have an open fire pit to
Smoke meats. 

Very friendly staff who brought out my nieces food right away (she has diabetes so this is very important!). Great atmosphere for kids since it gets a bit loud. Food was delicious, especially pulled pork sandwich. Love the corn, the Mac and cheese is very cheesy, so be careful. Love their cornbread! I'll definitely come back.
Excellent!! The brisket is very tender. The pulled pork is excellent. My favorite was the baby backs. I can't remember the last time I had such tender ribs. Highly recommend.

Wow - Now that's good BBQ!!!  We were at the BBQ festival in Scottsdale yesterday - Bobby-Q had the best brisket, ribs and chicken!  Their brisket is moist and juicy! and the ribs are fall off the bone de-lish!!!  I should have taken a picture of the bare bones so you could see just how bare they were!  Everything was outstanding!

The best BBQ ever and I am from Kansas City and know my BBQ!

The baby back ribs were tender and meaty by far the best I have ever had.

But don't stop there the four side dishes were also the best ever.

The mini donuts were fantastic,

The staff is unusually friendly and professional.

This second time here. Last time we had the combo BBQ platter, which was good. This time we shared the 14 oz ribeye. It came with 2 sides and cornbread. We chose baked potato and pecan cole slaw. Steak was cooked perfectly, and seasoned well. Both sides were very good.
Our server was Bre. It was her first day, and she did an excellent job!
They give you warm mini donuts as you leave, which was a nice treat.
We will definitely be back.
Good BBQ whatever meat you prefer. Sides are not the best especially the potato salad. Service is good. Prices are a little high but it smells so good walking up to the entrance.

What a clever name!! 

The restaurant is quite large but we made reservations to be safe. We got seated right away, and ordered the hog heaven to split between 3 ppl. We ordered the baby back and st.louis ribs with brisket, pecan cole slaw, mac and cheese and corn. They started off the meal with their complimentary corn bread, which was pretty good! Their brisket and ribs were tender and you didn't need a knife because it fell off the bone. We asked for their spicy BBQ sauce but I wish it was spicier. For their sides, I really enjoyed their mac and cheese and corn, which I recommend. Their cole slaw was just okay. The portion was perfect for 3 people and we even had some left overs. 

To finish off the meal, they bring you fresh mini donuts that they fry and shake with cinnamon sugar. Such a sweet treat!

I have been a past FAN of BobbyQ, however I recently decided to do take out order, the THREE MEAT Combo. It very disappointing to see the amount of meat placed in the order. Half a sausage cut in half an not even a tablespoon full of the pulled pork. It seems to have a good experience you have to eat there.

So yummy! Totally worth the wait, but I would definitely recommend a reservation. We "walked in" three nights before we actually ate there, and each time the wait time for two people was 45+ minutes. But still, TOTALLY WORTH IT!!

I was in town back in April '13 on business and ate here with colleagues. It was the first restaurant recommended by our customer.

I had the Whole Hog Heaven, ending up taking half of it home! It was some of the best BBQ I've had, though not the best (That was Oklahoma Joe's in KC).

The atmosphere was upscale with a down-home twist. They have a large beer selection and top off dinner with some freshly-baked donut holes (free with the meal).

I highly recommend this place when you're in the Phoenix area and have a hankerin' for BBQ.

I just had the best BBQ here at Bobby Q's! I sampled the brisket, pork and pulled chicken. All were incredibly juicy and delicious. The BBQ sauce was great, and not too sweet. The cornbread was excellent. Service was super friendly and super quick. Sadly, I am only in the area for travel and can't make this a new regular spot!
Absolutely hog heaven. I need to be wheeled out of this place. Best BBQ I've ever had!
Looking for mouthwatering BBQ or steaks? This is the place to go. Consistently amazing food and service.

Recently came to Bobby Q's and it was great from top to bottom! I'd been to the Q Bar plenty in my younger years but never the restaurant attached and boy have I been missing out!

The service was fantastic- it was packed but we waited half the time we were told. They have a great outdoor seating area with lots of shade and indoor waiting as well. Our server Jessica (in the bar area) was really great! Super friendly, kept our drinks full, our table cleared of unwanted dishes, personable, great with our three year old and just all around a great server. 

The food was phenomenal! We had the BBQ pulled pork, chicken, and 3 kinds of ribs. All were fantastic but the pulled pork and ribs were melt off the bone delicious! The complimentary cornbread and sugar donuts are not only a nice touch but we're really yummy and a fabulous way to start and end the meal! The coleslaw and Mac n cheese are also worth mentioning as they were very good too! If you have room for desert the Death by chocolate is also worth it, so much that if you can squeeze anymore food in take one to go! You won't regret it!

I don't eat beef or or so coming here was not my first choice.  However what I did eat was amazing - the cornbread and salad were flavorful.  The roasted corn side was so buttery and sweet.  I loved the mashed potatoes!

If you go to a BBQ restaurant I have two words of advice.  

1. Do order what they are known for
2. Don't try to eat healthy  

I ordered the shrimp and it was pretty bad.  I know everyone else loved their dishes but I made the mistake of trying to watch my calorie intake by ordering something that was not their specialty.  I have no doubt that Bobby Q's has amazing barbecue but what it does not have is good seafood.  I plan on trying this place again and actually ordering brisket which I hear is amazing.
Bestest barbecue in the valley!! Thanks for another stellar meal and experience :) the service staff is always spot on and there's always plenty of parking, too :)

Over Priced OK food....Did not impress me.
Everyone said the cornbread is awesome...NOT!  Dry and over baked. Needed a lot of Butter to wash down.

Service is good every time I have gone but honestly the food is average but nothing spectacular for me. I didn't have any of the ribs and when I did have a steak it tasted like I was chewing on rubber lol. But I love the Q rolls I would literally go there just to have Q rolls
talk about ambience, and 5 star service.  food and portions are worth the price.  great menu selection, night club next door if you want to dance and drink.  highly recommended

The food is AMAZING!!! Love the ambiance and menu selections.
The only part is the wait, but that only tells you how good the food is.

Pretty good sized portions. Get the whole hog if you're with a large group. Ribs,  pulled pork, and all the the traditional southern fixings you'd expect from a traditional North Carolina cookout.
TL;DR-5 shots fired at those who say that southern style barbecue can't work out west out of 5

Awesome BBQ. The brisket is super tender and delicious. The sauces have unique flavors and really accent the meats. 

Our server was Travis and did a great job. Very knowledgeable and friendly!

This place is always great! I took my daughter and wife after our softball tourney and they did not disappoint.  My wife said it was about the best BBQ she has had in a long time. (Next to mine of course).  If you are in Phoenix, I highly recommend this place.  Try the full rack of babyback and the Smoked Prime Rib.

I don't give five star reviews for barbeque restaurants lightly. I'm from Kansas. And Kansas City BBQ is in my blood. That being said... This place has some amazing food. I had the St Louis Style ribs and the sliced brisket and it was amazing. Smoked and grilled to perfection. Just the right amount of bark on the brisket. Delicious ribs that almost fall off the bone. So good that I'm salivating thinking about it a day later.  

We also got the Barbeque Egg roll appetizer and it was delicious. The wrap for these rolls is a puff pastry that is fried around their delicious brisket. Dipping sauces are both wonderful. I really enjoyed the nice sweet smokiness of their regular BBQ sauce. The chipotle ranch is also quite good.

No complaints from anyone at our table. Southern Fried Chicken looked amazing. My wife got the pulled pork sandwich and let me taste... It was really good.

I just don't think you can go wrong here. The only downside is the price. You can easily drop $25 per person here, but it's money well spent on a damn fine meal. 

Possibly the best BBQ in Phoenix. Easily the best I've had since living here and I've been trying them all. You should go here... Your wallet might regret it but YOU won't.

Bobby Q was really good! From their food to their service everything was great. We started off with their famous cornbread which was so good with that butter! For my main entree I ordered the beef brisket and 1/2 rack St. Louis style ribs which was so tender and juicy. I had a side of mac n' cheese and the potato salad which complemented the meal very well. My guest ordered the triple meat combo which included pulled pork, ribs and brisket with sides of the pecan coleslaw and baked potato. Everything was honestly really good and I would recommend this place to anyone who enjoys a true barbecue experience! I also enjoyed the cute mini donuts they gave for dessert. I would also like to note that we had plenty of leftovers which was awesome!

Bobby Q - we love you - but Thursday night was an off night. We enjoyed the brisket, perfect hamburger, q rolls, macaroni and cheese, roasted corn, and complementary donuts. Honestly, I eat Bobby Q's for the q rolls and the donuts, I think some of their other dishes are standard issue. My dining companion would point out that the food has a smoke quality that BBQ eaters love. I do not consider myself a BBQ person so I evaluate flavors without the analysis of smoke or BBQ. Thus, I enjoy the brisket, q rolls, and donuts - for their genuine flavor of the food itself. We were returning to Phoenix for a visit and made a list of the places we had to eat while in town. This is one of them! I hate to say this but we visited on a Thursday night and things were just off. My heartbreaks over this review because the only reason I am giving them 4 stars and not 3 is because I have had prior experiences that were 5 star quality.
Enough food to have for lunch the next day and it was still finger locking good. Ribs were well rubbed and right amount of sauce.  The mac and cheese was a meal within itself.  Keep up the good work.

This place is really nice and the staff is very friendly, but the BBQ is not good!  There is a sign above the place that says "Voted Best in the U.S." which really has me scratching my head.  Best what???  Certainly not the BBQ!  And certainly not in the U.S.!  I had the baby back ribs and they came out absolutely swimming in overly sweet sauce.  My wife had the Southern Fried Chicken and it came out soggy and undercooked.  I only complain because of the pretentious signs proclaiming they are the best and the really high price tag on the dishes.  

As I said, the service was good and the place is very nice inside and out.  I would love to try something else like their steaks, but honestly with a first try this bad I can't go back.

Unfortunately, with the exception of one place in Phoenix, there is still nowhere to get quality bbq in town.  Seems everyone's definition of BBQ here is crushing every piece of meat with ridiculously tangy sauce to cover the fact that they don't know what they're doing.

Okay, I am stingy with my stars.  This place really deserves all five.  Don't let the long wait discourage you.  We almost did and are so glad we didn't!  We were quoted a 2 hour wait time (with three little boys in tow) and actually ended up being seated within 45 minutes.  We were starving, so we ordered an appetizer and two huge platters (three meat and Hogs Heaven).  Whoa, it was waaaay too much food for all five of us (the kids ate off of our plates and they are big eaters). The portions are pretty darn generous, not to mention they give baskets of the best tasting cornbread I have ever tasted before your meal ever comes.  Our baby back ribs were moist and tender, and I am pretty sure that I ate the best brisket of my life.  The service was great!  Even though they were crazy busy, our server was very attentive.  A lady that seemed to be the manager also checked on us a couple times and brought us the delicious complimentary donuts at the end of or meal.  We will definitely return the next time we are in town.  Thanks for a great meal!

Let's start from the outside! It's adorable with a big patio with trees, water fixtures and a fireplace.  The service from the time you walk in until you leave is on point and friendly.  Our server Jeremiah was fantastic he told us about the restaurant and about the BBQ and how it is prepared. Inside is warm with a western cowboy theme.  Now here's the rub....I don't like barbecue! So what was I doing there? I was with two relatives from KC who are BBQ enthusiasts.  They split the two meat platter with 2 sides and they also added a salad.
