They said the pulled pork was fantastic! The brisket was good but not fall off the bone melt in your mouth like some, they concluded it must have just been that batch.  I ordered the smokehouse burger with no BBQ sauce and sautéed mushrooms on the side.  The burger is huge! And includes onion strings and thick thick bacon.  It was juicy and cooked perfect medium probably one of my top 10 burgers ever! The "secret sauce" which is usually some terrible aioli or thousand island concoction, theirs is a garlic butter on the toasted bun, so good.  Shoestring fries the best I ever had, some places they are so thin all you taste is grease not here.  How is it that I hate BBQ and this is one of my new favorite restaurants??

Macaroni and cheese that sticks to YOUR ribs?? Yes, please!! 
The cornbread, check! 
The bbq chicken breast, check! 
The ribs, check! 
The pulled pork, check! 
Everything deserves a check!

BEST BBQ ON THE FACE OF EARTH! My boyfriend and I live for burgers and BBQ and this place we saw on yelp & by so many people telling us to go here and man did we love it! Went there for my birthday today & I got the half rack of ribs & he got the beef brisket sandwich and it was everything we hoped for and more! Best macaroni and cheese and just everything! I wish I lived closer and could go there everyday! Definitely recommend going there!!!!

I have to say that this is some of the best BBQ I have ever had! The price is very reasonable as well, especially for the amount of food you are given. The BF and I shared the "Whole Hog" platter. We finished it, but only because we're gluttons and don't believe in wasting food. It was enough for at least 3 people. The meat just fell off the bone and melted in your mouth. I also appreciate that it wasn't smothered in sauce. They give you the opportunity to actually taste the meat but give you extra sauce on the side if you want it. We had the mac and cheese - gooey and scrumptious and the corn - roasty. The cocktails were tasty and also reasonably priced. We were there on a Saturday night with a party of 14. I don't know if we had a reservation but we were seated pretty quickly. We could tell that they were busy and even though we were taking up a lot of precious space they never  made us feel rushed. The waitress was a doll! Being a large group we didn't all arrive at the same time, needed separate checks, and needed drinks at different times. She didn't miss a beat and everything was accurate on our bill. If you check in on Yelp you get 10% off that visit and you can register for their mailings on their website and they'll send you a coupon for a free onion block appetizer.  There is a club attached to the restaurant but it is pretty bizarro. I wouldn't recommend hanging out there after your dinner. It isn't a honky tonk but a CLUB club for the locals. It doesn't really fit with the restaurant but whatever more power to them using the space to make some money. Apparently every table in the club is sold out every Saturday night so good for them. I forgot the mention the donuts. If you are too full to eat them after your meal, as we were, take them with you! I sincerely regret not bringing them home to be eaten at a later time.

Unbelievably great barbecue! I had the brisket, beef ribs, and pulled chicken. Sides were rather small but were tasty as well. I chose fries, macaroni, corn, and coleslaw. My server was awesome and attentive and the manager Cameron checked on us frequently. I would highly recommend this place. Living in the midwest I was skeptical of getting good bbq while visiting out west. They showed me right!! Two thumbs up!

Came in for Jacque's family bday dinner.  Our server was training a new server and neither of them missed a beat. The cornbread was just the right amount of sweet and the beef brisket was tender and full of flavor. The GM Taylor came over to check in on one of his rounds. Taylor sang a great song for the table.  A great howl in the end.  Very pleased with dinner and service. Thank you Bobby Q

My experience here was amazing. My dad and I were both in a really bad mood and looking for a little respite from a horrible day at the hospital. I had driven by Bobby Q's a couple of times and the placed looked fun so we thought we'd give it a try. When we arrived on a Tuesday evening the place was PACKED. The hostess said the wai would be 40 minutes and suggested we have a drink at the bar, which we were happy to do. Our server at the bar Chelsea then set us up at a table by the bar and actually offered to just serve us there. She was incredibly friendly and her enthusiasm felt completely authentic. And after we got our meal I can see why. The food was AMAZING. We had the "Whole Hog" barbecue package which was four different types of meat and three sides and everything was great. I can not wait to return.

This was the first time I have been here since the name change from Bobby McGee's.  

First appearance, it seems like the old place, with changes of course. The first thing that struck me was that all the Super Heroes were gone....those were the days when you could come in an have Batman (or if your lucky,...WONDER WOMAN) serving your food.  But like all things, we have to grow up.

Ever since El Paso BBQ closed down on 43rd and Peoria, I have been looking for good BBQ. Well, lo and behold...at Bobby Q's, I FOUND IT!

Start off with the Q rolls (which is a beef brisket rolled in a tortilla and then deep fried) and go right into your 2 or three meat platter. OH YEAR! The brisket is great, the pork is pulled perfectly, and all the meats are tender, juicy and flavorful!

Kristi indulged in a traditional chicken fried chicken and I will be darned if it was not the best I have had in Arizona! 

I had to force down the macaroni and cheese, which was also cheesy and flavorful, but I managed,

As we were leaving at 9:45 PM on a Saturday, the lines were already opening up for the party scene on the bar side....so it shows that even though its no longer the Bobby McGees I grew up with, it hasn't lost its lister for the night life!

Highly recommended!

Maybe the single worst brisket I have had in my life. Cooked to mush. I have never been in any BBQ place before that would serve that rather than say they are out. I am actually embarrassed for them. 

Nice bartender who cannot mix a drink. 

All around a bummer. Had high hopes when I walked in.

Everything was great here. I really enjoyed the beef ribs the most. Will return for sure. I bbq a lot at home, so for those that like the bbq sauce here, they do sell it for take home, which I've used on my briskets and pork ribs.

I've been in Phoenix for about 9 months now.  I had a serious craving for only 3 things since relocating here from Maryland.  That is UTZ potato chips, a real deal Holy Field Crabcake and some good soul food. 

 I've tried Honey Bears because that was deemed the best soul food in Phoenix.  What a joke!  I'll save what I thought about Honey Bears for their review.  I tried LoLo's Chicken and Waffles - I'll save that one for their review as well but I will tell you that it didn't stand a change to those Bobby Q's Beef ribs... Man my mouth watered when I typed that!

Seriously, nothing else compares,  The sauce, the meat, the seasonings, the flavors .. good Lawd!  The roasted corn, the cute little bags of doughnuts they give you after your meal really is the icing on the cake!

I've only been once but remember EXACTLY how good everything was I've tasted.  I think I should take a trip to Bobby Q's this Sunday
Fun place! its been a lil while but theres a good chance you will leave with a good story if you go with the right friends or meet the right people....

I literally don't know what to say. It's amazing clean BBQ food. Great staff and service. The right place to go if you are craving BBQ food. Get the big Hog thing and a bunch of sides, get the deserts. It's all good

I really usually enjoy going here for a bite & on this review I woulda loved to say that I did, but upon being seated & despite business being light, we didn't get served. We asked for service & nothing happened, but you know how they say things happen for a reason so upon leaving we went to Red Thai at 12th st & Northern. Absolutely delicious & service was wonderful. Thank you!

TOTALLY AWESOME ! We had a hankerin for some good BBQ, and went for the best. Each time my Wife & I go here, we are always glad we did. We split a " Hog Heaven ", and had plenty left to bring home. What you see below are Baby Back & St. Louis Ribs, Rotisserie Chicken, Smoked Sausage, Grilled Veggies, Mac and Cheese, and of course Shoestring Fries. A meal fit for a king, and impeccable service, is why we love this place.
My director introduced me to this place! Everything is delicious especially the cornbread!

Let me start by saying I wish I could give it zero stars. Owners/managers are racist, racist, racist!!  It is blatantly obvious that their "dress code" in the lounge is not dependent on what you're wearing but what color your skin is. If you are African American take your money and patronage elsewhere and save yourself the frustration and harassment. 
We have been here dozens of times over the years and have spent thousands of dollars but we're done!!  Their practice is unacceptable. Shame on them!

First timer it was amazing ! GREAT service very nice manager visited our table most of all wonderful food ! Portions very big and filling I was surprised. The food tasted very well cooked and real. Table of five and the wait wasn't long at all got seated right when We walked in server was with us in less than 5 minutes. All the servers were very attentive as well as polite. Always made sure empty plates were cleared off table drinks were full and made sure we were satisfied. Me and my family have no complaints! The set up was very nice as well the outside lights and set up were beautiful! Definitely going back !

Yummy yummy yummy BBQ! And their Mac 'n Cheese is the best! Great place to eat with a group, too! 

But I do have one issue; ingredients need to be listed on some of their items, like desserts. I ordered a chocolate item and when it came to the table, they had included walnuts, which I'm allergic to. When I asked about a different chocolate item instead, I was told by the waitress that it had peanuts in it (which I'm not allergic to but I know many others are). They had to throw away my first dessert in the garbage and bring me something else. 

Seems like a waste of money for a business, and a possible lawsuit too if someone went into anaphylactic shock. List the ingredients on the menu, or prompt the servers to ask the customers about food allergies.
Great BBQ, good burgers, possibly the best mac and cheese I've ever eaten.  GO there NOW!
Great Baby Back Ribs and Brisket! I'm glad we decided to eat at Bobby Q during our Arizona trip. Also, the service was great all around!

Excellent BBQ!  We started with the brisket flautas and got the Hog Heaven.  I know some people said it might be enough for two, but it was more than enough for the two of us and we can eat.  On top of all that you get donuts at the end for free.  Great wait staff and manager.  Next time we are back in the area, we'll come back!

One of the best BBQ restaurants in AZ. 
The other two are located in Mesa and at the Biltmore of course they are Bobby Q  restaurants to

I wanted to love it, but I liked it.

It's big. The service is very attentive (though my table was dangerously wobbly.)

The ribs were good - as was the sauce. Cornbread was tasty too.

Veggies were plain. And baked potato was meh. Not enough toppings and just not delicious.

Worth checking out if it's on your way. (It's right off the highway.)

Had the beef brisket, corn bread, mashed potatoes, and pecan cole slaw. The brisket was great, but the sides were all lacking. The corn bread was dry. The mashed potatoes were had a really thick texture. The cole slaw was fine, but the pecans didn't really add anything, kind of a strange addition. The best part was the sugared donuts they gave us after the meal.

Found this place courtesy of the concierge at my hotel while in phoenix on business.

The brisket Q-Rolls are awsome as well as the ribs.  Some of the best BBQ I have had.

Best, BBQ, ever.

It made the 12-hour drive worth it.  

Between three people, we had the Hog Heaven: chicken, St. Louis ribs, babyback ribs, and brisket.

The sides were awesome too!  All of them!  

The service was also excellent.  Manager came by and asked if everything was alright and the place was packed.

Afterwards, we went to the lounge that's connected to the restaurant called Q-Lounge.  There were a lot of fat chicks.

Apparently the owners traveled all across America and sampled different types of BBQ and thereafter, created Bobby-Q.

Bought a smoked turkey here for Thanksgiving and it was absolutely delicious. Have not eaten in the restaurant... just picked food up.  Only one experience but it was good.  The only reason I have not been back is because it is a bit inconvenient way to drive that far. But once a year or twice a year it is worth the trip.

Great food! Loved the "Whole Hog" platter,Chicken,beef brisket,beef ribs,pork ribs! Best value for your money.
Catfish,roasted corn and mashed potatoes were good too!

The brisket is really good and brittle, probably better off getting a brisket sand which. The 3 meat platter is really good, gives you an idea of what you will most likely get the second time around. And after trying between the sausage, brisket and ribs, ribs definitely take the cake! Corn bread is also good as an appetizer, and the grilled veggies really had some good flavor as we'll. The sauces are really good to I suggest the spicy, and at the end we got mini sugar donuts! Yum! Btw our waitress was Chelsea and she was awesome!

Love this place!! The pulled pork and the brisket are above average. That said, I couldn't find a smoke ring on the brisket. The sweet sauce is very good. The "tangy" is excellent. IMHO, the best sides are the Ranch Beans and the Mac n Cheese.... 

But, the St Louis Ribs are the reason to eat at Bobby-Q!! These baby back ribs are succulent and the meat falls right off the bone. They have the right balance between rub and sauce. The sweet and tangy flavors are what barbecue is supposed to be. I couldn't find the smoke ring under the rub and the heavy sauce. Sauce-less is not an option. Order an extra cup of the tangy sauce...

The cornbread is moist; a remarkable achievement since most places it's dry as a bone. Bobby-Q's cornbread is excellent and complimentary (Hint, hint to those from Nebraska who believe in charging for dinky little miniature cupcake-sized portions). It's even better with the whipped butter and/or honey on top...

Our waitress was knowledgeable and her service was top-notch. Our iced tea glasses were NEVER empty and she refilled the corn bread basket TWICE. (Hint, hint Nebraska...)

My only REAL complaint is the handicapped parking situation. The handicapped parking spaces are a couple hundred feet from the front door. I try to park out back near the "Take-Out" door. There are six spaces there. These spaces are approx 75 ft from the dining room doors, but are NOT reserved for the handicapped.

We usually prefer to cook our own bbq at home to avoid rubbery meats, but needed a quick place to take a family member for birthday dinner.  We were pleasantly surprised at the delicious food here.  The service was so accommodating and all of the dishes were fantastic. The brisket was tender, the corn bread was moist, and the little donuts at the end were a delicious, unexpected treat.  We will definitely be back for more!
Great place, great service and great food!! I shared the sampler plate it was very good!
Love it!!!!!!!!! Gotta have the aged steak!!!!!! Love it love it love it love it is this enough words to post? Nikole is an awesome server!!!!!!

Came here with a co-worker for lunch during a business trip.  We both agreed that it wasn't that great for BBQ.  The meat was incredibly dry, which they tried to hide by adding extra BBQ sauce.  Nice try.   Overall, it was decent, but not extraordinary.  Portions aren't enormous, but just about right so that you don't over eat.

Edit 9/12  - I visited this place again on another business trip this time with a client, and I must say I was highly impressed.  I suspect the first time I went, something went wrong.  Maybe the chef was having a bad day or something?  Either way, I ordered the Pork Pull burger and I must say it was really tasty.  Wasn't dry as my first experience, and had just the right amount of BBQ sauce.  Very impressed.  Bumping up a star to average a 3 and 5 to 4!

This is probably one of the best wet-rub bbq that I've ever had! My family and boyfriend came from California to visit my cousins and decided to give this place a try. My boyfriend and I are both originally from Arizona and we've been craving some really good, tender ribs that melt right off the bone b/c we can't be that in California! The service here is super quick and everyone is really nice. BONUS: They also give complimentary sugar donuts! I would totally recommend giving Bobby Q a try!!!

I wish I caught his name but there's a super friendly gray haired waiter working the night of 3.6.16 @ 8ish. He was so knowledgeable & friendly. 
We split an 8 oz steak & 1/2 rack of ribs. Came with loaded baked & mac n cheese & grilled veggies. Ribs were so good and sauce was perfect. Steak was a tad red but still enjoyed it.
Can I get a moment of silence for the mac and cheese??? Get you some. Super creamy & great flavor.
Complimentary cornbread was so good...glad I chose this place for my pre birthday dinner.

First time here for me and what took me so long to try it?? Food was excellent, service was quick and friendly. Jack, our waiter, was  The Best Server I have ever experienced. My teenaged son even questioned why he was being so nice. I guess when you are used to mediocre to poor service you are surprised when the service is exceptional. We will be back!!!!
First time to Bobby Q and we loved it. Brodie was our waiter and he was perfectly attentive without being intrusive. The doughnuts at the end of the meal were heavenly!  Thanks, Bobby Q.

What a joke, took 25 minutes for the waitress to come to the table, food is very comparable to outback steakhouse but for twice the price.

I ordered the ribeye ($36 for a 14 ounce nothing special steak) and my girlfriend had some pulled pork. We also had 2 drinks each, the total came out to $125 before a tip. The waitress was just ok but I tipped decent because I used to be a waiter and it's a shitty job. 

Will never be back again, food quality should be much better for the prices.

Best BBQ in Arizona!  Big portions, great sides, and great service.  I got the combo platter with pulled pork, brisket, and ribs...it was outstanding.  The pulled pork is exceptional.  For your sides, you have to get the Mac & Cheese!  

If you really like the traditional KC or TX BBQ joints that are hole in the walls with red and white checkered tablecloths (or none at all) and you have to walk through lines to get your BBQ, then you probably won't like Bobby Q's.  The food is great, but it is a somewhat upscale for BBQ.

Oh yeah, and the "Thank Q's" doughnuts are great way to end the meal.  They're so fresh and gooey!!
This place is ridiculously good.  From the cornbread, to the ribs, bothers and sugar donuts, it's quite delicious.  The service was great, too.  Highly recommended.
Best bbq I have ever had. Prices are great and their specialty cocktails are awesome. I am so excited that they will be in the Gilbert area this fall.

I wish I can give this place 5 stars! Everything was damn close to perfect. From the moment I walked in I was greeted with friendly smiles and warm welcomes. I sat at the bar top where I was greeted within 30 seconds. The bartender showed me the happy hour specials and told me how they prepare their meats. My drink never went under half, it was always refilled! Corn bread was super fresh and Mac and cheese was amazing. The bartenders customer service is top notch, they are definitely a model of amazing service. 

The ONLY reason my review is getting only 4 stars is because my steak was WAY over cooked. I asked for Med Rare and it came out with a slight pink center. However it was still really juicy!
Look out Kansas City, we have competition! Brisket and ribs were tender (no sauce needed). MacnCheese and cornbread were delicious. Catfish was yummy. To top it off, excellent service!
The beef is out of this world. So tender it melts in your mouth and very flavorful. Service was great and very prompt. Would definitely go there again and take friends

Ribs = pretty damn good. the meat was fall off the bones. I wish the sauce had a little more kick to it though. 

I came here comparing this place to phil's in san diego and it holds its own pretty well. The service was excellent, the food and drinks were good. You get a lot of food for the price so it beats phil's in that sense. There was corn bread at the beginning and donuts at the end. 

I'd definitely come back here again!

Since we're being completely honest and all, my husband and I were originally planning on going to Little Miss BBQ but found out mid uber ride that they weren't even open. But boy were we oh so happy that they were because we ended up finding Bobby Q's. 

Again, sticking to the whole honesty thing, we loved everything about this joint. From the moment we walked in and saw just how charming the venue was to the exceptionally good customer service they delivered, this place was on point. Our waiter even had the perfect balance of knowing when to check on us and when not to. He kept our drinks topped off and was so knowledgeable about everything they had. You could tell the staff took pride in working there.

We shared a dinner combo: ribs and top sirloin with a baked potato, mac n cheese, and roasted corn. We also shared their signature mud slide pie. Everything was good but let me break this feast down to my personal favorites:

The Ribs - I can totally see why they'd be dubbed "World Famous" for it. I mean, the meat literally falls right off the bone while maintaining the right amount of tenderness you can only find in a perfectly slow-smoked BBQ.

The Roasted Corn - I've never had anything like it. It's rich with buttery goodness and makes a stance with the char it leaves in your mouth long after you've digested. This is one of those sides that shouldn't even be a side, it's just. that. good. 

Bobby Q's, thank you for being open when all the competitors were closed - you guys have officially left me with a tasteful experience I will never forget.

Seriously the best BBQ I have had. I fly over from California to see family and this is one of my main stops when I get to Phoenix.  The St Louis Ribs are tender and yummy. Try the corn because they have a smoky flavor and just delicious.  The brisket is also something worth ordering.   Order the $48 (I think that was the cost) Family Feast.  It can literally feed a family of 4.

Order the Q-Rolls, they are great. I don't care if you aren't that hungry, you will eat them.

The brisket is amazing. The sauces are tasty. The pulled-pork is great also. Eat all the meats!

The food was delicious!  We came into town for the weekend and figured we would give this place a try because of all of the positive reviews. Two of us shared the Whole Hog and even after eating a lot of food we still had left overs. 
The brisket was probably the best I have ever had. Super tender and flavorful. 
The St. Louis and Baby Back ribs were both delicious as was the pulled pork. 
The Mac and Cheese was good but the beans left a little to be desired. 
Overall very happy with the food and the little donut at the end was a nice little bonus.

This is probably one of the best BBQ restraunts I have ever been to date. I have been to many, Rib joints, and I am definitely an eater. Great fall of the bone ribs, and has amazing sauce that accompanies it. We had the Whole Hog Feast, and it was amazing. You MUST get the Baby back ribs - completely fall off the bone. I just got my braces today, and it didn't even hurt my sore mouth eating the ribs! If you're in town, come on down to Bobby-Q!
Awesome bbq, cann i say awesome 1 more time i love this place... food is off the chain...
Always enjoy my dining experience at Bobby Q's! The service and staff are attentive and professional!
Great service and food. Better than Lucille's in my opinion. I wish we had this in LA!
Gutes Essen. Restaurant war gut besucht. Das nächste mal würde ich Baby Back Rib bestellen. BBQ Sauce ist sehr gut.

Recently voted one of the top 100 barbecue places on yelp, this is a must visit if you're in the Phoenix area.

The backyard patio is beautifully lit, has a really cool waterfall, and there are mister machines on the ceiling which help on those really hot Phoenix summer days.

Their food was excellent! I had the big potato with brisket on top and a side of sweet potato fries. It was amazing! This we potato fries are seasoned with a hint of cinnamon which makes him quite... sweet. It was the perfect amount of food. The chipotle ranch sauce that came with the sweet potato fries had a zesty finish.

I would definitely come back!

First off made a reservation and arrived to be seated next to the extremely hot rotisserie.  Very uncomfortable, not to mention it was 112 degrees outside that day.  I asked to be seated elsewhere but the hostesses' excuse was that this was all that was available due to reservations.  Well I made  reservation but she just made another excuse that we needed to be a larger party to sit elsewhere.  I gave it two stars only because my family likes their BBQ-I don't.

They usually have pretty good deals for two or more people.
I have been able to try just about everything from chicken to brisket to pulled pork and ribs. I loved it all. The homemade sides are a must.
Mac and cheese-YES! Usually no room for desert. Will definitely return.
This place is great! Meat falls off the bone and the mac n cheese and mashed potatoes are so yummy!
Always amazing! I used to work there and I miss the food! Good people, good food, and they aren't stingy with portions.

We have been going here since we moved to Phoenix 4 years ago. We even had our wedding rehearsal dinner here and our friends and family loved it. 

We have tried many items on the menu but my favorites are the q rolls with the chipotle ranch dip as an appetizer. We also like the onion stack. The cornbread they give you is so good as well. My favorite entree is the brisket. It is very flavorful. The best side is hands down the Mac and cheese. It is so creamy and delicious. 

They also have a great selection of beer, wine and cocktails. 

When you are about to leave you get a bag of freshly made donuts in a brown paper bag. I'm usually stuffed but have to eat one hot then take the rest home.

Bobby-Q's is fairly well-known in Phoenix and I understand why. The atmosphere and indoor/outdoor seating are perfect for any occasion. The food comes in very large portions and the restaurant tends to be on the louder side. It's great for large groups. Order the drink that comes in the pineapple... You won't be disappointed!
Dinner was so delicious at Bobby Q's. The Smoked Prime Rib was awesome! So much food and no room for dessert
I am visiting from Portland Oregon and this is the best BBQ I have ever been to!  I love the roasted corn along with the St. Louis ribs. :)

Let me just say that I have been a Yelp lurker for a long time and it was of Bobby Q's food that made me want to finally create an account and leave a review.

I went in last Friday for lunch and the place looked great inside. Very classy interior and our server Jo was incredibly nice and provided us with great service (always refilling our drinks and asking if we needed anything).

I ordered the 12oz sirloin steak which was delicious, as were the mashed potatoes that I got on the side.  My friend ordered a full rack of ribs (half St Louis, half baby back) and I tried some of it....and I have to say it was incredible. The meat was nice and soft and just melted in your mouth.

I really can't think of any negatives about this place, especially when they brought 4 complimentary mini donuts to us on our way out.

I will definitely be going here again and is well worth the money that you will spend there.
Awesome food (ribs, chicken, brisket, mac n cheese, mash potato, roasted corn) and service with the brightest smile all the time from Meghan

Had a great experience with RACHEL as our server, there was 7 of us! The Kale salad was fabulous! The pork spareribs delicious, corn bread and the Brussels sprouts! My Dad loved his brisket tacos! I tasted their dark beer which was  great and enjoyed the meal with my grape crush drink, was perfect!  Would recommend this place for sure!

Ok, I read all the reviews and I hate to swim against the current, my experience just wasn't that great. 1st off the restaurant is super loud, so not a great place to have a conversation, 2nd, I ordered the Brisket and I Love Brisket, but I didn't love it here. I got a huge helping of gelatinous cartilage and fat, and a small helping of actual meat. Now burnt ends are again one of my favorites, but there really weren't any of those dry crunchy ends packed with flavor one would expect. And the small amount of what i did actually eat consisted of 3 unflavorful bites. Lacking any real smoke flavor or even basic seasoning. In my opinion they hope their bbq sauce will give you the flavor the meat is desperately needing. The wait staff where great and the mac nd cheese was super creamy. Other then that, they would have rated a 2. Eat and live well my friends.

I went here with my family for the 1st time and made a reservation through Yelp and I'm so glad we did because it's super busy on weekends. The food was amazing!!! Best BBQ I've ever had! The manager went around to talk to each table and check in with them and made sure they were taken care of. Awesome service, atmosphere, and servers! Definitely recommend Bobby Q and I'll definitely be going back!

The atmosphere is very nice, the service was great, the food was a mixed bag. There were three in the party. One had the pulled pork and one had the brisket. Both were very tender and tasty. The third member had the baby back ribs and was not very impressed. We ordered a mix of sides so we could taste several. The baked potato and roasted corn were also nothing impressive. The pecan cole slaw is just slaw with pecan bits on top. Nice flavor. The grilled veg was a nice mix and grilled till tender. The mashed potatoes and mac & cheese were yummy! One of us had the Bobby-Q amber ale. It was very good and served in a very frosty glass. Desserts were good but not outstanding. All in all, a nice place to eat with good food for typical prices. Would definitely go back again and try something else.

Good beef briskets. Good boasted chicken. Flavorful meats with no extra fat garbage. The prices are fair. The service is always good. I've been to the Dunlap and the biltmore location. Both have nice settings. I love their free doughnuts as well. They give you free cornbread. Their Q rolls are the best tasting with brisket in there as well with chipotle sauce. This is one of the best BBQ places in AZ. Hands down.

Went here for an impromptu dinner. We were going to get dinner with M's parents and we wanted meat so we decided to go here. We have seen this place for years driving by and now we finally decided to try it. The patio was soooo pretty they had string lights everywhere. I love the ambiance. The inside was pretty too, but we kinda got stuck in a corner near a sink? I would have probably preferred the patio.

The service was great, and the food came out fast. The server welcomed us first timers very well, and talked about the awards the restaurant was won which was pretty cool. 

We decided to split a three meat plate and an extra side: baby back ribs, pulled pork, brisket with mashed potatoes, ranch beans, and macncheese.

The meat were very tender and the bbq sauce was good, I added a little bit of the spicy bbq sauce (not really that spicy tho). I felt like the bbq was soft and tender but it was also a little bland? I don't know maybe there was too much hype on this place that I set the bar in my mind so high? It was good but I thought it would be so much better. The sides were pretty good too especially the mac n cheese. Oh and I ordered the frozen lemonade which was nice (wasn't too sweet), felt like I was drinking a margarita ;)

Everyone else did enjoy the meal very much...maybe it's just my taste buds..hmmm...well I'd def come back for more to try it more...


Ooh the bread was sooo good yumm!

3.5stars for me for now
Very very good bbq to be found here, in a nice setting.  Very good service by very nice people.  If I could, I'd give it 4.5 stars.

Went to Bobby-Q for lunch and tried the sampler platter. For my platter I got the baby back ribs, ST. Louis ribs and the smoked BBQ pork with a side of mac and cheese.  My compadre got the same platter but substituted for the sliced beef brisket and pecan Cole slaw so we could both share. Before your food arrives you get two pieces of corn bread and butter and at the end of your meal you receive a sugar donut.

By noon the restaurant was standing room only and our server was very attentive and refilled my ice tea three times. The rib meat really does fall off the bone and you can smell the hickory wood and taste the dry rubbed spices with each bite of rib which was mouthwatering and delicious. We asked the waiter to bring extra BBQ sauce so he brought us the sweet and the spicy sauce to sample.

Baby Back Ribs (Sweet Sauce)
ST. Louis Ribs (Spicy Sauce)
Sliced Beef Brisket
BBQ Pork
Mediocre at best.  Overpriced for what it was.  Meat was not smoked, tasted like it was boiled.  BBQ sauce was good.
The Q Rolls and the Smokehouse Burger were absolutely fantastic. Will be returning very soon. Outstanding barbecue.

This BBQ is amazing!  The ambiance is welcoming and the staff is very friendly.  Very impressed when the manager makes table visits to ensure everyone is happy.  The food is priced fairly in comparison to portion size and quality.  Ordered the Baby Back Ribs and the meet just fell off of the bone!  Delicious smoke flavor, great BBQ sauce and wonderful grilled vegetables.  The food was hot when served and our server checked back within a reasonable time after being served.  I highly recommend this restaurant to those who are looking for great food and an awesome experience!  And as I am finishing up my review our server brings these warm to die for donuts as a night cap.....O-M-G!!!

So-so BBQ.  I had the brisket and St. Louis-style ribs with mashed potatoes and grilled corn.

1. Brisket - Average in flavor.  Nice and moist, but the only seasoning was the sauce (sauce was good...sweet Carolina style).  Needless to say I drenched the meat in sauce.  Overall, I found the meats to be smokeless and pretty bland. 

2. Ribs - See above.

3. Cornbread - Very tasty sweet cornbread.  My favorite.

4.Mashed Potatoes - They nailed this side dish.  Smooth and creamy, with a peppery overtone.  I wish I would have just ordered a plate of this as my meal.

5. Grilled Corn - Tasted more "burned" than "grilled".  I didn't even finish it (which is unheard of since I often think about the kids starving in Ethiopia).

6. Frosted Lemonade - I think I had 4 glasses before I passed out from sugar overdose.  These things are REALLY good!

6. Dessert donuts - tasty, need more of these.

7.  Service - Excellent, no complaints here.


Overall, I wouldn't advise against going, I just wouldn't go out of my way to make the trip out there.  The meats were IMO very unremarkable.

By far the best bbq I've ever had! I read the reviews and I've heard the hype but I needed to make my own judgement. Absolutely delicious. We went (party of 5) on a busy Saturday night so they told us the wait would be about an hour. It didn't take that long at all and if it did, it would be worth the wait. I got the brisket with Mac and cheese (def recommend) and ranch beans. Very good! Our server was Rebecca and she was so great. She was attentive and filled us in on the drinks and the menu. Manager came by and checked how everything was (my favorite thing). Overall fantastic experience and we definitely will be returning!

First let me say that you NEED a reservation if you don't want to wait for a table. I used the YELP site to make my reservation and it was super easy. Next the staff was really great! Potter, like Harry"Potter" was our server and she was very attentive and did an excellent job, keeping our drinks filled and checking on us, very attentive. The manager, Taylor stopped by to check on us too. We couldn't ask for better service. Now, the food. We were a party of 5, skipped the appetizers and I'm so glad we did. We ordered 2 of the Hogs Dinners which said they were for 2, but they were enormous and each platter could have easily fed 3 big eaters. (Not realizing that, I ordered a 1/2 slab of the Baby Back Ribs and 2 sides). On the 1st platter we had ribs, both Baby Back and St Louis style, Brisket, Rotisserie Chicken plus 3 sides, Mac & Cheese, Mash Potatoes and Roasted Corn. The second platter had Sausage, Brisket and Ribs; plus 3 more sides.  We had so much food left over! I wish Potter had told us not to order the extra dinner. If you're in the area, don't be put off by the location, stop there. You won't be sorry.

Was in Phoenix for the weekend for you sporting event, traveling by myself, so looked around for a good meat/barbecue restaurant and chose Bobby Q's because of Yelp reviews and I was absolutely blown away, food was great, large portions, and most noteworthy was the service... From the bartenders, the waiters, and even the people handling the hostess station, they we're all tremendously friendly and pleasant, and seemed genuinely interested in customer satisfaction.

This restaurant is top-notch is food, fun, and ambiance. Even the parking lot is beautiful...large shade trees in the middle of Phoenix! The scent of smoke from their 18-22 hour meat roasting grabs you as soon as you exit your vehicle. My mom and I came in for a weekday lunch and were greeted and seated immediately. The server, Hal, introduced himself soon after and had our drink orders on the table in minutes. He was a great server: personable, helpful and knowledgeable about the menu and food recommendations. He was kind and patient with my mom, stopping to listen to her even though he was slammed with full tables to care for. We ordered ribs and fries and a brisket sandwich with roasted corn. The cornbread was amazing and our meals were out so quickly there was no lag in between. Our food was tender and flavorful, moist and just the right amount of delicious sauce. The roast corn was perfect, as well. The cinnamon sugar doughnuts at the end was the best finish ever! Keep it up, BobbyQ's! We will definitely be coming back!!! (Next time I'm going to try some Q Rolls, for sure!)
now i know what all the hype is about around town! this place serves amazing and good quality food! I am a huge fan of their ribs, burgers, and their alcoholic beverages.

MehBQ. Abysmal service. Would have been a total bust but for the Mac & Cheese side and cornbread. But probably the worst, driest, most overpriced pulled pork sandwich I've had in the Valley. I won't be going back.

Took my wife for dinner and we shared the "Whole Hog Heaven" which included babyback ribs, st louis ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. The sides we had were fries, pecan cole slaw, and roasted corn.

All the food was outstanding with the brisket and babyback ribs being the standout meats. Least favorite was the pulled pork because there was a ton of fat in it but the meat had great flavor.

Highly recommend and we'll be back for sure.

road tripping through Arizona and did a quick yelp search because my friend and I were hungry - happened to catch this fine place for very good bbq - we loved the employees who were so friendly - the manager came by and asked if this was our first time and helped answer questions about people's favorites, very nice.  Food was fantastic - I had the brisket which was so tender and succulent (yum) with grilled veggies; my friend had the pulled pork which she said was tangy sweet and smokey - very nice find!

Fantastic BBQ place.  Minimal wait to sit down at prime time on a Sunday.  The service was very attentive and made sure we were well taken care of.  I ordered the 2 meat combination plate with baby back ribs and pulled pork.  My sides were fries, pecan coleslaw, and cornbread.  The sides were a good compliment to the meat.  The meat was very tender and full of flavor.  It fell right off the bone.  The complimentary doughnuts you receive at the end was the cherry on top of a great experience.  A+
Yum!! 2 meat combo for $25 Bbq brisket + BBQ chicken + mac&cheese + coleslaw with nuts + corn bread. Super scrumptious!

I had such a great experience last night for dinner! It being out first time, my husband and I were surprised at the great customer service we received from Mady. She gave us some background of the restaurant and recommended the meals and drinks we got that night. The food was amazing! Overall awesome experience and will be back!

We came here around 6PM on a Tuesday and heard that it was an hour wait. Luckily, we made reservations and did not have to wait at all! Very easy to make reservations over the phone for the same day. 

Service was really quick and attentive! I ordered the baby back ribs which included 2 sides. It was delicious! The sauce on the ribs really complimented the taste. Great first experience! Definitely recommend it.

Every time we come here we have an awesome experience!!! The cornbread to start is out of this world!!! Beef ribs are the best I've ever had and the servers crazy is spot on. The owner usually walks around and it honestly seems like he sees every table!!! Super nice guy. We love coming here. The fresh fried mini donuts are mind blowing!!!! If you like bbq, beer, and epic service come here. This place is the real deal.

Where do I even begin? This is the best bbq I've ever had in my life. So so good. The bbq ribs are so bomb!! My boyfriends favorite is the brisket. And DO NOT SKIP the corn bread. So good. So warm. Fresh. Tasty. Buttery. Goodness. I suggest to make reservations, it's always so busy.

This place is definetly a diamond in the rough. It is absolutely fabulous! The first impression is a great one and the last impression is just as great. I have yet to eat anything bad at this place. Everything is made to perfection each time. I love the brisket, pulled pork, and smokehouse burger. Also, you can't forget the potato salad and mac and cheese! Took my parents here while they were visiting and they absolutely loved it!

When I saw quite a few of my Yelp friends checked in at Bobby Q, I definitely couldn't pass up a chance to go. We went on a Friday night and the wait for a table was about an hour and a half. This was a little bit longer than expected, however we figured we would grab a drink and wait. After seeing how large the drinks were that others around us had ordered, we decided on just one cocktail called Shipwrecked. It was large and pretty sweet with a blue raspberry-coconut flavor. Since this was the type of fruity drink I typically gravitate towards, I was satisfied and would get it again.

Their estimate on the wait time was fairly accurate so about an hour & a half later, we were seated at a table on their outside patio. Our waiter was friendly and came by our table immediately. He went over the menu items and suggested some of the meat plates and sides. I ended up getting a Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich with a side of Mac & Cheese (which multiple servers seemed to be recommending) and my fiancé got a three meat plate with the baked potato and mashed potatoes. While we waited, we were brought out some warm cornbread and butter to enjoy, and a short while later, our food arrived.

After tasting a little bit of everything that we got, I wish I would have ordered one of the red meats instead of the chicken sandwich only because it was so plain compared to the other items. I'm not a huge fan of red meat which I was pleased to see chicken on the menu, but the red meat had the actual BBQ flavor I was hoping to find. All the side items were good; I personally liked the mashed potatoes the most but my fiancé liked the mac and cheese the most. The chicken sandwich plate and side was small enough for one to finish entirely but we had some leftovers from the three meat plate.

After we were done with our meals, we were brought a small bag with some cinnamon sugar covered donuts. I had seen a couple of people making them fresh at the front of the restaurant when we walked in, so this was definitely a nice & unique treat.

Overall, I would definitely be up for coming back here and giving some of the other menu items a try ... 4.5 stars, just not quite 5.

Rated as one of top 30 barbecue restaurants in the US. Came here at 4:30pm on Saturday but almost full tables. Old style machine for donuts at the entrance with hot donuts boiling and it's free. Ordered onion block, while baby back ribs and 5 jumbo shrimps. The ribs are super tender and juicy, really yummy. Enjoyed the dinner. Too full so have to walk before going back.

Thought I'd try it again after going there about a year ago and not digging it at all.  The sides are better than the bbq...tried the baby backs and found them to not be seasoned with spices at all.Lot's of smoke flavor if that's all you're looking for. Thank goodness for bbq sauce which was pretty good.

Finding good barbecue is a challenge.  With barbecue, people's favorite styles are so different and standards are exacting.  Yelp put me onto Bobby Q.  Impressive ratings.  Rare does any restaurant have the ratings that Bobby Q does.

It was a Friday night during spring training.  We tried making a reservation that day, but they were already fully booked.  The parking lot was overflowing (at night you can use the lot next door at the small "college") when I arrived.  Loved the smell of smoke as I walked in.  The hostess said 50 minutes.  I don't think it was much more than 30.

Three of us started with Bobby's Amber Ale.  For those looking for heavy hops (IPA lovers) or deep flavor (stout or porter people), it would be lacking, but I liked it.  We also got the appetizer of little taquitos, Q Rolls, filled with barbecue beef.  Those came with two good sauces.  Very good.

For the meal, I choose two meats: pulled pork and brisket.  Both were tender, well seasoned, smoky, a little sauced (and I wasn't compelled to add a lot more), and moist.  Others in the group got: a pulled pork sandwich, ribs, and a salad with chicken.  Everyone thought the barbecue was excellent, echoing my comments of seasoning, smoke, and moistness.  Everyone loved the sauce.

Side: I got the Mac N Cheese and corn.  The corn was excellent with some taste of grilling and well seasoned.  The mac N cheese was good.  Mac N cheese almost always disappoints, and this was better than most, though I didn't love it.  Many in the group went for the grilled vegetables which were excellent.

An excellent meal.  I can imagine a few being disappointed with the crowds, the wait, or the style of barbecue if it's not their favorite.  I've been to a lot of barbecue places that were not nearly as good.  I haven't gone to any significantly better (except my backyard on 4th of July).  So I'm going to say 5 stars, and I look forward to returning to try the spareribs.

Why 5 stars?  Why not 4?  This is a barbecue place.  I'm not going to rate it on the same scale a high end fine dining restaurant.  For what it is, a steak and barbecue joint, it does it as well as any place I've been to.  I wish it wasn't as crowded, but it's popular.  If you crave smoke, you should find great satisfaction here.  The sides and appetizer were 4+.  But the star of the show, the smoked meat, was excellent.  That's what I came for, and that's what they get the 5 stars for.

There are two things that I am certain of right now.  
1.  The huge mega fight this weekend is a hoax.  
2.  Bobby Q is the REAL DEAL for the style of BBQ it is.  I have eaten at BBQ all over the USA.  I know there are different types for each different region too. This place is very fantastic.  

The cute server Megan did a fantastic job explaining the menu.  She was on top of the drinks and asked us if we needed anything at the right time is seemed.  Very happy with the Megan.  Great job kiddo.

The food was really good.  I am not sure if Bobby Q is a certain style.  I have to research that a bit.  We ordered some little rolls that reminded me of taquitos and some onion thing too.  The onion thing was good.  The little rolls were out of this world.  They came with a BBQ sauce and a chipotle sauce too.  There were six and that was perfect for the three of us.  

We ordered a platter that Megan explained to us.   The platter came with two types of ribs, pulled pork and brisket.  I got the side of veggies.  The others got beans and mac and cheese.  I requested a vinegar base BBQ sauce because that is what I love.  The other guys got a molasses based sauce.  

Food tasting time.  I sampled the brisket first and holly f n sugar jiminy Christmas batman.  That brisket was very good.  I moved on to sample both of the ribs styles we ordered and they were awesome.  Falling off the bone.  The pulled pork was great with my vinegar based sauce too.  The cornbread was really good too. 

The meal was really good.  I am impressed and can not believed I lived close to this place and never tried it.  I like this place and recommend it to anyone.  Please remember food is subjective and likes are different.  We have seen a good boom over the last handful of years in BBQ here.  They are all different styles too.  Texas style, Memphis style and so on.  Like I said give this place a try.

Bring wet naps or ask for some.  You will need them.

Oh wow! This has to be the best barbecue joint I have ever eaten at! The staff is friendly and efficient, and the food is mouth-watering delicious! I have not yet tried one thing on the menu that hasn't hit the spot. I recommend making reservations if you're planning to dine during the weekend because this place is definitely popular with the tourists and locals, but the wait has never been awful. 5/5 stars!

After reading and hearing about Bobby Q I figured I had to find out for myself. 

When it comes to BBQ I find it, like others, hard to get quality BBQ. If I do venture into something new trying to find that diamond in the rough I have 3 staples to sample: Baby Back Ribs, Pulled Pork and Beef Brisket. I also judge beans and some carb. 

I ordered the staples with beans and Mac & Cheese. I wasn't given an option for wet or dry BBQ. I had to ask as the bartender was walking away to make mine dry and put it on the side. 

The meal started with a very moist and greasy corn bread basket. The greasy texture made me use a fork just to get it anywhere close to my mouth. 

Moments later my dry BBQ arrived and the server started walking off when I had to ask for BBQ where I learned there were 3 options: regular, spicy or a third that I don't recall. Nice to know that NOW. Thanks bartender. 

The ribs looked good but pulling apart showed they were not smoked at all. Just a HIGHLY salty rub and grill time. The pull apart can be achieved by many alternative means. 

The pulled pork was sweet, quality pork, but the exact same texture as what I get out of my crockpot. There was no bark, no sign of a smoke ring, nothing to indicate this was BBQ. 

The brisket is the only reason I gave this place 2 stars. They gave me 4 slices of what I would call Prime grade and perfectly smoked. The brisket showing a solid smoke ring and bark and it barely held together which is well beyond many other joints. 

The Mac and Cheese are almost exactly like Kraft Blue Box, so not original at all. The beans however were al dente and smoky sweet. Again, nothing special. 

To top off the epic failure in service, there was no wet nap offered or within sight. Really?? I just wanted outta there and to let others know, order a steak or prime rib to go.
You just can't go wrong here! The food is top notch and the staff are soo friendly and happy! A very well run restaurant!!

I was pleasantly surprised by Bobby Q's.  I've lived in central phoenix for years and I have seen this place hundreds of times (I think I'm always turned off by the location).  Finally tried it out and... it was great :).  The atmosphere/decor are beautiful and the food is excellent.

RIBS!!!  The ribs at Bobby Q's are simply amazing.  Let me start at the beginning.

This restaurant is very inviting.  Open  yet cozy and the patio is nice too.  They bring you hot corn bread when you sit down that is to die for.  They bring butter with it but I think it is already drenched in butter.  Very rich and delicious.  Not your typically dry corn bread by a long shot.

My husband and I ordered the 3 meat combo that comes with 2 sides.  We ordered the short ribs, pulled pork and "Broasted" chicken with Macaroni and Cheese and cole slaw with pecans.  The ribs were are absolutely our favorite.  Best ribs we've ever had.  The pulled pork was equally good and the chicken was great too although we would have liked a piece of white meat.  As someone else stated, they bring their two sauces in warming containers so that the sauce is warm and doesn't cool your meat.  The spicy sauce was our favorite and we used the entire container.  My husband said the mac-n-cheese was the best he had ever had.  It was good, I'm just not an expert on that dish.  I liked the pecans on the cole slaw.

My son was with us and he ordered the cheeseburger off of the kids menu.  The adult menu claimed to have some sort of fantastic burger and he was not happy that we made him get the kids burger.  Until it came.  They do not skimp on the kids!  His burger was huge, hand formed, and absolutely delicious!  He kept going on about how great it was so I had to have a bite.  Grilled deliciousness.

The fresh made donuts they give you on the way out are a nice touch but I was way to full to even comtemplate trying one.  My husband and son said they were great.

Only disappointment-Shoestring Fries.  I like big steak fries.  

We will be back!

Looking for some great food, this is definitely a top 5 place in the valley! From the prices, to the variety of dishes, and ultimately the customer service Bobby Q's is the place to be. When you have family in town, or need a night out with friends, give Bobby Q's a shot. I would recommend the Catfish PoBoy is a long time favorite, and the Ribs are going to be the best you have ever tried! Definitely going to be one of your favorite places to eat!!!
Food is great, i ordered take out so i cant comment on service very much. Have to admit i havent come back, but i do remember the food being worth the price.
Everything on the menu is delicious!! And server Sawyer is awesome and fun! The mac n cheese is a must, but there really isn't anything I wouldn't order there! One of my favorite restaurants by far!

Omg YES!!! Walked in at 6:30pm and they accommodated 30 of us. We sat at different tables but all close! Service was super fast so fast it was all over to quick! We shared their version of the feast so got to sample lots of goodness. The brisket was my favorite and corn bread was amazing. To hard to choose on what to get so get it all! 
I don't know the managers name but she was on it!!!! Thank you for accommodating us!

One of my absolute favorite BBQ places in town.  The smoked brisket falls apart in your mouth and the ribs also fall off the bone. The meat is the main event, but the sides are delectable as well.  The Mac and cheese is perfectly creamy and the cornbread is absolutely delicious. And what could be better than those melt in your mouth freshly fried cinnamon sugar mini donuts after the meal. Keep doing you Bobby Q.

Bobby Q's is hands down the best barbecue restaurant I've ever been to. The meat was cooked perfectly and came right off of the bone. The corn bread was made from scratch. The sides were absolutely delicious. I would 10/10 come back.

This is a great place to have some bbq. The cornbread in the beginning is so amazing. Lots of great options. They even have mini donuts to offer at the end.
Although the group of hostesses stared us down at our table because they were ready for us to leave.
Other than this, it was a great experience.

I love BBQ and this place doesn't dissapoint (except for the mac n cheese, tasted like box mac n cheese). Brisket was super tender, ribs fell off the bone, chicken was solid (we got the hog heaven). Try the Q rolls....and try to grab some extra donuts at the end (they're free, like mints).

Today was the third time I have come here. Each time I noticed other guest who arrived after me get their meals first. I asked today why this was continually happening. I was told if someone else's order was easier they would do them first. Well, when a table of 4 and a table of 2 can get their meal first over my 1 sandwich I will not be back!

I am not really a huge fan of BBQ but for whatever reason that was what we decided to do. 

We went on a Saturday Night and had I known they take reservations we would have made some. You should too! 

Once we did have our table our waited was a adorable 20 something guys who was absolutely attentive. So much so that when the manager strolled through checking on guests I probably raved about the service more than the food. 

I was with three of my sons who are 12, 9, and 3. My little ones had the mac and cheese. It was super excellent. 

My older son had the pulled chicken BBQ sandwich and I had the pulled pork. I ordered the coleslaw for my side since I like it on my BBQ. The pecans in the slaw are a stroke of genius. 

Cornbread is served that is very good while you are waiting for your meal. We also got the QRolls for an appetizer. My boys loved them. I thought they were OK. 

When you leave they give you a little bag of cinnamon donuts that are made in a little machine up front. The idea is cute but the donuts aren't good. They were actually kinda gross!

At the end of the day it is all about the sauce and the sauce was very good! 

I would skip the cornbread (even though it is free). It actually spoiled my appetite. I would skip the much praised QRolls too. The pulled meat sandwiches and slaw were worth a visit if that is what you might be craving!

Took my wife last night for her Birthday to try some place different and we were pleased! Being from the south (Georgia) I feel the "BBQ"...and this was actually very well done. We ordered everything meat -wise we could and would come back and feel comfortable ordering anything on the menu! Service was perfect, waitress did not hover over us and we certainly did not feel rushed. We will be back, thx Bobby Q!

From the moment you park your car and step  out there is magic in the air. It is almost a foreshadowing of things to come inside.  And when you finally do reach your  seat  your mouth will water and your  stomach will rumble because everything you've  heard is true. There food is that good.
  As far as restaurants go, Bobby Q has the look of an old industrial factory with a touch of western thrown in. The interior is a combination of wood, steel, glass, concrete, exposed pipes, ducts, and wires. At first it may  look like everything was thrown randomly together, but everything fits in a modern organic way. The overall  effect is entertaining. Your eye drifts from one area  of the  room to the  next.
  Now  the food. For lunch I had their combination platter consisting of the ribs, brisket, and chicken. And as expected, the food looked good. It smelled good. And it tasted even better.  It was hot. It was  tender. It was tastey. But what suprised me the most was the chicken. It held it's  own against against the ribs and mighty brisket.
  For more info check out their  website. Or better yet, just go.

Truly great food. The cornbread was served hot, it was soft and fell apart, unlike the dense briquettes I've experienced at other restaurants. I ordered Bob's Salad and wasn't very impressed, but that's what I get for ordering a salad at a barbecue place. My mom ordered the sampler from the lunch menu with brisket, chicken and ribs and THAT was amazing. The brisket was perfectly tender and fell apart as soon as I stuck my fork in it. The ribs fell right off the bone, and something about the flavor set it a notch above. We were a little disappointed that we weren't offered dessert, because we had planned on ordering it, but the server (who was still in training) didn't give us an opportunity to ask and disappeared after dropping the check. Everyone there is very friendly, the management is very attentive and the atmosphere is unequaled. I would love to host my next event there!

Server Brodie was super nice and had great recommendations. He was professional and sweet. Food here is awesome and never going to look at BBQ in the Bay Area ever again. He provided excellent service and this place is solid.  The cornbread is bomb and I recommend to do 3 meats combo for St. Louis  and baby back ribs with briskets. Definitely would come back to visit.

A few years back I had seen this cool looking building surrounded by a trees...behind of all things in Phoenix....a scuba dive shop.  I had no idea exactly what it was.  That was until this time around (2018), when we busted out the oracle that is yelp and learned that is "Bobby Q."  A play on BBQ....rightfully so.

Craving MEAT....we opted to pay this location a visit after some afternoon baseball. We parked in the front which was actually the back and enjoyed the greenery.

There was no issues what so ever on getting a table.  Fast and friendly service.  The interior is hard to describe.  I can only say that it is very cozy.  Every employee there was all smiles and working their tails off.  Our server...damn, if I can remember her name and I lost my receipt....she was awesome!  Happy and quick to suggest something tasty when we asked her.

The first thing she confirmed after we ordered was the "Q-Rolls,"  These were delicious pastry style rolls with delicious brisket tucked inside.  They were served with a delicious chipotle sauce.  I was so enamored with them, I forgot to take pictures of anything else....with exception of a delicious coconut mojito, we had ordered prior.

Next up was the "The Whole Hog Heaven,"  the GF and I split this amazing plate of BBQ.  It consisted of Baby Back Ribs....so tender the bones popped right out.  Beef ribs of which I devoured.  Pulled pork and Prime Brisket with mac-n-cheese and pecan coleslaw.  All for $51.

We were drunk on BBQ.  So good was what I can only say is the single greatest BBQ experience I have ever had, we chowed until there was nothing left.  NOTHING!

No meat sweats.....maybe just a little.  It was meat nirvana that was complimented by a visit from taylor.  Not sure exactly what his role in the experience is.  I can only saw he is a BBQ sage who wants to help you transition from the physical to the spiritual side of smoked deliciousness.

So full....no desert was ordered.  No matter....Bobby Q has a marvelous little doughnut machine and you are given a complimentary bag of tasty, fried dough.

Wherever we stay next year....you can bet your bottom dollar, we will pay Bobby "Budda" Q a visit..........

The Coconut mojitos are the best! And I will not go anywhere else for one. The Prime rib is delicious and always cooked the way I request. The staff are friendly and professional. Plenty of parking too. Keep up the good work.

Just had lunch at Bobby Q. We had the sample platter which came with beef brisket, one side, St. Louis ribs and smoked chicken (which we substituted for more beef brisket) and the beef brisket sandwich. Everything was incredibly GOOD!!! our server saw that we were sharing the strawberry lemonade and ignoring the iced tea so brought out another strawberry lemonade free of charge!!! We were served corn bread as we waited for our food which came out super fast. All that and our bill was only $26!! I definitely recommend this place! And if you tell them you found them on yelp, you get 10% off your bill.

Here in Cali, we call it barbecue, or BBQ!
In Arizona, they call it Bobby Q.

Well, maybe not all Arizonians call it that, but a good number of them do. When I reached out to some AZ Yelpers to find out where I can find some serious BBQ in Phoenix, almost every person mentioned Bobby's name. 

Bobby Q is a huge place that looks more like an upscale steakhouse rather than a BBQ joint. The inside is dimly lit and has a fancy, upscale decor. They also have two big bars and a banquet room. 

Right when our party of four was seated we received some delicious house made cornbread with sweet butter. After devouring the yummy cornbread we ordered two appetizers, their Q-Rolls and their Fire Pie Pizza topped with beef brisket. The Q-Rolls were similar to those pigs in a blanket everyone loves as a child.  Instead of mini hot dogs, Bobby stuffs the little flaky pastries with juicy beef brisket. The Q-Rolls were incredible alone but when dipped in the chipotle sauce that comes with the app, it gave the rolls an even more fabulous taste.  The beef brisket pizza was good but not great. They put lots of cheese on the pizza but not enough Bobby Q sauce or beef brisket. 

For dinner I ordered their three meat combo with pulled pork, beef brisket and St. Louis spare ribs. My fiancé ordered the Prime Rib with Chimichuri shrimp dinner. My dinner was big enough to feed at least two people. Every meat was phenomenal. The pulled pork and beef brisket were both juicy, tender and incredibly flavorful. The St. Louis spare ribs were falling-off- the-bone tender and had a nice smoky flavor. My girls Prime Rib was also really good but her shrimp were burnt, rubbery, and had almost no Chimichuri sauce on them, which upset her a little bit. Once your dinners are brought to your table, they also bring out two big containers filled with warm sweet Bobby Q sauce and spicy Bobby Q sauce. Both of these Bobby Q sauces were great but since I'm a huge fan of spicy I preferred the spicy sauce over the sweet one. My dinner came with three sides while my girls came with two. These are the sides we got.
Mac and cheese (we both got this) 
Pecan Coleslaw
Loaded Baked Potato
Roasted Corn
All of these sides were great but my favorite of the bunch was the Mac and Cheese. I don't remember what my other dinner companions ordered but I do remember they all said they loved what they had.
To wash down all this great Bobby Q, we all had huge glasses of their house made sweet tea, which was super sweet and delicious.

Even though everyone was full, we all decided to share a slice of their Sub Zero Banana Cream Pie for dessert. This pie was served ice cold and was more like a piece of banana cheese cake than a regular banana cream pie. This pie had an amazing banana flavor and was topped with lots of caramel sauce. To our surprise, after we finished the pie, our server brought us some home made complimentary cinnamon sugar donuts. These little things were wonderful, I just wish I would have been a little less full so I could have enjoyed them more. 

The service and prices here were both great. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Since it was our first time there he really helped us out by making suggestions and telling us what their most popular dishes are. The prices were very reasonable seeing that you get so much food.  

If your a fan of BBQ then I guarantee you will be a fan of Bobby Q. If you ever visit Phoenix you have to check this place out.

Wow wow wow asked for a 3 rib combo and manager made it happen and that was after he took care of two apps since we were seated 15 mins late.  Totally unnecessary but very appreciated!  Kristin our server was unbelievable and Taylor the manger checked on us 5 times during dinner.  If I could give 10 stars I would.

My husband and I tried this place last weekend and I'm so glad that we did. Their food was great and so was the service. My husband ordered brisket and ribs and he was in heaven after he finished eating. The portions of food are very decent for the price. We will definitely be going back to this place again. If you're a fan of this type of food then I definitely recommend giving this place a try.

This is the best Restaurant in AZ. Every food is to die for. Their baby back ribs are so moist that the meat just falls out in your mouth and best baked potatoes with everything. We took my friend parents for the First Time last night and they said everything they ate was so good that they were so quiet enjoying every bite of their dinner. And the atmosphere was perfect as always. And in the Summer their opening s new Bobby Q's in Mesa much closer to us woo hoo

The food was very good! The service was awesome!! The waiter Dylan took very good care explained everything to us on the menu and was very knowable with everything on the menu. The manager Jason was also awesome he came to our table several times and took very good care of us!!! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!!

Best BBQ I've ever had.  I come here every time I'm in Phoenix. 

Q Rolls (Pulled Pork Taquitos with glorious chipotle dipping sauce)
Cornbread (Unlimited)
Babyback Ribs
All sides
Bobby Q mini doughnuts

Service always friendly and attentive.  Highly recommended.

The food was very good. We had the "Whole Hog" split between four people and the meat was more than enough. The sides are small portions, probably the amount one person would get for meal. I did not like the "St. Louis" ribs they were a bit dry for my taste; however, my brother and dad said they were "ok." The Baby Back ribs were delicious, they fell right off the bone and were moist. The brisket was also much better than the St. Louis ribs. They charge extra to get bread to use with the pulled pork.

For a barbecue restaurant It is unusual to see an almost romantic setting. Bobby Q is unique in that way and several other ways. My wife is a vegetarian and there were not any entree options for her . Just side dishes which she has eaten  in the past .They started us off with there cornbread which was very tasty. I had the two meat entree with brisket of beef and the baby back ribs. My 2 side dishes were   a baked potato and the smoked baked beans which had  pieces of bacon and brisket in it. Very tasty.The brisket was a thick cut with a little barque sauce. Very tender and flavorful. The baby back ribs were so tender, I cut the meat at the bone and there wasn't a piece left on it.This was the first time I ever ate baby back ribs without getting sauce all over my hands and face. The ribs were succulent. We didn't want any desert but our waitress sent us away with these mini donuts which were warm and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar. My wife loves warm baked goods.The experience we had was very good. Bobby Q passes the barbecue test with flying colors.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner last night. It was our first time here, but we wanted to try a new place and after seeing the reviews (and how many reviews) we had to try it. We were both beyond impressed. There wasn't a wait since it was a Monday night, but I could see it being packed on a weekend. 

We ordered the Q Rolls appetizer and each got a cocktail. My boyfriend said his tasted a little weak but overall they were both very tasty and mine was not weak. I had the Peach Tea and I can't recall what his was. The Q Rolls appetizer was absolutely amazing. I can't recommend that enough.

For the entree, we decided to go with Whole Hog Heaven because we had no idea how huge it was. We got baby back ribs, beef ribs, rotisserie chicken, beef brisket, mashed potatoes, mac n' cheese, and shoestring fries. 

Right after we ordered, two pieces of cornbread came out with a side of butter. This was SO delicious. Shortly after, our meal came out. Let me say again how HUGE this was. I tried to pick up a piece of brisket with a fork and it was so tender I couldn't pick up the whole piece at once. I specifically wanted the baby back ribs originally as they're my favorite and they were easily the best I've ever had. Meaty and tender with an amazing taste. I suggest asking for some extra BBQ sauce for the table but the meats are delicious with or without it. 

There was so much extra that we both have enough for lunch and probably even dinner tonight. I'll be eating lunch soon and can't wait! 

They brought out a piece of ice cream cake for my birthday (vanilla ice cream with chocolate cake and a walnut fudge icing). Delicious but I was too stuffed to eat more than a few bites of it. 

After we paid, they brought us a little bag of these mini cinnamon sugar donuts which I tried this morning with breakfast. Very tasty especially considering they were next-day donuts. 

The service was great throughout the whole meal. Unfortunately I forgot the server's name but she was quick and attentive. Needless to say, we were very pleased and can't wait to go back.
Outstanding food and service!  Make sure you make a reservation, otherwise wait time on a Thursday evening was almost 2 hours.

Atmosphere is wonderful, service is great (people are so nice), and the food....the food is delicious. I tried all the meats and they are all so tender and tasty. Decent selection of mixed drinks and beer too-overall, you will not be disappointed.
Boasts excellent BBq. My daughter loved the baby backs but I am a little more difficult to impress. Family friendly which is always a plus in my book.

BBQ is not easy and this place does it right, but it was overpriced. I left full and satisfied, but this is too much of a nightlife atmosphere and they seem to try hard to create that atmosphere, BBQ first, atmosphere second.

really too good to try anywhere else. i think i will go somewhere else and give 'em a try, then the disappointment when they do not come close has sealed the deal for me. i will only do bobby q for bar be que from now on. 
until they slip up or something goes amiss i will give them my loyal patronage. they didn't even mess up a take out order, so any and every is top notch here in my little tasty intake. yummy in my tummy and that's a big tummy!
Really good barbeque we had the Sunday family feast for$39.00 with a couple of extra sides my daughter had chicken fried chicken we loved it all

Another awesome find on Yelp!  The food is amazing. Hard to decide what to eat it all looked so delicious. My wife and I ended up getting the bbq chicken and ribs and sharing. 

The crispy onion rings had a nice chipotle kick to them. To top it off they give you cinnamon sugar donuts complimentary. 

Great atmosphere. Friendly wait staff. Ate outside on the covered patio. Which is great in February when you are from Chicago.

Everything was absolutely delicious. There were a couple items we ordered that were not my favorite...but that's not to say they didn't taste good....just personally wasn't my favorite. The brisket was my favorite hands down. Meat is so tender almost melts in yours mouth. The baby back ribs had the bones falling off them when we were putting them on our plate! The beef ribs were more bone then meat and the meat was a little tougher...still had good flavor and I am glad we tried them but won't be ordering again. For the sides the mac and cheese was thick and my favorite...along with the mashed potatoes and we ordered gravy on the side! Yum! The pecan coleslaw was on point. The ranch beans were my least favorite item, the beans are a tad on the firm side and the sauce wasn't as sweet as I was thinking it would be. Maybe because of the ranch...won't be ordering again but also glad we tried them. The corn bread at the beginning was super tasty and the mini doughnuts at the end reminded me of back home MN state fair doughnuts!!! Overall, loves this place. A couple managers came by to check on how everything taste and I want to say maybe even the owner! I am not sure though I didn't ask him if he was....the waitress and the waiters were all on point. Awesome experience! Will be back!! :)

P.s. almost forget about the sausage! Perfect! The sauce on them was little spicy but just the perfect amount! That was my second favorite next to the brisket!
Wonderful atmosphere and excellent food. Our server, Paloma, was attentive, cheery and helpful with recommendations. Will definitely return!
Love this place!!!! Super yummy and great servers.corn bread is my fave, and the little donuts they give are perfectly sweet.

Nope never again. Make better BBQ myself.  They get two stars because the wait staff was excellent. All the BBQ is sickingly SWEET.  4 different meats on the platter and everything covered in it. Very one note.  Rib meat frll off the bone way over cooked, dry and pretty tasteless.  Brisket would have been good if it wasn't smothered in sugar.  My sangria was weak. They give you fresh made doughnuts as a thank you, nice touch, couldn't eat them doughy.  I don't mind spending over 100 dollars for a good meal, i just felt robbed!

Great place for meat lovers!  My friend ordered the rib combo and I had the 14 oz. medium rib steak with two sides -- Mac & Cheese and Roasted Corn.  The succulent steak hits the spot with every bite!  You can't go wrong.  Bobby-Q used to be known as Bobby McGee.  

Go Bobby-Q!!!

Been by this place for years on the 17, but never stopped in. My girlfriend went for lunch months ago, said it was good. We ended up being in the area, and decided to grab dinner here. 

Building is very cool, like an entrance queue to a ride at Knotts Berry Farm. Dig it. 

For a Wednesday night, this place is super busy, which is a good sign. Even better when I can get a table immediately because I don't care where I sit! 

Being a KC native, I'm very skeptical of BBQ west of the Rockies. I haven't had anything to knock my socks of anywhere in the Southwest. The menu here is huge, which is also a drastic departure from any BBQ place I've ever been to. Prices are definitely on the higher side, too. 

Ordered Q-Rolls to start, based on our server's recommendation, which were actually very good. Brisket wrapped in puff pastry, I could easily eat a manhole sized plate of these things. Awesome. I had the brisket platter. Brisket was good, definitely delivers, but not in my top 10 brisket adventures. With the excellent ranch beans and so-so mac and cheese, it was solid, but not worth $20, as portions are on the smaller side. Others at my table said the same about their ribs and chicken, too. 

Spicy sauce was served in a stainless pitcher, and was very forgettable. Good BBQ sauce is tough to find anywhere (especially since most, even Gates as of late, are just HFCS infused sugar shit these days), but Bobby's sauce was neither spicy or tasty. 

Beer is served in actual pint glasses (which I haven't seen in years), not the 12 oz. "pint" glasses we've all become accustomed to. Nice touch.
