Service was OK. Food came out reasonably quick. Manager checked in with us 2-3 times, which seemed a bit odd, but nice to see that leadership is engaged at this place. Or maybe our server was in the doghouse, unclear!

We basically decided that, while we dug the building, the service was decent and the food was OK, there really isn't any reason to come back since the value isn't there.
Best BBQ in the valley. Smoked pulled pork is delicious. Baby backs to die for. Prim Rib is spectacular. Plus they give you mini donuts!!
They do charge a cover after certain hours. It is a nice and little known place to dance in the West Valley without going to Westgate area

Very good service and very good food. The place is nicely decorated and the whole meal is affordable. The food is very tasty and very well cooked.

As a French, my only regret was on the chicken: although the sauce was very tasty, I believe that the quality of the meat was rather poor. But I guess it is complicated to find a good "poulet fermier" (free range chicken) in the US ;-)

Yet another great dinner at Bobby Q's. We have two favorites to take out of town guests to eat and this is definitely one of them. The brisket is lean, tender and tasty. The roasted corn, excellent. The Q Rolls...yep! Had the fish for the first time and it was above average, so I might stay to the beef and cow. After all, this is a barbecue joint. Also, I won't give away the after dinner treat, but those are AMAZING!!!

Man, I'm from Nebraska and know good smoked meat. This place was amazing.  Ribs were so awesomely tender and smoked that I was in heaven. I ate at the bar and the waiter "joe" was top notch.  What was even more amazing is that my food literally came within 5 minutes.  Faster than McDonalds :-). Bobby Q knows how to BBQ!!

This place is really really good, but a little expensive as far as barbecue goes which is why I'm giving a 4 star as opposed to a 5 star. The service is TOP NOTCH too. Seriously- the service is amazing and I've never had a bad waiter or waitress and they are always super attentive. 

I haven't ever gotten anything I didn't like either.. thinking about their ribs is making me want some right now! The house made complementary donuts at the end of the meal are a really nice touch!!!

We drive by Bobby Q's all the time, and comment how so and so said it's good - we should try it. Well, we finally did.  Long time Phoenicians will remember this as the old Bobby McGees with costumed, singing waiters.

It's a rustic-looking, galavanized tin building with lots of tangled plants growing around it under what is one of the last stands of eucalyptus trees in the valley; it's cool - makes you feel like you are some place else.

I was pleasantly surprised when we walked in.  I didn't know what to expect, and the decor is more elegant than I would have expected, yet with shabby chic touches.  Some tables have chairs on one side and banquettes on the other - something different.  It's very pretty.

The menu is pretty standard for a barbeque place.  I went straight for the baby backs (half-rack, $16.00), my favorite.  Hubs ordered two meats ($17, I think) pulled pork and beef brisket.  Our waitress was nice, but a little unpolished, very valley-girl, yet helpful and attentive.  She plopped a basket with two round pieces of cornbread and whipped butter on our table - delish cornbread.  Beer comes with a frozen glass - a nice touch. 

He ordered a wedge salad - generous helping of chunky blue cheese over ice berg lettuce with bacon and onion strings.  

Sides are standard - shoestring fries that aren't really shoestring, beans, mac and cheese, pecan coleslaw that we almost tried.  We both got the fries and beans. Beans have a little bit of meat in them, and a bit of zip, but are nothing outstanding.

The ribs, however, were superb.  I put my fork in between rib one and two and the first bone basically fell on to my plate.  I had to nibble the meat off only a couple of the bones - other than that it melted off the bone.  The flavor was perfect - the meat flavor comes through the not too sweet, not too tart, smoky sauce.  

Hubs thoroughly enjoyed his pork and beef as well.  The sides were so, so - we will try different ones next time.

We were too full for desert, but received two little - fritters or donuts (couldn't understand the valley-speak) in a paper bag to go.  Fished them out and ate them - little bits of heaven right there.

We will definitely be back for ribs.  It's a very pleasant, dressy casual restaurant and, a plus, it's on the west side!

Amazing BBQ! I got the lunch platter of St. Louis ribs amazing. Pork- the softest most tenderest pork, chicken BBQ was ok, still good but lower on the list. The QLina pork burger was sooo tender and juicy.  The fries were thin , crunchy, and and flavorful 5 stars!

Amazing food. Best BBQ we've had. The meat falls off the bones. The butter corn and the Mac and cheese are legendary. Even their beer is perfect with the BBQ. Go for amber ale. Best part is Ashlyn, best waitress. She really reads our minds and made our experience so much better! Ask for Ashlyn if you are here!

I've been to Bobby Q's 4 times now and always have gone at Happy Hour. Why? Because it has a nice little menu. Today, two of us ate 3 appetizers and the bill was $14.

This is my go-to spot for West Phoenix (I live in Chandler). Depending on your goal Bobby Q's has it - nice bar, nice restaurant, and nice club on the side.

Club: I've gone to the club twice now on Friday (not sure the hours). Earlier in the night it is rather interesting (in a good way). The way that I describe it as - someone brought in their iPod and put it on shuffle. They play country, hip-hop, rap, alternative, oldies, rock, and disco all in one sitting. This makes for an interesting dynamic as many people who want to dance to Toby Keith's "I love this bar" probably don't want to dance to the follow-up song of Soulja Boy's "Kiss me through the phone."

Except me of course - I stay and dance to whatever is playing.

With that said, the crowd is generally older. I was boogying down with a lady that was 70+ and having a ball. Later in the night (read: after 10pm) the crowd changes to an urban crowd and has a crowd that is complimentary to that music.

Defiantly worth the hype! For drinks I ordered the sangria and my Bf got the two IPA's on draft.  My sangria was good came in a glass mason jar.  My boyfriend enjoyed both IPA's. 

Appetizer we ordered the Q ROLLS tasty deep fried brisket with a Bbq dipping sauce and spicy dipping sauce as well-I enjoyed the bbq as it was a little sweet how I like it!

Main course we split the prime rib & bbq chicken combo.  Combo comes with a potato and two sides.  We ordered the MAC AND CHEESE and OH MY GOD it was prob the best Mac and cheese I've had in a while---five stars alone!!!!. The other side was the veggies...eh wasn't a fan . The veggies they chose were onions? Squash and peppers, to me that just wasn't what I was expecting- I had in mind broccoli or cauliflower? Seemed like an odd choice 

For  dessert we ordered the mud pie to go !

As a bonus they give you some homemade donuts for the road ( I was too stuffed but my bf said they were amazing)

Overall good pick, good music, and good service! Will be back for sure!

Jesus. I had heard about this place and seen it while driving on the i17. I finally stopped in and my god.... 

I got the bbq pulled pork sandwich with a side of grilled vegetables. Delicious. Just pure delicious. I got to sample the macaroni, and I must say it does indeed live up to the hype... The creamy, cheesy goodness doesn't disappoint. Even the cornbread with butter was delicious and its complimentary!!

To wash it down I ordered the bobby q amber ale, and it was more than up to the task to compliment my meal. 

If you're on the fence, like bbq, or just want a nice atmosphere do yourself a favor and stop by Bobby Q's. You're going to like what you ate. I guarantee it.

I had a great experience for my first time at Bobby Q. The vibe seemed family-friendly but still quite lively. It's a spacious restaurant with plenty of room for large parties and there's also a full bar so you can order from their drink menu or have them make whatever you want. 

Our table ordered baby back and St. Louis ribs, brisket and sausage. Entrees come with sides so we got a few of them. The sides were ok, nothing special. The BBQ was pretty good. The brisket was almost too soft though, crumbling into smaller pieces as we picked at it. But it tasted good, smokey and flavorful. My favorite, surprisingly, was the sausage. And it was perfect with their tangy Carolina BBQ sauce. We also ordered appetizers, spinach dip and these brisket-filled egg rolls. Spinach dip was good that came with really garlicky garlic breads, so that was good. And the brisket rolls are their most popular appetizer for a reason. 

The food was good but it was really the service that impressed me. Even with how busy they seemed the food came out very fast. Our server, Julie, took the time to explain things to us and was very attentive and patient. The icing on the cake is that they bring out donuts for dessert! Warm, sugared donuts. So good and that was such a nice surprise. Good eats that was reasonably priced and we were treated very well. I'm coming back for sure.

Bobby Q is a great choice for dining in Phoenix...great all around menu and great atmosphere...super busy place so it's not a bad idea to get reservations...we waited at the bar and had drinks on a Friday night as it was super packed...the bag of doughnuts they give you on the way out is a nice touch...
Best ribs in town!  Family restaurant and also romantic.  Fun bar too.  Great place for a special occasion.

First time in Phoenix and saw this place on Yelp.  Didn't really think AZ was known for bbq but decided to give this place a whirl. The bbq was surprisingly yummy.  I had the baby backs and spicy sausage. The bbq wasn't drenched in sauce which is how I like it. Huge portions and very reasonable prices. Their cinnamon sugar donuts at the end of the meal are so addicting!  Friendly staff as well with lots of seating.

Every time we come to Arizona we have to make a visit to Bobby Q's. Food is always so good. We made reservation and were seated a couple minutes after our reservation time. Our waitress was awesome and we got our food pretty fast considering it was pretty busy.

While I haven't written a ton of reviews on here I reserve five stars for an establishment that is truly outstanding, and Bobby Q fits that bill.  When an appetizer alone is so delicious that I would (and have) drive the 30 minutes from my house to get them speaks volumes.  

Q-ROLLS!  Q-rolls are ridiculously delicious by themselves but when you add the sauce that it comes with its another level.  I have sincerely come here just to get two orders of these because they are that good.  They have ribs for every type of person.  I'm a fall off the bone rib guy but people I've dined with there are not, so Ive tried various types of ribs and each one were fantastic even though the baby backs were my favorite. 

The wait staff have always been top notch and stellar with their recommendations and attention.  My ONLY complaint is that they are so far away but that isn't their fault.  I beg of you Bobby of the Q open another location!  Regardless of distance Its an amazing restaurant that I would find a way to visit even if it was on the moon.

went to bbq's today and it was great, service was on point, atmosphere was great. our waitress was nice a very good, the only reason why I didn't give a 5 star is because the ribs was a little to salty to my taste, maybe is the dry rub but the ribs were very soft and tender. bbq jumbo potato was excellent.  I will go back again to try other items.
Some of the best ribs I've ever had have come from here. Their sides are awesome too, especially if your a fan of macaroni and cheese.

First time eating here. We split the three meat with the two of us and it had great flavors. The bbq was so good  I am glad we stopped in. Our sides were the Mac n cheese and pecan Cole slaw - we were intimidated by the pecans but I barely even tasted it. Great mix!
This may be some of the most mouth watering, deliciously smoked meat and chicken I've ever eaten. Our waiter Wes was the Best!

Unbelievable.  Our 1st time at Bobby Q's, the last night of vacation and we couldn't have been more impressed. 
Our waitress (Christen?) started things off right with her friendly and warm style.  When my date wanted to know which sides were best, Christen brought out huge samples of the sides we were interested in.  Our glasses were never empty and our table was consistently bussed.  We chose the smoked wings for an appetizer and since we come from the "wingland" (near Buffalo, NY) we were not disappointed.  Big, meaty wings that were slathered in sauce and cooked perfectly.  We opted for small Caesar salads and were surprised.  The romaine was cold and crisp and the dressing was as good as any at many a high-end restaurant we've been to. Cornbread.  Damn, that cornbread was GREAT.  Then entrees:  I had the 3 meats: sausage, brisket and chicken.  Each was perfect.  Smoky, tangy and tender.  The brisket may just be the best I've had.  My date had the prime brisket and raved about it.  I was only offered the tiniest of samples from her but was amazed - that WAS the best brisket... ever.  At the end of the meal we remarked how terrific everything was (especially the cornbread) and asked for a box to take our remaining pieces to-go.  We were surprised when Christen brought out a box with an additional 6 pieces.  I had ordered the Sub Zero banana cream square to-go.  I was asked if it was ok for it to come out a little later, as the manager invited us back to the kitchen to look around and specifically to see the industrial-sized smokers.  That was an incredibly gracious gesture.  I even got some meat smokin' secrets out of him!  Again - a warm, friendly, gracious guy with a genuine smile and offered a feeling of being "family".  By the time we got back to the table my huge desert to-go was ready and we were fat and happy.  Christen ended our night with a warm (and strong) handshake and best wishes for safe travels, home.

No need to go into full details but let's say I had the mutha f&$&in best FOOD COMA lol.  The service is incredible and the food again... Just keep in mind FOOD..... COMA.  

Oh yeah a very very good recommendation is to get RESERVATIONS before you go.  You feel like VIP when everyone just waits outside hoping to get a seat.


Thank you BOBBY Q's

Awesome service from the waitress. Drinks just kept coming with out having to notify them. Awesome hot food, I ordered the catfish with mac n cheese with a loaded baked potato. The fish was nicely battered and tasted AWESOME!

Favorite BBQ place to go! 
 I had the lunch platter, which was St. Louis ribs, BBQ chicken, and beef brisket. Oh my lord, was it so heavenly good. As good as it looked. The brisket was my favorite, so tender and flavorful. All the meat just falls off the bone, so soft and dee-licious!
Can't forget to mention their mac n' cheese, so creamy and cheesy, best mac n'cheese in the world! I might be reaching, but I promise you it was oh so good! Also we loved the cornbread. Cute little patties is how they come out, and we can't tell you how those little donuts they serve after each meal, how tasty those little things are, a little sweet and crunchy on the outside, soft and doughy on the inside. We loved this place so much, we came back the next day for dinner, seriously! I'm pretty sure you'll love it too.

I first walked into this restaurant very unaware of its culture and cuisine. It was the closest restaurant to me when I was working as an intern a couple of years ago and so my roommate and I went one Sunday afternoon. We were quite surprised to come across this quite elegantly themed restaurant amidst a not-so-great neighborhood. The interior of the restaurant has a darker, vintage vibe to it and the outside patio is beautifully lit and adorned with a waterfall and misters for those infamous Phoenix summer days. The food experience was the fun part. We opted to for the Whole Hog which is a selection of three different meats of your choosing and three sides. We had the pulled pork,  the sausage, and the brisket. By far, the sausage there is the best sausage I've ever had. Might I add, prior to them serving our main dish, they bring out complementary corn bread that is second to none. I recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting to impress on a date or any company wanting to host a business meeting.

Look for the sign!
Found myself in Phoenix for a weekend vacation. The main purpose was to check out the grand canyon and catch a baseball game but I ended up finding one of the best BBQ joints in the country. After trying Memphis, Carolinas and Texas BBQ...the last place i expected to find great BBQ food would be in the desert. I noticed the big sign while driving down the highway and decided to go in. Its an upscale kind of atmosphere...well compared to what you find in Texas. Nice patio for dining when its not to hot. We got the 4 meat platter...and it was some of the best BBQ I have ever come across. I only wish they had one in Jersey. The have some great appetizers and mixed drinks in pineapples as well. Good wait staff, great mac n cheese too!! TRY IT

so we were from LA and somehow suddenly found the appetite for some good BBQ. While Phoenix is not known for its BBQ, we tried it out anyways, knowing that we're all hungry and could carve out any meat given in our direction.

we were dead wrong! we were expecting it to be another overrated and overpriced Lucille's BBQ down in California but oh my, we found a gem in Phoenix. We ordered the three meat platter and oh boy, it was good. me and my gf shared the platter, we got the st louis ribs, the brisket and the pork. the ribs were great, it falls off the bone and it's so juicy and tender. one of the best ribs i ever tasted, period. the brisket were unbelievable. smoked right, you'll taste every flavor of it. salty, meaty, and juicy, we were all happy just to be there at that time.

if you visit phoenix, make sure to visit BOBBY Q as it will never let you down!
The thing I love most about BobbyQ is their service! The staff is very friendly and attentive! Their ribs are honesty the best around Phoenix!

LOVE this place. Free cornbread, LOVE. Free mini-donuts at the end of your meal, LOVE. 10% off thanks to yelp, LOVE! My friends and I always get the Whole Hog Heaven. It's the most bang for you buck for sure and then some! I've tried all sorts of different combinations and would recommend everything EXCEPT the chicken, it was a little too dry for me. And ALL the sides I've tried are delicious: corn, mashed potatoes, shoe string fries, mac n' cheese...perfect! The Q rolls appetizer are a must-get appetizer with the Chipotle sauce! Service is always great too! 

The Q Lounge next door seems like it would be a fun place to go post meal as well. We didn't go but it looked like it was bumpin' and they played some good music!

I'm sure it's been said nearly a thousand times before but this may very well be the best bbq in AZ. I'm a native Texan and used to eating some good Texas bbq but this is something to write home about. Jake our waiter states that they smoke their meats for 18 hours. The food tasted every bit like they did. I could really taste the smoke flavor with the sausage which they filleted open to soak up the flavor. I can tell you that it tastes like they use pecan and mesquite wood for smoking. I've passed this place thousands of times and smelled the fresh wood smoking and my only regret is not coming here any sooner. If you're bringing a group make sure to try the whole hog heaven. It's more than enough food for three people. The food was every bit worth the price!

We are visiting for Denver and came here from the Yelp reviews. We both had the pulled pork and it was absolutely delicious. The smoked meats were cooked perfectly and sides we filling. This was a great find and we most definitely recommend this restaurant. Oh, by the way the donuts at the end.... OMG!

"I LIKE PIG BUTTS and I cannot lie"

When visiting a new city, I try to eat things we don't have in Hawaii. Good BBQ is one of them so I'm no expert, but this place was so finger-licking-I'm-on-vacay-screw-my-diet good! Since we only had one shot to try everything, we tried the sampler:

WHOLE HOG HEAVEN $48
2 choices of ribs (we got baby back and St. Louis, I would get double baby back next time)
2 choices of meat (we got pulled pork and brisket, totally would get that again)
3 sides (we got roasted corn, beans, grilled veggies, but the shoestring fries were also very good)

KIDS MENU too! The kids had the chicken strips (which is like the breaded processed kind you get in the freezer), which they absolutely enjoyed because it is familiar to them. The key to a good kids menu is to offer things kids like (not mini versions of the adult food), and they do very well here. (We also ordered the appetizer chicken tenders, which is more like real chicken, real batter and they didn't like that as much.)

BBQ sauce- when asked if we wanted extra sauce, (regular or spicy?) I asked for both. I thought they'd bring little containers but hallelujah they thought of everything-we got little coffee pots of sauce brought to the table. Try the meat first before you drown it with sauce because it really needs no sauce! But I love sauce. I dipped the fries in it, the corn in it, the beans in it, I love good sauce. We (or I) emptied both pots of sauce, but TRY THE SPICY sauce! It's not that spicy and was delicious!

Service was great, and the little things like complimentary cornbread cakes and cute freshly made on the spot "THANK Q" cinnamon sugar donuts was a nice treat! 
Highly recommend!
This place has some of the best BBQ I have ever eaten! I had the baby back ribs! I can't wait to come back here next time I'm in town.

My boyfriend and I were going to Bobby Q's to enjoy ourselves for his friend's birthday but the night turned out horrible.

First off, we paid for a table and they made us wait until 10:45pm to even get our table when they told us to be there by 10PM, then one of their waitresses charged us for a water (which was NOT a water bottle) which are free from as far as i know and we gave her a 20 dollar bill and she never came back to give us the change. Then the security gaurd kicked us out for being "too intoxicated" we hadn't even had a drink yet! We were 100% sober because we hadn't even gotten to our table yet!!! He just randomly picked us out of the crowd and told us to leave saying my eyes were closed and it looked like i was falling asleep! How can i fall asleep while dancing? and how can i make eye contact with you if i'm sleeping? I couldn't believe it!! I asked to speak to the manager and then the security gaurd tried to say he was the manager when he clearly was an 18 year old kid trying to talk down to me. I will never go back to that club again. It was by far the worst experience i've ever had at a night life club and i do NOT reccommend ANYONE to go there! People don't waste your money here!

Good food. I had the ribeye, it was delicious. The mac 'n cheese was very good, not mushy at all: just right. The corn was good, too good to be healthy (i.e. sweet and buttery).

My experience with the service was more of a mixed bag. I was waiting 10 mins before the waiter came. It was a minor thing but the manager put the appetizer on the house. Also I had ordered my steak medium-rare but the steak was closer to medium-well (the difference is the blood, medium-rare is a little bloody, medium is not). I mentioned it to the waiter and the manager put the steak on the house. Honestly, the steak was so good I did't care.

I would go again. 5 stars for the food, 4 stars for the service, and an extra star for effort.

The food is AMAZING!! I had the rotisserie chicken and bites of my husband brisket and ribs. The brisket is my favorite for sure! The mac and cheese is amazing and so is the roasted corn!! I gave a 4 star instead of a 5 because the services wasn't great, they were busy which I understand but the food is so good that I am sure they are busy all the time so the server should be used to it. The server was really friendly but we had to ask other servers walking by for things because our server wasn't coming back to check on us, we kept seeing him but he didn't stop. Again the food is amazing and I will definitely eat there again and recommend it to my friends.
Booby Q's baby back ribs are always prefect, very tender and the favor is the best! The ambiance is quite nice as well. The staff are always attentive and friendly!
The beef brisket is to die for . I had the Texas Beef Ribs and it was the best I have ever had and I eat a lot of BBQ ! I would def recommend all my family and friends .

Here's my two cents...

We had an outstanding meal of baby back ribs and a pulled pork sandwich. I cheated and grabbed a bag of the "Thank Q" donuts on the way in instead of at the end because as they say, "life is short...eat dessert first."

I want to go back but I live in another state. Next time!

Best brisket ever! I've been here a few times and it never leaves me with feelings of disappointment! I love the q-rolls and the warm corn bread. If you are a party of 4 get the whole hog heaven! Delicious.
Spectacular.  Burger, Mac n chz, cornbread, fries, brisket, and free fresh mini donuts for dessert.  One of my favorites in Phoenix!

Holy Cow! How many times have you been for BBQ where the quality of the sides has been totally forgotten, not here! Seriously, best mashed potatoes I've ever had. Split the whole hog, 2 1/2 slabs of ribs, 2 piles of meat, 3 sides. Amazing, a bit past tender (fine by me) but perfect rub and sauces. Mac n cheese was crazy good. Staff and service was very friendly, restaurant was done very well, enough southern comfort without the hee haw cheese, no wonder it was still packed at 8:30 with people still waiting to be seated

After all the glorious reviews this restaurant has, I had to check it out. I ordered the Saint Louis ribs, pulled pork and brisket. My sides were the beans and coleslaw.
The service was good, and the donuts at the end were good, the slaw wasn't bad either.
The rest of it was bad to terrible, the cornbread came out and it was mush, I couldn't pick it up and eat it, it fell apart in my hands.
 I thought what ever, the meat should be good. 
The main course came out, the exact same way, light brown clumps of mush, the brisket fell into little pieces and needed to be put in to a sandwich to be eaten. The pulled pork had very little taste. Next the ribs, the meat fell of the bones, a mushy mess, I had to eat them with a fork, because it was impossible to pick up a rib bone. I  only ate as much as I needed to feel not hungry,which was less than half. I had to eat the sides just because it was solid food. I will never go back there again, And considering the other complaints of  'mushy meat "  on here  this wasn't a fluke, I felt I had to add to it. Total waste of money.

I came here for dinner with my family the other night and we had a nice time. I would definitely recommend making a reservation because they get SO busy especially on weekend nights. 

It is for sure likely going to be crowded and on the loud side, but it is a super fun environment. The restaurant is really big and it has a great Western theme. 

We were seated pretty quickly with our reservation. It definitely took awhile for us to be greeted and to get our first round of drinks. Our server mentioned that the bartender was really behind so that it might take awhile for our drinks. I felt bad for the bartender and it seemed like they should have had another bartender helping. They had also run out of many of their gins because it was the end of the month, but I felt like that shouldn't be an issue. However, their cocktails were tasty. 

Regardless, our server was super nice and friendly. She was very good and attentive in the beginning and then towards the end it was difficult to track her down for awhile. I think she had a really big party that she was taking care of. 

For starters, we started off with the recommended Q-rolls stuffed with brisket and served with chipotle sauce. These were delicious! They were crispy, not oily, and the brisket inside was tender and flavorful. 

For my entree, I got the fried chicken, with a baked potato and mac n'cheese. The fried chicken was very good--crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The baked potato was good--not overly oily. The mac n' cheese was very good too, but reminded me a lot of stouffer's mac n' cheese, which isn't a bad thing--just reminded me of it. The prime rib that I tasted was also very good--tender and flavorful.

The prices were fair.

Overall, really fun and casual ambience, good food, fair prices and decent service.

My fiance and I were SPEECHLESS. It was nothing short of PERFECTION. We were greeted by the friendliest staff, the food was beyonddd amazing. Everythibg is made from scratch so if you don't finish your food, expect to get the best quality left overs for the day after. We got the combo deal with two one half ribs two one half meats and three choices of sides. This is a one of a kind bbq place worthy of the travel and food networks. I'll be back soon.

We saw this place on Yelp while visiting from Washington state! IM SO GLAD WE CAME!  Not only was the food AMAZING, but Travis our water was friendly and knowledgeable!! Highly recommend the Q rolls!!

Amazing food and service.  Stacy was our server and the best server I've had in a long time (I travel and eat out quite a lot). She guided us through the menu and was extremenly knowledgeable and friendly. To be honest, I had low expectations for a BBQ place but Stacy wowed us. I ordered the prime rib and baby back ribs for myself since I couldn't decide. It was the best decision I made.  The special sauce was delicious and Stacy gave a little bit of their original and spicy sauce. Everyone at the table was extremenly happy with dinner. We will definitely go there again if we come back to Phoenix!

It's so good it's not right!!! Unbelievable!!! We had the whole hog, best BBQ I've had in AZ yet. Meat fell off the bone, the pork was tender and perfect, the brisket was tender and perfect too. The Mac-n-cheese was unreal and the ranch beans were spot on. For dessert we had the banana cream pie...ridiculously amazing!!! I'm glad I live 42 minutes away from Bobby Q because I would pack on the lbs for sure. If you want great BBQ, excellent service, and a restaurant with unique character Bobby Q is a no brainer.

Great Bque in Phoenix! My friend and I stopped in Sedona for barbecue ribs and it was a total disappointment! So we were a bit hesitant on going to Bobby Q for dinner. The service was great! The ribs were just on point! Great food and ambience! Loved the pineapple splash!

In Arizona some b&)tchen BBQ!!!! Saw the place on the fwy and jumped off to find the place...
Place if huge! If u mis this place please get ur eyes checked! Lol 
First impression was people leaving and telling us how good it was.. Two different parties! Man a place that makes people do that! 
We all ordered the sampler platter .. Three choices of meet and one side .. I ordered ribs, brisket and pulled pork..pulled pork cooks for 12+hrs .. Was good just a little to mushy for me.. Brisket was over the top for me! YUMMY!! Now the ribs.. I have traveled all over for ribs and this is hands down my favorite! My side was Mac and cheese as a recommendation and I have only had one better than this! I heard people taking about the potatoes behind us and how good they were ...  Oh yes did I forget to mention the corn bread! 
Look don't hesitate to come here! Your palette and ur stomach will love it!

Service: We definitely had great service. Prompt attention from our server Phil and the manager stopped by. 

Decor: Country shabby clean. Dark woods, colors and Distressed textures; high ceilings made the place feel open and large.

Food and drink: Full bar; mediocre strawberry daiquiri & good virgin strawberry lemonade. The corn had great flavor along with the corn bread patties. Grilled chicken and ribs had decent flavor, a little smokey, very little char. .. The ribs were very tender but the chicken was a tad dry. Great smoked sausage and shoestring fries. The bbq sauce was tasty, not overly sweet and not to runny. Cinnamon donuts are a nice touch at the end of the meal.

Overall I would give it 3.5. It wasn't bad,  it just wasn't outstanding.

My first experience here was half good, half bad, and we left a comment card to reflect that.  The response I received was customer service at it's best.  The proprietor sent me a letter of apology along with a small gift card to replace the one item we had that wasn't terrific.  
I've now been going back for 3 years on a regular basis thanks to his response and attention to service.  EVERY time since the first has been exceptional.  From the food to the service to the beer - for singles, couples, and families - this place has the menu to make you drool.  It has even become my visiting friends "must eat at" restaurant in Phoenix.  
Favorite items so far are the juicy steaks or baby back ribs, and the melt in your mouth sweet cornbread.  YUMMMMMMMMMM
Amazing BBQ. Brisket is melt-in-your-mouth. Service is great too. Thanks Serena for taking care or us!
Omg, best eating in Phoenix, AZ, pay a little more than usual for a plate however it will be well worth your money, for taste and portions.
Went here last week for a business lunch. Corn bread I'd fantastic. I had heard brisket sandwich and fries. All very good and I would recommend it.

My husband who doesn't like tomato saucy BBQ meat says it was the best BBQ meal ever because sauce wasn't sweet as some others he tried. Mac & cheese was way too creamy for my taste but corn side was good w/ smokey flavor. Their beef brisket is so tender, baby back rib falls off the bone so good. beef rib was also good but after trying different sides all of us ordered, if I ever come back to Phoenix, I will surely come back and order a baby back rib w/ mashed potatoes and roasted veggies with extra bbq sauce to dip the meat in. Excellent bbq!

So I previously posted about hating this place. That day I was hangry and wanted some brisket but ended up at the club and not the restaurant. I recently went back and the food was amazing! I had the Q rolls which were out of this world and my entree was the 12oz sirloin. The steak was wonderful and the sides were delicious. I had the Mac and cheese and ranch beans. Great restaurant!

Until Bobby Q's entered my life i wasnt a fan of BBQ anything! made me kinda sad to see so many people enjoying some messy ribs but anyways I i digress...This place has changed my life for the better!. Their St. Louis ribs are fall off the bone AMAZING! and their Mac n Cheese is a must have! I have to admit this place has made me a bit of a ribs snob, if something doesnt come close to Bobby Q's i automatically right that place off.

A short review but you get the gist of it...

Winner winner bbq dinner.  Been here several times.  Everything has been pretty spot on.  Only thing I would pass on is the brisket pizza (and I love pizza) it's kinda dry and unnecessary.  Ribs, brisket, mac n cheese, burger, sausage, brisket, corn muffins are all delicious.  Never been disappointed here

Recently moved to Phoenix so I wanted to try some local BBQ.  I decided to get take out from Bobby Q based solely on its reviews.  From the time I called to place my order to picking my food up, the staff was very friendly and welcoming!  They really seemed to care that my order was accurate and that I had everything I needed before leaving.  

The food was great!  I ordered a St. Louis rib rack with Mac n Cheese and Potato salad as sides.  They also gave me a couple pieces of corn bread with my order.  So not only was the food great, but the value for what you get is top notch as well.  I can't wait to come here again!

Verdict:  HIGHLY RECOMMEND - they do everything well.  If you're on the fence, try it.  You won't be sorry.

We picked Bobby Q's based on other Yelp reviewers. We were in town for the Mom Made Market in Scottsdale and wanted to take my husband out for some BBQ for his bday. We had reservations for 7:30 but came earlier and they sat us right away. Can't remember our waitress's name but she was so sweet and attentive. You get free cornbread with your order and they kept refilling it for us...my kids loved it! We got the spinach artichoke queso to start and it was amazing!!! Slightly spicy but not overly. Too spicy for my 7 year old but he's a wimp. My 8 year old loved it. My husband got the brisket sandwich with potato salad as his side. He says what makes a good BBQ place is how good their beef brisket is and their potato salad. (He's Texas born). He said both got 2 thumbs way up. They offer 2 sauces....spicy and original. The original was really sweet and the spicy not very but really good. I'd recommend that one. I got Bobby's salad and it had roasted chicken, goat cheese, apple, walnuts, cranberries, celery and came with a Dijon vingerette. It was so huge and so good. I hate when salads don't have very much "stuff" in them. Every bite was more than lettuce. It was so big and I couldn't finish it and even down to my last bite, plenty of chicken, cranberries and cheese. Both my kids got the kids BBQ sandwich with shoestring fries. I can't believe their meals were kids sized! Sandwiches had tons of chicken and sauce and a huge mound of fries. AND you get free warm cinnamon donuts at the end of your meal!!!!! If we are ever back in the Phoenix area, we'd definitely come again. Oh and the patio (where we ate) had lights stringed everywhere and a cool fountain. Great vibe out there. Perfect way to celebrate my babe's birthday.
I love Bobby Qs, their food is pooping amd always on point. Good atmosphere and clean. They nice.

Bobby Q is an excellent BBQ restaurant in Phoenix.  The portions are large and the food is tasty.  

We recently went and shared a rack of St Louis ribs, brisket, corn bread, mac and cheese, a smokehouse burger and fries.

The ribs and brisket were good.  The mac and cheese was creamy and delicious.  The corn bread was soft and fresh.  The fries were the perfect size.  But the best of the best was the smoke house burger.  It was a huge patty on an awesome toasted bun.  It came with shoestring onion stack, bbq sauce, and cheese.  Easily a top 5 burger in the valley.  

I recommend Bobby Qs to any bbq fan or burger fan.  Highly recommend the smokehouse burger.

Shut the front door, and sit down for the best baby back ribs you've ever sunk your teeth into. If you are in or from Phoenix, you are in BBQ luck. 

Take yourself to "Whole Hog Heaven." It says you could enjoy this meal on your own; unless you plan to fast for two to three days share with a friend. Double down on some baby back ribs, enjoy some mac n'cheese, and save room for some complimentary fresh fried doughnuts for dessert (Or like me force them down with a BBQ covered grin.) Lot's of people rave about the Q-Rolls, however that was probably the only moot point for me. I'd recommend you save room for the meats.

By no means is a five star review for this place original, but I can only confirm that this place is still doing what everyone is talking about. Smoking some of the most delicious meats I've ever tasted.

While reading the free Glendale paper at a much-suckier restaurant I scoped a coupon for Bobby Q-$30 for two dinners, appetizer and dessert.  I figured what the heck, I've heard a lot of good things about this place, though I've been burned before it doesn't make me fear that fire :)  So me and a buddy went for some Q this past weekend.
This place is actually a lot hipper and nicer than the...umm....kinda crap neighborhood would make you think it would be...the entrance is not really well marked, we thought they were closed because we couldn't get in!!  We could be dumb though...
The brisket rolls were deep fried goodness, nothing wrong with that.  Chicken/rib combo was solid very moist, though I would have appreciated more smoke flavor.  And the spare ribs had that gristly-mini-bones-fatty-section action (though not unusual for untrimmed spare ribs)  The sauce and the sides (mashed potato and mac-n-cheese) were good and the portions are absolutely ENORMOUS!  I'm still eating their Q!!

This was the last stop of a girls weekend before we all headed back home. Travis our waiter, was great at service and answering all our questions. The food was excellent. I will bring my family here when we return. I ordered the pork ribs, which were tender and not too much sauce on them. Our table opted to try all three sauces, all were good, but my personal favorite was the spicy one. The fries were a little too salty for my liking, which was probably a good thing since I didn't stuff myself with them. Unbeknownst to us, the meal ended with hot mini donuts rolled in cinnamon and sugar, all packed in to-go bags.

Worst customer service this evening!! Which was none. We sat at our table for 10 minutes with no server coming to our table. After a table behind us had people seated and within 2 minutes they had a server take their drink orders. We got up and left. We won't be returning.

i really enjoy this restuarant. but does anyone else miss bobby mcgees and its maze-like interior filled with would-be actors who honed their craft as servers? and there's nothing like scooping salad out of an oversized bathtub. that's all i'm saying.

Really liked this place.great atmosphere and fantastic service. I had the trio of baby back ribs, brisket and pulled pork. Topped it off with a side of Mac n cheese and pecan Cole slaw. Some of the best I've ever had.
Dinner was very exquisite, the wait was about 20 minutes. The cornbread was amazing and the meat was very tender. Lots of beer choices

WOW, should I say more? This was our first time here. My Son has Gluten allergies and was worried for what to order for him. Well, they have a full menu of GF items. The food was amazing. Service couldn't be better. Our server Jason had one ask: we had to let him know if anything about our food that we didn't like. We loved it all. On top of that Mgr stopped by to welcome us there since that was our first time. I can't wait to go back. You will love it. Give it a try.

Review for first time going to Bobby Qs - lunch on a Sunday. Ordered the pulled pork with a side of mac. Food was very tastey. The mac and cheese was made in house. It's all about the cheese sauce and there's was very rich without being greasey. The pulled pork was tender and not drown in sauce. I thought the serving would be a little larger a serving. The mac did not fill the bowl and the bun (not a roll) the pulled pork was served on was about the size of a McDonalds cheeseburger roll. It was piled pretty high, but it was 20% smaller than I pictured for the price. I ordered two brews service ice cold in a frosted glass. Service was quick and very good. I would go back again to try the platter. Just be really hungry or bring a bunch of friends because the people next to me ordered it, and it's a huge plate.

Before the food review, I need to praise our server, Edgar, who was efficient, adorable, and helpful.  The atmosphere is also really nice. The portions were adequate for the price.  Now.....

Good Q flavor is a fairly subjective thing.  That being said, well-cooked meat should be pretty objective.  The meats I had here, I wasn't real excited about.  

There's "falling off the bone tender," and then there's mush.  I found ours to be of the mushy variety.  The mouth-feel was pretty weird.  We had the baby backs, pulled pork, and brisket.  There was not much outer crust, and that's what held what flavor the meat possessed.  Under that was lightly-flavored mush.  The baby backs had potential.......

Sides we had:  pecan coleslaw ("we ran out of pecans") - I liked it because it wasn't of the sugary-sweet-and-gloppy southern variety, and I could actually taste the cabbage.....mac 'n' cheese - ton of very creamy sauce that was on the bland side.....beans - pretty good, and I'm not a fan of BBQ beans, usually.....roasted corn - very buttery.....corn bread - flat disks that were of the crumbly-and-not-too-sweet type, as opposed to the cake-disguised-as-cornbread kind a la Marie Callenders.

I might go back for a burger...some cornbread....some of the little doughnuts served gratis at the end of the meal.....maybe not........

My husband and I ate at Bobby Q for my birthday today. We had the lunch sampler platter. The brisket was very tender, the meat fell off the ribs and the chicken was awesome too. The sauce was very tasty - not a bunch of Southwestern spices which have no business being in BBQ sauce - like real sauce should taste. Garrett was a great waiter as he had the right mix of being attentive without hovering.  I received a birthday treat, thanks Taylor and Garrett, which was very chocolatey good. We will visit again in the future.
Great food!! Great service!!!! Amazing food(cornbread, brisket, mini donuts) and cute drinks!!

Guys! This place is fantastic. I can't go anywhere else for steaks and ribs! 

Carmela, my server, was super nice and informative on restaurant and menu. Thank you dear!
Great service and amazing food. Owner was a nice guy. The ribs are perfect. Mac and cheese was thick and delicious. Brisket was perfect.

This is a nice place with a great patio. We ate indoors and I tried their "Perfect Burger" and it was honestly the best burger I've ever had. I don't know what's in their secret sauce but it's amazing. Try the fried onion crisps on the burger - delicious. My husband had the beef brisket and it wasn't his favorite (that's the only reason I gave 4 stars). But we both liked it enough to go back.

Some amazing BBQ!  You start off with corn bread that is really moist and sweet.  It's almost like eating cake.  We did the three meat platter and they split it onto two plates for us.  Don't bother with trying different sides, just get double the Mac n cheese...you won't regret it!  It's creamy cheesy goodness!  Brisket is really tender as well as the chicken.  Finish your meal off with some complimentary mini donuts in cinnamon sugar goodness and you'll have to roll out the door. Nice environment, good service and great food!  I know I'll be back for more when I come back to Phoenix!
I think that you won't be able to find better barbecue. It is a little expensive but i think it is worth it.

I have neutral feelings about BBQ but this place was great.  I was dubious as we pulled into the parking lot.  I worried we accidentally wandered into a crack den.  However, once we found the front door, I was pleasantly surprised.  Super cute inside and a nice patio I'd love to visit when it's not 110 degrees outside.  The mac n' cheese was fabuloso and our waitress was fantastic.  My salad was a little bland but that is my fault for ordering a salad at a BBQ restaurant.  My dining companions were super pleased with their plates o' meat.

Oh my mouth-watering BBQ goodness. Ignore the sketchy neighborhood and 30 minute wait, because the meal is worth it! 
My boyfriend's favorite food is BBQ-anything so I left the ordering up to him (and the choice was easy): Whole Hog Heaven - 4 meat choices plus 3 sides. Settling on St. Louis and Baby Back Ribs, BBQ Chicken, and Brisket, with sides of mac & cheese, coleslaw, and beans - he was as giddy as a kid on Christmas. I was pretty hungry too - and I had to admit the smell of BBQ wafting through the back kitchen door had my taste buds excited. The meal did not disappoint to say the least. The ribs were literally falling off the bone, the chicken was cooked perfectly, and the brisket was melt-in-your-mouth tender. All 3 sides were the perfect addition, however I do have to say that the coleslaw was my favorite, especially paired with the brisket. 
What sent us over the edge of BBQ heaven were the extra special additions before and after the meal. To start us off - homemade, warm cornbread with whipped butter. To finish us off - complimentary mini donuts (yes, you heard me right).
Erg I would give 5 stars, but there was a hoard of drunken girls taking over the bathroom (there is a club attached to the restaurant?) that I found fairly annoying. Oh well.
Highly recommended and we will be going back!

Another great meal at Bobby Q Kristi M. services was awesome lunch menu was r reasonable the Q rolls are amazing. Unfortunately I'm on a diet wanted to bring my son someplace so I had a salad, which was good too.

This place has delicious food! The ribs, sides, and cornbread are great, plus they give you little doughnuts for dessert! They give you a great amount of food for the price, very reasonable. The environment is classy but still very comfortable. And the service is on point! Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable, plus we had a manager check in on us as well. Great place and we will be back!

Joy Martin

37 minutes ago
This is the best place to eat in Arizona!!! Love the corn bread and beef brisket. The wings was one of the best too. Wil... See More

Best Barbecue in AZ, quit reading this and go get some smokey ribs and steaks!!! Super smokey deliciousness, try the sangria (you're welcome) you also get homemade donuts for free to take home and enjoy later cause you have no room left in you're tummy from all the steak, baby back ribs, pulled pork and juicy chicken...
Beef ribs were amazing. Tender and falling off bone. Just enough sauce. Sides of fries and coleslaw were solid. Corn bread muffin was a juicy and tasty. Great atmosphere and great food
Great food great atmosphere great drinks thoroughly enjoyed our meal and time at Bobby Q

Great BBQ dinner on our last day of Phoenix vacation. Great staff - Ashlynn explained history of restaurant, how ribs and brisket prepared, and choices of sauces. Had a "Whole Hog Heaven" - which for our family was baby backs, St Louis ribs, and double order of smoked beef brisket. Tried two sauces - regular and spicy, which came to us in two small carafes for pouring. Sides included corn bread, roasted corn and ranch beans. Everything was tasty and we had left overs for part of lunch the next day. Ended with a death by chocolate dessert - which was two pieces of cake and a huge dollop of cream. Staff came by to replace empty drinks and refill water. A little dark inside so we were afraid to see what BBQ sauce stains were on our shirts when we left, but overall, a great place to dine.

Definitely a huge fan. I absolutely love the ambience and setup. Their service was fast and amazing. They serve tea that comes in these cute little boxes and they give you a select variety. They also give you home made cornbread with butter. 

I ordered the two meat platter which came with two sides. I ordered pulled pork and the baby back ribs. The ribs were probably the best I have tasted. I balanced the meal out with their grilled veggies and Mac and cheese on the side. Needless to say I was in the clean plate brigade that night. 

For dessert, you really need to try the mud pie. Very generous portion to either share or just feed that sweet tooth for yourself.

Overall I'm definitely a fan :) :)

The service at this place is awesome! I've been here a few times for lunch and dinner and every time I come here I've always enjoyed the service. 

This place have the best BBQ by far in the Phoenix area!! The cornbread is excellent and I don't even have to mention the award winning Mac and cheese!!  

If you looking for a place to bring your family, friends, or significant other this is a nice place for a date or family gathering!

Great restaurant!  I had the brisket sandwich and loved it.  They bring out fresh cornbread before the meal which is a bonus and small little donuts for after the meal.  The restaurant has a great decor and is a very pleasant atmosphere. If you want some good ol fashion barbecue- try this place out, you won't be let down

Come here for the beef ribs but that's about it. Tried the sirloin steak, and pulled chicken but it wasn't particularly special or better than other places. The macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, and apple cobbler also did not stand out.

While you wait for your meal there's complimentary cornbread with sweet butter and honey. That was a delightful surprise. 

Service was outstanding! Our waiter was very patient and enthusiastic. 

The place itself, both its interior and exterior is extremely charming, reminds me of a classic Lousianan old bayou building. 

To be fair, I am comparing the barbeque I had here to the barbeque I've had in Texas. 

Don't forget to check in here for 10% off of your bill. And they give you free doughnuts on your way out!

happy hour friday 4:30-8 can be a full crowd with no parking, park at carrington college! The free buffet at the q lounge is amazing prime rib, shrimp, tacos, nachos so good and bbq chicken will be going back friday with some friends!

The food isn't overwhelming in portion size (I had lunch).  The taste was great bbq.  They could use a little flare in the sauce department in terms of variety.  The hot bbq sauce wasn't very hot.  

Price is reasonable and the service is good.

This was my third time here and though my previous experience(review) was horrible, my wife and I decided we would give Bobby Q's another try. We came for a late lunch/early dinner on Saturday(07/30) and were immediately sat. Our waitress, Bailyee, was enjoyable and tentative! This was a HUGE difference from our previous visit and waiter. We both ordered adult beverages and both were great. We started with the spinach and artichoke dip, awesome choice! My wife ordered the salmon which is a good size portion and she really enjoyed the flavors! I stuck with my favorite pulled pork, one of the best I've had. The food is great and Bailyee, our server is awesome!

Chef Mark, your staff redeemed themselves this time around. Please let Bailyee know we truly enjoyed her and wish she could be our server each and every time! We appreciate her stating to us we treated her very nicely and she decided to give us extra donuts as a token of appreciation. We will be back for sure!
This place is the best we had to wait because they're busy. But they came apologized and are giving us free desert. I always come here because they are courteous.

Went to Bobby Q with a work colleague and fellow BBQ enthusiast. We ordered two 3-meat combo plates so that we could try almost everything. 

All 3 ribs tasted good (baby back, st-louis, beef). I would have hoped for more smoke and more of a rub (we ordered them dry with sauce on the side). Of the three, I think that the St-Louis were the best.

We also had brisket, pulled pork and chicken. All three of these need lots of smoke (in my view) to be a success and there just was not enough. The brisket was not sliced and had no barque. It was more of a "pulled" format in small pieces. It tasted a bit dry and lacked smoke.

Overall, it's OK but not great. I'm stuck between going with 2 or 3 stars on this because the sides weren't all that fantastic either (mac & cheese, fries, grilled veg, ranch beans). However, it is still decent BBQ if you stick to the right items (ribs).
Food was wonderful. Had Bob's salad. Hubby had brisket. Mac and Cheese is the bomb. Server Meghan was awesome. Very attentive and explained everything. Will be coming back for sure!!!!

Short version: The food is delicious and the service is wonderful! 5 stars.

Long version: 

Ambiance: i was impressed with this restaurant as soon as we stepped in. It reminds me of the Lucille's BBQ chain in decor and ambiance - classy yet family friendly, with southern comfort and hospitality. Their menu even has a truck on the cover.

Service: Excellent. All of the waitstaff was attentive and courteous. Our waitress explained the history of the restaurant to us since we told her we were first time visitors. 

When our party of three told her we were planning on splitting a whole rack of baby back ribs, we assumed we would get a large plate of whole ribs and then three plates. Instead, we got three separate plates portioned with 3 equal parts of ribs and the sides distributed evenly as well. Such an unexpected and very much appreciated gesture, considering that ribs are messy enough as it is!

Food: AMAZING! 

Sweet Tea ($2): Refreshing and sweet, but not in excess.

Corn Bread (free): The only thing served that I didn't enjoy. If you like dense, oily cornbread "patties", this might be your thing.

Cajun Shrimp ($11): The shrimp is marinated in cajun seasonings and beer and it is accompanied by garlic bread. The slightly alcoholic flavor paired well with the shrimp and cajun spices and the garlic bread was buttery, crispy, and not overwhelmingly flavored.

Baby Back Ribs ($26): The best bbq I've ever had in my life! To be fair, I'm not a huge bbq connoisseur, but the ribs are succulent, tender, flavorful and the bbq sauce adds a tangy flavor. The meat falls clean off the bone.

Shoestring fries (comes with ribs): They are extra skinny and salted to perfection - my favorite type of fries. Scrumptious.

Mac & cheese (comes with ribs): Creamy, cheddary with a delicious consistency. The BEST kind of mac and cheese to accompany a rack of ribs.

Thank Q Donuts: When you leave, they give you fresh, warm cinnamon donuts - and a lot too! They gave us 6 for our party of 3. An awesome touch.

This will be my new go-to bbq joint from now on :)

Tip: If you check in with yelp or foursquare and tell your waitress, they will give you 10% off your entire check. Be sure to tell the waiter before you ask for the check!

The claim is that they to have the best brisket in Phoenix, which couldn't be further from the truth.  Little to no smoke flavor, no smoke ring on the brisket, the sausage was burnt on the grill.  If this is the alleged best Phoenix has to offer......wow not!

Having been all over this great country and tried amazing BBQ, this fell way short.

This is our new brisket Q place. Oh my, so delicious!  We've tried several dishes and so far everything is so tasty that I can't pick a favorite yet:) this is my date night with the honey, and those craft beers are great. I love the big blue van..hope they bring on blue moon on draft soon.

My husband told me that Bobby Q is on the top 100s for best Barbecue in the US but I say top 10 and the best in the world for Mac and cheese! The service is always top notch! I have said before I never really liked smoked food but it's so perfect here and the barbecue sauce is so good! Thanks to the chefs and wait staff for another great experience! 






Okay 11 months later and once again had best BBQ meal. Heads down the best service in town the Manager was on the floor with a smile, very pleasant and making sure the customers were happy. Our waiter recommended an appetizer that was so good. I hope that more people will come try the Greatest BBQ in AZ!!!
Great staff and best BBQ. We have business meetings here often. Always greeted with a smile. We like to go here on the weekends. Wait time is not long. Highly recommended.

This is now the must go to place when we come to Phoenix. We came across this gem last year when we were here for spring training and it was so good we had to come back again this year. The service is the best you can ask for. They are quick,friendly and answer any question you have for them. The food comes out very quick which is great since the smell of the BBQ everywhere has you craving your meal. We got the hog heaven which a sample platter of all the BBQ they have. We picked the ribs,chicken and brisket. All of them were excellent. Our waiter Justin was awesome and he recommend the banana cream pie which was had Bobby Q's twist on it. It was very refreshing and the perfect end to a great meal. Will definitely come back here every time I'm in Phoenix.

We sat at the bar and our server was super friendly and nice and really helpful with suggestions. We split the q-rolls, a two meat platter of baby back ribs and brisket, which comes with two sides. We got mac & cheese and coleslaw. We also had their house beer. 

Everything was soooooo delicious. The q-rolls are not to be missed!! The ribs and brisket were amazing. They have regular and spicy BBQ sauce and both were sooooo good! Definitely recommend coming here!

Rushed is the first thing that I remember from our experience at Bobby Q's ... from ordered to trying to take our plates to dessert ordering and the check.  The check, that brings me to another issue... we were a party of 3 (easy right?) so we ordered the big meal thingy (Whole Hog Heaven) and we split it and as a party of 3 (couple and a single) we asked the waitress with our check to use 1 card for a 1/3rd of the check and 2/3rds for the balance.  She pauses and says I will do it by your meals, I remind her that we ordered ONE BIG MEAL and need to split, she says "OK no problem, I have a calculator back there..."   Waitress and our check comes back and she did 1/4 and 3/4 to which I asked why and what the confusion was and while she was miffed, she offered to take the cards and re-do the charges, I declined this.  It's sad these are the things that were the most memorable of our visit.  BBQ was just "OK", over priced and really not that great given the "we've heard this and that about this place".  I will be in no rush to go back, it wasn't horrible ... it just wasn't great and add in the service issues, enough to go to other great BBQ options in the valley.  The corn bread and the donuts were really good, I will say that!

Went here to celebrate and my husband was in literal "hog heaven" all the meats were great, I split a simple ranch salad with him, which was good. Mac and cheese is ridiculously good and so was the service. Too full for dessert but had one donut and it was crazy good too!!

BE CAREFUL OF YOUR CREDIT CARD, we had food there and we paid, left the restaurant and remembered that we did not get our credit card, went back to the restaurant, I showed the front desk girl where we were seated, she went and ask the waiter and said we don't have your credit card!!!!
I asked another girl who was very nice and she said I will help you find it and came back with the credit card.
I asked the front desk girl, did you check yourself? Did the waiter check before telling me you don't have it? She had no answer...

My wife and I ordered the Whole Hog Heaven. The meat was spectacular! Ribs were smoked to perfection, chicken was juicy, and the pork was great! The two suggestions we have are to make the tables for two a little bigger (would have been fine if we ordered something different), and provide moist towlets for cleaning your hands after eating the ribs. Those suggestions don't affect the rating I gave 'cause the food was just too good!
As for the service, our waitress was fast friendly and very informative! Next time I am in Phoenix I will be back to Bobby Qs!

After my bf's graduation, him, his friends, his parents and I decided to have lunch here. This was my first time here but according to my bf this place is pretty good and he talked about it so many times that I thought I actually been here before. Well I finally got to try it.

I ordered the Platter since I really wanted to try more than just one type of meat if this is the only time I get to try it - so with the platter you get to select three types of meat plus one side. I ordered the beef brisket, bbq chicken (I requested the leg and thigh since I'm not a big fan of the breast) and sausage with the pecan cole slaw as the side. It also comes with corn bread. 

They served us all the corn bread in a basket first and it was the softest corn bread I've ever had but it had a soft buttery taste - kind of just melted in your mouth - I really liked it. When my platter came I was somewhat disappointed because they gave me ribs instead of the sausage - but it was alright because I ended up really liking the ribs. It wasn't a lot of meat but the flavor was good. What I really really liked was the beef brisket. It was the softest beef brisket I have ever had. It was amazing because it was so easy to chew and the flavor was also very good. The BBQ chicken was okay - I liked it just because I could request for dark meat pieces but it didn't really have that strong of a BBQ taste. The coleslaw on the other hand was my least favorite. It wasn't very tasty and it lacked dressing too. 

The services was pretty good - our waitress was friendly. The place itself was surprising dim - for a BBQ place and one thing I notice was usually when you step into a BBQ restaurant you would get hit in the face with a smokey bbq-y kind of smell however not here. When I stepped into the dining area - I didn't really smell any of that meaty bbq aroma - and not only that but my clothes didn't even absorb the smell of the restaurant. This isn't a good or bad thing - just an observation. 

Overall I really enjoyed my lunch - for 13.99 the platter was fairly priced since everything on the menu (from sandwiches to salads to platters) was ranged around 10-14 dollars a plate.
Food was great.  We really enjoyed the brisket... It melted in your mouth.  Our waitress, Shay was the best!

I really wanted to like this place. My husband has been wanting to go for a while, and we finally went tonight.

Let's start with the positives (I'll apologize in advance for jumping around). We ordered the calamari appetizer ($12.50); we both enjoyed it. Hubby had the three meat combo dinner ($26) with pulled pork, beef ribs, and chicken. It came with 2 sides, he chose baked potato & beans. He liked it all and the few bites he shared, I liked too. I ordered the 10 oz prime rib dinner($26). It came with 2 sides. I wanted a side salad, so I got one side and $3 up charge for the salad (which she told me up front & I was fine with). The blue cheese dressing is great. Some of the lettuce was brown though, so that was a little off-putting. The prime was just so-so & I would not order it again. 

Now for the rest of the not-so-great part of our dining experience. It is rare that hubby and I get to go out alone together these days, so we were really looking forward to having a nice dinner out. Our server was a little over-zealous at first. It was our first time there so we were taking our time going over the menu. We ordered the calamari appetizer and asked for a few more minutes, again. She brought 4 warm pieces of cornbread to the table. She comes back a couple minutes later & this is where one thing that really bothered me, happens. I have my little plate in front of me and as I'm about to put a piece of cornbread on it, she takes it, puts it on a dirty plate from someone else's table - as I was saying, "oh, I was still using that", and she says, "oh here, you can have it back" and set it back down in front of me! I said, "no, you can take it". She didn't even offer to bring me another one. Now, I've been a server before & even when I was inexperienced, I would have NEVER done any of that. Very unprofessional. 

When we placed our order (this was right before the plate incident) things came out in timely fashion, but then it was almost like she disappeared. I didn't like the mashed potatoes, something tasted a bit off - like they used milk that wasn't good or something. It wasn't until I was about finished with my prime that she came back to check on us. I asked for a baked potato instead, and she was back in a flash with one. 

So overall, hubby was satisfied with his food. Me, not so much. Service, lacking. And, for probably the worst part of it all...about half hour into dinner the lounge area starts playing heavy club music. Not only is it competing with the country they have playing in the restaurant, but you can feel & hear the bass so much that it literally made us feel so irritated that we decided to take the rest of our food home. It was not a good dining experience for us. We probably won't be going back.

Delisious. St. Louis ribs had a great smoky flavor but the baby back ribs were more moist. Mac and cheese was very good, had a lot of good cheese flavor without being greasy. Pecan cole slaw and ranch beans could have been better. Free cornbread and after dinner doughnuts were delisious. Not the best sauce I've ever had but definitely had good flavor, the 'spicy' sauce wasn't very spicy. Definitely going back since its right up the street but a little pricy for an everyday lunch or dinner, special occasions for sure. A must try if your around the Metrocenter area.
Great service, great drinks always at a good price music is cool.... but the main attraction.... THE TACOS!
This is the best restaurant I've been to in Phoenix. Everything there was top notch! Once seated the service is quick and friendly. Definitely a place that I will come back to.

I have been to a lot of BBQ places and this is gotta be the best. Highly recommend this bbq, you wont be disappointed. Good cornbread, and meats were tender and smoked to perfection (we had the baby back ribs and brisket). Good max and cheese and the mashed potatoes were very tasty. 
Service was great and food was literally on the table 5 minuets after we ordered.
Cant wait to go back and try some more.

First time at this Bobby Q (we have been to the Mesa one before).  
Same outstanding food.  Had:
Baby back ribs - the meat fell off the bones.
Pulled pork - a little on the fatty side (normally we eat very lean meat) but just how I wanted it.  

Service was great as always, manager even stopped by to say Hi.

Bought some BBQ sauce to take home.

We will definitely be back.

My family went and it was the best experience ever!! The food OMG the food was so good. The wait staff was amazing. It really felt like home. I will definitely be going back thee. I highly recommend you check it out. Great home town feel. Best BBQ I have had sense my move from Illinois. A definite must go!!!

I had the half rack of St. Louis ribs.  I thought the ribs were way over cooked.  Just to tender, to the point of being mushy.  The service was great.  The corn bread before the meal was very good.  I got mac and cheese and the pecan Cole slaw for my sides.  The slaw was blah, and to mac and cheese was ok.  The desert was an big.  I got mud pie ice cream, it was very good.  I will go back because the service was good alot with the atmosphere.  I will try a steak or fried chicken next time not the BBQ.  Oh and they give you doughnuts with your check!
This probably the Best Beef Brisket I ever had!!! This is my second time here the last time I felt the same way and that was 7 years ago!!!

Had a great meal at Bobby Q while in Phoenix for the week. It's tough to impress me with Q because of my long history of slow smoking meats in my ancient stick burner. 
I started the meal with the Q rolls appetizer, let me say these are brilliant and amazingly good!! They are basically brisket egg rolls that melt in your mouth, so light and crispy with a ton of flavor!! I ordered the three meat combo with Pulled pork, Brisket and Baby Back ribs, my sides were the beans and the Mac-N-Cheese. Brisket was super moist and tender as was the pulled pork, Baby Backs fell right off the bone but didn't taste over done at all. Beans were good, not over powering as some Q places can make them, they are simple and good. Mac n cheese was creamy and super cheesy, didn't finish them because I was stuffed to the gills by then!!  The little donuts at the end of the meal are so good, I wanted to take a bucket of them with me! Service was great as well, Jason was my server and he did an epic job as I never went without iced tea, food was out quick and he was the one that talked me into the Q rolls. If I lived here I would be a regular for sure!

In these days of turmoil in the world and a rough economy, a place where you can go to feel the warm fuzzies, be cozy, and get good value for your money would be what you're looking for, right?   Well then, you have found it at Bobby Q.  And even non-carnivores can enjoy themselves.

The moment I got out of my car the seductive scents of smokey bbq wafted into my nose.  Winding through the patio with a bit of a ramschackle look with plants and tin and who knows else (but it's all for show), I enter the inner sanctum:  spacious and with dark walls, high ceilings, big paddle fans, and a bustling atmosphere.  A cheerful hostess greets my wife and I and takes us to our table.

The seating is comfortable, and the lighting is bright enough to read the menus but low enough to enjoy.  Our waitress, Tiffany, is a real joy.  She is very cheerful, checks on us just enough, and gets the orders correct.  She came out in short order and answers all our questions knowledgeably, and soon brings out the first golden nuggets of our meal: complimentary corn bread (they look like muffins without the tops).  They are delicious: very warm, melting in your mouth, moist, and with little pieces of corn in them.  The accompanying butter is hardly needed.

The menu, of course, focuses on meat, but for those inclined towards other proteins, there are other options: grilled salmon and shrimp  for example.  My wife order the baby back ribs with mashed potatoes and grilled veggies.  I got the grilled salmon, grilled veggies and pecan cole slaw.  I also had the "homemade" lemonade which came with free refills.  It was refreshing, but a bit on the sweet side.

I first got a side salad.  It was a decent size but basically iceberg lettuce with a few cherry tomatoes, croutons, shredded cheese and a little green pepper topped with red onions.  Warning: if you don't eat pork, they sprinkle bacon bits on top, which wasn't mentioned on the menu.  I got the blue cheese dressing, which didn't have lots of flavor but had real little pieces of blue cheese.

Soon the entrees came out, and they were good-sized.  My salmon was nicely seared and with a slight crispiness outside and very moist inside, served with a light sweet sauce on top.  The grilled veggies were green pepper, onion chunks, zucchini, and summer squash, served with a light vinaigrette.  Very tasty.  The serving size was about 1/2 cup.  The pecan cole slaw was good sized, with the right amount of mayo, and topped with the nuts (so if you are allergic to nuts, they simply can leave it off).  I wound up taking home 1/2 the fish and slaw and some veggies to make a lunch!

My wife finished off the 1/2 rack of ribs that she said just fell off the bone.  She took home some of the generous portion of mashed potatoes.  I tasted them: they were red skin potatoes with some of the skin in there and plenty of flavoring and very good.

While we had a generous meal, we felt for the benefit of our readers to press on and have dessert.  While "Death by Chocolate" cake sounded tempting, they were out of it, so we got Peach Cobbler instead. It came in a bowl: sliced peaches topped with a light pastry that was seasoned with the warming spices of cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves (it seemed) and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Along with that we received the complimentary mini-doughnuts dusted with sugar and cinnamon.  Those melted in your mouth.  Tiffany gave us both two, but they never made it home!   Oh, and the Peach Cobbler was delicious, too!

Verdict: this is a great place for families and couples and anyone else as it is very welcoming and has great food to suit most tastes.  Except probably not if you're vegan.  I left it with a nice warm feeling all over and the thought that I would return.

Yelpers: there is currently a discount of 10% off the bill if you mention it.

Amazing. Best food in Phoenix by far. We came for lunch with no expectations and were blown away. We ordered the brisket appetizer, two choices of ribs, the brisket entree, and Mac and cheese. Everything was incredible we left completely full but still wishing we could've eaten more. We will definitely be back.

I want to start off by saying, this is the BEST BBQ place I've ever had. The ratings and the reviews are all true. The best! My friend and I were in Phoenix for the weekend, and as soon as we checked in our hotel, we both were hungry and graving some BBQ. I personally was not expecting any good BBQ places nearby, we almost settled with a mediocre place at the Westgate shopping center! Glad my friend stumbled upon Bobby Q's. With over 1000+ reviews and still holding a 4.5 average rating, I came in with high expectations. 

My first thought when arriving was this place was pretty hidden, there is plenty of parking, the restaurant is big, and best yet, it smelled great from outside already! We were a little worried it was going to be busy and would have to wait a bit for lunch because of its popularity, but we got greeted and were seated right away! 

Our server Hunter greeted soon after and introduced himself and told us about Bobby Q and now they smoke their meats. He was extremely helpful and friendly and checks in on us frequently since he knew this was our first time. My friend and I each got the or own 3 meat combo which was only $25 and came with 2 sides! I chose the brisket, baby back ribs, and pulled pork with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. We also ordered their blonde ale beer, which was good refresher. 

We waited for our food, and were given corn bread. Which were amazing!! We had to stop ourselves before we got full from them. Our food came quicker than expected, and we were not disappointed. There was definitely more food than I was expecting. There was going to be leftovers for sure. Having the first bit was heaven and knew immediately this must've been the best BBQ I've ever had. Way better than the Wood Ranch here for sure. My favorite was the spicy BBQ that our server Hunter gave us. It had a little kick without it being to spicy. My friend and I enjoyed our plans until we were too full, which we barely ate half our plates. We were more than happy to have it for leftover dinner. 

Before leaving, Hunter gave us complimentary donuts, which were a great touch, but we were way to full to have any, so added it on to our leftover bag. 

Overall, this place was delicious! Service and food was excellent!  I will definitely have to stop by here when I come back to Phoenix.

Was in Arizona for spring training.   The whole place was filled from fans from different cities.   All the ribs were great the brisket was awesome also.  For side orders we had Mac and cheese and beans were all great.  Service was awesome our waiter was Johnny on the spot with anything we needed.   Hope to come next year.

Awesome place, great food, waitresses are awesome, best place to eat in Arizona..  excellent bbq.. if you live in Arizona or anywhere for that fact and haven't eaten here.. your missing out. The staff is the best and prices are good for what you get. I love this place and will continue to come here forever...

Love this place.  Ate at Booby Q Friday night.  It was busy but we were seated promptly.  Service was excellent and the food arrived quickly.  The steak was excellent.  This place has great management and staff.  It is no wonder it is consistently busy.

Highly recommended.

We made reservations for here (on Yelp) 15 minutes prior to arriving, and they got our party of eight in right away, even though there was an hour wait.
