The service was amazing and the food was 5 stars. The meal started with super moist and tasty cornbread and a delicious onion wedge that our whole table enjoyed. Everyone's food was so good. I ordered the baby back ribs and they fell off the bone and melted in my mouth. The meal ended with full stomachs and complimentary fresh, warm donuts.  I was very impressed with my whole dining experience and can't wait to return.
The Food was BOMB MY N*GGA ! The service was great, friendly and nice environment. Recommend it to everyone who loves some good bqq ribs.

I absolutely love this restaurant the service is amazing and the food matched it !! Had no issues loved how the manger on duty walked around to see how every table was doing ..can't remember servers name but he was amazing ! Restaurant is kinda pricey but worth it !
Great home style cooked food and friendly staff. Has a great atmosphere, that is perfect for families or a romantic date. Great restaurant highly recommend it.
Amazing! Ordered the beef ribs and could eat them with a fork they were so tender. After dinner they give you freshly fried donuts that were just awesome.

Food was sub par. We got there about 20 minutes before close and they were converting it into a night club so we got a to-go order. They forgot some of my order and it defeated the whole purpose of going there. The donuts were good, but I know good BBQ and this isn't it. I called and left a message about the messed up order and they took like a week to call me back. Not going back.
The people at Bobby Q's are so friendly. This is the best BBQ in the area. I got the brisket for take out. The prices are reasonable and the quality is amazing. I give 5 stars for the brisket!!!

I give it 1 star for its BBQ. My wife and just happen to see a sign saying Bobby Q has the best BBQ in the country. Here is another example of over priced and over rated BBQ!! Not only are they NOT the best BBQ in the country! They are not even the best in Phoenix! I am not sure who they paid for that rating, but they got ripped off. If you are going to say you are the best in the country. you better be the best! And Bobby Q doesn't even come close I am sorry to say. But I will say the rest of the menu is good and the service is awesome!

Awesome bbq and great service.   I went with a friend from work during lunch.  While it is a little hard to find (nothing a gps won't fix) the food is amazing!  I had the sampler.   Left very very happy. A must try for bbq fans out in AZ!

Great food #1 I've went twice in one week ! I really enjoyed the brisket sandwich and the ribs are very good.. the portions are good size so at least you leave don't leave hungry.. I will be back again. The atmosphere was awesome inside and they have a great patio, nice and shaded , way better than I thought considering the neighbor hood and the parking is interesting. The prices are a bit much considering I eat a lot of BBQ all over the valley. But it's a sweet spot and probably one of the nicest places around right off the 17, so it's very convenient.
Extremely friendly and delicious food. The ambiance is chill. Would definitely go back.

Im seriously in a food coma right now.  This is the 1st time here.  Our waitress Alexamdra told us all about the history.  The food was excellent.  We will definately be coming back.  I give this place 20***

Best of the valley award winning and deservingly so. Nice attmosphere, great service, and most importantly AMAZING food.  Portions are large enough to share.  Craving great bbq, give this spot a try. You won't be disappointed!

The brews are great but the BBQ is not the best. They gave us a waiter in training today and he was walking around with the supervisor most of the day. Im sure this is not the best process but what ever works for them might not work for the customers. 

We tried the smoked wings for starters and the shrimp appetizer both great plates. 

For lunch we ordered some of the links, st louis ribs, baby back ribs, and the smoked pulled pork. None were more than ok. 

I would give the place try might not meet up to my expectations but it might to yours.

Bobby Q's catered our wedding and the food was absolutely awesome. I've also had their food at other catered events and it was equally awesome then, too. I've impressed that a BBQ-based company is so accommodating of vegetarian diets and that their vegetarian food is actually really good!

We had a Mexican meal catered for our wedding. Our guests raved about the meats and I really enjoyed the enchiladas and guacamole. The servers were good, the food was excellent, they went the extra effort to match their buffet display to our wedding colors, and the cost was far more reasonable than most wedding meals. If it hadn't been my wedding, I would have stuffed myself silly on the food it was so good.

I've also had the barbeque meal catering at a different event, and it was delicious! The servers were so accommodating as soon as they heard I was vegetarian (offering to grill up some other fare for me). The mac & cheese and biscuits were awesome.

The ambiance.....i cant say enough about the fantastic feel this place has. It has a rustic look with upscale charm. I sat on the patio and was nervous the noise of the expressway would annoy me. That exact opposite happened. The fountain with the trickling water and the ebb and flow of cars combined to make me feel peaceful and relaxed. The place is incredibly clean as well. 

For the meal itself I ordered Q-rolls to start. These were like beef brisket meeting an egg roll.  It was served with a chipotle sauce and bbq sauce. It was easy to eat and very tasty. The crispy dough outer shell complimented the flavor in the beef. 

For dinner i ordered the 2 choice option. Beef brisket, of course, and the baby back ribs because sever said they'd be one of the best i would ever had.   To be honest, i have had better beef brisket in Tennessee. By all means it was excellent but a tad dry compared to some of the juicy fatty brisket from those hillybilly towns off the  main roads. The server did not lie about the baby back ribs. My grandmother's ribs compete with these and that says a lot to the quality and taste. WOW!!!!!!  Wonderful!!!!!  I also ordered the ranch baked beans. Very flavorful. It has beef and pork in them. Some of the meat was stringy so texture was odd but flavor is great. 

As for the service.....OUTSTANDING!!!!!  Hunter was my server and his knowledge of the menu and ability to give tips enhanced my experience. He was friendly and had just the right amount of chattiness. The manager, Cameron, was also extremely attentive. I felt like i was in the fine dining section of a cruise ship. They both teamed up to make sure everything was perfect throughout the night. 

I look forward to returning here to try more of their fabulous menu items!!!!

Ps. They due brew their own beer. Tastes like a shiner bock with less after taste.
I grew up with Dinosaur BBQ in syracuse before it was famous and the flavor changed.... This place topped dinoq it was amazing

We had beef brisket.  It was overcooked and dry .The sauce had an unusual flavor may be too much vinegar . The beans were cold . Corn bread was also dry and was overcooked . Sr ice was good but I will not go back in the near future
Not real BBQ...just over cooked meat.

The best brisket sandwich I have ever had. Moist. Just the right amount of sauce. 

I was just passing by and just decided to try it based on yelp reviews. They were all right. Delicious food. 

The service was great. The sandwich was delicious. I also had the Mac and cheese. Tasted very bad for me but fantastic. 

I wanted to try it again to make sure it wasn't just a fluke. I had another brisket sandwich. Delicious again. The waitress was very friendly and very helpful. The manager stopped by and asked how everything was. I will definitely be back even though it's about a 40 minute drive from home.

Came back again and this time brought some friends to help us eat the Hog Heaven meal and we still had a ton of yummy left overs. Our waitress (I think her name was Megan, sorry I can't remember now) was super patient with us. She was always on top of things. Jason, the manager, came by and said hi to all the patrons. What a nice guy!  Look forward to coming back here again and again. Sign up for their newsletter!  I just got an offer for a free appetizer.

We hit this spot on our way out of Phoenix yesterday.  We had received awesome feedback from our friends.  I am always a little biased when it come to BBQ because I lived in St. Louis, KC and Memphis. 

Let me tell you that this place is outstanding!!  The ribs, beef brisket and Cajun shrimp appetizer were excellent.  

Better than the food was the wonderful service.  Even the manager stopped by to check on our experience. 

We will stop here on every future trip to Phoenix.

This is THE best southern restaurant! No doubt about it. My fav restaurant in the world. I come here often. The food doesn't compare ANYWHERE else. I love the mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, ribs everything. Great customer service everyone makes you feel welcome. I love the atmosphere.

Great place. Top rating.  Cool restaurant, great vibes, friendly people, outstanding food and nice bar area. This is a can't miss.  Cornbread and awesome BBQ, brisket/ribs and mac n cheese that will blow you away.  Oh yeah, the "thank you donuts" - incredible.  Might as well order a dozen of those babys take my word for it! I found my sizzle here. Ask for Tiffany, she is awesome!!  See ya there.

UPDATE: I ordered the hamburger there and FORGET ABOUT IT - THIS IS THE BEST BURGER IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA.  The staff here, in my opinion (aside from Hillstone which is equally as good) is the best you can find anywhere.

Other restaurants should figure out how they hire people and pay them to figure it out.  I have been to hundreds and hundreds of restaurants across the United States, you won't find better.

Told 2 Phoenix natives last month that I'd be in Phoenix  & was going to be with my 88yr old mom & that she loves BBQ & asked for BBQ suggestions. Both said hands down Bobby Q. They were 200% in the money! Service was incredibly friendly, prices more then reasonable & the food...YOWZA!! No words for how good. The meat is bursting with flavor & couldn't be more tender. One in our party doesn't eat meat & he devoured the poor boy catfish sandwich & said it was the best he'd ever tasted.  Mac n cheese & Cole slaw sides also tasty. Ooh and loved the corn bread & of course the donuts! There is nothing not to love at Bobbi Q! I have 2 upcoming trips to Phoenix & this will be a stop both times! Yummy

Food was AMAZING OMG!!!! And the service was just as good. Our server helped us out so much since our group of 4 had never been there. But the bar was pretty disgusting. To start it off one of the bartenders jumped up on the cooler where they keep clean glasses and is also at the bar top height where people's food and drinks were. Then the same bartender took a container that was used to keep mixing tools and mixed up a drink in it then put it back on the counter and put the mixing tools back in it with out washing it or getting a new container. And then watching how the drinks were mad was pretty bad the bartender consistently under poured all the drinks. Overall it was a great experience except for the bar. And make sure you get there early enough or make a reservation it's a popular joint so expect to wait. I will absolutely be back when I come in to town again.

Overall really good restaurant. A little hard to see off the road. Had a big party and they were pretty on top of things. Nice wait staff and clean restaurant. The food seemed like it sat for a while before it hit our table. I'm sure it would have been a lot better but it tasted like we were eating take out. I was really looking forward to this place bc of all the great reviews, and BBQ is the birthday boys favorite. Unfortunately multiple people in our group said the same thing about the food.

We arrived at around 8 on Saturday and waited around 20 minutes to be seated. It was pretty busy.

The wait allowed us to check out the menu before hand and we knew what we wanted before we sat down. Unfortunately they were out of baby back ribs so I had to opt for the St. Louis style. FALLING OFF THE BONE. They smoke that shiz for 18 long beautiful hours! We were all very happy with our meal and I only wish there was BBQ this good in LA.

Afterwards we all shared an order of peach cobbler and nearly fell asleep at the table from tasty overload. I haven't had cobbler that good since I was a kid and my godmother use to pick the fruit fresh from her trees.

I bookmarked this spot for our trip to AZ and completely forgot to mention Yelp for 10% off. I would be kicking myself harder if the food wasn't worth the price in full. I have to remove the one star for not having the baby back ribs.

Had the brisket and rib combo.  Brisket was tender and juicy, great flavor.  Ribs were awesome, pulled the bone out with no resistance.  Mac n cheese was good and gooey, as it should be.  Wife had the pulled pork sandwich, no complaints there either.  All around good experience for some good BBQ, definite return trip warranted when we're in Phoenix again.

Another great dining experience.  Hunter & Taylor took good care of our table.  Good app recommendation, we went with the Q rolls, I could have eaten them all for my meal, but shared.

We all had different entrees/ sides; we all enjoyed our choices. I recommend any of their entrées, but you must try the pecan Cole slaw.  It is soooo good,creamy sweet with crisp fresh slaw with fresh pecans.  Give it a try.   The cornbread is awesome and they will give you some homemade sugar doughnuts on your way out.  

Looking forward to our next visit.

Very good food! Great service! They have the BEST ribeye steak in town. They have Fleming's Steak House beat hands down. Much better steak & price. There appetizers and side are very good. I highly recommend this place!

Seems good so far.  We had a good time, the food was fresh.  Mary, my wife, had something she did not like and the corrected it too.  I had a side that was not warm enough (baked potato) and they swapped it out for another side dish.

I don't think I can say enough positive things about our experience. We stopped by Sunday afternoon on our way home back to LA from Payson, AZ. The reviews is what drew us in and off course. Called ahead of time to put our name down. We were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance. The manager, Laura greeted us and ended up seating us. We told her we found the place on Yelp and were from out of town. Our waitress came right away. Super attentive. Laura came back to check on us. Asked us what we ended up ordering (Ribs & Catfish) she insisted we tried the brisket, brought us a little sample.....SHOULDVE ORDERED THE BRISKET!!!!! Oh My Gawd! AMAZING. Even contemplated taking some to go, but we were staring down the barrel of a 7.5 car ride. My sister lives in Goodyear, AZ I already informed her to make the drive!!! Next time we are in town you know where to find us! Oh wait...don't forget the hot fresh mini donuts you get in your "Thank Q" bag with your check! They're literally doing everything right. Please come open one in Simi Valley, CA!!!!!!!!!
Great catering - easy to work with - Don't skip the Mac & Cheese!
I'm from California & I have to say this joint has the BEST BBQ ever; Excellent Service to the food! Thank you Leanne-I'll be back soon and I hope to have you as our server!

The atmosphere is awesome and the brisket is the best I've had since living in Texas. Their corn bread is sweet and soft and the cowboy beans are the best. Not much else to say. Wish there were more locations!

It took a UYE (thanks, Deb!) to get me to finally try this place which is just a few blocks from where I live, and now I'm sorry I didn't try it much earlier. The cornbread starter was awesome - I could have eaten all that was in the basket, but had to be considerate ;-) Upon a yelper's recommendation (thanks, Jacob!), I had the St. Louis style BBQ ribs with sides of roasted corn and pecan coleslaw.  The ribs were fall-off-the-bone tender, so amazingly good. The more sedate flavors of the sides were a good counterpoint for the intensely savory ribs. We shared desserts -- the chocolate overload was good, and the peach cobbler was not overly sugared like it usually is in most establishments. I like it better that way because the taste of the fruit comes out more, although apparently the others preferred sweeter.  My only gripe was the lighting: on our table, the spotlight-like fixture above me shone harshly on me while keeping the others in comfortable darkness. The servers were friendly and efficient, and the mini donuts given on the way out were scrumptious. This is one place for many return visits, and I'll make sure they seat me in an area without a mini-searchlight above.
Great place. Good food and nice staff. Free doughnuts on the way out. Never had any problems

Wow. All I have to say is the food (especially the Mac n Chz) is so good! Even for left overs. Very good service! And after dinner we even went over to the Club Side - Q Lounge. Nice people and good security. Bathrooms very clean as well!
Stopped here after a spring training game and wow! The food is amazing the service top notch will stop by again when in town....oh and reasonably priced

I came here tonight with my family for dinner.

My wife and I have been here several times. We love the food and the atmosphere. The service has always been great too. 

I wish things could have gone differently tonight, but the way everything was handled was truly professional.

We ordered our food and the bus person was clearing out our table. Well, he accidentally dropped the plates and sauce basically exploded everywhere under the table. My legs were drenched in sauce and my sister's new pair of shoes were stained. My sister had to run to the bathroom to see if they were ruined.

The bus person was very apologetic and so was our server about the incident.

The restaurant manager came up to us after my sister returned and she was also very apologetic. She offered to replace the shoes, she comped my sister's dinner and even threw in free desert. She even got my sister's food replaced because she was waiting in the restroom trying to clean up while her food was getting cold. 

Food was great, the manager really knew how to take care of the customers. I know we'll absolutely be back! 

Try the Q-rolls!
Mac and cheese to die for. Ribs fell off the bone. Donuts at end were a treat. Was on vacation and ate there twice it was sooo good.

Huge...Huge...HUGE!! Ordered the two way combo. Ribs and Brisket with beans and mashed potatoes. Everything was tasty and the service is really good. Cornbread is ridiculous! We were here for a baseball tournament and the staff took care of the whole team in a professional manner. Definitely a go to place the next time I'm in town.
I'd probably say this is the best BBQ in town! Or at least phoenix, north phoenix! Really really good, take the whole family no one will be disappointed

I have heard many things about BBQ in the state of Arizona. Everything from how its not in the same league as KC and TX Bbq and how it lacks flavor like bbq from those places. but I have to say that this place makes me wonder if they never ate here.

It is certainly not blue collar BBQ as its not cheap which means its food not everyone can enjoy. That is the magic of BBQ! I lacks that  "wear the shirt you dont mind getting messy" feel which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. 

Otherwise the meat is expertly smoked (you can smell it on the drive in which is key), the flavors are amazing, ribs fall right off the bone and of you so much as breathe on the meat it falls appart for you. 

The endless cornbread is really a nice selling point for me now as its so moist and yummy. 

The waitress was very well versed on the menu and provided some excellent attention to us while we were dining. 

The food was fantastic, the staff is very friendly, the setting is well enough for a special occasion. Its not your everyday neighborhood bbq joint but if you just got paid and want to celebrate a special occasion then this place will send you home with a full belly and a smile of your face.

One of very favorite places to have a nice dinner. My wife and I met at Bobby Q's 11 years ago, so it is an extra special place for us. :) Best BBQ pulled pork and brisket in the valley and be sure to try the Q Rolls for an appetizer. YUM! :)

My Guilty Pleasure: 

Hands down one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix and the top 5 best BBQ I've ever had. I have nothing negative to say about this place except you might feel a bit guilty after all the food you will have! The portions are pretty big without the big price tag. A dinner for 3 will cost you less than $50. Great atmosphere and usually good service also. Be prepared to wait about 15 minutes on weekends and the dinner rush if you do not have a reservation, but it is definitely worth the wait!

Food is awesome...service is awesome! Came in on a Sunday evening with a party of 13.  Justin and Amberly did an awesome job serving us.  
Baby back ribs come right off the bone.  The corn bread is amazing and the donuts that they have are to die for!  Price is good too.  For 13 of us the check came out to 211..not bad at all!!!!

My reason for the low rating is due to misinformation about their happy hour buffet regulations. I did some researching before heading last night and nowhere did I read about an age restriction in order to partake in the section where they hold the buffet. So when my husband and I and our friends, who had a baby with them tried going in we were shocked to learn we wouldn't be allowed to go in because we had a baby with us. Yet none of this information was posted any where so we were all surprised. Also the fact that there was no manager present did not help our situation, what place doesn't have a manager present at all times? What made things worst was how the host who went by choo choo came off to us as rude when dealing with our situation. We had a big group of friends waiting for us at the patio, where we could of easily been seated but had to turn away and leave our friends because they refused to let us go in. Disappointing costumer service to say the least.

WOW!  What a pleasant surprise!  We were in town from Iowa and saw the wonderful reviews.  So seemed liked a great place.  And we were actually in awe of how good Bobby Q's was!  Absolutely the BEST baby back ribs we've ever had and the Smoked Chicken was wonderful too.  Actually EVERY single thing was awesome.  PLUS - we had FANTASTIC service!  Just couldn't have been a better experience.  And then donuts on our way out.  WOW - wish it was a little closer to Iowa! :)  Thanks Bobby Q's for welcoming us to your wonderful BBQ.  We will be back!
This is my favorite place to eat in Phoenix! I love the rotisserie chicken and mashed potatoes.

I'll go 4.5/5 for this one.  I've eaten BBQ all over the country, and I can't say Bobby Q is "as good as it gets", but they are pretty darn good.  Almost 3 weeks ago Mr. M and I met up with Tim S. and his family to give this place a try.  

Right away I was impressed with the friendly service, and the hostess was helpful when we needed to add a high chair to the table.  Our server was Kanisha and she did a great job and was on point with taking our orders, making sure our drinks weren't empty, and bringing us togo boxes and the check when we were ready.  

We wanted to be able to try a wide variety of items so we started with the Q-rolls ($10.50), which are absolutely delicious.  Brisket wrapped up like an egg roll?  Heck yeah!  Those disappeared quickly.  We also started with their house beer, which if memory serves is an amber ale and that was a nice, easy to drink beer.  Really enjoyed that as well.  The smaller one is $4.95 and the larger one is $6.00, so the moral of that story is, go for the big one!

I ordered the BBQ chicken/prime rib combo ($34) which came with 3 sides.  I chose the loaded baked potato, mac & cheese, and the ranch beans.  Mr. M ordered the 3 meat combo ($25) with pulled pork, brisket, and some ribs.  

I thought I would waddle out of the joint stuffed to the gills, but we actually had so much fun talking that I didn't eat nearly as much as I thought I would.  Here's what I thought of the food:  Prime rib, chicken, and ribs:  Excellent!  Brisket: very good.  Pulled pork and ranch beans: really nothing going on there.  Very little flavor in the pork, and the beans tasted syrupy and had no BBQ flavor.  The other sides we had were very good.  I could OD on the mac & cheese.  Nicely done.

Lunch was pricey if you look at the receipt total of $93.63 after tax, before tip, but we had a lot of leftovers.  Overall we had a great experience and I would go back any time.

first review ever..

best mac and cheese in my life thus far..

the smoke aroma from the ribs and sausage tends to break dance on your taste buds well after swallowing..

the meat falls right off of the bones..i know the term flaccid is not a great word to use for meat or marketing meat but the way everything retains its flavor while being cooked to perfection,  while maintaining abundant flavor is, while applying the laws of inertia through the recesses of your fork is incomprehensible..

I'll be back in 48 hours bc coming back tmrw just looks desperate..

Very good BBQ. Rough part of Phx and it is kind of tough to find the place, let alone the door once you park there. The food was well worth it, however and the manager even gave us some free mac n cheese to try. It was awesome. We got free cornbread, the mac n cheese bowl, and doughnuts when we left. Service and food was really good. It's a 4.5/5.

Looking for some good BBQ?  You won't be disappointed with Bobby Q's.

As soon as we were seated, our server came over with a friendly greeting and a basket of warm cornbread.  She recommended the Q Rolls which are flour tortillas stuffed with smoked brisket and deep fried.  5 rolls per order - served with chipotle ranch dressing and bbq sauce.  The perfect combination, moist brisket inside a crispy tortilla shell.

Hubby prefers the St. Louis ribs and I had the baby back ribs.  The ribs had a nice smokey flavor and the meat practically fell off the bone.  Each bite was a a mouthful of heaven.

We chose the mac and cheese and the pecan salad as our sides,  The mac and cheese was nice and creamy.  The pecan cole slaw was okay.  Basically coleslaw sprinkled with chopped pecans.

Service was great!  Our server was very attentive.

Although we didn't have room for dessert, our server brought us a little bag of donuts to take with us.

YUM...what more is there to say?!?  Too busy licking the sauce off the fingers.

I absolutely love Bobby Q! I've been to Phoenix twice to visit my brother and both times, we've paid a visit here! Their outdoor seating is so cute, especially in the evening when they turn on the light fixtures. What I love is that you can come here for a casual lunch with a friend, come in for a meal with a group/family or for a casual dinner date with your beau. Most dress casual, others put on a cute dress if they're in the mood. Do you! 

They're also extremely accommodating. On my second visit, we squeezed in a quick dinner before my flight. We were really TIGHT on time on a Friday night and when we arrived, we needed a table for six [ugh, we're jerks for showing up expecting a table, I know]. Anyways, there was a long list but my brother finagled a little bit and we managed to get seated in within 15 minutes. 

There are several items on the menu that I think are worth your money:
- Spinach Artichoke Queso Dip: YUM!!! My brother and I are crazy about this dip. It comes with some damn good garlic toast. Definitely one of my favorite appetizers ever. 
- Baby Back Ribs: Can't go wrong with their Baby Backs! They fall right off the bone. *DROOLS*
- Two Meat or Three Meat Combos: This allows you to pick from a variety of options including beef ribs, baby backs, St. Louis, Brisket, Pork, and more! 

Can't forget to mention that all of their BBQ platters come with your choice of two sides, sauces and cornbread! 

Can't wait to be back in Phoenix so I can have another meal here!

Love this place. Food is reasonably priced and the portions are large enough for lunch the next day. Wish their beer menu was a little better and cocktails not so expensive but everything is made from fresh ingredients so I understand. I LOVE THE FOOD!!!!

I have seen the sign while driving and FINALLY decided to try it, glad we did.  Austin was our server and he was great super friendly and attentive.  
I had the beef brisket with mac and cheese and pecan slaw..brisket was super moist and thank goodness it was not covered in sauce just a little drizzle (would have been perfect w/out sauce too), mac and cheese was WONDERFUL!  pecan slaw was just OK.  My son had the chimi shrimp with mac & cheese and mashed potatoes of course we had to share a few bites, shrimp was done perfect had great flavor the potatoes did not disappoint either they were yummy to.  
Had to have a little desert of course..peach cobbler was simply amazing!  

For sure going to be back VERY VERY soon.
Excellent food, service, and the sugared donuts are to die for. Wish they had more locations, but a great evening out.

We were really enjoying the outdoor eating area.....until some yokels at the next table started talking to and feeding the sparrows.  In about 2 minutes we were covered up in birds landing on the ground, on the chairs at our table and even on the table itself.  We got up and entered the building.

So....the food.  We ordered and split the sampler platter, with barbecued chicken, brisket and short-ribs.  All three were top notch.  Fairly good selection of beers, I enjoyed an IPA from Deschutes Brewery, something we don't see much of on the east coast.

Except for the outdoor experience, this is definitely somewhere to check out if you like BBQ.

Great BBQ, and very friendly service. It's not quite a "5", as it doesn't stand out with the superlative factor leaving a ever lasting impression. Nevertheless, it's worth a stop it your nearby and looking for some good BBQ.

I don't know how many times I've passed this place on the fwy. But finally I tried it and was amazed at how juicy, tender and satisfying the meat really was. Tried the feast platter with my date and we couldn't believe how yummy it was. We couldn't even eat half of it. It was so good and worth every penny (although is only served Sundays). Had ribs, chicken, tri-tip, slow cook pork and....something else PLUS two sides and corn bread. It was so good we said we must go back. A must try.

Odd location. Lower income neighborhood. But the restaurant is fun, clean & well presented. On weekends: they have dj/live music and dancing. Fun!

One of the best ribs and brisket I had. The rib meat could have fallen right off but it was just right- juicy and flavorful . The brisket was flavorful but could have been less dry. Overall top 3 ( I've been to a couple in Austin and Houston) and this one made it on that list. The meal comes w one side ( Mac and cheese- a little too cheesy for me tbh) and corn bread (could be warm. Order the sweet tea and call it a day!

This amazing place has been here what 30 35 years, maybe even longer. They are still great, if not better than ever.
I have always liked the food here. I just never seem to make it out to this part of town anymore.  If you are at Metro center or on the I17 headed south this is a great place to stop for Lunch or Dinner.
The meat here is wonderful! I mean really good. I love the Ribs, and the BBQ sauce is mighty fine. 
It is always busy here, is it any wonder. they are still serving up great food and great service. I know that they have a lot of other things on the menu, but I always  get BBQ.
When you like it, don't change. Full service bar and lots of parking.
Please do not drink and drive though.
Years ago the staff used to dress up in Costume, too bad they do not do that anymore.
Food was really good. Service was great just thought it was odd that the big dinner meant to be shared with 5 only came with small sides that on

After the review (below) of my catered dinner from Bobby Q, I received this email:

I would like to apologize for your catering experience. We pride ourselves on our food and take negative reviews very serious. I've shared your review with the owner and the kitchen manager. I would like to invite you and your family in for dinner on us. We would like to prove to you the quality of our food. Just call me directly and make a reservation. Again, we apologize for your experience. 
Jason Gilliland
Restaurant Manager

I wasn't sure how I felt about accepting a free meal - that was really not a goal when I wrote the first review.  In fact, my first thought was why should I waste my time on doing this food again?  But - I was very impressed with Jason's email and decided to give it a shot. He wasn't asking me to change my review - he was aksing for a chance to prove how good they can be.  If it was terrible, he was running the risk of me updating with an even worse review.

My roommates and I all had the day off today, and around lunch time we were discussing food.  We were definitely in the mood for BBQ.  I called Jason, and he immediately set up our reservations for dinner tonight.

Complete breakdown on the experience - 
The room was nice!  Actually, the place was MUCH nicer than I expected a BBQ place to be - but not so stuffy we felt underdressed.
Our server was Ashleigh - she was 100% on point tonight!  From her brief rundown on what Bobby Q is and what to expect, to menu descriptions, keeping our water and iced tea full, checking back at perfect intervals and - my *wow* moment of service - when she dropped off the moist towelettes, the packages were pre-opened!  Sounds silly - but when you have BBQ greasy fingers, those packages can be a bitch!
The food - holy mother of wow - this was the same place as the last review?  The food was made with the same recipes in the same kitchen??  The only thing that tipped me off was the cornbread - still over the top amazing!
The three of us split the Cajun shrimp appetizer with garlic toast points.  While it did not have the level of kick I've come to expect from BBQ shrimp, the flavor was incredible.  Adding in the rosemary was a dash of genius, and the 6 shrimp were perfectly cooked.  This is a recipe I'd LOVE to have!
Wedge salad - HUGE!  In addition to the iceberg, tomato, bacon and bleu cheese, there was bacon.  Not just the baon bits - but big chunks of Meat Candy.  The blue was one of the richest and creamiest I've tasted.
For meats, we had brisket, rib eye, St. Louis style ribs and beef ribs.  Across the board, each was fantastic!  Just as the AKC is looking for the "ideal" of each dog - the meats we ate tonight could be held as the ideal against which all other meats were judged.  Each of the four was a perfect example of what that meat can become, when prepared perfectly!
The cole slaw does have good flavor - and I adore the fine shred they use.  So now it's two thumbs up for flavor and texture.  The mac and cheese was incredibly rich and creamy.  The baked potatoes - well, they are well prepared baked potatoes.  Either they're done right or wrong - not a lot of middle ground - and these were right.
I aldo enjoyed the featured beer - the Bobby Q Amber - which is brewed by Sonoran - so that was double local goodness.
I'd love to be able to review the peach cobbler - but we had already given up and filled boxes with leftovers to be tomorrow's lunch.  None of us had room for another bite.
Then Ashleigh brought the donuts.  Damn donuts!  Perfect, warm and soft, cinnamon sugar fried rings of perfect!  I knew I was full.  I knew I shouldn't eat anything more.  And I am so lucky she only brought one for each of us...otherwise I'd still be there eating more and more and more of them!
Fantastic dinner - all of us were incredibly happy from beginning to end with the entire experience.
Thank you Jason - if you wouldn't have reached out, I never would have known what I was missing!
We will definitely be back!

We've lived in AZ for 8 months, moved here from the south, and I'm so thankful we finally found some dang good BBQ! Our reservation was at 7, and we didn't get seated until about 7:12, and the staff could not have been more accommodating! They felt so bad, and we were just enjoying the patio- no big deal at all! We even got a free appetizer out of it, so great! Ribs, fried chicken, brisket ALL OF IT WAS DELICIOUS!! Can't wait to go back!

We had a reservation and were seated immediately. We sat for about 15 minutes without the waitstaff acknowledging us. Called a waitress over and explained the situation. She took our order right away. The manager came over and offered no excuses ( which I liked) just apologized. Made remedies to our bill and free desert. Loved the food. I just moved here. Was looking for good BBQ here and found it. Will be back again. Thanks so much.

This place has been reviewed by so many, nothing I could say would be original. Glad we read other reviews.  Loved the mac and cheese and corn. The side potato came with tasty real bacon.   Rib eye was cooked perfectly.  The ribs were excellent.  We consumed enough calories for a week.  The portions are so large, we have leftovers for breakfast.  This was a wonderful Valentine's dinner.  Not good for the health but a yummy once in a while treat.  Oh and the draft beer was extremely favorable!

Let's just say...WOW! Every aspect of our dining experience at Bobby Q was amazing. The meal starts with endless corn bread, which falls apart in your mouth. The portions are extremely generous, so try not to fill up on appetizers (which are also amazing, by the way). The brisket, pulled chicken, steak fried chicken; and burger were equally delicious!! And the sides are difficult to choose from and will definitely not disappoint!! I'm confident that you can't go wrong with anything on this menu!! Would definitely go back and recommend to all family and friends!! Would go back 10 times out of 10!
This was amazing BBQ! The brisket had great flavor and was tender and moist. The "smoasted" chicken was the same!  And you get fresh donuts at the end.

Great BBQ! Visiting Phoenix for the first time and really enjoyed the Smokehouse Burger and Mac and Cheese. Cool ambience, excellent service, and delicious food. Our server Daniel was friendly and prompt and really made our meal an enjoyable experience. Ask for him when you come in!
Good food, and great service. It wasn't 10 minutes before our order hit the table. The ribs were tender as can be without losing texture.

Baby back and St Louis sale ribs are awesome. Love the coleslaws and baked potatoes.  Will sure be back next time we are in town!!!

Corn bread is also very very good!!!

Solid BBQ. Service is efficient and the food is delicious. Love the Mac & Cheese. Usually have the pulled pork sandwich but I've also had the beef brisket and its terrific also. Plenty of parking and a good location make this a west side favorite.

Came here for the first time. Heard great reviews. Never new there was a restaurant here. It's like hidden, lots of trees next to it. You park in the back of the restaurant. 

Sign up for the club member to get emails and your first email you get $10 off. 
Check in on yelp you get 10% off. 


I got the filet mignon it comes with 2 sides I got mash potatoes & garden veggies. It was delicious. 

Also we got the whole hog heaven. Comes with 2 rib choices, 2 meats, & 3 sides. We we got the baby back ribs & St. Louis ribs. They are both good the only difference is the St. Louis ribs taste more smokey. The meats we got both chicken rotisserie. The sides we got were mash potatoes, garden vegetables & fries. There were a lot of fries. The veggies were huge. The meats, were good & ribs. 

After you order your food they bring you corn bread with butter. It's delicious and sweet. Also after your meal they bring you complementary donuts they tasted like cinnamon to me but for my more they tasted like lemons.

This restaurant has the best Baby Back Ribs and Mac& Cheese in town.
Our server, Tyler, was excellent with his service.  He knew what to expect from us and when to expect them.  I rate this establishment 5 stars with the quality of food and service.

I'm from California and been to many BBQ places and this place is by far the greatest I've seen to date . I am in no way joking . Just to sign in their was a line . But the 55 min wait was well worth it id wait it 3 times for the meal I've received . The meat on the rip steak chicken etc was just top quality and the way it is cooked in wooden ovens just tops it off . You can taste the quality and it really changes the way you look at food. This place man is one of a kind. After the meal I literally texted my brother and told him Lucile's is trash compared to this place. Don't sleep on this place .

Bobby Qs isn't the type of place I usually go for.  Its a very touristy kind place, almost like a Macaroni Grill for BBQ.  The big difference though between this place and Macaroni Grill is the fact that the food is actually really good at Bobby Qs.  The staff was very efficient and knowledgeable about the menu.  One of my pet peeves is when a staff member has to go and ask someone about a question I have about the menu.  Its pretty obvious the staff here is trained really well.  I had the ribs which were perfectly cooked.  Again though, not the type of place I go for, its also kind of has a upscale feel almost, but definitely not your hole in the wall BBQ place.

AMAZING FOOD AND AMAZING SERVICE. I never write yelp reviews for anyone, but this place took the cake. My server was the sweetest gal named Maddie, she was fast and good at her job. The food was falling off the bone good. Nothing bad about this place. Thank you!

OMG, best bbq in Phoenix, even better than Charleston's! Service was outstanding - Shea, our waitress, top notch, THE best! 
It's an little off the beaten path, but SO worth it! 
The fried cornbread is the best I've ever had, and I'm from the south. The pulled pork wasn't fatty, it was SO moist - had it replacing chicken on my salad and inhaled it 10x over ;-) My husband got the pulled pork sand - was awesome. And, let me say, I haven't had sweeeet tea like this since Texas - to die for!
Would go here again in a heartbeat. For best bbq, it's hands-down the best in the valley.

Definitely the place to be.. Amazing ribs and briskit.. Awesome hosts that know how to take care of the guests.. Extremely impressed with their presentation and culinary skills.. Definite definite recommendation.

I can't tell you how many times my husband and I have been here. We moved here a little over a year ago and a colleague took him to try it. He came home raving about it until I agreed to try it. It's a fun atmosphere and we went for our first and second anniversaries. Last month we took our newborn son for his first visit :) We love that the manager always walks up to your table to make sure your visit is going well. They also have response cards (usually on the table, but not always) that you can fill out with when you were there and how your server was. That definitely shows that they really care about the service they are providing. Though it's almost always very busy, they have great service and the food comes out quickly and hot. Speaking of the food.. My husband is obsessed with their ribs and spicy BBQ sauce (he always asks for his own BBQ sauce bottle to have at the table) He also loves their burgers and swears that the Mac n cheese is the best in the world. When I go I get the steak sandwich. It's juicy steak cooked to perfection on garlic bread with sautéed mushrooms, au jus sauce, and fried onion strings on the side, incredible. But in saying that.. I always try to go on Saturdays because they have a steak and crab special for $18. Their crab is to die for! They place a candle on your table with a butter tray above it that's perfectly melted and warm. I also love their shoestring fries. They give you complimentary cornbread during your meal and a bag of little donut holes afterward. I love this place. We went here three weekends in a row one time (We had different things to celebrate each time and didn't want to go anywhere else!) I love their specialty drinks too. Like most specialty drinks, they aren't cheap.. But yummy. The shipwreck is my fav. If you like good food and good service, GO HERE!

Came in last night for my boyfriend's birthday & it was amazing! We were sat right away, the food came out quickly & the staff was very friendly! I used to live in San Diego where our #1 bbq place was Phill's Bbq & this place has beat it BY FAR! We will be back!

I love the baby backs ribs here and the shoestring fries and corn and the onion block.
Service is fast and very friendly. 
All the food is great and everyone is very outgoing.
Anything BBQ is great. The steaks are also really good.
I can't say anything bad.
They go out of there way to make sure you enjoy your time and there great food.
Every meal comes with corn bread it's really good.
You can have a great desert but you also get homemade donuts to top everything off.

Was visiting Pheonix/Glendale for a Raider game, and yelped around for a spot to eat.  This BBQ joint is off the wall.  I have not had BBQ like this and the service is the best.  I highly recommend this place if you are a BBQ aficionado.

If your me and want to find a joint with a rocking atmosphere, awesome food, and just to have a good time, this is your place!This is what we ordered:

Baby Back Ribs W/ Cold Slaw and Potato Salad- 5/5 rating. Ribs were succulent and off the bone tender. They had a smoky and flavorful bbq taste. Both sides were flavorful and were a great palette refresher.

St. Louis Style Ribs W/ Corn and Cold Slaw-
4/5 rating. These ribs were more meatier yet still were fall of the bone tender. However, these had a less of a bbq and smoky flavor than the baby back ribs. Both sides brought value to the Ribs as well. 

Bbq Brisket W/ MAC n Cheese and Cold Slaw- 3.5/5 rating. Brisket was very tender with a nice melt in your mouth texture. However, they lacked a predominant smoky flavor and the portion was skimp to price. Mac n Cheese was very cheesy while Cold Slaw had good flavor. 

Overall, this place is great to pig out and have an awesome time with dynamite bbq. Service was superb and as an added bonus you get mini donuts at the end of your meal;) 
Note: Prepare for long lines or else call in reservations.

I was always hesitant to open my heart to this restaurant because (a) it has about the worst name they could have possibly chosen, and (b) it gets a lot of hype, but now that I work right across the street, I *have* to try it.

My first visit, I went with a tried-and-true classic, and something most people could probably agree is a barbecue bellwether: pork ribs.

Along with the ribs, I had their slightly disappointing lemonade (their beverage selection is quite weak for a barbecue place) and the beans on the side.  The beans were at an acceptable level of quality for a good barbecue place.  The ribs, however, shined.  Melt-in-your-mouth tender, these ribs were smoky and tasty, and the meat just falls off the bone.  You don't even need to pick these up; you can use your fork if you wish.

Of course, I couldn't issue a verdict on a place like this after just one visit.  I went back, and this time for the smokehouse burger cooked medium rare, with shoestring fries.  I don't usually order burgers at barbecue places, but I heard good things about this burger.  And boy, did it live up to expectations.  I am not usually a fan of barbecue sauce on my burgers, but this one really worked.  Part of it was the crispy onion straws, and part of it was the fact that the cook was very close to the mark on the meat temperature.

The meat wasn't particularly lean, so it is a burger you can probably order medium and still have plenty of moisture left.

The fries were also tasty, and were a perfect complement for this burger.

Now, one thing I am not a fan of is the ambiance.  It doesn't seem to have that rustic feel that you usually expect from a barbecue joint; this place seems just a tad too upscale, if that makes sense.  But I cannot deny that they make some great food here.  One could make the case that, despite their horrible moniker, Bobby Q serves up the best barbecue in the Phoenix area.

This was not on our must try list but I forgot why we ended up here. 

The bestie and I shared one plate of ribs with 2 sides. I must admit, their ribs were delicious and fall off the bones kinda thing but I'm not sure why he LOVES IT SO MUCH. He said it's the best ribs outta all the places that we've been to. Like Phils in San Diego. Or Everest Jones in Oakland. The sauce wasn't bad at all actually. It's not as sour compared to Phils BBQ. If you don't eat much, one full rack is good enough for 2. I thought it would be typical TGIFs or Claim Jumper or BJs ribs but it was much better than that! Well done with smoking the ribs because it wasn't that burnt like most places. I loveee their french fries, the skinny type! Delicioussss. 

Lovely service so that was 2 thumbs up!
It's nice to sit outside the patio but be careful with mosquito bites! 
We came early that day so it wasn't too crowded but it will be after 6P.M.
You get free donuts after you get the bill which is nice!
Lastly, check in for 10% off your bill!
Good bbq. The coleslaw is delicious. The spicey sausage is not spice at all. But has a good taste
Food and services service were excellent.  Had the brisket for lunch.  Good portions and the the side are made from scratch.  Def would recommend

Just thinking about writing this review is making my mouth water... One of my husband and I's favorite date spots. We always prefer to sit at the bar. I love the warm atmosphere. Makes me feel like I'm in a real BBQ joint somewhere in the South. I have never been here when it's not busy. There is typically a wait, but usually not for the bar. (Pro-tip and part of why we are "Bar People.")As you walk through the front door, you are not only hit with the delicious smell of BBQ, but something else... Cinnamon? YES! Right behind the Hostess stand, you will notice a few of the girls making fresh, home-made, cinnamon and sugar covered donuts. They place them in cute little paper bags and they come with every meal. Even when you think you are so full, you couldn't stuff anything else in your belly... they hand you these melt in your mouth, warm, fresh out of the fryer, donuts. And you will finish them. Trust me. 

But let's start at the beginning shall we? Guest's get a complimentary basket of their home made Cornbread after they are sat, always nice, but I try to save as much room as possible for the good stuff. I have never gone to Bobby Q's without first ordering the Q-Rolls to start. The BBQ Version of a Taquito. A white tortilla, filled with Smoked Brisket and served with a chipotle dipping sauce. These little babies are the best "Taquito's" you will ever have in your life. The chipotle sauce is a bit sweet and compliments not only the chipotle but the Brisket very well. 

As for dinner, my husband and I always share and rarely come home without a to-go box. Our Favorite dinner to order is the Pick 2 Wood Fired Barbeque Platter. The Sliced Beef Brisket and the Smoked Chicken are my favorites. The Brisket is so tender, you can cut it with your fork. (That goes for any of the meats really. No need for a knife here unless you get a steak.) Drizzled with their House, Home-made BBQ Sauce. Perfectly sweet and tangy. The Chicken with its smoky, smothered in BBQ Goodness its juicy and tender. We have had the ribs, the pulled pork, and the sausage. Pretty much anything under the Platters section of the menu... we have had it, and I have yet to leave feeling unsatisfied. As far as sides go... I don't care what you get as long as you also get the Mac & Cheese. This is a MUST!! So creamy and decedent. It's hard to finish sometimes. The best Mac I have ever tasted. 

And there you have it. The best BBQ this side of Phoenix. I dare anyone to say different. Ok... I need to mop up my keyboard now and head to Bobby Q's ASAP. See you there!

This place has amazing atmosphere for a BBQ place. The meat is fabulous and the BBQ sauce even better. Service was fantastic and the manager was out greeting guests. This place stays true to the over 1000 reviews and four and a half stars. 

We will bring everyone we know here!!

Service is fantastic, meat falls off the bone, leftovers feed you for another day. Pulled pork, and the ribs are unreal. Mac and cheese is the best side as well. Mini Donuts in a to-go bag cause you won't have space to eat them after your meal. Place can get quite busy, but have only had a good experience so far.

I have been to a lot of great BBQ restaurants and unfortunately this was not one of them. Bobby Q was okay, but it was definitely not great. The food was mediocre, and the portions were small for a BBQ joint. In addition the service we received was not good. We had many lags in service throughout our meal, and part of our order was incorrect. I think there are probably better restaurants in the area than Bobby Q.

Great service! Good cornbread, decent coleslaw but it ends there. Our waiter was awesome. He deserves 5 stars. Had a gift card to use & was craving ribs, ordered the big pig platter and the ribs were all that was edible to my liking. Obviously this place isn't hurting because it is packed!!! I will continue to go back to my usual bbq joints.

Sooooooooooo beyond disappointed, this was by far our worst restaurant experience since we've stepped off our plane. The ratings are completely false, has anyone in this area ever tasted gourmet Mac n Chz because that stuff that they serve called Mac n Chz is the worst I've tasted in a long time. The chicken, well can you just say extremely bland & beyond dry. Let's not forget to mention the calamari slash fish sticks, are you serious Mr. Bobby Q because being a Floridian that was definitely not the calamari that we're used to. A Florida restaurant would be closed down if they served crap like that. The only thing we left confused with are the ratings, come in fellow yelpers you're supposed to keep it real & you guys are just disillusioned.

Stumbled across this place by accident and after seeing how highly rated it was, we just had to try it.

My husband LOVES BBQ. He's particular about everything from taste to texture to size portions.

He loved it all.

Great atmosphere, great service, food was brought out very quick too!

We had the Whole Hog dish with beef ribs, briquet, and rotisserie chicken. Our sides were coleslaw, baked potato, Mac and cheese, and vegetables. It fed three people and we still brought some home. 

Everything was exceptional! 

My only qualm, and it's a small one, not enough good vegetables. A few squash and mushrooms but mostly onion and bell pepper filler. 

This Cali girl can't wait to come back to visit again!

I can't complain about anything here.  The food was delicious, portions are generous, the service was fantastic, I loved the atmosphere, you get 10% off by checking-in on Yelp, AND they give you a surprise bag of homemade donuts on your way out!
This food was the BEST barbecue I've ever had!!!! Worth every cent! Don't miss it. The 30 minute wait was worth it! Service fantastic too! Management checked in with us during our meal!
Great 5star food, but it's overpriced.  There are other lower priced bbq places in Phx that are just as good

Bobby Q's was recommended to us by friends who had dined there the previous week. We made reservations and had a wonderful meal. I started off with a coconut lime mojito, which was delicious. The cornbread is incredible! We ordered the whole hog heaven, which includes 4 meats and 3 sides. We selected baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, brisket and sausage along with potato salad, ranch beans and grilled vegetables. This meal is great for sharing! The brisket was my favorite. The ribs fall off the bone! At the end of the meal, we received complimentary mini sugared home made donuts, which are to die for! Can't wait to try Bobby Q's again!
Loved it great food, place and atmosphere perfect and non the less staff super friendly!

*Cue N'Sync - It's Tearin' Up My Heart*

Bobby Q does in fact tear my heart up.  TO A MILLION SHREDS.

Here's the low down...

Good: 
-St.Louis Style Ribs, tender
-Service
-Complimentary Donut Holes

Bad:
-Beef Ribs, tough, small
-Sides: forgettable

Although I love all-things beef, the beef ribs here are a disappointment.  The portions aren't nearly worthy of the price tags and the only reason they serve you the butter-saturated corn-bombs is because you're technically paying for them.  I don't even think the pork ribs are smoked...

The service bumps it up a star, otherwise, a two-star establishment.
Best BBQ I ever had. Huge portions of meat on the beef ribs, what more could you ask for? Ordered a mix plate with pork, chicken, and beef ribs, everything was super tender and delicious.

This place is amazing!   And this is coming from people who were raised on Tennessee BBQ.  This is the real deal.  Tender, smoked meats and really good sides.  And the mini-donuts with your check were delish!  We will be back!

My wife and I and friends have eaten here many times. Great BBQ. Great steaks   Excellent grilled vegetables. Priced ver reasonably for what you get. Free fresh donuts after your meal. Only downside .......when it gets busy or near full, hostess staff has a difficult time contacting and seating waiting guests. I have been waiting a couple of times and been skipped over. Overall the food is great!!

First time at Bobby Q tonight. Read about it on MSN as one of the top 10 steakhouses in America. 

We arrived at 7:30 on a Saturday evening at t the place was hopping. We were seated right away tho. Our server, Amber, greeted us quickly. We were brought menus and cornbread as we made our drink orders. 

For entrées we ordered the Ribeye with baked potato and side salad and I got the three meat combo. I ordered Brisket, Baby Back Ribs and a Hot Link. My sides were Mac N Cheese and Pecan Cole Slaw. It all came to $80 plus tip with two glasses of wine.

The entrees were good. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, had minimal gristle and was flavorful. The ribs were very tender. The brisket was good but personally I don't like BBQ sauce on my brisket but that's the way it came. The hot link had no snap but was tasty. 

The Mac n cheese was excellent but the slaw was very boring. Why five stars?  Good food, excellent service and decent value.

Great experience! The food was delicious, the service was super fast, and the staff were extremely friendly. I had the pulled pork sandwich and roasted corn, mmmmm. The complementary cornbread was great too, and they bring you as much as you want, including some to go if you want. I highly recommend this place!

Is a great place to eat. They have different variety of foods that are all very delicious. Coming here quite often throughout the years the level of service is excellent. At night on the other side turns into a club. It's very awesome very much a lot of fun and good music Good Times.

I really liked Bobby Q. Made reservations for a Saturday night.
We shared some Q Rolls and then ordered our own entrees.
I loved the Q rolls. One of three at the table thought them a tad greasy, Two of us did not.
I had the three meat combo with Brisket, St Louis Ribs and Chicken. Mac and Cheese and fries.
Was the meat the best I ever had? No, but it was dang good. My favorite of the three was the Brisket. 
Shoestring fries are my favorite fries and what I opt for them when I can. I demolished the large pile they put on the plate. The Mac and Cheese tastes like it is made with that processed cheese food that starts with a V. I love that processed cheese food that starts with a V. I have had lots of different versions of mac and cheese with my BBQ across the US. They may have used a fancy blend of real cheeses, but in the end, the processed cheese food at Bobby's is right at the top of my fav list.
Adult beverages are a bit pricey, but they are good and not watered down.

The service was great. Joe was our waiter. He was new but I would not have guessed until his supervisor came to the table. 

I will be back.

Short and Sweet. 

Long wait on Sunday Night.  Make a reservation. Location on 27th packed. 

Fast and friendly service. 

Prices too high. $22 for 1/2 rack Back Back and $29 for full rack. $13 for BBQ sandwiches and hamburgers. 

Prime rib and Steaks way over priced for a BBQ restaurant. Drinks (alcohol) overpriced. If you don't mind paying MORE than go for it. Food is generous portions and GOOD but nothing special. 

Mini (free) sugar donuts after dinner are hot and tasty but watch the grease contained herein. All and All if you don't mind paying more and get lots of food and a loud dinning area then go for it.

Bobby Q is incredible! The service was amazing, the meat literally fell off the bone, and almost everything is made in house. Our server was awesome, even though it was busy we were very well taken care of. Truly on of the best in the U.S. Highly recommended.

Wow! The most delicious and tender brisket I've ever eaten. No knife needed as it just melts on your fork. Loved the bbq sauce, not too sweet and he spicy one has just a little heat. The ribs fall off the bone and the portions are plentiful. Will be going back for sure!

My new BBQ favorite!! Was so yummy, the wait was insane and we were skipped a few times because she forgot our preference was the patio, but once we sat down it was excellent service and amazing food.

I'm out on a girls vacation in Phoenix and my friend recommended this joint. 

This place has the absolute BEST BBQ I've ever had!!!!  Everything was great from the complimentary corn bread to the complimentary FRESH BAKED donuts they give you as you leave. I ordered the baby back ribs and catfish plate. It came with a baked potato and I requested Mac and chew and grilled corn as my sides. I also had a bottomless frosted lemonade to drink. 

I was so satisfied!!!  Mostly because I have plenty leftovers for dinner.

We came here for lunch with a group of 7. The staff was welcoming and service was great. Everyone was happy with their orders. I had the rotisserie chicken with Mac and cheese and the shoe string potatoes. Yum. Everyone else's entrees looked just as good. The food was fantastic and overall great experience. Will be back again.

I went here with a large group for a friend's birthday. This place is great for large groups! The atmosphere is casual with slightly higher-than-normal ambient noise/sound level. Dishes are large and can be shared. 

Cornbread is served prior to appetizers and entries are brought out. The bread is fresh baked, but in my opinion, slightly dry. It's okay if you're using butter though. I had the Smoked Sliced Beef Brisket with Mac & Cheese and Shoestring Fries for my two side dishes. The brisket was probably one of the best I've ever had. Piping hot, super juicy, and tender (fell apart on my fork as I was picking it up)... With just enough sauce so that the meat wasn't swimming. I liked how they served both mild and hot bbq sauces on the side so you could have more sauce as needed and to the spice level you prefer. The Mac & Cheese was very creamy, but nothing extraordinary. It felt very heavy. The shoestring fries were your typical thinly cut fries that are crunchy, but could use a little more salt. Towards the end of the meal, "donuts" are given in brown lunch sacks. They resembled beignets in the shape of donut holes. These donuts were very sweet and oily, but had a nice crunchy outside and soft inside.

Over all, I was most excited about the brisket (next time I come back I'll definitely reorder this dish). The donuts were a nice surprise, but overly oily for my tastes. I would recommend a reservation, since when I went the restaurant seemed quite busy. Not too shabby for a bbq joint in the southwest!

Sorry Yelpers!  This is not my first time here but the second!  Well if we count the take out my husband brought home Sunday than this is my 3rd.  Everything we have ordered here is fabulous!  On Sunday my husband got the 3 meat meal & I the loaded baked potato with brisket.  The brisket on my potato was Melt in your mouth yummy goodness!  Now I had to fast one of the hubby's St Louis ribs.  Oh my goodness - I was sad we didn't get a rack of those for my dessert.  It was soooo good!!! 

So 3 days later I am here for the ribs & that Mac n cheese. I am trying the Cajun shrimp as a starter which I always get the onion block.  Maybe new favorites to unveil today! Will be continued....

Soooo good. Brisket, Mac and cheese, q rolls, and the service was wonderful. Manager stopped by the table and asked, how everything was. Little donuts at the end was a great touch. Definitely will venture back again, soon.

We came here for a much needed date night w my boyfriend. He saw this place off the freeway so we decided to have dinner here. When we came in they said it was going to be a 20-30 min wait which was fine w us. We took a seat at the bar to enjoy a few drinks while we waited but we got seated before our drinks even came out. Already a plus. Our server, Cameron, came over introduced himself and gave us a history lesson about the location on how their meals are prepared, which was very good to know. He suggested the Q-rolls for an appetizer and they were amazing. Our meal was outstanding, I had the fried chicken, my boyfriend had the 3 meat combo. Lets just saw we had to take doggie bags home lol. Then I believe the night manager, Lauren, came over introduced herself and thanked us for visiting. I have not been to a location that has such great customer service in such a long time like this. I've been in customer service myself for over 20 years and it's wonderful to see that an establishment like this one truly cares about their guests. Thank you and we will definitely be back.

This is good barbeque in an unlikely spot -- Phoenix.  The meats are all slow-cooked, so everything is fork-fall-apart, Kansas City-style.  They have some variations in sauces, too -- a vinegary Carolina-type sauce, a spicy one and a sweeter KC sauce.

The sides are well-prepared, including traditional cole slaw; corn; beans; potatoes.  For appetizers, try the sauteed shrimp...perfectly cooked and garlicky.  When all is said and done and you hate yourself for eating that much meat, they give you a brown bag of freshly made, sugary mini-donuts.  Just so you can hate yourself a little more.

Service is always friendly and usually prompt.  Recommended!

If I am just judging based on the food...it gets 5-stars.  I wasn't wild about the chicken marinade or the presentation, but the bbq is good eats.  We felt  rushed because food came so quickly, but I am sure that had to do with how busy they were and the ease of serving bbq.  I would recommend the brisket and pulled pork, as well as the mac'n'cheese.  We had great service as well...wonderful people.

Had a fantastic evening with a ridiculous amount of food at Bobby Q's. Having visited on several occasions, we have never had a bad meal. In addition, the service is always outstanding.  Tyler and his team have always done a great job. In particular, Lexi is one of the best servers ever!

Best Mac N Cheese in town!! Best steak, best ribs, best onion rings...I don't think I've ever tried something I didn't love! Very friendly staff. "Take out" is fast and best of all the pint of mac n cheese is only like $4 including the Best corn bread in town!! Lol

Hands down one of the best bbq joints in Arizona, if not the entire south west! Friendly fast service, always tender and perfectly smoked meats, and fantastic drinks. Fair warning. This place is always busy. Make sure to reserve a table on open table to skip the wait.

The search is officially over. Call off the hounds and rendezvous at Bobby Q. With a name so simple yet perplexing, it must either be the greatest or worst barbecue to have ever existed in this Quadrant. Like a gift from a god, their smoked ribs and brisket are tender to the touch and have the tendency to fall onto the table before reaching your plate. Such tragedy. Minus 1. Their sauce oomph is somewhat mild along with its sweetness and to me that is a blessing. Being a victim of the great-bbq-but-bad-sides or the so-so-bbq-but-good-sides, Bobby Q has made a believer in me that there is a higher power out there that watches over us and to those that do great things, rewards us. Mission accomplished.

Wow! Some great barbecue at this place. It's a bad time to reminisce about the meal I had because I am hungry right now. I only wish the potato salad was more flavorful. Dessert, meal cornbread was all ridiculously delicious.

Delicious! The food was amazing and very full of flavor! Loved the vibe the restaurant gives off. Staff was friendly but we got sat a a big round table set for 6 but our party was only 3 and the table was in the middle of the room so slightly awkward but once we chowed down we forgot all about it. Highly recommend visiting for some brisket!
Corn bread is the best I have ever had.  The ribs are good, but the brisket was extremely mushy.  Appetizers are great and the ambience is fun.

Terrible service!! This was our third time here and I was shocked at the service. Our waitress was always missing and not coming to our table at all. When she did she never brought us back stuff we asked for. The food did not taste like it usually does. They gave us 3 donuts for a family of 5. Not sure if management changed but I was very disappointed. I will not be coming back!.

Such a great local spot. Our server Austin was super rad. Funny dude and had great recommendations and funny stories. Will definitely be back and recommend this place to friends when I'm back in town. 

The food was amazing as well!

I have eaten here numerous times with my wife. Not sure what is better, the food or the service. They always make you feel at home and bend over backwards to give you great service. Food is hot and fresh. I take out of town guests here and EVERYONE loves it.

Ok I am going to try and get through this fast because I am heading into a food coma and quick. So my friend and I had dinner tonight and we were seated by the lovely manager Rennie who was just so delightfully cheerful. Then we got the best server in the place Jack. I decided to change it up and get something other than the ribs so I chose the two meat combo. OMG the  pork and brisket was to die for and I was not disappointed at all. My food was full of flavor and the meat was tender and juicy you could cut it with a fork. I had chose this plate because my friend ordered the same and she made it sound so good and I was not sorry for not ordering the ribs which are oh so delicious as well. Jack was quick and on top of keeping our drinks filled and making sure we were taken care of so if you decide to dine here ask for him. When we had finished our meal we were pretty full and had opted not to have dessert but Jack was such a sweetie and came out with this heavenly chocolate ice cream cake. I was so full but this cake was just so darn good. I am home now happy and full with my puppy who is licking my bbq scented face lol. I had an extraordinary dining experience and will undoubtedly be back very soon. Sorry no pics were taken because the food was too good I forgot :) next time though.
A little splurgy, but so delicious!!  Ribs fall off the bone and the corn bread is so sweet and yummy!

We live out of state but definitely wanted to make sure we tried this place out. So glad we did. Cameron gave us great service. The food and drinks were great. Our only thing we would like to have had different is maybe put the bbq sauce on the side instead of on the meat before bringing it out. This way you could enjoy more of the meats smokiness flavor. Otherwise everything was great and the donuts were a great little surprise! We hope to be back again!
This is my favorite barbeque, the service is excellent. Pork ribs, pulled pork,beef ribs, brisket it's all great.

I really liked this place.  The atmosphere is cute and the server was so friendly and helpful. Everything we ordered tasted amazing.  I had a ribeye cooked to perfection.  Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes were so delicious.  The potato salad wasn't great but everything else was amazing. Loved the lemonade and my husband had the ribs and Pecan slaw.  It was just really good food and service.  I'm definitely going back.

Went with husband and famiky for first time today.  WHAT IS ALL THE HYPE? This was the worst!!!  Had the supposed great burger, which I say was mystry meat. From the first bite it tasted weird.  I had maybe three bites and the texture was so disturbing I could not eat any more.  Diarrhea  for the rest of the day, sure I was poisoned.  Husband had sausage; he loves BBQ, but not sure what he was served.  Crossed both our minds we were served food like the did in Chain Saw Massacre. Taste was horrible.  He didn't finish his either and had a stomach pains. Sticking with Dillion's from now on.  This place cannot compare.

The food was awesome, the atmosphere was great, and service was perfect. We really enjoyed the chicken, beef ribs, pork ribs and brisket that we had. The only let down was the corn bread which was kinda dry. The special (forget the name) margarita was ok... not all the waitress chalked it up to be but she didn't look old enough to drink so maybe that was the issue there. Ill get the thing in the pineapple I see pictures of next time. Its a little tough to find, but with GPS it was not too bad. Service was really great, our waitress was on top of it. A manager even came and asked if there was anything he could do for us. We forgot at the end of the meal to show our yelp discount and they reversed our charges and added the discount, no problem. We will definitely make it a regular spot! Only thing I was a little confused about is there seems to maybe be a bar on the back of the restaurant? We looked for it but couldn't seem to find a way in...
Went  again to Bobby Qs and once again found what I've found before: it's so good it's almost perfect.

I tried Bobby Q's tonight for the first time. Our waiter Jason recommended  some items and everyrhing was delicious. The Brisket was so tender and the ribs fell right off the bone. Great Bbq! I would highly recommend, if you're in the Phoenix area.

Ordered the Thanksgiving meal for 3-4 people for $75.  Came with grilled corn,  creamy mashed red potatoes, gravy and corn bread.  Wasn't the best meal I had but def would order this again.  Loved smoked turkey for a change than the traditional oven-baked Turkey.

Bobby Q was our first stop after leaving the airport when we arrived in Phoenix and it left one helluva impression! We came by in the early afternoon on a beautiful Saturday and there was zero wait which is perfect because we were starving. We had the choice of sitting outdoors or indoors but chose the latter because not only was it warm out but I saw customers sitting outside swatting flying bugs.

We ordered the whole hog heaven which is a platter where you choose two ribs, two meats, and three sides for $48. With the help of our waitress we decided to go with the baby backs and beef ribs, brisket and sausage for the meats, and the mac & cheese, ranch beans, and the shoestring fries for the sides. While we were waiting, we received complimentary cornbread. Moist, fluffy, buttery, and semi-sweet... these cornbreads were the best I've ever had! I'm sure they are SO bad for your health though but I could only live in the moment!

- Baby back ribs: May sound like a boring choice but nope. These were smoked to perfection and the meat fell off the bone. I was very impressed.
- Beef ribs: If I had to pick a favorite meat of the meal, the beef ribs would be it. These are finger-licking good with loads of meat, and even some bone marrow too. Just divine. Absolutely to die for. LOVE!
- Brisket: The first bite I had of the fatty brisket sent me to meat heaven. Succulent and explosive in taste. The leaner parts of the brisket was a touch dry and needed some extra barbecue sauce to fix that though.
- Sausage: Robust in flavor with a nice peppery kick.
- Mac & cheese: I'm not usually a fan of mac & cheese but these are great. I ate spoonfuls after spoonfuls. 
- Ranch beans: Smoky and savory. Love these beans. Again, best I've had. My favorite of the three sides!
- Shoestring fries: I'm generally prefer thick-cut fries but these were an exception. Impeccably fried and perfectly salted, these were very tasty and fun to pick at. Simple yet awesome.

After our incredibly satisfying feast (yes, we had leftovers for the next day!), we were given freshly fried cinnamon sugar doughnuts on our way out. They were amazing! OMG! The first bite of everything at Bobby Q was seriously like a party in my mouth. Every. Single. Thing. From start to finish.

I LOVE BOBBY BBQ! PLEASE COME TO NEW YORK!

A bunch of friends and I tried this place for my husband's birthday the other day after I found it here on Yelp.  For the love of everything tasty, this place was the BEST barbeque place I have ever been to (aside from a place I loved that went out of business in San Diego).  After reading all the reviews about the appetizers and entrees, I pretty much already knew what I wanted to order before even sitting down at our table.  

Our waiter, Lorenzo, couldn't have been better with his service and sense of humor.  The feel of the interior was a mix of casual and modern yet not too overly countryfied...there weren't dead animals hanging on the walls staring at me as I ate or hides either.

The group of us ordered the Onion Block for our appetizer.  I am not an onion person, but am a fan of the Bloomin' Onion at Outback.  But I can tell you right here and now that the Onion Block at BobbyQ's was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G-L-Y delicious!  It had the perfect crispy consistency, but what made it was the BBQ ketchup that it comes with.  I could have ate the sauce by itself.  The 6 of us ravaged it.  

For our entree, my husband and I went for one of the winning combinations, particularly the BBQ chicken and prime rib.  We decided on the ranch beans and the Mac & Cheese (after the reviews) for our sides.  I went to ask for an order of corn bread (3 for $1.50) but Lorenzo told me that he would bring us a basket for all of us.  So, I am not sure if that is something that is included, kind of like chips and salsa at Mexican food joints.  

The chicken was absolutely juicy and had the perfect amount of sauce and the prime rib was also juicy and melted in my mouth (we ordered it cooked Medium).  First, the Mac & Cheese was so very creamy and tasty that I had to stop myself from eating that and get back to the meat.  But the ranch beans tasted like so many others I have tasted, not bad though.  My friends and I, who also ordered the M&C, noticed a hint of jalapeno (not spicy, just the taste).
