We asked Lorenzo and he told us they have two types of melted cheese in the kitchen, one being the cheese they usually use for the M&C and then this pepper jack/jalapeno cheese they use for other dishes.  He had said they must have accidentally used the wrong one and that it hadn't been the first time it happened.  This was so not a problem, b/c that jalapeno taste was actually what made it, I think.  I'll have to request it next time.  

The desserts didn't impress me much, but I knew from the reviews, we'd be getting free donuts before we left.  I loved that touch!  Mark my words, we will be going back more than once.  I'm sure we will take our in-laws and my family to give them the chance to taste BobbyQ's deliciousness!!!!!

Amazing food!!! Started off with the ohhh sooo good corn bread!  I had the pulled chicken sandwich.  They put home made skinny onion rings on the sandwich!! Slice of heaven on earth!! The home made warm mini sugar donuts...DIVINE!!
Hubby had their brisket platter with potato salad!! It was delish.  We are from Texas so we know good BBQ!!

Definitely tops in the Valley for barbecue.  The pulled pork platter and the sandwich are scrumptious.  Mild or hot homemade sauces are perfect.  Plus how can one not love the warm cornbread to munch on while your order is being prepared.  To top off, you receive a bag of mini warm sugar donuts when you get your check.  Definitely worth the drive.  Also four function rooms for private and corp events.  Full carry out menu as well.
Enter from southbound I-17 frontage road or 27th Ave.
I'm newish to Phoenix,it's my random visit to this place being the closet place for me I've choose this but thoroughly enjoyed the service and I had south chicken which is amazing.
Love this place we got so muc b food we had a lot of left overs if yur looking for a sit down with a rustic look this is the place.

this place was ON POINT!

server was awesome! we had the brisket, baby back, st louis ribs, sausage, grilled veggies, coleslaw and bread pudding! nothing bad to say about anything. everything had fabulous flavor, grear taste, good smoke, high quality and a LOT of love! when i come back to PHX i want to try the baked potato.  plenty of parking in the back and this place has excellent prices!

keep it up guys!!!
Amazing BBQ!  Due to the distance we do not eat here regularly, but the times we have, we have been pleasantly surprised -- even our picky eater, eats all his food!

We have saw the good reviews, so we decided to drop in and see it for ourselves. We went to the to go side and ordered to take home. I wish we wouldn't of waited so long. I ordered the pulled pork with shoestring fries and corn on the cob. My wife ordered the half rack ribs and same sides. My pulled pork was delicious and the spicy BBQ sauce is now my favorite sauce I have tried here in Phoenix. The ribs were awesome fall off the bone good. the corn tasted smoked as well best I have ever had, and the cornbread was great. By far the second best meat I have tried and best spicy BBQ sauce here back home love the volcano BBQ sauce at whole hog cafe. Portions were just the right amount to fill you up. Can't wait to try the sausage next time.

This is a neat place to take out of towners.  It's off I-17 but very out of the way and dumpy looking from the outside.  Then, surprise - it IS open!  

We tried the whole hog heaven which was plenty for 4 people.  We got the St Louis ribs and baby back ribs - both delicious and saucy.  We also got the hot links and beef brisket.  I wasn't a fan of the hot links.  The beef brisket was slightly dry but with a bit of sauce it was quite delicious.  

We also got corn and macaroni and cheese as sides.  I wouldn't recommend the corn - its very buttery and overcooked.  Mac and cheese was better, but mostly because its nice against the salty meats.

We also started with the Q-rolls(?) which was beef rolled in pastry material.  The sauce it comes with made it quite tasty as well.

All in all, if you're looking for a nice, sit-down bbq restaurant in Phoenix, this one's hard to beat!

very good place.  The mac n cheese was actually too rich and creamy for me, but if that's the way you like it, it will be your new fav.  i like mine baked.  chicken and pulled pork sandwiches were great, but i can't scream about the chocolate overdose dessert.  they did send us home with some free freshly made doughnuts, though, so i don't have much right to complain.  we'll be going back.

Food was delicious!
The service was a little slow, but it's Father's Day so I anticipated that. Our server was still very attentive and helpful!
The only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because of the cleanliness level. It was generally clean, but I was turned off by the overhead dust on the decorations and light fixtures. Don't want dust in my food. Otherwise, I highly recommend Bobby Q!

Barbeque is not my favorite style of cuisine. There. I said it. That having been said, I find myself going to BBQ restaurants on a regular basis because the men in my life live for it. So I got talked in to hitting up Bobby Q. Sure...why not...

The food at Bobby Q is EXCELLENT. Probably the best BBQ I've ever had and as I said, I don't like BBQ very much. Very flavorful, not overly sauced, good sized portions. All around, excellent.

So why the 3 stars? Three reasons.

1) RIDICULOUSLY high prices. It's BBQ, not Morton's steak house. Our party of 4 bill was nearly $100 and there wasn't an alcoholic beverage in sight....

2) Service was not up to par at all. You do not leave the appetizer dishes on the table when you are putting down the dinner dishes. And you don't leave said dishes on the plate after the lady of the table has gone out of the way to stack said dishes perfectly so you can easily take them away. And you don't leave them until said lady has to ask you 3 times to take them away. 

3) Restaurant was dirty. Sorry but leaving tables unbussed all around us just isn't acceptable at the prices you are charging much less at a lower-price-point establishment. 

Bobby Q...get your service up to par, take a good look at your price points, and CLEAN. I'll be back I'm sure since the men in my life love BBQ. I would love to be able to raise your stars!
Amazing place for the best BBQ in the Nation.  You can really taste the time and effort on preparing the food.

I'm in Phoenix for a pretty lengthy business trip and will make sure to hit this place again before I head home. We started with the Q rolls which are essentially a brisket egg roll. These were incredibly tasty. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with the potatoes salad which was great as well.

Apparently I never finished this review since I was in phoenix in january. Last week I returned for work and hit Bobby's again! Wow great food this time I ordered the brisket! Again phenomenal probably the best BBQ I've ever had.
Great BBQ! Rib meat fell off the bone, brisket very delicious, great corn bread and deep-fried donuts. Great service from Austin, too. Definitely recommend.

We orginally set out in search of another bbq place but it was closed so we ended up at Bobby Q!  Thinking it was going to be a chain-style restaurant.  Boy, were we wrong!  The building and atmosphere was true to the BBQ tradition.  SUNDAYS at Bobby Q!!  $28 got us a family feast of Smoked Chicken, Smoked Brisket, Smoked Ribs(St. Louis style), Smoked Pulled Pork, 2 sides (We chose Mac & Cheese, Mashed Potatoes), Cornbread.  The cornbread was slightly sweet, buttery and very moist!  All the meat was very tender.. but I am partial to brisket which really impressed me the most...  My boyfriend loves ribs and said on the ride home that they are better than his favorite.  The spicy BBQ sauce was a little too tangy for me and needed more kick.  The server Jon was very informative about the menu and knowledgable about BBQ.   We left very full and happy with alot of food to take home!  It was worth the drive across town!

Wow! We were in this area and decided to yelp for the highest rated restaurant. Bobby Q's was the one. We were so happy with our choice! The food and service were both amazing. Our kids walked away saying it was the best restaurant ever. The baby back ribs and smokehouse burger were the best. We also enjoyed the corn bread muffins at the beginning.  We will definitely be coming back. It's a new favorite for us.
This place is where you come when you want good BBQ. Try the ribs, of course, and they Bobby Q Rolls.

Always good service. Taylor the manager almost always makes it to your table during your visit.  If sometimes something is wrong with your order they ALWAYS make it right. They make it feel like you are important. I have had everything on the menu and like it all. It is a little high on the price side. Try the chocolate desert...Wonderful.. They give you a little bag of cinnamon donuts on your way out..
other than the lopsided table, food was spot on....very unfortunate that it wasnt an all u can eat brisket night...delicious!

Wow. Some of the best BBQ I've ever had. Beef and short ribs fell right off the bone.  Awesome coleslaw and the Cajun shrimp.  Yummm.  Great wait staff and friendly   When in Phoenix I'd go here again in a heartbeat.

Don't go when it's busy on a Saturday early evening last Sat: 10-11, went there around 5:30 pm went straight to bar thinking we would be served faster than waiting in line for a table and we like to interact with the bartenders.  WRONG!!!! First off we sat down being the first couple, then another couple, then another couple and then a single person.  All of the other people were served and acknowledged before us!!!  We thought, are we invisible?  We had never been treated like this before!  Tony one of the bartenders NEVER made eye contact with either myself or my husband once!  They were smashed busy full service bar also going to the kitchen to get us cornbread.  But when you first sit at a bar you would think the bartenders know to look up occasionally and greet the customers with at least "We'll be right with you"  Tony looked pissed and unhappy the entire time we were there.  The food is fantastic, my husband and I shared the full slab of baby back ribs with two sides: mac n. cheese and coleslaw, excellent with the extra spicy, hot sauce on the side!  Nice hot doughnut holes delivered to us after we were done!  We have eaten here couple times before and got takeout a couple of times when we went camping.  Spoiled our Saturday date night for a couple of retirees.  Hope it wasn't because I was Asian female and he was grey haired older man, kept thinking it was because of my race but not sure, Tony greeted and went right up to take care of a Black couple that sat down next to us.  Who knows, very sad, bothers me until today.  Never treated like the invisible couple before at a bar!

It was close to the hotel so we dropped in. Great surprise.  We sat at the bar and had great service.  Don't miss the Q rolls, baby back ribs, or the outstanding beer selection. Shout out to San Tan Brewery for the delicious Pale Ale. Please stop in and check out the best "little" BBQ joint in Phoenix

It's been a while since I ate there but went with friends who go there once a week (at least).  The food was wonderful...anything on the menu was a good choice and everything I tasted was delicious!! Great job people.

My review has changed,and by no means is it a reflection of the service provided by the staff were great. I was disappointed in the quality of the ribs I got. Hoping it was an off day. But the disappointment in the quality stuck deep down; I was looking forward to those mouth watering, fall off the bone ribs. Skeptical about coming back just to be disappointed again. May have to go to Mesa location next time. Further but would be worth it if they keep their standards.

"Very, Very, Very, Very Good!" my wife's cousin's daughter(what' her official title anyway?) said after her dinner and that sums up this place. 

Great decor. Fast and friendly service. And most importantly good food. Go on Sunday's and they have special called Hog's Heaven at a discounted prices ($28). It comes with 1/2 pound each of the following: Chicken, Brisket, St Louis Ribs, Baby Back Ribs and two sides. More than enough food to feed 4 adults and 4 children. 

The brisket was my favorite. It was melt in your mouth good. I would have preferred if they did not douse it with BBQ sauce as I like it on the side. It was still good. Ribs were off the bone delicious. These were my kids favorite. The chicken was moist. For the two sides we ordered shoe string fries, they were OK, nice and crispy and the grilled veggies. 

When you leave they give you complimentary donuts, which are freshly fried in the front. They have a cool looking mini fryer. They were yummy according to my kids. I did not partake in those as I was stuffed. 

I will be going back to this place again fo-sure. 

BTW there is a bar with a dance floor on the other side of the restaurant for those of you who are interested. Look they were just getting ready for the night crowd when we were leaving.

Bobby Q's has the BEST ribs ever!! I believe they cook them for close to 20 hours so when you get them they are super tender. Once you taste their ribs, you will only come here for ribs. Service is always good! I have nothing but good things to say about this place!

Fantastic service! Our server, Anthony, knew the menu inside and out and offered great suggestions. I don't like barbecue sauce (I know, I know) but the rotisserie chicken was fantastic. I had corn and mac n cheese for sides which were both great. They have a good drink selection and full bar. I had tons of left overs so expect to get a to go box. Unfortunately, I was wayyy to full for dessert but the options looked delicious. They give you a bag of cinnamon donuts when you leave and when they learned we were in a hotel nearby they loaded us up. The service alone deserves 5 stars. I will definitely be back my next time in Phoenix.

Great food and extraordinary service. What can you possibly ask for more?! We shared a whole rack of St. Louis style ribs. The bbq sauce they brought on the side was sweet and the meat literally just came off ths bones. You don't have to bite it off. And our server knows every detail of food on the menu. She is ready to answer all the questions you have and thorw some recommendations. Had a wonderful time here.

Great place!
We ordered Our Thanksgiving dinner 2 years ago, it was really tasty and the portions were enough.
Planning to order again our Thanksgiving dinner this year.

Food was great! Drinks we're great! Service was great! The overall experience was awesome! After having a horrible experience at Thee Pitts Again we had to find a new BBQ place and we are glad to have found this one! We went on a Saturday night around 6 -7 and we had a 15-20 min wait which was well worth it. One of the managers brought us a sample of the Macaroni and Cheese.... IT WAS AMAZING! Almost needed a glass of milk to wash it down with! We will be returning!

Feels like a chain. Competent but nothing special.

I had the two-meat plate with beef ribs and brisket; sides were beans and cole slaw. The beans had a nice kick. Meats were competent. The regular sauce was really sweet. The spicy sauce was not too kicky. It was $17.50.

Stopped by for lunch on our way to the Grand Canyon with a group of 7.  YELP didn't fail me again on this one!  Awesome 5 Star service, good quality bbq, very nice both inside and out!  I can see this place being slammed during peak hours, or at least it should be!  Definitely would make a return visit if ever back in AZ.

Best BBQ Brisket EVER!  Just went there for lunch and it was awesome as always.

Fast/friendly service, reasonable prices, excellent brisket and mac n' cheese!

Ohhh...and those lil donut things they give you after your meal. Soooo good!

Can't wait to go back!

This place was amazing! The food was delicious and the service was the best! Justin served us, and he was absolutely amazing. He knew it was our first time here, and he did a great job making is fall in love with the place. I rarely get good service when I go out to eat, so I was excited when I got GREAT service here. If the food was mediocre (and it's not) I'd still come back because it was such an enjoyable experience. 

But the food! I had the pulled pork sandwich with potato salad and Mac n Cheese. Everything was just great. If you still have room in your belly after the meal, get the donuts!! Get them! You won't regret it.

Eat here often. Actually, I tend to order to go more than I do dine in. I have to say, the food is excellent.  Best BBQ in the Phoenix area . Staff is pleasant.  I only gave 4 stars because I feel the staff behind the bar could be more personable.

Great place. Great food. We commute to Phoenix from various spots around the country. But the highlight besides the food is the staff and especially the bartender Chelsea and server Alexis B. Alex's has a an infectious laugh that will get everyone laughing.

I visited this location last night with an ***acquaintance***. My first issue was my server needed to check my ID, fine, not an issue. My issue is he grabbed my ID and moved to the other side of the table holding my ID down and very close to the person across the table in clear view. IDs contain personal info, such as an ADDRESS!!!!!!!! He held my ID so long that this person I was out with could have taken down my address. Need training on proper measurements and safety precautions when checking IDs. 

Moving on, the drinks weren't good to me.. I tried 3 different drinks, The Hammer (or whatever), that drink that comes in a pineapple, and some sangria type drink in a jar with blueberries.. yeah, just no! All three?! Come on.. a better drink menu please. 

Lastly, we move into my meal. It was pretty good. Had the salmon dinner.

Now, the lady Alicia ( not sure if I spelled it right) I'm assuming she's the manager, was great came over twice to ask if the drinks were better and make sure the food was tasting good. Very nice lady

I'm a Texas native and grew up on barbeque. I knew how to barbeque before I could ride a bike. Okay, that might be a stretch.  I've lived all over the West. As a consultant and general contractor, I've been able to travel around quite a bit in the Central and Western US. Everywhere I went, there was always something wrong about the Q.

I stepped onto the Bobby Q "campus" (big property) and was immediately 'greeted' by beautiful shrubs and trees. The exterior is intentional, laid-back, and I love it. It sets you at ease so you can get ready for some great food. It reminds me of the roadside shacks we'd stop at on our family fishing trips in Texas. 

When you walk in the front door you're greeted by people who have "tenure". Some of the wait staff have been with the owner over 20 years. Now that's a testament to good business. We (my wife and I) were seated and served their awesome cornbread and butter. Our server took great care with us since we were 'newbies'. 

I had the Brisket, St. Louis Baby Back Ribs and Chicken. HOLY HANNAH - When that brisket hit the tastebuds, I thought I had reached Nirvana then stepped in Valhalla. My eyes rolled into the back of my head and I let out a let out a slight guttural sound of satisfaction. If I wasn't so hungry I would have stopped at that first bite knowing I had reached the apogee of barbeque gastronomy. 

Well, I'll spare you the ennuis of the rest of my experience, but suffice it to say that you too, could reach your barbeque Nirvana by coming here. Have I been back? YES!!! I will keep coming back to get my "fix". I hope you enjoy too.
Monday nights are not packed. no reservations required. Seated right away. closes at nine so late dinners might have a time crunch but the waiting staff is super nice.

All you need to know is... PULLED PORK!!! It is seriously one of the best pulled pork I've ever had! I'm from California and we are blessed with Phil's BBQ and my sister and I prefer Bobby Q over Phil's BBQ!

What We Ordered
- Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- 2 Meat Combo: Pulled Pork and Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- Steak Sandwich with Shoestring Fries
- Catfish Po Boy Sandwich with Roasted Corn

The complimentary corn bread was good! Very moist! The beef brisket was good! The meat was tender but I felt that I needed to add the bbq sauce for it to taste better. The Mac and Cheese was super duper cheesy!! I loved it!! The Mashed Potatoes were really good as well! Super buttery and smooth.

The Pulled Pork (not pictured because my sister was sitting too far) was AMAZING. It was good by itself or with the bbq sauce! I really wished I ordered this instead, like I originally planned. Luckily, my sister let me sample some of hers. :) My Mom enjoyed her catfish po boy. She's really picky so that's telling you something lol. My Sister and Mom loved the roasted corn! 

The only bad dish was the Steak Sandwich but I don't know if that's because my Dad ordered it medium well. He said it was too chewy and had no flavor. His shoestring fries were really, really salty and soggy! He was very upset, to say the least lol.

They give you little sugar donuts, (Thank Q's), at the end of the meal! They were so cuteeee! They were just average tasting but I enjoyed the fact that they were free! I will come back for the Pulled Pork!

Holy cow!  My family had some amazing BBQ here.  Best brisket I ever had and the baby back ribs were to die for.  Corn bread is basically as good or better than cheddar biscuits at Red Lobster and that is saying a lot.  Service was excellent and our waitress was very attentive.  If you love BBQ, this place showed why it's rated so high.  Can't wait to go back!

Not the best BBQ I have ever had, but it is pretty darn good.

Because it is not really obvious from the street, we overshot Bobby Q and had to do a turnaround in quite a sketchy strip mall a couple of blocks up. Half expecting a total dive we were pleasantly surprised to find the restaurant itself nicely appointed.

Before we even ordered our food a tasty basket of cornbread was brought to the table. We ordered a sampler plate containing 3 different meats - pulled pork, brisket and St. Louis ribs as well as a BBQ chicken sandwich. We couldn't decide on which sides to select but when our server brought us a sample of the mac & cheese to try our minds got made up in a hurry.

On the sampler plate the St. Louis ribs were terrific, the pulled pork was not too bad but the brisket was kind of dry. Fortunately the server had brought large containers of 2 types of BBQ sauce to our table so we were able to moisten the brisket with the sauce. The chicken on the sandwich was moist but I found the sauce a little too mild and sweet.

The service we received was friendly and attentive and the little doughnuts in the to-go bag was a nice touch.  Overall, worth a repeat visit if we are in the area. 3.5 stars.

Traveling all day looking for somewhere to eat, we stopped here taking a risk as to what we would get.  It was after 9pm and we were not expecting much.  I was extremely shocked at the quality in a great way.  It was so good that i had to come back a second time while i was in Phoenix.  
The service was amazing and the food was tasty.  The first night i had the pulled pork with mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese was amazing.  The second night i had the beef brisket and mac and cheese.  I cant remember the other side i had because the mac and cheese was that good.  
On the first night after eating, we were given a complimentary desert, not sure the name of it, but it was amazing.  And then the little doughnuts were the next arrival.  They are hot and ohhh so good.  A great finish to a great meal.  
I will go back again and send others to eat here.
The food was fantastic and their house beer is possibly the best beer I've ever had!  Rebecca was our server. She was very helpful as it was our first visit.

We are out of town folks from CA & Hawaii & this is amazing BBQ. 2 of my colleagues had the rotisserie chicken and I had the 2 meat combination of Tri tip & ribs & the BBQ sauce was delicious and the meat tender. The portions were huge. Yummy onion ring block and we ended the evening with ice cream in a hot apple cobbler. Must come back when I visit Phoenix again!

One of the best bbq restaurants that I have ever been to. There is always a long wait, but the staff was able to help us find a table at the patio. I think the patio is better than inside because it's spacious, and there are mist to cool the temperature off. We ordered Hog Heaven, fried onion rings and couple drinks for four of us, and we couldn't even finish all the food. 

Corn breads are delicious and just like the ones I had in North Carolina. It's not too sweet, outside of corn bread is a bit crispy and inside is soft. When you placed the butter on the top of corn bread, and the butter just melts right of away. This combination added extra flavor to corn breads. 

Whole Hog Heaven: beef ribs, pulled chicken, baby backs, prime briskets, mac & cheese, meshed potatoes, roasted corns. 

Man o Man, They are so delicious. briskets are moist and tender. you don't need to add any bbq sauce. Prime briskets are great to eat by itself. I like to eat mac & cheese after having briskets. M&C here are really good with a slide sweet taste in it. 

- Baby backs were cooked so well and the meat fell off the bones easily. 
- Pulled chicken was juicy and didn't have the dryness that chicken breasts usually have. 
- Beef rib is delicious and still attached to the bone, some people like it roasted so the meat would fall off easily. However, for me, I prefer to chew the bone. very yummy.

If you ever visit Phoenix, definitely stop by here and make reservation at least couple days ahead of time.

Guilty pleasure! The cornbread is so good, My bf and I seriously just ordered a bag of cornbread to take to his apt for dinner! LOL

Great customer service, this is one of those places where no matter what you try it's still going to be delicious.

Bobby Q is one of my favorite places to go whenever I have family or friends new to Arizona. It has fantastic, flavorful, smoky BBQ options in a clean spacious dining area. With all the choices and sides, it has something for all lovers of BBQ. 

My favorite starter is the Q-Rolls; but who could resist a crispy eggroll stuff with their delicious and tender smoked brisket. And usually we order the Whole Hog Heaven, which really is a feast for everyone eating it. You get to pick two ribs, two meats, and three sides. You cannot go wrong with anything you chose. I usually get the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, smoked sliced beef brisket, and smoked pulled pork with a side of sweet potato fries, pecan cole slaw, and mac & cheese. 

What I recommend:
-- Q-Rolls
-- Whole Hog Heaven
-- smoked sliced beef brisket
-- baby back ribs
Bobby Q is the best BBQ restaurant in Phoenix. It is always a great meal whether at Lunch or Dinner.  Love those little donuts too!!
The food and service were fantastic. We had a large group reservation and had many people not show. The manager and staff were so accommodating, understanding and kind. I will definitely be back.

Yes!!!! Everyone's meal was soooooooooo good!!! I was a little worried about the area this restaurant was in and got a little worried about the signs in parking lot that they aren't responsible for theft in cars! Yikes is this a problem here? 

We decided to give it a try and we're glad we did stay!!!!  The mashed potatoes were sooooooooo good and so was the Mac n cheese! I highly recommend those sides!  The food was all amazing and they give you free donuts at the end! What what!!! How awesome!!!!  

We will visit again if we return to this area!

This place is classier than your typical BBQ joint, which of course means just a little pricier.  But with the extra money comes high quality food.

My most recent visit, I ordered the brisket sandwich with shoestring fries, and was quite satisfied.  Service was fast and friendly, and the food was excellent.

First up was the cornbread, which was very flavorful and full of buttery goodness.  The meat was tender, juicy, and went very well with the regular barbecue sauce.  The fries were also good - I couldn't figure out what was special about them, but whatever it is, it works.

Overall, a very good place, highly recommended.
One of our family favorites!  Amazing food, and if you have Garrett, amazing service as well!

We were very underwhelmed........the waiter went on about their meat is smoked for 18 hours,  thats bs........the baby back ribs were obviously boiled and maybe lightly smoked, the pulled pork had a very faint smoked flavor.  The side dishes were good, but the meat is ok at best, not real authentic bbq.
Love this family owned restaurant! Great service and best baby back ribs ever!!  My Texan husband agrees!!!

Bobby Q is an up scale restaurant having delicious foods y romantic environment.This is a quality restaurant in all areas service is professional but very friendly to assist you w your order. I look foward to going back to Bobby Q for the Holidays they will be all festive can't wait. I have only given 4.5 stars . Because I never want a place to quit trying to keep their standards high. This is my highest rating. Because this place has earned it. Happy Holidays everybody be kind y share good will. Forgot Yes they do serve alcohol beverages.Cheers!
This place has some of the best BBQ in phoenix!  The platters are HUGE and the sides are all really good! (the mac and cheese is to die for!) Plus...free to-go donuts for dessert!

Coming from LOs Angeles I really wanted to try some AZ BBQ. The place was very nice resembling Lucilles Bbq. We ordered the  hog heaven, and easily shared amongst 3 of us. It was very moist, and delicious I enjoyed the meat entrees very much. What I didn't care for was the Mac n cheese it was a little too velvetta for my taste. It resembled the Mac n cheese from KFC. The coleslaw was delicious as well as the baked beans. I would probably eat here again but keep in mind for peeps from Los Angeles it's comparable to claim jumper IMO. But the service was A+++ and family friendly atmosphere. But this is coming from a person who frequents Bludso's BBQ in Compton so I feel like I have higher standards. Lol but definetely worth a try.

You know how it is.. when your jones'n for something .. your just gonna have to find it.. ENTER yelp app on the iPhone! Boom .. Bobby Q's within 15 minutes of my home.. during the rain and the wind.. thats what I needed .. good old barbeque.. Really.. I couldnt decide how or what to order to get my comfort food on.. because that is the way the menu rolls.. Ended up with the 2 meat platter.. split with someone else.. salad on the side.. perfect.. pulled pork, beef brisket.. yum.. 
mashed potatoes are the kind grandma used to make.. 
my cohort in jones'n crime got her carb on with the mac/cheese.. (kind of velveety' for me..but still yummy).. 
AWESOME corn muffins.. 
Alfonso, our waiter.. the best Ive had in months:-) 
Oh yeah.. they love yelpers .. mention it.. see what you get:-)

Love this place!! It was our first time here and we'll definitely be back. Great service, our waitress was super friendly and always checked in, and two managers stopped by to ask how we were doing. The food is incredible too, we loved the Q-rolls and also got the huge BBQ combo :) it's expensive, but tons of food! We both ate a ton and had almost a third meal left over.

As a Phoenix native, how the hell have I not been here before? Honestly, I skipped this place because I heard it was a club. And a BBQ place. But I've never heard of friends coming here for BBQ, only drinking. It's on a rough-ish side of town. WHY THE F*CK ARE THEY TELLING ME ABOUT DRINKING HERE AND NOT EATING? Skipped this place for years. Mistake. I recently started back up at school and had to drive down the i17 for many miles a couple times a week. I ride a motorcycle and never had to look at the signs when I passed this place. IT SMELLS SO F*UCKING GOOD!! I always knew when I was passing Peoria/Dunlap. I decided to have my birthday dinner here despite having never been before. I call the day-of my dinner and make a reservation for 20. No problem. They ask if I want separate checks while making reservations. Being in the industry, this is a good sign. They greeted us all with waters and we had two servers. We all get served basically at the same time. Impressive.  Best ribs I HAVE EVER EATEN, EVER. Dope. At this point I'm pretty hammered and totally feeling myself. They bring me a fuggin complementary  dessert with a candle and now I am vaguely remembering my friends signing to me...BUT I AM SO FULL. What the actual F*CK am I supposed to do with this ice cream? I take a bite and all of the sudden there are these little baggies of the best donut things I've ever put in my mouth. So hot and perfect and mushy and yum. I need to go back. Seems like a perfect place to grub and then party on. Next time I'll get less drunk at dinner and try to venture into the club scene they have. Hopefully it isn't too hood!! Lol

Yooooo BBQ ribs is one of my fav foods. I've been to many places from Lucile's, Gus's BBQ, Bludsos, and to Phils BBQ. I have to say of all the BBQ joints this is the best one I've been to. 
I would highly recommend the BBQ platters from a two rib combo or three meat combo of your party is 2-3 ppl. My dad went to town on the meats and I cleaned house on the ribs. I normally prefer baby back (usually my favorite) but the St. Lois ribs were especially good here. I heard really good things about the Q rolls but unfortunately wasn't able to try it. If I'm ever in the area in AZ again, I will def make sure to come through again to try the Q rolls along and enjoy the most amazing ribs I've ever had!

This place brings back some memories. It used to be the old Bobby McGee's themed restaurant, and I used to go on dates with my daughters when they were just little girls. It was dress up time with Dad, and they really enjoyed meeting the various servers that acted out their various personas. 

The last time I was here was a few months after they remodeled this place, and turned it into Bobby Q's. The food wasn't that impressive then; therefore, I never made it a point to return.

Due to an accident on the I-17, we had to make a detour on Dunlap to escape the traffic. Instead of having to endure a prolonged wait for dinner, we opted to give this place a try. I forewarned my wife that I didn't think that this place was any good, but we would give it a try anyway.

And we were about to be quite pleasantly surprised.

Riley, our server, greeted us with such enthusiasm and made compelling statements  about how amazing this place was. #89 in the country as far as BBQ joints are concerned, and over 1100 reviews on Yelp. 

His statements were received with some trepidation by yours truly, and in my mind, I was saying to myself - we shall see!

My wife ordered the Wood Fired Top Sirloin Steak, and I ordered the 3 meat combo (Pork, Brisket, and Chicken). For our drinks, we ordered the sweet tea.

The tea was just wonderful. Not too sweet and not too tart, and had zero after taste. Just the way the both of us like it. 

We were provided with fresh homemade cornbread that was just pure evil! They were absolutely and ridiculously delectable. You could just taste the sweetness, along with all the calories and the carbs! A caution sign should accompany these babies.

In spite of the myriad of people eating here; especially the two large parties that apparently were part of some spring training tour group, the service was prompt and efficient. 

Nary an empty moment went by without Riley continually checking in on us and apprising us of our meal's status.

Not too terribly long afterwards, our meals were presented to us.

My wife really enjoyed her Sirloin Steak, and she was quite impressed with the roasted corn that came with it. And the generously lavish heap of shoe string fries made a great accompaniment to her already delicious meal.

My 3 meat BBQ combo was quite heavenly. The smoked meats were very tender, and the sampling of the various BBQ sauces provided just brought out their flavors even more.

In the middle of us enjoying our meal; Renee, the manager stopped by and checked in on us as well. She was engaging and quite friendly. She even helped clear our table as we progressed through our dining experience.

And when we were all done, Riley spent a few moments recapping our experience.

We had nothing but great things to say about the service and their food. Both were thoroughly enjoyable!

Love good BBQ and really love this place! We had lunch, got there a little late, 12:40pm, so not a huge crowd. Waitress was fun, helpful for first timers. We both had the 3 meat lunch with one side. I had chicken, St. 
Louis ribs, and brisket. Wife ordered brisket, pork, and St. 
Louis ribs, she had the mac and cheese for her side. I could not decide on potato salad or cole slaw, our waitress brought me both! All the meats were some of the very best, the brisket better than any I have ever had. Ribs were good, have had some close, but not quite as good as Bobby's. Chicken was very moist and tender. Corn bread was very good, came with whipped butter but did not need any on it, it stood alone like a champ. The only item that was not absolutely best was the pork. It was good, just not over the top like the other choices. Their potato salad is the BEST, we always measure the salad against MIL's, and this was close. Cole slaw was standard fare with chopped pecans, not a big chopped pecan fan, so I didn't really care for it, was just standard old cole slaw, nothing "special". We also got a personal visit from the manager, she was very friendly and sincere. All in all, LOVED IT and will go back.
The best BBQ place west of Dallas TX.  Ask for spicy BBQ sauce. If you order roasted corn no or easy butter. Corn bread was good as well.

Brisket is ok, sauce is decent and atmosphere is a little hood come 8pm. I dined here over the weekend Bc I was to lazy to fire up my grill (way to humid out) so I went here w/ my bro Rob and was hoping for some goodness. I don't think I'd eat here again since its not my idea flavor/taste of BBQ. Don't let my review steer you away from trying it though, everyone has their own preference when it comes to BBQ so I'd try it and go from there.
Official rating,
Food: ***
Customer service: **** (manager very sweet , waitress was su-lOh!)

Drinks: *** (Sangria was ok, beer a little warm)
Always stop here when out for the races ! Great food best smoked sausage ever! Always ask for Jessica great person and very friendly

This place is delicious!!! I'm usually not a fan of BBQ, but I think it's because I've only had subpar barbecue up until now. My boyfriend on the other hand, always has an appetite for the sweet and savory goodness that it offers.

Take out was quick and we were out the door in 15 minutes, despite a packed house. Service was very friendly too.

I'd recommend the brisket and baby back ribs. My boyfriend said the St. Louis ribs were just ok. The sides were equally delicious! The mac and cheese + cornbread (complimentary) were my favorites!!!

Compared to Phil's BBQ, our party agreed that Bobby Q's is much tastier. 

Next time we'll opt to dine in, and I'd like to try the bread pudding as well!

I love Bobby Q and can't believe I haven't been here in over 5 years!  We brought some out of town family to enjoy some great BBQ.  I enjoyed the rotisserie chicken with a side of roasted corn and mac 'n cheese - wow, that was amazing!  The cornbread they serve should be illegal...it is that good.  I love that they make homemade donuts as you walk in/walk out and they give them to you at the end of your meal.  Bobby Q's has a really nice atmosphere and the service is great too!

Originally, we weren't planning to go here, but as we kept on passing it by from other places to our hotel, I yelped it see what their rating was. It surprised the hell out of me to find out they averaged 4.5 stars. Now, me and Kathy are huge BBQ fans and wanted to balance out our weekend with a meat splurge. We decided dinner was going to be how it was going down...

Again, the stoopid Google Maps app fails us again and has us feeling our way to Bobby Q. We finally get there and got sat down immediately. We got served a basket of cornbread that looked like hockey pucks. There was a crunchy texture on the outside, while the inside was moist and fluffy. It was spectacular, but don't fill up on them, unless you are on a diet and weren't ordering anything else. I'm usually skeptical of ordering brisket, unless I know there was some Texas affiliation. Lots of the Yelpers raved about the brisket and when the waitress recommended it, it was a no brainer. What was difficult was what else to order.

We settled on the the Whole Hog Heaven, after much debate between me and Kathy and interrogation of the waitress. The Whole Hog Heaven is their best feast where you can choose 2 BBQ meats and 2 pit ribs types, plus 3 sides. We went with brisket, smoked sausage for the meats and St Louis ribs and Texas beef ribs. For the sides, we ordered the mac n cheese, roasted corn and shoestring fries.

First off the bat, the brisket was as good as advertised by Yelpers (thanks, y'all) and our waitress. Juicy, moist and tender with a smoke crust gives the brisket an unforgettable experience. Another winner was the St. Louis ribs. It literally fell off the bone and was oh so tender. The sausage was good, but not outstanding and the beef rib was also just acceptable. Against the waitress' suggestion for their "smoasted" chicken, I do think I will try the smoked roasted chicken and the baby backs next time. All of the sides were tasty, but the stars were the brisket and St. Louis ribs.

To top off a grand BBQ evening, we were given a brown paper sack of mini donuts that were sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar. That's a nice touch. Overall, I give Bobby Q a solid 4 stars on the basis of the brisket. You can have a brisket sandwich and die happily, and yes, its that good! The service was good and the food came out fast. 

I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu. There was a couple next to me,  who ordered enough for a small army. The guy raved about how the Southern Fried Chicken was the best he had ever had. The dude looked like a food heavyweight, so he must have had a few country fried chicken in his lifetime, so I'm adding that to the list.

Until next time, BBQ compadres...

Went here for a date night. My fiancé and I were impressed by the decor. Call ahead to get your self on a waitlist! The drinks were great. The food was pretty salty for our taste, even the appetizers. Our waiter recommended the q-rolls, ruined our appetite for dinner and both of us thought it wasn't great as the waiter hyped it up to be.  The ribs and chicken were the best part. Good over all but don't think we would come back, again everything was way too salty! Would be nice if they added healthier sides maybe a collard green or side salad option instead.
This place was the worst food and service. The waitress was rude and the manager was worse

This is my first time in this place. I was looking to take my family for the sunday's lunch and we wanted a texan food. Our first option closes in sundays, so we picked this place with no higher expectatives. I was completely wrong:

All the staff was friendly. They set up a table for us in a minute, the place gave me a good first impression. Since we have 3 kids (1,3 & 5 yo) we selected the typical brisket and susage with sides (grill veg, mac & cheese and potato with bacon) My wife and I shared the orders witht the kids. All the orders were served in less than 10 minutes. 

Honestly I was expecting to pay close to $ 50, my suprise was that all this costs 31, I put down an extra tip for all the good service, food and the place itself. 

I score 5 stars for this place.
I'm from Texas and we know good BBQ.  So take it from me it's Gooooooood.   I had the Brisket and Baby Backs which was so tender.

Great food and great service.  The Hostess, Waitress and Manager were all friendly, helpful and attentive.  I had the rib eye - tasty and cooked as ordered.  My friend had shrimp chimichurri - she really liked them.  The free donuts were delicious.

Would give them 10 stars if I could. Went here for dinner on our way back from Grand Canyon and the positive reviews do not disappoint. My husband and I shared "The Whole Hog," which comes with a choice of two ribs, two meats, and three sides. Our favorites were the St. Louis ribs and the brisket! Super tender and juicy and not fatty or gristly. Everything is so good here. Also great service. Wish we lived nearby but will longingly wait for a location in LA.

Been here twice and both times it has proven to be hands down best BBQ I've had. mind you I've never had Texas BBQ but this has set a high bar for me. the whole hog heaven is way too much for 2 people but perfect for 3-4 people! Best brisket, and Ribs!

Great food great service fast fresh my wife and I visited this location March 8th Potter was our waitress fast friendly food blew our minds we've been to lots of BBQ spots in Phoenix but this is the best we had q rolls for appetizers they were great and hot we got the hog heaven for main came out hot and on time corn bread kept coming so did the drinks corn bread was to die overall slap yo momma food will be returning on pay day lol

We were traveling through Phoenix on Father's Day and I was trying to find something great for my dad. Yelp led me to Bobby Q as it was close to my hotel. The hour and a half wait time given made us question for a minute but we decided to stay. Best choice ever! Only waited about 20 minutes and had one of the most amazing meals ever. Although they were packed, the service was great! In fact we decided to come back a week later on our way back home. We made a reservation this time but didn't really need it at 5:30 on a Monday evening. Food was still remarkable, Ashlynn was a wonderful server, and we cannot wait to go back again on our next trip through town. We had prime rib both times, corn, baked potato, Mac and cheese, and the Q rolls which are sooooo good!

Duuude! The hamburger here is one of the best in the Valley. I forgot which Yelper recommended it to me, but he was right. Just very good, high-quality ingredients -- and the right amount of them. Soft, flavorful bun. Fresh, hand-formed, patties. Mmmm!

Oh yeah, the BBQ here is good too. Their sauce is great; and they serve it in heated containers so it doesn't get your food cold. Try the BBQ Chicken sandwich -- with fries or coleslaw because both are top notch.

Lastly, if you check in with your phone, you'll see a 10% discount to Yelpers if you mention it.

The Best BBQ Ribs restaurant I ever been to, hands down.  Love this place!!!  If I had a lot of money and time I would drive all the way from Glendale, CA to Glendale, AZ every month just to come to this place.  Think about opening up a new restaurant here in LA.  You would be welcome!!  Love you guys.  Great service, lovely décor, fantastic and mouth watering food.  Fall off the bone tender meat.  The side dishes were outstanding and well prepared with excellent recipes.  They were so tantalizing, fresh and plentiful.  Don't forget to grab a strawberry lemonade (Hold the sugar on the rim, though---Sugar Overload!!!!).

My family and I were itching to try something new for dinner, and my mother suggested barbecue. We went to azcentral.com and found the reviews for Bobby-Q and decided to give it a whirl. I can tell you, we were not disappointed. The portions were huge (enough for lunch tomorrow) and our waiter, Alonso, was incredibly knowledgeable about not just the food but the history of Bobby-Q as well. When we first saw the prices, they seemed a little steep, but after we saw how much food we got, it was perfect. And, at the end, we got a bag of donuts that are made fresh in-house, and WOW, they were reminiscent of a delicious churro! Overall, it was really superb, and we will definitely be coming back AND recommending it to our friends!

Okay based on the abundant reviews we decided to try the lunch menu. I had first thought of ordering the whole hog heaven but didn't think there would be enough for four so we each ordered individual meals. I had the soup and slider. I had the baked potato soup with a brisket slider. The soup was good not as thick as  others I have tried and the slider was awesome. The roll was nicely toasted and a good portion of brisket. I should have asked for extra sauce as my sandwich went dry halfway through.  My family ordered the the catfish po boy kids chicken finger,jumbo bbq potato,sampler platter and a brisket platter. The only complaint we had was on the brisket platter.... Small potion for the pride. Overall there was a vote at the table on how bobby q fared against another famous bbq place and the results were... Cornbread... Bobby q.... Mac n cheese ... FD.... Tea... Bobby q... Brisket .... Split soup Bobby q and fries split. Overall for a family of six we would probably go back to the famous platter of meats and fixings but I enjoyed the service and food today at Bobby Q's.

Had the pulled pork and Mac/cheese. Very yummy. 

Strawberry lemonade very tasty too. Nice decor/ambiance and very friendly service.

My first official food consumed in Arizona - it was a fine choice!!!

I'll be back!

Bobby Q is a unique property, in which one side is a Barbecue restaurant and the other is a music venue. A couple weeks ago, we celebrated a co-worker's birthday here, and although we were outside when it rained, we didn't have to worry about getting soaked. The beers were quite tall, and the food was excellent! Along with ordering the pulled pork mini-burritos and wings, we were also given small sacks of fresh cooked mini-donuts. Nowhere have I gone to, have those been served; you wouldn't think of a BBQ place serving such delectable little donuts!

In regard to the music, I can't say I've been there but did have a DJ friend there recently headline there for a Thursday night. The set up looks good, for being outside of Downtown Phoenix and Old Town Scottsdale.

Can highly recommend if not for the BBQ, at least for the small sacks of fresh donuts!
Brisket was amazing. Best barbecue I've ever had and I have had a lot of A lot of barbecue. Staff is in credibly friendly service was good and bartender was on point.

Good Food.  I had the smoasted chicken. Smoked and roasted.  It was good.  My son's had ribs and ribeye.  All the food was cooked to our liking. Everything tasted great.  The restaurant was clean, noisy, cool decore.  We had an excellent meal in which someone else treated us to.  This place is just a little out of my budget especially feeding my boys who alway spring for the ribs and steaks.
This place is great! I had prime rib yummm plus great service. I'm a big fan now. Me and my husband went there for our anniversary and both loved it. The area isn't great but the food is worth it.

This place puts me into a pretty good meat coma every single time I go.  I blame the restaurant.  The food is so good that I can't stop shoveling it into my face, even when I know it's quitting time.  The brisket is the best I've ever had, excellent roast corn and mac and cheese, and strawberry colada is a total mouthgasm.  It's very cozy in the restaurant and nice and dark so that you don't have to be ashamed as you're smearing rib sauce all over your face.  But seriously....this is the best BBQ I have had in the Phoenix area so far.  So go!

Our server Michael was awesome! He really knew his stuff and I would never have guessed he had only been there 2 weeks! We had beef ribs, pulled pork, baby back ribs and brisket. The food was amazing! If you want amazing service, ask for Michael!

Solid four-star restaurant but not five. The beef brisket was the most flavorful brisket I've had in my entire life; A penetrating yet not overpowering smoky sensation.  However, I was disappointed with two of the three the barbecue sauces.  The "regular sauce" is sweeter than catch-up with just a little more sophistication.  The spicy sauce tasted more like corn syrup mixed with hot sauce.  However the Carolina sauce was a genuine flavorful masterpiece.  It's commonplace for vegetables in barbecue joints to be lackluster, but a four and one half star 800+ review restaurant should be an exception to the rule: it was not. On the more delectable side, we had the Apple cobbler for dessert -nine out of 10.

Ok this place is officially AMAZING! I always passed by on my way home from work and made it a point to open my window every time I pass by. I wanted a taste of that savory aroma passing through my nostrils. I've been budgeting and not going out to eat so much but today I was celebrating a personal accomplishment and thought "why not?" I'm so glad I stopped by for lunch. Once entering, the friendly staff showed me to a table, where the bartender-didn't catch his name, but was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful- suggested the sampler. In a sampler you get 3 meat options, 1 side, and cornbread. I ordered the ribs, brisket, pulled pork, and mac&cheese as my side. Service was quick and prompt, and let me tell you, those were probably the best ribs I have ever had. The brisket was flavorful, yet missed the mark a little there regarding texture though it was a bit tough(which is the reason for 4stars, not 5). Pulled pork was simply delicious. And the mac&cheese was super rich! I loved every bite! I did not leave empty handed either! fresh from the kitchen 1/2 dozen cinnamon sugar doughnuts right out the door. This place is so welcoming and delicious I wouldn't mind coming again with a party.

An excellant choice for a family looking for great prices ,great staff, great manager ,great food ,great manager ,its a10 ,a 10, yes a10, the interior and patio dining are awsome,we loved it ,will be back!!!!

Hi, 
I visit Bobby Q on 7-19-2011 after reading the good reviews about this place, so I want to check it out myself since I'm from Texas.  I ordered a Whole Hog Heaven for me and my hubby with bottle of wine, and for my daughter I ordered the pull pork sandwich.  Alright people, the barbeque was ok and for the people who have dentures this is place for them.  The ribs, meat melt of the bone alright but it's too mushy.  I can't even pick up the bone because the mushy meats just melt in the tray.  Good bbq ribs, meat should attach to the bones when you break it and melted in your mouth when you eat it that's call good bbq people.  Their pull pork was good and their corn bread was delicious seriously, but the brisket was too dried and the meat is brownish like old meats.  After tasting the brisket I just stop eating my dinner.  Lucky I had a bottle of wine.  Good brisket supposed to be little char on the outside, pinkish inside, and juicy.  Barbeque sauce normally served on the side because the good briskets meats are juicy and tender; therefore, the sauce doesn't need to poor all over the brisket.  Our server was alright doesn't know much about wine though, but I can't complaints because I'm not at fine dining.  The ambience was ok, music ok, but menu little greasy and some bread crumbs in it that's not so ok to me.  The price is very cheap.  Quantity is beyond my expectation but need to work on quality of foods.  For three of us the bill comes to $86.37 including tips.  I hope this review help some of you, thank you!
It was amazing, our server Bryce gave us a complimentary dessert because we celebrating a night out just the two of us! Great portions and great food. Amazing!

I am NOT a BBQ lover, so when I give this place 4 stars, I mean it...it's pretty darn good. I've tried all the BBQ spots in the East Valley i.e. Joe's, Famous Daves and I am indifferent to them. A drug rep brought us catered lunch from Bobby Q's and I had never heard of it. They have received national awards for their food and apparently they won State Best Mac&Cheese. We had cornbread, mac& cheese, pulled pork sweet & spicy flavors, coleslaw, and salad. I tried really hard not to go back for seconds on the Mac & Cheese and Pulled Pork that was catered at our office, but I my will power cracked and I dove back into the M&C and pork. It is so good, the flavoring is on point, the coleslaw is crisp and not runny. I'm a fan for sure. If I'm in the area I will definitely try to check out the actual restaurant and take my family or friends there.

Love love love Bobby Qs
We go there as much as possible the food the service and the atmosphere at all top notch. We take our friends and family there as much as possible. We even took our employees there for a work party. Everyone loved it .. can't wait to go there agin.

Made me miss Kansas city. The meat melts in your mouth the vegetables where crisp and flavorful. Best barbecue I have tried in the valley. Service is fast and phenomenal. I would definitely will be coming for seconds

Have only had the brisket and the mac n cheese. Constently cooked and service is good, cute waitstaff and quick service. Havent tried anything other than brisket sandwich and catfish fillets. Cocktail selection is blah, sugery and few craft beer selections. Always craving the mac and cheese tho! Been here too many times to count over at least 5 years

We moved here over a year ago and have been looking all over the city for BBQ that reminds us of our old Kentucky home.

Well, it's safe to say we've finally found it. Holy mackerel! We absolutely adored our dinner here. Our server, Lorelei, was lovely, and the manager(?) who came by to check on us was equally as wonderful. 

We will DEFINITELY be back! We are in love

Bobby Q has great BBQ at an reasonable price and above average portions.  You will not leave hungry.  

Don't let the exterior of the building fool you.  It looks ghetto and run down but I think that is the look that they want.  Once inside, it looks better and again the BBQ is delicious !

Friendly servers.  Complimentary donuts.  Yes, I'm a fan !

Went during lunch time, it was the best bbq I've ever had! The St Louis ribs and mashed potatoes were amazing, the corn bread and mac n cheese were great. I'm from San Diego and was in Arizona for spring training I'm so glad I found this place. If I'm ever in arizona again I will make sure I stop here. It was heaven!!!
Excellent service, fun atmosphere, great food!.. We loved the outside patio... even in August!! Highly recommend this restaurant.

I visited Bobby Q's in March 2013. Let me just preface this review by saying I am not the biggest BBQ fan there is. I lean more toward the veggies when it comes to food preferences, and you'll certainly never see me eating ribs.

That being said, I LOVED Bobby Q's! I had a cheeseburger (yes, I do eat burgers), and it was downright delicious. Mac and cheese was amazing as well. My friend had the ribs and couldn't get over them.

Highly recommended!
Love Bobby Q, glad they opened a location in the east valley. Used to drive over to the north Phoenix location, but not its right in the neighborhood. The wings are some of my favorites in town

You have to put ratings in context. This is a BBQ joint and as far as they go, this is 5 star. 

Atmosphere is great, service is super and the food was tasty, prepared to order and perfect portion size. Great little extras - like Pecan Cole Slaw - who would've thunk. I ordered the ribeye steak and it was cooked exactly to order delivered with great sides. Great beer selection on tap and those donuts - warm, soft, sweet donuts. 

My only regret is that I didn't go sooner or more often on my trip. I'll be back!

Excellent barbecue in Phoenix! Bobby Q is a great place to go for good barbecue in the Valley with authentic meats and extra touches to make everyone happy. They have a funky location off I-17 so you need to exit and drive the frontage road to find the place. Once you arrive, you will not only smell the smoke, but you will enjoy the unique decorations and friendly atmosphere. The restaurant is huge which is good for groups.

The baby back ribs were just amazing. Sweet, smoky goodness falling apart with all the fight long cooked away. They also serve brisket egg rolls, fall apart cornbread, and super cheesy mac and cheese. The Q Rolls were a special treat since the flavor of the meat survives the deep fryer and is a very unique item. The bag of fresh mini doughnuts at the end of the meal is a nice touch and a tasty ride home.

Their location is a little tough if you have to fight traffic on a weeknight, and there is really not much else around. Prices are a bit high, but you are paying for good barbecue. I really like this place and am glad to have it on my trips to Phoenix!

I was really surprised to see how busy the restaurant was on a Monday evening but it was in the middle of Spring Training. The restaurant is much more franchise-y than I expected but it still has homey roots.

We ordered the three meat plate of St. Louis ribs, baby back ribs, and beef brisket with pecan coleslaw and baked potato. The meat is incredibly, incredibly tender. It ended being too soft for my preference but if you enjoy fall off the bone BBQ this is the place for you. The sides are delicious and go well with the food. We found the BBQ sauce way too sweet for our tastes. Service is fast and everyone working is very friendly. The little touch that was lovely are the cinnamon sugar donuts you get at the end of your meal. A nice treat to top off a pretty decadent meal.

I enjoyed the restaurant overall although it didn't fit my personal preferences. It's a fun place to check out when you're in Phoenix!
So good! Stay there or take away the food is always good. It has a busy atmosphere, but it fits the place. I have not waited more than 15 minutes to be seated, even when they are busy.

My husband & I tried this while in Phoenix based on the Yelp ratings & reviews. We were not disappointed at all. We ordered the whole  Hog Heaven meal (baby back ribs, St. Louis, pork, brisket, cole slaw, mac & cheese, and mashed potatoes).  Our meal was just amazing. Service was great. Definitely planning on returning when in the area.
This place has some yummy bbq! Their Mac and cheese and cornbread were incredible! The service was great too! The only negative I saw with this restaurant was there were flies everywhere.

Stopped for lunch during a long day on the road, and so glad we did! Atmosphere is just right for a much-needed break. Clientele appeared to be mostly working professionals on their lunch break. The free cornbread is the best I've had--fluffy, with the perfect amount of sweetness. I ordered the brisket sandwich w/ beans and wife ordered the St. Louis ribs lunch special w/ coleslaw; both meals were outstanding. Water was frequently refilled without having to ask. Waiter and manager were both very friendly. This is a well-run, well-led restaurant. Kudos!

Amazing barbecue where they're known for their ribs and brisket. The Ribs were alright, but the brisket... delicious and tender. Corn bread served on the side compliments the BBQ cuisine but I didn't find it to be the best I've ever had; just OK. Something about the lack of heartiness of it threw me off. If you're in the mood for the richest mac and cheese you'll ever taste, grab a side. Soooo cheesy I felt like I had to take a break and eat my steamed veggies to prep my taste buds for more. Of course the french fries were tasty and mashed potatoes tasted like butter which is always a winner in my book. 
The place itself is located in a bit of a weird place; you'd never think it was there. But when you find it and go inside, the overall feel is very welcoming. When you walk in you'll notice a server frying up donuts. Not sure if you grab these on the way out or what but we asked the server about it and got some delivered to our table to share. Great food and laid back atmosphere. BBQ is top notch, try for yourself.

I just went here for lunch today after reading lots of good reviews. I have to say that I cannot argue with the great reviews. The atmosphere is fun and the prices were decent. I ordered the brisket with mac and cheese, BBQ beans, and pecan coleslaw. The hubby ordered the brisket, pulled pork, shoestring fries and roasted veggies. The meats was amazing, so tender and moist. The BBQ sauce had the perfect flavor, not too tangy but not too sweet, and also not too thick. And the sides, OMG sooooo good. The mac and cheese was creamy and cheesy, the beans were sweet and meaty, and the coleslaw was creamy, refreshing, and the pecans were a nice contrast. The hub let me try his fries and although they were very small and thin, they had a good flavor and I loved that some were soggy (I love soggy, greasy fries). Oh and how could I forget, they give you cornbread cakes before your dinner arrives. They were very tasty. They also give you mini hot doughnuts with cinnamon and sugar at the end of your meal. They were good, however, a little dry. I think they could have used more flavoring in the dough or maybe some sort of icing to dip them in. My only other complaint is that our waitress was a bit slowing in refilling our water and bringing a box along with our check. I would say that this place definately lives up to the hype and positive reviews. However, living in Maricopa, it takes close to an hour to get to Bobby Q's. So I probably wont be driving out there just to eat at Bobby Qs but if I was in the neighborhood, I would definately make sure to stop  :)

Food was delicious. Second time coming here when visiting Phoenix. Corn bread they start the meal off with is delicious. 

The decor is great. A lot of effort went into it to make it look so nice inside. 

Would have gave it 5 stars but took about 30 minutes to get good out. Bbq never should take that long to serve. 

Meal was great and desert was even better. Service was good too.

Mini donuts at end of meal are the best.

Started with the Q-Rolls. Shredded BBQ Brisket inside flaky pastry. Great idea. Great with Chipotle sauce. I had Baby Back Ribs with a loaded baked potato and Mac 'n cheese.  Everything was prepared to perfection.  Oh....and the cornbread.....best I've ever had.

I would definitely return. I would also say Texas BBQ is the best. Service was excellent.

Was in town for business and found this place on Yelp. Got there around 3pm and got seated right away. Got the following:

chicken tenders: very good. spicy bbq sauce was excellent
mac n cheese: excellent
mashed potatoes: pretty good

Prices were very reasonable and service was friendly and the food came out right away. Would absolutely return here.

This place looks great, its incredibly spacious, amazing southern decor, insanely clean bathrooms and extremely friendly people.

The food is incredible, especially their ribs, we did the HEAVENLY HOG which is supposed to be for 2 people but TRUST ME you need a third person to finish this off otherwise you will die driving back home due to the most incredible food coma of your life. The hog consists of 4 meats and 3 sides, the meats are plentiful and we got baby back ribs, st louis ribs, brisket, and sausage and sides were mac n cheese, string fries basically thin fries, and ranch beans which were basically pinto beans and some pulled pork inside (i didnt taste any ranch).

Baby back ribs were 5/5 for sure, super tender and fall off the bone type, one of the best i've ever had. St louis ribs were also 5/5 and slightly different flavor and has some of that cartilage but i dig that stuff so nom nom. The brisket was very lean and smoky on the sides, which some people like but I was eh about it, I think i just dont like brisket all that much in general unless its slightly fattier than usual so this one was just alright for me 3/5. The sausage is really interesting in that its a bit dry, but they have this marinade prior to it at least it tastes like it did and has a really smoky flavor which i thought was interesting but overall just decent, 3.5/5. The mac n cheese is some of the cheesiest/creamiest mac n cheese you will ever have it was seriously some of the best ever in my opinion and I dont usually even like mac n cheese 5/5. Beans were fairly standard with the pulled pork, good if you like pinto beans 4/5. The string fries could be better in that it was fairly standard fries but slightly hard, not really but just if i had to nitpick 3/5. Overall you get A TON of food for $48 and i highly recommend you have 3ppl eat it despite the menu saying 1 really person could consume this, highly unlikely unless you're a competitive eater. 

Complementary corn bread is given prior to the meal and IT IS THE BEST CORN BREAD EVER its so good that I forget why I used to hate corn bread. Oh right probably because just about everywhere else I've had it it was always dry and bland, but this place is the ultimate exception 5/5. Also after you pay you get complementary donut dessert and I think they say they bake that in house and its a super light, fits in the palm, a small super sugared donut and its also delish 5/5. I'll definitely come back here and probably one of my fav bbq places of all time.

My, oh my! Every once in a while you stumble across a gem when you're in another city. This gem was located right across the 17 freeway from our hotel in Phoenix

Saw this places' sign from the freeway and it looked intriguing. Not much on sweet style bbq sauce or brisket because I'm biased  (Raised on Eastern North Carolina style chopped pork) but this place was off the hook!

Walked in the door and told there was a 1 hour wait so we decided to wait. Found a spot at the bar so we decided against waiting and ordered our food from there. We started off with these apps they call Q-Rolls and they claim they're "World famous". Well, they deserve that title as far as I'm concerned. Bbq brisket rolled in pastry shells like taquitos with chipotle and bbq sauce for dipping. Mercy!!

For my entree, I had the St. Louis and baby back ribs with roasted corn and tater salad. The meat was super tender and falling off the bone. The waiter offered to bring 
me more sauce but it was super delicious just the way it was. Not a big fan of tater salad but this was great so I'm a fan of theirs. 

My wife had the fried catfish and same sides as me and she was well satisfied, She really don't like Bbq but she liked the taste of mine a lot.

DERN!!! I forgot to mention the cornbread! This is what bbq should be served with. Last, we finished up with the bread pudding. My wife said this was the best she ever had so that's saying something, Bread pudding is her favorite dessert and she never likes anybodys but her own.

This place was not completely laid back with paper towels and checkered table cloths but they weren't over-the-top fancy either. To me, a great place to drink a beer and bust the buttons on your britches.

A favorite of ours when we're up around North Phoenix.  We love the dry-rubbed-wood-smoked-tender barbeque meats!  For my hubby and father-in-law, myself and my son, we always order the Hog Heaven.  It is really enough or all of us!  You get 2 choices of meats and 2 choices of pit ribs with 3 sides for $36 dollars !  We get a few extra order of corn bread. The meat on the ribs literally fall off the bones and the brisket is soooo tender!  They have a KIDS MEAL menu, but my son loves the baby back ribs with the sweet barbecue sauce.  It really is the best in the valley that we have tried so far.  Dillon's comes a close second, in my opinion.

This place continues to impress.  I am compelled to write an update only to say at a recent visit we had one of the best dining experiences ever, anywhere.  

The food remains top notch, best quality, but the SERVICE... wow... they've always gone out of their way but this time the service was incredible.  Our server was on top of it 110%, the management came to make sure we were happy, I mentioned one small concern in passing and it was as if the place stopped for us.  No one rested until it was addressed.  I can't tell you how much we appreciate being... appreciated!

People say "you drive all the way to 27th Ave & Dunlap from north Scottsdale to eat?"  I say HELL YEAH we'd drive twice as far for great BBQ because it's hard to get the real thing like this.  Besides it's a matter of perspective, Phoenix metro area is small compared to Chicago.  The greater Chicago metro area is HUGE, it spans at least 6 counties.  We drive 55 miles each way for real BBQ back in IL.  And we're lucky to have it that close.

Oh yeah - for the first time we had the "whole hog" and it was an experience.  It was 2 meals for us, and the leftovers were just as good the next day.
Sooooo good. All the food is amazing!  I crave the corn and love the BBQ sauce. And don't forget the mini doughnuts for dessert! Great mood lighting and a comfortable atmosphere.

Great layout, the place is great for getting together with friends, family or that one special person.
Love all your bbq, ribs are always a thing of beauty!
Everybody's food was great and the waiter was very nice the service is awesome and I love how they give the little doughnuts at the end ! Great place to eat .
Only good on Tuesday. Watch out for the door man with butter teeth!
The food was amazing and the waitress was super nice! I would definitely come back and recommend it to other people!

This is our third time to Bobby Q. My husband requested that we go there for his birthday dinner. I have to start by saying that told the hostess that it was my husband's birthday but nothing was ever said about it. I don't expect alot but a candle stuck in the mac n cheese or in a donut as acknowledgement that it was his birthday would have been nice. That said, our server, Zac, was lovely. Very attentive and pleasant. Clearly, the hostess just didn't bother to mention the birthday because I'm sure that Zac would have said something nice. He was great. The baby back ribs were yummy. Very fall off the bone. The mac n cheese is quite cheesy and I love the cornbread. On this occasion, we didn't have dessert because we were stuffed from ribs but I have had the banana dessert before and it is spectacular.

Wow! Didn't go here for a long time, because I didn't want to get sucked into another BBQ place that claims good, authentic BBQ. Now I'm upset I waited soooo long to try it. 

Started with some great warm cornbread. Perfect size for a pre-meal snack...and just the right amount of sweetness. 

I ordered the 3-meat combo, for only $3 more than the 2-meat...great value!  I weigh in at 315lbs...and I didn't even GET to the 3rd meat - way too full. I got brisket as one of the meats - honestly, tasted like it was right off the smoker...that's NEVER the case in BBQ joints, it's always dry and flavorless by the time it gets to the table - not here folks, may as well been eating it right from the pit. Very impressive. 

Sides: hats off to the Chef, FINALLY...a BBQ place that has crafted their sides to be as good as their meats. And a special mention...the mac & cheese had great flavor! I also got the corn...tremendous. Can't wait to come back to try the other sides...

Energetic atmosphere, great staff, and tremendous food at a good value. 

Thank You!!!

This place needs a sixth star.  I'm impressed every step of the way.  Polite and helpful on the phone, personable and prompt waiters, perfectly portions cooked to perfection.  I've been to every BBQ place within 10 miles of home and I was very happy to have found Bobby Q's at 9 miles out.

This is my favorite BBQ place! Better then BBQ in Austin.  The brisket melts in your mouth and the bark is yummy and salty.  To die for! We will be going back for sure when we visit again for next year's baseball spring training! The chicken and sausage were good too.  I really liked the corn. They give you free corn bread while you wait. Austin was a great server.  He made sure we had everything we need and our cups were filled at all times.

I will definitely come back to this place again. I LOVE their BABY BACK ribs. Don't get the St. Louis style ribs unless you're the type that like lots of meat and less fat on your ribs.  Their ribs are juicy and tender. Their Strawberry lemonades are also very tasty. 
Our waitress was so nice and always checking up on us. She was also very helpful in giving tips on which ribs to get. 
I love the free cornbread and the donuts when you leave. :)

Great BBQ, comfortable family atmosphere, service was spot-on and friendly (our waitress was Carmella). I visit mom in Phoenix at least once a year.  This place is going on our list of recommended restaurants to share with friends and family. I had the BBQ Brisket dinner with my 2 sides: the pecan cole slaw and beans. Although I usually tend to prefer hot BBQ sauce, I prefer the Carolina sauce - delish!!
Bobby Qs is amazing. I loved the ribs and the Mac n cheese! The sweet tea was awesome too. Treat yo self and come eat at this place!

Good service, decently priced, foods pretty quickly brought out! My boyfriend and I shared an entree with a two racks of ribs, and tri-tip! For our sides we had greens and sweet potatoes. Everything was delicious, very tender meat. And good flavor! Would come back-- haven't found a BBQ place out here that beats it yet
Love this place. Excellent food. And for the best experience, sit outside on the patio. Amazing atmosphere. Highly recommended.

I recently tried the new Bobby Q and I wanted to try the original.  The outside is run down and off a side road, so get your GPS out if you are not from the area.  The hostesses were a bit chatty with each other and I decided to not wait for them to finish their conversation and went to the bar area to get food.

The bartender was a splendid and excellent waiter/host for us.  Great service all the way around.  They start with decent cornbread and then you have an extensive menu to choose something.

I do not know why people say this is a $$ place as it is $$$ to $$$$ depending what you order at a minimum overall.  This place is not cheap, however, it is worth giving it a whirl.  The salads were made exactly how we wanted them.  THe chicken was really moist for being a a breast.  The red potatoes are very good and the roasted corn have fantastic flavor.

To end dinner they give you some small beignets to eat.  So tasty and  nice way to end the meal.  The newer facility near the mall in PHX is MUCH nicer inside, however the food is consistant with quality and flavor.  Great place to go, however bring your wallett  :)

One of my very favorite restaurants. The food is delicious and the service is always really good. Hubby and I were both craving the southern fried chicken since they didn't have that at the new location in Camelback (we went there about 2 weeks ago). Bobby Q never disappoints!!  Yum!!!

My family and I frequent this restaurant often, the food is good yet pricey.  MY REVIEW INVOLVES The fact that my wife wanted to throw a graduation party for 30 people. The manager was non friendly and not AT ALL communicative with information, almost as if they didn't want our money or reservation. They offered us a small weeknight window, no menu suggestions, no flexibility.   

We have taken our party elsewhere to a restaurant That was happy to serve us and make an extra $1500
