Good BBQ west of Texas is simply hard to find. This is Tennessee style BBQ, slow cooked over Hickory. Definitely a carnivore spot!

The Q Rolls are excellent with the Chipotle dressing. Also, I really like the avocado salad with brisket. They'll bring you a side of Salsa and the Chipotle dressing which when mixed provide a creative dressing v the house ranch. 

Service is great and the ambiance is very nice.
Love this place! The restaurant bar is welcoming and a great spot to escape the fast pace of life. Try the happy hour menu... the brisket quesadillas are addicting.
This place is a perfect BBQ place .. every time I come it's excellent food I think is one of the top places to try in Arizona

Big plates of food for a decent price. 
Brisket was ok, with a texture of pulled pork not brisket slices.
Sausage was ok.
But baby back ribs, by far, were the best. Tender and good flavor.
Cornbread was also great!
Might return if I was in town.

Fabulous service and food. A must if you're visiting the area. Get the baby back ribs and brisket. You will not regret it. Finish it off with a slice of Death by Chocolate cake. Very tasty. The house cocktails and lemonade was also very good.
I heard a lot about this place and their bbq ribs & sauce. I finally ate here and well...I rather go to famous dave's but their mac & cheese is good :)

We found this place by accident, a very happy accident. The wait staff are very friendly and accommodating. The waitress we had was super friendly and helpful, she brought us samples of things we had questions about, etc. You receive a complimentary sweet cornbread circle for a starter, very tasty. The entree options are well rounded, there is something for everyone. The portions are huge, so be prepared! And at the end of the meal you are given a complementary mini donut covered in sugar. A great experience!

Sooo glad we got a chance to try Bobby Q while visiting Arizona!

First and foremost, their service was incredible. I called in 45 minutes before and booked a reservation for Sunday night. Upon arrival, they greeted us warmly and seated us right away at a comfortable booth. Hunter, our server, was awesome. He was super friendly and helped us make our dinner choices. 

My boyfriend and I shared the Wedge Salad and the 3 Meat Combo - St. Louis Ribs, Baby Back Ribs, and the Brisket. The Wedge Salad was really fresh and refreshing (but not the healthiest since it comes with a pile of fried onions, but I'm not complaining!) All the meats were fall-off-the-bone tender and the bbq sauce was on point. For the sides we had the Baked Beans which were perfectly sweet, and the Mac n Cheese which I could probably have done without but it was okay. 

I couldn't have been happier with the meal and service but then they come with a bag of HOT FRESH donuts on the house. Wow...talk about cherry on top. You guys definitely made my night! 5 stars all the way!

The best corn ever! Had the 14oz ribeye and it was great as well. The wife had pulled pork and loved it. We were driving down 17 and were hungry from our trip to the Grand Canyon. Looked over and saw this place from the Freeway and just had to stop. Prices are reasonable and the service was just right. No complaints.
Love their Mac and cheese. Also their barbecue ribs are really good. Very good price and good service it is always so packed.

My mouth is sayin' yeeee hawwww howdy partner!  

My wife and I split the 3 meat combo with chicken, sausage and the lip smack baby backs.  The side were the roasted corn and ranch beans.  This was plenty of food. 


Service was great. Really appreciated the manager coming by twice to check on us.

Came here with my mom while we were in town for work and wanted to try something locally owned. 
First of all, the staff are the nicest people! Our waitress was Nikole, and although it was a little hard to hear her, she was the most upbeat and sweet girl we've ever had as a waitress. 

The food was amazing! The meats were great, and the sides were just as good. The ambiance was really nice. Kind of like an upscale BBQ joint. Plenty of choices for all types and it came to our table before we could even finish our cornbread. 

All in all an excellent dining experience

Truly enjoyed this place. Very reasonable priced for the amount of food. Had to sit in bar due to business but found a seat right away. Ordered appetizer and drinks. Q-rolls were delicious as well as spinach artichoke queso. There was a bit of a mix up when finally seated  (much faster than 45 minutes quoted). No one notified server so took a bit before got assistance. For our inconvenience they comped an appetizer. (We still had drinks and appy from bar so truly didn't feel too inconvenienced, but I consider that great customer service. 
Had the 3 meat combo brisket, baby back ribs and pulled pork. All were excellent but the brisket was a standout. Mac and cheese was very creamy and delicious, baked beans above average. 
Will be back!

Was in the Phoenix area and had heard about this place and we decided to give it a try. We weren't disappointed. The service was extremely good, the BBQ was exceptionally good, and the food was reasonably priced. I wouldn't hesitate to try this place again.

I love this place more every time I come here. The service is great, the food is spectacular, and the atmosphere is fun. I've been coming here for years and will continue to come back. This specific time in, I brought a colleague from out of town. She loved the selection of beer and really enjoyed the food.
Probably the best brisket I've ever had!!!!! Amazing food and the drinks are good too. The free bag of mini doughnuts you get after your meal are so yummy. Worth every penny.

This food was amazing! I loved the brisket appetizer and their cocktails were to die for. I cannot wait to move to Phoenix to eat here more often. The outside atmosphere was amazing and so comfy! I think I found my new favorite restaurant!

I've worked in the restaurant business for seventeen years.  I just moved to Glendale, and went out with my family to a local place with great reviews.  The food and service didn't disappoint.  Both were excellent.  Sabrina was awesome, especially with my 7 year old niece.  Will definitely be coming back!

Probably the best BBQ place I've ever eaten at and this includes Phil's BBQ in San Diego.

I ordered the Whole Hog Heaven and everything was perfect. Love the BBQ sauce, the ribs (even the beef) were fall-off-the-bone. The sides were great as well. Lots of food for the money.

Service was very friendly and even the manager was checking up on us.

The interior and exterior of the restaurant are also very nice.

Thank you Bobby  and all your wait staff for making our Westside UYE a  great time ..Sawyer and her little busy helpers  kept us happy .  The food was tasty , smoky and  down home yummy..
Great seeing some many Yelpers  just hanging out and enjoying some good food...

Try saying Bobby Q three times really fast in a southern accent. It sounds like you're saying Barbeque.

I can't believe that I've been living in this area for a few years and I just started patronizing Bobby Q's. There's definitely a happening vibe to this place after dark. The place is packed and the air is buzzing with conversations and laughter. They have ample seating inside and outside. We met some friends that have never been here a few weeks ago and they became instantly hooked.

We ordered steaks, pulled pork, ribs and brisket. Everything along with the sides were fabulous. My brisket was tender and the flavor instantly transported my taste buds to a happy place. The pulled pork was equally as good. I've had the ribs on other trips to Bobby Q and have always enjoyed them. I got a big thumbs up on the steak from my dining companion so I'm going to have to try that next time I'm in the house. The tab for four people without alcohol and before tip was $70. 

This is definitely my favorite BBQ place in the metro area.

According to Tripadvisor Bobby Q is the Highest Rated BBQ in Arizona. Bobby Q is a very large old fashioned looking restaurant. I don't know how old it is but to me it looks a hundred years old with Giant Old Trees shading the parking lot. As you walk in you do get hit with an aromatic BBQ aroma. 

We were quickly seated and our server gave us a fast run down on Bobby Q. We learned that everything is made in house and the meats are smoked with mesquite wood. They also start everybody out with what I recognize as Johnny Cakes with soft whipped butter.

I had the BBQ Pulled Chicken Sandwich with Pecan Cole Slaw. The Chicken was falling apart tender and laced with sweetness but not too much. A small amount of skinny fried onions were added to my sandwich on a soft grilled roll. The coleslaw was drip free and fresh and crunchy.

My husband had a much better value item called the lunch sampler plate with 3 meats and a side. He enjoyed everything. I tried a taste of the brisket and for me it was too succulent and fatty but for my husband who likes fat he thought it was just right. My husband ate the macaroni and cheese I have to say it tasted like processed cheese. I didn't like the macaroni and cheese but I know most people do like this style. My husband liked the beans too he said they were packed with all kinds of meat ends.

When you're all done they present you with a bag of Fresh Made Thank "Q" Cinnamon  Sugar Donuts.

Not my stye of BBQ but I still thought it was good and plan to return for dinner.

Form Texas and was not in the mood for bbq but decide to try it. Bobby Q was incredible. Food great, service great and the feel of the place was great. The bbq is just as good as the best bbq house, Hutchins in McKinney TX
Best pulled pork ever and Bobby even stopped by our table to check on us!  Will be returning the next time I am in Phoenix.

Seriously the best bbq I've ever had. Came from out of town and was shocked to find out how good this place was. Meat on the ribs was falling off the bone. The beef brisket was extremely tender and cooked to perfection. The Mac and cheese is to die for. Really rich and creamy. You won't regret coming here at all. So sad that I have to go back home and not have one of these places nearby. 
Also, phenomenal service. Really nice to notice that the manager, Taylor, took the time in between delivering plates out to stop by tables and check in.

Bobby Q has a rustic, Western vibe with a music selection customary of a traditional BBQ joint. The play on words for the restaurant's title was what caught my attention but I came into Bobby Q with my sister and boyfriend since we were craving some good BBQ. 

We ordered the Cajun Shrimp appetizer to start. The shrimp is sauteed in beer; this was the standout factor for me in this dish because I could actually taste the flavor of the beer, which complemented nicely with the Cajun seasoning and butter. 

We ordered the Full Baby Back Rib BBQ Platter to split 3 ways. You can choose from a list of sides such as mac and cheese, shoestring fries, ranch beans, mashed potatoes and pecan cole slaw. We decided to get mac and cheese and shoe string fries. I was expecting to be given additional plates to pick off the rib platter but our waitress was kind enough to have the kitchen split the dish on 3 separate plates, with a portion of mac and cheese and shoe string fries on each plate. Right when I started cutting my ribs, the meat fell cleanly off the bone. The 22 hour smoking process yields amazing results because the meat was moist, tender and just plain heavenly! The BBQ sauce was tangier than most but was delicious. My sister even loved the ribs and she's not a huge meat person. 

Lastly, what made the experience worthy of the 5 star rating was the service. The service was PHENOMENAL! Our waitress, Kessa, was informative on the restaurant's history (they used to be Bobby McGee's!) and their smoking process (the meat is smoked for up to 22 hours). In addition, the manager/restaurant owner personally came up to our table to see how we were enjoying our food. Our waitress was also sweet enough to bring us a half dozen complementary cinnamon donuts to end our meal!

We JUST finished an amazing dinner at Bobby Q tonite.  We are in town for a week from Southern CA for a baseball tournament for my son & looked to Yelp for a top BBQ joint in town that we don't have in our neck of the woods.  We hit a grand slam choosing Bobby Q.  From the minute we sat down, our waiter Tommy (who was fantastic), told us the history of the place, made recommendations for us & was very attentive the entire meal.  The cornbread muffins were delicious.  We ordered the Q rolls & spinach artichoke cheso dip as appetizers.  The Q rolls were AMAZING - highly recommend.  The spinach dip was very good, especially when I asked for tortilla chips instead of the bread that comes with it.  For our meal we got the big "Hog Meal" I think it was called.  You get to choose 2 types of ribs (a full rack), we got a full rack of baby back, 2 types of meats (1 lb), we chose brisket & pulled pork & 3 sides but we chose 4, coleslaw, mac n cheese, fries & roasted corn.  BY FAR the best meat was the baby back ribs.  The bones were just there for looks cuz that meat FELL OFF THE BONE.  They were so good.  The pork was tasty too, brisket was our #3 favorite but very tender.  The coleslaw is delicious, my son loved the mac n cheese & fries & the corn was smokey yummy tasting too.  At the end, when they bring the bill, they bring these SINFUL homemade donuts with the check.  OMG!!  They were so good.  I had to get a second little bagful on the way out.  We also bought the sauce they use.  They sell it if you loved it.  We loved it.  Definitely recommend this place.  Our waiter Tommy made our experience here awesome.  Drinks were good, service good, food good.  5 stars for sure!
Amazing!!! Good service, good food, good drinks! Jessica was so helpful and friendly. Enjoyed having her as our server!!!

First of all, I was with a large group who all appeared to enjoy their meals.  SO this is solely based on my palate.  I was starving after drinking my glass of wine at the bar.  I ordered the Grilled Top Sirloin with a 1/2 Rack of Baby Back Ribs.  Sides were baked potato (they forgot my sour cream and were so busy I didn't have the heart to ask for it..so that's on me), pecan coleslaw and potato strings (what was I thinking with already having the baked potato?)  

Anyway, things arrived and the plate so full I didn't know where to start so move things aside and attempted to cut my steak.  It was cold.  It was also SO tough it took a number of tries for me to cut it.  My husband offered to cut it but I was determined!  The one bite I finally got off was tough and chewy.  The smoke flavoring overpowered it.  So I was done with the steak.  I then tried the ribs.  The meat fell off the bone and was extremely tender.  I did find them tasty but could only eat a couple due to the salt content.  Too salty for me.  I'm not sure if it was the sauce or if they use a rub, but it was overwhelming.  The pecan cole slaw was ok...I expected better.  It needs pineapple  :)    I didn't eat the fries as they were cold by the time I got to them.

Thankfully there was plenty of cornbread on the table which was amazing.  I wish I would have ordered some to take home. 

Would I go back?  Yes, but to try some other items like maybe Bob's Salad.  Sounds really good.  I don't think I could eat the meat again because of the salt and overly smokey flavor.  
The donuts at the end were evil...so maybe I'd go back for cornbread and donuts with a side salad. lol

My BIG complaint is our servers when bringing the receipts were really flustered.  I had two servers arguing behind me about things being wrong.  That is unprofessional and unnecessary around your customers.  I held my tongue but it was difficult.  If you have problems with your receipts...take it away from  your customers to sort it out.  I have no problem reiterating what I had and you can ring up a new receipt to get it clear and most people at our table would have felt the same way.  Again, DO NOT ARGUE in hearing distance of your customers.  It can ruin a nice evening for us.

Anyway, many of the friends with us loved their meal and I know Bobby Q's is a favorite for some.  Unfortunately I am not one of them.

Excellent place! Like theirs steaks and ribs.

Based on recommendations visit on lunch was awesome

Been going to Bobby Q's for years.  Love the lunch atmosphere, and specials.  The Mac 'n Cheese has always ranked at the top of my lists as the very best ever!  The pulled pork and brisket have always been excellent, but this last time I tried something different - a burger!  Yeah, I know, this is a BBQ joint, why would anyone get a burger?

Well, I am glad I did!  Like the Mac 'n Cheese, this burger is now at the top of my list!  It was sooo... damn... good!!!  The "Perfect" burger was just that  - perfect!  I ordered the meat medium and that was how it came out. The meat was amazingly tender with incredible flavor. It would be really hard to find better.  Maybe the only burger I've ever had better was at Carver's Steak house where they made my son a Whiskey Peppercorn burger that was not on the menu.  At Bobby Q's, I could only eat 1/2, and the next day my reheat was still amazingly good!

We also tried their beef brisket flour taquitos that were insanely delicious as an appetizer!  Later that evening we went to the Yard House at Westgate and I tried their famous Vampire Tacos - they weren't as good as these beef brisket taquitos at Bobby Q's.  Thumbs up to Bobby Q's.

People love the cornbread here too!  Baked in cast iron, it has an incredible crust.  Still, personally, I liked the Old El Paso BBQ Company's cornbread, but they no longer exist here.

I got to say - I love this place!  Fantatstic food and service that always delivers!!!  We left with about 10 complimentary cinnamon sugar mini donuts they make fresh and hot right there.

Killer deals at Bobby Q's happy hour (3-6) too for their beef brisket tacos!

Go, you simply will not be disappointed!

Amazing every time we go.  Ribs are flavored just right and they are fall off the bone, just like they claim.  Cornbread is just right --- just a little sweet.  And the sides are just as good.  I always get the mashed potatoes or Mac n' Cheese.  Yummyness.  What I appreciate the most is that the food comes out hot every time and the waitstaff are always very friendly.

Beyond impressed! We've wanted to try Bobby Q's for years, ever since we saw it reviewed and featured on Check, Please! Arizona (local PBS station show where Arizonians share and review each other's favorite restaurants). We were in Glendale For Glendale Glitters, and as I always do, I searched Yelp for restaurant options nearby with a lot of reviews, and high reviews. Bobby Q's was just 5 miles away in Phoenix, so the stars finally aligned! 

The restaurant was busy, as expected on a Saturday night, so we opted to try the outdoor seating in lieu of the 20-minute wait for an indoor table. The hostess assured us that it should be comfortable when she saw our hesitation, that there were plenty of heaters to keep us warm (hey, 45 degrees in AZ is cold!), and it was perfect. 

Victoria, our server, was welcoming and helpful, my mom, husband and I ordered our drinks and meals, the sangria was good, as was the corn bread. We ordered the Q Rolls, and it took longer than expected to recieve them; however, they were delivered with an apology for the tardiness, an explanation that our ticket went missing (they were crazy busy), and we were told they were on the house for the delay. We all looked at each other and said wow, great service! By the way, I will dream about those Q rolls, wrapped in crispy spring roll-like shells was the best, and most tender, beef brisket I've ever tasted -- the juices ran down my hand while eating. 

We found ourselves ordering drink refills, and people watching while we fell into a conversation lull, before we realized it'd been a while since we had finished our appetizer. The food was delayed due to previous ticket issue, but was so incredibly good. My mom and I each ordered the stuffed potatoes with pork, mine with veggies on the side, which I was impressed were cooked kabob style on a grill (too many restaurants treat vegetable sides as a boring after thought), we also ordered a side of sautéed mushroom and onions that I nearly wanted to swim in because they were so flavorful! The ribs my husband ordered were tender, and their spicy barbecue sauce was a great pairing. He said the Mac and cheese was "so good," as was the roasted corn he ordered, and the pecan coleslaw my mom ordered. Our eyes all lit up with the first bite, and I said, "we're definitely finding reasons to come back here" (we live an hour away). 

Donny, the manager stopped by and apologized for the delay, and offered to buy us desert. We are so impressed by the level of customer service we just received! Not enough businesses take care of their customers like this anymore. The food was so good that we would have gone back regardless, but the positive, and proactive, customer service we received drive me to write this review, and want to tell my friends and family about this place. 

I've tried and cooked a lot of barbecue, we have a Texas sized semi-professional smoker at home, my family is Southern, and I grew up on North Carolina barbecue, this is THE FIRST time I've ever eaten barbecue outside of NC (most certainly in AZ) that I can rave about, and that I will make a point to seek out again. 

My only disappointment was the Q-Lina sauce -- I understand barbecue is regional, and as personal and touchy as religion and politics to some, but the traditional NC barbecue I grew up with didn't involve tomato/ketchup/sugar based sauces. This is in no way a deal breaker, as I loved their traditional and spicy barbecue sauces for the sweet tomato concoctions they were, and will stick to those in future visits. 

Thanks to Donny and Victoria for taking care of us as first timers, so glad we have left overs to look forward to, and can't wait to return!

Great service.. Great atmosphere.. Amazing BBQ.. Probably one of the best! It's kind of a hidden treasure.. Don't let the street view fool you, as soon as you walk in, you'll find everything to be clean and the food fresh! GREAT place!

I came here a few nights ago with a group of about 10 others. The staff was very welcoming and either the owner/manager was there greeting everyone who came into the door. 
They did mistakenly bring out an incorrect order for someone that I was with, but the owner/manager personally came over and took the plate back and brought the correct order, on the house. EXCELLENT customer service. 
The food itself also warrants 5 stars. The meat was really tender and flavorful and the sauce was great. I'll definitely be back to try out other items.

First off , I've tried bbq from North Carloina,  to Texas,  but nothing compares to bobby qs.  Their cornbread is OUT OF THIS WORLD . The pulled pork A+, the mac n cheese is creamy heaven , and the staff is ALWAYS polite and friendly . Never have my girlfriend or I ever had a disappointing experience here! A MUST TRY in phoenix . Plus you get free mini donuts at the end of every meal :)

BBQ yummy!!! I'm from San Diego and I've been to Phil's BBQ and they pretty much go toe to toe. 

I feel like I should've ordered something else cause my chicken sandwich was alright, but everyone else's food was awesome. I tried my table mates food and the meat just fell off the ribs. It was delicious! They also have a spicy BBQ sauce upon request. I'm telling you to request it! Its tasty!

I love that they gave complimentary cornbread during and donuts at the end of your meal. Didn't need to order dessert!

All in all, good experience.

Love their food!

I have been 3 times now. The first 2 times I had great service. This last time I was here for my birthday dinner with a friend. Our service was weird, it was multiple people but no one around when we actually needed anything. Our food took a very long time too. The table who sat next to us were seated and got their food before we received our 2 orders. Although it took what felt like forever for our food it was great like I expected.

By the time we were able to leave it took quite some time to get our bill, pay and even ask for a box all while servers were rushing around past us to help other people but no one to really help us. Once we were finally leaving I realized that we had waited so long that 3 couples had already been seated, eaten, paid and left at the same table next to us all in the time it took us to order an appetizer and a meal for 2. 

If it wasn't for the great food I may have given less stars. I most likely will be back, but to the new location in Mesa. Driving 30 miles for dinner to wait that long is not ideal.

I love the ambience of this place, there's always something to look at. The barbecue is amazing as well as the macaroni and cheese. I have had many items on this menu but always come back for the brisket. The brisket is very tender and has a great smoky flavor. It goes well with either the loaded mashed potatoes, loaded baked potato, or and in my opinion the best cheesiest homemade macaroni and cheese I have ever had.I would definitely recommend to anyone and will be going back soon.

Corn bread was super awesome!! It came out warm and soft and amazing. The waiter recommended the two meat option; wasn't sure what he chose for me but they were amazing! The meat were cooked well, fell of the bone style and were super succulent! MUST try the pecan coleslaw! Loved the combination! 

Also, on another note, there is a Poké gym within the building. Battling while stuffing yourself with meat = fantastic. (P.s. Bunch of eevees too!)

My wife and I stopped at Bobby Q's because we were in that area of town and looking for something tasty for lunch on Yelp. We found this place, which had several stellar reviews, and decided to give it a try. 

I got the beef brisket sandwich and my wife got the pulled pork sandwich. I had a side of fries and she got a side of macaroni and cheese. Starting with mine, the beef brisket was amazing. It was well seasoned, they used incredibly soft, super fresh, potato rolls for the buns, and the order came out hot. The french fries were crisp and well seasoned. 

The pulled pork that my wife had was good as well, however it was a little on the dry side, and probably could have used some more barbeque sauce. The macaroni and cheese was really good, and some of the creamiest I've ever had. As a starter, they also bring out cornbread which is hot, fresh and soft. It was quite excellent. 

For drinks we both got some of their specials. The drinks were massive, well priced at only $10 apiece, and easily big enough to share! Our waiter was Mateo, and he was really friendly and helpful. If he's working, request him. The restaurant itself had a huge outdoor covered seating area with fans and a fountain. There was a nice breeze, and even though it was a hot day it was still comfortable to sit outside. We really enjoyed this place, and would definitely go back.

I just feel compelled to again state how much I freakin' love this place

I think its super.

Last time I branched out and ordered a filet (my bf ordered ribs and then we split to make for a delicious mixed meal)

OMG
THE FILET WAS AMAZING!

Like, better than high end steakhouses.
I love this place.

Just wish it were closer to me!

Fantastic! Food, service, atmosphere...everything was great! Big portions, Mac n cheese was great! St. Louis Ribs were extra meaty, brisket tender, catfish crispy, and beef ribs were super tender!! And they serve Sweet Tea! Lemonade comes in a frosted mug either on the rocks or slushy. We had on the rocks and it was perfect.

Such a fun atmosphere! There's so much to look at.
The food is great, wasn't too impressed with the macaroni, tasted like velveeta to me, but the rest of the food was on point! I'd try em out if you've never been there.

Went here for Valentines dinner, it was fairly easy to get in (even though they asked if we had reservations) there was no wait time. The hostess was very nice (Paloma) and quick with getting us situated and fed. The food was good, not what I expected for the price though. 
   Both mine and my boyfriends meals were a bit on the bland side not having much flavor. We had to put salt and pepper on everything, the Mac n cheese tasted like the Velveeta box kind and the "grilled veggies" were not grilled and were just blah, however their cornbread was DELISH! and melted in your mouth! Sooooo good! Now the catfish and ribs my boyfriend ordered were VERY TASTY and the ribs literally fell off the bone! But the steak I ordered was just ok, I had a better one at Red Lobster?!
  If we get food from here again I'll probably just stick to the ribs next time.
The ribs are really good. Jessica was our server and she was very helpful and attentive. Mac and cheese alone is worth going back for. The donuts at the end are melt in your mouth!

First visit here as I was looking for a decent BBQ experience.   I have to say this was far better than entry level decent!   The food exceeded my expectations as did the wonderful service provided by Leigh Ann (sp) I highly recommended "The Whole Hog", a varietal feast for two!  The baby back ribs melted off the bone!  Mac & Cheese tasty as was the seasoned roasted corn. This place is worthy of future visits with more friends in tow!

Denise and I met our daughter and her boyfriend for dinner yesterday on my birthday. Always wanted to try this place. We started off with the Q-rolls, guess this is suppose to be trendy! Many restaurants are doing the same thing. hybrid of a egg roll and sandwich! This one was BBQ brisket deep fried like an egg roll! It was OK, not that bad. I ended up ordering their combo platter, sample of their ribs, sausage, and brisket ts. Sausage was great and spicy, and their ribs were very good. Wife had the fried chicken (boneless) I am not a fan of boneless chicken. No flavor! Get me a fried chick with bone, it will taste a lot better then bone out! So! Their chicken really had no flavor, wife was not impressed. Daughter had a burger that was huge, and it looked great! Wanted to try it, but I had enough on my plate already. Wife had a bite and said it was really good. We ended up have their peach cobbler, I tried a little. Not a big fan of peach, plus daughter already baked me a cake for my birthday. Wife again was not impressed by, said it was to doughy! 
Biggest Con! Price! I have had better BBQ that cost a lot less. Spending $100.00 for four I expected it to be a little better. 
Loved the place, would like to come back on a weekend evening to see how the atmosphere is!
Honestly not the best bbq I've had famous Dave's best ribs and Rudy's best brisket. I really liked the spinach and artichoke. The food was just way to greasy and fatty for my likings

Went to this establishment to celebrate my graduation. The food was amazing. We made reservations, so we didn't have to wait in line. The food came out quick.

I'm from CA, but if I come back to AZ for any reason, I would eat here because of Destiny. Her service exceeded my expectations tremendously and made my celebration very special.

I went to this place with some friends, and with an open mind. The service was great! Unfortunately, the food was so-so. I ordered the pulled pork and received a rather dry pile of shredded pork topped with a dollop of barbecue sauce. The vegetables on the side had this intense, artificial "liquid smoke" smell that was so strong I almost could not eat them. The other side dish I ordered was the mac-and-cheese, which tasted of the Kraft variety. The menu said it had three cheeses in it, mine had a chunk of unmelted cheddar in the middle that was not very appetizing.

The other people I was eating with liked their food. One ordered baby back ribs and the other had some kind of a roast. Typical overpriced American fare.
A gem in the Phoenix area for good smoked BBQ. My favorite is the Sunday's Whole Hog combo to share with three. The smoked prime rib here is also a treat. I love the corn bread while you wait!

I came here because it was on Yelp's 100 reviewed restaurants in USA. I feel this place does not deserve the hype it receives and the food comes off as glorified food truck distributor food. 

I was pretty hungry being on the plane all day, so I figured I would order a ton of food. For starters, I ordered the Q Rolls and Cajun Shrimp. Of course I had to try their cornbread they give out for free. I went with two orders of the three meat combo which includes pulled pork, brisket, ribs, sausage, and chicken.
The Q Rolls are definitely the few highlights of the meal. They were meaty, greasy, and a satisfying crunch on the outside. The queso dip that comes with it makes it even better. The cajun shrimp were Ok, but Im a dummy thinking arizona is going to have good shrimp. The cornbread was really moist. I was only going to have one bite, but ended up having half of the entire piece. Now for the meats. Dont get me wrong as I highly critisize the meal. This is much better than Rudy's or Dickey's (gross). But I was expecting something on the same line as Lockhart, TX (which I foolishly continue to expect when going to so claimed 'amazing' barbecue joints.) THe ribs were fall of the bone (not my favorite style, although some people like that). The pulled pork was soggy. The brisket had some good points, but the bark was soggy (they probably use foil to speed up the cooking process). The sausage was OK, but nothing special. It certainly could have been spicier. The chicken totally took me by surprise. It was moist, tender, and had a nice smoke to it. Normally I wouldnt order chicken over the usual trinity, but they do a good job. All the meats had this sweet taste to it, and didnt have much of a strong smoke flavor (besides the chicken). The BBQ sauce on the table just added to the sweetness. 

The sides were all crap, expect the mac and cheese. That was actually pretty good. Everything else lacks any real flavor or craft. For dessert, they gave us some in house donuts. I like the idea of this, but they are arent that spectacular. My friend wanted coffee, even after the waiter said it as horrible. It was probably the most watery coffee Id ever tasted. I know coffee is not something someone should order at a BBQ joint, but at least you know ahead of time.

I imagine people who think this place is amazing either eat bbq from dickeys or have never visited Texas. Either way, I wouldnt come back here again on my own time and would advise anyone you can to go to Little Miss BBQ instead. Thats how BBQ should be.
For me, best barbecue around. Next closest is Franklin's in of Austin Texas. They work hard on the quality and it is always very tasty.
Amazing!!!! Best BBQ in AZ I promise you. Meat cooked perfect, sides were great, big portions. I didn't try the dessert because I was so full but it looked yummy.  Staff was super nice as well. A++

It was my Bachelors of Science in Project Management graduation gift from my fiancé, Tony.  I love a great steak, since I was raised in a Slaughting Ranch in Mexico with my Grandparents.   I know a great steak.  Paloma was our wonderful waitress, very knowledgeable about the the manner in which they age the beef, when they cut the steaks, and with what they grill it.  When the steak arrived it was accompanied by grilled vegetables, and a loaded baked potato, which the exterior had been rolled in seasalt while baking.  The steak was grilled perfectly, mouth watering tender piece of heaven.  I would be remiss if I do not mention the rolls of tender Brisket snuggled in a deep fried flour tortilla, it had a wonderful taste of Carne Machaca, so tasty.  We completed the scrupulous dinner with a very light dessert of a pineapple drink.  The drink arrived in a beautiful hollowed out pineapple.  The drink was so refreshing and yet not too sweet.  Donny, the Manager was so hospitable, made us feel like family, or regulars.  We will return.  I would highly recommend making a reservation.  Thank you for a memorable graduation gift.  Delia,

Some of the best pulled pork I have had in life, let alone in the Phoenix valley. My waiter- Kody was fantastic and and the meat was the perfect amount of smokey sweetness! I highly recommend this to anyone who is a BBQ fan. Side note- they gave us freshly made mini donuts as we left- I mean- come on!
Ribs, perfect, chicken moist, ribeye tender... great poor, yummy corn muffins.. we took some home. Hot doughnuts for dessert. Yes they are busy.. I can see why.

I just drove past Bobby-Q's and remembered that I've had a good experience with them.

The time was around Thanksgiving. They offer smoked turkeys that are pretty much ingenious. One, they're smoked - so literally half the cooking is done for you. I can't stand putting an entire raw bird in an oven and waiting for it to cook for 234 hours. Well, I've never really done that, because I think I wouldn't like it much, as I hate waiting while I watch people poke, prod, and baste a raw behemoth and then put it in the oven for 234 hours. 

This thing was done in I think 2 hours. 2 hours!!! Brilliant. And better yet - it tasted phenomenal. The spice rub was so complementary to the meat it needed no sauce to make it a tasty experience. 

And it wasn't cost-prohibitive. The only thing you really need to worry about is ordering one well enough ahead of time for your occasion.

Awesome spot and very good BBQ! The brisket is tender and cooked perfect, the portion is great! Also the rotisserie chicken is vey good! Service is superb!! Our waiter Jay was extraordinary! Went out of his way to make our night special.. Stay for the club later it reminds me of the LA club scenes in the 90's! Jesse is the best!! Fantastic night!

Jack was an excellent server. Being that we were first-timers at Bobby-Qs, he was very thorough and was very attentive. I had the filet, while the rest of the family had brisket and pulled pork. One word to describe ... DELICIOUS!  And the hot cinnamon sugar donuts when we got our bill topped off our great meal. Will be back again!  Be sure to check-in on Yelp to get a discount on your bill at check out too!

Like most people who grew up here I have driven by this place a thousand time, and gone in a few. Bobby Q's has always been known for its bar. The night life, has always been it calling card; now that has changed. 

Last night I took my wife there for an anniversary dinner we started off with a few drinks. Bar staff were friendly and attentive. My wife had the Chocolate martini, that's a desert before dinner.  We had reservations at 7:30, and we were seated at 7:32. The place was packed, so when you go, get a reservation. We started with Cajun shrimp, good serving, and it was a short wait for the appetizer. Good quality corn bread was brought out with our appetizer. We really wanted to try the prime rib. I researched, and found that Bobby Q's has been voted the best, and they are right. Prime rib was tender, and you almost don't need a knife. The flavor was outstanding. I like a lot of people like horseradish, and they have the creamy type, and fresh ground, and it is fresh. When you bit in, and feel the heat in your nostrils.. That is fresh. The other side were as good, and the pecan coleslaw was outstanding! One person I talked to about Bobby Q's said it was a bit pricey, but the quantity and quality of food you get is worth it. Our server (I wish I remembered her name) was great. She was there when you want her, and not when you don't. Desert was apple cobbler, tart apples, crunchy crusts, and good vanilla ice cream; Granny would be proud. 
The only one thing that was not to my taste, and this is not the fault of the restaurant is the noise.. A lot of people drinking, eating, and talk tends to do that, but the swap of that food for a little noise, it's worth it..

If you haven't tried this place yet, you're missing it. All you people like me who remember Bobby "s for the bar scene; well its different now.

I was traveling with my husband and after flight we decided to eat in Bobby Q.  We have some good restaurants back in Chicago and we enjoy many of them but I have to tell you that we did not expect this restaurant to have such a good food.  
We had full size fire roasted baby back ribs, roasted vegetables, baked potato and house salad.  Those ribs were so soft and BBQ sauce was amazing!!!
Even vegetables had a scent of the real fire and had a perfect tenderness. Our fully loaded potato was exquisite.  Just a perfect taste.  Salad- was a house salad. Good tasting but Nothing special about it.  
If they had mixed greens or spinach- It would be my favorite place.  Nevertheless I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone. 
Andrew and Elwira

Definitely a great dinner spot to hit up if you're visiting Phoenix. As all the reviews said -- food was amazing and service was excellent! For a group of 7 we got Hog Heaven, extra order of fries and Saint Louis Ribs. Loved the complimentary corn bread and donuts! They kept your drinks refilled and best thing is after you order the food is served shortly after you devour the delicious corn bread. Their sangria and ale were also worth trying :)

Best BBQ in Phoenix.  The ribs, the pulled pork, brisket, it's all awesome.  BUT........ the mac & cheese........... it's addictive!  The best I have ever had anywhere EVER!!  My husband tried to steal a bite once & he nearly lost a digit!  The "Thank Q's" at the end of your meal are a cute touch.
  They do have a full bar in the restaurant, as well as a lounge.
If you love BBQ, or even like it just a little bit......... you have to check this place out!

First time trying this place today. Stopped in with a friend for a late lunch. Our waiter Jonah was beyond amazing. He recommended the corn bread to start then gave us suggestions for other appetizers. Q rolls were delicious along with the wings and chicken tenders. The manager Taylor went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. When we were finished they brought us sugar doughnuts that were the best. We sat outside on the patio that was spacious and held a lot of charm. I will definitely be back to visit with friends.

Excellent bbq, tried the "smoasted" (smoke-roasted) chicken and the brisket, both excellent. Sauces good but not needed with the amount of flavor meat had. Sides excellent-roasted corn especially, table cornbread and donuts delicious as well.
Best BBQ I ever had. The corn bread is outstanding plus there spicy bbq sauce is crazy good. Great service and cocktails. They have a secret Bourbon Mule Delicious
Outstanding ribs and great atmosphere.  My new favorite BBQ

Wow! what a buried treasure that I have heard so much about, and today we found it!!
Have seen the sign, but never knew where they were...but oh do we now! We went there today for lunch, and it was a treat from the moment you walked into the place. The hostesses greeted us, sat us immediately, and then "Christopher" appeared like magic as our server! What a delight, he was funny, great suggesting things, and very professional! I had the beef brisket sandwich with those crazy fries, my hubby had the pulled pork with a delicious pecan cole slaw...yummy! Our friends had the brisket also, and we were delighted with everything, we will be back and we will ask for Christopher! Thanks for the "donuts"... :-) jojo

The food was excellent! Fall off the bone ribs, tender Tri Tip! The Mac and cheese was so creamy and tasty!! The service was great I forgot the servers name but he was great! Even the manager of the night was going around to the tables to check on us. We sat on the outside patio that was decorated beautifully! The lights, the table to the water fountain and the nice view of the bar and televisions! Great pric

Nice dinner spot. Bartenders were super friendly and informative. Started out with a happy hour Bobby Mule. Twist on a Moscow mule with some tequila and honey. No fear, honey is subtle. Drink was well mixed and presentation was excellent. For dinner I had the two meat combo. Baby back ribs were great, flavorful, fell off the bone and not too sloppy. Brisket was okay, texture was solid but just an underwhelming sauce. Cornbread was unique and again, great presentation. Portion sizes were very large. Best part of the meal were the side dishes. The Mac and cheese had some great flavor with even better consistency (no runny cheese) and the mashed potatoes were extremely fresh. After the meal be sure to take home some fresh donut holes for free. They taste like mini elephant ear rounds. Average to above average BBQ, but a great atmosphere with tasty complimentary side dishes.
Really impressed with the service and quality of the food here. Overall, the best BBQ I've had to date. Highly recommended. Be sure to make reservations!

Awesome food  hostess and waitress were excellent. Homely but classy building and decorations. We ordered a mixed family platter with St Louis ribs/baby back/ brisket and sausage, all were excellent and tasty. Highly recommend this bbq joint. When I come back to Phoenix I will surely come back again
Travelling from California I found this place on google. I have to say it is in my top 5 of best bbq I have ever ate.

We were in town visiting and looking for a BBQ place and ended up at Bobby Q's. Let me start off by saying I'm not a huge fan of bbq so I was hesitant on going, but once I tasted it I was SO glad we chose it! The portions are huge and easily shareable, plus the sides are SO good! I tried the macaroni and mashed potatoes and they were both great along with the corn bread which comes before your meal. They also give you mini doughnuts with your check which were again super good. The service was also great, I don't remember our server's name but he was super attentive and recommended a bunch of items on the menu. Bobby Q's is definitely worth checking out and it's safe to say I will be eating there whenever I'm in town!

If you've never been to bobby q you have got to go! One of the best meals I've ever had! Mashpotatoes to die for & try the q rolls beef brisket in a tauqito type breading with a chipotle dipping sauce?? Yes please!!

Anyone that doesn't give this place at least 4 stars probably thinks Burger King is real food. 

 This place has consistently provided the wife and I with amazing food for over 10 years.

A mandatory stop on every Spring Training trip.
All 3 of us get the 3 meat comb,  never have been disappointed.   Will be back next year if not sooner.

The restaurant had a comfortable but classy kind of country charm.  There was a nice size bar area and people seemed to be having a good time watching the game on the two large flatscreen televisions.  The regular dining area was a large room with several smaller areas off of the large area.  There was a mixture of square, rectangular and round wooden tables and chairs.  While we were there I saw the staff moving some tables together to create dining for a large group of people.  The lighting was low, more like a bar setting, but adequate.  We had reservations, via Open Table & the Yelp app, and were seated immediately.  

Our server was friendly and attentive.  We ordered two Strawberry Q'ladas, a strawberry flavored Pina Colada, off the speciality drink menu.  We got our drinks then he took our order and food was at our table about 15 minutes later.  The drinks were very good, but we both wished they packed more booze.  The cornbread was brought to our table after our drinks but before our meal.  Both grandkids had to have some right away.  Both gobbled down their pieces and probably would have asked for more if they could have gotten away with it.  

The Baby Back Ribs were outstanding; falling off the bone the way they are supposed to be but hard to get just anywhere these days.  I also had the Pecan Cole Slaw and fortunately for me, the pecans were sprinkled on top so I could scoop them off and eat the rest of the really good slaw.  The Ranch Beans were pretty unusual.  I have not tasted anything quite like them.  My wife said they had cinnamon in them but there were a bit too spicy for me so I shoved them off on my grandson, the "fire eating kid."  But I enjoyed what I had already eaten.  The cornbread was good but I really liked the super thin french fries I kept stealing off my granddaughter's kid burger meal plate.

My wife had the 8 oz Sirloin Steak and Baked Potato.  She asked that the steak be medium well and it was.  It appeared to be larger than 8 oz.  The potato wasn't as good as the steak; it could have been a little hotter.  It also came with a few thin onion straws that were a nice little surprise.  Before we left, we were surprised with some warm little donuts to take with us.  They were rolled in cinnamon and sugar and were just the right end to a delicious meal.

I asked the server if there was any chance the owners would open a location in Tucson because we would definitely be regulars.  But sadly, according to our server, both the owner and his kids are retirement age and the likelihood of a Tucson location appears to be extremely slim.
Great BBQ, ambience and service. Ordered the 2 item beef ribs and brisket, mashed potatoes & roasted veggies. Made to perfection!
i still have dreams about this place. deliciously evil, fair priced BBQ. A must have if you're in town.

I went there today with my family because of all the reviews on yelp. When we got there our waitress was nice and it was a busy place. The food was off the chain. It was the best ribs I ever had in Arizona so far. Please try out this place and it will be worth it. Great food, wonderful service, fair price.

In town for spring training with my dad and uncle. A+ BEST RESTAURANT in Phoenix ! And we tried most of them! We stayed at the inn place motel and it's only a mile down the road. Friendly staff Vanessa   Was our waitress and she was so nice and helpful. Struck up conversation and actually made us feel right at home! 
They have a full bar and lounge for night life but we dined in I got the brisket platter (smoked for 18hrs ) and it was delicious!!!! So juicy and flavorful, came with 2 sides I got creamy mashed potatoes and shoe string fries both tasted hot n fresh not frozen or microwaved like most restaurants potato products. During our (short) wait after ordering we were served fresh made from scratch corn bread and got another basket without having to ask. A few rounds of beers/drinks and we were stuffed and completely happy. 


UPDATE: We went back! Our last night and this was the only place we wanted to be at. Our server was  Sarah  And she was friendly fast and had refills out without asking I got the same order (plain and simple) and if possible it was BETTER than the first time! 
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO SPRING TRAINING CROWD 

No wait weeknights 
About $20 out the door meat entree 2 sides drink tip tax 
Free refills 
Country/lounge dark environment with mood lighting couple TVs
Omg it's so delicious just love this place and the food is just Awesome...doesn't get any better than this place...

This is hands-down my favorite BBQ place in the greater-Phoenix area. Great atmosphere. I love the brisket and the Mac and Cheese is to die for! Last night had another great experience with Amberlie as our waitress! She was outstanding. I also discovered a new yummy drink there: their sangria! Will have that again next time for sure! I always take out-of-town guests here and it never disappoints.

Heard  good things about Bobby Q.   Went today on Saturday for late lunch after the shooting range.   Easy parking.  Was seated in seconds.   Waiter on it right away.  Then came the cornbread  -  that's when perfection got started.  I ordered the three meet dinner with brisket, sausage and baby back ribs.   Damn so tasty all falling of the bone so tender.   Two sauces mild and hot.  My glass never empty.    Manager came by after to check on us-- she was just  awesome.   Ordered a dozen cornbread to take home.   Then they bring us a little bag of hot cinnamon and sugar donuts  -- perfect surprise.  These guys know BBQ.  Definitely best overall in Phoenix!!   Do it!!

Hands down one of the best smoked BBQ eatery!

Had the Q-rolls, smoked prime rib, and half chicken. Plus some drinks...all for $80 including tax/tips!

Perfectly cooked. Juicy, tender meat. What more can you ask for?

Check in to get 10% off your bill.

Definitely coming back.
Happy hour 50% off and cold beer, near the hotel. The chicken wings and brisket rolls are excellent

I thought, silly name, can't be serious barbecue, but this is good!

Meats are slow smoked, and arrive hot, smoky and juicy with a choice of sides and hot or mild sauce.  For a starter we had some Q-rolls, kind of a BBQ brisket taquito, with chipotle sauce.  Good start.  Beef ribs and pork ribs were tender and easily pulled off the bone.  Brisket and pulled pork were as tender as could be, with a nice pink smoke ring, evidence of slow smoking.  Excellent Mac and cheese and pecan cole slaw.  Beer is plentiful and cold, service quick and attentive, and (bonus) a check in discount for Yelpers when we visited.  This is now on my list for future visits to Phoenix.
Great food and great service. Reasonable prices for the portion size. We was too stuffed for desserts. We will definitely be back.

New to the area and found this place always looks busy when driving by on the freeway so looked it up on yelp and saw it was worthy for a try.  Well....in a word..."underwhelmed".  Should probably be one star.  It was extremely busy for a Sunday evening which I guess is a good sign and they seated me right away (party of one) so thumbs up there.  I ordered the wedge salad to start and what I got was a very cheap iceberg lettuce head with a sliced tomato and some cold greasy onion straws on the side.  See what I mean?  The menu made it sound like it was a specialty of the house!  Their "homemade blue cheese dressing" was more mayo than anything...couldn't taste any blue cheese in there.  Seriously, worse than a chain restaurant and a few dollars more expensive too.  The St. Louis ribs were an item that is particularly reviewed on yelp so I went for those with a baked potato and macaroni and cheese.  Taste was good, not spectacular but the real problem was the temperature...pretty close to room temp.  I knew I had been had by all the advertising for this place...more hype than substance.  The waitress asked how everything was and I started to say it was just ok and elaborate the problems but she quickly whisked away to another table.  I could tell she was working to the max so I let it slide.  Overall, a thumbs down.  There are a few other BBQ places in Phoenix so I'll look there next.
If you've never been to bobby q's you have to try their baby back ribs. They are the best fall off the bone baby back ribs I've ever had!!! The cornbread and donuts are to die for.

Love that BBQ

Had an excellent meal at Bobby Q's, ordered the platter with pulled chicken, brisket and ribs. The  chicken and brisket were moist, tender, and flavorful and the ribs were fall of the bone delicious.

The service is great and the staff is helpful and accomdating.

Travis was our server and we had a large group. He did and excellent job with all the orders and keeping up with our needs. The food was excellent; I had the smokehouse burger and it was delicious. If ever in Phoenix again we'll definitely be back. Everyone enjoyed their meals.

Fall of the bone juicy, tender, well seasoned, and nice waitress at our table,  pretty much summed up or night. 

Ordered hog heaven, thinking it would be sufficient for 2 people - - easily could've fed 4. The meat separated from the bone so well that we skipped the knives. We might even have skipped the fork too because it was quite delicious. The most memorable part was the corn bread. I normally hate corn bread because it's like rolled up dust balls sprinkle with corn essence. Not the ones here. This page turned me into a believer of corn bread and the Arizona charm. 

Baby back, St Louis, pulled pork and chicken ranked from favourite to least favorite. Chicken was bland and feels similar to what I would get at Costco. Pulled pork was soft and moist, but the essence came from the BBQ sauce. The ribs though. You can't go wrong with the ribs.

My favorite BBQ in the valley. Their brisket is always delicious, as is the corn bread and the mac n cheese. (Let's be honest, there's not a bad item on the entire menu). If you go and you don't order the Q Rolls, you are doing yourself a disservice. They are amazing! The wait can be long, but it's worth it. Plan ahead and make a reservation if you have a large group. Going in as a party of 2, we've never waited very long.

I love coming here and I have been for years so why not write a review ....every time we visit we are always pleasantly greeted. Our food is fresh and cooked great. I'm a picky BBQ eater and I've never had a bad dish here and of course the corn bread and fresh donuts are an added bonus!!!
Disappointed.  I heard it was good but the brisket was very fatty.  We had a reservation and still had to wait 30 minutes for a table.  Don't think I will hurry back anytime soon.

This is by far one of my favorite places to enjoy a casual dinner, especially in the evening. Love the vibe and atmosphere that this place casts. The servers are always attentive and friendly. Also, each time I've gone a manager will swing by the table to make sure everything is great. I would also recommend stopping by for their happy hour specials. Lastly, get the Q-Rolls, you won't regret them!

Sorry, I gotta write the review before I decide on the stars.  I've been wanting to go to Bobby's for a long time.  Finally made it for dinner last week.  We had a reservation - and I'd sure recommend it for dinner - and were seated right on time.  Think we were in the main room, back by the take-out room.  A little noisy.  Very good waitress.  Cornbread was amazing....next time that's all I'm going to order. 

Ok, down to deciding.  I guess my main complaint was that nothing tasted particularly smoked.  The brisket was good, but if it was smoked as long as they claim, there should have been more smoke - there was just a narrow, light ring.
The sides were excellent.  The wine was good, the people were very friendly.

I will go again...want to try it for lunch.  So I've decided.  Next time I really hope it's a 4 or 5.

One of our favorite stops in phoenix. Our company has a datacenter in phoenix so every few months we head down to phoenix and make it a point of going to bobby Qs. I typically get their prime rib which is always cooked to a perfect mid rare as requested. Their service is always excellent. We must keep going during their training cycle because they always have us sit where the waiter is training someone. Their pricing is perfect for the amount and quality of thr food. I will be back.

Love the food. Always fantastic. Service is hit n miss. Met my hubby here 18 years ago, when it was Bobby McGee's so it has a special place in our hearts. Bobby Q's should follow the Ray Kroc motto- put your money on the talent(service).

I've been a Yelp lurker for a long time... Taking advice from others without actually posting my own reviews of restaurants.

I decided to break my silence after I had lunch at Bobby Qs.  Visiting from out of town, we decided to get BBQ before heading to the airport.  Everything- from the food to the atmosphere to the service was delicious.

Although the pulled pork sandwich was delicious, the real star of the show was the Q-Rolls appetizer.  

Now... Would it be wrong to reschedule a flight in order to fit in one more meal at Bobby-Qs?!

I'm in the service industry and am pretty critical on service but this place not only had great food but the service to match. I normally just write a review and move on but it was so good I actually went searching for bad reviews because it's simply mind boggling anyone could write something negative. First timer but I'll be back! Thanks Bobby Q!

My family is new to the Phoenix area and I asked around to see where I should find good BBQ and Bobby Q is where I was lead. The brisket was very tender and moist and the Mac n cheese is heavenly :) You definitely get what you pay for and our waitress Nicole was a sweetheart and took very good care of us, as did the rest of the staff who checked on us periodically asking how everything was. Very friendly setting and very delicious food!!! P.s. you get a little dessert surprise on the way out :) that was my favorite part

Once again I don't understand these high reviews they must have not ate at the same restaurant that I ate at. Everything I ate was extremely greasy/ fattening and artificial tasting. The free corn bread they bring out was so buttery and greasy I couldn't eat it. Next my girlfriend and I shared two entrees, the pork ribs with mac n cheese and fries, and the pulled pork with corn and cole slaw. The ribs were so fatty and the quality of meat was not up to par. The pulled pork had a nice flavor but made me feel very ill once I was done. The corn was a joke, it was super water logged and they left the unwanted part of the corn on top as a garnish.

My husband and I ate lunch here last week and loved it!  The atmosphere is cool and the food was delicious.  Some of the best BBQ we have had.  I had the pulled pork sandwich and macaroni and cheese.  He had the ribs.  Both were awesome.  Service was great.  We would highly recommend it! Can't wait to go back!

I'm actually writing this review while sitting in the restaurant because I'm so full and my pig of a husband is still eating :)

The food is great here. The whole hog heaven combo is more than enough for two people. I also really like the baked potato! I wish the roasted vegetables were a little warmer.

The service here is excellent. From the moment of entering, to waiting for food and everything, service was excellent. I had four different people either checked up on us or brought us extra condiments/forks.

I'm glad this is our last meal in Phoenix on this vacation.

Some of the best BBQ you will ever find in Phoenix, Arizona. Nice portions, great atmosphere, very nice patio and superb waitstaff make this the place to go for slow-smoked BBQ. We will definitely be back!!

I went there last night for Happy Hour (which is available in their lounge section). Let me say the food was WOW. I kept hearing about this place's food and finally decided to go try it myself. My boyfriend and I were surprised how dead the lounge was, as we both have been there on Friday and Saturday nights and the place is packed. Anyway, they offer 1/2 price appetizers from 4-8 Tuesday-Friday. We ordered their Jumbo Wings, asked if they come with a medium sauce, waitress said no. So I asked for sauce on the side, as I don't like very spicy food. Also ordered a brisket quesadilla and beer fries. The wings were very big, all drumsticks. Perfectly fried, very meaty, and their wing sauce is not too spicy, it was delicious. Perfect wing sauce I say, not too thick or thin, full of flavor, with a little kick. Excellent. The brisket quesadilla was huge, very meaty, and the meat inside was perfectly tender. The beer fries, oh the fries! The waitress told me about them, they are not on the menu, you have to ask for them. They were the best I've ever had. For fries, you don't expect much. They're fries for God's sake, but these fries are something to talk about. Crisp, flavorful, salty with a little sweet. Definitely a must try! I'm excited to actually go eat in the restaurant section next time! DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

What a great BBQ place! Would definitely recommend the Brisket, pulled pork and Mac n cheese. The service was great as well, Kodi had no problem handling a table of eight. Plus they give you complimentary mini donuts at the end :)

We try to make it for at least one meal each time we visit Arizona. This time, it was on St. Patties day, for a larger party, also celebrating a birthday. We didnt have to wait long at all for them to get our table ready. The server also had alot of fun making sure we were able to have "green beers" we were hopeing to celebrate with. The Sunday BBQ special with all the diffrent cuts of meat, enough for at least 2 (if not more) to share was great, and plenty to go around, at an extremely reasonable price. Everyone was full, and very happy. Like always, good food at the right price. The fresh, made in house donut holes to top off the meal are always looked forward to, and will return everytime we visit.

Went Sunday night with the bf, and we shared a huge combo of prime rib and bbq chicken with baked potato and 2 sides. We opted for a 2nd baked potato and pecan cole slaw.
We ordered hot tea, and it's the cute little boxes of Revolution tea, in various flavors -golden chamomile, ginger peach, tropical green, and earl grey lavender is what we ended up with. Love all of them.
I love prime rib, and this really hit the spot. The horseradish was not that spicy though. Still tasty (we get both) but I was hoping it had more of a kick. 
The bbq chicken practically fell right off the bone. the bbq sauce is one of my favorites.
Cole slaw was delicious as usual, but I didn't see any pecans.

Stefania was our server, and she was pleasant and attentive.


I like how versatile the table and booths are. They can easily be arranged to accommodate various sized groups, and just the fact that you can control how close you are to the table is always a plus in my book. I've been to other restaurants where it feels like you're a mile away from the table if you want back support. So it's great that this is not an issue.

I really want to try their oatmeal cookie martini, and some of the desserts were tempting, but I don't know if I'll ever have room to try!

A fun place to go for a celebration, a date, or family dinner.

"You smell like smoke."  That's the greeting I received when coming home from a terrific UYE organized by BBQ lovin' Deb L.  And at that point, if my stuffed self didn't already know it, I knew I had just eaten some damn good food.

Upon arriving, I had a deja vu moment of being there before...a long time ago, sipping a virgin strawberry daiquiri (I told you it was a long time ago), and thinking I was all that.  Yes, it was Bobby McGee's at one time!  So flash forward 25 years, and I'm having a strawberry lemonade "adult" beverage, which was quite tasty btw, in the company of 20 fabulous Yelpers!

We were given corn bread pretty quickly, and it was devoured pretty quickly.  A little on the crumbly side, but delicious nonetheless.  Because my husband could not join us, I went with the 2-meat combo (brisket and pulled pork) so there would be some left to take him.  Yeah, that's my story.  I was a happy eater to find I could order my meats sauce free!  The brisket was good, but a little too fatty.  The pork was really good, however; adequately seasoned and smokey.  I tried the spicy sauce on the table, and found it to be just right, just a little kick to it.  For sides, the mac and cheese was creamy and not lacking in sauce.  Yum.  The roasted corn was really really good.  If corn always tasted that good, I would move to Iowa.

Our service was great and they were accommodating for our request for separate checks with a 20% gratuity.  Our service was actually good enough, especially given a party that size, that I tipped extra.  And I did refrain from eating all of my meal, so that I could have a nice lunch the next day when my husband refused my offer of the leftovers.  Only problem was he didn't refuse.  And I went hungry the next day, wishing I had eaten all of my meal when I had the chance.
It was amazing.. I love the drinks and food and the service was good too, treat u like a Queen.
Each bite into my food brought a tear to my eye. I will base my next trip to Phoenix around visiting this wonderful establishment again.

Yum! We shared the Whole Hog platter and loved everything: the baby back ribs, beef ribs, brisket, and sausage. My sons had a Perfect Burger and sirloin. Everything was 2 thumbs up. Good thing for the moist towelettes at the end bc we were a mess. Travis was a great server!

Best food  always amazing service  great atmosphere every time love the cornbread cake 
Love the  pineapple drink    Great for dinner for 2 
Or amazing large party dinner

Best beef brisket I've had yet.. and I don't normally like beef brisket.  

I had the lunch sampler thing at the suggestion of my bartender, who was friendly and helpful.  He also suggested the mac-n-cheese and although I didn't feel like mac-n-cheese I tried it.  This stuff was so damn good and the hot sauce he suggested I put on it was out of this world!  The cornbread was also a highlight of the meal.  

The sampler included ribs, bbq chicken and beef brisket.  Each were perfectly cooked, seasoned and super tender.  Of course I would recommend getting a little extra bbq sauce on the side, my preference was the hot which I loved!

They finish the meal off with a bag-o-donuts.. basically sugared doughballs.  Nonetheless they were very tasty and a nice, different take on a dessert for a bbq meal.

It was also nice that the bartender didn't scoff when I asked him to switch the tvs to ESPN (who wants to watch the news in the bar anyways?).  Not only that, but he put it up on all the tvs and raised the volume.  I had a really great lunch there and will be returning soon.

Growing up, Bobby McGee's Restaurant used to be a staple eatery that my family and friends loved. We knew we could get good food and enjoy a setting that was colorful, eclectic, and maybe even charming in its own special way... if that's not too far-fetched..all at the same time. Once I moved onto college, and others went their separate ways, we all forgot about Bobby McGee's. It would often be a topic that would arise at a dinner convo, "What ever happened to that one place we used to go to near 27th Avenue and Northern?" But that was all that ever materialized.

Luckily, I was reunited with this restaurant, now known as Bobby-Q's. It has since transitioned into a Kansas City/Texas mixture type barbecue, but still a great atmosphere! After a long day of rock climbing, my friends and I were famished and they suggested getting barbecue. Once we arrived, all the memories started flooding back of this place, and I love what it's become. The barbecue is really good! It's actually one of my favorites, I'm surprised to say. Three of us shared the Whole Hog Heaven, which is a major platter where you can choose 2 ribs, 2 meats, and 3 sides. Our selections: the Baby Back ribs, the beef ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, potato salad, macaroni and cheese, and grilled veggies. The rib meat was tender and "fall off the bone" type texture. The  baby back ribs were by far my favorite of the bunch. 

While waiting for our order, our group also shared the smoked brisket Q-rolls with chipotle dip. These were really delicious but kind of reminded me of eating a mini chimi since the phylo dough was so flaky and crispy. There was a small heap of roasted corn served on the plate as well that was super smoky in flavor. 

Even though it is the middle of winter, the patio was still very comfortable since all the heaters overhead were on. There is a metal waterfall sculpture that extends the entire length of the patio so it is very soothing and entertaining to have the sound of "rain" behind you as you're eating outside. Ashlynn, our waitress, was very accommodating to our large group of 7 that even included 3 super energetic kids. She even treated us with extra doughnuts at the end when we were finishing our meal. We will definitely return again and again to Bobby Q's!

Ridiculously good! The food was amazing, the service was great and it has a really fun atmosphere! The donuts they give u at the end of your meal are fantastic (and free!). I'd recommend this place to everyone!
Great service and excellent food. Waitstaff helpful in selecting portions and most popular items. We had ribs and brisket. The Q rolls (brisket served like an egg roll) are super.
If you can't give a real reason, then best not say anything at all. Not ever going back. Don't even have fun while you're here, they'll throw you out.

The last time I was here it was named something else and my waitress was dressed like a naughty cop. I was 16 then...now it has taken on a brand new face! I'm probably last to know that this place doubles as a night club.  A latin room and a hip hop club...it was amazing. I didn't get to eat dinner there so I can't speak for the BBQ but as far as the nightlife atmosphere in this area it gets 4 stars! Get there before 10, or the cover is $10 but still that isn't bad.  They have just about every spirit there, and even using the premium well is no more than 7 bucks. Will be going back real soon!!! I am still wondering how they got my number to text me specials...but i can't complain because they are sending me some good stuff.
Love it, love it, love it. Food is great can't stop ordering take out. This is not a Texas restaurant but as close as Arizona can get too one. Can't wait to go again.

My first time here and I LOVED it! The BBQ sauce was excellent. I had the two meat platter with spicy sausage links and St. Louis ribs. Excellent!! The roasted corn side is excellent. I didn't get to try but the peach cobbler looked delicious. Next time!  I really like the ambience of the place. It had a cool vibe. This would be a great place to come for any occasion. Great for out of town guests or family dinner.

ok....first let me say that I grew up in PHX. And we used to go for special occasions to "Bobby MaGees" which is where BobbyQ's is now located (says something about the quality of my restaurant experiences as a young fella)...And as cheesy as Bobby McGaees was...i kind of miss the pirate serving me my dinner (and the salad bar in the bathtub).

But i do like what they have done to the place. Cool interior. Casual but with a nice upscale feel. The patio seemed really nice (didn't sit out here).

We tried a variety of things. A burger, a pulled pork sandwich, brisket, baby backs etc...

I think the standout were the ribs. VERY good...very tender (but not overcooked), good sauce.  I enjoyed every one.Everything else was just ok. Like on par with Chili's (which isn't saying much). 

The sides were pretty tasty. Corn (roasted and then taken off the cob for you) , mashed potatoes, cornbread...all pretty good. 

Dinner for 4 (2 kids, no booze)...50$.

But a 5 star place? Maybe in the context of other restaurants in the Dunlap and I-17 areas (next to crazy Mitch's Furniture barn.) But not in the broader context of PHX.

I would definitely go back for ribs...but not a place that will go into the normal rotation.

Side note: Hilarious crowd on a Saturday night. Lots of "west side" clubbers...or maybe too old to be clubbers but want to go clubbing (there is a lounge attached).

I have never had BBQ in the South, Texas, or anywhere outside of California (except Bobby Q), but of all the places I've tried, Bobby Q is my current favorite BBQ place EVER!  I found this place on Yelp and came here while on a trip to Arizona.  The place was pretty crowded but we only  waited about 15-20 minutes.  We ordered babyback ribs, St. Louis ribs, corn, and mac&cheese.  They also give you DELICIOUS AMAZING CORNBREAD!

Everything was excellent.  The St. Louis ribs were the best ribs I have ever had.  They were extremely tender and had a nice flavorful bark on the  outside with dark grill marks.  Their BBQ sauce was equally awesome and the kind I like -- a bit more on the sweeter side, less on the vinegary side.  The babyback ribs were also tasty, but not as flavorful (and less meat of course) than the St. Louis ones.  The sides were good but more forgettable due to the sheer perfection of their ribs.

I don't know if I will ever be in Phoenix again, but this place is a must-return if I ever am.  Oh and at the end of the meal, they gave us complimentary, piping hot FRESH cinnamon donuts!  That double-won me over.  I want Bobby Q right now.

My sister and I were seated very quickly and our server JT came right over.  He suggested an appetizer and it was on point!  They were the beef brisket rolls; I don't remember the actual name.  We asked which he preferred out of two items on the menu and was given a quick response. The service given to us by the entire staff was great,  even the manager came to ask us how we were.

The food was amazing.  We both got the Fried Chicken with gravy. We had mashed potatoes and mac n cheese. Everything was really delicious!! 
We both recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and a great night.  

P.S. The complimentary donuts are also really good!

My friends and I were visiting Phoenix for Spring Training and staying at a near by hotel. As none of us were in a state to drive but desperately needed dinner we decided to check out Bobby Q. We were definitely worried about what we were getting ourselves into given the neighborhood surroundings but once we walked through the doors of Bobby Q we were pleasantly surprised.

The menu was incredible. Every BBQ option under the sun. All meals started with some great corn bread. The beer selection was phenomenal! We ordered a bunch of different things on the menu and loved every single one. Personally I had the rib combo plate and enjoyed every bite. My one regret was ordering the baked beans as one of my sides. It wasn't bad but just seemed average in comparison to everything else. Definitely get the mac and cheese!

This was definitely the best surprise of our trip and we will definitely be heading back next year!

Had never been here before. The women sitting next to us told us we had to try the Q rolls which we did. Almost a "brisket in a blanket"  type appetizer. I like them best dipped in the chipotle sauce they came with, my husband liked them dipped in the barbecue sauce which was a little sweet for my taste.  I had a brisket sandwich with a baked potato and my husband had the salmon dinner with fries and mac & cheese. (yes, I made fun of him for getting salmon at a barbecue place-- but he said it was delicious!). Very large portions--- be prepared for a food coma afterwords!  The brisket was very good! The server was wonderful, and very knowledgeable about the menu. A nice touch was fresh made cinnamon donuts that were given to you at the end of the meal.

I have to say it was overall pretty good.  The location is nice.  I heard how wonderful the mac n cheese was supposed to be, and I did not like it.  It tasted very processed to me. Also, there was too much cheese in it.  The waiter we had was awesome, and the customer service was great.  I have had better bbq where I am from on the East coast, but it was not awful by any means.  I think the mini donuts are adorable.  Also, the cornbread was amazing.  I ate a piece, and I do not like cornbread usually.  I will come bk and give you guys another try in the future.
Have been to this place several times and just love it. Food is great and service is wonderful. Great atmosphere, a little pricey but it makes for a great date night!

Luv, Luhv, LOVE their Whole Hog platter.  It's always enough to feed my family.  2 types of ribs, 2 meats, and 3 sides.
