The service is always friendly, though my server out in the patio wasn't as good as the other servers I've had there before.  I'll eventually have to go back there again and try some of their other offerings.  Great BBQ!

Found this place on Yelp while in town on business today.  Looked like the place was run down and on the way to being washed up when I pulled up into the parking lot.  Turns out that "run down BBQ shack" is the look that they were shooting for!

The inside is another matter.  Obviously a BBQ place.  But a very nice one indeed.  Nicer and with more personality than Famous Dave's or Lucille's.  If this is a chain, it doesn't feel like it.  I sat at the bar (as I usually do when traveling).  They have indoor and outdoor seating.  Both looked comfortable and fairly well lit.  And the place is CLEAN; including the restrooms!

The staff i dealt with was friendly and attentive without getting on your nerves.  Obviously experienced and well trained.

I had the baby back ribs with mac & cheese, and grilled vegetables.  The ribs were meaty and tender with an excellent BBQ sauce.  Meat came off the bone easily.  I ate them with a fork with no problem.  The meal came with good cornbread and butter.  The Mac & cheese was creamy and delicious.  And the vegetables were grilled just right without being too soft.

Don't be put off by the rustic appearance of Bobby Q's.  This is a well run restaurant that gets plenty of business.  And they should.  They have a smoker on premises, and smoke their ribs and brisket for the better part of a day.  They also dry age their own beef on premises.  I was told that the rib eye is superb.  But that will have to wait for another day.

If you like BBQ, I just don't see how you could have a bad experience here.

Who knows why I chose BBQ in Arizona when coming from Texas, but it was a great choice. They had a sweet kick to everything (their sauce and cornbread) which was a huge plus to me...but it wasnt overly, diabetic sweet. The lemonade tasted home made... and very good. 

I had to get a to go box and they gave cute little donuts when you are done. A little on the higher side price  for BBQ ( again, I'm from Texas), but I'd return!
Great food, great service.  All staff was very nice, wait wasn't extremely bad (20 minutes).  Had the hog heaven and split it with a friend.  We still has plenty to take home.  Awesome cornbread!

Really really good barbeque, and I'm a harsh critic.  Spending a lot of time in East Texas has me a bit of a bbq snob but this place didn't disappoint.  Good baby back ribs, good rotisserie chicken, good corn bread, and solid mash potatoes.  Also, great frozen strawberry lemonade.  Not the cheapest but I don't mind considering I was satisfied.

This place is the best barbecue I've had in Phoenix so far. For some reason I expected a cafe-style joint given that most places in Arizona are run that way but instead we were greeted with a big, fully decorated roadhouse style building with a huge patio and fancy interior. They even had a separate bar area which I plan to try out soon. I was told it was overpriced and overrated by my in-laws and it was everything but that! We both got a sampler platter which comes with three meat choices, a side, cornbread, and little unexpected fried sugar dough thingers to send you off. I'm usually expecting dried meat and sides that taste like they've been sitting out but everything was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy. I was even impressed by the corn that had a sweet smokey flavor to it. Only $26 before tax for two people as well. Service was great, energetic, and helpful as well. We took home what little scraps we had and had a midnight snack that reheated well too. I can't wait to come back with friends and family to show them a "cooler" version of claim jumpers.

Amazing BBQ and great sides. Brisket and Pulled Pork are amazing! Pulled chicken and ribs are good too! Mac and cheese is phenomenal! Shoestring fries are a plus. Food comes out super fast! Q-rolls are a must as an appetizer. Sangria is great as a drink, but is a little pricey. They give you donuts at the end, which are pretty delicious! They have great desserts. Would suggest reservations during the busy times! Service is always fantastic. We had them cater for our rehearsal dinner and they did an amazing job. One of the best BBQ joints in the valley!

Brought our out of town company (out of country even!) looking for a good local style food that wasn't Mexican.  So glad to have discovered this place!  Good service, very friendly staff, and of course, great food!

If you like meat, Go here. I got the 3 meat combo. It was big. It takes 2 to down this. The staff at the bar was great. Also the manager stopped by. Cool place to go. Food was really good. Eat people, eat here.

BLOWN AWAY by this place! my husband and i just moved here less than 2 weeks ago, we wanted bbq so we came on yelp and say this place had great reviews, and decided to try it with absolutely no idea what to expect. this place is INCREDIBLE! its a lot nicer than we were expecting, we thought it'd just be some hole in the wall with great food... maaan were we wrong! awesome craft beer selection, great craft cocktails, the cornbread is epic, bbq brisket sandwich melted in my mouth and had an amazing smoking flavor that cannot be achieved by cutting corners.. bbq sauce was delicious, mac n cheese is legendary and super creamy, mashed potatoes made me hear angels sing, shoestring fries were surprisingly above average, and as if we weren't already in heaven enough, they bring you a bag of fresh cinnamon sugar donuts to take home. i can now die happy. seriously it was so good that they could have come to our table at the end and told me it was human flesh we'd just eaten and i woulda been like f it, i guess im a cannibal now cause im 100% gonna eat that again.

Had the brisket and it was so so so so so soft. Delicious. The cornbread was also great and I liked the sauces, although the spicy didn't have much of a kick. The only disappointing bit was the Mac and Cheese. It tasted like it came out of a Velveeta box :/.

Cheap Beer, Platters full of BBQ Meat, Good Music, and Basketball on the TV.

How can this not be an awesome place?!?!

Another gem of a find from Yelp while staying in Phoenix. Again, out of the way, from where we were staying anyway.  Another place smack dab in the middle of a neighborhood. Another place with friendly service, amusing barfly regulars, and good food.  If it weren't so hot in Phoenix, I'd have a crisis about living arrangements!

Happy Hour in the bar was great: $3.00 large beers on tap and 1/2 off appetizers. We shared some hot wings which were very tasty. I wanted more of those, for sure.

After about 3 or 4 beers, we went with the Whole Hog Feast. The name alone is awesome!  For 36 bucks we got:
-Baby Back Ribs
-St. Louis Ribs
-Pulled Pork
-Beef Brisket
-Mac N. Cheese
-Cole Slaw
-Baked Potato
-Cornbread

Um, hello?!?! This was so much food and it was all good!  The cornbread was sweet and had great texture; meat was tender and flavorful, mac n cheese was rich and creamy. A little spicy bbq sauce on the side to kick everything up was a nice addition. Mouth is watering a little now just typing it out!  Although we were stuffed (and had a full to go box ready), we had to try the Peach Cobbler. So good.

Again, if I lived nearby, my pants would be in serious jeopardy of fitting properly! =)

The 4 stars is for Friday night happy hour only!! It runs from 4-8pm and they have an outstanding complimentary buffet! The drink specials are decent. You can get a double well drink for the price of a single, and they pour nicely. 
Back to the buffet - I'm pretty sure it is only on Fri, but the buffet has tacos, nachos, fruit, veggies, and a beef brisket.

My waistline theories go like this: if it's free, the calories don't count. This goes for items like free bread, butter, candies at the end of the meal and especially the free donuts they give me before I leave Bobby Qs. Those definitely do not count towards my waistline. Bobby Qs is a your run of the mill BBQ restaurant with fun (and slightly cheesy) decor, fatty yet satisfying and tasty food and overall a fun time. This restaurant is hidden off of random side streets but the catch is that you can see it from the 17. 

Like I said, the food here is fatty but pretty good. Expect BBQ food with a chain-like feel. The atmosphere is the same. In summary, if you're in the area and get hungry, this is a great option. I think it would also be fun for a low key group dinner. Plus, they serve those donuts. Yum.

My wife and I have been going here for years. The food is fantastic. In house smoked meats are some of the best BBQ in town. The steak and crab leg special on Saturdays is my favorite. At $18.00 you can't go wrong. Great beer selection clean glasses and always cold. They strive for great service and we have always had a pleasant experience.  Highly recommend.

I know a thing or two about a good BBQ being from the midwest.  Let me tell you that Bobby Q's is a good good day. 

The doughnuts at the end are wonderful. 

I recommend hittin' this place up on a Sunday when you can get the family chicken/ribs/pork/brisket with 2 sides combo.  

If I'm ever back in Phoenix I'll be over at Bobby Q's.

2000+ reviews and rated nearly 5 stars? Why, yes please!

What an incredible experience. This was by far the best BBQ spot I've ever been to. Great ambiance, with both indoor and outdoor seating options, great service, a wonderful dinner vibe, and most importantly, the  best tasting food!

On a nice evening, I'd recommend, if possible, to sit at the outdoor patio.  Outdoor string lights cover the patio. It's sort of dim inside but with bright lighting above each table. Instead of waiting for a table, three of us sat at the bar. With a couple TVs, we were able to catch up on sports.

Among our group we ordered the beef brisket and ribs. When they say a full rack of ribs, you get a full, meaty rack. The sides included shoestring fries, grilled vegetables, roasted corn, sautéed mushrooms, and mac n' cheese. The mac n' cheese was the star side of the show while the ribs were the best I have ever tasted. When our food arrived, I was immensely in a better mood (I was already in good mood seeing how awesome the place was). When I tasted the food, I couldn't have been in a happier place. The brisket was delicious but clearly, the ribs are something truly special.

You get 10% off for checking in on Yelp. I forgot to use it but everything was so amazing I didn't care.

This place is highly recommended and I would absolutely without a doubt go to Bobby Q again.

Excellent bbq... Excellent service.... Had the baby back ribs in the meat fell off the bone. The coleslaw was excellent as well as the mac & cheese!  We'll definitely be back! Thank u Yelp for the 10% off

Free sides of corn bread and donuts for desserts? Sure! The food was very tasty and price is pretty average for a bbq joint. My baby back ribs were delicious, but they are too fall off the bone if you get my point. I prefer ribs that still cling to the bone, but can be pulled off easily as well. To each their own. The sauces were amazing and the portions are ridiculously huge. Sharing is recommended if you don't want to take home leftovers.

Good bbq and super busy. Made a reservation via Yelp and was glad I did because it was packed out when we arrived at 8pm.

Our server, Jonah, was super nice and helpful with the menu.

We got St Louis ribs, sausage, brisket, potato salad, Mac n cheese, baked beans and grilled veggies.

The sides were good...mac n cheese was creamy and cheesy, veggies were grilled just right, baked beans were flavorful and pieces of brisket were in them and the potato salad was seasoned well.

The sausage was a nice combination of seasonings and pork with not to much fat. They advertised it as spicy but I didn't notice any heat.

The brisket had a nice ratio of fat and meat and the ribs were tender.

Overall good bbq at a little higher price than I'd pay normally but it's a more upscale restaurant and the service was very good.

I was really torn on giving them four stars.  But the main entree was  just not something I would come back for.  

Everything started out great.  Our server was on top of it.  Her name is Shay, and girl, you are just a SuperServer.  She is five stars.  She is excellence in itself.

The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is pretty good, casual yet upscale bbq joint.  They nailed that.

One thing to note is that all the meats are smoked for over 20 hours.  Sounds good!  We own a smoker, and the longest we had smoked anything was 8 hours.

For the appetizer, we ordered the Q rolls;  Tortilla wrapped brisket deep fried and served with chipotle sauce.  YUMMY!  Delicous!  If I come back, I will order these again.  The cornbread everyone raved about was alright..

For the main entree we split the 3  meat combo;  the pork, brisket, and sausage.  For the sides we had mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese.  Sure glad we shared.  It was alot of food.

This  is where it falls for me.  Maybe I went on an off day; but the meats were disappointing, especially after hearing they have been smoked for 20 hours. It was not flavorful or delectable or anything, just meat that was edible.  Even drowning it in bbq sauce didn't make it anymore appetizing for me. The mashed potatoes were very very BLAND.  I salt and peppered them to death trying to flavor them a bit.  The mac and cheese was very creamy, and was decent, but...I make tastier mac at home, thought not as creamy.  Its sad for me to convey this; I really was not satisfied with my meal.

Now the doughnuts they provided at the end of the meal was fresh and good. 

I don't know if I will be back, mainly because I want to try other restaurants and there are so many options out there.  But when I finish my quest to attempt different types of eateries, Bobby Q is not a place I would write off.

Came here for lunch.  We got the Q-rolls and people aren't kidding - they were delicious.  I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  Everything was really good.  My husband had ribs and brisket and scarfed them down.  I was really stunned by the prices though - really high in my opinion.  Food was good, service was good, but it was pricy enough to prevent me from returning on a regular basis.  Entrees ranged from $17-40.

Anytime is a good time for barbecue. The smell of burning wood, the sweet thick or vinegary sauces and meat that just fall off the bone -- these elements have mass appeal to my senses.

So it's probably no surprise that I've been to most Valley smokehouses to check out their goods.

My latest exploration, Bobby-Q, came after a day of bargain hunting at a clearance outlet at Metrocenter. So much shopping can work up an appetite, and you'll need an appetite since the prices at Bobby-Q are low and the portions are large.

The location might be familiar to many longtime Phoenicians -- it was Bobby McGee's until about five years ago. I have many fond memories eating there with my family as a kid.

While the building got a $3 million dollar makeover, the charm and coziness is intact. It's sort of a cowboy chic with dim lighting, stained concrete floors and a tin ceiling. The seating is comfortable and the service friendly and efficient. If you're in a hurry, you can call ahead; there is a separate entrance for to-go orders.

Everything on the menu is made in house, from the barbecue sauce to the fluffy corn bread. Being an avid home cook I can appreciate these extra steps.

Always wanting to try something new, the Q-Rolls ($7.50) are a take on a Mexican flauta. Filled and rolled with smoked beef brisket and then deep-fried to a golden brown, these looked better than they tasted. The roll's open ends allowed for far too much oil to penetrate the meaty interior, which ended up a tasteless crunch.

A steakhouse classic, the Wedge Salad ($5), is made with a quarter of crisp head lettuce, sprinkled with smoked bacon, chopped tomatoes and bleu cheese crumbles. I can never resist the power of blue cheese and bacon.

The menu includes entree-sized salads, sandwiches and steaks, but my focus was on smoked meats. You can order two or three meat platters, but I opted for the Whole Hog ($36), a choice of two ribs, two meats and three sides.

When the plate arrived, my eyes widened. Huge slabs of Baby Back Ribs and St. Louis-Style Ribs were framed by piles of pulled pork and beef brisket, it's quite the mother lode of meat, so be prepared to share with others.

Going straight to the ribs, I grabbed a bone and it immediately separated from the rib meat. The meat was melt-in-your -mouth tender, and rightly so; they cook their meats low and slow for about 20 hours.

With all of the meat loving going on, it's easy to forget the sides. The Mac 'n Cheese was creamy and gooey and was worth ordering again. Pecan Cole Slaw was good, but I especially liked the toasted pecans, hich provided a nice contrast. Roasted Corn comes topped with a few wheels of corn on the cob. I wish the entire dish were served this way, since the kernels were swimming in a pool of butter.

After finishing this feast, there couldn't possibly be room for Peach Cobbler ($6.50) or Mud Pie ($6.50). But it was a nice touch that the check was brought out with a small bag of hot fresh cinnamon and sugar-covered donuts.

On our recent trip here I decided to try the Southern Fried Chicken. It was very juicy and extremely tasty. The chicken was also boneless which made it very easy to eat. The chicken was also skinless but still had their own "skin" on it with their seasonings. Very tasty indeed! It came with a side of white gravy which was perfect to drizzle on top or dunk in each bite. The piece of chicken was quite large so I definitely have left overs. I again had to have the side of their mac n cheese as it's so yummy.

What an awesome experience. Had such a wonderful dinner tonight here. Had a minor incident (really was not a big deal!) and all night we were joking with the server about it because we thought it was the funniest thing. At some point he must have relayed this to the manager (it really was not a big deal at all!!) who walked over and comped our entire meal. In turn we left a huge tip to the server because he worked hard and deserved it. Thank you to the female manager that was on duty tonight, you went above and beyond the call of duty. Your kindness was uncalled for and you really went the extra mile to take care of us. It really was not necessary but still very much appreciated.!! This is the kind of positive experience you never forget. We will continue to visit!

Favorite BBQ place in all of Phoenix! Favorite family spot for birthday dinners. Many options for everyone to choose from. The cornbread is amazing! Be sure to ask for seconds. Great ambiance and environment. The mini donuts after the meal are delicious too!

i'm torn. on the one hand, the service was superb, we liked the actual dining experience, and some of the food was great (mashed potatoes, mac n cheese, cornbread, wings, donuts, arnold palmer cocktail). on the other hand, i went for some RIBS and that is where they failed me. i had whet my appetite last week at pork on a fork where i had some seriously tasty ribs. like i wanted to climb up onto the plate and roll around in them, that is how good they were. so now i'm on this bbq blitz and it was my birthday so i requested to come to bobby q based on reviews seeming so positive, like supposedly best bbq in phoenix! anyway, got baby back ribs and you couldn't even pick up a rib that is how much the meat fell off. like literally reached for a bone and all i got was bone, meat stayed on the plate. it was like a gelatinous mess. there should be some bite, some crispy parts from the smoker, something! and i wasn't crazy about the sauce - ribs were way over-sauced, like sauce got slapped on right before they went on the plate and i did not care for the flavor of it. no choice of sauce, yet when we were packing up our leftovers the waitress appeared with two different kinds in to-go containers. huh? so i wonder if i had ordered something else if i would have been happier, but still. truthfully, i doubt i will come back unless someone else makes me and if i do i will stay away from ribs.

The decor of the restaurant made you feel that you were transported to a different place from Phoenix. My husband and I ordered the Whole Hog Heaven to share. For the ribs, we chose the baby back and beef; meat brisket and chicken (bone-in); sides mashed potatoes, mix veg and corn. The portion was generous and the BBQ was delicious. The only thing was there was not enough BBQ sauce on top and we needed to ask for extra. The food came pretty quickly but since we were seated at the booth that belonged to the bar, our waiter/bartender was busy and we needed to wait to get his attention. We didn't get any dessert but were given some fresh mini-donuts to go. That was a pleasant surprise.

As a relatively new transplant from the Bay Area I lamented the lack of great , independently owned restaurants here in the Phoenix area- particularly given that I live pretty far north up the 17 near Happy Valley with little more than national chains. But a friend suggested I try this place for great BBQ so last week I took the 17 minute drive and was absolutely knocked out on a number of levels. 

The service of this establishment is superb. It is one of the best managed restaurants I've ever patronized and the staff, from the bartender to the server all operated at a very high standard. 

Now as for the food, one night I had their St Louis style ribs SANS the extra sauce ( I am a dry rub guy) and they were superb. Not fatty at all, tasty,  and the meat fell off the bone. Good fries and a very nice pecan coleslaw. Buy the chicken tender appetizer? OMG! By far and away the best I have had anywhere in the country!

Last night I enjoyed the fried chicken which is actually a butterflied breast of chicken - also excellent. The friendly gentleman sitting next to me at the bar had their prime rib and LOVED it. It looked AWESOME!

A big shout out to the manager Taylor who handled a minor issue ( my bad, not Bobby Q) in a MOST professional way. If in Phoenix you absolutely MUST go and if you're coming in for only 3 or 4 days, I would absolutely recommend you place Bobby Q on your list as those restaurants you simply cannot overlook on your trip to the desert.

Bobby Q has being in the restaurant business down pat. When you first walk in, it seem sort of up scale. The waitress we had seemed new, but was very nice and was sure to remember everything. The food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time and was tasty. I had their Fish Fry Friday and I think the fish could have been seasoned a little more. I found myself using more of the tartar sauce because of the lack of seasoning on the fish. They do this thing with homemade donuts which I think is a great happy ended. I am the type of person that does need a little bit of sweet at the end of my meal and that was perfect.

I have not been here in a long time, and man Bobby Q's has really stepped up their game. Same location, same awesome feel with better food and service.

We had a great time! The baby back rips were spot on, the pulled pork was nice and moist, and the brisket had very little fat on it. The side were all fantastic as well. Extra cheesy Mac and Cheese and fluffy mashed potato's. This was all washed down with there house beer, which was a Red from Sedona Brewing. No complaints at all on the food.

The service was also great! My pops was in town from Florida so we all went out and our server was more then accommodating the kids and all of our needs. He did a fantastic job, and had several other tables besides ours. 

Plus you get a little bonus before and after your meal. Bonus number 1, 10% off your bill when you do a yelp check in. Bonus 2, corn bread brought to you before your meal. Bonus 3, after your meal you get cinnamon  donuts. 

I am looking forward to going back and thankfully this is one of the few BBQ places that is a reasonable distance from my house.
We had a wonderful experience here good food good service really delicious bbq ribs and the little donuts in the brown bag were delicious. Would go back. Really good food won't be disappointed.

We were visiting in this area of Phoenix looking for a good dinner.  Well, we ended up with an even better dinner than we were looking for.  The atmosphere was great along with a superb wait staff.  The baby back ribs were fantastic along with the sides and peach cobbler.  This was a great choice and we will be coming back next time we are in town.

Everything was 5 stars: food, service, ambiance. 

I had the St. Louis ribs, beef brisket, coleslaw, roasted corn, corn bread and I tried the pulled pork. Again - all outstanding. The ribs really stood out for smokiness and tender. I have to say too that the coleslaw was among the best I have ever eaten (pecan coleslaw). Oh yeah - constant re-supply of incredible cornbread biscuits!

As much as the food, the service was noticeably top notch. Various servers kept us informed about their role (drinks, taking order, bringing food, etc.) and our main server was attentive and well paced. The manager checked in and asked how we were enjoying our meal. Even the hostess gave us good information about where to sit. 

Venue: great lighting, comfortable seating, roomy (but not too much) tables and well managed noise level. All good.

Value: $55 for two including tip and one drink each. Wow - for that meal, service and atmosphere, a tremendous value. Go here.

It's crazy to think that I am just now writing a review for Bobby Q's! My first experience with Bobby Q's was a few years back and I still think to this day that it is some of the best BBQ I have had. The great thing about Bobby Q's is that its not all about the BBQ but they also have really amazing burgers, appetizers, and those delicious little cinnamon sugar donuts at the end! Just the thought of those little pillowy sugary donuts makes me drool! Q rolls as an appetizer is a must and their spinach and artichoke dip is fantastic as well. 

I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who was looking for really delicious BBQ!

One of the best BBQ joints I've ever been to. My friend and I both ordered the Whole Hog Heaven which we probably should have just split. Large portion of food that left us full without completely draining our wallets. The complimentary mini donuts at the end of the meal were a nice surprise.

My fiance and I loved our meal here: we would say overall 4.5 but rounded up. Our server Zac was fabulous! He did not miss a beat. Loved the cornbread. The fiance loved the Q-rolls but they weren't my jam. We shared the 3 meats combo. They were out of sausage so we split the brisket, pork (my favorite), and ribs (his favorite).  It was so nice of them to provide us with 2 plates with all of the meats split so we could sample everything. I also tried the mango margarita which was fabulous and the perfect bite and sweetness. I loved the creaminess of the mac but the fiance wasn't too impressed. Shoestings delivered but were nothing special. Overall, I was very happy and we left with leftovers. The churro spiced light donuts were also fabulous. I just love the feel of this place.

Wow...  I'm from California and we don't really have any BBQ there, so I like to indulge a little when I travel.   Last month I was in Ft Worth, Dallas, Austin, San Antonio, and New Orleans.    People there  said I had to try the Salt Lick in Round Rock (outside of Austin), and it was "ok"... I thought at the time.. "ok, it's above average"... I thought maybe I didn't really have a taste for it. 

New Orleans Jambalaya can't be matched... I'll leave it at that.  I didn't try the gumbo at Bobby Q, I just thought I would be disappointed after New Orleans a couple of weeks ago.   Brisket was unbelievable, also the best I've ever had. 

I tried the 3-meat combo and had chicken, St. Louis ribs, and brisket.   All were over the top, the brisket especially.  The ribs were very large and very tender.. probably the best I've ever had (anywhere). 

Mac & Cheese is supposedly their specialty... it was good, but I've had better, it wasn't that memorable but I didn't leave any behind either.  Baked potato side ... I wasn't happy with it, seemed under cooked or something.   I usually have a salad at least once a day, but I didn't try it at Bobby Q, I assumed it wasn't their thing. 

Ambiance was excellent but I opted to sit in the patio, it was a beautiful night, but what a mistake.   It was only occupied by a work-party or something and they were rather ripped, drunk, and to the point of talking about what it's like to travel in the south as a gay man, etc... kind of crude and I wasn't interested, neither was anyone else... higher class places would have asked them to leave. (I dinged the score for this).  After the crowd had it's fill of drinking, they turned to smoking... Oh My ... Yuck... haven't seen that in about a decade... One nice thing about California... smoking is fine, as long as it's 200 feet from anyone else.  The patio has a cover that is low and curved at the sides, it held the smoke in like an airship.   After 20 minutes, I was really gagging and it made the food taste awful.   Smokers... I know you like to light up after dinner, but you don't smoke "during" dinner.  Why is that?  Makes the food taste nasty? Yes... it does... learn to be considerate and take it outside for people that are eating and paying as well.   Took any desire for dessert away, I just wanted to leave at that point. 

If not for the smoking (which should really be banned in the constrained area), and the mediocre sides I would have given it 5 stars.   As it is, solid 4 (meat was that good).
Bomb!! Everything is just delicious. My man feel asleep at the table lol. That's how you know it's good

Loved this place! I tried the St. Louis style ribs and they were right in the description.. They fell off the bone and had a good bark as well. The salads were great (which I also had). I was expecting a plain boring salad but no; It was delightful with plenty of veggies and extras. I didn't particularly care for the side of ranch beans, felt like they could have done a better job with making those tastier.. Also loved their complimentary "thank Q" doughnuts.. They were warm and tasted somewhat like a churro... The ambiance was fun and pleasing to the eye and I even heard their a night club on the other side of the restaurant which sounds like fun too. Overall I suggest anyone to come try this place, I don't think you will be disappointed.

This place is 10 stars. My husband was looking up BBQ in Phoenix and came upon this place so on the way to Sedona we stopped by. 
The area looks like there wouldn't be a restaurant and the parking lot is not to appeling but once you hot the side and see the patio and inside man this place is nice and the food is GOOD!! There was 7 of us and we got sat fast. I had the BBQ chicken and mash and I ate it all and I never finish my food. My husband had the Sampler plate and he loved it. The corn bread is good. After your meal they bring a bag a freshly fried donuts and sugar. This place is soooooooooooooooooo good. When we come back to Phoenix we will go there again. Best BBQ we have tasted by far.

I read a review here saying the ribs were as good as PHIlS BBQ in California. I did not believe it since Phils has award winning ribs. Well I was wrong. This place has the best ribs in Arizona. You will not leave disappointed one bit when you leave. The manager Krissy was super nice. I highly recommend you come check this place out.

Awesome BBQ! We ordered beef ribs, baby back ribs, and a brisket sandwich. Apparently, their meat is smoked for 22 hours or more. The ribs were super tender and the brisket was juicy. The sides we ordered, corn, shoestring fries, and mac n cheese were good as well. Also included in the meal was cornbread. That little guy was delicious! Would we come back? We will definitely come back.

We were in Phoenix for a family vacay and we were lucky to find this great place.  Best BBQ ribs I've had and  customer service is EXCELLENT!  We ordered take out,wait time was minimal.  Wish we had one in Cali.

Went on A Mothers-day thought it would be over packed but it wasn't . Table for four seated quickly. Ribs, steaks, barbecue pork sandwich all was excellent and the free bags of doughnuts as a desert was a nice touch.

My family & friends were visiting from out of town and randomly stopped by to have dinner at Bobby Q's in Phoenix Az. Not sure what to expect, we were blown away by the best service we have ever experienced, anywhere!  Not only was the service exceptional, the food was absolutely delicious! I'm a pretty picky eater and the food was beyond what I expected.  We all shared. We ordered ribs, prime rib, pulled pork, and the amazing Q's for an appetizer. We finished with a mud pie and banana freeze dessert.  While waiting to be sat all the way to finishing our meal, we were educated about the extensive preparation that goes into their food, Bobby Q's brewed beer (which was very good!), and all of the ways they prepare all of the food on the menu.  A HUGE thank you to manager Jack Lineberger!!  He was awesome and made our experience awesome enough to post on Yelp.  Thank you Jack!  We will stop by the next time we are in town!

Better than Wagyu I had at Roka Akor in Scottsdale 

Hubby and I stopped here for lunch after reading the reviews on Yelp. I ordered the prime rib and shrimp chimichurri combo. Husband ordered 2 meat combo with chicken and brisket. Both meals were OUT OF BOUNDS. My prime rib was BETTER than the $250 Wagyu I ordered at Roka Akor. Waaaay better. Drinks are equally outstanding. I had an old fashioned that was yum. Serina-thank you for the phenomenal top-notch service! Good luck on your test next Saturday!!! And manager Joanna-thank you for quickly responding to meat readiness. I wanted it a little less red and it was resolved in minutes. No waiting!!! The food, drink and service were incredible.  Will tell everyone I know to come here.

We had a big family dinner here Friday night (14 people) and had such a great experience!! The Q rolls are one of the yummiest things I've ever eaten; I had filet and my boyfriend had the ribs & various meat platter and it was all SO GOOD. I see why this restaurant has such great ratings, the fresh donuts at the end of the meal just top it off. We'll be back soon for sure

The service my family and I received (dining with five adults and two cranky little ones) was phenomenal! Our waitress couldn't have been nicer and the manager checked on us and made sure we were getting good food and good service. The food was great too and we thought it was a good value because we all shared the biggest barbecue platter (and the kids shared a kids meal, which was split for them and they were given extra fries) and it was more than enough food (we even took home some leftovers). GREAT experience all around: such a kind and lovely waitress plus delicious food!
I went for dinner with my friend. The meat was really good especially the huge beef rib!! I can say that it is one of the best bbq in az!

Great BBQ! One of my favorite places. Recommend going earlier in the evening because there is always a very long wait! We usually wait about an hour every time. There is very little seats to wait so usually have to stand. Huge parking lot so never have a hard time finding a spot to park. Location is a little odd because you have to drive through a residential area. Overall cool place!

We had to stop by to visit this highly Yelp ranked BBQ restaurant.  And we are happy we did.

Venue: (5/5) place is big and without a doubt has that southern country feel.  There is outside and inside seating.  We came in the winter so the outside was not an option.

Food (4/5) 
BBQ ribs and a side of Mac and cheese (5/5) - My friend is not big into food and is still talking about the amazing ribs and the creamy Mac & cheese!!!! Ask for the BBQ sauces if you want to smother more amazing calories on your meal (like me).  

Corn bread (5/5) the best I've ever eaten WOW

Warm donuts to bring home (3/5) not the best but free and warm

Service (5/5) warm and friendly

What a great find on a Friday night... great BBQ and amazing southern charm and hospitality. Complimentary corn bread to start and cinnamon mini donut in a little paperbag to go! And, the BBQ was good!!

If there is one thing Bobby knows how to do, that is how to que! Second time visiting this place and first time in a year. This visit made me wonder why I gave up meat for almost a year of my life. They may want to reconsider a name change to flavor town because your taste buds are ambushed by an abundance of flavor from every which way. I had the Jumbo BBQ Potato topped with brisket and a side of Mac n Cheese and it was phenomenal! I can't remember the last time I had a meal this enjoyable and delicious where I savored every bite. The brisket was cooked perfectly, little to no fat, juicy, tender, and flavorful. The barbeque sauce was full of flavor, not too thin, not too thick, and it had the perfect amount of tang to it. The Mac n Cheese was full of cheesy flavor. It went really well when paired with the barbeque sauce. I poured a little over the Mac n Cheese to give it a little extra flavor. The place was packed and they said we had about a 45 min wait and ended up waiting only 15 or so minutes. The service was great as well. I can't wait to go back!

Hands down the best BBQ place I've ever had... never given a restaurant a 5 star but this one deserves it.. everything was on point from the cornbread all the way to free dessert when u leave.. try the ribs and the brisket (stay away from the beef ribs and get the pork ribs)

I would give 6 stars if I could. This place has it all! The food, the service, and the atmosphere is always on point. I've never had a problem in all of my visits here. 

-The Service
My first time at Bobby Q, the Server greeted us (My Girlfriend and I) with an awesome attitude. She explained that their signature ribs are smoked for 22 hours, and a brief history about the company. There's usually a Manager circling around to make sure everyone is satisfied.

-The Food
My Girlfriend and I always order the 2 Rib Combo, I get the St. Louis Style, She gets the Baby Back. Believe me when I say, the meat literally and I mean literally falls off the bone with no effort at all! The sauce tastes amazing and they're not stingy with it. One of the highlights is the cornbread. Now, if you know me at all, I used to hate cornbread. But Bobby Q has changed my mind. The cornbread is very tasty and you can actually taste the real corn.

-Atmosphere
Kinda gives you a feel of an indoor picnic. They have unique seating. I personally like seating in the booths facing the TVs at the Bar. They usually have sports games on (NFL, MLB, NBA etc...) I believe at a certain time, it changes into a Night Club, which I have yet to try. I haven't tried their drinks yet, but I'm looking forward to it.

I would recommend Bobby Q to anyone I know. No matter how busy they are, they make sure their customers are happy. And they do get pretty busy. That's expected with the amazing food and service they have. Kudos to the Owner and Managers. And thank you to the wonderful staff! I'll definitely be back! - Gabriel Salazar

Great BBQ spot in Phoenix area. I came to eat here from out of town and was impressed by the excellent service despite high volume when I arrived. The food was incredibly good and fast. I waited longer to order vs actually receiving the food. Very good flavoring and pricing reasonable. Recommended 100%!!!

The price of that Sunday special is now under $40 but it's still a value!

Bobby Q is still a regular for our household. We LOVE the ribs which fall off the bone as you pick them up from the plate, the mac and cheese which has a mild tang and the sweet, buttery corn. 

Even if you don't go on Sunday, Bobby Q offers some great family-size platters at a reasonable price in a fun atmosphere.

Sorry to disagree with so many happy consumers but I just paid nearly $20 for very poor beef brisket. It's one thing to smoke the meat until its tender but quite another to cook it to an almost mushy texture. Couldn't even pick up the brisket with a fork-it fell apart. That's not tenderness on a BBQ scale. The grilled veggies were 3/4 large chunks of bell pepper...meh. I really wanted to love this meal but came away feeling like I paid far too much

They are just great, here! The food AND the service!!! I have NEVER been disappointed. Even if something has slipped a server's mind, they have immediately owned it and rectified the issue. I recently did a pretty big take out order for 10 and when I went to pick it up, the worker asked me to go over it with him while he boxed it all to make sure nothing got missed! My family has been going here for years...we treat our of town guests to it and, I imagine, we'll keep it up for years to come!

Absolutely delicious!  Some of the best BBQ I've had in a long time.  The pulled pork was succulent and the brisket was juicy and tasty.  Enjoyed the complimentary donuts after our meal.  

Thanks for a wonderful experience!

A must go to place when in town. Best BBQ EVER!

The service is great and this is a great place for groups. Especially when getting the hog heaven. 

Brisket, sausage, chicken, corn bread.

Based on the recommendation of my peer yelper's, my wife and I tried this while in Phoenix. I have to say we were not disappointed at all. This was AMAZING! 

Our server was Alexis and she did a really great job. Great positive energy and made us feel very welcome. She was on point with our food and follow up on our needs. Excellent customer service!!!

The appetizer we tried was the Q rolls which is a brisket spring roll with two sauces. They hit the spot and were super tasty. The cornbread was a nice touch as well with a little butter and then with the bean sides for the meal. 

We ordered the Hog Heaven meal which the description states it is great for yourself or to share with someone else.....Hmmm no this is enough for you, your friend, and another friend lol. 

I was expecting small portions so you get a taste. You get to pick two of the three rib styles. These are not just one or two ribs. You get a half rack of two different styles of ribs. Then you get three meat choices plus three sides. These are all regular portions not small mini portions.

I am a big guy and really enjoy BBQ. Between my wife and I we did not finish this meal there was enough left for a whole other meal.

The food is smoked on site and you can taste the nice smoke flavor in the meat which is tender and juicy. The ribs have a lot of meat on them with just a touch of crispiness on the outside. The meat was fall off the bone tender. The brisket was so moist and tender it was incredible. The sausage is absolutely home made! You can taste the difference in the sausage and texture. The chicken is super tender and again full of moisture even the chicken breast was juicy. 

The pecan colesaw, ranch beans, and the mac & cheese were all super tasty sides!

If you are in the area I would highly recommend stopping and checking out some amazing BBQ.

We had an awesome dinner with4 other friends tonight  all enjoyed our meals  so much food the corn bread is awesome and the warm donuts at the end of the meal  are amazing   i did think my potato was a little dry and you could tell by the cheese but other than that  i would still go back  our waiter was Hunter he was as good as the meal  so nice and kind and very helpful   he had a very Happy personality...
The food was incredible, huge portions!  Our server Amanda by far the greatest we've seen in hospitality!
Food was great and service was even better! Scott was fantastic. there was a little wait wait for our food and the manager offered a free desert on her.

I have used Bobby Q'S for years for major events and dinner. I not only would try to eat here as much as possible I catered them for my wedding reception, and several family parties. 

So since I have moved to Houston I went here as soon as I came home. For Texas to be known for BBQ I can say Bobby slays the majority of them with his cooking. Not only is all the meat good but the side dishes are out of this world. 

We ordered the Whole hog heaven which is a BBQ lovers dream. We choose both Baby back ribs and St. Louis-TENDER FALL OF THE BONE

Brisket-Incredible but most importantly consistent. for all the years I have been coming it is always melt in your mouth incredible.

Chicken-So tender and smoky I die

Sides
Mac and Cheese-Always so delicious although this time it was slightly off, I couldn't put my finger on it. I would like to believe it was just a bad batch, because its always so creamy and full of velvetta, YES.

Potato Salad-Perfectly seasoned too perfection, Served super cold and reminds you of summer.

Corn bread-From scratch moist and sweet. You could eat a pound of these.

BBQ Sauces-Hot and Reg-Thick, balanced and rich the only type of sauce that should be on BBQ. Think Sweet Baby Rays X10

Last the complimentary donuts- DO NOT MISS THESE TREASURES.
Favorite part you get fresh made donuts at the end , they have leveled up the food experience to a whole new level !!

It's got everything a great BBQ place needs - great selection of meats always cooked to perfection, great tasting sauce, sweet tea, Mac n cheese, sweet potatoes and peach cobbler! Service is always friendly and timely. As a native Texan who lives here in the valley this is the best place I've found. The only negative is the location.
Not a place I frequent but found the food and service to be very good! My drink was a little weak. I'd definitely come again!

I'm getting pretty close to not setting foot in here again.  Here's why:
As a regular, I not only go there for the food, but because of the people.  I have known these servers and bartenders for years, right up until they get shopped and fired.  That's right folks, my meals are usually almost ALWAYS ruined by some idiot shopping a beloved server or bartender of mine and I have to sit there and listen to Joe Shmo ask moronic questions like (no joke) "can my daughter have a beer?  She's sixteen....what's the legal age to consume alcohol?"  Now as a former secret shopper myself for a LARGE company, here's a few words of advice, train your shoppers, a want ad in the newspaper is ridiculous.  If you care THAT much about customer service, let your customers be your shoppers, because I can spot these idiots when they walk in, and most of them LOVE the idea of judging a young person and making them sweat for their job.  Shame on you.  Secondly as a loyal customer, the way I was treated by your shoddy excuse of management when having an allergic reaction to peanuts in your dessert was appalling.  Here's my assessment as a former shopper:

1.) When I asked the wait staff if the chocolate dessert had peanuts in it, they seemed sure it did not, but nobody could be sure because it wasn't printed on the menu.  Upon having two bites of the dessert my mouth immediately swelled up and I had an allergic reaction.  Ciara and Toni were very concerned and attentive, offering water and even a concoction to help me purge the food if needed.  They both kept a watchful eye on me while making sure to not neglect other patrons.
2.) I asked to speak to a manager to merely suggest for the second time (this happened before with their banana dessert) that as an establishment, they should protect themselves by listing peanut ingredients on the menu.  The manager replied that usually when someone has an allergy they tell the server and then the server tells the kitchen, thus making me the customer feel like it was a failure on my part to notify and announce my allergy to the entire restaurant upon my arrival.  Sitting there astounded, I asked if I was indeed hearing what I was hearing, and she glossed over it, thanked me for the feedback, said they were going to reprint their menus at some point, offered to call "someone"I'm assuming an ambulance, and pat me on the back and left.  Really?

So here's the deal, the food is good, the servers and bartenders are the best.  Pretty much everyday they work in fear of losing their job, and I can't support that.  They remember what you drink, how you like your food prepared, your name, and that's not something you get in chain restaurants, but the regulars, the ones who you could count on to support the place, they've slowly disappeared, and I'm headed that way myself.  Unless you've been sitting at your spot, enjoying your meal only to have it RUINED by some jerk shopping your friend and one of many favorite bartenders or servers, you don't know what sick is.  Getting a job in today's economy is difficult enough, but these people treat the mostly 20 something employees like slave  workers who are fortunate to be breathing the bobby q air.  I can't fathom going in to work everyday wondering if it's my last.  Finally, when a regular has a concern like PUT PEANUTS ON YOUR MENU, it's not just for the patrons benefit, but your own, and you failed to see that, instead you shrugged me off and couldn't get out of my presence fast enough; I know when I'm being patronized, don't forget, I can shop you too, and you failed big time, as in you'd be fired.  Good customer service is what Pita Jungle did where they asked me for my phone number or email address to discuss further (turned out to be pine nuts that were most likely cross contaminated).

So in conclusion, when you look around and wonder where all the regular money was that you could always count on coming in every dY at the same time, it's probably at the Black Angus, one of your former regulars is now a regular there, people can go there and grab some food and a drink or two without witnessing the torture you inflict on you're employees.  Shame on you.

I have been to Bobby Q a couple of times now and LOVE this place.
If you have a date that you need to impress and still fill your carnivorous desires, this is the place!  It's all good: ribs, juicy brisket, smoky chicken, can't go wrong here. 

The atmosphere is awesome at Bobby Q's the outside is Caribbean and the inside classy. The only improvement I would like to see would be the lunch menu on the weekends.

Bobby Q is an amazing BBQ joint. Highly recommend it! The ambience is warm and fun. The service was exceptional. It was my first time and the waitress was very well versed about the food and how it is prepared. She made great recommendations. The cornbread was so good and rib meat slip off the bone. Sides were okay. I enjoyed the grilled veggies, but the Mac n Cheese not my favorite. Dessert, Banana pie, is a must! We were approached several times by two managers and our waitress definitely checked in a few times. It was very nice, but our conversations were interrupted several times throughout the evening. Less interruptions ideal. If I am ever back in Phoenix, AZ I would definitely return.

The food here is amazing! We started with the Q Rolls which were delicious! The brisket was so tender and flavorful! I got the pulled pork sandwich which was fantastic. It was cooked to perfection! My boyfriend got the ribs and catfish combo. The ribs were out of this world, the best either of us has ever had! You didn't even need a fork or knife to get the meat off, it was literally falling off the bone. So yummy! 

We're from Chicago but we will make a trip to Phoenix whenever possible just to eat at Bobby Q!

This place is soooo good. Brisket was fresh and tender .  I thought their prices were very fair. The appetizers are very good the Cole Slaw and macaroni and cheese was good. Service was great . I wasn't that  impressed with the doughnuts but it won't stop me from going back
The ribs and brisket were both fabulous fall off the bone, Q-rolls and cornbread were great, highly recommend !!!

Awesome. 

I haven't had decent barbecue in, well maybe years. The service was fantastic. Immediately seated, our waiter was attentive but not smothering, always coming back for refills. 

The complementary cornbread is such a wonderful treat. While not the best cornbread I've ever had it certainly was welcome after a long day. It was light and crumbly and delightful.

I decided to go all out and order a full rack of baby back ribs. Even though my waiter forgot to give me a steak knife I didn't really need it. Now I realize that falling off the ribs does not make good barbecue, but it certainly helps. These were tender and succulent, the sauce was not slopped on and complimented the taste of the meat. 

I got sides of mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. The potatoes were average, nothing special. The mac was buttery and cheesy as it should be. 

It made a wonderful lunch the next day. The next time I feel like treating myself I'll make my way up here again.

The bbq here is pretty good, but that has been documented well by others. My favorite thing on the menu is actually the fried chicken. It's a HUGE boneless breast that is breaded in a yummy coating and although it is fried, it is not a big greasy blob. It comes with two sides, but they suggest one be the mashed potatoes and gravy. The mash is really quite good. There is a hint of spice in there that is unexpected and nice.  My only gripe is that they serve the gravy on top of the fried chicken and I have never understood why you would drench something crispy in anything that is going to eventually turn everything to a gooey mess.  The flavor is great. Just put it on the side.

The free donuts are a nice touch, but nothing special, so save the calories and get the banana pie/pudding thing. The crust is made of crushed nuts, which is then topped with a substantial layer of bannana pudding. All of this is then topped with carmelized bananas and drizzled in carmel. YUMMO!!

And if you like their macaroni and cheese (which IMHO) is heavenly cheesy goodness, skip it as a side and order a quart to go instead.  You will get about 8 to 10 side servings for around $6.50 and that is a HUGE savings over the sides price.

Put your walking shoes on for the hike you will need to burn off the calories and just know going in that you have to through your diet out the window for one good meal.

I am an Arizona native and at first missed Bobby McGhee's but who knew the owners were such magicians with BBQ (and this coming from someone who lived in the south for 13 years!).  The brisket spring rolls are a delight to the taste buds and the ribs are fall off the bone delicious.  The meat was not greasy at all and had just the perfect amount of seasoning as well as a small amount of sauce. Yep... true BBQ is about the meat not the sauce.  The cornbread has just the right amount of sweet, though my southern hubby was disappointed it was not hot water cornbread. 
This is most definitely not your chain BBQ restaurants that just hint at true quality product. Absolutely 5 stars!

We stopped at Bobby Q st the end of girls' weekend, and I'm so glad we did!  Travis m, our server, was awesome! His recommendations were right on, and he was really friendly and attentive.

The food is amazing! I had the jumbo BBQ baked potato with beef brisket, and it was delicious. I almost couldn't eat the entire serving, but I did! The brisket was moist and tasty, perfectly done, three bbq sauces were available as well.

For dessert, we got some free hot cinnamon donuts to take home--so make sure to save a little room. The prices are great, too.

Spotted this gem from the 17 FWY. Just visiting Phoenix for a weekend, I turned to my boyfriend and said, "We have to go there before we head back to LA." He was totally on board once I showed him the pics from Yelp. Banana Cake, Doughnuts, Meat. Yum!

We didn't even know until the day of that we would get a 10% discount for mentioning Yelp! Bobby Q rocks!

One Whole Hog Heaven and four refills of Arnold Palmer later, we were in Bobby Q Heaven. My God!!!

Check out the pic I uploaded with caption --
"Feast your eyes on the Whole Hog Heaven"
Yup. That's my boyfriend, the most perfect man for taking me here, and buying me the best BBQ I've ever had, ever. Period.

Service was perfect. Adam was extremely attentive. Great personality. He even brought me a cole slaw sample because I was inquiring about it, but didn't end up ordering it! Needless to say, we were so impressed that we left a 50% tip. Seriously, Bobby Q and Adam are that good.

Vibe is perfect. Decor is amazing. Indoor/Outdoor seating. Food is fantabulous. Service is impeccable. Oh, the best - when you pull into the parking lot, before you even get out of your car, you can smell the smokey meat goodness. All of their meat is smoked/cooked for 24 hours before hitting your mouth. That means that all the meat is fall off the bone perfection.

And the extra bonus - the moistiest corn bread before your meal and the sweetest cinnamon sugar doughnuts after your meal. What more could you ask for?!

I want a Bobby Q location in Los Angeles. In fact, why not put one in every city? This stuff definitely needs to be shared.

Above scale BBQ.  The atmosphere is more upscale than the typical cowboy BBQ restaurants.  This is refreshing.  Prices are very fair with extra large portions.  My wife and I easily share entres with food left to go.  Flavor is smokey in a good way.  Of course the meats are very tender from slow smoking.  The wait staff tends to be on the younger side, so may get terrific service or marginal.  Management and kitchen seem to be more consistent than the wait staff.  But, don't let this keep you from the restaurant, the food and atmosphere are tops.

Awesome BBQ. The cornbread is served fresh and hot. Honestly best cornbread I've ever had. We ordered "The Whole Pig" and it was epically delicious. We split it between two but it's honestly enough for maybe 3-4. Very friendly and quick staff. Highly recommend

Best one I've tasted in Arizona yet. For the price and the quality of the food I would definitely recommend Bobby Q. The service was great! All the servers were friendly and welcoming. 
Last time I came I got the ribs, mash potatoes, frys, and mac and cheese. I was more than satisfied! 5 stars for sure!

Seriously awesome BBQ in a totally random place.  The ribs were unreal, seriously, fall off the bone, meaty deliciousness to the face.  Be prepared to wait for a little while before being seated, we came on a Tuesday night and had to wait for about 30 minutes, always a good sign that you're in for a treat.  I will definitely be back!

Wow! Bobby Q's is the place to go if you'd like a very nice barbecue dinner. The baby back ribs, pulled pork, and beef brisket were all succulent and tender. The cornbread, which is served before the meal, was a favorite of mine. The end of the meal concluded with a bag of cinnamon sugar doughnuts . What could be better?! It was a great meal. 

Hog heaven , which is a meal on the menu, is suggested to feed 2 or 3 people. But this can easily feed 4, especially if
You have no large eaters. ON Sunday's , they serve a Similar meal for a lower cost . 

My family was looking for a nice sit-down meal that was not far from Grand Canyon University, so we were excited to find such a Nice restaurant within 10 minutes of the college.  The food, as well as the atmosphere, gets 5 stars. We will definitely return!

Bobby Q. Was feeling kind of skeptical about a Phoenix bbq place right off the freeway, next to a Phoenix scuba diving academy. Immediately distracted by so many strange bbq scuba situations. Either way, turned out to be kitschy in a great, not overwhelming or mass produced way. Wood paneling, mirrored saloon doors, and roasting chickens on a spit. We were seated immediately and our server was very friendly/fast. Beer/cocktail selection was meh. Q rolls were really good. Spinach dip was ok, made better by garlic bread sticks. In my opinion the real shining star was the mystery bag the server dropped off when we paid. Oh look a cute doggie bag FILLED WITH FRESH HOME MADE CINNAMON SUGAR DONUTS. These were spontaneous drool level, manna from heaven level good. Next time I want the ribs and maybe 9 or ten bags of donuts.

From a former KC, KS resident...Killer BBQ, try the Q-Rolls, you won't be disappointed.  Baby back and beef ribs are also legit.  Two trips in the last month and I'd go back right now if it was closer

Only 4 stars because its one of the first bbq places we tried in Phx ....and they did set  the bar relatively high. 

Q rolls with the chipotle dip was enough  to make me go back. Catfish poboy was decent ...the pulled pork sandwhich tho was everything to expect from pork smoked for 18 hrs.  

Had a chill waiter tommy2027, and was checked on by the manager who brought over fresh cornbread ...overall great first experience.

Review from a visit on 9/2/16, just getting around to it.  Found Bobby Q based on Yelp reviews.  We were in town to visit my son that just started at GCU.

As we walked up I was a little surprised at how dressed many of the people were.  They looked like they were going out clubbing.  Turns out, there is a night club/bar attached to the restaurant.  Seems many of the club goers had dinner then moved on to the club.  The club in no way ruins the dinner experience and you can never hear the music or even know the club is there.  The food was very good and the service was excellent.  We were a party of 9 and we were assigned 2 waiters.

If you are Gluten Free all of their sauces are GF and they have a GF menu.  Only bummer is that they don't have a GF version of their cornbread.  The meats are tasty, tender and juicy.  The sides are all generous portions and good.  All 9 people got different items and no one was disappointed.  For the non-meat eaters there was a good selection of seafood.  I will return on my next visit to AZ as good bbq is not always easy to find.
Yum.   This place is great.  Nice atmosphere.  Bar tender is very pleasant.  Tried the pulled pork.  Best I have ever had.

Wow! What a fabulous dining experience! We tried a large sampling of menu items (7 kinds of meats, 6 sides, etc.) and all were scrumptious! Large servings + reasonable prices + great service + FINGER-LICKIN' GOOD FOOD = one amazing dinner. You've got to try Bobby Q if you've never been - and you'll be hooked for sure.

The food here is spectacular... however it was eclipsed by our server Austin. He was so attentive and friendly. We enjoyed the prime rib and the sirloin ... both were cooked to perfection and very tasty. The sides complemented the steaks but the standout had to be the Mac & Cheese - simply incredible. We recommend the Iron Stone Merlot  off the wine list. We finished off dinner with the Sub Zero Banana Pudding , it's a great dessert without an overpowering  banana flavor. We highly recommend Bobby Qs and of you go ... ask for Austin.

I really liked it - and didn't get a chance to try anything more than the pork and a nibble of sausage as I was there for lunch and was kind of in a hurry.  The service was solid and everything I tasted was delicious... I just wanted a slightly bigger portion.  I realize they bring out free cornbread when you get there, and free tiny doughnuts when you leave (both are really good) - but you come there for MEAT!  I also realize it was a 'lunch portion' - but for the prices I wanted more bang for the buck.  The only side I tried was the mac n' cheese, and have nothing bad to say about that either.  I think the solution is to go for dinner and maybe try the sampler where I can leave satisfied.  I'll be back if I'm ever in the area!
Good Good service Ribs were amazing  Mac n cheese was good great sides are sever Alicia was super sweet

That darn Smokehouse burger is awesome. 5 stars. 

The smoked corn was a little Meh... it was oily like not butter oily... not a huge fan of the texture either. I like corn crunchy and it was not. 

Service was great. 

I did see an unmentionable bug running around near the back entrance towards the chicken rotisserie thing, but bugs have to eat too right? (still 5 stars lol)

This is the go to spot for a nice quiet dinner inside or out, the meat is amazing and if you feel like breaking those dance shoes out they have two dance floors! Love going here definitely gotta try this place out at least once.

Let's start with the name. What a clever double entendre!BBQ and Bobby Q. Love it. 
First time here a few days ago and totally impressed. The staff is so friendly and courteous. Sadly this is a lost art. So I love it when you find restaurant staff really enjoying being good hosts. 
Now to the decor: love the rustic interior. Very warm and cozy. 
Last but not the least, the food. Well I can attest to the quality of the ribs and the brisket accompanied by the tasty sauce. Yessir!
Will surely come back for more and check out the other stuff on the menu. 
Keep it up y'all!

We came here and ordered the Q roles. The Q roles were an appetizer, but  I am pretty sure that could work as an entre for one person. Our main dish was the 3 meat combo. We chose the string fries and mac and cheese as our side dishes. Baby back ribs, brisket and beef ribs were our meats. Everything was delicious! The portions were definitely bigger than we expected. And both my boyfriend and I have leftovers for lunch tomorrow. The customer service was very friendly and the manager even came to greet us and make sure we were enjoying everything. We loved our first visit here & definitely recommend it to other people who like the Texas style barbecue.

Excellent BBQ joint @ PHX!  Great menu selection (see menu here: http://bit.ly/5wWlwt). They have wonderful BBQ Combo platters. I usually get the Ribs and Pork. The sides are great as well. They've outdoor seating. Great place to have nice red meat and a beer at a fair price.

Solid BBQ spot in central Phoenix. I had the 2 meat combo with baked potato and Mac and cheese. The food was really good. I have had better BBQ but this spot definitely is worth coming back to. It can be a bit noisy so bring your loud voice with you. Food came out decently fast for being BBQ and the amount of ppl that were eating.

The food!! It was delicious. The service and atmosphere could have been awful and I still would have given a good review on the basis of the food alone. However, the atmosphere was inviting and simple with warm lights, wooden tables, and old-fashioned decor. Our waiter, Austin, was very attentive and outgoing. He checked in frequently and was able to make suggestions because of his knowledge of the food (he had worked in the kitchen previously). There is complimentary cornbread to start, which just melts in your mouth. Our food came out very quick and every single thing was just to die for. My favorite thing was the rotisserie chicken and my boyfriend loved the brisket. Complimentary mini-donuts are also given with the check-yummy! Overall, this was a great place to go for out anniversary. I highly recommend.

Delicious! The meat falls right off the bone. The whole hog heaven can easily feed 4 people and gives you good variety.  The Mac and cheese did not disappoint. Im not a fan of mac and cheese, but
I'm glad we tried it. a must try.

Service is really great. My nephew has food allergies and our server and manager explained to us which kid's meal would be good and not. They also made sure that his food was cooked separately to avoid cross contamination. Overall a good experience. BBQ heaven indeed.

Btw, they give you free cornbread, free heavenly dessert donuts and 10% off if you check in on yelp

Food: 5/5 (I'm 100% satisfied)

Service: 5/5 (Staff super friendly)

Parking: 5/5 ( A lot of space available)

Atmosphere: 5/5 (Nice and cool)

Even water tastes different here. This is my first time to come and eat at this restaurant. And now I understand why this business spot got so many excellent and high reviews on Yelp. 

Going to a restaurant does not simply means putting your butt on the chairs and eating what ever they give you. It also means enjoying your meal and satisfying your taste. 

Bobby Q just has everything it need to be the best Phoenix steakhouse. The price is not too bad if I compare to what I enjoy when eating here. My friend and I ordered the Two Rib Combo which includes two sides. We want to share, so the staff put on two different plates for us. We finish our lunch with ice cream. We decided to pick Death by chocolate, but the guy recommend me to pick Miss Mcgee's Mud Pie. That was delicious.

We came there pretty early, only three tables have people. But when we left, they were all full. Such a popular and crowded business.

My dad is a steak lover, so next time I will bring my family here. I know he will love it.

Little hard to find off the freeway, but well worth it. Visited for the first time after a spring training game in Peoria. Cool bar, and excellent food and service! Had the Homemade fried chicken and gravey with two sides, delicious! Also had appetizers and few drinks and everything was great. Will be back every year.

I love the restaurant. The ambience and service here are outstanding. The food meets expectations but does not exceed them. 
The brisket was almost on the dry side but good. The chicken was fantastic. The beef ribs were not very meaty but were sweet and tasty. 
My real complaint was the ribs. The baby back ribs were good, but a little overdone. I couldn't pick them up without them falling apart. Personally, I think they should be firm enough to hold together when you cut them and pick them up. But if I give the bone a firm tug, it should come out. It's a fine line and easy to cross. Bobby Q crosses the line, but all in all it's a very good BBQ joint. Given the competition in Arizona, it's easy to see why they are so successful.

My boyfriend and I came here on the way home from a weekend getaway.  You can always smell the BBQ right off the highway and it literally draws you in.  I was surprised that the atmosphere was as fancy as it was (think dim lighting and cloth napkins).  Don't be scared it's not really a fancy place and the food is still very affordable.  
The service was stellar.  Honestly, I had forgotten what good service was like after moving to Arizona, and then I came here and was shocked.  The waiter was friendly and the manager came out and talked to us for a long time and even brought us some mac and cheese on the house!  Good service always equals a returning customer with me and I was impressed that they took the time to make you feel welcomed and happy. 
The mac and cheese was outstanding.  It was rich and creamy and the cheese had just enough flavor YUM!  The shoestring fries were also very tasty.  The meats here are very delicious.  They are slow cooked and tender as can be.
The barbeque itself was pretty good.  It is kind of a tangy sweet flavor that wasn't the best barbeque I've had, but still pretty tasty.
If you drive past this spot on the highway make sure you stop in and pick up some delicious food!

I placed a huge to go order last Saturday. Being from the South, we have high expectations for BBQ. Bobby Q meets these expectations plus more! The service I received over the phone and when I picked up my order was superb. Justin went above and beyond. The food was excellent. The baby back ribs were falling apart tender and had a great flavor. The smokiness isn't overpowering and we enjoyed that. The pulled pork was some of the best we had. The chicken was wonderful and we really enjoyed the hot link sausage. All the sides were delicious as well as the cornbread. Dessert was very good also. Overall, we felt it was an excellent value for the quality of food and service. Thanks for not disappointing, Bobby Q!

So I've traveled various states and up and down California, always looking for as good a bbq I had when I was in Austin (actually Driftwood) at Salt Lick Restaurant. I use that place as the baseline for the best bbq I have ever had. Well, Bobby Q went as close to that level as ANY place I have been to since. The ambiance when you walk in sets the mood for carnivorous meal you are about to encounter. I went with the 3 meal combo, St. Louis ribs, Beef ribs, and the coup de gras sliced beef brisket. The St Louis and Beef were the damn near the best I ever had. I typically ask for the sauce on the side, so I can taste the meat and carefully add the sauce on my own, but this time I forgot. Regardless, it was cooked perfectly and sauced just enough, so the meat was still the star of the plate. The meat came perfectly off the bone and with the sauce was amazing. Herein lies why they didnt get the 5th star. The sliced brisket, although tasty, lacked the nice smoke ring and was cooked a bit too long. Again, it was still delicious, but I couldnt give the 5th star because of that. Also, the mac n cheese, which they say is very popular, was starchy (mind you I dont mind cheese) but the that was lacking in the taste. I washed it down with West Coast IPA from tap so that was a plus as well! And of course, complimentary to the meal was cinnamon sugar mini donuts, 2 per customer that came out with the bill. This was my first foray there, but will definitely not be my last while my son is attending college in AZ. My hats off to this place, as I told that to our waitress that night, as well as the manager.

I try to have something different each time we go and I have not had anything I didn't like. This food is smoked perfectly and tastes amazing! My family tells each other about going here and it's an expectation when they visit. Yum!!!!

Over all the food was great. The lemonade was too sweet with more sugar on the rim. Not a big fan. You really can't taste the actual lemon. Sangria was delicious and services was great. And you get free mini donuts.

Went here for a meetup group event.   First off, I would like to say, if I was grading the cornbread, the mac and cheese and the mashed potato sides, I would give them a resounding five stars.   The service, I would give five stars as well.   It's the BBQ that I would give more like a two or three stars, hence, the three stars since that's probably what the place is known for.

There was probably about 20 of us.   We had two servers, which they were organized and kept things moving along.   Drinks came out in a timely fashion as well as the warm cornbread and butter, which I could have just made a meal from that!

I love pork ribs, as you can probably tell from my prior BBQ reviews.   We could either order a half or a full.   I figured, since I was filling up on the cornbread anyway, I could take most of it home and ordered the full rack.   I asked which was leaner, which our server stated it was the baby back.   I don't want all that pork fat.  

The ribs were, mehhhhh, okay.   A bit on the dry side; yes, falling off the bone, but it just lacked that bbq, smoky flavor that I am used to.   The sauce wasn't all that tantalizing either.

Now, the mac and cheese and the mashed taters, that was another thing.   I don't know what kind of cheese it is, but it was creamy and plenty of cheese.   The mashed taters had the skin, which I like, and was quite tasty as well.

I ordered a manhattan, which was good.   It's just that I think someone drank half of it before I got it since the glass was partially filled.   I was wondering what happened to the rest of it.

Would I return?   I would for everything except the Q.    I didn't care for the dryness of the meat and the blandness of the flavoring.

Whoa.  Fantastic BBQ.  Out of the numerous places I've been to, Texas and all, Bobby Q wins numero uno at this point.

It's really hard to find good brisket.  Bobby Q has GREAT brisket...the best I've ever had.  And yes, even better than the places I've been to in Texas.  The BBQ overall was better than what I've had in Texas.  

We ordered a 3 meat combo platter with ribs, sausage, and brisket.  Our sides included pecan cole slaw and mac n cheese.  The cole slaw wasn't very tasty or flavorful.  The mac n cheese was cheesy, creamy, and yum.  We also ordered a side of veggies to make us feel better about our meal.  Haha.  

It was busy but we were able to get a table right away.  Service was decent.  Parking gets a little packed but you'll find a space somewhere.  

 Oh, and at the end of the meal...you get fresh donuts sprinkled in cinnamon sugar FTW!  Yes!  Yes!  Yes!  (Yes, that's my Hunter Pence chant.)  

Bobby Q is doing everything right and I'm so glad I got to try it.  Gives me another reason to come back and visit Phoenix!

Awesome place!

Love the service and the food. Nice atmosphere as well.
the corn bread has to be my favorite thing! best pulled pork sandwiches.. MMM!
the manager always intrudeces her/him (theres 2) and make us feel welcomened.

The beef brisket is so good and tender
The pulled chicken is also really good.


I had the catfish last time and it was ok, I would stick to the Bbq. 

The cornbread is the bomb and the donuts are a great dessert. 

I love the potato salad, mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese.

4.5 stars.....I really battled over scoring this fine establishment. So let me break it down:

Setting: 5 stars-Great decor, lots of televisions, dim lighting, and just a comfortable feel.

Staff:  5 stars- Our waiter was awesome. I am very frustrated with myself for not remembering his name. He checked on us often and really took care of my party of 8. The manager also walked by and checked on us. Class act all the way around. 

Food: 4.5 stars- The food was great. The sides (French fries, potato salad, Cole slaw, Mac and cheese) were awesome. Each side could not have been any better. As for the meat, it too was very good. The problem I have is I compare everything now to the barbecue spot Little Miss Barbecue.  The meat (pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and ribeye) was moist and flavorful. Better then Little Miss? No, but it was darn good. I really would love to give the meat a five but that would not be fair to Little Miss. For dessert, we knocked out the bread pudding and their complimentary mini donuts. The bread pudding was not on their menu but it needs to be. It needs to be their go to dessert. It was amazing!!!!! Loved it!!! LOVED IT!!! The donuts were so fresh and a real treat.

Bobby Q's is legit for sure. I would and will stop by again. I really wish I could give it 4.5 stars. What a nice meal/time.
I really enjoy the quality of the food here. I haven't had a bad experience yet. The customer service is just as good. Thank you.

I dunno if this is THE BEST BBQ i've EVER had.... but it is definitely the best i've had in phoenix! 

they offer this family special - the whole hog heaven, which is st louis style ribs, bbq pork, bbq beef brisket, and bbq chicken, plus 2 sides, for around $30, which feeds 2-3 people. so we ordered one of these, plus a 3 meat combo (2 orders of baby back ribs + more bbq beef brisket). oh my word. so much meat! tasty, glorious, juicy, succulent meat! i heartily recommend the st louis ribs over the baby backs, bc they were cooked SO tender and were so nice and meaty.
