it was alllllllll good! and their spicy bbq sauce? love it! for sides, we tried the grilled corn, mashed potatoes, and shoestring fries. i'd say forget the fries, but definitely get some of that corn! and the cornbread.... well. it was pretty good, but i did expect better. 

i saved some room for dessert, and we tried the apple griddle cake. it was like.... cooked apples on top of a custard-like crust. we were expecting it to be more of an apple pie type deal, so it was slightly disappointing. and it also wasn't awesome, but it was still good. i adore how they give you a cute little bag of hot, fresh donuts! they were delish, and still tasty the next morning. 

a little deals heads up - if you go on sundays, the whole hog heaven meal is a bit cheaper. can't remember the exact numbers since i didn't pick up the tab, but it's a screamin' deal!

I brought my boyfriend in for lunch/happy hour and we were lucky enough to get sat with Jay at the bar. I've been in the service industry for years and generally loathe dining out because I'm usually critiquing instead of enjoying. This instance was the exact opposite. I instantly felt at home and completely cared for thanks to Jay. His menu/cocktail knowledge was exceptional and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We'll definitely be back, thank you for an awesome experience!!!

The pulled pork was absolutely wonderful.  It was delicious.  I had the mac 'n' cheese and ranch beans with it.  The mac 'n' cheese was good but heavy.  I thought the ranch beans were going to be like baked beans but they weren't.  They weren't sweet like baked beans; they had a thinner red sauce on them and the flavor didn't work for me.

The cornbread was ok.  The pieces looked like muffin tops.  It was good, but I've had better.  

We went here for dinner at 7:30 on a Thursday.  It was loud and really crowded - too loud to comfortably converse with the two people I was dining with.

Our family was in Phoenix for Wrestlemania 26 and asked people around town where to get some good BBQ.  The general consensus was " Bobby Q".  At first I thought it was an accent or they were talking funny repeating BBQ back to me, lol. After a few chuckles we decided to give it a try and stopped if for dinner.  WOW... what a treat.  They were crazy busy and had us seated with in 20 minutes.  We ordered some ribs which were awesome.  The mack n' cheese was some of the best I've ever had. The corn bread was was the high lite of this meal in my opinion, moist and full of flavor.   Service was top notch and I'm so glad our family got a chance to eat here while on vacation. After our meal we were treated to a little dogie bag of freshly made cinnamon and sugar dough nuts they make by the front door as you wait to be seated! If I close my eyes I can still smell them!
Never disappoints! My favorite place for a great dinner and worth the little extra cost; there is always another meal left for the next night.

Solid BBQ joint.  Wife and I split a whole hog heaven and it was way more than we could handle.  Got chicken, brisket, baby back and St. Louis ribs.  Ribs were great, meat falling off the bone.  I thought the brisket was a bit dry; wife thought it was moist and delicious.  Go figure...  The chicken was  chicken, not much to say about it. I gotta say though, the cornbread was spectacular - I could've eaten a whole basket.

I normally don't say much about service, but this place is on top of its game. Happy staff were popping out of the woodworks asking if we're satisfied or need anything else.  Check-ins were frequent but not  annoying.  Atmosphere is nice too. It was busy on a Friday night so make a reservation.

We've been to Bobby Q's many times and it's always been a great experience. Everything we've eaten here has been delicious, the services is exceptional, the prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is great too. My husband loves the Baby Back ribs and usually sticks to that. But I like try something different each time. On our most recent visit I had a Ribeye steak and it was delicious. Perfectly cooked, tender and flavorful. Our server, Lindsey, was very friendly, efficient, and accommodated all of our special requests. Our food was served quickly and exactly as ordered. We like to take our family and friend's to Bobby Q's too, because we know there will be something on the menu to please everyone. Bobby Q's is one of our favorite places for dining out.
Wonderful service, family friendly environment, and delicious BBQ. Wish we lived closer to this gem!
The food is always amazing!  They switched to Coke products though, so I'm trying not to hold that against them!  Great food, awesome service!

Everytime I come to Bobby q's it's always super busy! The location is a little hard to find but its off Dunlap and the i17. They have good cocktails drinks that they have prepared for you and I love shock top on draft and they offered it. Very good for ribs, steaks, and all there sides! If you haven't been I definitely recommend stopping by.
This is the best BBQ me or my family had. The meat is so tender it melts. Cameron our server is really good and knows his job. Desert and drinks are great! Sad is so far from home.

Bobby Qs was recommended by my realtor, a local resident who suggested I try it. I had to come by myself since I am visiting the Phoenix area and was on my own for dinner tonight. Since it happens to be just across the highway from my hotel I decided to try it.

I sat in the bar and the very friendly and outgoing bartender took my order for the combo rib plate which came as a half rack of baby backs and a half rack of Saint Louis ribs.  They were out of the beef ribs which I would have ordered over the baby backs which feel are over rated.

The ribs took less then 15 minutes from order to table. The plate was impressive and the ribs were excellent.Other then size of the bone I couldn't tell them apart.  For me general rule for ribs is that if they are "falling off the bone" they are over cooked. That was the case here, but the ribs were so tasty I was able to overlook that. They have two choices of BBQ sauce, spicy and mild...they were both similar in flavor with the spicy having a little more kick.  Overall the meal was excellent...I wish I had someone to enjoy it with. All in all 5 stars for food, service and atmosphere.  Next time I am going to try the smoked prime rib...sounds interesting.
I LOVE the mac and cheese, the ribs, and the queso garlic bread appetizer is amazing as well. Fun atmosphere and have been here 5 times at least without a bad experience yet.

Why oh why have I waited so long to come here on a Friday night? You get a a fabulous little mini buffet that has tri tip, nachos, shrimp, cheese, and its free? Oh and the drink prices? Two very strong drinks, $4.50 each? What? Are you kidding me? Tons of people which makes for great people watching, great food, good happy hour prices? Again why did I wait so long? Oh I will be back. That is for certain.

Amazing service from the moment I walked in until I walked out. The setting and environment is very comfortable and inviting.  The food... is above an "ok" but it is over priced. On a scale of 1 to 10... overall a generous 7 (because of the selection). Ranch beans are delicious but could be served hotter. The corn bread is yummy and moist. The potato salad is creamy and very flavorful (you better like dill). The brisket was moist and tender but the sauce was a little bland for me (I like more heat). The baby back ribs were over cooked. In fact, I didn't like the ribs.

In summary, the price is almost worth it for the service and setting but let's be honest... I can't eat either of those.  $31 for a 2 meat combo and a beer.

This is now our "go-to" place for company lunches. The food is amazing, I highly recommend the beef brisket and if you love vegies get a double order of the gilled vegies. 

I seem to spend a lot less at Bobby Qs compare to Famous Daves and the atmosphere is far better at Bobby Qs.

Better service, better food in a nicer restaurant for less.
Q rolls excellent. Cornbread is sweet and good.  Ordered the family dinner pack.  Everything tasty. Great lemonade too.

Yep, when the kids are happy, everyone is happy. 

My 7 year old loved this place, actually all of us loved this place. 

It has ambiance, and a great menu... 

So, here it is: play by play:

5 stars for parking 
5 stars for wait time, busy dinner time and we were seated immediatley 
5 stars for menu options 
5 stars for speed of food coming out
5 stars for everythingggg

The brisk was tender and juicy. The cornbread was sweet and the baked potato was cooked perfectly. The service from Sara Hendricks was stellar. By far, the best bbq joint I have been to in a long time.

Great service, great food.  Our server was very nice and attentive, even though she was busy with a large party in the next table.  The food was aces as well, we enjoyed the ribs, the brisket and the sausage.  We had potato salad with the corn and the beans as sides, and you can tell how fresh everything tasted.  Definitely a keeper...we had so much left over.
The service was fantastic. The food was great. The pulled pork was awesome and the mashed potatoes great. My kids got the barbecue chicken and they both loved it. Will definitely go back for more

This place is amazing. Party of 4 ordered pretty much one of everything and it was all incredible. We eat at a lot of BBQ places around the US - one wouldn't expect one this good in Arizona. 

Portions are big. Lots of wonderful options. Highly recommend it 

The only weird part is the club. We went on a Thursday night - late. At 10pm - a club opens up next door. Not really our scene. I've never seen a BBQ place transform into a night club.
The Happy Hour is a ton of fun. It's best to reserve a table if you come. The food is good! The music and dancing is for all ages. You must be 21 for Happy Hour!

Oh no! I caught the meat sweats again from Bobby Q! That bastard! 

I can't claim I'm an expert in BBQ, however I think I hold my own and Bobby Q is damn good. We enjoyed a few happy hour beers for $3 to $5 depending on the beer. Then we did it, we went with the Whole Hog ($36). It included 4 types of meat and 3 sides. The highlights were the St. Louis ribs, the beef brisket, mac n cheese and the cole slaw. Way too much food for two, but my company was paying so let the sweats begin! 

Service was friendly and the decor was inviting. The back room area, or I guess the club, was a bit sketchy but what club isn't at 5PM. Maybe that's where you find the cure for those sweats!

Back in Phoenix with my wife and since I had to go to PF changs with her, I brought her to Bobby Q for a bbq dinner last night.  We ordered the whole hog, ribs. Pulled pork, brisket, 3 sides.  Great tasting and the services was exceptional as well as the food.  We shared the whole hog dish, and brought more home as leftover than we were able to eat.  Moving to Phoenix in a few months and this will be our bbq joint.

Awesome Barbeque. The chicken was so tender. The grilled vegetable were cooked perfectly. The corn was served off the husk and was so sweet. But the best part was Carmella. She made me feel like I was in own living room eating an perfect dinner. Ask for her she'll make your night.

I don't get it.  This does not do bbq justice.  bbq should be at a no-frills joint with limited service, a clear view of the smoker, and paper towels everywhere.  this looks more like a chili's.

Ordered the ribs and tasted mostly the sauce.  Which is okay sauce, but not the main draw when you order ribs.

Also the service was pretty mediocre to unprofessional.
Medium Rare steak cooked to perfection. Fabulous mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese. I have never had a bad meal here, always exceeds my expectations in quality, taste, and service.

It was a rough day today and I needed comfort food.  There are takeout parking spots out front (yay, thank you!) so carry out was super easy.  There are few places where I'll shell out $25 for a meal (it was more like two very full meals!).  The carryout host was super friendly and I only waited a few minutes for my bbq.  

Delicious!!  THE MAC N CHEESE IS AWESOME!!  (I know there's Velveeta in there!)  It isn't some food-servicey lumpy, watery crap.  So creamy and just melted in my mouth.  Meat was tender and not covered with fat like other bbq places.  I have at least one more meal with my leftovers.

My blogger buddy and I were in Glendale for Spring Training and found ourselves sighing at the lack of original food places. Not that eating in strip malls is bad.. it's just bad.
Luckily, my friend yelped and found this place nearby. We sat ourselves at the bar.
The food was outstanding! Not only did we LOVE our food, we met a regular that was hilarious and had schtick with our bartender/waiter. She was very funny! Oh.. and that was some quick service indeed!


There is a nightclub attached to Bobby Q. My friend and I did venture on over to check it out, but it was definitely NOT our scene or music. Very Vegasy. So, maybe skip that.. unless you are 23 and like Vegas clubs.. Or are like us.. and blog about traveling and check out things we would not normally visit. Or - if you want to dance off your meal, maybe? No.. wait.. I don't think you should do that. The food is really fantastic and should get to stay cozily in your stomach until it's good and ready to part ways.

www.DartandMap.com

We couldn't make it to Little Miss BBQ, so we went to the next best rated BBQ join in town: Bobby Q (ha ha - Arizonian and their puns). 

Among 5 girls, we ordered a family meal and an additional rack of ribs.
-Cornbread: buttery and delicious, but save your appetite!
-Meat: enjoyed the baby back ribs over the st. louis; for both types of ribs, the meat falls off the bone; didn't enjoy the pulled pork or beef brisket 
-Sides: recommend the cole slaw and mac & cheese; potato salad is decent. 
-BBQ sauce: enjoyed the spicy BBQ sauce and used lots of it; regular sauce is too sweet.
-Complimentary donuts: just fried dough - nice gesture, but we passed on it. 

Bobby Q was super affordable for a hearty, calorie-heavy meal. Good service, ample seating and delicious BBQ.
Service is top notch, the food is incredible and their happy hours just ROCKS! if you want a fun place with a well themed atmosphere and great food, this is the place to go.

Excellent service. Waitress was excellent. She forgot our appetizer but we were glad later because we had so much food. Great strawberry lemonade.  We got the whole hog so we could try multiple things. Had enough leftovers for dinner (we were there for lunch). Great mac and cheese. Loved the ribs even though I usually never eat those. Brisket was excellent. Chicken was good too. Loved the spicy sauce. Great cornbread. We live out of state but if we come back to az we will probably drop by again.

I definitely recommend this Place! Great food, great service and awesome price. Paid less than $150 for 6 people and we got the yelp discount. My father and fiance both got the  Ribeye and the rest of us ordered their Sunday Meal Deals, which was so much food. I loved their cornbread and their roasted corn side dish is a must try item.  I will go back next time in phoenix!

I'd definitely recommend making a reservation, as this place is always packed! The food and customer service here are consistently amazing though, and well worth the few seconds it takes to call ahead. It's a date night treat that we always look forward to!

Building looked interesting off the highway and reviews where mostly positive so we gave them a try.  As we walked up the aroma of bbq filled the air and knew we where in for something good.  Our waiter was nice answered all our questions gave us some recommendations.  I had the beef ribs and they where done great and tasted just as good as they looked.  I will advise the sides are big potions.  During our meal we talked with a lovely lady who worked there and gave us the history of the restaurant and noticed I hadn't ordered the the macaroni as a side and brought me one because it was house specialty.  Dam! it tasted great.  I would recommend saving room because you get doughnuts at the end of the meal that are done in house.   

Overall a good meal and would co

Awesome restaurant the food was outstanding, service was fantastic. I have been there several times and would definitely recommend it to anyone. Great place to take that special someone to or Celebration get togethers. I Will absolutely be back. Don't forget your bag of donuts before you leave.. If you don't want them I will take them.

Found this place on Yelp and got 10% off.  It was fantastic.
Had the brisket and pulled chicken.  The brisket was good, but the pulled bar-b-q chicken was out of this world.  Every meal comes with skillet cornbread that was delicious.
For sides we had the baked beans and mac & cheese.  Both were excellent.
The incredibly sweat tea (I suggest getting it half & half) was awesome.
There were plenty of wait staff on hand even though it was an unusually busy Sunday.  They were all friendly, attentive, and attractive.

Great place, fun environment, yummy bbq, delicious margaritas, and the best hot cider mill donuts!!  Phillip was an awesome server and made our visit the best!  We had the best time ever for our last nights stay in Arizona!  Thank you Bobby Q!!

Service from the bartender and server was outstanding.  I've given an extra star for the service.

Yelp reservations worked like a champ and the server did honest the Yelp check in discount.  (She forgot to add it the first time I asked about it - not the end of the world.)

Ordered the Whole Hog Heaven.  All in a good value for two peeps.  Ribs were good as well as the pulled pork.  The brisket?  The brisket was a consistency that I have never experienced.  It was a bit like the consistency of mashed potato.  As a WSM owner, I've made my fair share of brisket and pulled pork.  I've never turned out a spongy brisket.

Ribs were fall off the bone which is all about marketing.  For fellow BBQ fans, we know that this means over cooked.  

Perhaps it was just an off night for the brisket?  All in I would go again.

All around amazing restaurant! I have seen this restaurant on a MUST try in a list somewhere but forgot the name. So I decided to enlist Yelp for help when I was in the Arizona area for Spring Training this year. What strike me was the 1300+ yelp reviews and the 4.5 stars rating. I knew I had to bookmark this. Reservation was easy as I did it on open table (4:30PM on a Monday).

My bf and I arrived earlier and sat at the bar. That's when I learned the hard way that Arizona has a law that prohibits selling alcohol to anyone with a vertical ID, even though they might passed the age of 21. (Yes, I'll be renewing my license this month as it expires next month). Oh well...

The full party arrived and we were led to a table for 6 in the back. We were promptly greeted by our server, Riley. He made us feel welcomed with his friendly attitude and provided us with a great recommendation for appetizer, the Q-roll! Everyone enjoyed it and it set a good note for the rest of the evening.

All the "adults" except me got the Bobby Q Amber Ale that went really well with the BBQ, while I got the frozen strawberry lemonade. It was delicious! They served us complimentary circular shaped cornbread before our main course, that was really good too. This is coming from someone that doesn't blink twice for cornbread. Then our order of the Whole Hog Heaven and a rack of the St. Louis Style Ribs came. That was the perfect amount for our group of 6 adults. We only had 2 ribs left and everyone was stuffed! To top off the amazing meal, our server gave us a bag of homemade cinnamon sugar donuts to take home. Overall, I was so glad my choice for dinner was a success!

Parking: A big private lot. There are spaces reserved for to-go orders.

Atmosphere: Outdoor patio, bar and dimly lit indoor seating. 

Good for: Dates (not really for first dates unless you don't mind eating BBQ), catching up with friends, small and big groups (family, friends, celebration, birthdays, etc.)

Service: Super friendly and accommodating. Right when I entered, the hostess was smiling and ready to help. Our server was awesome!

Food: Amazing. Don't even need a knife, it just melts off the bone! Whole Hog Heaven for groups of 4! Try the Amber Ale or the frozen strawberry lemonade.

Apparently, they'll turn into a nightclub on St. Patrick's Day. I'll definitely be back if I'm back in this area! :)

First visit today, it's 50 minutes from home but we were in the area and went on a recommendation, so glad we stopped.

Absolutely phenomenal pulled pork sandwich, best I have ever had to date, bar none. Really good baked potato, excellent service, great ambiance, free corn bread that was also pretty good.
At the end of the meal the waitress brought us a little bag of tiny cinnamon donuts that were made just seconds before she brought them to us, scrumptious.

I was also given a sample of the brisket, it was really good too.

Look out Joes BBQ!!! (And I love Joe's) When Bobby Q's opens this fall at Stapley and I-60 you are gonna take a hit.

Given the opportunity, we will revisit Bobby Q's when We're on that side of town.

(Kudos to our very pregnant and excellent waitress today, 15% tip to her and 15% tip to the baby. My wife just had her first Chemo treatment for breast cancer and is rapidly losing her hair, the great food and service really cheered her up today and she really needed that. Thank you!!!)

I've been to this bbq place twice now. Every visit has been an excellent experience. 

Place:  Both indoor and outdoor dining area are clean, well lit and kept cool. Menu was easy to read properly organized. Restrooms looked and smelled clean. 

Service: Received by staff with a smile. Leanne (our server) explained the menu and informed us that they smoke their meat low and slow. She always checked on our food and asked us if we needed anything else. We asked for a different sauce every time she visited our table and she provided us options every time. Manager visited our table to check on the sevice and food. I appreciate it when staff makes sure we are enjoying our visit. 

Food: Exceptional bbq!!! Prime brisket was juicy and tasty. Baby back ribs were very tender and falls off the bone but still has that chewy texture that releases more flavor. Sausage is sweet and garlicy. A perfect pair for something starchy like mashed potato or rice. Beef ribs are tender and the fat around it is full of smoky goodness. Corn bread is a sweet and salty goodness. Want a great appetizer, try the Q-rolls.

I'll be back. This will be my go to BBQ in AZ.

Saw the high reviews on Yelp for this place and had to check it out. Went with pick up this time and I got the two meat dinner plate. Ribs and brisket with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The best of the two in my opinion was be Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes were nothing spectacular. As far as the meat is concerned....Holy moly, this place has got to be one of the best bbq spots in Arizona. A bit pricey but worth it. The cornbread and little donuts are also amazing. I would come back here in a heartbeat! If you're in the mood for some good, finger licking bbq, this place is it! Also looks pretty lively inside on the weekends, check this place out if you're in the area, it won't disappoint!

First time eating here. I love it. There is no way anyone can eat all of this food in one setting. I'm completely speechless. Everything I ate was delicious even the donuts that they give you at the end of the meal. 

Ashlen is an excellent waitress! Extremely friendly and knows the menu well. I will definitely return, but the next time I'll make sure I have on my fat girl pants.

If it's your fist visit, try a combo platter. Such as the beef brisket, sliced pork and St. Louis ribs. The brisket is especially tender, juicy and flavorful. The ribs are also very good. 

The sides at Bobby Q are also good-sized and tasty. The beans and mac 'n cheese are especially good. 

One final note: after you pay your bill, you're presented with a "Thank-Q" brown bag with fresh-baked cake donuts. Nice touch!
Fantastic BBQ! Staff are so helpful & friendly. The pulled pork platter was excellent. Nice touch giving you a little bag of hot donuts when you leave.

What a great day for lunch. This place is on point. From the corn bread to the little doughnuts out the door. Wow they know ribs, pulled pork, and steaks. Even the Mac and cheese was top notch. Loaded baked was over the top also.  Simply a most go.  The server

I came here with a couple of friends after reading the reviews and I was not disappointed.  My ribeye steak was well-seasoned and cooked perfectly.  My friend ordered the St. Louis and baby back ribs and both were fall-off-the-bone tender.  The side dishes were plentiful and the corn bread was moist and delicious.  The complimentary donuts were warm and a perfect finish to an awesome meal.  Better than Lucille's in California.

This place is a great place to come with friends and have a great cocktail and great barbeque at the same time. There's a reason why everyone should check this place out at least once in their lifetime. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. If I return to Arizona I will definitely bring more friends here with me!

I'm certainly jaded by the variety of outstanding BBQ joints in Texas, so my visit to Bobby Q just wan't mind blowing.

In and of itself, Bobby Q has fine, workaday BBQ. The ribs are fall-of-the-bone moist, but almost entirely lacking in flavor save for whatever sauce you slather them in. No smokiness, no meatiness, just sauce. 

The mac-and-cheese is average, not good, not bad, and the coleslaw is mayo based, which I hate. Fortunately it's priced right, heck, it's downright cheap for decent BBQ, and our server was awesome. 

Not a bad BBQ spot by any stretch of the imagination.

Nice place and everyone's very friendly. I sat at the bar and has a drink and menu in front of me within the minute.  Ordered the lunch bbq brisket special. The bartender recommended the mac and cheese as a side.  Within a few minutes cornbread came out and my food a minute or two behind.  The brisket was okay and the BBQ sauce was good.  The bartender asked if I wanted more sauce and brought me the spicy as per my request.  Sauce was good but no where near spicy.  The mac and cheese was extremely good and the cornbread has a good not overly sweet flavor.  I would give 4.5 stars based on the brisket bland taste.
Great food   I had the smoked prime rib and my pop and jean had the baby back ribs.   The ribs were fall off the bone tender.   Prime rib was fantastic.  2 thumb up for this place

45 Minutes to get there from the Gilbert area and it was worth it! Will I come again? Of course! I don't normally give 5 stars but when I do, you better believe it means something.

Greeted right away, sat right away.. Didn't even wait a minute! Good timing! 
Waiter: Riley - Great person -great customer service! Suggested, educated and was always checking up on us to see how things were. 20+% tip well earned.
Food: Outstanding. The meat literally fell off my fork it was extremely tender and flavorful. Cornbread was to die for. Got a desert: "Death by Chocolate" - Oh Em Gee! Everything was just good! 
Inside: Atmosphere was good.Would be a great place to bring a big party of XX over!

Thank you for a great birthday dinner!

This was my first time at Bobby Q's. I have had catering from here before many times and it's always delicious but this was my first time at restaurant. The restaurant is a little hidden off the free way but it's very pretty inside and has a big lot light up patio that is pretty at night time.

Food was super good, service was great, and a very  modern/fun atmosphere. This would be a great place for date night, family dinner, and even late night drinks. They serve cornbread to start which is delicious and then end the meal with complimentary fresh cinnamon sugar donuts with your bill. I got the loaded BBQ brisket baked potatoe which was very good and large portion. It came with a side of the mac n cheese which was the best I have ever had. My fiancé got the ribs which he said were amazing and the meat just fell off the bone. They serve the meals with home made hot BBQ sauce which is delicious. 

Price is moderate to high depending on what you get. You could get a big platter to share with a few people for a good price. I will definitely be back and continue to use them for catering . Highly recommend!

Went to BObby q for a birthday gathering recently. We were a party of 6. I was the only one who had been before. Everyone was impressed with the place. The service was outstanding. I appreciate the fact that we were really able to relax and our server paid attention to detail. Food was great. Will be back.

The hog heaven truly is a piece of heaven. I shared the plate with 3 others and we all left fully satisfied. The baby back ribs, while not fall-off-the-bone, were smothered in a deliciously sweet sauce and were by far my favorite. Overall, I loved being able to sample so many different types of meat and enjoyed everything I ate. Each table is also served complimentary corn bread, a great appetizer to kick off the all-American meal. Our server was wonderful as well and was highly helpful in answering all our questions and making recommendations.
Beast BBQ around!  Good food and good service.  We love sharing the variety BBQ platters.

The service here is refreshing.  The servers are friendly and not rushed, they hold a friendly conversation - not a canned "are you celebrating something special tonight?" Like a particular restaurant I frequent.  The food is prepared properly (steak done as requested) and prices are reasonable.

Great BBQ joint in Phoenix! Such a good experience!

This place seemed like it was in a random location/nothing around the area, but maybe that's just because it was dark out and we were just trying to find the restaurant. The parking lot is large to accommodate all the people they likely have every night.  

We were greeted and seated immediately. Inside the ambiance was pretty loud and fun. Lots of space and seating, so groups are great here. When you walk in, you also might notice the doughnut making machine on the right. Try to save some room for those at the end! They're pretty good, and you get them complimentary! 

The service overall was good, fast and friendly. No complaints at all.

The food was really good as well! We got the Whole Hog Heaven. For two people, we really didn't come close to finishing this, so this might be good for three people, or four with smaller appetites. The meat was all delicious! I thought the brisket and pulled pork was a touch on the dry side, but I just threw some more sauce on and all was good. The cornbread is lite and fluffy, and the sides were great. Of all the meats, I actually thought the St Louis Ribs had the most flavor. And then, there was the doughnuts! Cinnamon Sugar I think. I don't think I have ever seen something like this given out complimentary before! What a nice touch!

Overall, great bbq spot in Phoenix! Highly recommend this place!

We've gone to Bobby Q's several times over the past few years but this was the first time I was really compelled to write a review.  I went in for lunch today (on a Sunday) and much to my surprise they had a Sunday Feast special for $28.  It was 4 meats and 2 sides.  Phenomenal.  We had so much food left over we had to bring some home.  

The service was really good.  Our server was training someone as well and my experience at other restaurants is that usually slows things down.  Not today.  Our Iced Tea's were always full.  The only complaint I had was that I was trying to watch a football game on the TV and one of the servers turned the TV away from the dining room and towards the host station so they could see it.  They should be aware it's not about them - it's about their customer.  It wasn't a big deal so I wasn't going to say anything but thought I'd throw that in here in case the owner is reading.  

I still give it five stars today.  We will be back soon!

We recently took my son here for his birthday since he is a bbq fanatic! It was our first time and our server let us know a little about the place and the food which was nice. The corn bread was great and unlimited although we only needed one basket with our q rolls and meals. We ordered the pulled pork sandwiches with potato salad and mac n cheese on the side and my son had the ribs. I have to say I would probably get the ribs next time as well, the sandwich was ok but the sides we couldn't get enough of! 
By the end my son could barely fit his complimentary birthday dessert! Our server was absolutely wonderful and while we felt the food was pretty good the service we received was truly amazing and the best we've ever had. We will be coming here for many more special occasions :)
This place is gorgeous with a lot of friendly staff!!! The food is amazing, the ribs are perfectly done and its a must !!!! I highly recommend this place !!!!
Great bbq...another place to hit next time we are in town! Bar had seating inside and outside. Drinks were yummy. Don't do what I did and forget your "free" donuts.
It's been about 3 years since I've been here.  I am pleased to say it was just like coming home.  The staff were all very friendly and welcoming and the food was delicious.

Wow. The lines scared me but the wait was worth it. Fantastic food. Every item outstanding. Service outstanding. Very few places serve ribs line this. The St. Louis ribs peeled of the bone.  The smoke was perfect.

Amazing. Everything about it. The people are extremely friendly & polite. Very "At Home" feeling. They serve very large portions for a reasonable price. And the food is just amazing. Everything we tried was delicious. I highly recommend it.

Bobby Q's is seriously my favorite restaurant in the country. I travel all over for work and sample local restaurants whenever I can. In over a decade of travel, I have not found a place I like more than Bobby Q's. For me, this is an absolute MUST stop every time I come to Phoenix.

Bobby Q is set back off the freeway in a slightly shady part of town, but don't let that deter you! The parking lot is covered in huge Eucalyptus trees so you can have shade on those hot summer days when you spend the next 1 to 2 hours of your life here haha. The BBQ here is delicious. The meat is moist and not overly wood tasting. I have had BBQ that had so much wood smoke cooked into it I was burping up the taste for the next 3 hours. Yuck. The potatoes are so good and the best part are the house made donuts in the brown baggies you get on your way out. He donuts are worth going here for alone yum! The staff is always attentive and it has a more upscale vibe. The outdoor area is shaded and has very tranquil water features so it is enjoyable to eat outside as well.

Whoa. If you have not eaten here, drop what you're doing and head over. Simply the best meat you have ever tasted. The brisket is to die for. If I were requesting a last meal - Bobby Q's beef brisket would be it. The baby back ribs are also superb. Chicken - it's good, but how good can chicken be.

The cornbread to start is simply fantastic, especially with the whipped butter so it soft and melts in nicely.

Also, the service is superb. Quick, friendly, helpful.

Simply fantastic. My favorite place to eat.

My boyfriend was in the mood for prime rib today so I did a goggle search for places in our area. One of the listings that came up was Bobby Q. Based on the name and description as a BBQ restaurant, we were a bit unsure, but decided to trust the fantastic reviews. 
The service- Our server Amberlee (please forgive if misspelled) was pleasant, knowledgable about the menu items, and sooo attentive. Our iced teas never got lower than half full and she was always near if we needed anything. One of the managers even came to the table after we got our meal to ask how everything was. On a scale of 1-10 for service, I'd definitely give a 10. 

The food- In one word, WONDERFUL. Amberlee brought out corn muffins right after she took our order, which were not only moist but super tasty. When our prime rib arrived, mine was the 10oz end cut and his was the 14oz medium rare, we were astonished by the portions which were MASSIVE. The meal came with two choices of sides- mine were the loaded(bacon, cheese, sour cream, butter and chives) and roasted corn(corn on the cob roasted on the grill, then the kernels are shaved off and sautéed in butter) while my boyfriend had the mashed potatoes with the white gravy on the side as well as the roasted corn. Everything was perfect- the prime rib was seasoned just right with creamy horseradish and au jus and the sides complimented the meat perfectly. 
Once the plates had been cleared, Amberlee returned with a bag of complimentary doughnuts to go. We were so stuffed, but truly appreciated the gesture. The check was approximately $55 for both meals and two iced teas which wasn't bad for what we got. Not only great food, but fantastic service. We are planning on returning and telling all our friends how wonderful Bobby Q is!
Good damn, that was a good eat and awesome service, too! Will be back for sure.

First time visiting on a Sunday evening and this place is packed! We ordered the Hog Heaven family meal offered on Sunday only. Austin was our awesome, and kind server.  He told us a brief history of this place. We enjoyed our dinner here. Will return for sure!

Every week our family orders take out from Bobby Q.  This is seriously the best bbq in Phoenix.  They have great prices & give you a ton of food.  One Christmas Eve we realized they forgot part of our order after we were already back home.  After calling the manager actually drove to our home & delivered the missing items.  They don't even deliver normally! That is what I call excellent customer service.

On a return trip from Sky Harbor, we stopped there, at our daughter's request, to eat.  That meal was the best BBQ meal ever.   We shared about 5 different meats (sausage, pork ribs, beef ribs and brisket, and chicken) with several sides, including mac and cheese and pecan cole slaw.  The beef ribs were OUTSTANDING!   Would definitely return.

My boyfriend & I were first timers, from the moment we walked in, everyone was so nice and welcoming. Our server(don't remember his name) gave us a little breakdown of the restaurants background and made some awesome suggestions for us. I have a Duck Duck Goose, strong yet sooo good! We ordered a Caesar salad with grilled chicken to start, that was delicious! And that was just the beginning of heaven! Def such a great experience all around. Such great customer service and delicious food! Will be going back soon!

I have been twice since I last wrote a review and can find no excuse for not adding the 4th star.  I went for a Yelp UYE dinner and had a half rack of St Louis ribs with cole slaw and mac and cheese.  Last night I was there in a party of four and had the Smokehouse burger.  That is one of the best $10 burgers I have ever had.  The bun doesn't really hold up well so if you put it down you will end up finishing it with a fork.  Around the table there were ribs, steak and pulled pork.  It was my choice of restaurant and everybody loved their food!  One of our party ordered a Mojito and was told they don't make those there but other than that the drinks were fine.  I have now sampled 3 of their desserts, I didn't care much for the peach cobbler but the banana cream and the chocolate over dose were really good.

A coworker of mine highly recommended this place last year when I told him I was headed out to Tempe for spring training. I didn't get a chance to come last year but I made it a point to check it out this year. I was able to make a same day reservation for Saturday evening through the yelp app and I'm so glad I did because the wait was going to be about an hour otherwise. We waited less than 10 minutes to be seated. 

Our server Tiffany was great, we told her it was our first time so she took the time to give us history on the restaurant and she gave us her recommendations. The corn bread was so yummy and moist. My fiance and I shared the whole hog heaven, which comes with two meats, two ribs and 3 sides. For $40 not bad at all, we didn't finish our ribs and meat (there was a lot for two.) The sides could have been a little bigger, we devoured the mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were so creamy and flavorful. 

I usually prefer baby back ribs over the St. Louis but in this case we agreed the St. Louis were better. The pulled chicken was my favorite, it wasn't the typical chicken covered in bbq sauce. It had some other flavor I can't describe but it was amazing! We walked out of here stuffed, I almost needed to be carried out. The home made donuts at the end were a nice touch, even though I was full I couldn't stop eating them because they were so light/fluffy and bite size. Definitely took advantage of the 10% for checking in. Saved us 10 bucks, I'll take it!! I'll be back next year when I'm in town.

Went out on a date Friday night, again he picked the place, and it was a non-chain place, which scored him some points, but Bobby Q's gives the feeling a chain place, I have never been and I never knew about the Bobby McGee's that used to be there, I'm not from Arizona, and wasn't around during that time.   

After I went to Bobby Q's I actually looked at some the reviews from fellow yelpers and man I am sorry I missed out on the roasted corn, I am going to have to try that next time I go!  Our server's Melissa was a good, but she got tractable, like we made bets to see how long it would take before she came back to our table to check on us, it was about every 10 mins. Now don't get me wrong I love good service, but there is a difference between being pushy and good.

Like I have said before, Im a visual person and when I saw on the drink menu that yummy looking drink called Strawberry Qlada, I knew I had to get that, when it came to the table, it was just as beautiful in person, pinks, red, white, pineapple & cherry garish, it was a delish drink!

The round corn breads were a sweet surprise! I love me some cornbread! And with the whipped butter, what could be better, other than drowning them in hot bowl of chili! 

I ordered the 8oz center cut top sirloin with mac & cheese, ranch beans & mushrooms & onions for my steak!   I had asked Melissa if she liked the mac & cheese and she is it was the bestselling item on the menu, oh that's good, but that didn't answer my question lol but I wound up ordering them anyways, and they were good, but it wasn't great! Yes it's made with 5 different cheese, its creamy and it's like eating velveeta mac n cheese, not my fav but if that's your thing, then it's up your alley! The ranch beans were good, it was little peppery and sweet, which is a great combo for me!  The steak was the perfect amount for me! It was cooked to perfection, it was tender and tasty! The mushrooms and onions were sautéed just right, not too soft not to hard!   

Had I read reviews I would have known at the end of the meal they give us some sweet donuts! How cool is that! Any places that offers sweet little donuts is alright with me!

I was so excited to try this - Yelp rarely lets me down - but I was disappointed overall.  

I give kudos to the host and waitress; both were very friendly, chatty, approachable.  My server gave me some background on the restaurant and made helpful suggestions.  I have high expectations when it comes to barbeque - juicy, lean brisket with a nice smoke ring, smoky chicken in a thick, tangy sauce, and the sides need to be out of this world.  

Based on a recommendation, I ordered the two meat combo, brisket and pulled rotisserie chicken.  For sides I got the corn and a baked potato (not a traditional barbeque joint side necessarily, but it sounded good).  The brisket was soft, chewy, fatty - way too much so for my taste.  I was enjoying the chicken until I encountered a bone - that was the end of the chicken for me.  The corn was very tasty, and oh yeah - the cornbread - that was the best part of the meal!   In my opinion, the baked potato had been pulled from the oven about fifteen minutes too soon - it had yet to reach that fluffy potato interior that is so desirable about baked potatoes.  

I sat outside; they have a lovely covered patio with various seating options and the ambiance was nice (if you don't mind birds flying around, very close to you).  Overall though, I can't get excited about this place and can't say that I would go back.

My wife, two children (12, 10) and I ordered the hog heaven.  Our food and service was absolutely awesome.  The kids each had a frozen lemonade which were delicious.  My wife had the raspberry sangria which she enjoyed immensely.  As far as sides are concerned, the slaw is just ok. The roasted corn was very good. The Mac and cheese is awesome.  I like a little more chew on my smoked ribs, but that is just me.  I would return to this restaurant without hesitation.

By far one of the greatest experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. I came here with my girlfriend during lunch. Our server Lexi was phenomenal, she was knowledgable about the menu and made great recommendations. She was very interactive and made sure I was satisfied. The manager Joe stopped by to say hi and ask about our food and experience. Definitely deserves 5 stars. We will be back!

Meat literally fell off the baby back rib bone. No seriously, I'm talking about meat fell off the rib bones without any fork/knife effort.

And that brisket? Smoky, tender, soft, meaty & sweaty pieces of brisket chunk topped with Bobby's own BBQ sauce was ridiculous.

Starter: Q Rolls or bust. Think deep fried rolls with brisket inside, served with both BBQ and chipotle sauce.

To finish the meal, your server will come thank you with freshly made donuts. I wanted to be mad at them for making me fatter than ever. But I couldn't. I was all smiles with a ring of meat sweat glistening on my forehead.

Don't worry Bobby Q, you will forever be my Phoenix go-to restaurant. Can't wait to try your burger and steak soon. Until next time, I need to shed some lbs.

3 words: WHOLE HOG HEAVEN.
Can you say food coma. Saw this place while driving down Black Canyon freeway and I realized why it sounded so familiar. I saw it from an article I had screenshotted naming the 100 best restaurants in the country. So of course bf and I had to go. We decided on the whole hog heaven. 2 types of ribs, 2 types of meat, and 3 sides to share between us. Sooooo good. Meat was tender, flavor was delicious, and it came so quickly. Shoutout to our server Jason for being so friendly and attentive. Oh, and they give u free mini donuts in the end. Sold. Lol.

Had hubby's birthday dinner; this was one of our best dining experiences! Service was awesome, food was delicious (we had St. Louis ribs, three meat combo and baked cobbler) and ambience was great. Will recommend to our friends and definitely return again. :)

If you have a big appetite you should definitely try this place. Their portion is huge! First, they will treat you with a complimentary cornbread (the best I've ever tasted), then they'll take your order..if usually order their q rolls for appetizer and then 2 ribs ( all three types are good so I'd recommend trying all of them), then they'll have a complimentary dessert for us. I can never finish their food..way too much! Definitely coming back!

Just like last time I was here, the food was fantastic as was the service. The portions are exceptionally generous and the meat tender and filling. This time I ordered a bbq brisket sandwich with macaroni, and the macaroni alone threatened to fill me up.

All five of my table took boxes home, maybe eating half the food from single entree orders.

Then they gave us free doughnuts to take home.

The restaurant tends to be loud, but the service is excellent ( shout out to Cameron F, who was on top of service tonight in a full house and never missed a beat, nor did he overwhelm). Well worth it!

This is one of my favorite spots! My 6 year old LOVES it here! 

Baby Back Ribs = AMAZING! 
Burgers = JUICY! 
Brisket = PERFECT! 
Pulled Pork = SPECTACULAR! 

They have great shoe string fries! The only thing that falls a little short was the corn bread. Needs a little perfecting. Very reasonably priced.
No need for a lot of words...food speaks for itself.  Hands down the best BBQ I have ever eaten in my life!

I can't say enough good things about this place. We were a party of 11 which included 5 kids and 6 adults.  I called for reservations on a Saturday night,  and I was glad I did, because the place was packed. They had our table set up in a private room which was awesome. The food was delicious and huge quantity. The service was spectacular and if ever back in town, I will definitely be visiting this place again. Thank you for an enjoyable meal!

This was our first visit and we were very impressed. The manager gave us a free appetizer and greeted us and all the tables around us. Our waiter Tanner was outstanding. The food was exceptional and the price was reasonable. We will be back.

Such bad service today came in to order some wings ordered them extra crispy at 3:56 and had to come all the way back because they weren't cooked right at all mind u I came all the way back from 83rd Ave and Thomas do know the time is 5:45 they replaced the wings but not the pizza that know was cold due to there error but no credit no owner came over no manager just not good service anymore

The food here is amazing, especially the baby back ribs. Well priced for the amount of food that you are getting. Didnt even wait long for the food to be ready. Shout out to Cody for being an awesome waiter. Great service. Great food. 5 stars

Excellent service and food. Parker and Christie were great! They were both very attentive to our group as well as all others. The food was delicious! Defiantly coming back next year after a DODGERS spring training game!

Wow this place was so delicious! We were expecting a hole in the wall Bbq place but we're surprised to see how big and nice it was. There was a long wait but for some reason the hostesses sat us almost immediately! (My husband flirted w them I think lol!) our server gave us amazing service! Our favorite was the brisket and I ate like 5 corn bread muffins! We definitely will return when in town again!

Bobby Q's has one of the best Mac n' cheese in the valley! Everything I have had here is AMAZING! So good that my husband and I had them cater our wedding and it was still good even though it had to travel and sit before it was consumed! One of our favorite restaurants!

Briskets melt in my month. They make me smile and happy. Food is good, service is good. My husband says the briskets are too soft but not me. PERFECT and BEST IN TOWN! 
My son got ribs kids meal. They were way too smokey. Not sure that's how it supposed to taste. Smokey flavor was overwhelming and he did not eat much. 
We get free homemade donuts after meal. They do taste good but not my favorite. To me, too greasy.

We were craving ribs after a long day of hiking so we decided to try this spot on our way back home. We were in for a real treat!! First off, we were seated immediately in their beautiful patio. Our waiter was super attentive and friendly. We all ordered ribs, and were expecting to wait a while for our food. Seconds after bringing out some steamy fresh cornbread, our food comes out aswell. Everything was delicious and plenty. We all got to go boxes. To top it off, we got complimentary freshly made mini donuts on the way out. Delish!!! Our family will be back!

We came in for a late lunch and found the staff and food to be exceptional! It was the first day of our spring training vacation and it couldn't have been a better meal. The manager even came up to make sure there wasn't anything else they could do to make our experience even better. Would definitely recommend the ribs to those who visit Bobby Q's.
Every time I come here the service is extraordinary! I love the food, the people, and the atmosphere, it's just a great place to come with family and friends. If your
Need to pull out all the stops and impress the boss and/or customer? Don't mess around with other places just come here! Best ribs ever!

I have enjoyed BBQ all over the country.  This is now my all time favorite!  I can't say enough about this place.  Our waiter, Harold provided excellent service.  Was our first time there and he went through all the menu options from appetizers to main course.  The appetizers were excellent.  We shared a plate of St Louis and Baby Back Ribs along with Brisket and Roasted Chicken.  Incredible!  Cooked perfectly and so tasty!!  Ribs were meaty, tender.  I had a dinner salad with Blue Cheese dressing.  The lettuce was crisp and the dressing was very good.  The sides dishes were also perfect.  We had Mac and Cheese, mashed potatoes and green vegetables.  Everything was so, SO GOOD!  There's usually something that just ok...at any restaurant but not last night!  The portions were HUGE and every bite was equally delicious.  I almost forgot about the corn bread and corn off the cob.  Both so fresh and tasty!  We shared a sampler entree and we were so full.  If that's not enough, they bring you a small bag of fresh doughnuts with sugar/cinnamon.  Said I was too full but the Manager twisted my arm and convinced me that I had room for one!  Absolutely delicious!!    I highly recommend this place.  Make sure to go there hungry!!

I do love Barbeque and ribs and Bobby Q delivers exactly what you pay for.

Pulled pork is good, but not as good as Texas Roadhouse up the street.
Ribs are all right, but the meat quality is no where near that of a 4 or 5 star joint.
Steak is just bad. 

This is an ideal place for take-out or a quick lunch sit in; don't bring your bbq savvy friends or girlfriend here.

Wow!! I'm so impressed with absolutely everything about this place! 
The ambiance was great and very classy! Granted we walked in wearing practically sweatpants and hats, no one made us feel uncomfortable for our attire! 
It is more on the fine dining side of BBQ, which I think is awesome! :) 
They sat us right away with big smiles and asked us how our day was going! Very polite and sweet hostess! 
Our server was also wonderful! Brought us refills before we needed to even ask. Made great suggestions for the menu, and explained the restaurant to us since it was our first time in

We decided to split the baby back ribs which came with two sides and cornbread! Omg amazing and SO much food! I ate the leftover ribs for breakfast! Lol 

I was so impressed at how wonderful everything tasted and how great the service was. 
Manager even came over to each of the tables and interacted with us, offering us refills and confirming the food was to our standards! 

I noticed the table next to us, had an uneven table which wobbled a little, and the staff switched it our immediately and made sure they were comfortable. 

I was totally impressed with every part of our meal, to the interactions with staff, to the wonderful delicious food! 
Menu has so many choices! We can't wait to go back for some more fabulous BBQ! 
Yum! Oh and the donuts are heaven!
And being 34 weeks pregnant and constantly craving BBQ, we will probably be coming back very soon!

Best BBQ I've ever been to. 

The food was absolutely fantastic. You have to get the hog and share so everyone gets to try all the different kinds of meat.we ordered every single side dish and they were all fantastic. The service was great like a friendly family. Both kids and adults loved the whole experience. Very cool atmosphere. 

Don't leave without having the complimentary fresh doughnut
Delicious! I receive excellent service. I've been a fan for years and will continue to take my family and friends.
Excellent barbecue!! My mother & I came here & loved it all. Pulled pork, fries, drinks. They gave cornbread to start & donuts to end. I recommend!

I used to drive past this place daily and have always heard great things about their food.  I remember going there when it was Bobby McGee's.  They still have the club ambiance late night and it looks pretty popping if you are into that.  We just went for the food.

I was stoked after checking in to see that they offered a first Yelp check in for 10% off your check, score.  The food was great.  My wife had the rib platter, very tasty, juicy and the BBQ sauce was delicious.  I had a Catfish Po'Boy along with a side of Mac n' Cheese, both were great.  They have plenty of drinks and a nice selection of beer on tap.

Thank you Bobby Q's, when I am in the need of BBQ I will be back.

The location is this place is hidden but once it's found you will fall in love!  Once we arrived we were greeted by lovely staff.  The place itself is gorgeous.  

They gave complementary Cornbread and butter, this was soooo delicious!!!!! 

We order a small feast, for $50! This was a choice of 3 meats.  This was a perfect size for 2 people. Now, the sides were on the small side. 

I ordered the house sangria, it was way to good.  I expected good but not GREAT. 

For dessert, YES there was room for dessert, the apple pie cobbler was just warm enough to melt the giant scope of ice cream. 

As we left we were given a farewell with cinnamon sugar donuts!

If I ever come back to Phoenix this place is a must!

Came here tonight with a party of six adults two babies and they hit all the right points again. Thank you Bobby Q's for being consistent, warm, friendly and hospitable. Our server, Jonah, was attentive and brought us all the little extras that we needed with a smile. It was a special occasion because my folks are leaving to go back to their home on the East Coast and we don't get together very often so we were happy to be able to enjoy a good meal in a friendly place.  We will see you again.

My boyfriend and I love BBQ.  As some pretty serious BBQ lovers, we came to this place because of its reviews on yelp.  Well, we were definitely not disappointed.

Service:  Definitely great service from the wait staff and manager.  The waitor did frequent checkbacks to our table (and those in our section).  He didn't seem rushed or in a hurry, even though it was a busy night.  This being a popular place to eat, I had assumed that we would get the "rushed waitor" treatment-- case was the opposite.  The manager came by to check on our meal as well and we received some good recommendations for the future.  

Food:  All I can really say is A++ Amazing.  We ordered a full baby-back rack of bbq ribs with macaroni & cheese & fries.  Ribs were definitely the best we've had.  You can tell they don't just slap them on the grill and throw some sauce on it.  Mac & cheese was very creamy, just the way it should be!  The fries were fries, what can I say...?  They were good.  

Overall:  We're going back again and again.  The resteraunt was loud at the time, but it's to be expected on a Friday night with music in the bar area.  Didn't mind at all--everyone we saw there seemed as though they didn't mind either.
Love the St Louis ribs,  not crazy about the beef ribs though.  The best cornbread! Service is usually good, and the prices are reasonable for the quality. A great neighborhood joint.

Oh my god this place is good. Pulled pork, beef brisket, and oh yeah the Q-rools are all to die for. I would recommend anything on the menu cause I have tried it all. The smoasted chicken is unreal! For me I wont go anywhere else for BBQ except my own house.  The atmosphere is great and its a little dark &  there is a outside patio area as well. They have great lunch specials. The food portions are good size you will probably be taking some home.  And when your done and pay they bring you a little bag of the best little doughnuts ever.  Oh yeah Doughnuts.

My husband has been asking to eat at Bobby Q since we moved into our house in the north valley about 8 months ago.  We finally got around to it on his birthday last week.  On first entering, I felt like I was in a BBQ joint in Austin, TX.  The atmosphere was so Texan and down-home I might as well have been in Austin.  I ordered the special drink of the day, an adult Arnold Palmer.  One word:  AMAZING.  The lemonade they used really put it over the top.  So fresh and tart!  Everyone at our table was pleased with the abundance of meat and side items they received.  The icing on the cake was definitely the freshly fried mini cinnamon and sugar donuts they give you before you leave.  It's little touches like that that will beckon us to eat here again and again.

The interior is awesome the service is a wonderful it's very high-class very clean very welcoming in general it's really good barbecue I just have had far better barbecue for a lot cheaper. I would definitely suggest it to someone but not before I suggest about three or four different barbecue places first.

Seriously the BEST Baby Back Ribs I have ever had. I'm not joking. Tender, flavorful, fall off the bone, perfect amount of flavor and sauce.  Delicious.  The owner stopped by our table and ask if everything was fine. He was hustling. They really take the time to make sure everyone's meal was delicious and everyone is having a good time.

Stopped in here with my crew from school on lunch break from GCU. We sat on the very lovely patio. There are interesting fountains, and you don't feel like you're in the middle of Phoenix, which is always nice. The service was amazing. He took our picture without hesitation, and he knew we were on a time limit so he helped get our checks closed in a timely manner. I'd try this again for dinner sometime when I have the opportunity to relax a bit, but my impression was top notch!

Great reviews from so many people so I feel less bad about a non-stelller review.  

Service was great - friendly and quick.
Rolled-Q was really good.
The bbq meat were a-ok.  Not bad, but I was expecting better from someone who makes it for a living.  Chicken and pork were fine but the brisket was a bit dry.  Ribs were not bad.

Free fresh donuts were nice :)

Conclusion is anything fried is good here.

Amazing sides with good BBQ

Positives:
I used to go here when it was Bobby McGees growing up. It is completely different now.  It's very nice on the inside. Been there twice and once was for a party we got our own private room!  Our staff was amazing!! So tentative and everything came out great.

The sides are my weakness here. Their potato salad is super good!! Mac n cheese is wonderful. Good slaw. The bbq is very good also. I would not say it's the best I've ever had.. But it is defiantly worthy of eating and paying for. Yummy!! We all loved our food. 

Negatives:
I don't have any complaints.

Best BBQ in town. Not to mention the best Mac n cheese and potato salad! The steaks and burgers can compete with anyone else's too. The staff here is top notch and service is always fabulous. Don't forget to get your donuts as you leave! One of the valley's local gems.

We recently went there to celebrate a birthday. The beef brisket melts in your mouth. The roasted corn was delicious and the other barbecued meats (chicken, baby backs and beef ribs) were simply the best.

The desserts were very good too. The only downside was I lapsed into a food coma.

Our waiter Jason went above and beyond great customer service.
Outstanding! Service was excellent.. Food was great, along with the Smokey aroma throughout the restaurant. Nice job!

One of my favorite restaurants in the Valley! Service is always wonderful. The meats are always tasty and tender (I think my husband and I have tried every option!) and the sides never disappoint. I dislike cornbread but theirs is AMAZING! I also usually get the Sangria, which is pretty good. 

All in all I think it's always been worth the wait (it gets busy on the weekends, just like everywhere else) and the money.

Me and my wife visited here for the first time last night. We started off with the Q rolls which was heaven rolled into a tortilla, one of my new favorite appetizers hands down. For dinner my wife ordered the 12oz steak with mashed potatoes and Mac n' cheese. The steak was cooked EXACTLY how she likes just the right amount of pink, juicy, and melt in your mouth amazing. The mashed potatoes were seasoned to perfection and she couldn't get enough of the Mac n cheese. I ordered the half rack of ribs and fries however when they brought our food they had accidentally brought out a crusted cod. I politely voiced the mistake and our server handled everything professionally and immediately corrected the order and even let us keep the cod and brought my ribs out. The ribs...I cannot stress how perfect my ribs were. I consider myself a rib lover. I order ribs at almost every restaurant that serves them and these ribs were hands down best ribs Iv ever had in my life! The meat would literally fall off the bone when you picked it up. The perfect amount of fat, no chewy parts at all, and the BBQ sauce was smothered all over. The meat just melted in your mouth. After dinner the manager came out to make sure we were taken care of and gave us free dessert for the mistake that was made. At no point in time was I disappointed in the service. Everything was spot on. This place is my new favorite place to eat in all of phoenix! I will most definitely be back again and again and again!

Oh yeah BBQ! I don't think I consider Arizona the south so I didn't think there would be a delicious BBQ place in Phoenix but I was wrong. Bobby q's is great for date night good for kids good for groups. Service was good and BBQ was legit. Get the baby backs! Yum! Falls of the bone it was so good I'm sure I overate. For sides we really liked the pecan slaw and liked the spicy BBQ sauce. For those who don't drink alcohol they make a nice virgin strawberry piña colada. Loved this place!

I was told this place is a must try, and while the atmosphere and staff are great, the barbecue is pretty standard. I had a three meat combo of St. Louis style ribs, pulled pork and brisket. The pulled pork didn't have much texture and was kinda mushy. The ribs were very tender and had a nice rub  to them. The brisket was a bit dry and needed a bit of sauce to make it good. The coleslaw was creamy but not too creamy and beans were pretty pedestrian. Overall what really makes this place is the atmosphere and the service, otherwise fairly average. Oh the donuts to go are a nice touch on your way out!

I've been here several times and I have never been disappointed. Brisket is delicious and perfectly tender. I've also had the pulled chicken and the catfish, both good. All the sides I've tried are tasty, the Mac and cheese is out of this world. They start with fresh cornbread that is also amazing. I grew up hating cornbread, but somehow decided to try it here, and now I'm hooked! The fresh mini donut things at the end of your meal are great too. It's great for lunch or dinner. I haven't been to their night club but I have eaten in the restaurant while the club was open. The club has a dress code which I did not meet, but I figured it didn't matter since I wanted eat. The bouncer gave me a funny look when I approached, obviously I can't wear jeans here! But then I explained that we just wanted to dine in the restaurant and he was more than happy to let us in. They also have a full bar, some good craft local beers on tap and decent cocktails. The atmosphere is really cool, inside and out in the outdoor seating area. You can't go wrong with this pace!

After a long week of hard work,  my daughter and I always make a point to get together and have a nice dinner on Friday nights. We always struggle trying to find a new restaurant  to add to our short list of favorites. BobbyQ made that list longer last night.

We arrived at 7:15 on a Friday night. This place was hopping. There was parking readily available so I thought we would get in right away.  There were at least 40 people waiting for seating when we approached to hostess stand. She very kindly took my name and told me I would be seated in 1 hr and 15 mins. After having a light lunch, that was a long wait. So, I asked about the bar seating and was told find a spot and its yours. I hovered around the bar and found an open patio bar spot with 2 seats open. It was perfect. Plenty of space, no jockeying for elbow room. No talking over our neighbors. Absolutely perfect. Our bartender Chris was very attentive. I told him we were newbies and on a busy night he told us the story BobbyQ. He told us his favorite foods and got us some water. Said any of the 3 bartenders would take our order. 

We picked the whole hog heaven,  lots of food for 2 people, but allowed us to try 2 styles of ribs, 1/2 rotisserie chicken, and brisket. Also 3 side dishes for $48 bucks. There was so much food, we brought 80% home. 

The service: we were immediately served the complimentary cornbread. We ordered 2 strawberry lemonade and they were great. I thought I would be charged 4 bucks each but for these speciality drinks but they were 2.50. I pay that for a Coke in most places.   Settled in our seats and within mins our food arrived. And it was impressive. We enjoyed our dinner and asked for to go boxes. We packed our food and the store manager appeared ready to pack our boxes in BobbyQ shopping bag. He also brought the complimentary cinnamon donuts. Hot and yummy, we loved it. Thanks BobbyQ for a great Friday night! We will be back!

Notes: if you sit at the bar for dinner look for the outside patio seating. Not a huge fan of the Mac and cheese. Everything else Great! We'll be back!

We were impressed. Everything tasted absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is great too! The shrimp appetizer was so good we ordered a second! My 9 yr old loved the mac n cheese and said "when I die I want this place to be heaven."  The baby back ribs fell off the bone and the mashed potatoes are to die for. Definitely check out Bobby Q's!

The service we received from our waitress was Great! The food-not the best. I wouldn't recommend the calamari since the presentation looks like pile of cafeteria fish sticks and taste is similar to tofu. This was first and will be the last time coming here.

By far the best BBQ brisket I have ever had. To begin, the staff welcoming us was super friendly then the waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the pulled chicken sandwich, top sirloin. And brisket. Everything was fantastic except the sirloin...it had an amazing smoke flavor and was cooked to my preference however, the texture was very chewy. We told our waitress just so she knew however, she brought out her Manager Laura who was absolutely amazing. They brought out their kitchen manager Jack who gave us the grand tour in the kitchen. He showed us the smoker and explained the process of how everythijng was ran. When we arrived back to our table a brand new plate with an exact replica of my meal was sitting there. The new steak texture was amazing with the same great flavor. I'm positive it was just a bad cut and they went over and beyond to make sure we were pleased. It was a great experience and we can't wait to go back and taste everything. Thanks Bobby Q

We enjoyed our dinner at Bobby Q - good barbecue, sandwiches and plates. Just had beer -but definitely more to choose from. Enjoy.
,

Came here after SF and AZ football game. Staff are friendly. I had my order to go, got a complimentary drink, strawberry lemonade. So good! Food is awesome, so tasty! I took the leftover back home (Los Angeles) and had it for dinner. Wish we have it in California or should I say Los Angeles :). Thank you Bobby Q!!

Absolutely delicious St Louis style ribs, corn bread patties, home style corn, shoestring fries, and prime rib that my husband and I shared. The BBQ is definitely one of the best we've had in Arizona and it's definitely worth taking a drive out to. The only reason that I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star rating was because our waitress was terrible she might've been having a bad day because she was really sweet but she completely forgot my drink and my husband's shrimp and fries with his meal after being reminded. When they finally brought it out the shrimp tasted off like plastic almost. Everyone has off days but that's just unacceptable. Other than the waitresses slip ups we absolutely loved our experience and would definitely come back! Great atmosphere

This place waaay exceeded my expectations. I will admit, I went in not expecting such a great experience. The food, the service, everything was really first rate. For sure we will be back there. I just wish that it was closer. BTW even though it is closer, we will definitely not be back at their Mesa location. The 2 experiences had absolutely nothing in common.

My son and I came for lunch! YUM! Pricey for lunch but still great. He had a burger and fries which he loved!
I ordered the 3 meat combo with the expectation of having left overs. I did. We started with the Q-Rolls which were delicious. Definitely will be back!

I took a group of 7 here. They were really busy but there was a lot of people working. We hung out at the bar and had a drink while we waited. I liked this set-up since we were already starting to drink before we even sat down. Lots of great restaurants have this feature but most places in Phoenix are missing out on this. 

Everyone got something different but it was all good. We will be back.

Really good bbq! Generous portions and decent prices. Outdoor seating has a nice ambiance. My favorite meats were the baby back ribs and brisket. Seems to be a very popular place as it can get very crowded at times so make sure to make a reservation!
You need to make a reservation for this place because it is always packed. It's always packed because it's amazing. The entire family loves it.
Service was excellent & the food was outstanding! The regular BBQ sauce is delicious along with the cornbread. They are voted the number 1 BBQ place in the nation and they lived up to that!
How did yelp know I went to Bobby Q's for the first time? I had the chicken plate and it is fantastic.  Good service & fun decor. Scuba shop next door just made it all better.
One of my favorite resturants in Phoenix. Their baby back ribs are incredible way better than any ribs I've had in Texas
By far the best BBQ I've had. A little tricky to get to but well worth it. The flavors just satisfy your craving for good old BBQ comfort foods. Can't wait to try it again.

This is our first time here from California and can we say that from the first question I asked my server to my last bite of brisket I have been so pleased and in awe of this food. The manager stepped to our table and checked on us, which is how a manager should be. Overall great way to start our vacation!!! Worth the drive! Request Tasha for service !!!!!

It may be impossible to find good pit bar-b-q outside of Texas.  I'm still hoping, but have not found it yet.  Fair warning, I'm hard to please when it comes to bar-b-q'd brisket.  In Southern Texas, the pit master starts cooking at 10PM to have meats ready for lunch the next day.

I've heard a lot of good things about Bobby Q from family members.  Was able to stop for a Saturday lunch today.  Ordered the two meat platter with cole slaw and potato salad.  

Nice attentive waitress brought out some cornbread muffins.  I grind my own corn meal and cook buttermilk cornbread in a cast iron pan I've had for twenty years.  Tough to compete with my cornbread.  These muffins have blenderized corn kernels to give them a little flavor.  They were the classic sweet cornbread.  Sweet with a little bit of canned corn taste.  Oh well, I came for the bar-b-q.  

Sliced brisket and sausage was served on a platter with sides in small bowels.  Oh no!  There was sauce drizzled on the brisket and sausage.  It's almost heresy to put sauce on good bar-b-q.  Definitely an insult to the pit master.  

The prime brisket was very tender.  Brisket is a tough cut of meat that has to be gently cooked for a long time to coax out the tenderness and flavor.  Even then it has to be cut across the grain to be tender.  These thick slices were amazingly tender.  There was no smoke ring.  Tender bland brisket.  The sauce was the star of this plate.  Crash and burn.  

The sausage had grill marks on the sliced sides.  Reheating on the grill did not help the flavor.  It was a little spicy, but had very little flavor from smoking.   Again, the flavor was from the sauce that covered it.

Cole slaw had chopped pecans on top.  Nice touch as I love pecans.   If the pecans were browned in a little butter, it would have helped a lot.  Otherwise, pretty plain cole slaw.  OK, but not special.

I've had awesome potato salad.  This Bobby Q's version was OK.   Good, but not anything to write home about.  

So, I continue to be a disappointed Texan.  Guess I'll have to invest in a smoker.  

Go to Bobby Q's for good service, quality tender meat, and good bar-b-q sauce in a nice atmosphere.

The service was great, the product was not. The meal started with some really good corn bread, so we had high hopes. The iced tea was so bad we sent it back twice and ended up switching to Pepsi. They forgot our appitizer until after they brought out the entre. The  q rolls were OK once they got to us. The pulled pork was so over cooked it was nearly the consistency of mashed potatoes. The brisket was ok, nothing worth the $22 price tag for the 2 meat combo. All that being said they knocked of the app and one drink.

Menu can be a little overwhelming for first timers because there are so many combinations make sure you ask your waiter for help. Everything is so delicious here you can tell they take their time on it. Managers will stop by to make sure you're enjoying your meal just a very positive atmosphere. This is for the restaurant only as I've never stayed for the club... who would after eating heavy BBQ hehe...

OMG..meat coma with the whole hog feeds 2+..So good I couldn't stop eating. Sides were delicious too and be sure to ask for an extra side of spicy bbq sauce. So amazing. Love love this place. I came to take out an order and was immediately greeted and offered a complimentary beverage..I chose ice tea and waited about 15 to 20 min for the while hog. So worth the wait and I even got to sit with a chicken rotisserie sitting in front of me.

Landed in Phoenix and read all of the positive reviews here. I'm not really a meat girl but wanted to try this since barbecue is popular in Arizona. The restaurant itself has really nice to court and clean the staff was very friendly and attentive. We ordered the beef brisket and ribs which is good enough for two people. We ordered that with a side of the mac & cheese which was absolutely amazing and grilled vegetables to balance everything out. The bill wasn't so bad either I can get Casas around $30 which is pretty good for quality meat. Before we left we were given a complementary sugar donuts which definitely hit the spot. I'm giving this place 4 stars only because when we left we felt extremely heavy. I think it was the extra sauce that we asked for so definitely don't do that besides that this is a definity a Must
