This place is legit! Very good tasty food! Awesome environment! I visit Phoenix often - will stop by this place again. 

I ordered the brisket, pulled pork and ribs! Best in Phoenix!
Night life gets lit. The tacos are bomb!!! Especially on  taco Tuesday!!!! Gotta try them. Lol

Great food, great service, tasty treats. The baby back ribs fall off the bone, the bbq sauce is really good, both the regular and spicy. Mashed potatoes delicious, brisket is good, chicken is good. I really haven't had anything I didn't like. :)
Cameron our server was awesome. The atmosphere was awesome and so was the food. I was blown away. Would definitely recommend

Let's start this review out by making it clear that I am a "smoker".  In other words, I have my own rig, and I know how to use it.   My husband and I shared a "whole hog" meal.  St. Louis Ribs, Beef Ribs, Sausage and Brisket.  Of all of these meats, the only one that we didn't care for was the brisket.  Something was off and very mushy about it.  Brisket should be able to be pulled apart with your fingers, not completely fall apart like baby food.  For the sides we had baked potato, beans, and pecan coleslaw.  These were also great.

The atmosphere is somewhat contemporary, and very comfortable.  The service rocked!   It's no Mom and Pop place, but a great effort on their part for sure.
Complete jerks here. Not impressed.  Staff was rude, drinks overpriced (but expected). My phone was stolen out of my purse, and rudeness prevailed til the end. I'll never return.
Delicious BBQ and great prices. We fed our family of 6 for about $50 and had a lot of food left over. Highly recommend eating here.

Loved this place - of course, another great find from Yelp! 

We were in the area, and headed on in due to great reviews. Can I just say - holy cow giant drinks! We ordered our drinks and they came out in fun "glasses." And when I say glasses, I mean his was a ginormous martini style glass and my so-called glass was a cut out pineapple. The people at the table next to us on the patio were like...um, what did you two order?? We had no answers for them other than...awesomeness apparently! I've had some small martinis for $10 before...so this was just...whoa.

I had the pulled pork and mac and cheese. I will admit that the pulled pork was a bit dry, but a little extra BBQ sauce and that's an easy fix. Plus the BBQ sauce was delicious, so it gave me an excuse to use more! Win. 

The mac and cheese was, for lack of a better word, luscious. Creamy, cheesy and everything good southern style comfort food mac and cheese should be.

The real winner here for me was hands down the cornbread though. I'm a huge cornbread fanatic, and theirs was true southern to the core. Well done Bobbby Q, well done.

Overall: A+
Some good southern BBQ with great sauce and great sides. And...the drinks..I mean seriously...the drinks!

While in Scottsdale for the Barrett Jackson auction we saw this bbq restaurant from the freeway and decided to give it a try. 
LOVED IT!
Great craft cocktails - we had a few minutes wait so decided to order a drink at the bar. I really liked the cocktail menu and they had a good variety of beers on tap as well. Before we took our first sip, our table was ready. So off went to the dinning area.
Our server was very helpful and gave us a few tips on what they are know for, what he likes and answered any questions we had. He was training a new server and I felt he did a great job demonstrated how to help a first time customer.
The plates are huge! we had enough for lunch the next day. My cousin got the fried chicken, which was a crispy fried boneless chicken breast. It was very moist and super crunchy. The gravy on the mashed potatoes are is just like the gravy my grandma makes.  
My husband and I had a three meat combo and tried the ribs, hot link and brisket. All of them were moist and delicious. The beans were super yummy, my husband always bases his review of bbq on the beans and these got an A+. 
At the end they bring you a little bag of fresh hot, sugary sweet mini donuts. Ohhh be still my heart. We even had enough for our morning cup of coffee the next day.

Best BBQ in AZ! My mom and I came here for dinner and started our meal off with the Q-rolls for an appetizer. They were good and definitely worth a try. We then ordered the Hog Heaven for our entree. The Baby back ribs are so tender that they fall off the bone! The beef ribs were good but not as tender which was expected so no complaints here. The pulled pork and chicken are also delicious. As for the sides, the mac & cheese was good and creamy  but the baked beans and coleslaw were mediocre. We stuffed our bellies and still had enough for leftovers. This place is definitely on my list of places to bring people when they visit me in PHX.
The best barbecue anywhere. Good sauce with tender meats. The brisket was extraordinary! Cornbread and sides were also very good. Highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Was not expecting food this good. I had the brisket and was not disappointed, the family had ribs and chicken. Both were very good in appearance and flavor. We will be back the next time we are in Arizona.

We ate here for Father's Day and had the pleasure of being served by Michael. Not only was our food great but our service was also amazing. The restaurant was packed so the good service was a pleasant surprise. Michael was on top of everything and very attentive to our needs. We go here often and have never gone wrong with the food!

In my opinion, this restaurant has the best food in Phoenix. Everything tastes great. I wish they were located in a safer neighborhood so that people can go there for dinner. But other than that, this place is amazing!!! I go there at least once a month to get my favorite "smokehouse burger". This is by far the best burger in AZ. I love burgers in general and I have tried just about every place in phx but I have to say this smokehouse burger beats them all.

Food was very good and service was great. I had the baby back ribs with Mac and cheese and coleslaw (if you don't like pecans - order without because only on top).  All of it was very flavorful but a lot of food. One of us had fried chicken platter which wasn't a great deal for what you got but several others got pulled pork sandwiches which they liked.  I would recommend sticking with smoked meats which is their thing anyway. Best part was the donuts they bring you at the end - they melt in your mouth!

Whether you were going here for a dinner with your family or for a night on the town, especially on Thursday or Saturday night, this is a cool place to come kick back and enjoy yourself. The food is amazing and the staff is nice.

As a lover of BBQ, I cannot believe it took me 6 years of living in Arizona to find this gem. My girlfriend and I went here after much anticipation on a Sunday afternoon and we were blown away. This is not only THE best BBQ you can get in Arizona, but the service and ambiance are second to none. 

We shared the Whole Hog feast and had enough left over for a late night snack. The cornbread was the most amazing, moist, sweet corn cake I have tasted. Beef ribs?  Amazing, tender, juicy, beefy. Baby Backs? Fall off the bone and meaty, Pulled Pork? Juicy, smokey, melt in your mouth. Brisket? Full of sweet smoke and seasoning. I got an order of burnt ends to take home and the knocked my socks of with the seasoning and smoke - YUM!!!

The manager came by our table and chatted with us for a bit about our meal. She gave us a little history on how Booby Q's came to be. Later, our server came by and informed us we could pick any dessert we wanted - compliments of the manager. We picked the mud pie - again THE best I've ever had. At this point in the meal we were not surprised by the amazing-ness of the dessert. Wow! Hard to find service and attention to the customer like that anymore. 

All in all this is now in my top 3 favorite places to not just eat, but to dine in Arizona. In my opinion, a 5-star dining experience should cater to all 5 senses - Bobby Q's did just that. If I could give a bonus star, I would. If you have not been to this restaurant, stop searching Yelp right now and make plans to go. You will NOT be disappointed.

I have wanted to try Bobby Q for years and finally had the opportunity with some friends. It's a really good place for BBQ!

I made a reservation (they get an extra shout out for being on Open Table) and it's a good thing I did. 6:15 on a Wednesday and the place was packed and many people waiting to be seated. We were promptly seated thanks to my reservation. 

Our server came by to take our drink order and asked if we wanted any appetizers. Knowing what we would most likely be in for food wise, we skipped the appetizers and went right to dinner. 

To drink I ordered sweet iced tea. $2.00 I love this stuff and order it wherever, whenever I can!  

Though we skipped the appetizers, we did order salads which were really great, $5.50. Ranch house salad, my favorite type anywhere. Crisp lettuce, cheese, tomato, red onion and ranch dressing. Simple and delicious! 

My friends split the Whole Hog Heaven platter. They could choose two kinds of ribs, two meats and three sides. They ended up ordering double ribs and double brisket. There was so much food that four people could have easily split it. $48.00

Being a prime rib fan, I had to go for it. I ordered the smoked 10oz slab $26.00. It was outstanding! I was a little afraid the smoked flavor would overpower the meat...Not at all. It was just right. My entree came with two sides so I had mac and cheese and potato salad. Both outstanding! 

Dessert was tempting as mud pie was available which I would normally go for. There just wasn't room after all that food! We did however receive a complimentary bag of mini doughnuts. Served hot and dusted with cinnamon and sugar. Delicious and just right. You can take those home if you want. 

Everything about our evening at Bobby Q was outstanding. We were taken very good care of by our server and management checked on us a couple of times. Special shout out to one of the managers on duty Donnie. He was very friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were enjoying our evening. Nice touch! 

Be sure to try Bobby Q! It won't disappoint! Look for the Mesa location opening soon! 

Enjoy!

Went on a Saturday with some friends, was a 2 hour wait to dine in (make a reservation!) But for take out once we ordered we got our food pretty dang quick, within 10-15 minutes. I got the Texas beef ribs with the pecan coleslaw and mac and cheese and the apple cobbler for desert. The ribs were really good, juicy and super flavorful. Coleslaw was tasty but not outstanding, the mac and cheese was amazing though. The desert was disappointing though unfortunately and just okay. Each order comes with cornbread that was hot and fresh and really tasty, just wish I had some cranberry sauce with it! Will definitely come back.

I was honestly pretty hesitant on coming to Bobby Q for dinner because I had only heard of it being a night club. So when my cousin chose this spot for her birthday dinner I was a little bit skeptical. To my surprise it was a very nice casual dining setting and the food wasn't half bad! 

I ordered their 2 meat plate option that comes with 2 sides. I picked their rotisserie chicken and beef brisket along with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious! I even had some leftovers to take home. 

Afterwards we were given a bag of doughnuts!

I can see myself coming back!

Make sure to make a reservation anytime you go, unless you're willing to wait a good 1-2 hours. Place fills up quick because of amazing food and service. My wife and I were sitting at our table within 2 minutes, we already knew what we wanted so we ordered right away. What was surprising is that the food came out within 5 minutes, not even enough time to enjoy my beer. We ordered the whole hog heaven which was $51, we were intensely stuffed and even had plenty of leftovers. That whole hog heaven could easily feed a family of four. Thumbs way up for this place.

Service was good, food was ok 
It wasn't as good as what we got at the Biltmore location, but it wasn't awful.

Ate there for lunch. Wow, was it good.

I took two friends there and they were just telling me bad experiences with burgers that they had. (They are very particular with their burgers.) They both agreed that the burgers they ordered and ate were the juiciest burgers they ever ate. From my perspective, they looked really delicious.

But I had the full rack of baby back ribs. Oh man. We were just wondering why their burgers came with knives, but my ribs didn't. Then I just pulled one off. Or should I say I kept it from falling off. Oh, that's why. Yeah, that tender. So good.

Loved the corn bread and the mini doughnuts they gave us for complimentary dessert.

Yep, Yelp came through again and brought me to a five star restaurant. Gotta love this.

It sucks that we don't have a Bobby Q where I'm from because this place was spectacular. The food was amazing, great/friendly staff, free dessert, plus complimentary mini donuts!!! Our waitress, Nicole, was super. Highly recommend!

Had a business lunch there...we both had pulled pork, we both enjoyed it, therefore one dimensional review.

Recommended it to my daughter & son-in-law,  don't know what they ate, but, they liked it...hopefully not pulled pork ;)

a little expensive but great food, great patio!
servers were friendly and service was fast!
we'll be back
r

In an effort to cure our weekend blues - the hubby devised a new plan.  Instead of staring @ each other all weekend we alternate weekends and plan something for us to do.  Budget of $100.   No complaining!   

This was his weekend.  I'm one of those wives that loves a surprise/hates a surprise.  With that in mind I had great anxiety over the adventure ahead of me.  We start off with major construction going on our off ramp.  So we got a little side tracked and wound up going through some stranger parts of Phoenix.  I couldn't imagine a restaurant here so I was really starting to wonder what he had planned.  Then all of a sudden closer to the freeway there it is.  The most glorious signage I had ever seen.  Bobby Q's.  Fantastic.  He's gonna feed me and then the night will really begin. 

We head into the restaurant and everything is so cute.  It helped so much that tonight we could finally WANT to eat outdoors if we wanted to.  It's so much cooler.  We were told that it would be about five minutes.  We turned around, sat down and then our names were called.  Not bad.  I immediately notice the comfy little love seats and some of the tables.  We were not lucky enough to grab one of them but next time I tell you, my butt will be in one of them, or outside.  Tiffany came over and explained everything.  Which was great.  I love when wait staff knows their shit.  As a diet coke fanatic I will gladly let it pass that the competition is served in their restaurant.  I oped for the peach iced tea and had four more glasses after that.  At $1.75 how can you beat that.  And its not artificial tasting at all.  This was good.  Hubby had a beer that was specifically made for the restaurant.  BBQ Amber.  Good.  Went well with the meat.  Tiffany (who in my opinion is the epitome of what a wait person should be) immediately brought us some corn bread (to hold us over) and it was so good.  So GOOD.  I frosted mine like a mini cake with that butter and was all over it.  YUM.  When we put our drink order in we put an order for the Q-rolls in.  Before I was done with my first glass of iced tea - the appy was out. Think a smaller version of a taquito with beef brisket inside.  So awesome.  Good, just good!  I ordered the three meat combo (go big or go home) chicken, brisket and baby back ribs.  Chose mashed potatoes and corn as my sides.  Done and done.  Pic to follow.  I picked up a rib and it looked like the flintstone quarry.  Clean.  Not a lick of meat on it.  Where was the meat?  Oh on my plate.  It slid right off.  Not a touch of fat anywhere on it.  Melted on my mouth and was so good I was having trouble sharing.  The brisket was phenomenal.  The chicken with a touch of the spicy bbq sauce was run out on to the freeway and play good.  DELISH!  Do you get what I'm telling you here?  Hubby's meal was just as good.  Mac and cheese was great.  The corn.  O EM GEE the corn.  The little corn coins.  So cute and so damn good.  More peach iced tea.  At some point hubby used the term "meat mayonaisse" to describe the ribs.   He says that the fat on the ribs (which was minimal) melted in his mouth.  

The manager came over to check on us and what a doll she is.  I'm so mad that we didn't get her name.  Dear Manager - thank you again for the delish meal, the unexpected treat after and the great time we had on our date.  We will bring everyone we know there, we will suggest to everyone that they go there.  It was a real treat.  

To summarize - great place, great drinks, great service, great food, great manager, great dessert.  It will be our go to restaurant.

Bobby Q's is BBQ-licious! Definitely lives up to its reputation (#4 restaurant in Phoenix). Just walking in was a culinary treat. Prices are quite reasonable. Decor has a fun log cabiny feel. Very friendly, knowledgeable, helpful staff. We split the pulled pork sandwich with mac & cheese and calamari appetizers (unfortunately for me, I wasn't all that hungry). They brought out cornbread and gave us cute Thank Qs doughnut holes for a treat. We also got their sweet tea. And everything, literally all of it was great- like I'd actually recommend every bit of it to anyone! Well done Bobby Q!!

What a great place in not such a great area. This place is excellent. The building itself it very cool; the inside decor is unique too. Our food was fantastic. We had the spinach and artichoke dip app and shared the huge meat platter. All the meat was smoked to perfection and was just what you expect with good BBQ. Our service was great. Hostess was very friendly and didn't make us wait. Our server (Christian?) was also on point. Never missed a refill and was super efficient. This place is defiantly up to par. I will highly recommend to anyone. Even though it's a far drive from my area. Plus they give you these amazing little donuts before you leave! Just another thing that makes this place exceptional.
Absolutely the very best BBQ  in AZ.  The meats are wonderful and the sides excellent.  The servers are very pleasant and patient.  The only restaurant to go to for BBQ.   You won't be disappointed.
Great food, good service. Check out the Saturday Steak and Crab special, it is yummy. I really love the roasted corn.

Love this place! Got the pulled pork entree with 2 sides. The macaroni and cheese is to die for and the pulled pork is so moist and has so much flavor to it! Our waitress Stacy was phenomenal! She was very attentive to our needs by filling our drinks without asking, helping us with our take out and explaining how all the meat is prepared. If you want good barbecue come here you won't be disappointed!!
Food is horrible and there dance night even worse security was doing drugs in the restroom and where offering to sell some worst place

The service was outstanding. The food was delicious. We had Q Roll-Ups, an appetizer, and an absolute must! Then we had brisket and baby back ribs, outstanding! The macaroni and cheese was truly over-the-top excellent. Sharlie, our wonderful server, was lots of help in making good recommendations, super attentive and friendly, and always made sure we had everything we needed. She is a real Jewel! The manager, Taylor, stopped by with a personal greeting full of sincere warmth and genuine interest. No wonder this place is so fantastic! What a great bar they have, too! And oh my goodness... those insidious little puffs of delicious doughnuts fried in peanut oil they bring you at the end of your meal in the little to-go bag, The Perfect Touch of hospitality and Lord have mercy they are far too scrumptious! We are from out of town and eat out a lot and this place is at the top of our list!

Went to Bobbie Q for the first time and plan on returning.  Our server was Jo and she did an excellent job of informing us about the history of the place and answering questions about the menu.  The food was served quickly and it was the correct temperature.

We enjoyed the cornbread as it had a hint of sweetness.  We had brisket and smoked chicken.  The sauce was very good.  Baby back ribs coming out of the kitchen looked meaty and delicious.  There is a smell of smokey meat before you enter the building that builds up your appetite.  Once inside, the decor is a pleasant surprise!  The manager did come to our table to ask about our experience and the complimentary mini donuts at the end of the meal were another pleasant surprise!  We'll be back!  This place ticks all the boxes.
This was are first time there, Great atmosphere awesome food, barbecue is the best I've had in this State would recommend and will be returning. The wait is worth it, service is quick!!!

After a Sunday afternoon of sun and fun at a Spring Training game, my friend and I were kind-of, sort-of, well not really anywhere near Bobby Q.  OK, we were west of the 17 freeway, so I suppose that counts as "near".  In any event, since missing out on the UYE the previous week, I was happy to visit this new-to-me BBQ spot for a very late lunch/early dinner.

We were seated immediately, and started off with a couple of Blue Moons while perusing the menu.  It was extensive, with almost any type of BBQ combination you can imagine.  I did not take the time to review it all, because I only had eyes for one thing.  Brisket.  To sandwich, or not to sandwich, that was the only question.

We ended up selecting two BBQ platters - one with smoked BBQ brisket and the other with smoked pulled pork.  Each came with two sides - we chose mac n cheese, pecan cole slaw and potato salad.  Hey, wait, that is only three sides.  That is because we got two, count 'em TWO orders of mac & cheese.  Enable my bad habits!

Look!  Corn bread!  Warm, moist and topped with a healthy ball of butter.  It was probably a good thing we were only given two pieces.  I could have eaten a LOT of that...

Our meals arrived quickly, along with a carafe of spicy BBQ sauce (that went very well on the mac n cheese, I might add).  While the portion sizes weren't huge, they were still impressive.  It was immediately obvious that my friend liked my brisket better than the pulled pork.  How did I know this?  1) because it was OhSoVery good and 2) It was quickly disappearing from my plate without any effort from me!  Of the sides, of course I liked the mac n cheese the most - while it was not the oh so decadent Fleming's version, or the gooey cheesy version from Scottsdale BBQ, it still hit the spot.  

* We did make one strategic error.  While writing this review I noticed the Yelp Review Discount offer of 10% off the bill.  Too late to help us - but not too late to help you!  Go, eat, and ask for your discount!
Absolutely delicious food consistently and great BBQ! Decent service. Bill for four people was 90 bucks with good tip.

It was good, but didn't blow my mind. The sides were sub-par as expected. We have a SmokePro Camp Chef at home so maybe I am spoiled with what my husband makes? I just wasn't blown away by the BBQ and it wasn't any different than other places I've been. I did really enjoy the fried dough before we left. Those were yummy, but hard to mess up fried dough. Service was great and so was the atmosphere. Next time I would probably go with a simple sandwich rather than the 2 meat combo. My ribs were fall of the bone good and very tender.

Love this atmosphere and did I mention the free treat at the end?! (drool) I love the mac and cheese! it is a must, the staff is super nice as well. Great for birthdays, a date, or even to bring your family!

First off,  I like this place.  Food's good.  Service too.  They have a policy there where the manager is required to visit your table.  That's fine,  just don't interrupt conversations at the table like what happened when I was there this weekend.  Yeah, it's your job, I get it but I was MID SENTENCE when I was interrupted by a manager to ask if everything was all right.  I lied and said, "yes" but I should have said, "Yeah, everything was fine until you thought it was okay to interrupt me while I was talking."  Do your job, yes!!  Just learn some damn manners.

All was delish here !!!

Had the 3 meat platter with 2 sides and cornbread that I shared with the husband: we got the brisket, baby back ribs, and pulled pork. All the meat was moist and delicious and tasted great even without the BBQ sauce. We mac-n-cheese and grilled veggies for the sides...and both were yummy. My favorite was the cornbread...it was the best I have had and i would go just for that . They also give you these little fried donuts with cinnmaon and sugar for free before you leave and they were super sweet and yummy!! 

Did not know about the 10% off when I went...ooh well maybe next time.

Service was great too!!
This was some of the best BBQ I have had! My daughter and I both got the sampler with ribs, chicken and brisket. All were fantastic! Will be back.

Buffalo wings were great and the beef ribs and corn bread were super yummy.  My steak was decent, it didn't taste like it was aged over 60 days.   Food was served very quick and like other reviewers mentioned, location is not that obvious.

Oh what a happy gal I am now that I have found this place. I've been here twice and both times were good. I totally have to agree that the brisket is pretty awesome.  The Q-Rolls are super delicious. Smoked brisket rolled in fried won ton with a chipotle dipping sauce. I was upset that I had to share them. Next time they are going to be my meal, along with the yummy corn bread. The only thing I'd stay away from next time is the sweet tea.  Can we say a cup of ice could not even water it down enough?  That said, I appreciate this local place that offers yelpers a 10 percent discount for some great food!  I will definitely be going back for the great service and BBQ.
Absolutely the best bbq brisket so tender it falls apart,sausage has an awesome smoked flavor try all the sides super flavorful! Service is second 2 none

I feel like I'm at a lost of words because of how amazing Bobby-Q is. 
My husband and I tend to be picky with any place we eat. Tonight Monday night only about a 25min wait for seating anywhere. Pretty glad we got the outdoor seating.

Vince was our waiter tonight and wow above and beyond with customer service along with Chris who is a manager.
They must really strive on customer service because man it shows they are all on top of everything here.
Ok so where to start we started with the apps of the BBQ beef chimichanga things omg our kids couldn't stop eating them. As for main course my hubby got a half rack of ribs with potato salad and veggies(veggies not so great not even cooked all the way), I got the grilled shrimp in a Chimichurri sauce with Mac and cheese and roasted corn... all of it was amazing and I would order that again, as for my kids they got a pizza and it was very tasty they said.
Best part was the desert the little mini donuts
Soo yes I would come back my kids even said they will only eat BBQ from here!!!!

O.M.G.!!!!!!  My mouth is drooling just typing this review.  

Back home (San Diego), the best bbq place to dine at is Phil's BBQ.  This place is 100 times better than Phil's.  We ordered the "Whole Hog Heaven" and it was plenty for two.  Their pulled chicked, brisket, ribs and beef ribs are delicious and came with 3 sides.  The Mac N Cheese (Yummy), the beans (Tasty) and the roasted corn (excellent) were a hit.  

When I go back to AZ, I will MAKE sure to come back to visit Bobby Q.   Trust me...You will NOT be disappointed.

Very good ribs, melt in your mouth brisket, ranch beans and pecan cole slaw were decent, award winning mac and cheese tasted just regular... nothing special but ours didn't have a cooked crust like other photos on here. All in all great " BBQ" place.  Will be back!
Best BBQ I've ever had!  And fried fresh donuts before you leave!?!! Seriously.  The lunch sampler is a must have.  Best brisket.

Let's start with the mini skillet cornbread, exactly as good as it sounds. The brisket rolls are the best with the BBQ sauce and ingenious. The slaw was good with the pecans. The roasted corn was excellent. The ranch beans are more southern and a lil too sweet for me. But seriously people. Cinnamon mini doughnuts?!? Wow wow wow wow

Bobby Q is to legit to quit!
Having recently spent a few months in Texas and KC, I figured that Bobby Q would not match up or be as good as I remembered.

I was WRONG this place is great! While it's by no means the quality of BBQ, its some of the best I've had outside of Texas and better than many places in Texas.

The Brisket is moist, not as smokey as it should be, but it's tender and full of flavor.
The Mac N Cheese is excellent.
The Corn also kicks A.

AZ is lucky to have a gem like this in their city. Most places around the country can't even get close to this.

Hats off to Bobby Q!

heard so much about this place so HAD to try. the cornbread is good and we ordered the hog heaven. the ribs with the brisket and the pulled pork. DELICIOUS. best BBQ we've ever had. perfect portion for
us. the sides were small but there was enough meat to compensate for it. also, the service was super fast. less than 15 minutes after we ordered, the food had come out! will be coming again!

The servers here are well trained and are very helpful when it comes to helping out with ordering. The meat here is perfect and I am not even a big BBQ guy. Not only is the meat great but so is the corn bread. The corn bread is complimentary but honestly it is my favorite thing about this restaurant.
Great Environment! The 3 meet plate is off the hook! Recommend sharing this to open the posiabllities for other great items on the menu..
Tommy did a huge job providing great service. The pulled pork had an amazing smoke ring...as did the brisket,..as did the chicken...and the q-rolls are a great idea. Good stuff--worthy of its rep!

Ive been to the bar here and the restaurant one time. The restaurant serves fresh donuts they make there (great way to entertain the kids) and has good bbq food. I dont remember too much but from what I recall everything tasted fine. Good place to take families.
Brisket is unbelievable. Try the mash potatoes and mac & cheese as your sides. You will NOT be dissapointed!!!!

One of my top picks for brisket! Love ordering brisket and baby backs with coleslaw and shoe string fries! Fast service, came here on a holiday and it was minimal wait time for seating, and the food was out in a jiffy! The sangria is my usual drink choice and the banana pudding something cake is a great closer!

Excellent food and atmosphere. The weather was perfect for lunch outside and the lunch menu was fairly priced. I got the sampler to try all of the best BBQ. The brisket was a little dry but the ribs were to die for! I will be back again hopefully soon. I will get a full rack of ribs for my entire meal though. Juicy, fall of the bone, perfect smoky flavor. You can tell Bobby Q's knows what they're talking about when it comes to the ribs. 

I can tell this is something I will be craving again.

I'm addicted to this place. The meat just falls off the none, the sauce is fantastic, most of the sides are great, and the service is always friendly.

Finding this place can be a bit of a challenge, I've found that using the frontage road to get there almost always ends in a u-turn but well worth the difficulty. And this place can get packed so definitely make reservations, even if you're a small group. 

There is plenty of room for large groups, though it is really loud and very crowded on weekend nights when the connected club is open. I have yet to check out the Q-Lounge but it looks fun!

I always get the Q-Rolls, which are like southwest brisket filled eggrolls of joy with a side of chipotle aioli. They offer tons of meal options, including ones that are great to split even with more than one person. Their brisket is delicious and their shredded pork is great but its their ribs that leave me wanting more for days to come. The meat just falls right off the bone and I can hardly finish more than 3 of them before I'm stuffed. I happily eat the left overs for days! 

They also have great sides, their corn and mashed potatoes are definitely my favorites. Their roasted veggies do leave a bit to be desired flavor-wise but the portion is still large. When you're seated, the table is given corn bread and butter which is so good, you have to remind yourself not to fill up before your food even gets to the table! And when you leave they give you a small bag of donut holes! Seriously this place makes you feel like family and makes sure you leave stuffed.

My husband and I were in the Phoenix area for a few days and picked this restaurant based on the excellent reviews. Having eaten there I can say that the high rating is very well deserved. The meat was tender and flavorful and the sides were excellent. All too often the side dishes are afterthoughts, but Bobby Q takes just as much care with the side dishes resulting in a mask where every single bite is delicious.

Taylor Branch who is the dining room manager is fantastic! Professional, courteous, knowledgeable and extremely friendly. We have had dinner at this restaurant several times and largely due to the outstanding customer service we receive from Taylor as well as the great food! We will continue to visit this location.

Everything is relative to the area.  So I will say that this is definitely the best in Phoenix or anywhere else in Arizona.  No chain or mom&pop shop can compare to Bobby Q's.

I ordered take out but their little after dinner doughnuts were a nice twist to bbq.  And the cornbread was certainly better than average.  My favorite part comes when we speak of the macaroni&cheese.  Who and how in the world did someone in Phoenix learn how to make mac n cheese like this ?!  I was skeptical when I looked at it because it was an off-white color.  But it was creamy and full of rich flavor.  I ordered the smoasted chicken and drizzled some of that bbq sauce on it.  It was well cooked and the bbq sauce was high quality with a little zip and long lasting good after taste.  Strongly recommed the sauce (on the smoasted chicken) and mac n cheese. 

Your mouth will water when we talk about the peach cobbler.  It's not the best I've had (3 places I've tried around the world have been better) but it's a B+++++.  The crust is almost candied and melts in your mouth.  The flavor is NOT too sweet or powerful to the point where you can only eat a few bites.  It was well put together.

To top it off, the person who answered the phone and took my order (and my money) had her customer service skills in high gear.  She made me want to return because I felt like I was being taken care of.  Big smile, plenty of suggestions on whether I wanted her to include an extra cornbread or a couple extra doughnuts....at no charge.  Very accomodating so I had no problem living her a nice sized tip.  She made the experience enjoyable and I will be back time and time again!!!
If you live in Phoenix you need to eat this BBQ! I had the pulled pork and loved it I did need more sauce but I like a tone of sauce.

I had a two hour layover coming from Austin, TX through PHX and onto San Francisco.  I knew I would be cutting it close, but I jumped in an Uber and hightailed it over to Bobby Q.  The I-10 shooter couldn't even stop me from getting to my barbecue beef ribs and buying chef Mark H. a drink.  I was greeted by a lovely hostess and waitress named Jessica.  I got seated at a large booth, ordered a drink, and my beef ribs.  The drink and food appeared quickly.  The Bobby Q experience is simply the best.  The whole staff is just plain awesome.  Various people came by to bus plates, ask how I was doing, and see if there was anything they could help me with.  It was a great meal with some serious cornbread and mini-doughnut dessert.  I LOVE PEOPLE FROM PHOENIX AND I LOVE COMING TO BOBBY Q!

Unfortunately, chef Mark was not there, but I did make my flight home.  Chef Mark, if you read this, "I owe you a drink."

This is the best BBQ in town. Very nice place! The service here was amazing and very attentive to our table, even though they were busy.. Our orders  came out on perfect  time and it served warm and fresh. We had a good choice of entrees and appetizers and everyone  was very happy with our delicious meals.  The manager checks  on us many times to make sure we're having a great time. I will definitely be returning here again.

We had lunch at this place on our recent trip to Phoenix.  We came in between lunch and dinner and were seated promptly.  My husband and I ordered a full baby back with grilled veggies and shoestring fries on the side to split.  My son ordered the chicken tenders with shoestring fries on the side.  The food was amazing.  Our ribs were very tender and fell off the bone.  The sauce was not overly sweet which was also a plus.  The veggies were grilled well and not too overly cooked.  The shoestring fries had enough crunch and saltiness.  My son I'm sure enjoyed his food because he ate the leftover chicken tenders for dinner, and he doesn't normally eat leftovers.  Our drinks were never empty.  The server was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed - extra sauce, drinks, etc...  The bathrooms were clean which is always a plus.  The only thing is that I wished they had sweet potato fries on the menu too.  Their fries were good, but love sweet potato fries with my ribs.  Great food, great service, ample parking, clean bathrooms.  Definitely will return.

this is where i go for bbq in phx!!!

my family loves going here.  we have gone in small and large groups.  they are very accommodating.  even with reservations it takes awhile to be seated.  eventhough there is a lot of seating this restaurant is always busy.  they even have private rooms.  the restaurant is very nice inside and the customers are even dress real nice.  looks kinda weird seeing folks dress professional in a bbq joint.  if busy the parking kinda sucks.

the food is awesome!  everything that my family has tried as been awesome.  the corn bread and honey butter is delicious!  the ribs, steak, chicken, grilled salmon, salads, fries, it's all good!

the servers seem to do a great job and never had one problem.  great job!

i hope you enjoy this place because i do!

Any one who gives this place more than 3 stars is taste bud deficient. Lesson #1: good BBQ has some smoke to the meat (this place has NO smoky flavor to their meat)
Lesson #2: there was no smoke ring that denote it spent any time cooking low and slow like they advertise. 
Lesson #3: the meat fell of the bone (Great BBQ is removed from the bone, not fall off the bone. Kansas City BBQ Society rules)
I suspect that the baby back ribs I was served were first boiled, then placed on the grill right before it was slathered with raunchy sauce.
The only reason it got 2 stars was because our waitress was fabulous, giving great service with nice atmospheres.
We had a great time here last night! Friendly service and the filet mignon was awesome as usual! Justin was great! Thank you!

Service here is amazing. While a coworker and I were waiting for the rest of our party, the probably-owner offered us drinks, and the waiter checked in with us a fair few times to make sure everything was good.

Food was...not so amazing. Portions are large enough for 3 people, and none of those people are meant to be me.

I ordered the 1) 8oz sirloin steak with 2) mac n cheese and 3) shoelace fries, along with a 4) frozen strawberry lemonade. 

1) Ordered medium rare. Average steak. There was a vein of unchewable running through it that I had to spit out. It really is quite massive and is the only thing I wound up finishing or even putting a dent into.

2) Waaaay rich. Like eating a bowl of solid melting cheese. Not my thing, but maybe it is yours.

3) Fried breaded onions. Like onion rings, but also like eating oil.

4) Unbelievably, jaw-achingly sour. The waitstaff offered me another to replace it, which was just as sour, but it couldn't be helped.

Tl;dr: 5 star service, 3 star food.
Stopped in on a Sunday for some wings, sat at the bar to watch FIFA games. Wings were fantastic! And Sharli made me the best cocktails. This place gets busy fast, but the bar service was 5*!

Tasty BBQ! We ordered the lunch sampler plate and picked brisket, baby back ribs, and BBQ chicken! Also got a chicken cranberry salad! The BBQ meats were very tender and flavorful! The salad was fresh and tasted good, too! They give you complementary corn bread in the beginning of the meal and freshly fried donuts after the meal :)
Country music playing in the restaurant~ there's also an outdoor patio area with string lights that look very pretty.

We love Bobby Q, it never disappoints. We took our adult son and everything we ordered was perfect. I had the salmon and the guys both had ribs. There was plenty to take home and enjoy for lunches the next day.
Great place ... reasonably priced, fast and the service was superb! Sit on the patio if it's not too hot.

Was in Phoenix for a few days this week, and this place was right down the street from my hotel. Outstanding service by Chelsea at the bar. Very friendly, excellent bartender and had a great rapport with all of her customers, whether they were a regular or someone new. Next time I'm in town, this is my first stop. Food was excellent.

Coming from Virginia, I have some pretty strong opinions on what good barbecue is. For the most part, I've avoided barbecue since moving to Arizona, but my friends wanted to try out Bobby Qs, so trying out Bobby Qs we did.

We sat on the outdoor patio which was warmly lit and welcoming. Our server was incredibly friendly, which only added to the good vibes. Although not barbecue, the southern fried chicken caught my eye. I got it with creamy mashed potatoes and a delightful (maybe yogurty?) mac and cheese on the side. The cornbread that came with it was also heavenly. Though they are round and slightly more difficult to handle than the regular square ones, they were delicious and moist and there was more than enough butter that came with them.

My s/o got the pulled pork platter with roasted corn and shoestring fries. We traded our mashed potatoes and roasted corn because I absolutely ADORED the roasted corn. Perfectly buttery with such a good roasted flavor. Just thinking about it makes me hungry.

The only gripe I had was that for its price, there really wasn't that much food. It was enough for me to have leftovers, but it can't compare to my favorite bbq joint back home where $11 got you a pound of pulled pork.

Came here with some friends on a Friday evening and was told our wait would be around 40 minutes. Turns out we only waited 20 minutes!

The atmosphere inside was very nice, dim, loud, great for hanging out with friends or date night. The decor was very cool as well. Turns out on the other side of the restaurant you have a lounge area where it's blasting with music. Such a big restaurant!!

Our waitress was super nice, gave us some delicious cornbread first thing, and then gave us more. My boyfriend and I shared the two meat combo, with brisket and roasted chicken, and we chose mashed potatoes and mac and cheese for our two sides. It was delicious.

**^ this was written a while back and I never finished writing it. I've been back since and the food is still delicious! Tried the pulled pork quesadilla (YUM!) and southern fried chicken! Both were very delicious. Our server this time seemed new but he still tried his best to take care of us.

This place is the BOMB, I was hauling butt down the freeway & out of the corner of my eye I saw a cool looking place to eat. It looked like an amusement park restaurant. I stopped at my hotel to drop my bags and called my coworkers and we met there. I ordered the whole hog & it was mighty tasty. They had cold beers and a full bar. After my meal I was thinking I couldn't be any happier and then they handed me a bag of mini donuts which were lightly covered in cinnamon & sugar. they tasted like a churro. this place is a must try for BBQ lovers. the food is amazing.
Love this place! A must have when in Phoenix... the service can be slow but they always do their best to accommodate large parties which is awesome. Good food, always yummy!

Any restaurant that gives you complimentary cinnamon donuts when you leave gets 5 stars in my book! The food is delicious too- great service and atmosphere. This is the second time I have been here and will definitely be back

Okay firstly, I am from the South, so I grew up with "pulled pork" as the definition of barbeque. This place has got it and the sweet ice tea to go with it (one of the few things I miss from SC). My boyfriend and I dropped in here because we were in the neighborhood, and right off the smell was heavenly. It wasn't very busy, so I don't know if things would be different at another time, but the waitress was very friendly and we ordered and got our food in a timely fashion. Everything was delicious. We sat outside and I really enjoyed the sounds of the fountain (shaped like a still I think) and all the little succulents growing on the brick wall.

We had dinner at the BobbyQ Biltmore location with another couple last evening.  The drinks were great, the BBQ and steaks top notch as always, and our waiter was very good.  So why didn't we rate our experience as a 4 or 5?  I was shocked as we finished our last spoonful of dessert(bread pudding, yum!) and the manager walked over to our table and ask us to either leave our move to another table so that she could seat another party.  After spending over $250 for a dinner for 4 this just seemed very inappropriate to me.  I will not be back.

Bobby Q...you had me at cornbread and donuts.

We made an open table reservation for 7:30 but arrived at 7:15 and were seated immediately. 

We ordered the whole hog ($38) that comes with your choice of two orders of ribs and two orders of meat and three sides. We decided to order the St Louis Ribs, baby back ribs, pulled pork and brisket. The sides were two orders of Mac n cheese (since our kiddos love Mac n cheese) and corn.  

Complimentary cornbread quickly arrived. Flatter than most corn breads it is packed with flavor. Tad oily but it was warm, moist and absolutely delicious.

As soon as we finished the bread our entrees arrived and we were shocked at the quantity. Could definitely feed 4 adults.  The St Louis Ribs...OMG! Yummy. Fall off the bone tender with excellent flavor. My boys who usually don't care for ribs ate half of the ribs.  The baby back was also delicious and less fatty. The pulled pork and brisket were also excellent although the ribs were definitely the highlight. Mac n cheese was incredibly creamy and perfect for the kiddos. Corn was a mix of slivers of Cobb and corn kernels in butter. Can't go wrong with that.

We couldn't finish our meal but that wasn't the end...they give you a brown bag labeled with "thank q" on it. Fresh hot, light and fluffy cinnamonny sugary goodness that tastes like fresh churros but with a mini donut texture.

10% off with check in only sweetens this place. Thanks Bobby Q for a delicious meal.
Off the beaten path and the looks are deceiving.   Food and service was awesome.  Ribs were awesome along with service from Ashleigh.
Every visit for the past seven years have proven to be consistently amazing. Great service, flavorful food. Pretty much everything on the menu is AMAZING!
They were so friendly here and the food was delicious. A bit expensive but it was worth it. We'll be back.

Let's get the bad's out of the way first.

The server advertised multi cheese Mac n Cheese. Stating it was the best!
Yes, it was good. But, at least 75% of the cheese was Velveta/processed cheese. It was smooth even when cold, real cheese doesn't do this.  But, again tasted very good.  Just don't exaggerate about its contents.

Thursday night at 6pm, they were busy and the speed proved that. 30min for two medium rare steaks. They were also still prepping the coleslaw due to them running out, which I received at the end of the meal.  Come earlier than 5:30pm!

Now, the Q-Rolls are absolutely awesome! Flakey, tasty and unique. Get them!

We ordered the 12oz Sirloin. Server stated 60 day aged in-house. It was super tender, flavorful and beautifully prepared! Seasoning very tasteful. If you like your steak well done, they you just burn your money away.  Medium or medium rare only!

The beans are very steak house like. Tangy, sweet with a depth of flavor. 

Servers are highly trained, consistence, very nice table-side manor. 

We'll be back and hopefully changing this review to 5-Stars. Have to do 4-stars now now.
Walked in for lunch was greeted and seated immediately.  Server was friendly, polite and attentive.  BBQ sampler was wonderful and the food came out quick despite it being very busy.

I eat here twice a month because it os close to work, but it's worth the drive from any where. It is one of the best BBQ joints I've eaten at. Staff are friendly and the service is good. I need to eat here sometime when I'm not working so I can enjoy a bevie. It's has a fun decor that is probably enhanced with alcohol. ;-)

This might be my longest review ever. You don't have to read it, but you probably should. 

How this place has over 700 reviews to begin with is beyond me. Not even Amy's Baking Company has that many reviews and, as you might know, was heavily trolled after it aired on Kitchen Nightmares. They must be handing out money to folks for writing this shit. Or they're planted reviews. What's even more baffling is that it has a solid 4 stars. Methinks something is not quite right, but whatevs. Let's move on, shall we?

This place is truly bizarre. I've been here maybe a total of 3-4 times since it first opened many years ago. It's a BBQ restaurant / club-lounge thingy. And as I learned for the first time at happy hour yesterday, it's apparently two different restaurants. At least, that's how everyone acted. My boss had made reservations for us in the Q Lounge for their Friday happy hour. Apparently you can just walk in (provided you're 21) and eat a buffet spread for free. But not until you get past the LAUNDRY LIST of dress code rules. Yes, a restaurant that serves BBQ, near Ghettrocenter, has a fucking idiotic dress code. Seriously some of the dumbest shit I have ever seen. I thought I was in metro Phoenix at a BBQ restaurant, not a Scottsdale nightclub. The list includes asinine things such as: No white t-shirts, no hats, no sunglasses, no sandals, and must be a cougar. I wanted to be like, mo' fucker, do you know this is PHOENIX? We wear sunglasses upon walking up. We wear hats to shade our faces from the blazing sun. We wear sandals, often times fashionable ones, so our feet don't get all sweaty. And white t-shirts? Now you're just acting foolish. Of course, my boyfriend whom I invited, was wearing a white t-shirt, with a nice button-up collared dress shirt (it was unbuttoned), a hat (a nice one, like derby style), and sunglasses because um, to shield your eyes? He was asked to button up his shirt, remove his sunglasses (no shit Sherlock, don't we all once we get inside?), and remove his hat. Mind you, he's a nice dresser, not some hobo with tattered clothes (usually). Had I not been invited by my boss to this happy hour, I would've bounced right then and there. It all just seemed like some giant, corny joke.

Time for a paragraph break. It helps your eyeballs if you break things up. I'd like to point out that the actual restaurant portion does not honor said happy hour. That's right, you must go to the 21+ side with the fun dress code rules to have happy hour, even though it gets insanely crowded with nowhere to sit. Oh wait, you CAN order a happy hour beverage, but you have to get up from the table and walk your ass to the bar. If you order a beverage at your table, it'll be full price.

I will now talk about the redeeming qualities which merited that killer 2-star review. The food is very good. The mac and cheese is the cheesiest, and all of the meat is incredibly tender. A wee bit overpriced, but not awful. They also give you free freshly-made donuts when you leave instead of a damn dinner mint. That's pretty dope. The staff is very kind. Our sever, Alicia (sp?), was very sweet and accommodating. Kudos to her.

Lastly, it's confusing as shit to get into this place. The parking lot is weird, and if you've never been, you'll have no idea where to enter. The Q Lounge vs the restaurant portion. Two different places, remember. Even though...it's...not.

Note: Just don't dress like you live in Phoenix. You might not get inside to the dopest dance club in all of metro Phoenix.

1st time there... odds are it will be the last.  Ordered the BBQ pork and BBQ brisket sandwiches... couldn't taste the difference between the two.  the meat was tender but lacked flavor. 

The mac n cheese was just like store bought Velveta... nothing special... nothing great. 

The pickle was good...  tea wasn't bad. 

The peach cobbler... the crust tasted like it had onion powder in it.. really off putting. 

So... it was edible.. but.. it wasn't cracked up to what I thought the place was going to be after reading all the wonderful reviews.  Nice atmosphere... but... the BBQ wasn't anything special.  there are several smaller BBQ places around Phoenix which are much better.  Sadly... even Famous Dave's was better than this place IMO. 

So... 1 1/2 -2 stars....  I had much better. 

Hatch
Best baby back ribs !  Service is always top notch and lively patio.  Tried the Q Rolls appetizer and they are delicious as is the fresh cornbread!  Our favorite bbq in Phoenix!

Stuffed our faces! Love this place! Great food! Our waiter Hal was awesome!!!  We walked away stuffed!!! The experience was made even better because of the great experience Hal gave us just by being the great waiter he is!!!

Best BBQ I've had in AZ. I smoke meat every other month or so but love to be treated. Most places smother meats in crappy bbq sauce but they were really light on it and I got to enjoy the meat. I had the brisket and pulled pork. I have to say the brisket was hands done great!! The beans weren't anything special personally. But the corn was good as was the mac and chz and dear god how could I forget!!?? The corn bread! I'm super picky on corn bread but it was awesome! No honey needed!
Def a cute set up as well. The little booths around the bar was great. And they have a dance floor at night on the weekends. Awesome place! Highly recommended!

Ordered the ribs, they were really delicious! The BBQ sauce that came on the meat was awesome as well. My date and I ordered the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs and the beef brisket. 

I guess my only complaint is that the ribs were too tender for my liking, completely falling off the bones - making it hard to eat them. 

Sides were bomb, mac and cheese was delicious and the corn was great. 

I would definitely come back here to eat - but might consider what other BBQ options there are before, simply in the sake of trying something new.. not because I was disappointed here at all! Great food and really fantastic service.
Love this place!  Great atmosphere!  I have been coming here sine I was a kid and the food is always consistently good.

Although I don't eat meat anymore this is still our go to family restaurant. When I was younger I remember how amazing the food taste and that still remains the same. Would be awesome if there was some vegan BBQ options but I understand it's a meat house! 

Still my family and I come once a month, and my parents go to the night couple every Friday. If you're looking for a good time with the family or with friends and don't want to drive to two places. Come here on a Friday or Saturday, eat dinner the. Walk just past the hostess and go dance and work off those calories! 

Great staff, amazing bartenders, and nice management! 

Again, although I am vegetarian/Pescatarian I still enjoy myself and just eat salad and the salmons OH ! And You must try the Mac n Cheese !!

Ok so we brought our brother and his girl Christina it was her Birthday! Devin and Orlando served us with quality, precision, yup hot food and AMAZING taste! We are amazed at how well this place has ran for years! Didn't know the manager has managed this place 5 years! Hats off tho the WHILE TEAM! Amazing place. So grateful that it is all the best of the best!!

We read the reviews and were expecting a very good to excellent BBQ experience. Unfortunately, we had a mediocre to average dinner.  We tried "the whole hog" and expected generous portions of ribs, chicken, and sausage for the price.  We received lunch portions--at best.  The ribs were very dry albeit they fell off the bone.  The chicken was average and the sausage on the tasteless side.  The BBQ sauce was typical and really too sweet for this type of fare.  The corn was greasy, the fries were average string fries, and the mac and cheese was good (according to my wife since I think typical mac and cheese is too bland). We passed on dessert but we were given a gift of two small doughnuts that left a serious grease stain in the bag.  I thought the doughnuts were a weird accompaniment to this BBQ dinner.  I must commend the service as prompt, courteous, and very friendly--bravo.  Overall, the experience was so lackluster that we would be unlikely to return.  I did note that the bar and lounge scene was very active while the dining room had plenty of empty tables at 6 on a Friday.  Perhaps one should consider this more a bar and lounge and secondarily as a BBQ Emporium.  Something to thin about.  If you are looking for serious BBQ--look somewhere else.

FIVE STARS... My first time, everything was delicious!!! 
Baby back ribs 5 stars
Cheeseburger 5 stars
Kids cheeseburger 5 stars
Onion block 5 stars (BBQ ketchup rules)
Corn bread 5 stars
Free donuts 5 stars
Baked potato 3 stars
This place is a must eat for BBQ FANS

I ordered a smokehouse burger with mashed potatoes.  The BBQ sauce is amazing, plain and simple.  It has the perfect amount of sweet and tangy.  It didn't go too well with the thousand island sauce, but that's of little consequence.  The setting is great and the prices are about average.  It's a nice place to go to hang out with friends or with family.  That said, I do have 3 complaints.

1. I ordered my burger medium-rare, and I received medium well.  
2. I felt very rushed to eat.  I was constantly asked if I'm finished.  Do I need a box?  etc.  Yes I know you have a line and I'm only one person, but I would still like to enjoy my meal instead of scarfing it down.
3. This is the worst offense.  I was watching the setting, and I noticed one waitress sneezed into her hand.  At first I thought she was going to go to the restroom to wash it off, but nope.  She turned and started to service another customer.  Yuck.

Can anyone say brisket? The brisket is to die for here and the mac and cheese is the best I've ever had in any restaurant.

The brisket is so tender that you can tell its been smoke d 12+ hours. The meat is so tendet it literally melts in your mouth. They actually use cheese in their mac and cheese instead of using a roux. If it wasnt I couldnt tell because it tastes so good. 

Not to even mention about the great service here. They explain their cooking process. They always check on you. I purchased a beer I tried for the first time and didnt like it. The server allowed an exchange for a fimiliar beer. I always get good service and food consistently here. Bobby Q is my BBQ spot whenever I come to visit Phoenix.

I went here tonight with my lady and everything was great. Ordered the St. Louis style ribs but wasn't a big fan. Mentioned it to the waiter and the GM came over and comped it. He got me the brisket platter instead, but also a few baby back ribs for us to try. Went way above and beyond my expectations! 

Also best macaroni and cheese I've ever had at a BBQ joint bar none!

A Crowd favorite! I have been coming to Bobby Q's since I moved back to the valley in 2006. This place is great if you want BBQ. It isn't Texas BBQ, it isn't Kansas City BBQ, it isn't North Carolina BBQ. It is Arizona BBQ (If we had such a thing) - I can't get over the little things they do right here. From their BBQ egg rolls to their brisket, and little donuts for desert.. Where to start!? My wife and I generally get a 3 meat combo because you get a lot of variety. Their sauce is great they have a nice kick and I like that they do it right and not slather it on for you. Over the holidays this past year we had placed a reservation and we were accommodated easily. 16 people, not a single mistake, billing was done perfectly, and everyone was attentively taken care of during the meal. It so rarely happens with large groups we were impressed with the service. The prices are really reasonable compared to a few places that are a significantly closer for us, When people come to town, hungry - I send them your way. Keep up the great BBQ we'll be back soon!

Yumm-o

Loved the brisket, so tender and not fatty like most places.  My husband said that the potato salad is the best ever.  Definitely worth returning and would encourage anyone that likes good BBQ to go.
Great bbq! Some of the best we have had. Our server, Carmella, was amazing and the rest of the staff were very friendly. Gives Texas a run for its money

I had eaten the BBQ at the bar side on Friday nights were they have free food with a two drink minimum (diet Pepsi for me) and thought it was good. I finally made it to the restaurant side were I was told they had two smokers (a must for good BBQ). I went for the half order of baby back ribs and thought they were GREAT, darn good BBQ sauce too I must say. I got the beans and coleslaw with pecans, the beans are cowboy BBQ style, not bad and the slaw is very good, you also get corn bread that is better then mom makes, (my mom uses the box mix). One of the best BBQ joints in Phoenix for sure.

Maybe my son and I have different tastes than most of the reviewers or ate here on an off night. Our experience was that the decor, menu, service, and presentation were all great, however the BBQ was tasteless. We ordered the Whole Hog to share. It included two types of ribs and two meats. The meats were all beautifully prepared, fall-off-the-bone tender, looked great, and then very little taste except for the sweet sauce on everything.

Maybe we are BBQ-spoiled living in Texas.

Great barbeque! Came her on my birthday in July and Jack was our server. This was the best barbeque I've had in Phoenix, so far. Service was EXCELLENT (thanks Jack) Happy Hour was great, too. (Stayed for dinner after happy hour) Had the Baby Back ribs and chicken. Both were cooked perfect. You can't go wrong coming here if you're looking for good barbecue. Also, It gets busy after 6pm, so if you don't want to wait get there by 6.

Pretty much as good as it gets as far as BBQ is concerned. Ribs, coleslaw, cornbread,  peach tea..all awesome! Also the smokehouse burger is one of the best I've had.They also  bring these little doughnuts ( free) at the end that just melt in your mouth.. so delicious.  Service was great. Sit in Sawyers section. I hear Friday nights in the bar are a good time as well.

I love BBQ and I've wanted to try Bobby Q for a while so when the boyfriend had a friend coming to visit who was staying near here I suggested we try it out.

It's always a little scary to take someone to a place you've never been to but Bobby Q did not disappoint.

We started with their Q rolls for an appetizer. SO good. They are kinda like egg rolls but with brisket and they come with a chipotle dipping sauce that is really good. 

I ordered the brisket sandwich (apparently I was in a brisket kinda mood) which comes with shoestring fries and I ordered a side of mac n cheese as well. I'm not kidding when I say this is some of the best beef brisket I've ever had. It was so tender, not dry at all and it had just the right amount of sauce - enough to give you that rich BBQ flavor but not so much that the meat is swimming in it.
The fries were good but the mac n cheese was really good. VERY rich and creamy. I couldn't finish it all. 
The boyfriend had chicken and mashed potatoes. He said the chicken was good but the potatoes came without gravy. Maybe they forgot it? So those were kinda dull. 
Our friend got ribs and mac n cheese. The ribs looked amazing - fall off the bone type.

We stayed at the table really late - we were literally the last people in the place but they didn't seem to care that we were just hanging out which was cool. 

We didn't go to the bar next door but it was packed and looked like a fun place to grab a drink.

Bobby Q turned out to be a great place to bring a visitor since they let us talk forever and the food was tasty and reasonably priced. I would definitely eat there again.

I'll say up front that, being a Texas BBQ fan (and resident), I was a bit skeptical of BBQ here in the desert, but I was here with a group from work, and they were footing the bill, so here we go. 

First up at the table, following beverage service, were baskets of little round cornbread rolls, a little smaller than hockey pucks, but far more tasty. They were a little sweet, but not overwhelmingly so, baked to a golden brown, and great with the supplied whipped butter. 

For the main course, I ordered a three meat plate with sliced brisket, ribs, and sausage, with a side of mac and cheese. Here's the rundown:

Brisket: This, alone with the other meats, had sauce already applied (I forgot to ask for it to be omitted), but it wasn't slathered with it. The meat was a tad bit dry, but it was what we call in Texas "lean brisket", so that was to be expected. It did, however, have good smoke and a pleasant flavor all around. It was also well seasoned, as were the other two meats. A good start to the meal!

Ribs: These were smallish, still "assembled", and looked quite nice. Upon digging in, they were a slight bit overcooked (definitely the "falling off of the bone" phase), but the meat was tender without being mushy, and it also had good smoke and flavor. There was also a quite nice meat to bone ratio. 

Sausage: The weakest of a decent spread of meats, this was a medium grind that wasn't overly "Eckrich-y", had good smoke, but the flavor just didn't wow me. 

Mac & cheese: A fairly standard offering, it did have a good, strong cheese flavor and creamy texture, but the pasta was overdone . 

This was really a nice meal. After the main service, a few bags of little donuts, sprinkled with sugar, arrived at the table. They were hot, fresh, and VERY tasty. It would have been totally easy to just eat the whole bag, but I limited myself to three :). Definitely check this place out if you want some decently good BBQ in the Phoenix area.
Great Barbeque. Love their Fried onions and they have fabulous Mac and cheese. The servers are friendly and helpful. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Amazing lunch... Catfish Po- boy was delicious. My son had the loaded baked potato with chicken and friend had a chicken salad. Everything was tasty. Our server Careron F was delightful.  He answered our questions and make sure we received all of our special substitutions.  We are already planning our return.

Overall had a great experience here. It was super packed but once we were seated I could see why. The ambience was warm and welcoming, the service impeccable, and the food absolutely delicious. I ordered the prime beef brisket platter with Mac and cheese and coleslaw and everything was portioned out perfectly for me. Thier alcoholic beverages were fun and creative and full of flavors. The cornbread was perfect and the complimentary sugar donuts were a great ending to our meal. As I'm sure others have said so far, I would highly recommend trying this place out

Great food and great service! Had an amazing time with the family celebrating a birthday! Definitely don't pass on the whole hog meal- we ordered two to share between 6 and we're able to sample a little of everything. You can't go wrong with anything your order, it's all amazing!

Ok, let me start by saying I'm all about beef ribs.  If they are one the menu -that is what I'm having.  The beef ribs here were falling off the bone tender but relied way too much on the sauce and not enough on the smoke in the meat for flavor.  Overly sweet and no tangy heat that I expect on a good beef Q.  Like some odd mix of St. Louis style meets beef ribs.  I'd give them an 7/10.  And at $28 I'd expect a 10/10... Sides were hit and miss.  The whole corn was really exceptional - really a 10/10, great smoke flavor.  Slaw was ok but the pecans really didn't add and the slaw was lacking something 6/10.  Beans were good but again too sweet and not smokey 8/10.  My husband's brisket sandwich was pretty good but nothing outstanding.  He said 7/10.  

Friendly, fast, professional service was still not enough to push this review up to a 5*.  Overall pretty good but I probably wouldn't bother to go again.  I'll save my Q quota for somewhere in Texas...

Went during lunchtime during the week. Was definitely pushing it on time. Our waitress was extremely nice and bubbly. Got in and out in 25 minutes and food was delicious. I recommend the brisket & potatoes salad.

I have been there three times now because it is absolutely delicious! 
The first time, I got the rotisserie chicken with grilled vegetables- both were outstanding!  
I have also had the salmon, which was great and cooked perfectly. 
I also went there with my family for a birthday celebration, so we all ordered various things.  The whole hog is great because it is a lot of food, and easily feeds 2 people.  The ribs are very tender, and the brisket is awesome!
Everything here is delicious, and this has definitely become one of my favorite places. 
The cornbread is a great little appetizer, though I wouldn't eat too much because I prefer to save room for all of the BBQ!  
Overall, the service is fantastic, and the food is awesome. 
Also, the donuts at the end, are a great touch! :-) 
I would recommend this place to anyone!

I wanted to love this place, after seeing the reviews.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  Perhaps a steak is not what one orders at a bbq place.  

Staff was great.
Bob himself seemed respected by his team.
I loved the atmosphere.
Baked beans were really good.  Great texture.  Not just a soggy mess.
Onion strings were perfect.

The top sirloin I got was very tough, strings of gristle running through it, making it even harder to cut.
I didn't order the filet because I wanted more flavor than a filet usually provides.  The flavor of the sirloin was lack luster.  A good grill flavor but not much to it.
It was cooked perfectly. 

They did so much right but for a bbq place with not so great steak, I really want to go with 3.5 stars.

I'll be back to try the ribs and brisket.  I have high hopes that I will be updating my rating.

Good food, but they messed up our to-go order, they forgot the cornbread and one side, no mac and cheese tonight. How hard is it to put the food in the bag? We probably won't go back, Haps and Joe's Real BBQ are just as good, probably better, and they've never forgotten anything. Too hot to drive back to get the missing things.

I had the Beef ribs and I'd rate them as ok.  The meat was really tender and the sauce was good.  However, I couldn't detect any of that Smokey bbq taste that I enjoy.  Overall it was a decent meal, I'd eat there again.
Amazing food. Best baby back rib ever. Amazing service. Reasonable price and great ambience.

Ive been to Bobby Qs 3 times now and I cant get enough of this place! The staff is super friendly everytime I come in and if you rrsd my other reviews you will know thats a big deal to me. The last time I was there I ordered the baby back ribs with mac and cheeese and mashed potatoes. When I got my food and picked up a rib the bone fell out clean. I cant tell you how satifying it is for that to happen. Great food, great staff, and donuts at the end of the meal! Isnt America great!

This place was really good! Service was really great too. We had ordered an appetizer but they forgot to put it in, but we honestly forgot about it until after we ate our lunch. They ended up boxing the appetizer up for us to take home no charge (they really didn't have to but the gesture was nice). Good barbecue, definitely will go back.

We arrived early for our reservation for a party of five and sat at the bar. Very Friendly service throughout the evening. A very nice selection of beer on tap and a full assortment of beverages can be had. All five of us ordered a variety of BBQ dinners and each person was very pleased with their meals.

Went here for a MeetUp and was very impressed.  Service was good considering the sheer size of our group, food was excellent (I had pulled pork and it was delish!), and the little baggie of donuts was a fantastic end to the meal.  Would highly recommend!

Unbelievable service and food! My wife and I went here on our way (moving) to Florida from California and were greeted with wonderful service. Everyone was super nice and even the manager checked on us. The food was truly out of this world and I'm sadden by this review knowing I live about 2,000 miles away.

I am not a happy camper right now. I have never exoerienced such discrimination until tonight! My friend came over and talked me into decorating for christmas. So after getting my christmas tree all done and watching movies all afternoon we decided to run out to Bobby Q's for a quick drink to celebrate the season. Me and my friend put candy canes on peoples cars in the parking lot to spread cheer. Dressed in a santa hat and candy cane headband we walked into the bar and ordered one drink. After ONE drink the bartender told us he wouldn't serve us anymore. Mind you ONE and he took my friends second away. We weren't acting weird or anything!! We were talking to people around us handing out candy canes. We took the receipt to the manager and asked her why the bartender felt like he  didnt want to serve us. She stumbled on her words and couldnt give us an answer. I feel it may have been because i was wearing a HD shirt with tatoo sleeves?? Idk but WOW is all I can say. I will never step foot in that establishment again!!
Delicious BBQ, but perhaps going there the day after Thanksgiving was not the best idea...I was still stuffed!  Next time, I will nkow to go hungrier!

(Before I say anything, order the Q Rolls. I don't see a single possible way anyone could be disappointed by them. Unless you don't eat meat, and then I feel sorry for what you're missing out on.)

Finally went off the beaten path (literally) and tried Bobbie Q's after years and years of driving right by it along the I-17. If you're anything like me, you thought it may have looked a little questionable from the freeway. Old perhaps, run down, neglected? Let me assure you, none of these are the case at all. Once you navigate the side streets to find this hidden gem, you are sure to be pleasantly surprised just as we were. 

Prepare to be greeted at the hostess station inside a beautifully kept up and clean dining room. You may notice the donut machine just behind the hostesses making fresh little donuts which will be warm and waiting for you on the way out. Once seated, I highly recommend you order the Q Rolls, as stated at the beginning of the review. The beef brisket wrapped up inside them is out of this world good. Great dipping sauces too. 

For the entrees, we had a loaded baked potato with shredded chicken, a pulled pork plate, a brisket sandwich and a pulled pork sandwich. Aside from one small complaint of a little bit of extra fat in the pork plate serving, everything else was excellent. Didn't notice the fattiness in the pulled pork sandwich I had half of, so I'm guessing it was just a fluke. The half a brisket sandwich was outstanding and the potato with chicken was also very good. Tons of side dish choices too; sure to be something for everyone.

As for the service here, the servers and managers don't appear willing to let anyone get out of there unhappy. They pride themselves on having happy (and most likely return) customers. Just look at their current Yelp rating; that's not easy to do! We had two different managers come over and check on us at two different points during our meal. Our server took great care of us, even hooked my mom up with extra cornbread. Totally made her night. And to all of the guys out there: ice cubes in the urinals when it's time to relieve yourselves. How many places can claim that? ;-)

I love their food! I always eat the smoked brisket with mac n cheese and coleslaw.. My husband always gets the two meat combo with mac n cheese and mashed potatoes. We love the mac n cheese and the doughnuts they give complimentary! 
The only thing I would say is try to make reservations because there is usually always a wait.
Literally the best customer service ever!!! The food was amazing as well! It is a hour drive for us but we will definitely be back.

MEH. 
The hubs and I took a few friends here on Saturday night. They were JAM PACKED but sat us in the estimated 20 minute wait they gave us. 

Our waitress was good and quick, though she didn't come back for a loooong time at the end and we all were ready to just go. But they were busy, So I understand. 

My 3 star review is on the salad I got (I know right, who gets a salad at a BBQ place, this dummy does) I got the Avocado Club Salad with Brisket. For Avocado being the first descriptive word i was expecting a TON of avocado in this salad, I was soooo excited for all the avocado I would be consuming, unfortunately there were maybe 5 or 6 very very veryyy small pieces of avocado in the whole salad (trust me I searched that salad bowl over) not even a half of an avocado...so maybe just call t the Cobb salad and be done with it? The brisket was cold and salty. The ranch dressing was extremely watery. 

HOWEVEr the little corn cakes they bring you in the beginning were HEAVEN and the fresh made donuts at the end will drop you to your knees they are so amazing!!!
Bobby Q was excellent for Father's Day lunch. Service was excellent and the food was the best BBQ ever! This is the best BBQ in Arizona! Yummm

decided to try out this BBQ place while is was in Phoenix for spring training with the family.  The place is a bit hard to see from the road, and if you are not careful you will drive right past it.  The parking lot is a good size with plenty of parking, provided i was there for an early dinner so this may not be true during peak hours.

The entrance to the restaurant is on the side of the building.  inside there is a small bar and a nice dinning area.  You can see the chickens on the rotisserie in the back, and the smell makes you instantly hungry.  We were seated near the back and our waiter (Riley) was quick to greet us and make sure we were doing good.
