Not knowing what to get Riley made a few suggestions for us to think about before taking out drink orders.  Most of us got the Bobby Q Amber Ale and one Strawberry Lemonade.

We decided to order the Whole Hog Heaven and a second order of ribs.  While we waited for our meal we had some of their fresh complementary corn bread and enjoyed our cold drinks.  Food came out in the right amount of time, not too long or too fast.  

All of the food was delicious and went well with the beer.  During our visit the staff was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.  Drinks never went empty and we had wet naps before we asked.  To finish everything off we got free doughnuts at the end.

This is one of the best BBQ places i have visited and i will definitely be back during my next visit.

Away from home on the 4th of July my boyfriend and I were craving BBQ and after scouring yelp for the best BBQ places we decided on Bobby Q.

With reviews upon reviews and pictures of the whole hog heaven the boyfriend and I told ourselves that we would not be tackling that beast on our own... but we did. After a conversation with our waiter it really did seem like the best option to sample what Bobby Q had to offer. And for the amount of food given, it was well worth the price.

Although overwhelmed when the platter arrived to our table, the boyfriend and I found ourselves quickly working our way through it. We had enough leftovers to stuff one person senseless. 

Do yourself a favor and opt for the baby back ribs and the st louis ribs. You get more bang for your buck this way instead of going for the beef back ribs which they will only serve you two of with the Whole Hog. Shoestring fries, baked beans, and mac and cheese were on point and if i had to do it all over again I probably wouldnt have gotten the pulled pork and asked for more brisket instead.
Delish!! Pulled pork was tender, great flavor, daughter loved her hamburger. The sides are fresh and taste great. Little pricey, but service is great.

I have been here a few times and every time I come here I love the place. They have by far the most tender barbecue and great portions. I've never had a problem getting seating and the service is always been really good. Of course the hot donut holes on the way out our fantastic but I can only eat here on my dieting cheat days but it is definitely on the list of places to eat when I want to eat this kind of food. I really like the ambience as well. Another thing that's good is that the price points are where they should be so yours able to take big groups and family and their stuff for the family my kid is really picky and I like chicken fingers and he liked what they had

If there's any errors in this post it was done through Siri
The best BBQ in Phoenix. So yummy and huge portions. Try the frozen lemonade is delicious

Hands down some of the best bbq I've ever had. The brisket practically melts in your mouth, but it was the St. Louis-style ribs that were perfection. They seriously rival any ribs you'd get in Missouri or, frankly, anywhere in the country. 

My friend & I also got the Bobby Q Amber ale, which we were told was only sold at the restaurant & nowhere else in the world, and it's excellent.

The waitstaff were also extremely knowledgable and friendly. This place is a gem in Phoenix.

I wish there were at least vegetarian substitutes for even one meal. I ended up with a side of mac n cheese, and a "vegetarian" pizza that looked like it was assembled by a child, and tasted like flour and regret. Not really satisifying. Not worth the money. The 10% off coupon with yelp was a redeeming quality, at least.

We visited Bobby Q for the first time this week. The food and service was great. We ordered the ribs, chicken and brisket. The ribs were fall-off-the-bone delicious. The chicken was moist and flavorful. The brisket was tender and cooked perfectly. Our waiter was very attentive. We will definitely go back!

I didn't enjoy the food at all. The BBQ sauce was ketchuppy and the brisket was spongy. You can get a better meal at Texas Roadhouse and pay less. I guess this has more classy ambiance but I'm after a good meal
Good food, good staff, and those little doughnut holes...YUM!

Food here is fantastic!!!  While this restaurant is a little tricky to find and not in the best of neighborhoods it is well worth the effort. My family and I had the three meat combo with sausage, baby back ribs,pulled pork, Mac n cheese,and pecan coleslaw.  Portions were big and enough for the 3 of us.  Corn bread and the great donut holes at the end really topped of the meal.  Love the atmosphere, decor and the service was great.   I highly recommend and will be back.

Food is amazing, service is great! The prices are very reasonable especially for how much food you get. 

On the flip side, I wouldn't do the nightclub that it turns into after dark. They charge a cover for both males and females. The drinks are overpriced and the atmosphere is stuffy. Clientele that shows up after dark is very sketchy. Would never go there without a guy in tow. But I would definitely go for lunch or dinner! It's such a 180 its unbelievable!
Love the side dishes. Always fantastic service. lol I'm mostly vegetarian so for me to go here it would seem like an oxymoron. But I love Bobby Qs.

In Arizona for spring training games.
Went with a friend who had been before.

Amazing food!

Our server Alexis and her contagious laugh and top notch service made the experience wonderful!

Our friend had her as their server when they were there before as well.

You are in Phoenix and hungry make Bobby Q's as definite destination !!!

Had dinner here last night! Our servers name was Caleb! What a amazing young man I couldn't believe how knowledgeable and how professional he was. The service was outstanding and the dinner followed that as well kudos to Caleb
Excellent service! Came for lunch on a week day, the ambiance was perfect for a BBQ - not to mention the insanely good mac and cheese!

Not a big fan of BBQ (Sorry!) but the bf is so our friends decided to bring us here while we visited. My bf and friends bf had the Whole Hog Heaven. Being big eaters they were both happy and left full. I had the best southern fried chicken ever! Boneless chicken breast with the crispy outside (not chicken fried steak) it was amazing. Everyone at the table had a bite. Mash was great too. Service was quick. Staff was amazing. My bf wanted donuts (which they give you on the way out) before dinner and they gave them to him, he's spoiled.  Manager came over to chat with us which was really nice. She also gave us another bag of donuts on the way out for later. We will def be returning here for the best bbq ever!
The brisket egg rolls make it a worthy place to stop, bbq bacon cheeseburger also is meal,worthy, hog heaven is well noted but didn't have it. Other items to eat and return again for

Here is my opinion on Bobby Q. Let someone else take you. Why? Because I took some family members there, on my dine. And I learned the hard way that this place is a bit pricey. Four people, some ribs and a few drinks later and I went near $200. Not lots of drinks , either. The ribs though, AWESOME. We all agreed they were near the best. The grilled veggies seemed right off the fire. There was nothing we didn't like. Nothing. Even the coleslaw is special. Truly. Not a good place to treat multiple people to is all.

Nicole, 

Thank you for your assistance for preparing my birthday party. The Staff of BobbyQ's was outstanding last night and provided my guests with a very welcoming environment and monitored the area exceptionally. 

The food of course was excellent and even had to order more which was delivered promptly so nobody went hungry. 

Fantastic work. 

Thank you again, 

DBW
The Mac n Cheese tho... to die for and the service was very pleasant. Best spot for lunch
This is another close go to favorite of ours.  The best BBQ in town.
This place is soookok good! The ribs were sooooooo tender the meat literally just melted in my mouth!!!! And the mini donuts wee bomb too!!!

Funky looking place- huge!  Liked it right away, even from the parking lot.  Friday night when we arrived, crowded and a long wait- about 40 minutes.  We ordered appetizers- the rolled ones with BRISKET in them!  Perfect with a cold Blue Moon beer.  Finally, got a table and a cool waiter who brought us warm cornbread- great start!  We ordered baby back ribs, catfish, fried chicken with baked potato, coleslaw (with pecans!) and, my favorite, the creamy mac & cheese.  Fantastic find.  Only wish we'd had room for the cobbler of the day!
Love this place from the smoke house burger to the watermelon Margarita!  Will definitely be back.
BBQ here is amazing! Our family of 4 (kids are teens) had plenty of food with the Hog Heaven. Baby back ribs are falling off the bone. Brisket and pulled pork were flavorful and tender.

This was our first time eating here and they didn't disappoint. I didn't have their signature pork but I had their jumbo chicken wings and they were delicious. We will definitely be back to try their pork!
Have been to this place 4 times now. Every time I am satisfied because of the generous portions and lets not forget the free, hot, and fresh donuts at the end of your meal! I love this place!
This is our favorite casual restaurant. Easily the best BBQ we've had, period. The beef brisket or baby back ribs are particularly good.

Possibly the best BBQ I've ever had. I recommend their Cajun Shrimp and their platter!! One word: DELICIOUS!!! Not to mention the beer they have on tap... all in all I will be back when I get back in town. I reside in OC or else I'd be there more often.
The best bbq around! My daughter and I fell in love with the brisket. You won't leave disappointed.

on my way home from visiting family in Sedona, I thought it would be a good idea to stop in Phoenix to grab food before we drive back to California. Getting out of the heat without walking into an icebox made the meal very relaxing. My server Justin made sure to help me out with some amazing suggestions as well as made sure I never ran out of water or cornbread. I ended up getting a two meat combo of baby back ribs and some brisket. The brisket shredded easily and I couldn't pick up my ribs by the bone, absolutely delicious.

Visiting Arizona from the East Coast and read about Bobby Q's here on Yelp. We  decided to give it a try and were very glad we did. What a great time and meals we had. Our server "Smitty" was upbeat, he was very attentive to all our needs. The pulled pork and brisket were tender, tasteful, generously portioned and well above expectations. I would definitely recommend.

The Q rolls were absolutely delicious. I am going to make that at home. You cannot go wrong with perfectly smoked brisket wrapped in a tortilla and deep fried to a crisp! The beef brisket was perfectly smoked and moist. 
It is certainly worth visiting while in Phoenix.
Our server Joe transformed our meal from another BBQ joint to a home cooked feast. Do go anywhere else for brisket.

I'll be very honest in saying, "I'm not sure if I should be reviewing this establishment". I say this because I'm not big on Barbecue, I'm not the rib or the brisket eater, so this review is based on the overall opinion of everyone in my party. Let's start with my Southern Fried Chicken, for me it was a bit disappointing, mainly because I didn't realize that it was going to be a boneless chicken breast (I blame myself for failure to pay attention to the menu description), it was very well cooked & seasoned, but just okay. I especially enjoyed the cornbread as did everyone at our table, so I do recommend the cornbread. The grill corn was good, but tasted a little like can corn. The Rib eaters absolutely loved their ribs and the brisket eaters had mixed emotions

Love this place! We were on our way home from Tombstone and read the reviews on this place from Yelp and we had to stop by. I ordered the pulled bbq chicken sandwich with Mac n cheese and it was delicious! John was our server and he was super friendly! He was on it with the refills l! Towards the end of the meal the manager came by and talked to us. I highly recommend this place!
Travis was an excellent server and the food was delicious!!! The atmosphere is really nice and we enjoyed sitting on the patio.

All crappy restaurant owners should take note. Bobby Q is basically a textbook example of how to successfully run a restaurant properly.    

Bobby's claims it was voted the Best BBQ in the US, although I'm not sure of their source? Nevertheless, I'd have a hard time arguing, as it definitely sets the bar extremely high. We've been here several times and have never had a bad meal. In fact, virtually everything we've tried on the menu seems to be done correctly. 

The pulled pork, which is my preferred way to eat BBQ, always manages to impress me with its flavor. For sides, I've had the mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese, which is far superior to that low-grade sludge they try to get away with dishing out at all of these other places in Phoenix. Even their fries are better than you'd expect.

The place is decorated to the point where, if I didn't know any better, I would have wrongfully assumed it was a chain restaurant. But yet, I like that, despite their popularity, they haven't decided to branch out and open up 20 different locations all over the city (and I actually hope they never do for quality and consistency purposes).

I've always wondered if their steaks are equally as good as their BBQ, but I've never wanted to sacrifice the taste of a great pulled pork sandwich in order to find out. And we're always so full after our meals that we've never been able to try some of their desserts. Based on their Yelp pictures, it seems like many people are in the same boat.

But, like all business owners should know, it's the little things that go a long way. The complimentary cornbread you receive before your meal is both unique, yet extremely well done. Oh, and that's not all. On your way out, you also get treated to a little bag of their homemade donuts, which you can often spot being made whenever you first walk in. I've said many times that it's little touches like that keep customers coming back - and it most definitely works. It's not rocket science and I'm amazed that other restaurants have failed to adopt this well-received approach.

Easily one the best BBQ experience in all of Phoenix and a great all-around business!

I was invited to a bday party there. When I got there the bouncer decided that my jeans were to long???... Never heard of that before. This so called dress code seems to be a way to stop certin people from going in. People of color beware! Take your hard earned money somewhere else.

I'm a BBQ whore. I grew up eating pulled pork in North Carolina. 

Move to so cal and for years couldn't find you some barbecue until I found a place called Phils. Which honestly is the best I've had anywhere consistently winning national awards

Upon moving to Phoenix I couldn't wait to try this place all I can say I was highly disappointed. The brisket was dry who pork was soggy the highlight of the meal was the cornbread and it cost me $28 no thanks. This place may have been the bomb years ago but not so much now

Tried Bobby Q's after a long hot day in Phoenix, what a treat! Plenty of parking, friendly staff, and awesome food! From the cornbread and Arnold Palmer I started with and the brisket and beef ribs to finish me off! I was very pleased with everything, we will definitely be back!
Honestly one of the best BBQ places I've ever been. Not only was the food absolutely amazing, but the service was superb! I highly recommend anyone visiting to eat here.

If you're ever cravin' some good ribs, steak, burgers... come down to Bobby Q's! My partner and I went here for date night and we were not disappointed. I ordered the ribs and they were dripping with flavor! My significant other had the burger with bacon (of course I had more than a few bites of his) and we both agreed it was the juiciest burger on the block. The macaroni and baked potato were SO delightful. It was a pretty busy evening for Bobby Q's but they managed very well by tending to their customers in a timely manner. 

Their club opens at 11, we had seen people lining up to go in as we left, so you know it must be poppin'. We haven't came here for the club portion, but let my food go down and sooner than you know it I'll be out on the dance floor. Overall, we had a wonderful night; great atmosphere, awesome service & superb food. We even got little doughnuts as a dessert when we left. We will definitely be coming back! And I can't even wait until we come back because it was that good.

The nicest staff you'll ever meet, great food and real southwest atmosphere!
You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Ribs (full rack), Steak and Cajun Shrimp a must! Start off with the onion block and then enjoy some cornbread as well prior to your entree.
The portions are large and the side dishes (2) come with each entree. So be careful how much you order- maybe one entree and some apps.
Sit inside or outside and use Open Table for no waiting! 

A win win for all the family!!!

I used to eat a lot of barbecue but I haven't had much since I stopped eating pork. The waiter had multiple alternatives for me, including beef ribs which are difficult to find. I decided on the country fried chicken, and was not disappointed. Cocktails were awesome. Each side plus the main meal was delicious and perfected. The wait staff was friendly and helpful, and the ambiance was lovely. I don't live in Arizona, but I would move here just for Bobby Q's!

This may be one of the finest barbecue places I have ever been to.  Not only was the barbecue I had fantastic. The service was outstanding. The food was quick to our table and they topped it off with free beignets for everyone. I truly wish they had this place in utah.

I organized a dinner here for my dragonboat team which consists of about 48 people.  So keeping that in mind, I will continue my review.  

When my group got there, we were served very fast and they took our orders.  Service from the waitresses was GREAT! 
Pros:

One great thing about this place is that they serve limitless CORNBREAD!  For a hungry team, this is amazing, especially before your food gets there.  

Now to the food.  The FOOD is great quality.  I loved the flavor of the ribs and bbq sauce.  The mac-n-cheese wasn't the best, but it was good.  I would say the spare-ribs were better than the beef ribs here.  
What was also nice was that they let us split checks which made it a lot easier for us to pay.  They waitresses also gave us complimentary doughnuts which is awesome.  

CONS:
When I went here, the portions of the meals weren't what we were expecting for the price.  A few of my teammates ordered the two rib meal and they didn't get much food.  We had to ask if there was a mistake because there was such little food for the price.  The manager(?) came and apologized and said they ran out of ribs?  I don't know exactly how valid this excuse is, but whatever.  I think that for an establishment such as this, it should have been a bit more prepared considering we did have reservations.  This is probably the reason why I am not giving them a full 5 stars.  I know the experience might have been different under different conditions.  Hopefully next time, our experience might be a bit better food quantity wise.

Absolutely loved our first time here since it was Bobby McGee's.  Taylor our server was quick and prepared to let us know why the change occurred. Very very impressed with the food. The manager stopped by our table to check on us and seemed very sincere.  Taylor was a superb server, attentive and very friendly. We actually talked about who and why would bring family and friends back asap.

BEST BRISKET IN ARIZONA.  I am a BBQ fanatic and extremely picky. Had the best from Texas to California, and have been let down by Arizona until I found this place. Only been going a year, I have my own Weber Smoky Mountain smoker and rarely eat BBQ out of the house.  This place, I can honestly say, makes better brisket than i am capable of at home no matter what I try.  Brine, inject, mop...nothing seems to hold a candle to Bobby Q.  Have an onion brick, Brisket and Doughnut holes and SMILE!

Solid..YES GO HERE.. 

No 4 stars so quit asking for it...4-5 hard to deal out.  But, hey a (solid) 3 is on your way to the big time!

Great pulled pork.  Excellent brisket...good sausage.  I'm not a real fan of the sausage, however; seems to be smoky but that's just me.  Sides are great (beans, m&c, slaw are all we tried).    

Atmosphere is good.  Very busy with a young to middle age crowd.  Dance floor opens at 8PM on certain nights and that may (or may not) change the demographics.

Bobby McGees was great...this place is doing pretty good too!   But, let's keep this place a secret for now, OK?  

Highly recommended (shhhh, quiet...)  3.75 stars if I could swing it.  Waiters/esses wear no costumes (yet).

The BEST BBQ I've tasted since we moved to Arizona! Pork ribs so tender the meat was falling off the bone, beef ribs so meaty you could make a meal of two unless you eat like me :). Pulled pork and brisket to cry over they are so tender & smokey. My wife said she would happily go back. She had the fried chicken and loved it, though next time gravy on the side. She did try my pork & brisket and loved them too. Bobby Q is a definite BBQ lovers restaurant. Service by Linzy 1980 was quite good she was patient as we made up our minds as to what we wanted and when I explained I had ordered baby backs & beef bones but was served St. Louis and baby backs she promptly went back to the kitchen and brought the beef bones, only having a satisfied customer on her mind. We will be back! Oh yeah the onion ring loaf excellent and one of the three sauces they serve is sure to please your taste buds.

Always a great place to get BBQ. We checked it out after they did catering for a GCU event, GO LOPES! Totally worth it. The food was amazing as usual. I love the taco appetizers and the mini donuts that  you take home. The brisket, pulled pork, bbq chicken, ribs, and kids meals are amazing. Will totally be back. Make sure to use your YELP discount too!

This place is a hidden gem! The staff are SUPER friendly and the food is delicious. I am originally form California, and wish they would have a Bobby Q's in the bay area. The cornbread is mouth watering, and their beer is delicious as are the ribs, mash potatoes, mac n cheese, grilled corn and apple cobbler. There were 4 of us, and we all shared each others food, as there was hearty portions offered. I advise you to do the same, so you can taste different dishes at once. I will definitely return, if I am back in Arizona. Our waitress Victoria was soooo friendly and nice! I absolutely also loved the ambiance and the restaurant is set up so you think you are in the south. LOVED it!

This is one of the best BBQ places in the area, great environment with great patio and nice homey feel. The place is been packed every time I have been so there is usually a bit of a wait and since the bar is a bit on the small side it can be hard to get a drink. 

The drinks a very delicious and there is a pretty good selection of mixed drinks, some wine and a small selection of local, I believe rotating beers. I had a Old Fashioned which was very good, not the best I have ever had but I'm pretty picky. Also a Mile High which was interesting but not sure if I would order again.

Make sure to come with an appetite as with most BBQ places it is going to be a good amount of food. 

The CORN SIDE WAS DELICIOUS!!! 

The rest was very good, I had a steak and some grilled veggies. Delicious.  The group I was with loved their meals as well and very little was left on the plates. 

All in all great place! Give it a try!

back in town for spring training and we had to go back.
Alot of the time when you go back somewhere its never as good as the first time but not here. I ordred the brisket and its the best. The dont hide the meat with a gallon of sauce. they actually dont give you enough sauce. They dont need to because the meat is that good but most sauces are bad and you would actually want them to drence the meat with there sauce. Its hard to find great meat with great sauce. The mac n cheese was the best. good bread. I cant wait to go back to Phx to see family of course :-) This is also the place to be. came on a friday night and it took forever to get a table but the club/bar was jam packed.

Excellent first time meal here . Started off with the Q rolls and they were incredible. Main course was brisket, pulled pork, mc n cheese, garlic mashed potatoes, and cornbread. This is the best brisket I've ever had. Fork tender, juicy and delicious. The Mac and cheese was incredible with a hint of burned cheese in the top and super super creamy cheesey goodness inside. Garlic mashed had just the right amount of garlic. Pulled pork was also tender and delicious. Extra bbq sauce served in small pitchers in the table- spicy and regular. Our server was also excellent- quick, thorough, and professional. All in all a delicious meal and my out of town lunch guests even went back for dinner!! Delish corn bread too!! AND...we got a little bag of cinnamon sugar donuts to take with! Thanks, will def be back again and again.

I just had lunch at Bobby Q's.  The employees were very friendly and prompt.  I had a 2-meat platter with st louis ribs, spicy sausage, mac/cheese and roasted corn.  Everything was delicious, and they accepted the 10% coupon without even looking at it.  I only gave it 4 stars because even with the discount, it was double what the same meal would have cost me at a Texas BBQ place of equal quality. :P

I would give the waiters 3 stars and the hostesses 2 stars ... but the food is too good to complain and rate this place any lower than 5 stars. I LOVE their cornbread and free donuts! It has a cool setup - a little more space would be nice though. The wait is always way too long and I always find myself shoulder to shoulder with other people. You have to squeeze past chairs just to get through and squeeze through people just to get to the hostess stand. Pretty annoying, but the food is worth it.

What a find!  Being Southern, I was skeptical at first about finding good Southern food in Arizona.  We drove up and parked in the adjacent parking lot, and were surprised that the entrance was on the other side of the building!  But the rustic looking building was attractive on the outside, and when we entered we were surprised at how classy looking the inside was.  We were seated earlier than our 7:00 p.m. reservation on Open Table at comfortable booths that had movable banquettes on each side-- booths are sometimes a problem for me due to my size, but problem solved!  We of course had to order the local specialty draft, Bobby-Q's Amber Ale from Sonora Brewing, and we both enjoyed our pints, accompanied by sweet corn bread muffins, which my wife said were made from Jiffy mix, which we both love anyway.  We then selected the onion block, accompanied by a delicious Bobby-Q sauce for dipping, and we could not eat it all and brought about a third of it home.  Lightly battered and delicious.  We then chose to split the combination platter at the recommendation of our super friendly and attentive waiter, Jason, and he was so right because we even took part of that home too.  The one we chose had both of our favorites on it,  baby back ribs for me and fried catfish filet for my wife.  The catfish was perfect and savory, and the ribs fell off of the bones--honestly, I did not use my knife to separate them, just my fork.  For our sides we chose ranch beans, simmered with pork shreds and delish, and pecan cole slaw, which I don't eat but my wife wanted to try.  She liked the slaw, but the chopped pecans were just sprinkled on top and were not as good as those we have in Georgia.  Jason brought us a box for the leftover onion loaf and a rib, along with a short small brown bag, cut off and imprinted with "THANK YOU" on it, containing four little cute fried sugar donuts, a nice touch.  The manager came by near the end of our meal to ask how everything was, and we praised the food and Jason's service.  A beautiful night out and we felt like we were back in the South!
Great atmosphere and great food. The "Perfect Hamburger" was truly perfect and cooked to my specification. Price was $10 and included a side of fries .

I came here for my birthday and this is a spectacular place for the drinks to be inexpensive and potent. my friends chipped in together and we bought a bottle. a woman jumped on top of a bouncer's shoulders and came out with a sparkling cake.
I liked everything but the rude hostess. Curt over the phone and couldn't care less about my question.

This was my first time here, and we waited only 5 minutes without getting attended and when they attended us they felt that they made us wait too long and they took the initiative and gave us a free appetizer, and the food suggestions of the waiter and the manager were great, their service is really good and the food was amazing. Best BBQ I've had in the PHX area.

Best BBQ joint in the valley. The Q-Rolls were fantastic, I almost wish I had just gotten a couple orders of those for my meal. I split the choose two-meats (baby back ribs and beef brisket) and two sides (mac and cheese and corn) with my date which was a great deal and quite delicious.

We had the opportunity to visit Bobby Q's for dinner on our last night of vacation in Phoenix.  It was dark when we headed out and their location put them about 8 miles away from our hotel.  As we headed into the area of town it is in, we began to worry that we had been given bad directions, but sure enough, past the high school here was this crazy, big building housing some of the best bar-b-que I've ever had.  It has a vast parking lot and as noted, is quite large.  Certainly larger than most bar-b-que joints I've been to.  We were greeted promptly and chose to eat in the bar area rather than wait 20 min for a table.  The fact that there was a wait at 7:00 PM on  a Thursday night again says something about how good this place is.  We were seated in a side by side booth near the bar, quite comfortable.  Patrick Buckley was our wait person, and should be teaching hospitality he was so good.  I had the baby back ribs and my wife had the "Smoasted" half chicken.  They started us with their amazing home made corn bread, and the meal came quickly behind.  Portions were good sized and the meal left us happy, happy, happy and waddling back to our hotel.  Although stuffed, we couldn't help ourselves and took an order of peach cobbler to go.  And, if that is not enough, before you leave they hand you bag of little home made sugar donuts they call "Thank Q's".  All of this and a full bar too.  I highly recommend going to Bobby Q's.  Take the drive, make the trip, you won't be disappointed.

Remember Bobby McGee's? Well they changed with the times and now it's Bobby Q's. Crazy. Know what else?  They've done it right!

The building has been renovated to anopen country feel. The patios are awesome with great water features.  The seating is comfortable and the lighting is perfect with the setup. It's all. Well balanced. 

We started with the Q rolls because all the reviews on here said we should. Yep. Yelpers are right. Tasty!

Let me take just a brief moment to tell you about Caleb our waiter. What a great guy!  He gave us a run down of what's what with his cute helpful self. We came late, which can be a problem, and the service and staff were so friendly. 

Ok back to it...

Next was the wedge salad and yummy. Caleb (the rockstar) split it without us even asking.   the chunks of blue cheese and the crispness of the iceberg were awesome. You could hear the couch from the lettuce. The crispy onions on top were a bonus. 

We went with the massive meat platter and three sides. The beef ribs were massive and not stringy at all. As Caleb told us, all meat is cooked 22 hours or something.   The pork was shredded perfect with the right amount of BBQ sauce. The brisket, my favorite was sooo tender. Mmmm meat. 

We had the corn, mac and cheese and beans. I tried them all and felt they were all a great "goes along with" but mostly ate meat. 

What a great dinner out!  Great food, ambiance, and amazing staff.  Caleb thanks for being a great server and hope to have the pleasure of your service again.

We have been here several times love the atmosphere and wait staff is great Chelsea was awesome tonight. Just came in for happy hour and apps. Can't beat the price or service. Thanks see you soon. .....
I love taking the guys at the end of the week to this place. Great food, beer. Good times...

Came to Bobby Q. from word of mouth. Went to Phoenix for Spring Training. Went there on Sunday and got the Family fest (1/2 lb ribs, 1/2 lbs pull pork, 1/2 lb brisket, 1/2 chicken plus 2 sides) for $28.00. This is the best BBQ that i have tasted. The brisket can be cut with a fork and melts in your mouth. The chicken is not dry but moist (even the chicken breast). The one thing i do want to try is a 22-hour smoked prime rib....until next spring training, i will have to wait. Also, mention yelp and get 10% off your bill!!!
This place has amazing BBQ! It's a great atmosphere, they have delicious drinks and great service! You can make a reservation through yelp which made it so easy! I'm so glad we found this gem!

I have got to say a friend brought a new resident last  night to welcome him to Az to your restruaunt. And I was shocked to find out  the way the bouncer treated him. I used to enjoy  Bobby Qs.  It is disappointing  that the bouncer would harass her very well dressed friend.
They got a dress code, a free drink signup, and some good ass drink deals. People seemed pretty cool and the drink girls are super sexy! :) ill be back some time or another.

Outstanding barbecue!  We came with a party of 8 (including 4 crazy teens) and all of us were very pleased with our dinners. Among us we had ribs, pulled pork, grilled salmon, hamburgers and more. Before the meal they brought us these amazing corn bread biscuits, and after the meal they brought these little deep fried cinnamon doughnuts.   Everything was superb. Great atmosphere.  Great service. You can't go wrong.

I was really concerned when we drove up and couldn't smell any BBQ smells. That is always a bad omen. 
Let's break down the good points, first. Very nice staff and clean restaurant. I would roll around naked in their cornbread and ask to be buried with the mac & cheese. The meat preparation of the ribs and the pulled pork was really nice.
However.
The sauce sucks. Both the regular and the spicy are thin and lack flavor. You can taste the ketchup in the sauce and little else. The onion brick was cold and greasy and the shoestring fries were limp and flavorless. This is the first time my husband has been to a bbq place and not basically licked his plate clean. He left over half of his brisket sandwich. Unheard of. 
The meal was pricey and mediocre. This is far from the best bbq.

Bobby Q in Phoenix deserves fifty stars, sixty even. This place is AUTHENTIC and FRESH. The barbecue is REAL and not microwaved. This experience at Bobby Q was the best one that I have had at a restaurant in Phoenix, in years. Taylor, the manager was PHENOMENAL. The absolute, hands down, most personable, nice, friendly, and understanding manager we have ever met. He chatted with us, made sure that we had everything we needed, and then retrieved a box and checked back in on us when we were finished. Our server, Mara, was so sweet, on top of our needs, and super friendly. She told us all about the restaurant and her great experiences with the team. I couldn't have asked for a better dinner to have had on date night with my husband. Keep rocking Bobby Q! And thank you Mara and Taylor. You both were the absolute best!

I went here with my boyfriend. Our waiter was being trained, but he did an excellent job! I got the pulled pork sandwich (minus the bun) with shoestring fries. My boyfriend got the sliced BBQ brisket sandwich with cole slaw. We both really enjoyed the BBQ meat. The BBQ was a very sweet (but not overly sweet), and delicious. The fries were amazing, but my boyfriend said the cole slaw was kind of dry and bland. They serve cornbread before the meal and it's extremely moist and good - wasn't blown away by any means, but it was your standard cornbread.

My boyfriend also ordered the frozen lemonade which was so amazingly good! If you've had the frozen lemonade cups at a ball game or something of the like - it tastes just like that except better! Comes with a sugar rim.

I'd definitely go here again. The only complaint I have is that it is small (they have outdoor seating, but when we went there were tons of bugs - ew!) and LOUD. Our table was also super wobbly. Only complaints though. Also, reasonably priced! My boyfriend and I escaped under $30 (not counting tip).

Ohhhh where do I begin??? The weekend is usually a tough time for my wife and I. We scour Yelp! all day to find the perfect new place to go out to eat on a Saturday night. On this particular Saturday it was my turn to choose the spot. I was in the mood for BBQ, but was some what tired of the usual places on our list. Well then came Bobby Q's! Coming from the Surprise area it was an easy ride down Olive to Black Canyon Hwy. As stated several times already, the place is somewhat hard to spot as it i set back from the road with limited signage, but we made it into the lot on our second pass. It was about 6:30 and we didn't have reservations, but fear not! The wait we were told would only be about 20 minutes. The time came and went however no open table. The greeter apologized for the delay, but offered for us to wait in the VIP lounge for a drink and free onion block appetizer. We no sooner go our drink and the table was ready! Everything was moved over to our table and away were went to enjoy our dinner. The service was as good as it gets, A+! My wife went for the Smoasted Chicken with sides of baked potato, and roasted corn. I opted for the slow roasted beef brisket sandwich, and a side of mac and cheese. Once the server brought over the onion block, and corn bread we wee set. The onion block was fantastic and big enough for up to three people. The corn bread was perhaps the best I was had in all of Arizona! My wife rated her chicken dish an 8 and sides a 8 as well. When all was said and done...she was STUFFED! As for myself, the sandwich was just big enough to satisfy my apatite, and was delivered just as the menu stated! Deeeeelishous! As for the mac & cheese...have you ever had something so good it cold buckle your knees? Yeah, it was THAT good! No matter what you order from the menu, get a side of mac & cheese! As we finished up the owner himself came over to our table to see how our experience went. The OWNER! Not some manager, but the man himself! When all was said and done the bill came to just under $30. I did not order a Alcohol based drink, only Dr. Pepper, but they too looked top notch from those around us who indulged. Bottom line is this place is now my favorite BBQ spot in the valley, and given the chance it will be yours too!

Yum, Yum, Yum.  This was my first time and we made it count.  I ordered the beer collaboration with Thunder Canyon and it was great! From there had some of the Q Balls which were fantastic.  We got to meet the manager and had a great time with our server as well.  Thanks Bobby Q!

Their BBQ is amazing. Tender, juicy, fatty, and tangy all in one bite. We got the sampler plate and tried a little bit of everything: beef ribs, baby back ribs, chicken... Their sides are decent, not impressive but not bad. Very good service overall. They also give you a bag of fresh donuts as desert. :)

This place was AMAZING! Thank you help for pointing us in this places direction. We were late for our reservation (that we made here on Yelp) but we were still immediately seated when we arrived. 

What we had

Q-Rolls: You have to get these. Crispy on the outside, tender flavorful brisket on the inside. Both dipping sauces were great. Literally waited maybe 3 minutes for them to come out. 

Full Baby Back Rib meal with mash potatoes and grilled veggies. My son was freaking out over how tender the ribs were. Falling off the bone. He said both sides we're good too. 

2 Meat Combo with Brisket and St Louis ribs. Everything was juicy. Ribs were falling off the bone. I only needed a fork to eat them. I had the Mac and cheese and the baked potato. I like my Mac and cheese more baked than creamy but the flavor was great. 

Apple cobbler was piping hot. The ice cream was melted in minutes. Not my favorite cobbler. I like mine with more crumble oaty topping but thats just me. 

The dessert donuts at the end we're perfects crispy and soft on the middle. 

Four thumbs up to our server Harlod (per the receipt) but I swore his name was Hal. He was so friendly, informative and quick to refill drinks. He also checked on us frequently. 

If we are ever back in Phoenix we will for sure eat here again. Tons better than any BBQ spot we're tried in San Diego.

The service super friendly. The food ample and delicious. I would have given this place a 4 because I am a California guy and I've been to plenty bbq places, but for what it was in a different state for me it's a 5. The ribs here are quite flavorful. the waitress I had was super friendly, although a little too chatty but I didn't mind. She improvised a cherry Pepsi with grenadine so a pretty resourceful crew and I like that.
Went there this evening and the food was delicious and the waiter was amazing!! Thank you

It's pretty clear from all the reviews, meat loving barbeque aficionados really like Bobby Q's. 

This review is for my fellow vegetarians who for some reason end up here.   Why you say, would a vegetarian even end up here? Well, for one, to keep peace in the family, for the sides, and for my fave salad, a wedge of iceberg lettuce ( I can hear some of your groans, "iceberg lettuce!" "What is she talking about") with house made chunky blue cheese dressing.  This dressing is the best I've ever had -  I usually get a pint or so to take home. The grilled vegies are consistently good as are the baked potatoes and the corn bread.  The mac and cheese is rather average.  Prices are reasonable - portions on the large size.

The little donuts they send you home with are a nice/sweet way to end the meal - but not worth the calories.  

The wait staff are fun, friendly, efficient - the camaraderie has a good feel to it.

Really I'd still say this place is 3 1/2 stars but since you can't do that on yelp, 4 stars it is.  Came back with some girlfriends.  Still not the best BBQ but not bad either.  As tender as the ribs are, they still don't have that great smoky bbq taste within the meat that makes bbq REAL bbq.  We got the hog heaven meal so we had the baby back ribs, st louis, pulled pork and chicken with the potato salad and pecan slaw sides.  THe pecan cole slaw was good.  
Roasted corn side was not quite what I expected as I thought it was just that.  It was roasted some but was more like small slivers of corn on the cob on top of a bunch of corn kernals.  But the sauce was tasty - probably pure butter.
We also got the fish fry special.  The fish I have to say was done pretty well.  It was a crispy batter so it wasn't overly soggy with oil.  The fish (cod) was pretty fresh tasting.
This time the cornbread wasn't as soft which I liked better.
Tried their banana pudding dessert.  It was different than what I was expecting.  The pudding was a lot thicker than I would have liked but still tasty.  The crust though was yummy.  It was a walnut-like crumble.  Very similar tasting to the inside of baklava.
Still have yet to try their peach cobbler.  Will next time.

I got take out what I got was a pulled pork sandwich with potato salad and a order of calamari all of that for one shitty payment of $26 clams the sandwich size is a joke about as small as my pecker might want to rename that sandwich to "a bun" seriously where the hell is the meat? Now whatever pork I managed to find with a search party was in fact tender and has flavor. On to the potato salad I got to say it's good hearty chunks of potato. Finally the calamari ummm pass don't get it if you so tell them "I'll have and order of disappointment please." This was my first time ordering from here and after this letdown it's hard to determine whether or not I'll come back.
I love this place!!!!! Great pricing on Food! Wonderful costumer service and I love the experience I get when I'm there ! The food is amazing !!!!!

I'm from California. There are places in Cali that resturants call their selves the "best" BBQ. I stumbled on this place on Yelp and saw all these reviews. So I gave it a try. I do admit I'm picky with food because I love flavor on my food. And I can say my food was very good! I ordered the stuffed baked potato with brisket and side of Mac n cheese. My waiter later gave me some donuts. I do recommend this place! Don't forget the donuts so good and crispy! 

P.s. my waiter Scott was awesome! :)

Good barbeque.  the steak was not good.  i got prime rib it was all grisly and could not even chew it.  my husband did not care for his steak either.  we also got dessert.  No good either.  death by chocolate was terrible.  cobbler not very good either.  everthing was ice cream.  need to add some variety.
Overall good food the chicken on the other hand needs work it was dry and clumped up in your mouth no matter how much barbecue sauce you put on it the service was good nice atmosphere would recommend

By far, the best barbecue place I have ever been to.  We ordered the Whole Hog Heaven and we're in heaven with each bite.  The Mac and Cheese is excellent, the ST. Louis ribs are to die for and the service is excellent.  Look forward to my next trip to Phoenix so I can eat there.
Visited now a few times.  Great food and really good service.  The brisket is the best.

great bbq.
great service. great food all around.
been back here many times. maybe one of the best bbq ribs in phoenix.

Went to Booby Q this past week while on PHX for business.   The place was packed, yet we were able to get a couple of seats in the bar area.

Our server was relatively new there, but good and kept it lively.  We ordered and the food was out pretty quickly. 

For the price, I found the servings rather small, but very tasteful.  Quality competes with our local "Phil;s BBQ" on San Diego.

At the end, the server took the check and said "let me get you some doughnuts."  We were like...WHAT?  The guy brings back a bag full of cinnamon sugared, hot, fresh doughnuts. They were awesome!!!

They have a doughnut machine behind the hostess stand and truly make fresh doughnuts on the spot!! I would go back, just for the doughnuts.

Yummy! We drove up here since the other place on top of this list (close to the university) was sold out. Worth the drive! Easily the best bbq I've had. Hubby and I shared the 2 rib platter (St.Louis and beef) with 2 sides - cole slaw and roasted corn. Fall-off-the bone meat, tender and moist, smoked but no overwhelming "smoky" taste, delicious corn bread that we asked for more! Our server, Carissa was fantastic. The manager on duty came to each table greeting customers. Top that!

I have been here many times. Bobby Q has been and always will be one of my favorite restaurants. Not only is the food great and the service excellent but it's consistently great. Some restaurants are hit and miss, but not here. 

On my last visit, I ordered the southern fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy and Mac n chz. As a southerner, I was admittedly skeptical about boneless fried chicken but it was delicious.  Usually I get a steak or BBQ, each of which are always delicious.

Went to Bobby Q tonight and really enjoyed it.  My partner and I started with house salads which were very fresh and tasty.  Then we shared the 3 meat sampler dinner and I am glad we shared, the portions are rather large.  Our dinner came with your choice of two sides.  We shared the baby back ribs, pulled pork and brisket; our sides were mac and cheese and beans. The cornbread and the doughnuts at the end were quite enjoyable.   Everything was delicious.  The great thing was that since we told them we were sharing, they split the dinner on two plates so we didn't have to do that at the table.  We decided to only eat half of our dinner so that we could order dessert.  The dessert was good but not anything really special.  We had the apple cobbler.  The menu said peach and I would have enjoyed that more.  It was good.  Overall our evening was very nice.  The service was amazing and the place has nice ambience.  We will definitely be back.

Delicious food, great service and fun ambiance = amazing dining experience. I have frequented Bobby Qs on several occasions for company dinners but had not dined with my husband. Over the weekend , my husband and stopped in and had a fantastic meal. We started with Q rolls, big hit! For entrees, we went with roasted chicken which was some of the best we have ever had and the fried chicken which was crispy but tender. The side dishes were all exceptional and ending the meal with warm mini donuts was a great way to end the meal. We do not live near Bobby Qs but this meal is worth the drive and we can't wait to return.
This place has some great bbq.  We had a large party and they accommodated us on short notice.  The cornbread was spectacular, the bbq was great and the donuts were a nice touch.
Great BBQ. The service is great. It's a little pricey but that is to be expected

I don't usually like to give a review after only having been to a place once but... I have never felt so welcome, so well treated, and so satisfyingly full after one visit!

I have definitely found my new favorite carnivorous dining place. 

My friend Don S. checked in here one day and I asked him if he was clubbing because I had been to the lounge with my cousins before but didn't know much about the restaurant since it had changed from Bobby McGee's back in the day. He laughed! Told me they have an amazing burger! Say what? Bobby Q is a five minute drive from my house! How did I not know this? 

I went last night with my son and let me tell you, one of the most pleasant dining experiences of my life! I ordered the smokehouse burger. It is 50 cents more than the regular burger and probably a hundred times better because it has bacon! Haha. I love my meat still pink in the middle and when I ask for something m.rare I would like it m.rare and preferably closer to the rare side. The chef hooked up my patty perfect! One of the best burger I have ever had! My little boy ordered the mac off the kids menu (love kids menus), and he loved it so much he ordered up a second helping! Sean our waiter was so kind and helpful and playful with the boy. It's so much more enjoyable when the staff is good with kids. Laura, who must have been management, came out to check on us mid meal and was also super sweet. She brought me out a sample of the brisket. Melty and delicious and bursting to the brim with flavor. She also told my son that if he tried the brisket she would bring him desert on the house! How cool is that?!? Of course he tried it, but more importantly he loved it! Then came.... Death by Chocolate! Its like an ice cream sandwich with brownie book ends! And so large that I only let Buddha tackle one part of it. 

I cannot wait to come back and try more off the menu! Oh did I mention that they give you free donuts at the end of your meal? I mean who can eat donuts after this kind of meal! But they are just as tasty the next morning! YUM!

So impressed!

One word "Awesomeness." The food is outstanding. Ribs fall off the bone, brisket so tender it shreds with the lightest touch, pulled chicken equally as tasty. The Mac-n-cheese and corn bread is phenomenal. Nothing but BBQ heaven. Can't wait for a repeat visit.

Love this place ! The Bbq  was amazing this is the second time I've been here we came up from Tucson  and I couldn't wait to come back with more family ! The food is amazing and the service . Thank you for the great food ! We will be back

Brisket was better than average but not true Texas Smoked. Sides were good but not memorable. Manager seemed rushed, distracted. Prolly worked her way up from serving. She'll be effective in another year or 2. Servers and Barkeep were attentive and respectful. Hostess was exactly what is expected.

Upscale leather and wood steakhouse decor, was attractive and comfortable.
My sirloin steak sandwich was best tasting meat I've had in awhile. An unsliced tender and flavorful piece of meat.
The two servers, one a trainee, seemed to be tripping over each other. One dropped a big steak by my arm, then placed a new knife FACING me. Uurrrr, excuse me, that's not right.
Our comfy booth at the edge of the room was near a congregating place for servers, distracting to us diners. Doesn't mgmt notice this.
Young lady mgr asked about our experience, but her cool brusque manner said she wasn't really interested.
For the two of us, a hefty $68 lunch, granted it was a lot of food and was very good!
Just loved the complimentary cinnamon twists which is why we came in there in the first place!  Will pickup a couple of dozen for next breakfast potluck.

5 stars well deserved! Food was excellent. Our server Cameron was very attentive and explain to us the menu since it was our first time here. He recommend the 3 meat combo and everything was delicious! Mashed potatoes are very good and the ribs are the best! If you are a bread lover like me, you will loooveee their corn bread. It was so good I had to ask some more to take home! 
If you are in Phoenix you can't miss it. Go hungry because portions are generous.

On a road trip thru AZ we wanted some BBQ.. of course I got on yelp and found this place so we head in. It's a litter weird find and the parking lot is in the back of the restaurant. You walk in and it doesn't look like a typical BBQ place. Looks more like an upscale fine dining place. We got seated and was greater by the server who had to tell how good the restaurant is and all the awards and everything it's won.. I really don't care let the food do the talking.. I ordered the Texas ribs and they were huge and very good. The biggest down fall of this place is the prices. Seems liken your paying for the big huge fancy restaurant more then u are the food. That being said food was amazing there corn bread was very very good and the whole experience was very good just a little high priced IMO.
Great que.  I have lived in Oklahoma and Texas and Bobby Q is up there with the best of them.

Great Gluten Free choice!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This place is on my Favorites list. Not only do they have amazing BBQ but they have real menu for Gluten Free options even though it includes nearly every item from the regular menu.  Server very knowledgeable and not afraid to go ask kitchen staff questions.  My family sampled almost every BBQ item on the menu and couldn't decide which was best.  And those that get Dairy and tried the Mac & Cheese you all who who posted are right they say it was the best as was the birthday desert i couldn't eat. Thanks anyway.
Amazing bbq spot easily the best bbq in the valley and excellent customer service as well.  I will definitely return

We are from the Midwest and it's difficult to find good BBQ around here.  This is the best!  It is definitely a Midwest style BBQ.  Lots of parking behind the building.  The Hostess was sweet and knowledgable and let me look around the lounge area and told me about the dancing and crowd.  We got seated pretty quickly even though it seemed crowded.  We went on a Sunday about 130pm.  The Server (Dana) was great.  She said she had been there for 8 years.  They bring you corn bread to start.  It was really good and very moist.  We decided to order an appetizer since we hadn't been here before.  We ordered the wings 1/2 & 1/2.  They were both amazing but the BBQ was so good, next time I would order all BBQ.  We ordered the Half Hog platter to share.  It was the Sunday feature so it was only $31.99.  It came with ribs, brisket, chicken and pulled pork.  It was all wonderful!!  It was a lot of food.  It said it feeds 2-4 people.  It is definitely enough for 4 people.  It also comes with choice of 2 sides.  We got the mac & cheese and shoe string fries.  The mac & cheese was so creamy and delicious!  The fries were good too.  The only negative I have to say is that they serve Pepsi products.  We will be going back a couple times per month.  And I might go one night to try the Salsa dancing.

Shay was a wonderful server. She was very nice and took really good care of us. The pulled pork, brisket and baked potatoes was delicious. We really enjoyed the home beer and the Q-rolls appetizers.   The donuts at the end of the meal were a great touch to the end of the meal. By the way, the manager is also on top of everything making sure everyone is satisfied with the restaurant!

Made the trip up the 17 to visit Bobby Q last night. I love me some good bbq, and had heard good things about Bobby Q, so it was time to give it a try. It being a summer Tuesday night the parking lot was busy, but not packed and we were seated right away. The restaurant itself was doing a good business. I enjoyed the interior. It was one of the most, dare I say, upscale bbq places I've frequented, though it's not upscale at all. 

Our server came by quickly and introduced herself. She asked if we had ever been there before and when we said no she got excited and told us all about the place. We each ordered a beer and decided what to order. We settled on the Whole Hog Heaven Feast to get a sample of a few things. Our Whole Hog included St. Louis & Baby Back Ribs along with brisket and sausage. For our sides we went with the ranch beans, corn, and mac n cheese. We weren't able to polish off the whole thing, but we came close. 

I must say that these were some of the best ribs I've had in a long time! They were perfectly cooked, easy to remove from the bone, but not fall off the bone, and amazingly the pork stayed together. I slightly preferred the baby backs. I wasn't as big of a fan of the brisket, but then again I am generally not a fan of brisket. To me, the best bbq is pork. The sausage was good, but I wouldn't go and order it as my dish. We got some of their spicy bbq sauce on the side and thought it had a good flavor. You could feel the heat, but it wasn't hot or overpowering and didn't linger. 

Of the sides we agreed the mac n cheese was the winner, though the beans were flavorful as well. The mac n cheese is certainly cheesy! Corn is corn. 

I know I really liked this place because as I was eating I swung my legs like a little kid who can't touch the ground with their feet. Signs of a happy camper. 

We are gluttons for punishment so we got some apple cobbler for dessert. It was good, but not memorable. Overall, the service here was wonderful and everyone made sure we were taken care of. We will definitely be back!

Stopped at Bobby Q on the way to the airport from Sedona based on the Yelp reviews.  Once again, I was not let down.  It was a busy Sunday afternoon, but the service was great.  Hostess was friendly, food served efficiently and the waitress was great.  The interior is quite spacious and nice.

The prices are reasonable for the generous portions.  We had a sampler and everything was good.  Not great, but really good.  Overall I left happy.  If you are in the area and in the mood for barbecue, I don't think you can go wrong at Bobby Q.

amazing. every time. this review isn't even necessary. I'm just writing it anyways to add another five star review to the most epic bbq place in Arizona. I will never go anywhere else, I've been to six other "amazing" "award winning" bbq places in Phoenix and they don't hold a candle to Bobby Q. excellent staff!!! perfect food!!! love the atmosphere!! awesome drinks!!
What more do you want? History? Been at that location for I don't know how long. Atmosphere? 1st rate of service? Nice people? Fun? Oh of course fantastic food!

My wife and I had heard about this place from a friend. In the past, we have always relied on ourselves to barbecue at home as Phoenix sucks when it comes to bbq restaurants. All I can say is WOW! We arrived early on a Saturday to avoid the crowds and were seated as soon as we walked in. Our server, Hal (Harold), explained the menu, answered all of our questions and was very attentive throughout our meal. We were very impressed with everything from start to finish and will definitely be back. There are a lot of awesome pictures of the Bobby Q's plates on yelp, and it all looks so good. Also noticed a great sense of teamwork and pride by the entire staff. That means the management is doing their job and doing it well!
Simple bar atmosphere at night (pretty pricey). As for lunch/dinner - Good service. Amazing food. Perfect house beer. I've been here a million times and have never been disappointed.

This is my favorite bbq place in town! I've never had a bad experience here. The service is always great and the food is just out of this world. Even the lemonade - the first time I ordered it, I thought they misheard me and thought I ordered a cocktail because of the sugar rim, but no. It's just delicious homemade lemonade, the best I've ever had. My favorite part is the fresh, hot, homemade donut holes they give you for free at the end of the meal - So delicious!

The husband and I were on our way to Sedona the night of 3-3-2016 and decided to stop in this metropolis for food. Did a yelp and this restaurant popped up with very good ratings.  The place was packed and we had to wait about 25 mins, this was a good sign. Our server Michael was amazing, personable, warm, friendly and very helpful with our ordering and everything else.  We told Michael we were not going to have a fridge in our hotel room, so did not want leftovers.  He suggested we share a plate since the portions are large.  We ordered the beef ribs with mac and cheese and bar b q beans and an extra side of mac and cheese.  The mac n cheese was generous and creamy and cheesy, there was a cheddar flavor in there that just made you want to sing. The bar b q beans was so flavorful and plentiful and the beef ribs were smoky and tender and the bar b q sauce was to die for.    Renie came by as we were eating to make sure we were happy with our meal.  Nice classy touch, we were emphatic fans by then.  She also told us to save room for the complimentary fresh doughnuts to be delivered at the end of our meal.  Wow!  And they did not disappoint.  The doughnuts where so hot we had to be careful, this should be the ONLY way doughnuts ought to be served. Do not walk, run to this place, you will not be disappointed.

The most moist and tender BBQ I have ever eaten.  They smoke for 18-24 hours and the ribs and the meats were excellent.  Also ate their award winning Macaroni and Cheese which was the best.  Cornbread is also served along with the meal making a great dinner.  Next time in Phoenix, I will definitely go back.

YUM!!! I would recommend this place if you are in the Phoenix area. My co-worker and I heard nothing but good things about it, so we decided to check it out.

Atmosphere: The exterior is quite deceiving. It looks like an old, big shack. The interior is gigantic and cozy. It is clean and organized. There's a pretty bar area, a doughnut station, and lots of tables. They have a separate area with another bar that I think is used for private parties or probably weekend nights. There were some cool decorations on the walls all over the place.

Service: It was great!!! Our server was so knowledgeable. She was friendly and personable, and she had fantastic, flawless makeup! Lol. A manager came by our table to see how we were doing during our meal. It added a nice touch knowing that they cared.

Food: Delicious! Cornbread? Yes! I ordered the grilled shrimp with macaroni and corn. The shrimp was cooked to perfection! And the seasoning was great. It was also great on the corn. I probably could've just eaten corn as a full meal and been happy. Hehehe. The macaroni was delicious, but it was as good as my mother-in-law's. Lol. My co- worker really enjoyed her meal - pulled pork and coleslaw. We split a dessert - the mud pie, and it was good, but we were hoping it'd be on par with the rest of the food. It wasn't, but it didn't take away from the meal. The best was probably the doughnuts!!! They give out free mini doughnuts. They are fresh and sooo wonderful!!! Don't forget them on your way out!

They have gluten free barbecue that is loved by the whole family! We always get take-out so the little kids in the family can play when they are done.  Although we did eat at the restaurant a few times, they make fresh donuts that are not celiac safe.  I am sure they are amazing but I have to usher my son out before he cries from not getting a donut. The non-celiacs in the family loved the donuts just as much as the meal.

The staff is friendly and can answer questions about food ingredients which is greatly appreciated!

Always a great BBQ at BobbyQ.   The brisket is so delicious - cannot wait to return!   Our group tried the ribs, pulled pork and brisket and we were one happy bunch!   Staff is friendly and efficient.  Will return again and again.  Love sitting outside in the winter!

Ok I have to start off that I was initially going to give Bobby Q 3 stars until my wife filled out a Review and was responded promptly by the manager offering his apologies and a quick resolution. I was very impressed and changed my review to a 4. 

Ill start off with the decor of the restaurant. I really liked it and felt welcomed. It felt like a more upscale BBQ joint. 

We first ordered the Q rolls. These were simply amazing! They are brisket wrapped in tortilla then deep fried and accompanied by BBQ sauce and a chipotle mayo. 

We also got homemade corn bread while we waited for our entrée
. 
We then had a 3 meat combo.  We choose pork, brisket, and sausage. When it came to the actual BBQ I thought it was good, but not blown away great. I thought the sausage was over smoked and I'm not a fan of chopped brisket. I like my brisket cut into long pieces. The pulled pork was solid but again nothing blew me away.  I liked the man n cheese but honestly thought the garlic mash pataoes were a lil tasteless though. I added a lot of pepper to give them some taste. 

Overall Bobby's was a great place to eat. The service was outstanding, our server was Shay. The Q rolls were amazing and the food was solid. I really liked the personal customer service after my wife's review. So the only thing keeping me from a 5 star rating is the actual BBQ. I will give it another chance and would like to try the ribs this time.

My boyfriend and I were in town visiting and we couldn't resist trying Bobby Q. We came in and got sat quickly even though they were very busy, the service was wonderful and drinks were delicious! We got the Pineapple drink that's served in an actual pineapple (because why not). The food, we got "The Whole Hog", and boy was it delicious, my boyfriends favorite was the beef brisket and mine was the baby back ribs. WOW.

Good stuff, I came here yesterday for the first time in a long time.  I used to go to the club here years ago and it was always a good time.  However, I just came in for lunch and ordered a BBQ chicken sandwich which was about $10.  I got a side of spicy BBQ to go with it and man was it awesome.  Service was great, atmosphere is high end for the area with a dark modern look.  I will probably going back but after drink and a tip lunch ran me about $16.

So as a last meal in az this was pretty epic! Phenomenal service-I was checked on by several people, the food came out seriously fast. Best of all tony gave me good recommendations and made sure my meal was epic. I'm sorry to report he succeeded.

The food was fabulous. I got the 3 meat combo and of that the baby back ribs were my favorite. The chicken was fantastic and the beef brisket was great but hats off to anyone that can cook a pig that good! The grilled veggies were tastie and made me feel better about eating here. The beans were also great.

The sauces were also very tasty. I highly recommend the spicy to anyone who wants a zip to their sauce. All in all a great last meal in AZ before going back to Cali

Not only was the service amazing, but so is the food. Ribs were fall off the bone, cornbread was so soooft, and the free donuts were amazing crispy goodness. The drinks also tasted like top of the line stuff.

From start to finish everything was superb (Q-rolls, cornbread, meat combo, apple cobbler and that complimentary mini donuts to go!). This is one of the few restaurants that I have dined in where the manager checks on the customers. Thanks for the recommendations and good service, Chelsea!

Great vibes.  Did not disappoint.  Great BBQ Joint atmosphere.  Fresh mini donuts up front, open rotisserie grill in the and the ribs were all fall off the bone.

Gotta get "the Whole Hog".  Choice of 4 different meats and three solids.  Feeds 3-4.  All that for $50.  Great value for awesome food.  Per my 14 yr old son (the boy loves his ribs), this the the "best ribs I have ever had".

I'm not crazy about BBQ so my review might be slightly biased. 

I got brisket because it seemed to be the most crazed about meat. I could see why people love it but it was just decent to me. Very tender but typical BBQ flavor. 

Mac and cheese tasted like what I've had at other BBQ restaurants but a bit better. Same with the corn bread. 

I got it for take-out and they were extremely quick so that was much appreciated!

Here for the late night club and dancing. It's definitely a fun late night spot where cover is $15 per person. There are 2 different dance floors with DJ's. One is hip hop and the other is Latin. It's pretty crowded but fun. It must be noted that on the patio, they have "Taqueria El Pariente" that sells the Best "carne asada tacos" in town for just $3.

Oh man this place is amazing! My dad treated my family to dinner here for my birthday!!! I absolutely loved it!!! The service the food everything was so wonderful! This will be my new spot for bbq it's so delicious! We had the whole hog heaven oh man that's the best meal ever! Yum!!!

What can I possibly have to say about a place with 1000+ reviews and a 4.5 star rating? Plenty. First of all,  if you're not from the area (like myself) this place may seem deceptive. Its in a bit of a lonely area and can be hard to miss if you're not sure what you're looking for. But once you make it, you will not be disappointed. This place definitely gets 5 stars for its service; everyone from the host, the bartenders, our server and even the manager were super friendly! We were seated very fast, despite being initially told we'd have an 1 hour plus wait (not complaining). Now, let me tell you about the food: AMAZING and food porn worthy! I had the prime rib and BBQ chicken combo with roasted corn, mac and cheese and a baked potato *drool* The prime rib was sooo tender and had a nice smokey taste to it (I wish I had the 14 oz instead of the 8oz). The bbq chicken was great. The roasted corn and mac and cheese, wow. Even our complimentary corn bread was mouthgasmic. Extra stars for the food coming out at lightning speed. OH, we'll be back FOR SURE.
Seriously the best bbq ever.  Come here from las Vegas just to eat! !!! It's the bomb can't go wrong with anything off the menu

First time visit-read other reviews and decided to swing by. Dean our server recommended "The Whole Hog" and suggested the sides. He was spot on with his recommendations and his service and personality made our meal "wicked good". 

If you want good BBQ, put this place on your list and ask for Dean, he will take you to the promise land.

Baby back ribs were tasty, coleslaw was crunchy but not too soggy, mac and cheese was creamy and flavorful. Girlfriend's "Perfect Burger" was okay, but the fries were very good. The outdoor seating area was cool, and our server was friendly. Pricing was fair. I'd say give it a try!

I am going to begin this by saying this may be the best BBQ I have EVER eaten.  No joke.  I had the smoked beef brisket and my two sides were mac and cheese, and shoestring fries.  They even had sweet iced tea which for me is a must for any respectable BBQ restaurant, the sweet tea was also great.

The brisket was cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing, you could tell it was cooked properly over the hickory wood.  I've had Texas style brisket at about a dozen popular places in Houston and only one small place called Gatlin's comes close to the brisket at Bobby-Q.  The bbq sauce also had a good flavor, the mac was very cheesy and the fries were perfect for dipping in the original bbq sauce.  What else can I say about this place?...it was great.  I almost went here two nights in a row during my trip to Phoenix, went to Pizza Bianco on the second night and was not impressed.  I wish I would have gone to Bobby-Q the second night, I would have tried the sliced BBQ pork.
Talk about good ribs or bbq oh my they smoke there meat it tasts so delishious must give it a stop in try once you will be hooked
The baby back ribs are amazing! Fall right off the bone. If I had one wish it would be they build another location in Scottsdale. The pulled pork is also amazing!

OH Wowza polowza! How good was the combo platter! OMG! The baby back ribs were falling of the bone. And may I say the best corn bread all of us ever and I mean ever tasted. And our server Ashlen deserves a raise if she hasn't gotten one recently. She was such a sweetheart and always checking on us to see if we needed anything else. The wings were delicious as well. Thank you yelp   
People for voting this place with high honors. Already bought gift cards. And we will be regulars. The Mac and cheese is the bomb too! Oh so good!!!!!
Very good food and service. Nice bar area with TV available.
We split the 2 meat combo. Both the brisket and baby back ribs were flavorful and tender. The cornbread is delicious snd the side of corn was nice and smokey. Great food!

I was not impressed with this place I went in with my daughter and ordered some baby back ribs they were a bit fatty the flavor of the sauce was good but the meat in my opinion was just not worth the price maybe I just got a bad batch I don't know

Sometimes I am annoyed with this Yelp rating system having only full stars. I want to give 3.5 stars. 
In any case, Bobby Q is a good BBQ place to go to in phx. Other than being in such a random location, the food is what you'd expect. I'm coming all the way from Gilbert and honestly there is one other BBQ spot in Gilbert, I'd also recommend.
I personally enjoy the ribs and fries at Bobby Q's though. I'm not a big fan of their pulled pork but that may just be me. I did like their mac and cheese and of course their check-in special! The little donuts at the end are also a nice treat.
The reason I am not giving them 4 stars is because my friend seemed to have gotten food poisoning after eating here. I am sure they keep things clean, but somehow something got through.
Again though, I'd still recommend this BBQ joint. Not too shabby, but not really WOW either.

If you find yourself in the Phoenix area then Bobby-Q is your BBQ stop! This was my first experience here, but my co-workers ate here 3 out of the 4 nights we were in town! This is not an expensive joint by any means, but it is a "nicer" place than your road side BBQ stand, even nicer than the outer appearance of the building suggests. This building also hosts a trendy night club, which we did not visit.
The BBQ here was on point for sure! Everything from the brisket to the pulled pork and even the BBQ egg roll appetizer thingy's (thingy is the technical name) were all tasty and gone before they knew what happened!
On top of that the staff and facility were all top notch, helpful and cleanly!
Mac & cheese was to die for! I thought their chicken was try. I loved their drinks! And the servers were nice. I can go back :-)

Decided to try the baby back ribs again...and, this time they were delicious!  Maybe the last time we were there, the cook put a little too much rub on them.  But, this time, they were like I always remembered.  Everything was delicious!

Also, we had the BBQ chicken, and it's so amazingly juicy and flavorful.  Definitely the best BBQ chicken I've ever had.

Just felt like doing a follow-up, since I'd had an issue with the ribs before.  Glad to know it was just a one-off.

Brisket had no smoke flavor, was overcooked and soggy.  Vegetables were ok, dessert was the best part.  To-go dept, of which if they have a dedicated person, did not think to include anything to eat with, or napkins.   Worst BBQ on record.
WOW! This is definitely an authentic BBQ restaurant. Also, excellent service and nice atmosphere. Portions are generous.
Great service, great food, great time at Bobby Q! We started with the Q rolls, cornbread then went with the baby backs and brisket...everything was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant.

How the mighty have fallen...  I used to look forward to visiting this place - great food, good ambience.  After this last visit, my family and I are not going back.  I don't feel wanted as a customer because of my food allergies.  

I have gluten sensitivity and BBQ restaurants tend to be safer than most.  I'm a big fan of ribs.  Give me ribs, mashed potatoes & ice tea - and I'm content.  No special modifications required.  

Their gluten free menu looked like a child had done it.  It was very negative and I don't think it was accurate.  The waitress asked us if we wanted cornbread moments after she had brought us the gluten free menus, and brought us doughnuts at the end of our meal.  I've been there in the past and received excellent service, to the point where I was thinking of scheduling a banquet there.  The last two times, the service has been so meh,  I'd rather take my money elsewhere.

Extremely surprised with this place! To be honest I didn't think I'd enjoy it as much as I did... Baby back ribs where oh so delicious! I'd absolutely recommend them 100%   - Also a must try is the tri-tip OMG to die for!!!! Mac & Cheese was also very flavorful! Its fathers day & the wait time was alittle over an hour Uuggghhhh but it was oh so worth it!

Great place! Food was amazing and the drinks were worth the price. Took my mom and relatives for her birthday, and everyone enjoyed the atmosphere at Bobby Qs. Plus my my parents remember the original restaurant from many years ago in San Bernardino CA. Great restaurant !!! Will be back!
Love this place! Everything I've had has been absolutely delicious! Go see Sawyer she is an awesome server!! :) and dont forget to get the Mac n cheese! Best I've ever had!!!

Review 5/10 for the 10 bookmarked businesses to review before the end of 2016! From Meagan B.'s thread: https://www.yelp.com/topic/phoenix-yelp-phoenixs-10-firsts-of-2016
