Bobby Q's was on our way back from our weekend trip up north and it was around lunchtime so we figured we'd get something from there to go so we could eat it back at home. The menu was easy to browse through online. I called and placed an order for the three meat combo which would be ready in 15 minutes.

There are two areas in this restaurant. The front is for dining in while there is a separate back parking lot and take out entrance. Service at the counter was friendly and they even offered me a drink while my order was being put together. 

The smell of BBQ in the car was mouth watering as we drove back home. I ordered the combo with baby back ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. For sides I had the roasted corn and coleslaw. The meal also included 2 pieces of cornbread and they gave me some extra BBQ sauce.

All the meats were very tender with smoky flavor. My favorite of the three was probably the pulled pork, followed by the baby back ribs. The brisket was good and they included fatty and lean pieces, but the memory of the superb brisket from Little Miss BBQ still lingers in my memory as one of the best I've had.

The sides were excellent. The roasted corn also had some smoked flavor and the coleslaw was crisp, tangy and refreshing.

Overall it was a good meal and I do like how they have more convenient hours and better atmosphere than Little Miss BBQ. I will be back for more BBQ!

I stopped in for lunch during the work week. It is located not too far from my employer; however, I had never visited previously. Having lived in Atlanta for 12 years I enjoy barbecue, but have not found too many places in Phoenix that it well. My initial experience with Bobby Q was via catering at a work function. It was very good, especially for catered food and I added it to my mental list of places to try, but continually forgot to actually go. A few work friends were having a happy hour get-together and again I passed it up. Finally I went for lunch and was suddenly said that I have missed prior opportunities to go. 

I sat at a table in the bar area and the service was good. I had the sweet tea, which is a requisite for any good barbecue meal. The menu had several good looking items, but I went with the pulled chicken sandwich and a side of mac & cheese. The sandwich was excellent and I would put it right at the top of the Phoenix barbecue list. While the sandwich was great, the mac & cheese was phenomenal and I would rate it as the second best I have ever tried. I envisioned myself as David Blaine shackled into a phone booth filled with this mac & cheese and I had to eat my way out to survive. I win that battle my friend. I win that battle 9 times out of 10. And the doughnut things on the way out? Yes, please!

I will most definitely be back. I may go with the chicken again or try another tasty item from the menu, but whatever I get it will come with a side of mac & cheese.
Awesome BBQ, good ambiance and great service. One of the best happy hours also... Love this place.

Best BBQ I have had in my life. Took my wife and four kids there and all of us loved it! Great service and amazing food. Will be back!!!

Came back and it was just as good! Our waitress Jessica was amazing. Brought 2 friends and they thought the same!

I am mixed on this one as a "go to" place for an every time college-parent-visiting-out-of-towner. We enjoyed the experience, but probably once tried once satisfied. This is your traditional, but unique, big-shack BBQ atmosphere with a donut twist. As you walk up, the smells are incredible and you are greeted by very friendly people. I ordered the 3 sampler of pork, brisket and sausage. The sausage was smoked to perfection - very good. The others seemed on par with any other good bbq sampling - not disappointed but not blown away. Certainly worth a four-star, but not tickled plenty as a 5 star - bbq rarely is. The problem is we ate a bunch, and It stays with you for a while. Advice is start small and come back often if you love bbq. The parting sugar donuts are a great benefit, but made with peanut oil so allergies beware. Too heavy to be a go-to spot every time.

I came year last August (late review...sorry) and I was SUPER impressed! The ambiance was much different from most BBQ joints. It was a bit on the sleek side which I liked very much. My hubby & I opted for the catfish po boy...(at a BBQ joint..go figure!) and that sucker was GOOD! I liked at the end of the meal they give you these wonderful little fresh donuts...Ahhh...be still my beating heart...When I go back to Phoenix, I'll be hitting up this place! One more thing... Location is a bit awkward. If You're headed to this restaurant & if it feels like you're lost.. You're not...it's in somewhat of a residential area.

The service was excellent, very attentive, and offered suggestions.  The food was delicious, I had chicken and my friend had ribs.  Both meals were prepared perfectly.

The atmosphere is really friendly and laid back.

Will definitely comeback on my next visit.
best BBQ ever!! this place is awesome, we are so glad one is opening near us in Mesa!!

After 1100+ reviews this is merely me plugging and showing appreciation for this amazing BBQ restaurant.
I went in knowing exactly what I wanted and knowing that Friday will be very busy with a long wait.  I made a reservation on OpenTable which helped.
My suggestion is to stick to the ribs - or brisket if that's your BBQ of choice - but I highly recommend the full rack of ribs.  I'm sure the steaks and burgers are good, but if you want a steak you go to Dominick's; if you want a burger you go to In N Out; if you want ribs you go to this place.
They huge and tasty and come with 2 sides and they'll give you as much sauce as you want. 
Will we be back? Of course.

What can I say? 4.5 stars and over 1600 reviews. You figure it out, then go eat there. 

I recommend the whole hog heaven, share with another and STILL have leftovers to take home. 

Also, the fact that they give you freshly made donuts at the end of your meal...well, that just seals the deal.
Worst bbq in the state, even messed up simple lemonade.. tried them twice to be sure, will never go back again!!
Amazing food. The mac and cheese was out of this world and the grilled shrimp were great. I don't even like ribs very much, but I tried my boyfriend's and they were so tasty.

Very worth the drive from where ever you are, this is probably the best BQQ restaurant in the valley. Brisket was tender and the Mac and cheese complemented the dish very well. There was a little bit of a wait but that comes expedited for such a popular place. Have family/friends in town definitely bring them here.
Best BBQ EVER!!! Everything was GREAT! Our waitress was Anne & she was cheerful & friendly! Will definitely recommend it to EVERYONE!
Pretty good as usual. If you love bbq, this is where you go. We go here quite a lot. Oh and the Mac and cheese, to die for. Q-rolls are also a great option. I love that chipotle ranch they have.

Service: nice and very accommodating. This place is busy but they're organized. 

Food: so much to choose from. I got smoked brisket, Mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes. We started with Q rolls too. Great!! Brisket is tender. Get the spicy bbq sauce!

Environment/ambiance: very busy. We sat outside. It was so nice. It's pretty loud because it's so busy. 

Parking: lot, spacious.
I miss you everyday Bobby Q. I wish you were in riverside. Arizona is so far away but anytime I'm there you're my first stop. Never change.

So I just recently moved to Phoenix from Indy and after a day of shopping a friend suggested that we go get some BBQ, I'm not one that usually seeks out BBQ so I gave her a meh, but went along anyway and I'm glad I did.

If I were a bride at the altar and I was told I could never have Bobby Q ever again if I married the man in front of him I'd have to think twice before saying those vows as I'd question the sanity and ill intent of the Benedict Arnold standing before me. In short THIS PLACE IS FRIGGEN AWESOME!!! 

I was able to get a 3 meat platter for $25.00 and stingy is not something that resides in this place's vocabulary. I got more on one plate than I could for $25.00 at the grocery store and when they sat the behemoth of a plate before me I was full before I took a bite. The meat slides off the bone so you will need a fork...and a bib...and a belt extender. The flavor was fantastic from the sauce, to the meat, to the macaroni, to the corn bread, to the napkins, and to the free doughnuts after. The staff is super quick and friendly! I took food home and was really sad when the last of it was gone... So here I am here again on my second of what will be a lifetime of trips leaving a review as I wait to be seated, question is why are you still reading this and not here yet?  :-)

I change my previous review of this plae. I went back against my wishes and despite my predesposition enjoyed everything tremendously. I still have my qualms with my previous experience with the lounge but have become a big fan of the restuarant!

The food was well done, and the wait staff was tremendously impressive.
I really like this place now I know it's one of the top 100 restaurants on Yelp brisket and pulled pork are really good the q rolls are a must if you come here.
Not as good as I hoped it would be or the reviews stated. I had brisket it was ok, beans not spectacular and coleslaw. Very friendly staff maybe just an off night. Will try again.

I lived in Australia for a year and Texas for a year so I like to think I know what good BBQ tastes like. This place definitely has it, and excellent service on top of it. The St. Louis ribs were perfectly tender and delicious, and the meat easily came off the bone. The cornbread was great too--I heard some ladies at the table next to me saying they really wanted more, and I would have too if I hadn't already stuffed myself to the point where I couldn't eat another bite. Our server Joey was very attentive and quick and he and the manager came by multiple times to check in on us, bring us wipes even though we hadn't asked for them (but we would definitely need them later on), ask us how the food tasted, and thank us for coming. In the end, they gave us some free donuts in a bag (because honestly, I could not take another bite of food). Overall really great lunch--I can see why they were rated one of the top 30 BBQ places in the country on Open Table!

Husband and I came here for a date night and we had such an amazing server. I usually write down their names if the service is really great or is really bad but I didn't this time. I wish I would of! This server was on point and recommended some of the best dishes! We had lots of BBQ that was delicious. The ribs definitely were the best! One of my favorite reasons for coming to Bobby qs is the donuts for dessert.

FANTASTIC! Not just the food either. Service was impeccable. The bartender, Jo, took care of us at a booth in the bar during happy hour and was superb. Not only was she incredibly friendly her knowledge of their menu was impressive!

While we sat inside due to the heat they do have a fantastic patio that I'm sure fills up quick during the patio friendly time of year. Inside there is a bar area which includes a few booths as well as a large open area restaurant. 

We shared their brisket quesadilla off of the HH menu. It was very large and quite tasty. Brisket was very tender. They make their own guacamole which is served along side the quesadillla along with salsa and a bbq sour cream.

I had the (award winning) Smokehouse burger and was not disappointed. It was very juicy and had great flavor to it. I'm not usually a fan of barbecue sauce on my burgers but this burger is definitely the exception! I chose the mac and cheese of my side and let me tell you, the best I've ever had! Don't tell my grandma I said that!  I'm talkin stick to your ribs good. I'm drooling right now just thinking about it.

They also give you fresh baked donuts in your way out as a thank you. Warm and delicious, I will definitely be back.

Went there to celebrate my sisters birthday, everything was great. The service was fast we sat outside with the heaters so we didn't freeze too bad seeing as it's December. Can't really complain much about anything to be honest it was fun with the two dance floors one side is hip hop the other is latin music!

The taste of the 8 oz sirloin I got here earned the 5. I got a side of their spicy bbq sauce (which it wasn't) to go along with it. 

Started the meal with the Cajun shrimp which was grilled jumbo shrimp in a beer sauce...delicious. 

Back to the steak. I got it with grilled veggies. The steak was probably the most delicious flavor I've ever had. Their grill has some amazing flavor on it. This piece of meat was cooked to perfection, and didn't need a thing. 

I had 2 glasses of Mondavi Cabernet, and with everything it was under $50. 

They ask you if you want dessert, and if you say no they give you a little bag of little sugary doughnuts.
I had high expectations for this place and they exceeded it in every way! The decor of the restaurant is very inviting, but the highlight was the BBQ!
Best BBQ in Arizona, and best customer service. They really do go above and beyond to provide hospitality, and delicious fresh quality food. Wherever you are in Arizona it's worth the drive!!!

This place was so good! We ordered the dish that came with a combo of three meats and three side dishes. The meats we got were beef ribs, st.louis ribs, and sausage. I love beef ribs so much and restaurants don't always have them. Not only do they have beef ribs they are to die for. They are the best I've had in my life! They were incredibly tender and flavorful. The st.louis ribs were also super tender and flavorful. The sausage was good but, we probably should have got more ribs because those ribs are just so awesome. The atmosphere is very nice. The staff was very attentive and nice. Oh and the best part is that it is cheap. Our bill came out to like 50 bucks which is very good because I'm used to spending at least 70 at any BBQ restaurant.

Aleena was a fantastic server!  If this review were specifically for her, it would be a 5!  We were a party of 7 and she took really good care of us.  The atmosphere is nice, clean and comfortable.  The food was a disappointment considering the prices however.  Not a lot of flavor (has seasoning gone out of style?) and frankly the presentation was lacking as well.  So I waffled between a 3 and a 4 overall. Am going with a 4 only because our service was great.
Food good wait staff arrogant and in a hurry.  Had a drink that was in a dirty glass. They apologized went to bar and poured it in another glass and brought back.  Weird.  Noisy

First time here. I came with my son & didn't know what to expect. Being that it's location is right off the I-17 we'd pass Bobby Q's many times & often thought it was a dive due to its location. We were pleasantly surprised as we walked in & were greeted by two friendly hostesses & a nice ambiance. Both my son & I were dressed casually. I looked around and noticed some guests were dressed up, while others were casual like us. I immediately felt comfortable.  It was a busy Sunday about 7:30pm. I requested a booth as I wanted to enjoy mother/son conversation over a nice dinner. The restaurant's interior is a rustic western theme with a bar in the middle, dining patio in front & separate dancing lounge connected to the back.  Everything was very clean and orderly like a well oiled machine. Our server was professional, friendly and quick. My son ordered the hamburger with cheddar cheese from the regular menu which came with shoestring fries & I ordered the Rib Eye with roasted corn and mashed potatoes. Both of our meals were prepared according to our liking and tasted sensational! Prior to our entrees, the server brought out 2 warm pieces of round cornbread with butter. It was delicious! We wish we would have saved room for the banana cream pie, next time for sure!  Towards the end of our dinner the manager came to ask how our dining experience was, it's nice to know this business cares about their guests!  One side note, the complimentary mini donuts that are given with your bill are awesome.  I highly recommend this establishment  (Excellent Food, Service, Family Atmosphere or perfect Date Night) & we look forward to celebrating my upcoming birthday here!

The food was awesome! They have a giant blue drink to share...dont be fooled by the beautiful colors though ..it's not good nor is it strong so its a waste of the room in your belly trying to drink it all. Save the room for the delicious food :)

This was my first time eating at Bobby Q's, I had  9 guests including myself with no reservation. The ladies up front greeted myself as well as everyone else and asked us to wait. We were seated in a timely fashion. The prices were EXTREMLEY overpriced for the crap food you get. The mashed potatoes and gravy were cold, and goopy, the macaroni and cheese was soupy. I took 1 bite and sent it back! The manager came over dressed in pajamas and UGH BOOTS on. The table where I sat was right in front of the kitchen and I saw her giving the staff as well as the guests dirty looks. She is was so unprofessionally dressed for a manager. The food was so over rated as well as our waitress who apparently feels it is acceptable to dress crappy too just like the example being set by her Manager. I got ONE re fill the entire time I was there and I had WATER !!! ugh, my bill for 5 people was $142.00 including gratuity. I would never go back !!   WAY OVER RATED !!

This place rivals the Memphis rendezvous!!!  Some of the best BBQ, slaw and beans we have ever had!!
Impeccable service from the minute we walked in the door straight through to the end with our very satisfied bellys and tastebuds. And thank you Emmy for the wonderful service!!

Thumbs up, kids! This place puts Arizona on the map for great barbecue. I ordered the three meat sampler-baby back ribs, tri-tip and chicken with ranch beans and veggies. Meat was so tender! And I'm one for Sweet bbq sauce, so I was dancing with each bite! Service matched the great quality food and atmosphere

Visiting from out of town but very pleased with our choice.  Service was really top notch.  Great server, food out in 5 min, and tender meat.  The manager came by also to check on us with a great smile and attitude.

And the cornbread is to die for. Creative tasty craft cocktails.
Best BBQ I've had on the West... and I know my BBQ! Great service, portions, environment and food!

I was excited after reading the reviews, but I was a little disappointed. I was looking more of a Little Miss BBQ real BBQ type of place. It is a beautiful restaurant inside I must say. 

I should've known I was in trouble when I asked the waitress if they had burnt ends and she had no idea what that was. I ordered ribs and brisket. The brisket was ALOT of fat, not what I was expecting. The meat with the brisket was good, just not enough of it. The ribs I'm sorry to say were not memorable. Sides were pretty good. 

I also ordered an appetizer. It came out after my entree arrived. They were kind enough to not charge me for the appetizer because of this. I have to say service was good but I don't think I will return.

I went to Bobby Q's for a family birthday on Saturday. The food was amazing and the service was excellent as well. I had the 2 meat entree bbq and spare ribs with Mac n chz and mashed potatoes. The meat fell off the bone. My friend doesn't eat pork and she agreed it was delicious! She had fried chicken along with others at the table who all raved about how delicious it was. The birthday boy received a double chocolate dessert and we all had freshly made donuts. They were both delicious. I give this place 5 stars. I wish I could remember the waiters name to give him kudos because you don't receive excellent service as he gave us these days. We showed our appreciation with extra gratuity. Thank you for a nice experience.

I came here with my friends after hiking the Grand Canyon and we wanted an epic dinner to celebrate finishing our adventure. It was an okay experience. I had the whole hog with baby back ribs, beef ribs, brisket, and pork. The pork and beef ribs were easily my favorite. The pork was tender and pulled apart easily, and the beef ribs were tender and savory. The brisket was a little dry. All together, it was a decent experience but nothing I would make a special trip for.
Great smokehouse food and side dishes.  Left happy.  Chicken and brisket are excellent.

phils san diego vs bobby q? i still choose phils always & 5eva.

BUT bobby q did have delicious corn bread and MINI DONUTS!!! Food was great, service was great. Can't complain :)
The food here is amazing. If you're visiting Phoenix Arizona, this is one of the GO TO places.

Okay I have to say this is my 2nd time here all the way from cali. I have received great service both times but this time I would like to give an exceptional call out to joe our sever. He was awesome. Many people can learn from him.  Management take notice Joe is that guy you want to have around all the time.

Amazing place to go! 
The food is fantastic and the bar is even better. 
The restaurant is such a family atmosphere I loved it! Not to mention the whole area just felt just right! 
The services there are so great it's worth going.

Corn bread and the ribs are awesome!! I agree with everyone here. The food are tasty. The customer service is even better. We went ahead and gave extra tip. The wait time on the weekend for high rating restaurant usually 1hr or more in bay area. I'm do happy that i do not have to wait. I got seated within 5 mins. Definitely will come back :D

I have been coming to this please for years. They come every year for my birthday dinner with my family, and every year it is the same! We love this place and will always come back. This is by far the best barbeque you will ever find in Arizona through and through. The macaroni and cheese is heaven the cornbread is amazing the chicken, the fried chicken is out of this world! The barbeque pulled pork  is my all-time favourite and the perfect burger is exactly that! Just perfect! Order q rolls as an appetizer and the pineapple drink if you need a cocktail and please thank me later LOL!

OMG this place is huge! I had no idea. We placed our order through take out and got to see the bustle in the back of the house and they were really on it. Seemed like they worked together well. The young man and young lady doing the take out orders were super nice and sweet. The food...well you already know....delicious

This is my second visit to Bobby Q...the first one was several years ago. I ordered a ribeye steak and it was tender and flavorful. For $25 I got the steak and two sides and I found it to be a great value for a $25 steak. It is a step up from Outback and Texas Roadhouse, but about the same price. I sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive and friendly. One of my sides was the mac and cheese and I can honestly say that it was some of the cheesiest, and therefore some of the best that I have had.

I came to Phoenix on business, I live in NY where there is truly great dinning and I have to say that Bobby Q's is the best BBQ I have ever had. I had the baby back ribs - which could be eaten with a knife and fork, but the BBQ sauce was so good, I had to clean the bones - they were amazing, the corn bread AMAZING!! Lindsay was our server and she was fantastic. So incredibly good, anytime I am in Phoenix I will def go to Bobby Q's. I am not leaving for a few days and intend on eating there one more time before I leave. Yum!! We also got 10% off our bill for saying yelp!! It would be worth double the price of what we paid without discount!!!

Love the Brisket and Pulled Pork. Not to mention the sides here (Mashed Potatoes, Mac n Cheese, and Pecan Coleslaw are my personal favorites) compliment the meat very well. The cornbread and the chipotle ranch are also things I would recommend you try. In addition, the manager came around and introduced himself while making sure that everything was to our satisfaction. Love the attentiveness and professionalism displayed by the staff here. OH and the free donuts earned themselves an extra star :)
Focus on quality of product delivered, not always timing to deliver! Half cooked and doughy pizza is not worth it..

I literally left Bobby Q's last night thinking, I need to bring anyone and everyone I know from out of town here when they visit us.  Here's why:

Almost immediately after seating us at the booth at the bar (the wait was 50 minutes for a table vs immediate for the bar), the waitress showed up to greet us and get our drinks, and soon after brought us their oh-so-delicious cornbread.  We were set on the Whole Hog Heaven, which was a choice of 4 meats and 3 sides, but seeing that it was only me and my boyfriend. our waitress (I feel terrible for not remembering her name) suggested the Sunday special called the Family Platter which was for $33, you get a little less meat than the Whole Hog, 4 pre-chosen meats: chicken, brisket, pulled pork, and baby back ribs, and 2 sides.

Less than 10 minutes after placing our order, our food was here with an extra helping of spicy BBQ sauce.  It was marvelous.  The mac and cheese was the creamiest, cheesiest, most delicious mac and cheese my 10 year old self could ever ask for.  The shoestring fries were miserably thin, but I'm just biased being a fan of steak fries.  The brisket simply melts in your mouth.  The pulled pork does too, but only as much as pulled pork can.  The chicken was a lot better than I expected and I hate ordering BBQ chicken.  Oh but those ribs, the meat just fell right off the bone.  We were starving walking in, but stuffed after polishing off everything but the ribs.  My boyfriend, who had every intention of eating all of it right there and then, took a bite of the ribs, announced that we were going to take it home.  It was that good.  And that much food.  My only regret was not getting more cornbread.  But I can't really blame them for not offering considering how quickly they brought us that sheer amount of food.

In a nutshell, great, quick, and very accommodating service (the couple next to us wanted rotisserie chicken without any BBQ sauce.  Baffling, I know), delicious food, and tons of it!  But be sure to make a reservation.  Oh, and have I mentioned those cinnamon-dusted donut bites?  Bobby Q, you've ruined me forever.  I used to be very content with my after-dinner mints but now I'm going to have to demand donut bites everywhere I go.
Great food, crowded Friday night but were seated in 10 mins. Food price ranges from $ to $$$ perfect for everyone. Food was delicious great decor a must try!

BOBBY Q BBQ. It's so clever! Honestly when we drove past this restaurant to get to our motel...we were busy making fun of their name. That is until we found out that they made Yelp's 100 Places to Eat and we found ourselves waiting 50 minutes for dinner. Not laughing anymore. I highly recommend making reservations because this restaurants get very crowded. Thankfully this did not affect the service at all! We were taken care of from the minute we walked in, to the minute we walked out. 

Their menu has a little bit of everything so you're bound to find something that interests you. We started our meal with their Spinach Artichoke Queso Dip (with garlic bread) but honestly you don't even have to! Their house corn bread is delicious with their butter and can easily count as an appetizer with all the free refills they give you. With that said, the artichoke queso dip was also quite tasty. I just prefer my artichoke dip with chips rather than bread. The bread was just a little too buttery for me which made the appetizer feel very heavy. For our entrees, we ordered the Three Meat Plate (brisket, sausage, ribs) and their Jumbo BBQ Potato (all the usual fixings and brisket.

We absolutely loved the BBQ here. We've tasted some of the best bbq in Texas and I have to say that you can find some of the best right here in Phoenix, AZ. Everything was tender, fall off the bone delicious. I especially loved their brisket and my husband thought their sausage was great. I loved their BBQ sauce too. I even liked their sides! Their Mac-n-Cheese was rich and decadent, their pecan coleslaw was tangy and refreshing and their roasted corn was a little too smoky but that is purely a personal preference (less smoke is better for me). As for my Jumbo Potato, it was stuffed to the brim with all the fixings and very satisfying. We were absolutely stuffed after this meal. 

Our meal ended with some fresh house made donuts covered in cinnamon sugar. It was a great finish and we really appreciated all the effort put into excellent customer service. The managers were all out and greeting guests as well as cleaning tables! That was really nice to see. Anyways, I never thought that I would find a good BBQ restaurant in Phoenix but I was wrong! Next time I'm here, I'm definitely coming back for some great food! 5/5
This will be short and sweet. Love this place! We went whole hog, there will be awesome leftovers. Service was great, manager stored by to check. Loving this. Devil's Ale to boot. I'll be back!
Great food, although the to go order is confusing and you get funneled to the back, which I wasn't prepared for.

We went to this location even though the Gilbert location was much closer. Food was good and overall service was good however we felt very rushed to finish our meal and conversation!! They tried to clear the plates before we were done. 4 different people came up to us to see if we needed anything else. I realize it was a Friday night but we were only there for a little over an hour.

Have been looking for a good steak house but usually settle for outback. This was my first of what will be many visits. The difference in same cut here that I get at outback is unreal. If I didn't know better there is no way I would think these were the same cut..night and day. perfectly prepared and seasoned and delivered by a friendly attentive staff.The sides were also good. The wedge actually loses to outback unfortunately but everything else was sooo good I could easily overlook that. We have found our new place for  red meat.
Not the best .. Not the worst ... Definitely quite pricy for the serving size you get ! Their mud pie was the best purchase !

Loved it! We have been twice this past month. Both the pulled pork and ribs melt in your mouth. The atmosphere is wonderful and the kids loved it too. 
Zac was great and did great acknowledging my husband's birthday.

We ate dinner at Bobby Q based on their wonderful Yelp reviews.   We had Stacie as our server.   We wanted ribs and brisket.   Based on her recommendation we had a three meat combination plate - with brisket, St. Louis style ribs, and baby back ribs.   The best meat of the three was the baby back ribs.   The baby backs were cooked to perfection, with the meat falling off the bones.   The baby backs were delicious and wonderful.   The other meats - brisket and St. Louis Style ribs - were also very, very good.

The service was excellent - prompt, courteous, and attentive.   The atmosphere was very relaxing, and tables were spaced nicely so that we didn't feel cramped.   Stacie's service was excellent.

We will return here when we next visit Phoenix.

The Q Rolls were amazing, as were the baby back ribs and the sweet potato fries and shoestring fries! Will definitely be coming back. Tommy is the best waiter by far and went above and beyond to help us! 5 stars easy. 


Oh, and Chandler did it. He ate all his food.

This place has really good BBQ. I use to go here when I was younger..boy has it changed. It's clean, the service is good and the food was exceptional. Four stars because it's rather expensive. I have a hard time paying $12 for an adult beverage.

My husband had introduced me to this place and asked me "Hun, wanna go try out this place called Bobby Q?" and me, what? you mean "BBQ" and he says "No, its called Bobby Q" and were going back and forth with the correction of the name he's getting irritated with me and I'm getting irritated with him of his spelling! But, as we pull up and I see the sign it literally is called "Bobby Q" I got gonged!" hahahahaha and apologized! 

This is the first place that I really enjoyed having some delicous BBQ style dishes. I've had before in Mesa at another place and that was great too because we ate it as family style. But, this is probably one of my favorite places in the valley of having some good ole' BBQ dishes with the macaroni cheese, yummy corn bread, baked bbq beans, coleslaw and their delicious sweet tea, which is something that I haven't really had before but, all was amazing.
I love as we were coming up to the restaurant you can almost smell the slow roasting smell through your car which gets you excited and more hungry as you park. I love the barn look and the atmosphere and everyone in here is so nice!
You really feel like you are in another state and the food it's so picture perfect that my family/friends back home their mouths are dropping because we don't have this back home an if we do, it is not the same.
The q-rolls with the brisket is one of my favorite appetizers to get and I heard it's something new they just added to their menu. I've never was fond of brisket because it always tasted so dry, but, Bobby Q's its amazing. The brisket is so juicy, slow roasted for at least 18-24 hrs daily, and taste of the bbq on it is simply just delicious! All their meats are soon tasty, I don't need to go to one of those fine dining restaurants anymore, I just rather be comfortable and enjoy their combo dishes or the HOG HAVEN and bring home the left overs to salivate later for next days lunch or dinner....

They also have these amazing donuts with cinnamon on it, to me it almost could pass for "Malasada's" its a portugese delicatessen desert dish...Same concept! Was soon ono! Happy place- Amazing food, customer service, and ambiance!

2 words: MIND. BLOWN. Yes I said it. From their Cajun shrimp w/ toast to their BBQ rolls to their ribs, brisket, and sausage to their mini cinnamon donuts.. Bobby Q's knows how to do it right! Best BBQ hands down. If u don't stop here on your adventures through AZ.. all I can say is ?. The restaurant has a very comforting, family vibe and the smells when we walked in through the door we're a good sign of things to come.. Everything we ordered had a wonderful texture and their meat was fall off the bone good. I also love their spicy BBQ sauce. Our waitress was great. Parking is plentiful but there is a wait during peak dining times.

Was scrolling through Yelp to find a good place to eat in Phoenix. Stumbled upon Bobby-Q. 1000+ reviews with 4.5 stars??! YES PLEASE. Also, punny restaurant name? SOLD. Hahaha. Thank you yelp for showing me to this awesome gem during my short stay at Phoenix. 

Came in on Monday of Memorial Day weekend right when it opened so there was no line. PHEW. I guess it makes the experience much better when you don't have to wait in line right? Got seated quickly and the service was great! Our waiter (I wish I remember his name) answered all our questions and even gave us a little history of the restaurant as it was our first time there. Anyways, lets get to talking about the good stuff...THE FOOD. 

To be honest, I was already in love with this place when the complimentary corn bread came out. Free is one thing, but these corn bread were so moist and good! Between me and my friend, we ordered the whole hog heaven because we eat a lot and we were starving. We got the pulled pork, brisket, beef ribs, baby back ribs with a side of cole slaw, corn, and mac & cheese. The hog heaven only come with two sides, but you can pay about $2.00 for an extra side...worth. 

All the meat was delicious, although I wish the pulled pork and brisket had more sauce on them. My favorite is the pulled pork! Super easy to eat and literally melts in your mouth. The baby back ribs were good, but I feel like there wasn't enough meat and the meat didn't come off as easily as I hoped. The mac & cheese was BOMB, but my favorite was the corn. 

We also ordered a strawberry lemonade and that was delicious was well, and went really well with our food. 

And to end our wonderful experience, there was also complimentary donuts?! Sorry, but complimentary corn bread AND donuts? Can there be a place like this in LA please? Haha.

Very nice bartender and good selection of beers. Very nice hostess also, she even checks on you to see if everything is going well. I bought some of their tasty bbq sauce to go. I had the brisket nacho's which was excellent.

I have a rule of going twice to any restaurant, today was the second time I went and boy was it an abysmal experience. The first time was amazing. The ribs were great and the service was alright. I left feeling positive that I found a new favorite restaurant. Today was the polar opposite. I ordered the steak sandwich and it was horrendous. I don't know what it was about the flavor but it started to make me really really sick. So much so that I had to get up and go to the restroom because I felt that I was going to vomit. Thankfully I didn't, I stopped eating the steak, which if you take out the flavor issues, it was cooked properly, and the texture was spot on. 

Another thing which I found quite unprofessional was that the plate wasn't wiped.  It's not a huge deal but if you are a good restaurant you should show that when a costumer first sees the food. I got a mess of meat splatter and grease. I know it sounds trivial but the little things count. We eat with our eyes first, and it can totally change our experience from positive or negative. 

Am I going to go back? Maybe, $18 for a piece of steak, garlic bread, and mushrooms is a steep price to pay for something that makes me sick.

Very busy, very lively. Most of the experience was absolutely wonderful. Kept getting annoyed by a house fly in the patio, and the water feature noise, but quickly seated inside when I asked. The food was obviously delicious as you can see from other reviews. It was a bit pricey, but I was NOT visiting such a lovely restaurant without getting the steak. Worth every penny and the place was so charming I'd definitely go there for any occasion. 

Quick note: as I was leaving the manager asked how everything was, and handed me a small package which when I opened - when I got home - turned out to be the most delicious tiny doughnuts. From beginning to end a HUGE wow.

Ok was really excited to try this place. I ordered the brisket platter thinking it would be a better representation of what the beef is like as compared to the sandwich. Often times restaurants will use the crumbs or shavings for their sandwiches. My food was good but the 4 slices of beef were very very thin. I estimate it to have been a quarter of a pound of meat. For $21 I would think the portions would be a bit more. Brisket is better when cut greater than 1/4 inch. So this is why I am not giving it 5 Stars. The Mac and cheese was very good as well as the beans and corn bread.

Soooo good! The brisket appetizer was amazing! The service was fantastic and the Prime Rib was great! The best part was the Mac N Chz it was almost better than my own! Very impressed! And will be back again! My hubby loved the cornbread too!

I am soooo going back as soon as possible!

We were here earlier during this last MLB Spring Training, and didn't have reservations. It was too late to wait the one hour plus wait time. This time I planned ahead using OpenTable. After a long drive from Orange County, we arrive just in time for our 7:30 appointment. Our waitress Christin was awesome allowing us to sample things, so we knew exactly what we wanted to order. My wife and I had the Hog Heaven plate for 2 (or more!)... Baby back and St Louis ribs, beef brisket and chicken, and we even got to try the sausage. The meat was falling off the bone and was tender as could be. They didn't over do the barbecue sauce either. The cornbread muffins were tasty. The manager Barron was amazing as well... Thank you for comping the mudd pie to celebrate our son's birthday. We were constantly attended to. They definitely won over a customer for life. I will certainly be coming back next spring training.

A friend and I tried Bobby Q for the first time a few days ago. Reception could use some additional training in customer service. I had the two meat combo plate with brisket and baby-back ribs recommended by our server ALEXANDRA, WHO WAS AWESOME!! Meat was delicious, tender and juicy. My sides were Mac N Cheese & grilled veggies, both which were also great. My friend had the prime rib and shrimp, which were also cooked perfectly and he enjoyed them a lot. Dessert was apple cobbler, which was also well done. Overall, a good experience. Portions are ample, but so are the prices. Dinner for two with drinks and tip was $85.

Man this place is popular! But I can see why it's ranked top 100 restaurants in the nation by Yelp! We overheard it was an hour wait for walk ins, luckily we made reservations! The ambience was great, the lights were dimmed and there was this intimate vibe, but at the same time all these TVs by the bar were blasting the sports and games going on. 
Our waiter was great, very attentive. 
We ordered the baby back ribs and the prime rib. Both were perfect. The meat fell off the ribs cleanly and the steak was not too chewy, flavorful, and juicy! 
Would definitely recommend Bobby Q!

I ordered takeout here. I ordered the beef brisket dinner. It is absolutely the best barbecue I have ever tasted! I liked it so much, I am going back tomorrow for dinner. Absolutely a must visit whenever I'm in Phoenix.

Great food. Huge portions. I was able to bring half of my combo home. Looking forward to going back soon. The beer selection was sufficient. I'm glad they had Green Flash on tap even if you could only get it in a pint.

Great BBQ joint with great service. Start with the Q-Rolls as an appetizer, they are reminiscent of mini-chimis with brisket. I highly recommend the Smoasted Chicken. The Mac n' Cheese is sinfully cheesy. The potato salad is equally delicious and surprisingly refreshing. The cornbread is warm and sweet. Then finish your meal with mini complimentary sugar donuts. 

Additionally, last year I bought a whole Turkey for Thanksgiving Day. Talk about amazing! This is the first time my family devours the a whole turkey. Delicious!!!!!
I love Bobby Q! Always a must for dinner when we come into town! Service is great, food is great!

Spent $100 (two people) and wasn't better than any other place we've spent that much money. We will try it again. Maybe a different result. 

Much rather go to Papas, Arrowhead Grill, or even Outback for spending $100.

I had prime rib and my gf had brisket/ribs. Wasn't raving yummy, but better than average.

Try it out though. Tons of great reviews.

This is our second time here.  This place was just as good as the last time we were here.  It started with our waiter Rishad.  He was nice and very quick.  He made sure we left the restaurant satisfied.  Even his manager came by to see if we were enjoying the experience.

The meal started with their Q-Rolls.  Seasoned beef brisket with a BBQ dipping sauce and a chipotle dip.  They are always great.

Aggie ordered Smoasted chicken (smoked. & roasted) with BBQ.  Her sides were Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes.  She enjoyed it very much.

I ordered Beef brisket with Ranch Beans and mashed potatoes.  It was very, very good.  I enjoyed every bit.  

Mikaela ordered the Kid's Cheeseburger with fries.  I took a bit of her cheeseburger, and the beef tasted better than anything from other burger places.  I couldn't believe it.  

To drink, Mikaela ordered their sweet tea (best I have tasted from any restaurant), and Aggie and I ordered Frosted Lemonades.  They were tart and sweet, and sugar coated the glass.  That was a nice touch.

We will definitely come back here.  It is just epic!

This is my all time favorite restaurant of all times. If I were on death row, my last meal would be from here. If I were ever going to get married, I would  have them cater for me. I never went to Bobby McGees unfortunately, but I have been eating at Bobby Qs since it became Bobby Qs. I have never had a bad meal, nor have I seen anyone else not enjoy their meal. I have never had bad service, or even mediocre service. The food and service have always been excellent, above average, wonderful. 
I can't say how many times I have been here over the past many years. I used to go at least once a month as it was me and someones date restaurant for a long time. Every time someone visits from out of town, I bring them there. They always request to go back when they are visiting again. I've brought dates to this place, they have always loved it. When I talk to someone else about Bobby Qs, and they've had it in the past, they always say they love it too. I even met someone from out of town that said they go all over the country to eat BBQ and Bobby Qs had their favorite ribs of anywhere they've ever been to!  I've been to going away parties, birthday parties, tons of stuff, and I've still never met anyone to complain about this place. 
The only complaints I've ever heard is of the club. Who cares about the club? This is about the restaurant, the food, the service. Not some dance club where some teeny bopper got in a fight with her boyfriend so they had a bad night so they are going to complain about Bobby Qs. Come on now! 
Try the amazing, phenomenal food that Bobby Qs is!! The cornbread is great, the nice donuts they give you as you're leaving are delicious and the spicy bbq sauce is my favorite. I like that they sell their bbq sauce so I can have it at home too! It feels comfortable inside as well, the decor is nice. The outside patio is a great spot when the weather is nice. My dad lives 1800 miles away and is always asking me if I've eaten there recently and to take pictures of the outside water chains so he can replicate that at his house.

Fantastic barbecue and great setting. Good for the whole family. Large portions, great sauces and flavors, good service, and fantastic donuts. Have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed.

A) this place is open on Sundays which apparently a lot of good lunch spots in Phoenix are not and B) this is one of the best BBQ joints I've ever been to! 

The BBQ brisket was tender and moist, my bf is from the south and was very impressed with the authentic Carolina BBQ sauce. The service was really above and beyond, at least 3 different staff members came to check up on us and everyone was SO friendly. (A certain resort in Sedona could learn from the people here!). 

The strawberry lemonade was super sweet and after you've stuffed yourself on delicious, moist BBQ, they give you 4 donuts in a bag with your check. Great idea because a bag of beignets certainly makes paying easier, though the food and service were so good, paying would never be a burden here. 

If you like BBQ, you MUST come here! We'll be back for sure!
Awful, ghetto, and overpriced. I can't believe I've been there more than once. I wish my friends would stop making their parties there lol.

WOW, DELICIOUS!!! First I would like to compliment the host and our server Autumn, they were very polite and helpful and service was very attentive and in a timely manner. The wife and I decided to have lunch before our long drive home back to SO-CAL, she spotted the restaurant sign from the freeway and liked the clever lil Bobby Q name. So I yelped it and saw good reviews, so we gave it a try. The restaurant is not hard to find, it has nice size parking lot with lots of trees and shade. When you step out of the car you instantly get hit with the delicious smell of smoking BBQ! The building has that roadhouse feeling but a more family atmosphere,  the inside is very nice and clean, dim lit and once again very nice atmosphere.  I ordered my favorite BBQ dish, the pulled pork sandwich w/ mac n cheese as my side with a lemonade.  The wife had the beef brisket and the BBQ chicken with the pecan coleslaw and mashed potatoes as her side. While we waited for our meals they brought us some delicious corn bread that must have been freshly made, it was warm and sweet. So moist you could cut it with your fork and eat it like a pastry, leaving you wanting more after the last bite. Our food came shortly after we finished the cornbread so it had to be between 5-10mins from when we gave Autumn our orders. The smell was devine and the food presentation was very nice, not like your typical BBQ joints, it seemed a lil more fine dining, the quantities are more controlled , not just slapped on the plate in mass amounts. I first dipped into the mac n cheese and I'll tell you I could have stopped right there and not have tasted another thing and I would have left a happy customer, best mac n cheese I've ever had!!! Next I took a bite of my pulled pork sandwich and it did not disappoint. The bun it was served on was fresh and warm, the pork was succulent and smokey,  sauce was sweet and tangy which complimented the smoked pork.  The wife and i sampled eachothers food and every single bite was fresh, succulent, savory and absolutely delicious.  Hands down the best BBQ I have ever eaten!!! The only thing I can complain about is we don't have a Bobby Q's over here where I live in Diamond bar, California.
P.S. 
My wife says, she thinks there should be a Barbie Q in California, we will have to make Phoenix a regular trip until then though.

Great BBQ,  good flavor, great lunch prices.  Both brisket and baby back ribs are so tender and delicious. Very good service.  Manager goes around asking if everything is ok. Nicole provided exceptional service.

Get the Ribs! So while visiting Phoenix on business our group of 7 hungry diners wanted something substantial and memorable for our out of town experience. BOBBY'Qs, did not disappoint. I had originally ordered the brisket, but due to an error from the kitchen I ended up with ribs. The only regret I have now is I live so far from Phoenix. Nothing will compare. And I consider myself a rib aficionado. "Hunter" our server was knowledgeable, efficient and attentive. He told us the brisket  meat was cooked 22 hours. I tried my friends, and it was delicious. Even the side dishes were noteworthy. My favorite was the potato salad. A bit on the creamy side, but just the way I like it. Not an inexpensive dinner, but one that you won't soon forget. I can taste it now.l as I write this.

I guess you'll love this place if you're a heavy flesh eater that eats just about anything covered in sauce.  But for someone who saves their palate for quality meat, I would recommend saving your money.  The bright side, is that you'll get a choice of sauces, but other than that the food is not memorable.  I have not been back after finding red jelly (I suppose that it was congealed blood from a chicken that was too young - I'm not exactly sure) on the joints of the bones.

Hands down, it is the best barbecue restaurant I have ever been at. We were a party of six, and we ordered many different kinds of food and shared it all. The catfish was our least favorite dish. However, everything else was beyond amazing. We all agreed that the corn, mac and cheese, and cornbread were the best things ever ... Personally, I think their mac and cheese is the best mac and cheese dishes on earth :)

Not all barbecue is created equally. I'm from Chicago and grew up eating barbecue NOT pulled porked sandwiches or beef brisket, but pork barbecue ribs & rib tips from the south side of Chicago. Ya know, the kind where white bread and french fries are saturated in sauce at the bottom of the basket. Where you have to work a little bit to pull the meat off the bone. Where you smell the charred ribs a few blocks away. Now that's barbecue to me.

This does not mean that I cannot appreciate other types of barbecue. We spilt the pulled pork sandwich and slab of ribs. It was good, but I packed the leftovers for my husband's lunch today. When something is really good I don't share and sadly, the ribs we just okay. 

I gave an extra star for the customer service. The hostess and waitress were polite, attentive and nice. Too bad more establishments are not as well run as Bobby Q.

It's no surprise that this place is as popular as it is! The food, the service is just what you want! We found Bobby Qs on Yelp and decided that it would be a fun and yummy place for dinner. We had made reservations in advance so we were seating as soon as we checked in. I had the brisket, which is melt in your mouth soooo delicious. My cousin had the loaded potato which was definitely loaded to the max! And my other cousins shared a combination plate which had more than enough food to feed two! They even had some leftover to take home! My fiance had the steak sandwich, which was good, but wasn't our favorite. The steak was not as tender as we'd like it to be. But our server, Jason F, went out of his way to make sure that we loved our food and made the situation much better. Honestly, even if the food was bad (which it wasn't!) I would have come back just for the service alone! We can't wait to head back!
Well worth the trip!! We shared the combination platter - pork ribs, brisket, and pork. Amazing!! Thanks to our server, Loralie!!!
Food is pricey but well done. The cocktails, meat sides and even the little donuts you get for the ride home are all amazing.

So, the bf and I are in Phoenix for the weekend and looking for a good steakhouse.  All I'm able to find is a Lone Star, Black Angus, and Outback Steakhouse.  Boo.  I notice the Bobby Q off the I-17 and look it up on Yelp.  Pretty good reviews, and they serve steak!  So off we go.

What we ordered:
Strawberry Qlada & Mudslide on the Rocks
Q-Rolls
Wedge Salad
Ribeye Steak (with cole slaw and potato salad)
Prime Rib with Shrimp Chimichurri (with roasted corn and ranch beans)

My Strawberry Qlada was delicious (I like the coconut on the rim of the glass), but the mudslide was missing an ingredient (easily fixed).  The Q-Rolls weren't anything spectacular, but they did taste good.  We shared the wedge salad, which they split it for us and I was thankful!  It was enough as a starter, and it was also very good.  

The ribeye was amazing!  When it arrived, the bf asked for steak sauce, but after taking a bite of the steak, he decided that the steak sauce was not necessary.  It was so juicy and flavorful, I was a little disappointed I didn't order it for myself.  However, my prime rib was also juicy (not as thick a cut as Lawry's, but pretty good anyway!) and the shrimp was also nice addition.  The sides were all very good, but I loved my roasted corn the best!  

I realized there were two things missing from our dinners after we left the restaurant.  The ribeye should have come with cornbread and the prime rib should have come with a jumbo baked potato.  I don't think I could have eaten the potato, but I would have liked to have tasted that cornbread.

Our server, Smitty, was EXCELLENT.  He was friendly and attentive, and he made sure we were well taken care of.  He definitely made our overall dining experience a positive one.

We'll definitely come back again.

We came to Bobby Q off of the recommendation of a friend and we were definitely not disappointed! The food was super good, the service was great, and the restaurant looked very clean and nice. 

We came at around 12pm and there wasn't a line, and we were seated at a large table. The waitresses were very nice, and brought us water once we sat down. We saw the fresh mini donuts being made near the front of the door and they kindly gave us some before our meal; the donuts were dusted with cinnamon sugar and they were delicious! The donuts were soft, warm, and perfectly fried. After the donuts, we decided on the Whole Hog, which was quite a lot of food for three girls. The whole hog came with St. Louis and Baby Back Ribs, three sides (which we ordered shoe string fries, mashed potatoes, and corn), BBQ chicken, and brisket, as well as cornbread. The cornbread was buttery and delicious, and it tasted great with the whipped butter. The bbq was honestly the best I have yet to have! The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender, and the meat had a good fat-to-meat ratio. Of the meats, my favorite was the smokey St. Louis ribs, which were less saucy and contained chewy tendons (if you're into that like I am). The mashed potatoes was also super buttery and smooth, and tasted almost like a dip. Also, the waitress brought two pitchers of BBQ sauce, one spicy and one original, so be prepared to drench all the meat in even more sauce. 

After the meal, the waitress was super kind and brought us another round of donuts! 

I would highly recommend this place if you're in Phoenix! The food was amazing, the staff was super friendly, and the sides and donuts make this place stand out.

My wife and I enjoyed the Whole Hog Heaven!! We didn't get to finish our meal because it was that large of a portion!  We arrived hungry and now leaving with left overs.  I really enjoyed the service from our Waiter, genuine and prompt!  I'll come back, quality flavors of smoked and caramelized ribs!!!
Service is excellent food is great the managers Taylor and baron  have absolutely the best customer service I live in Las Vegas and when I'm in town I eat there at least 3 times
Loved the place! Went there to celebrate with family..... The whole hog was amazing! Brisket and ribs! Cornbread and little donuts! Fantastic!! Our server, Patrick was awesome! We'll be back!!!!!!!

I had such good food here tonight, holy cow!  I came here at the last minute because I was stuck in the house all day today, and needed to get out and eat something.  I decided to come here, and even though it's not my first time, it's probably the best BBQ I've had in a while.

When I first moved here, I used to drive by this place a lot, but being that I lived on the East side for many years, I was to lazy to come here since it was .  Boy, what a to far!

Man, this place was packed tonight!  I had to circle the parking lot like twice just to get a parking space! once inside, I was seated almost immediately at the bar.  After looking over the menu, I went with the Brisket sandwich with mashed potatoes. It came out right away, and man, was it good! 

Service was awesome, especially since it was so busy. The bathrooms were pretty cool with big steel sinks and pretty hand soap containers. I will say, I don't get the club thing attached to Bobby Q's, but there was a ton of people in there. I noticed it when I came in, but saw a lot of people in there when I went to the restroom.  They had a sign up with a dress code, and I'm not real sure what that's about, but seemed interesting enough.

This is definitely one of my favorite places.  The quality is excellent and I've never left hungry.

My favorites here include the brisket, baked potato soup, prime rib sandwich (occasional lunch special), mac 'n cheese and mashed potatoes.  No, not all at once though.  :)

I love to get the soup and sandwich lunch special and actually put my brisket in the baked potato soup.  I also like to order the brisket sandwich with mac 'n cheese and do the same thing.

The cornbread they serve is delicious and makes a great appetizer.  My only disappointment here is that when I first started coming here you got fresh from the fryer cinnamon mini doughnuts at the end of your meal.  Now, they're never fresh and you only get them sometimes.
YES! Got the baby back ribs and the meat just falls right off the bones.

Stopped here on our way to the PHX airport. Management is really active and always checking on us. The server was also great and tried really hard. The food was not good, and the prices are high for what you get. It smelled great from outside but unfortunately have had much better BBQ in Phoenix. The doughnuts for dessert are delicious! Might try them again next time we are in town, maybe just an off night.

This is probably best barbecue I've ever had. The corn bread is amazing. I got the St. Louis ribs, they wee fall of the bone. I got the Mac and cheese as a side. Every thing was great.  All the people working there were very friendly.

Out with two buds tonight on a quest for some good BBQ and to zap a few other cravings. I've been here one or two times before but for whatever reason was never able to try a lot of things.

First off I love the atmosphere and decor of the place. Upscale bayou? can that exist? seems like they were able to do it. Plus its nice and dark and comfortable.

One thing I recall is how great the service is EVERY TIME i go. Three different visits.. three different servers.. top notch each time.

Food!

Appetizers

Wings:
Delicious! These are smoked, fried, and then sauced. I hate(strong word on purpose) baked wings. I thought I was going to hate these but the combo of the smoked then fried works amazingly. It allows them to only flash fry for crisp. This keeps the wings juicy and plump but with the fried crispy skin that wings should have.

Brisket Fire-Pie:
Don't bother :/ I knew this was risky but I had a pizza craving. Normally BBQ pizzas have way to much BBQ sauce. This was the opposite it had very little sauce.. so little that it had no flavor impact leaving you wondering what that funky after taste is.

Cornbread:
Strong corn flavor.. not overly sweet. Could feel the grease/butter levels killing me not so slowly. But was good to the taste buds.
-----------------
BBQ

Pulled Pork:
Nice smoke flavor and good moisture content without being overly fatty. Not the best I've had but no complaints.

Brisket:
Same feelings as the pork. It was good and executed properly but certainly not the best I've ever had. None of the BBQ was overly salty but some of it was to far on the other end of the scope and could have used some more salt. There was no real bark on the brisket which was a little disappointing.

Smoke Links:
I didn't care for these at all. They were to fatty for my taste and needed more... something in your face. I think everyone agreed these were the our least favorite items.

Baby Back Ribs:
Very tasty ribs but surprisingly not my favorite out of the three offered. These are usually the safe best for best ribs at whatever place your at. There was something out of whack with the meat itself. It failed to really pick up the smoke flavor maybe? They were moist and tender and fall off the bone. But fall off the bone on the side of smoked to long.

Beef Ribs:
Surprisingly lean for beef ribs. Since they were so lean these could have used a little more time in the smoke unlike the baby backs. Beef ribs take a much longer time to break down to perfection.

St Louis Style Ribs:
YUM! Best ribs on the menu. Next time this is all I will order in the rib category. Flavor was great., meat was great., still a little over done but it took nothing away from them. I would come back for this alone.
-------------------

Sides

Mac & Cheese:
Delicious but they went the fake cheese route. It is hard to make good mac and cheese the old fashion way. Its hard in small quantity let alone restaurant quantity. I would rather have them understand this and serve it with primarily fake cheese and be tasty then try and do from scratch and serve me curdled cheese fail.

Pecan Cole Slaw:
Also sexy! Crisp, cold, refreshing, and not soggy. The nuts were a nice addition but if they could have somehow brought it out more in the dish it would have been ever better.

Potato Salad:
Mmmmmm. This was great and a tie for best side dish with the mac and cheese. Be warned.. This is HEAVY. Its probably 90% mayo but its potato salad.. its not healthy don't try and make it healthy. They did it right. It took a year off my life and I loved every bite of it. Its the bad years anyway! Creamy, perfect amount of mustard, great seasoning, lots of fresh dill.

Beans:
Interesting.. Sweet but not grossly sweet like some. Smokey but almost to a crazy level. When I tasted this I honestly felt like I was eating something with a liquid tobacco smoke flavor. It also had a lot of what was probably the BBQ beef in it. Not sure what I thought about this.

Planned Return Order:
Wings
St Louis Ribs
Mac & Cheese
Potato Salad
Pecan Coleslaw

Get these if nothing else and I would be shocked if you didn't leave grinning ear to ear.

Pros:
Great Service
Great Atmospheric
Acceptable Great to OK dish ratio
10% off for yelpsters!

Cons:
Awkward Location
Awkward Parking
Pricey

For those still stumped by the "how can fall off the bone be bad" the best test for ribs done correctly would be ribs tender enough to pull apart with your teeth but ones you can pick up and hold by a bone and not have fall apart. If you pick up ribs by the bone and the meat stays on the plate and the bone comes up clean its been neglected. I know this sounds crazy to most but when you have enough ribs done properly you will taste and appreciate a rib that was on as long as it was supposed to be and no longer.
Hands down one of the best BBQ restaurants I have ever ate at. Do your self a favor and go.

Out of all the bbq restaurants in Phoenix, this one by far is the best one I have been to.  My boyfriend and I are from KC and, of course, claim to know bbq.  Bobby Q's isn't as good as some of my favorites around the country, but for Phoenix, I give it an A+.

Many of the establishments in town have ok meat, but horrible sides.  Bobby Q was great all around!  From the corn bread, to the bbq sandwiches and finally the mini-donuts for dessert (that were even hot) everything was fantastic.  

The venue is a bit more upscale than most bbq joints and the parking lot and restaurant itself are gigantic.  Don't worry about getting a spot on a week night, there is plenty of room!
Called in for take out, they said be there in 15 min, waited 45 min in their sweaty kitchen and then got a whole $5 coupon!!!  Thanks!!!!
Amazing food. Great service. Sunday family special is such a huge value! Don't miss that Mac n cheese or the adult strawberry lemonade. Go here!

Our family has loved Bobby Q ever since we moved here from Tennessee. The food and the service are great and the atmosphere is something you don't always find in AZ. We love it! Best fried chicken and BBQ in AZ.

Off the charts. Don't know where to start!  Well first of all the service was was fantastic. So inviting and like you were at a good relatives house!  Hostess, server and manager all present and attentive. Then there is the food. We split baby backs with an onion block. Too yummy to describe. Ribs came with two sides and a choice of spicy or regular. Spicy was just right. We finished with complementary Mimi home made donuts that you see being made as you come in the door. There were 2 in our party and I think we are taking over half of our lunch. Oh and did I say come hungry!  This is a do over and bring back hungry friends.

Stopped in for dinner.  The atmosphere was great and there were many good smells wafting through the room.  We had several questions for the waitress regarding use of soy as an ingredient or cooking oil.  She had to keep going away to ask and the answers coming back were vague and not very helpful.  Not acceptable in these times.  Many people don't care, but soy is an allergen and one of our group has an intolerance.  We expect better of highly rated restaurants than to use soy as the cheap go-to ingredient in most of their menu.  Barbecue sauces can be made from real ingredients like cane sugar, tomatoes, vinegar, spices etc...   Ingredients like soy and corn syrup are a cheap sellout in my view.  With better ingredients and staff training this could be a really good restaurant.  If soy doesn't bother you, go for it.  The fresh donuts at the end are a great touch (soy there too).

A few of us from work arrived from the airport around 8; one of them had been here before and decided to take us for dinner.

What I liked:
-loved the cornbread!!!
-3 meat plate, great mix of chicken, ribs, and brisket. Ribs were nice, tender meat off the bone, great sauce and pit-smoked; excellent value for 20 bux!, 
-loved the roasted corn as a side
-unique dessert, complimentary mini donuts
-young staff, very friendly; for single guys, some of the staff are eye candy

Why no fifth star:
-the server, albeit friendly, did forget our wine orders, so I had to knock a star off.

Great BBQ place, excellent food and good value. There's a Q lounge next door, so will definitely stop by the next time I'm in PHX. Wasn't sure if I was in the meat mood, but BOBBY Q satisfied by BBQ fix!!!

My friend wanted to have dinner here...even though she doesn't eat meat, but that just means more meat for me.

I can understand why this restaurant is rated the top 100 bbq's in America...or was it top 10...either way, the bbq here was very good.

Luckily my friend made the reservations, because people were waiting out there for over an hour or so. I recommend doing the 3 meat combo for $25, which includes 2 sides. 

Their cocktails are pretty good too. And the service was awesome.

Didn't realize this was the old bobby mcgees till I pulled up. Came based on reviews and was skeptical. The only down side was the price. But the place deserves the high ranking. Not your typical BBQ lunch dive. Very nice place. Tried the Q rolls based on reviews. It was good but not something I have to have. Wish I didn't get em because I couldn't finish everything. Carolina q. Pulled pork with slaw and side of mac n cheese. They were right. Mac was solid. Corn bread was by far my favorite corn bread from a restaurant. Sand which was super. Four stars in conservative. Maybe 4.5. Try this place if you haven't been. To pricy to come often for me. But the service was high quality and atmosphere was great.

Great, no AMAZING BBQ. It's not your petite BBQ joint where you get some BBQ on your lip. In this place you'll get BBQ everywhere!!! On your face, your cheeks, your eyeballs and even places you didn't think you touched when you were eating Bobby Q. The portions are HUGE, the price is on the HUGE size too but its worth it. My only issue is that when I was falling into a food coma, the Waiter didn't take notice and shoved HOME MADE donuts in my face. I about died.

Had the BESSSSSSST BBQ ever.....can't wait to come back again! Matt was a great server, he made sure we had plenty of drinks! The food was at our table in a flash, couldn't believe how fast it was!!!! The place was gorgus!

Hands down the Best BBQ place in AZ!!! 

We came here on a sat so it was ridiculously packed! We couldn't find a single parking so we had to park somewhere else and walk. The hostess told us the wait would be 30 mins but it was less than that. 

We were seated and our waiter was super friendly. We already looked over the menu when we were waiting so we ordered pull pork sandwich with mash potatoes and my friend ordered two combination: brisket and baby back ribs with Mac and cheese and shoe string fries. For dessert, we went with the sub zero banana. The food came out super fast! The portion sizes were huge too! We shared our plates and omg it was so delicious and flavorful! The meats just fell apart and was cooked to perfection! The mash potatoes went well with my pulled pork sandwich and it was creamy! Mac and cheese was very creamy too and so good. The shoestring fries was just normal fries. We thought it would have some kind of seasoning on it like garlic or something. Now for the dessert. I thought they should've put more bananas on it because it really brought out the flavors. The crust tasted like an oatmeal cookie. Overall, the dessert was just okay and nothing to get excited over. I def want to try their mudslide next time! But It got 5 stars because our server was fantastic and the food was delicious! It was so yummy that when the server and manager asked us how our food tasted....oh you bet you got my answer lol! Delicious!!!!

Fun atmosphere, good food and great service. I always order baby back ribs & beef ribs at every BBQ joint I visit. Bobby Q's is very good. You get a ton of food for your dinero. The sides were just okay for me though.

The absolutely best food ever, they acutally adjusted my bill for a YELP discount that I got while I was waiting for my food. My Reisling was rather expensive for St. Michelles, $12.00 the only way I was OK with it was the 10% coupon discount. St. Michelles usually runs 6.00 - 8.00 I have never paid 12.00 for this wine. That was the only disappointing part of the evening.

This place has amazing reviews so we finally decided to try this out and yes, it is definitely worth the Yelp hype. We were seated in the outdoor patio, perfect for the weather that night. The customer service was great and I have no complaints. 

Our meal started with complimentary cornbread. I'm not sure if I was just too hungry or what, but that has gotta be the best cornbread I've ever had in my life. And I don't even like cornbread. For my entree, I got the Southern Fried Chicken with a side of mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. Yuuuum. 

I will definitely be back here to try something that's actually barbecue. The prices are a bit high, but once in a while, I think this place is worth it.
Really good food and a really chill place and great customer service. My wife took me for my first time and loved it. I highly reccommend it

One of the most popular BBQ places around. When we're here, it's protein time! My boyfriend and I ordered the three meat combo (baby back ribs, beef brisket, pulled pork) with 2 sides (mac & cheese and fries); and we split the order between the two of us. The meat from the baby back ribs was super tender, and easily fell off the bone - just the way I like it. The beef brisket was also tender, and very flavorful. The pulled pork was extremely juicy, giving you that gratification when you bite into it. Two thumbs up on their meat. Nothing spectacular about the mac & cheese and fries though. 

Service was great. I was with some friends who have never been here before, and the waitress patiently explained the menu. She also made some good recommendations to them. I was very happy with her fast service, splitting the check amongst our group correctly and quickly getting out those togo boxes. 

The best part about having a full belly at the end of your dinner is getting free complimentary donuts. I can't say "no" to sugar donuts! Love this place.

Went here for my 50th birthday and had a very enjoyable night.  I had the Smoked Prime Rib w/Mac and Cheese and Potato Salad.  It had a wonderful flavor and was tender as well.  Perfectly cooked.

The place was just starting to get busy, but it in no way took away from the great service I had.  The place has a fully stocked bar, so I had to have a spicy Bloody Mary.  

I started with the Cajun Shrimp appetizer and the flavor was spot on.  The shrimp were juicy and delicious and it comes with like garlic bread sticks to sop up the wonderful juices in the bowl.  

To top the night off, I was presented with a Brownie Sundae with candle for my birthday!  (Totally unexpected and delicious)  

Only regret was not going back and getting some BBQ to take home with me.

Tuesday Night. Walked in at 830pm, left 945pm. From order to being served 15 min.

This place is NOT a chain. Support your local Phoenix BBQ restaurants.

One of the few places in Arizona that serves Beef Ribs. Cannot over-emphasize this point..better than Claim Jumper..not even close. Beef ribs have twice as much meat as pork ribs but are much harder to find in restaurants. 

They smoke all their meat on site and everything is super fresh. Melissa & Sawyer were fabulous and I really appreciated the 10% off for using YELP. 

The only downside is that because we sat close to the chicken rack in the back near the kitchen we wound up smelling like a campfire. However we didnt really notice this until after we left and went back to the outside. 

The cornbread starter and donut pastry ender was absolutely unexpected and refreshing. 

Beef Ribs = $22.00
12. Oz Sirloin = $12.00
2 Non Alcoholic Drinks
Total was $45.00 with 10% off..Extremely reasonable, high quality, totally full.

Im a little biased with my wife being the catering manager, but excellent food is excellent food and great service is great service. Being in the restraunt business I truly admire when the easy things are done right. Great service, excellent food and a clean store.
The best BBQ ever! Great atmosphere and amazing food. Highly recommended!
Omg the best bbq ribs I have had. Must try if you like juicy fatty ribs. I love the fat melting off the ribs.

Love this place! Great staff and wonderful service!  This is a carnivores Disneyland, the Brisket melts in your mouth and the Ribeye is made to order. Bring your appetite because these are healthy portions, BBQ is almost as good as mine...

Omg! This is a must for BBQ!
First of all ,I want to thank tommy, Dylan and manager Joanna for exceptional service and attentiveness in making our first visit memorable .
I've tried a lot of BBQ and wherever I travel I try to eat local BBQ . I usually can eat a whole slab myself and still have room for more , but not the case here.
We ordered the prime rib brisket with Mac and cheese and shoestring potatoes  and the full slab of St. Louis ribs with Mac and cheese with shoestring potatoes . We were also offered corn bread  free of charge. The brisket melts in your mouth and is so moist and tender I'm drooling right now. Most briskets ive tried get dry and chewy but not here . The ribs had the right char on the outside but the meat falls off the bone with the right smokiness and moist flavor. It was so meaty and filling I only ate 1/2 the slab. The Mac and cheese is very cheesy and filling and the shoestrings were addicting.
Asking for a doggy bag, tommy and Dylan added additional cornbread ,xtra BBQ sauce and a bag of fresh cinnamon donuts! Great experience and I'm going back again ! I usually ask for sauce on the side when eating meats to fully enjoy the flavor of the meat Do not drown meat in sauce

Bobby Qs has to be one of the better bbq joints around the Phoenix area. This has been our go to restaruant for years. The hostesses are friendly and prompt and work very hard to help patrons with whatever questions they have. The wait staff is super friendly to tourists like ourselves and although food comes slow it's worth the wait. I will say if you are vegan or vegetarian by any means stay away this is definetly a meat friendly environment haha! The only reason i did not rate a 5 is the location, althouh a spectacular building parking is a little awkward and getting to the restaurant via highway takes some work maneuvering. Go here for great bbq and friendly staff. Pre-warning make reservations (yelp is the go to) and go after 730 or before 3! 

Bobby Qs thanks for another great meal!

My favorite place. I have never had a bad experience. The Burgers are perfection. That's what I am having today. 

We sat outside and they warned us that there is a problem with flies in the morning but we set out here anyway. It is true but hey it's outside and the weather is great!

And they were so accommodating when we asked to move. It's just on the morning and not a big deal.
