I have been to many a bbq spot and Bobby Q is at the top. Here on vacation with family and everything we tried was soo good! Have to get the Q rolls to begin. Pulled pork and chicken....top shelf. Brisket melt in your mouth and bbq burger was so tasty (close to my favorite Hodads!). Cornbread as good as anywhere. Way to go Bobby Q!!

Wow, the best pulled pork sandwich I have ever had. I had the coleslaw as my side which was better than any other I can remember.     I've heard that the ribs and brisket are very good too.   Reasonable prices during happy hour.

They have a lounge/bar/dance club attached to the dining room and it was much nicer than I expected.  Our server said Tuesdays are their busiest nights in the lounge/dance club area, (Tuesdays nights WTF?)    Interesting mix of people when I was there on a Wed. night.   Not the Tempe crowd, or Scottsdale crowd, or even the downtown hipster crowd.  It's the METROCENTER crowd which is just a mix of regular city folk.

The food was awesome. We ordered the 3 meat combo with ST. Louis ribs, brisket and sausage. Everything was delicious and I loved their bbq sauce. The mac and cheese was good, it was almost too creamy for my liking tho and the baked potato was also good. All in all, a really good meal and our server was extremely nice and attentive. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 was because of the manager in the picture who greeted the customers to our left, skipped our table, table to our right, behind us, in front of us ..yeah, you get the idea. He introduced himself to everyone, checked how their meal was going, and asked if their server was taking care of them. But skipped right over us. Not saying he's racist, but....

I'm used to only hearing of Bobby Q as a club not as a restaurant. 
I was quite surprised to see the other side! The hostess sat us quickly and were friendly. The server was great, attentive but not too invasive. I ordered the no Bobby Q rolls as an appetizer and wow I loved them! It tasted like a bbq mini chimichanga with a side of bbq sauce! For my entree I had the bbq pulled poke sandwich with shoe string fries and it was delicious! The service is great, our table was cleared as we finished our meals, our drinks refilled and had the manager come around and ask how our meals were! 
I can't wait to go back and try more! 
Great job to the kitchen and staff!

Don't know what all the hype is about this establishment but here's my feedback: First off my wife had the Ribeye entree I specifically told our waiter (a young fellow) no pink on the ribeye & to have whom ever is cooking/grilling the ribeye to cut the meat to verify there are no pink, but my wife received her uncut ribeye & she only ate what's not pink (1/2 of the ribeye). I was eager to try the beef ribs & again I told the young fellow easy BBQ sauce on them beef ribs because I wanted to taste the meat & the smoke flavor. To our surprise none of them were meant to our expectations. The beef ribs are fall of the bone but too much BBQ sauce on them ribs & I couldn't even taste the smoked meat. Ask any bbq enthusiast the taste are in the meat not the sauce. I rather stick with Dillons KC style beef ribs at Arrowhead location where you can taste the meat. This establishment is my first & last.
Everything is great here. Food is wonderful and so is the service.  Great for special occasions too. And those fresh donuts are amazing.

I loooooove Bobby Q! I've been coming to this location for years now with my family. It's a hidden gem off the side of the highway.

You're started off with complimentary cornbread. BOY, OH BOY. IT'S SO GOOD. 

We ordered a family combo style type of meal. The ribs literally fall off the bone. My mouth is watering just remembering the ribs. The chicken is good, but I'm all about the ribs! We ordered both the baby back and St. Louis and both are highly recommended.

The only downside is the size of the sides. They're incredibly small! I wish they would consider a bigger portion of the sides.

Everyone also gets complimentary donuts made fresh at the end of your meal! They're so delicious. I would pick those over the desserts.

Awesome food....however I have history here...used to come here all the time when it was Bobby McGees...regardless...best BBQ I've had in a long time...brisket melts in your mouth sausage was great...well cooked baked potato...and the ranch beans...about the best I've ever had...oh...don't forget to try the house Amber Ale...made just for them...tasty addition to any BBQ dinner
Corn bread is to die for!! Word of caution if you're dieting;STAY AWAY!  this place corrupts anyone's healthy eating habits lol!
Excellent food. Atmosphere and service.  Been coming to this place since it was Bobby McGees.    Highly recommend

This is the second time here, the last time was many years ago, way before there was a yelp.   The food is good, and the service was great, Hunter (waiter) was very attentive to our table, even as busy as he was  good job hunter.  My wife and I shared the Whole Hog Heaven (48) it is a designed for 2, but it is enough food for 3 to 4 people.  every thing we got with it had good flavor.

My only complaint was the drink we order was a chocolate martini, sporting an Oreo cookie when served it was missing the Oreo,  Come to find out they where out of Oreo, now tell me if I am wrong but how hard would it to be if they went to the store and got a couple of bags of Oreo, or take it off the drink special sheet.  Now I will say when I said some thing to the manager walking around he did accommodate us and took it off the bill, but the reason I got the drink is because I have dip an Oreo in milk, but have never dipped in in vodka, I was bummed.

Loved the food, service and overall experience. Travis was the server he was really friendly, attentive and helpful. He recommended the brisket, corn bread and corn. Omg they were amazing! I would recommend them. We will definitely be back.

A girlfriend of mine wanted to give this place a try. I personally shy away from BBQ spots as they generally are overpriced, they over-sauce and under produce according to my BBQ standards. However, this place is good and I will definitely return. We decided on the Whole Hog Heaven as we are East Valley folk and although we plan on returning it may be a while, so a sample of everything is what we were aiming for. We chose the baby backs and St. Louis for ribs and sausage and brisket for our other meat options. For sides we ordered the Mac and Cheese, which was delicious by the way, fries, ranch beans and an extra side of roasted corn. The meal came with cornbread.  The food was delicious and plentiful. The ribs were tender, meat falling off the bones. The brisket was good but I have had better. The sausage was tasty but nothing spectacular. All of the sides were tasty. I left there with a full belly, a hefty to go bag and no compliant. I will be back.

I'm in Phoenix on business. A coworker suggested Bobby Q's, so I gave it a try. The St Louis ribs, Mac-N-Cheese and Potato Salad are life-changing!! I will be back in Phoenix, and Bobby Q's is on the top of my "must" list!!

My boyfriend and I decided on a last minute lunch date to Bobby Q's and it was fantastic! Tanner was our server and he did amazing. He was attentive and everything came out fast. Donny, the manager, was sure to stop by and say hi. Thank you guys for a great time.

Bobby Q's deserves it's excellent reputation! The food, ambiance and service were great. The server's suggestions totally met our tastes. I loved the baked potato with all the fixins and barbecued brisket. I drank a local beer and it was perfect for my taste.

This was our second visit and again they did a fantastic job. We ordered the Whole Hog Heaven which came with two types of ribs and two different meats and three different side items. We split it between the two of us and still had leftovers. At the end of the day Bobby Q has fantastic food, average service and a rich and interesting history!

Food is great, prices are not. Bobby Q's offers some delicious BBQ. Brisket, chicken, ribs, sausage, ALL delicious! However, I think it can be a little pricey around $15-20 a person with a non alcoholic drink. Waitresses are beautiful and friendly. It really is great BBQ though if you are willing to spring for it. Warning: Thurs nights are hip hop nights. It attracts a mixed crowd, and a lot of ghetto crowd. The restaurant does a good job of keeping them behaved though.

I cannot say enough positive things about this spot. My wife and I loved the ambiance and everything we ordered. The service was great. If there was a draw back it would be a little pricy but not too bad.

This is without a doubt the best BBQ place I have ever had the pleasure of visiting! Lucille's at Tempe Marketplace had been my favorite, but Bobby Q's is even better, and that's saying something! From the time you are seated, the staff are friendly and attentive, even when the restaurant is packed (which is always). The food is to die for, I've tried their ribs, and the pulled pork sandwich, both were superb! The cornbread is amazing, I have to remind myself to save room for the actual meal. Also, at the end of the meal, they bring you freshly-made, warm cinnamon-sugar donut holes to enjoy. It's a bit far out location-wise, especially if you are in the Tempe/Mesa area, but for the best BBQ in Arizona, it's worth the drive!

This place is the best. Customer service is amazing. The managers are great. I left my credit card and sunglasses here and they were returned to me the next time I came in to eat. Oh and you can't beat the corn bread and donuts. I love this place!
Our group had a wonderful lunch experience. Melissa was a great server, meeting our needs before we asked. The food came out quickly. The food was hot and flavorful.  Definitely will return.

Spacious facility for larger groups.  Loved lunching outside on the porch, covered but still having an outdoors feeling.  I had a great salad, Bobby's chicken with blue cheese that had chunks of cheese in the dressing.  Only negative was being able to hear what the person across the table was saying.

Cornbread? Yes, please! I love cornbread. This place is cool. We went for lunch and while it's decorated to look like a BBQ dive you can tell they wanted a "trendy dive" look if that even exists. I likes. 
First you get the cornbread, which is my favorite so I started off happy. I had a salad, but two people got BBQ. I know - who gets a salad the first time they go to a BBQ restaurant? That makes no sense. They liked the meats and I think my husband said "meh." about the sauce. The baby had mac and cheese which he loved (and I liked) and the chicken was also a winner. 

I have to say - donuts at the end of the meal? Um, no. Ugh, no.They tasted pretty heavy with oil and sure enough after about 2 minutes I had the worst stomach pain of my life. Just say no to the donuts, I beg you. Unless you plan ahead and  know you are going to have a donut and you save some room, otherwise they will put you over the edge, and I am saying that after having a salad! I have never been anywhere that gives you donuts for your ride home, so I guess that is original on their part, right?

Overall, I will go back, this place was fun! Next time, pulled pork.

Stopped over in Phoenix during our travels and enjoyed an excellent meal at Bobby Q's. We had the beef ribs which were 4 large bones, shoe string fries and roasted corn along with a wedge salad. Everything was delicious and plenty for the two of us. Our server Hal was the best. He spent some time with us so we felt right at home. Easy access right off the freeway and plenty of parking. A great dining experience.

Great smoked meats and large portions. Pulled pork and baby back ribs were excellent. Cole slaw with pecans was also very good, not as sweet as I was expecting. Had the q rolls for appetizer, I did not like these. Brisket with sauce wrapped in a tortilla and fried. Like a taquitos and I don't like taquitos.
Sat night at 6 seemed to be their busiest time.

Husband and I ate here for the first time this evening.  I have tried so hard to find good barbecue since moving to Surprise from Memphis 4 years ago, and nothing came even close to "good"!  But, Bobby Q has made me one happy gal!  Pulled pork and St. Louis ribs were outstanding!!!  So well smoked and tender!  Macaroni and cheese was the creamiest I have ever had.  Brooke, our server, was superb.  Very attentive and helpful without being a nuisance.  I highly recommend this restaurant, and have already started telling everyone I know just how excited I was with this barbecue!

Well we went to the soft opening yesterday and I must say.. this is the best BBQ that I have had here in AZ.. The meat was tender, veggies seasoned perfect, mashed potatoes on point.  The service was great (need to continue when you open on 3 Oct 16).  The location is perfect Stapley and the US 60.. we will be coming back.  Very nice meeting Bobby too, such a great guy doing wonderful things with this bbq
Delicious food! Best BBQ I've probably ever eaten. Great atmosphere and service! Reasonably priced considering portion size and quality! Will be back for sure!

I love the great selection of food. Clearly the barbecued is absolutely delicious, pulled pork. Love the sandwiches as well. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. At night on Thursdays and the weekends the club part, is off the hook!

My boyfriend and I have been here a few times now and we love this place!! Hands down the best baby back ribs we've ever had. We usually get the Q Rolls to start and split a whole rack of ribs and leave stuffed. The complimentary corn bread is also really yummy! The servers are also super friendly; every time we go I always make a comment to my boyfriend about how nice the servers were. We've taken friends and family here and they also love it!

I tried Bobby Q's on the reccomendation of Yelp.  You guys know your stuff and I do trust Yelp when it comes to searching out new places.  As I've said before, I am no bbq afficianado, I just know what I like.  It was a weeknight when we went so it was not super busy.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  I noted that there was a large bar area and thought that this place was probably a hoppin joint on a Friday or Saturday night.  

Our server was very pleasant and helpful.  I asked what she liked on the menu and she told me her favorite was the brisket but she recommended I try a combo.  I got brisket and ribs.  I started wih a salad which was tasty and fresh.  My meal arrived shortly after and our server was correct, the brisket was so tender it just melted in my mouth.  It had a nice flavor.  Now, on to the ribs....yet again, melt in your mouth, tender and flavorful.  My daughter was happy as a clam with her chicken strips.  So, why only three stars?  Well, I don't usually disclose things like this but about an hour after we got home, I made several trips to the comode.  I never have issues when I eat, ever.  Something did not sit right with me or something was not good.  Was it the salad?  Don't really know but it lasted for two days.   Suffice it to say that, if that happend to you, would you be leary to give a stellar review and go back soon after?  

Bobby Q's has a nice atmosphere, cozy and warm.  I loved the music that was playing......blues and old soul.  The service was great too.  The other issue that I had was the location.  If I did not have a GPS, I never would have found the place.  It's set back off the road and the signage is very small.  

Maybe I'll give it another try in a year or so.....when the two days on the comode is a faint memory.

Great place for a large casual group BBQ dinner pig-out session.

~$25 for a 2 meat plate with 2 sides

Cornbread - On the house! So moist and soft that it falls apart if you try to grab it with a fork. Perfect amount of sweet and bread-y taste.

Q-rolls - brisket inside a croissant roll, tasty.

Brisket - the brisket here is so amazing tasty with the most tender consistency. I love it here, I could eat a bunch of it. Highly recommend getting brisket.

Baby Back Ribs - Very tender, falls off the bone and great flavor in the sauce.

Donuts - On the house! Made fresh, extremely warm with cinnamon on the outside. It's just like a churro in a donut form, YUM.
If you ever want to eat bar-b-q any where else ever again do not eat here.  This place will ruin all other places for you.  Truly amazing food. A highlight of our trip to Phoenix.

Had a great experience, out server was attentive and always checked up on us. The manager even introduced herself to us , the atmosphere is great as well as the people . The food is amazing, fresh and great in taste , my boyfriend got the brisket, theres no need for a knife , you can basically pull it off. The fried chicken is crispy on the outside but juicy on the inside . The artichoke dip with the garlic bread is a must get , got a little kick to it. They even gave us doughnut balls coated in brown sugar on our way out. I'm definitely coming back

My wife and her parents came to Bobby Q's to celebrate a birthday.  My wife and I ordered the "Whole Hog Heaven" (Baby Back Ribs, Beef Ribs, Pork, Brisket, Mac & Cheese, and Potato Salad).  Our meal was simply amazing.  My wife said, "This is the best BBQ I have ever had".  The Brisket was absolutely amazing and the ribs fell off the bone.  My wife preferred the Baby Back Ribs over the Beef Ribs, but they were both excellent.  

Since we were celebrating a birthday, our waitress brought us a desert.  We ordered the Bread Pudding...it was AWESOME.
Worst place I've ever been the manager profiles people without knowing who they are! Get another job you prick!

Every time we have guests in town (and otherwise!) we always make a point to go to Bobby Q's.  Every single meal has been exceptional and our out of towners are blown away by the ribs and chicken.  There's a reason this is one of Yelp's Top 10 for Phoenix!  I've never had tender, juicy ribs like they make in my life.  

And every time we have to bring a side dish to a friends house for dinner, we pick up a pan of the Mac n Cheese and some corn muffins.  We're the most popular people at the party!  I'm thankful this little gem of a place is only a few miles from me!

Bobby Q's is the BEST BBQ restaurant in the valley. Better then Famous Daves. Better then Waldo's, in my opinion. This used to be Bobby McGee's in the 90's and they would have live band and dancing there. I went there with my wife, mother-in-law and daughter. We didn't make reservations because we didn't know you had to until we had called them that day. At the time, they weren't taking anymore reservations until after 8pm and that was too late for us. It was only 3:30p at the time. The woman on the phone said the wait time was about 45mins, so we went anyways. We got there around 4:00pm and put our names on the list. They said they would call us when the table was ready. I kind of missed the little pagers we usually get at Cheesecake Factory and other restaurants, but personal service is still nice too. So I waited 30mins, checked the list and there were still 2 groups ahead of us. Check again at 45mins and still one group ahead of us. The hostess apologized and explained that customer with reservations would get seated first, which made sense, but I was getting hungry. Finally 55mins in we got seated (near the kitchen door) and was able to order drinks immediately as we looked over the menu. They had some specials, so I got the Prime Rib/Lobster Tail with 2 sides for $30. I got the Mac & Cheese and Corn I believe. I can't remember what everyone else got, but I know they loved the food. They brought out warm corn bread, which was moist, sweet and great with butter. My wife and mother-in-law loved their alcoholic drinks. I got lemonade which was excellent as well. The meals came after about 15mins. The prime rib simply melted in your mouth. It was delicious. The Mac & Cheese was perfect. Nice and creamy and cheesy, just like how I make it. My wife tried mine and loved it. I tried her bake beans and even those were incredible. The corn was also good, Even the coleslaw that I tasted was very tasty. The lobster, we juicy and I doused it in the butter for another bite. It was cooked perfectly. I tried my wife's Baby Back Rib and they were smokey, moist and incredible with the BBQ sauce. I couldn't believe how good everything was. The waitress came back and forth to our table at least 6-7 times during the meal to see if there was anything else we needed. Very friendly and courteous. My daughter, who's only 2.5yrs loved everything, especially the mac & cheese since she loves cheese. Definitely one of the best BBQ meals I've ever ate. I will probably get the Brisket or Baby-Back Rib the next time I go. If you have BBQ and Steak, this is the place to go. It was definitely worth the wait and the kitchen door didn't even bother me because I was enjoying the food. I forgot a couple things. i forgot to mention the appetizers. They give you a lot for the appetizers. We got the BBQ wings and Artichoke/Spinach dip and it was fabulous. some places will give you 5-6 wings for appetizer, but we got like twice that amount and it was delicious. At the end of the meal they give you soft delicious donuts for free. 5 stars from me here.

The Bobby Q staff is serious about customer service. This is one of the warmest and friendliest restaurants you could hope to find, with -exceptional- bbq. I've had better sausage, but the brisket here, smoked for 18 hrs, is astounding. Our waitress suggested the local Bobby Q amber craft, and while I was skeptical and figuring it would be meh, it turned out to be a perfect compliment to the food. I can't wait to try some steaks and ribs!

Great service! Waiter was friendly and knowledgable, special touches like the extra BBQ came out heated in an insulated craft my drink was in a pineapple fun stuff like that . The brisket was absolutely the best I have ever had and the Mac and cheese was pretty awesome too ! Big portions so bring your appetite !
Food was Excellent. Highly recommend this place. The service was average but the food made up for it. Only thing to note is the dark lighting in some parts of the restaurant.

Shelley Sikora has to be one of Phoenix's most passionate restaurateurs. She has a remarkable history managing a restaurant empire and also has more than one published cookbook. She was one of 34 U.S. chefs chosen to appear in the 2006 IACP cookbook, "For the Love of Food". Her newest cookbook called "Skinny Bread", 100 Amazing Ways to make Flatbread. I'm looking forward to reading.

Bobby Q's serves up authentic dry rubbed meats cooked to perfection, and spicy sauces. Walking in, it feels very comfortable. The decor has always been outstanding for the past twenty years. The attentive service is solid.

I could rave about dinner but let me just say, this house is in the top 5 'best BBQ' In AZ. Want to be #1 on my list, let's have live Blues. And I almost forgot to mention the cornbread and donuts.
Delicious! Got a flight of the local brew and the beef brisket. Nice atmosphere.  Good service

I was amaze of of high rating but was a bit disappointed. 

Ambience:  for a bbq place.  The interior has a fine dining steak house feeling to it with a southwestern dining on the outside seating area.  A good family friendly restaurant.

Service: Definitely has a welcome feeling to it. Waiter was good, but the manager was better and more considerate.  Our food came out on a timely manner ...but when we ask for bbq sauces, it took a while.  However, the Sauces was worth waiting for....

Food: Complimentary cornbread was great! It was soft, moist, and had a cake texture. It would have been better if was hot instead of room temperature.  We order the artichoke appetizer... The bread stick was perfectly toasted with garlic herb butter, but the dip itself was too heavy cheesy.  As for the bbq... I wished it was hot.  It was lukewarm, but not hot enough to bring out the full bbq experience.  The meat was smoke very well that left no greasy fatty taste, but the sauces is the best part.  All the meats was overly cooked so it did not stay intact very well. In the end, everything tasted like pull pork.

Overall, because of the temperature of the food and the overcooked meats, I rated it as 3 stars.

Bobby Q is now my favorite restaurant in Phoenix after my first visit.   The atmosphere was rustic, fun, and barbequey, the food was awesome, and the service was attentive.   I had the pulled pork and brisket...wonderful.   The mac and cheese side was certainly the best mac and cheese I've ever had...super thick, rich and smooth.  The bill for 2 with 2 beers and one premium cocktail was $50...AWESOME value!  Super highly recommended!!!

We are in Phoenix dog sitting and visiting restaurants we made note of watching Check Please Arizona on PBS.  Bobby Q was our first stop on our list and the food was wonderful. We ordered the Pulled Pork and Brisket Sandwiches with Pecan Cole Slaw and Mac & Cheese for sides. It all lived up to the review. The meats were tender, moist and the sides complimented the meat really well. 
The 4 Stars is for the fact that I had to get up and find our Server to ask for more BBQ Sauce because the sandwiches were served with barely a touch of sauce.  
The bag of To-Go Doughnuts they give you at the end of the meal would of jumped our overall Review Score to 4 1/2 Stars, but Yelp doesn't give you that option.
Amazing. Definition of BOTH, melts in your mouth AND falls off the bone. Wish I would've tried it sooner.
Holy Shiznit! Food was AMAZING!!!  Pulled Pork, Ribs and Brisket were off the hook! You MUST get the Mac & ChZ! Save room for their little donuts....puts a Churro to Shame!!!

Wow!!! I must say I put them to the test and they passed with flying colors! Let's start at the beginning...We came at the worst time of the day for food quality & service in the restaurant world 3:45pm. We were greeted by the manager he was very polite & the server Ann quickly came over with a big smile to introduce herself. I quizzed her on vodka drinks she nailed it! Our food came out and was hot, fresh, and delicious! The portions sizes were perfect, meaning my eyes are bigger than my stomach and they didn't disappoint, leftovers!!!!! I had the baby back ribs and the meat fell off the bone, clean...  the mac & cheese and the corn were seasoned just right. My dish was very flavorful. My daughter had the pork sandwich and every time she took a bite she groaned, keep in mind we eat out EVERYDAY for ALL of our meals & we are PICKY!! No complaints. The cleanliness of the bathrooms and dining room were excellent! Ann was very attentive and the manager even checked on us to make sure we were enjoying everything. Definitely on the top of our restaurant list! Great Food, Great Service.
Delicious! The smoked pork flaked off like butter. The gift bag of donuts given at the end of the meal was a nice treat! Highly recommend!
Very good. Cornbread was excellent. Appetizer-Q rolls on point. Baby back ribs were meaty and tender. Pulled pork reminded me of home. I'll be back.

In town for a few days so I decided to check out this highly rated BBQ place. Killer environment and great service!

I really enjoyed my brisket plate with mac n cheese, Brisket didn't have too much fat and had great smoke rings. Mac n cheese was homemade and super fresh. 

Finished it off with complimentary dessert donuts! I'll definitely come back to this place!

Baffled at the ratings this place gets.  The ambiance is nice, and it would be a fun place to go with a group of friends for drinks and "pre-gaming it" before going out.

But...

My family and I are rib lovers, and in no way shape or form did Bobby Q make the grade.  

The waiter touted them as smoking "all of their meats" for over 18 hours.  I almost fell of the booth, because you smoke meat that long either it's going to get bitter from the amount of creosote building up, or at the very least it'd be overcooked (well, perhaps except for pulled pork).  Ribs can tolerate about 5 hours.  His hyperbole was obvious.  Perhaps some people get really excited when they hear this line, because it's supposed to sound impressive.    

I ordered the St. Louis style spares, and parents ordered the baby backs.  All of the ribs were overcooked and mushy ("falling off the bone").  The spares were actually better cooked than the babys, which isn't saying much.  Interestingly enough, the babys were very fatty, in fact my Dad was spitting out pieces of fat.  Spares were not as bad (go figure, given it's usually the other way around).  We are not "fat shy" but this was really excessive.  The rack was not trimmed properly.

The ribs tasted smoked, although not an overly pronounced smoke ring.  Definitely not smoked 18 hours.

People freak about the Mac & Cheese here, but it's really nothing special.  Creamy and they certainly use processed cheese (which isn't always bad), but nothing more.  I really liked the beans - not too sweet.

In short, I could see how the other offerings on the menu may be good, and given the ambience and service another experience with different food may give better ratings, but ya gotta do your ribs well if you are going to call yourself a BBQ restaurant.

Once again, the lack of good BBQ in Phoenix continues to amaze me.

As a side note, we had leftover ribs.  I came home with my parents and was about to take them in the house.  My parents said, "you really aren't going to eat those, are you"?  I said, "probably not".  Into the trash they went.

We went here for lunch when we were out in Scottsdale for a debauchery filled spring training trip. We got a recommendation from a friend to try this place out and it didn't disappoint.

We got the Q-Rolls to start (brisket filled) which come with a chipotle dip. These were solid.

I ordered the full rack of baby backs and split it with my buddy who got a two item combo with brisket and pulled pork. The ribs were fall off the bone tender and had great flavor. The brisket was phenomenal as well. The pulled pork was good but the weakest of all the items we had.

Best part of the lunch was not losing on credit card roulette at the end. If/when I make it back to the Phoenix area I will definitely be coming back.

I really love this spot. One of the few Phoenix restaurants definitely worth going out of your way for. Smoasted chicken is fantastic along with the baby back ribs. Deep wood flavor infuses most grilled items. Patio is lovely Oct-May.
The food and service is really one for the ages. Great service and the food is delicious! Very well priced for some good food. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

I don't think this place needs anymore reviews and I'm sure everything has already been said.
This was fantastic and great for the money spent. The service was also top notch. Loved the cornbread before the meal, the Mac and cheese was delicious and the meat was tender and flavorful! Not much more you can ask for! Winner winner!!

Bobby Q BBQ. Clever. The restaurant had me at the name but it didn't hurt that they made Yelps 100 places to eat list. What does one do when they find themselves in Phoenix for the first time ever? Head over to Bobbie Q, of course. I came here for one reason and one reason only. Baby back ribs. I do love my baby backs. There is a pretty large parking lot to fit all the hungry BBQ lovers in one place. As I walked in and smelled the smoky goodness, the hostess in the front handed my party of three a bag of freshly made cinnamon sugar donuts while we waited a few short minutes for a table. Like a child who's been offered desert before dinner, I gleefully followed the hostess to our table whilst munching on my sugary donuts. Our waiter took our drink orders and I decided on the baby backs with a side of potato salad and mac and cheese. 

After what seemed like a forever of eyeing and sniffing my neighbors meals, our plates came out. The full rack of baby backs were huge. The photo does not do it justice. Talk about a bang for your buck! They smelled amazing as the smokey aroma filled my lungs. I went in with my knife and realized how easy the cut was. There is hours of love put into these ribs because the first bite just melted in my mouth. The best thing about these ribs...they are not overly sauced. You can ask for extra BBQ and add as needed, but the meat is not masked with sauce. I got through about half of the tender rack of ribs before I realized that I still had two bowls piled high with mac and cheese and potato salad. I used the complimentary corn bread with butter to create potato salad and mac and cheese sammies and inhaled my sides. The mac and cheese was so creamy with a distinct sharp cheddar flavor. I wish that the cheese was a little more gooey than creamy, but the flavors where there. The potato salad had good flavor and great textures. It paired really well with the sweet cornbread. Heads up, this place won't do you well if you are on the diet. This is one cheat meal you will not regret. 

The service was pretty impressive. Our waiter gave suggestions and replaced our drinks with new ones before we finished the original. Our food was served hot and when we were tipping over from being too full, he brought out to go boxes to pile our leftovers in. One of the managers was walking around in the restaurant and checking on tables throughout our meal. We gave kudos to the chef when he asked us about our experience. I didn't imagine Phoenix to be known for BBQ, but I was not disappointed with what I got. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating (with a sprinkling cooling system) with big enough tables to feel at ease. As I walked out, another bag of cinnamon donuts were handed to me and I vouched to be back. 5/5 overall experience!

This is definitely THE best barbecue joint in all of Phoenix. My out of town family even raves about Bobby q's and has to visit every time they are in town. My husband and I normally split the whole hog and get the Cajun shrimp as an appetizer. I'm not a shrimp fan but these shrimp are amazing. I can't get enough of them, the sauce they are in is sooooooo good. The whole hog, we normally get ribs and double brisket. The brisket is amazing, ribs are delish and even the pulled pork is awesome. We love the cornbread and the 'to go' donuts as well. If you haven't been here before you MUST try. I can't recommend it enough

This place was OK. I was surprised about the overwhelming amount of positive reviews, so I had to check it out for myself. I'm not from the South but I know when great food is great, and this place is good, but not great. The St. Louis ribs are better than the baby backs, which are a little too sweet. The mac and cheese was nothing to write home about -- it almost tasted from the box, but not as orange in color. Two friends who had the beef brisket said it was OK but too mushy. I got the peach cobbler, which was mediocre (and seemed like it had been microwaved hot). It's a far way to go for OK bbq, in my opinion. 

Most of us at the meal thought this place was fairly expensive as BBQ joints go. It was $17 for a two-meat sampler, and apps were about $7-8.

We visit our niece in Phoenix several times a year and always visit Bobby Q. While it is pricy, the service is spot on, food is spot on and the wait staff and bussers have that obvious "we're family"  camaraderie  found at the high end restaurants I've worked in before. Everyone is helpful to us as guests, the staff is helpful to each other, good service training shows! This time we are here for the 4th of July, where else but here for our meal? Nicole helped get information to us prior to our arrival, Victoria helped get everything organized the day of. Thanks for helping to make our day special!

grabbed a full rack of ST LOUIS RIBS and some sides at the carryout window. they were fall-off-the-bone tender -- i like my ribs a bit more toothsome but BOBBY Q's delivers on the whole tender promise. nice smokey flavor and both sauces were tangy and full flavored without being too sweet.

the sides were tasty. the potato salad was nearly as good as mine (which is very good) and the mac-n-cheese was creamy and rich.

the ladies at the counter were as nice as can be. next time i'm in the PHOENIX area, i'm gonna make a point of having a sit down experience at BOBBY Q's. 

maybe i'll even try the brisket and pulled pork ...

Love this place the food is amazing. The free corn bread is awesome and the free donuts for desert are awesome as well. Staff is always nice. Only somewhat down size is that's it's really dark some times hard to see the wonderful food.

Went on a Friday night. Went to the bar/happy hour while waiting about 40 mins for our dinner table, for a party of 3. The outside bar area patio seating was soaked because of leaking misters. And inside the bar was insanely loud.

Food was good. I had the roasted chicken and I wouldn't order it again...I'd try something else. It wasn't cold, but it wasn't fresh off the grill hot either. Baked potato was delicious, and roasted veggies were great. Corn bread was great. The food definitely tasted home-cooked. Not too greasy, and not too fatty. My meal was $13, almost the cheapest main course option. Nor sure it's worth the price.

I would have only given Bobby Q's 2 stars, but the servers were awesome - they were attentive and fast, and they gave our table an extra bag of mini-donuts for free. I give an extra star for that.

If I'm not paying, I'll gladly visit Bobby Q's again one day.

Looking for great BBQ in Phoenix, look no further. You can smell their food from down the street, and my stomach was rumbling just from reading the menu! So many choices (get a sampler we did!). You get a generous helping of the different BBQ meats PLUS sides & corn bread. The ribs were outstanding so tender, sauced perfectly, and finger licking good! You can get mixed drinks here if you want & desserts looked amazing but we were too full to get any this time out.

This has and will always get a great rating from me... the food is always OUTSTANDING.. the atmosphere is always  WELCOMING...and the service is always GREAT!!! My buddy had never been and since having dinner here with me last week... he's already been once... Keep up the AWESOME WORK!!!

Visiting from California with my boyfriend from Texas...and this Bar-B-Q passed the taste test !! Great waiter and the-manager checked on us to see how we liked the food. 
We will be back ...thank you

Went to Phoenix on business and I wanted to take an associate out for lunch. He always talks about how much he loves BBQ ribs so I did a search on Yelp and decided on Bobby Q. They did not disappoint. Not only was the entire meal one of the best BBQ I ever had, but they took 10% of the bill for mentioning Yelp. How cool is that? Great place, great waitresses and phenomenal ribs and sides...

Bobby-Q is a pretty good place for...you guessed it, BBQ.  The brisket's pretty good and tender.  The portion sizes are large so you won't go home hungry.  The place is quite big so there's plenty of seating including outdoors for those balmy summer nights.  And if you get bored, you can go check out the club/lounge in back of the restaurant.

Kind of gimmicky but not a bad place.
This barbecue is not what it's hyped to be. Not a candle to little miss BBQ. Not the flavor or tenderness we'd want from barbecue. Don't waste your time.

Bobby Q.... You have officially ruined BBQ for me. Nothing will ever be as good and I live too far away to get to enjoy this pure heaven again in the near future so now I am deprived of amazing BBQ.... All because of Bobby Q. 

I just left another BBQ place (this time in Atlanta, Georgia) and due to my now high standards for BBQ I must say I was severely disappointed :( I am currently sitting in the parking lot of a mediocre BBQ joint with extremely high reviews from the locals lamenting over the loss of Bobby Q to my boyfriend. 

I forgot to mention in my last review that not only was every single item that we ordered from the menu spot on but Ann, our waitress, also gave us mini funnel cake like donuts to go... ON THE HOUSE. I mean come on guys... No one does that!! 

To sum thing up... I have just been across America and back... Literally... and Bobby Q is the only restaurant that had such a lasting impression on me that I just HAD to come back and write an update for. My only question for them is CAN YOU OPEN A LOCATION ON THE EAST COAST PLEASE!!!!!
Great food and lots of it.  It is amazing, and the ribs are wonderful & all the different sides, everything & great desserts, mgr & staff are wonderful.

BOBBY Q'S. was just ranked among the TOP 30  BBQ  restaurants in the US! 

Need I say more?

Miracles do happen! I'm blown away by the kindness of strangers from this restaurant! My dear friend (71 yr old) Millie lives in Phoenix (AZ) and is home bound ---her bday is tomorrow 9/21. She has been craving BQ from this restaurant all summer long! I called this restaurant (from Ashland, OR) and begged if they could please deliver food to Millie. This restaurnt only delivers for large catering job.  Not only did this place deliver her food----they gave her BQ ribs, brisket, baked potato (all the fixings), baked beans, their famous mac & cheese, cinnamon donuts, banana cream pie with a pink candle ---FOR FREE!  I also happen to mention that Millie did not even have milk in her house --- so they delivered her big cups of milk.  The delivery person's name was Jason (coincidence---just like her adoring son) and he so kindly made her a plate of food and put the rest of the food in her refrig. He even texted me a  picture so I could see my dear dear friend, Millie. I am touched by the kindness of strangers----KUDOS and heart blessings to The Managers - Joe, Rennie, Jason, the amazing chefs, and the owners of BobbyQ's Restaurant in Phoenix----THANK YOU ALL ---- !  This is truly a random act of kindness!  

Please---If you are ever are in Phoenix - try this place ---- tell them Millie sent you!  Eat savory BQ in honor of a woman that can no longer walk. 

 http://www.bobbyq.net

THANK U---I can't stop crying---you made her birthday so special !!!!  

KINDNESS TRULY DOES MATTER!!!!  I am so so touched!  Bless all you who made ths amazing food====and Millie's day so special.  

I have posted this on Facebook and yelp. I am ever so grateful.

Service is impeccable and the food is delicious with great portions! The drinks are great, the free donuts on your way out are a nice touch! If anyone asks me for great BBQ I send them to Bobby Q's no questions asked.
We travel from Vegas to Phoenix 3-4 times a year and eat here everyday. Food is great and service is OUTSTANDING!! Taylor the manager remembers us every time. He's phenomenal.

We had dinner there with our 2 year old daughter. The food was delicious. I highly recommend the Q rolls as an appetizer. Our waitress was very friendly, honest and knowledgeable about the menu. The manager asked how our meal was and noticed our daughter was getting restless. He told us it would be fine to let her run around. Obviously a kid friendly place! We also noticed the manager comped food for an active military man in his uniform. Can't get better than that!
Delicious food and great service!! The portions are huge and they have the best corn bread!

This was the best BBQ I've had in my life. Celebrated 55th birthday. Got the whole hog heaven, and it was! Service was great. The waitress and the manager were very helpful and welcoming. Told them that they needed to open one in LA! Beef brisket and mac and cheese are great. It was all great. Didn't do the q-rolls because I wanted to fill up on the meat, which I did. You won't be disappointed with this place!

Went on Yelp yesterday looking for dinner idea.  Bobby Qs popped up, and sounded good.  Made reservation for 630pm, walked in and seated us immediately.  Server was sweet and prompt.  Tried the Q rolls which were delicious, but the chipotle dip was weak.  We both ordered chicken, and portions were huge!  Two meals each out of both entrees. My only negative comment is their prices for cocktails.  Vodka Paloma was $12!!  Way over priced.... only reason I didn't order a second.  Completely enjoyable evening!

Based on a very high recommendation from a friend, we made a reservation for the night that we flew into Phoenix for a guys golf/Spring training trip.  We could not have been more pleased with this decision.

We were seated promptly for our 7:30 reservation.  Our waiter (so sorry I forgot his name) conversed with us as he took our order - asked what we ere doing in town, where we were going, etc.  He answered our questions and made recommendations.

Two of the guys shared the Hog Heaven, two ordered the St Louis ribs and I ordered the beef ribs.  We also ordered the Q Rolls as an appetizer.  They Q Rolls were incredibly delicious (order this!) and even though the dinner portions were large, at the end of the meal everything was gone.

One of the managers (Jack) came by a number of times to see how we were doing and converse about the history of the restaurant, where we were golfing, what baseball games we were seeing, etc.  The personal touches made us feel very comfortable and welcome.

Then they topped it all off with a small bag of donuts and sent us on our way.  Wish we could have come back but our time there was packed.  But next time we're in Phoenix, you can bet we'll be by.
Bobby Q's is one of my favorite restaurants I have been to in Phoenix. The meat is always flavorful and tender; the rotisserie chicken is the BEST I have ever had.

We had great service & the ribs were delish. It was extremely busy & parking was a trick...not to mention it's in kind of a run down area. That seems to be how Phoenix is though. Was too full to order dessert but they brought us mini donuts at the end anyway - so yummy!

Okay, hard for me to give 5 stars to a casual restaurant but I totally agree with the overall Yelp rating that this place is 4.5 stars for food.  First time visit and have been meaning to go for 10 months since moving to PHX.  I got the Baby back ribs, potato salad & grilled veggies.  Ribs were great with little fat or gristle.  Pot. salad is awesome.  Two of my friends had the fried chicken (boneless) with chicken gravy.  I kept poaching their chicken, mac cheese and mashed potatoes. Corn bread is tasty but crumbles too easily for me.  Desserts were good.  

Definitely will be going back this summer a few times to this place.  I was in NC on vacation two weeks ago and ate at two BBQ places and they pale in comparison.

Great service and food. The complimentary cornbread is very warm and tasty. Manager Donnie was great and came over to make sure everything was great. Our waitress Tylor was wonderful. She brought us our beverages and kids meal right away. Brisket platter was very good. 
We also enjoyed the donuts for dessert. Everyone seems so happy and wanting to make sure the experience is great.
Can't say enough good about this place, ambiance, service, quality and taste of food, loved, loved, loved it! Price was also very reasonable!

We were driving by Phoenix and stopped by for a quick dinner. Two of us shared the Saint Louis ribs and the brisket, with coleslaw, Mac and cheese, grilled veggies, beans, corn bread, and frozen lemonade. The meat was tasty, and the grilled veggies and corn bread were perfect. I could've done without the Mac n cheese and beans. Travis took great care of us. He checked on us throughout the meal and sent us home with a refill of the frozen lemonade and a sweet donut treat to go. He went above and beyond in service and in creating a fantastic dining experience.

Great food. The waitstaff is also very nice. Their beef ribs are the best I've ever had. The ribs were the meatiest I've ever eaten. I've had ribs at other places where the meet was skimping on them. But Bobby Q's beef ribs were excellent! You can actually pull the tender meat off of the ribs with a fork and knife.

Beyond a doubt, my family's favorite restarurant in Phoenix.  Nicole was an outstanding waitress addressing all of our needs before they ever occurred.  As my youngest says (who's birthday it was), "This is the best meal I've ever eaten and my most favorite restaurant."  Believe it or not, that is the first time he's ever said such a thing.  I'm looking forward to my next meal at Bobby Q's!

Thank you Taylor & Luke B for your hospitality and great service. The food was amazing, thank you for everything. This was our 1st time, but will continue to be our favorite in Arizona. Alex & Marty Q

I have literally been here about 15 times or so and this place never disappoints.  In my opinion, this is the best restaurant in Phoenix.  I have tried the baby back ribs and burgers many times and I don't see how it could be any better.  The service is also outstanding and the atmosphere is great.  I would go crazy if Bobby Q ever closes.

Oh man, Yelp did not disappoint me during a weekend trip to the Phoenix area with this place. First of all, they warm you up with free cornbread whilst you decide on what kind of grilled flesh you'd like to consume; it's served with a side of butter but TOTALLY not needed...the cornbread is warm, soft, and buttery as it is. 

On to the main stuff - promove if there's just two of you dining would be the Whole Hog Heaven deal for $38: pick from two meats off of a list of four (the ladyfriend and I picked the beef brisket and sausage), two rib selections out of three (we rolled with the beef ribs and St. Louis-style), and three sides from their list (went with grilled veggies, mac and cheese, and shoestring fries). The brisket had that wonderful, beefy flavor - tender and moist on this particular occasion. Sausage was sausage; nothing spectacular. The beef ribs were good; they were decently sized and definitely meaty. However, we enjoyed the St. Louis-style ribs; these too weren't the pinnacle of ribdom, but these were also tender and delicious. As for the sides: grilled veggies - good, wish we had more; shoestring fries - they were fries; mac and cheese - too cheesy.

Why five stars? Great service, great deal for the amount of food we got, and, as many have noted, WARM DONUTS BEFORE YOU LEAVE. We didn't know about that part until we passed on dessert and received the check. If you feed me a good meal for a good price and give me a fresh treat at the end...well, you're a winner in my book.

Its been a little while since we went to Bobby Q.The food was great so I have no problem there at all,Service was alright I have nothing derogatory to say..However the condiments have a lot to be desired.There were 6 people and they brought 2 baskets of bread no problem and 2 butters in what you could call a cough medicine size cups.The same thing happened when we asked for ketchup 3 of us requested it and again they bring 2 small cough medicine size cups.(keep in mind) You have 2 teenagers and an adult.who like to eat.We asked for a bottle but were told they don't put them out.This is not an inexpensive eatery so when it comes to the condiments there should be no skimping on butter and ketchup..Sorry to say haven't been back since that dinner

Great food our waitresses Destiny was very helpful. It was my first time here. She went over the menu with us. Answered any questions we had. The spinach dip is scrumptious. I ordered the bqq baked potato with chicken and a side of grilled vegetables delicious. I will definitely be returning.
Stopped by here while at Spring Training, food was delicious, will definitely be back for their BBQ! Service wasgreat too, very friendly :)

It's our first time in Phoenix and we decided to visit Bobby Q to check it out. I made our reservation from yelp and it worked very well. We even received a 10% discount for checking in thru yelp.

Our meal started with delicious complimentary cornbread. I don't think I have enough words to describe how delicious ALL the food that we ordered specially the BRISKET and Chicken BBQ!
Bobby Q exceeded our expectations! They also have generous portion its good for sharing and worth every buck! HIGHLY recommended for your BBQ cravings!

This gem is right by our house, easy access and delicious food. I had no idea it was so fun, too. The bartender was a delight and she was quick to check on us and always offered suggestions on food. I loved it! We'll be back!

We were visiting from Chicago and walked to this spot because it was close to the hotel. We were very happy to see the great AZ atmosphere and delicious menu! Our food was excellent and our service was even better! Our server Nicole was great and on top of her game! If I am ever back in AZ I will make sure to stop here again!

Reservations - Open Table but not needed.

Service - Really nice.

Food - Good but not freakin amazing.
1. Baby Back Ribs - Very tender and meaty.
2. Brisket - Very very good.  Fatty, tender and flavorful.
3. Pulled Pork - Awful and dry.
4. Cornbread - Decent
5. Mac and Cheese - I like mine a little more dry so this was great.
6. Pecan Coleslaw - Boring
7. Potato Salad - Really good
8. Donuts - Nice extra touch.

This place has some of the best barbecue food I have ever eaten. The meats were delicious, cornbread and corn were phenomenal. The manager came by to make sure we were having a good experience. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. Special kudos goes to Patrick and Kody who were not only excellent at their job, but very easy on the eyes. I will definitely be going here again and make sure to ask for Patrick, you will not be disappointed.

Travis treated us like royalty from the start to the end of our family dinner for four. He made terrific recommendations and even let us sample some of the sides so we could make just the right choice with our meals. The brisket was delectable, the steak tender and tasty, the ribs were moist and meaty. We simply loved the cornbread and the Q rolls. Travis kept our drinks freshened, but never hovered or made us feel uncomfortable as we enjoyed our meal and family celebration. We are already planning our next visit and plan to ask for Travis by name.
Their food is amazing. The Q lounge is awesome. I'd definitely recommend this place for dinner or a good night out!

Oh my GOODNESS!!! 

Hands down the best BBQ!  

Amazing customer service! Had a small issue with the cornbread and the manager came out himself to talk to us and apologize and re

Oh my goodness!! I am not a big meat eater and this place was fantastic!!! We got the pulled pork,pulled beef, coleslaw, corn slaw and corn bread. So so so so good!!! I definitely recommend this place and will come back on my next trip to Arizona!
Great food, the complimentary donut holes they provide at the end of each meal are delicious. The food is pretty damn great, too. I would recommend that you try the BBQ brisket and pulled pork.

Went for first time tonight. The food was awesome. We ordered "whole hog heaven". Had more than enough food for 2. Could have possibly served 3. The ribs fell off the bone. The brisket melted in your mouth. The service was great. Have nothing but good things to say.

Holy Jesus it feels like I'm back in Texas when I'm eating here.  Bobby Q's has the best barbeque in Arizona, hell in the world.  I'm from Texas so I'm kinda picky when it comes to brisket, but Bobby Q's is the only place that does brisket justice in Arizona.  Check this place out!

Q- rolls, golden cornbread and pure 100% meaty BBQ - topped it off with a delicious frozen cocktail. We each ordered a two meat entree: pulled pork, beef ribs, and brisket - WOW!!! Sides of ranch beans, macaroni and cheese and shoestring fries - AMAZing. We've been in AZ 6 years and finally gave this place a go without 0 regrets. We will be back!!

I love Bobby Q! The food is delicious. We went tonight, knowing it would be busy, and waited over 40 min to be seated at a high top table in the bar. We had a great server who was very friendly and attentive. Got our waters quickly, followed by the delicious cornbread. I usually order the pulled pork, but this time I decided to get the pulled bbq chicken sandwich with mac & cheese. Didn't take long to get our food. Requested the regular BBQ sauce. The food was good, especially the mac & cheese which is very rich and yummy. Was interesting to see some vapor coming in from a fog machine in the adjacent club. I like the moist towelettes they give you to clean your hands after the meal. And perhaps the best part? The mini donuts! Our server even brought us some extra and offered to get us waters to go. The donuts were hot and scrumptious. Mmm mm! I think they raised their prices since the last time we came, but it's still a good value. Be prepared to leave full and happy.
It was awesome. We had the prime rib and ribs. The were tender and very tasty.  The pecan slaw was very good too.  Our server Victoria did a lovely job too. Highly recommend
BBQ brisket and baby back ribs were delish!  My favorite part of the meal was the skinny crispy fries.  Portions are big - be careful how much you order.  Will be back.

This used to be a Bobby McGees, which the waitress will probably tell you its your first time here.Soon after getting settled in, a basket of cornbread, along with soft, whipped butter, landed on the table, & it was incredibly good . We got the breaded fried catfish, and the  baby back ribs which are  my favorite. The food was very tasty and price is pretty average for a combination platter . For our sides we went with the ranch beans, bake potato , and mac n cheese. The sauces My baby back ribs were delicious, but they are too fall off the bone if you get my point. I prefer ribs that still cling to the bone, but can be pulled off easily as well. To each their own. were amazing and the portions are ridiculously small . Other than that I wish I would got more of your breaded fried catfish it was delicious, but one piece of catfish not going to cut it for me. And the doughnuts at the end are just the perfect touch.  Will return maybe .

If you like BBQ, this is probably the best place I've been to in phoenix.


If you have ever been to Lucille's BBQ in California or tempe it is comparable. Been there about 5 times and everything is good. They have large group deals making it pretty cheap. Also right when you walk in you see a donut making machine, and they give you donuts when you finish your meal which is awesome. Freshly baked and very fluffy. 

I come back often

Passing through Phoenix, we naturally turned to yelp for what to get. Bobby Q seemed to be a popular option is we decided to go for it. And it did not disappoint.

Went around noon on a Saturday and it wasn't too too packed. There's a nice outdoor area with lights and a fountain of sorts. (would try to avoid the back - sometimes there's one or tow more flies flying around). 

We got the hogs heaven (a family style mix and match) and got the brisket, St Louis ribs, pork and ribs with a couple of sides. And wow it was amazing. Everything is so delicious and just melts in your mouth. The bbq sauce great too. Neither bland nor too sweet. 

On top of it, the service was amazing. Our server was especially nice and took care of us well. Even if she were busy, she'd send another server to check in on us. This place is definitely  a must try.

While we were in town, I had a hankering for some ribs and thought I'd try this place based on the many positive reviews it garnered.

Location & Aesthetics - Located just off the I-17 somewhere I believe in the Glendale area of Phoenix.  Lots of available parking in an enclosed private lot. 
The place has a rustic look and feel to it.  Very spacious inside, clean including the bathrooms, and well lit.   

Menu - menus were quite extensive though my wife and I already knew what we wanted as we had a chance to review their menu online before meeting our friends there.  Menu was self-explanatory and easy to find what one needed, not too overwhelming.

Service - The staff was very friendly.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and was shown a large table to accommodate my wife and I including our friends who had two boys with them.  
I did have a gripe with the table we were seated at as it was a bit wobbly and thankfully my wife noticed too.  It wasn't too bad to shift our meals around so no loss on the ratings.  
Before the meals are brought, they do serve some cornbread with butter in the meantime and though I didn't try it, my wife said it was tasty, delicious, and not too dry or too greasy.

Food - I ordered the full rack of baby back ribs with vegetables and roasted corn.  Initially when I first saw the full rack of ribs I thought I wouldn't be able to eat it but I surprised myself.  My ribs was well cooked and was practically falling off the bone.  It was soft, tender, and juicy and you could even taste the smokiness to the meat.  The roasted corn was well seasoned, more than enough and came in a bowl.  The roasted vegetables that I ordered was lacking and only consisted of a few vegetable that looked like it was about a tablespoonful.  (-1)
My wife ordered the three-meat dish and it was so much that we had to take a bag back to the hotel.  She did comment on how well and delicious it was. 

Rating - 3/5.  The restaurant loses another star/rating based on a small issue.  
After the bills were brought to the table and the waitress ran my credit card, I asked if I can use my Yelp coupon and she stated that I couldn't do so as "the card had already been run" which I don't believe.  I couldn't see why she couldn't cancel it and re-run the card with the coupon. (-1)
Despite the 3/5, it's definitely a place I'd like to come back to try some of their pulled pork sandwiches which is what my friends had and looked absolutely delicious!
The Smokehouse burger (minus the BBQ sauce) is the best burger in all of Phoenix.

This is the worst BBQ I've had in a long time I'm originally from Chicago and this is not good barbecue I wonder if they even have a real barbecue pit it doesn't taste like it and really tastes like another version of Famous Dave's matter-of-fact Famous Daves is better will never go there again FYI if you're looking for good BBQ come to Chicago.

I like coming here for dinner. Been here three times and it's always absolutely delicious. I've had the bbq chicken, brisket, sausage and the ribs. They're always wonderful. The service is attentive. 
I cannot eat gluten so I forego the cornbread and the rolls but I am told they are quite good. I also have never been able to try any of their desserts due to my intolerance. 
I really do enjoy their bbq, the sauces are really good. I just wish they offered a couple of GF items, that's why the 4-stars instead of 5.
We (4) ordered the combo platter Whole Hog Heaven $51. The baby back ribs fall off the bone. The beef brisket melts in your mouth. Very delicious. One of best BBQ I had.

Excellent service from Chelsea the bartender and Ashlynn the server! If you go there I would ask for those two. They make the whole experience even better! The food is awesome and the donuts are delicious.

We LOVE Bobby q's!!!!!!!! We always have such great service every time we go and the food is always amazing!!!! The servers are always willing to accommodate and are so sweet when we bring our kids (they even throw in a couple extra doughnuts for them) we have made Bobby Q's one of our regulars and recommend it to everyone! So great!

We have lived In Phoenix for 10 years and have driven by hundreds of times as we driven down I-17.  We finally stopped in yesterday and WOW!  The atmosphere, service (thanks Jo), and especially the food which was nothing less than phenomenal! My steak was better than any steak I've eaten at any major steak house. Ribs were incredible, and their sides are amazing. Great portion sizes, and you get a lot of food for their prices.  Then hard part is finding how to get there; the Dunlap exit is the key to success.  We cannot wait to return.

This is our second time visiting Bobby Q's and once again, it was a tasty experience and a great break from our drive to Sedona. Our group was large, so we called for reservations (recommended since they are busy, especially over the holidays). We had lunch both times and the food was delicious and the portions were generous. 

You would expect the main entrees to be tasty, but the extras were also great. My sister-in-law was still talking about their cornbread a week later, but personally I'm a bigger fan of their free cinnamon donuts. We had the combo platters with a full range from the pulled chicken, brisket, pork, ribs and smoked sausage. Everyone enjoyed their food. 

The service was excellent and a great example of how a well run restaurant should operate. Everyone from the server to the manager were focused on ensuring we had a great time.

We've continue to enjoy our visits to Bobby Q's. This is now a mandatory stop whenever we are in the Phoenix area!

Ordered the three meats and two sides and nothing disappointed! Brisket wasn't full of fat like most places but instead tender, St. Louis ribs were fall of the bone! Had it w the Not spicy bbq and Chipotle's ranch and it was the best I ever had. 

Travis was as our server and was unbelievably patient and well informed! One of the best all around servers we have ever had at a restaurant and will be a major cause for returning.

The restaurant is clean and tidy with a wonderful ambience of not to loud of a bar area or annoyingly loud country music
Some of the best BBQ in the valley. Whole hog heaven was awesome and our server sawyer anticipated our needs perfectly.

We enjoy out BBQ and have eaten the "Q" all over. In addition I have my own smoker and have taken classes from some fine pit men and competition winners from KC and Memphis. I really enjoy the meat here but was very disappointed when we ordered a selection of pork ribs, brisket and beef ribs for a trip to Utah. We wanted some good food while hiking the parks. Everything was great except the beef ribs. We got 6 ribs with NO MEAT. I mean literally NO MEAT just smoked bones. If you ever had smoked beef ribs you know that there is a solid 3/4 to 1 inch thick strip of meat on the top side of the rib. The ones from here were stripped to the bone with only a little meat on the side. They ended up being expensive dog treats. everything else was great. DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON BEEF RIBS.  Always great service and drinks.

Great service and atmosphere, tons of parking, and the food is awesome.

We tried the Whole Hog heaven ($51). The Whole hog heaven is too much for one person. We tried getting one 'whole hog' each but no way anyone could come close to finishing it individually. Leftovers for a few more meals!

The brisket is amazing, just incredible, juicy, melt in mouth-type of meat, I personally think I would come back just to eat this. Baby back ribs are so good, I actually enjoy less fat vs the St Louis. The sausage is also super tastyans juicy.

The sides like potato salad, pecan cole slaw, and grilled veggies were solid.

For the size of the portions the food is overpriced.  The food tasted ok but it's nothing to write home about.  Texas Roadhouse and even Famous Daves blows them away.  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

Navigating the parking lot and figuring out which door to go in was interesting the first trip, but once inside, I liked the decor. High ceilings with obligatory (this IS Phoenix after all) yet interesting leaf-looking fans, huge wood doors (non-functional) and unique and interesting antique pieces definitely added to the overall feel of the place for me.  I like places with some character.  Though the contrast with the more modern and trendy tables, chairs and centerpieces on the tables along with the high-energy model-slim all-in-black with plunging necklines waitstaff was odd for me.  I mean, pretty is pretty, but I'm looking for tasty food and a warm welcome, not warmth anywhere else if you know what I'm saying (that's what places like Hooters were made for, no?).  I'm a bit more low-key when I dine out, though I must compliment the attentiveness and overall service.  My iced tea glass was never empty and "to go" boxes (with Thank-Q donuts) were promptly brought when requested (eyes always bigger than stomach).

Now - the food.  Definitely the place to go when you're craving really tender meat. The brisket is divine and they had me at pulled pork. Seriously. Meat roasted for 18 hours and I didn't have to do it myself? Heaven!! Now everyone seems to rave about the mac & cheese, but personally I am in love with the ranch beans - with pieces and shreds of brisket and pork in it. I was surprised at how tasty it was. I'd do takeout just for that.  The spinach artichoke dip was a bit high-fat for me and I had to stop after a few bites though my dining companion was happy to finish it off. Tasty but heavy.  The peach cobbler was not my choice, but I did have some and it was ok for what it was but it didn't wow me.

I will definitely be back for more brisket, pulled pork and ranch beans, but I may just as well get it "to go."

Great ambience, seated quickly, and the drinks and food came out super fast after we ordered. We got the Whole Hog Heaven--baby back ribs, beef ribs, pulled pork, and brisket--to share between us two and we absolutely demolished that platter. In like 10 minutes. It was that good. Everything was incredible, ESPECIALLY the baby back ribs, and their BBQ sauce is my latest favorite. Our server, Tanner, was nice and attentive. They give you a little bag of donuts after, but I haven't tried them yet since there's literally no room for anything else in my stomach.

My parents love coming here when they're in town. There is almost always a wait, so I highly recommend making reservations. The service is always good and the bbq... well, its pretty delicious. You can't go wrong with the St. Louis style ribs or the Pulled Pork- the Brisket, however, was a little dry on our last visit. You will definitely have left overs, so sharing isn't a bad idea. ****4 Stars.

I came back here for a date night with my wife. Call it an early valentine's day.  We made a reservation and we're seated quickly. 
The ambiance was loud but I expected that from how busy they were.
We started with the Cajun shrimp. They were delicious.  Perfectly seasoned with just a bit of bite.
My wife had the sirloin with baked potatoe and grilled veggies. She thoroughly enjoyed it. 
I had the 3 meat combo with brisket,  pulled pork,  baby back ribs, baked potatoe and roasted corn. The corn tasted just like it came off a grill. The potatoe was delicious and it was gone before I started on the meat. The meat was perfect.  A little more sauce would have been nice but it was great.
The service this time around was much better.

My girlfriend and I came here while visiting AZ from CA.  We actually used Yelp to find the place.  I have had alot of bbq, and this is BY FAR, the absolute best I have ever eaten.  Try the Q Rolls, then get the Baby back ribs.  You will not need desert trust me.

Wonderful dinner at Bobby Q in Phoenix area. Highly recommend everything here. Great ribs, brisket, chicken and sides. Great waiter named Luke, ask for him! Manager Taylor was great too got us in earlier than our reservation and attended to our needs. Great experience !

Very good BBQ.  I recently had the three meat combo. Baby back ribs were excellent, brisket had nice smoke flavor but was a bit fatty (for my taste), hot link was good.  Wouldn't go too far out of my way to back but if I lived nearby I'd be a regular.  The thank Q donuts are a nice touch.
Fantastic food, service, and those mini donuts at the end are to die for.  Go check it out and you will NOT be disappointed.

Such a fun place for my husband's birthday dinner! We made a reservation, showed up to the restaurant, and were taken to our table in a very timely and welcoming way. I had the prime rib- excellently prepared! My husband had the baby back ribs and loved them. The manager came around and greeted us. Since we were first timers, she brought out a sample of the brisket for us to try. Wow! We'll be ordering that when we return. After talking to us, the manager brought us dessert after finding out we were celebrating a birthday. We definitely felt welcomed, and look forward to returning.

5 stars are meant for restaurants like these!!

I went to Buckeye, AZ for business and contacted my friend that goes to pharmacy school in AZ and told him "I'm hungry. Where should I go". Without hesitation he recommend me here!

I am really satisfied and happy he recommended me Bobby Q!

The brisket, baby back ribs and baked potato is AMAZING!

The staff is very friendly and the service is excellent!

I will definitely go back when I'm in Arizona!
Great atmosphere and have always had a pleasant experience with staff. Food is AMAZING!

Excellent! My husband and I were pleasantly surprised with this hidden gem. Ordered a combination plate which consisted of three meats, one side, and cornbread. The meat was so so good and fell apart. 

If you're ever in Phoenix stop by and have the best meal experience ever! Price and food portions were perfect! Service was great everyone made sure that we were taken care of...trust me if you want a great meal come and get it!
A great find here in Phoenix.  Our waitress Joe was great, and we received free donuts on our way out!

oh my god....this place is heaven on earth. i could eat their ribs/brisket/cornbread/peach cobbler every day for the rest of my life and i would not be disappointed. as i'm writing this im salivating/foaming at the mouth thinking about sticky bbq sauce on my fingers and in my mouth. visual.

three of us got here during dinner on a weekday, seated promptly. had sweet tea and a strawberry lemonade (tasted like fresh lemonade and was addicting with a sugar rim!). Cornbread was served - delicious, sweet, buttery.

Next came a a 50/50 order of beef ribs/brisket with roasted corn and baked beans, a 50/50 of brisket/baby back ribs with walnut coleslaw and mac & cheese, and a pulled chicken sandwich. 

Long story short, orgasms ensued. The beef ribs I had, were fall off the bone tender, smoky, slathered in perfect amounts of sauce, and just so so so so damn juicy and cooked like they said they do it. The meat just fell off when I bit into it, and the bbq sauce was so sweet and perfect. I would dunk all the food I ever eat for the rest of my life in this sauce. Probably the best ribs I ever had. The brisket was delicious, fork tender, not dry at all (close to the best I've ever had). The beans were porky, smokey, and flavorful, and the roasted corn was so so deliciously roasted.

Finished the night off with a peach cobbler, which was pretty much illegal. Ice cream melted into a deliciously cinnamon nutmeg concoction of sweetness and cobbler, the most perfect grandma-made style cobbler 
I've ever had. Not too tart, not too sweet, just perfect. 

Best BBQ i ever had. LEGIT

Bobby Q is an awesome place. The environment is amazing - and the bartender Billy was incredible. The food here is top notche'. The people in here were incredibly nice and engaging and when ever I come back to this area I will be back. Lastly, when checking in on yelp, you'll get 10% off your bill.
Food is amazing and the staff is always friendly. I love the corn bread and the fresh mini donuts that you get on the way out.
Sat down, waited 15 minutes, left. Informed hostesses at front we'd waited, too busy chatting about their boyfriends to bother.

The server we had was by far the best server ever. This guy was on his game. Then we had a manager stop by for a quality check up. It wasn't over the top but just nice that they cared to follow up. I had a beef brisket sandwhich with a 22oz Fresh Squeezed IPA and my brother had a pulled look sanwhich with coleslaw and sweet tea. They served warm complementary cornbread with butter and finished the meal with cinnamon mini donuts. My beef brisket sandwhich was moist and cooked well. The bun was the sugary white bread and not totally unique (not 5star) but still tasted good. There is better BBQ but this was a good lunch. I will say, my brother remarked that the price seemed a bit high but I think this is pretty standard for most BBQ spots. The server we had was spot on. I wish I knew his name. I'd recommend this guy move to fine dinning and that Bobby's holds on to him. You'll notice him from other establishments. This is the waiter that cares.

LOVE this place! Best barbecue around! Two meat combo with brisket and pulled pork is awesome. Mac and cheese is heavenly. So good i can never bring myself to order anything different! Went in yesterday for Valentines tradition with my hub, and Zac was our server - I guess its his second week there, but he was a pro! Great service, great atmosphere, and killer food! What more can you ask for? Id give this place a hundred stars if i could. :)
Place is amazing.  This is definitely our come to place everytime we're in town for spring training

We found Bobby Q's by accident and couldn't be more pleased. Our food was fantastic! The Q rolls are to die for! The service was amazing, so was the atmosphere. Oh yah, and the hot donuts to finish it off, yummy!

I miss Little Bo Peep and the rest of the character servers of the late Bobby McGee's!!! I miss the private and romantic individual seating areas. I miss the salad bar and the food of yesterday!! If you have been around the area for a while, you know what I mean. If not, you missed out BIG TIME!! Bobby Q took Bobby McGee's out and I'm still depressed about it over a decade later!! Bobby Q, you do not impress me much.

Like many others, I do not understand the hype or the love of this place at all, whatsoever, NOPE, not now and I never will!!! Their meat is "moist" alright, to the point of no texture and you could feed it to a TOOTHLESS infant!!! I like some texture and a lot more smoke flavor!!!

I especially do NOT like the donuts they serve after your dinner. They are greasy and mush much like their meat. My young kid said they made his "stomach sick." Their cornbread is good, but I make mine from a boxed pre-mix and add a can of creamed corn and a small can of drained green chili's (only the 3 ingredients) and I like it BETTER!! 

I give them two stars only because for lunch they have a good deal. You can get a brisket or pork sandwich with a side for $9.00. The atmosphere is nice and the service is good so I might return for lunch, but not very often and ONLY if I happen to be driving right by. I will NOT go out of my way to eat here!!!

Over the years this upscale barbeque restaurant has gone downhill. Perhaps it was simply that they were too busy that Saturday evening, but food was sloppily served and overly salty. Worse,, it lacked character; for example the wedge salad was lacking blue cheese and tomato, leaving a chunk of uninteresting iceberg. Evidently, the management has come to the strange notion that throwing onion straws on things makes them worth eating.

Came here on a whim, and fell in love with the place.

Our server Raymond was super friendly and commented repeatedly on how they Love Yelp here.  Hey Gabi, this would be a great place for an official Elite Event, and they have an attached nightclub!

On to the food.  Ray suggested the Q-Rolls appetizer, and it didn't disappoint.  They're like flautas made with brisket, accompanied by two dipping sauces.  Simply Amazing!
