Ray also recommended the whole hog entree with brisket, pulled-pork and baby backs.  It was large enough for my wife and I to share.  Delicious and filling.  My daughter ordered the half chicken plate, and their fries are superb.

We finished it off with a peach cobbler, and to our surprise, we were presented with a bag of Thank-Q's (accompanying our check), which were freshly made dough balls coated in cinnamon & sugar.  Very good!

If we lived closer, we'd be a fixture in this place.

Excellent service. Brisket was amazing, rest was just okay. Ambience on the patio was phenomenal. Stopped in for lunch on our way thru, four generations of my family have eaten here thru the years and I was the last and told we had to try it if we passed thru. So glad we did. Parking is abundant. Bathrooms are super clean and so neat in the decor.

Ridiculously the Best 1st Time Experience of My Life!  This was My Last Stop Before Heading Back to  L.A. The Front Desk at THE CROWNE PLAZA Highly Recommended this Place Since I was Here on a Business Trip. I Was Ready to Head Back to PAPPADEAUX'S SEAFOOD KITCHEN for the 3RD Time this Weekend and I'm Soooo Glad I Took Their Advice! 

 MONIQUE Was My Server.  And Not Only Was She On Top of Her Game and Answered My Questions with the Conviction of a Preacher Giving A Sermon on a Sunday,  But She was as Beautiful as the Heavanly CORN BREAD She Brought Me and My Client!  For Starters the Q-ROLL'S Were SCRUMPTIOUSLY Delicious with 2 Different Sauces! The MIX COMBO MEAT PLATTER of BEEF BRISKET AND PULLED PORK Was Off the Chain JUICY and FORK TENDER! The BOBBY Q CHEESE BURGER that My Client Ordered was As Thick, Juicy and Made To Order as Any I Have Ever Laid Eyes On! Unfortunately,  I Wasn't Prepared to Handle Desert, (THERE VERSION OF BANANA CREAM PIE,  OUCH!) Especially Since I Had a 5 Hour Road Trip Back to La La. CAN I SAY FOOD COMA!  NOT! I'm Not Gonna Get Pulled Over By ARIZONA HIGHNOON PATROL For a DUI A La BOBBY Q! 
And If You Even Think that I'm Over Playin' My Hand then Just Head Over There and Call My Bluff! 

Like General Douglas Mac Arthur said to the People of the Philippines in WWII or Arnold Schwarzenegger said in The Terminator... "I'LL BE BACK"!

There aren't enough words to describe how amazing and delicious this restaurant is! You would be crazy not to come here. Not only is the food top notch all of the employees are super friendly and helpful! Will definitely come back.

I've been here twice. Both times were awesome experiences. The food is absolutely amazing, service great, and price is on target for the experience.  I had the pulled pork and my friend had the brisket.  Both were tender and juicy.  Both of us agreed the best BBQ we've probably ever had.  We will be back, lots.

To give a brief background, my fiancé and I just moved to the valley from Tennessee where BBQ and southern cookin' is done right. I had read a lot of great reviews about this place and since my soon-to-be hubby is a self-proclaimed BBQ connoisseur, I decided to take him here as a spontaneous mid-week treat.

It's a pretty neat location.. They definitely  nailed down-home, country vibe that they were going for. 

I wouldn't say the food was sub par by any means, but it didn't knock our socks off like the authentic, southern eats we're accustomed to. Sweet tea was off, mild BBQ sauce was WAY to sweet. Meat was okay, but nothing amazing. Service was decent. Mac n cheese was money. 

My guess is that the people who typically  eat here haven't lived in the South where this type of food is an absolute art form.

This location isn't particularly close to where we live so probably won't be back anytime soon but we are curious to try out Little Miss next!

Baby back ribs are amazing. Flavor and tenderness is 10/10. Best I've ever had. Mac n Cheese was absolutely delicious! Again, best I've ever had. Loaded mashed potatoes were good and corn bread was great. Customer service was on point. If I could, i'd give this place a 6/5 because of the atmosphere (restaurant side).

I have been trying to find a good BBQ place, and I have drove by and seen the sign driving north on the I-17 many times but reluctant to try because of my past experiences with BBQ places. Honey Bear BBQ has nothing on this place, HB BBQ pulled pork was dry and their sauce was too vingeary and not as thick, I was very disappointed, but until I tried BOBBY Q's...I was impressed with the decor,  and it was a nice day so we sat outside on the charming open patio with a trickling water fountain near us. The food is cheaper during the week but weekends is a bit more expensive....there is too much to tell, you just have to try for yourself, you wont be disappointed.... and you get a free little dessert as you leave ( freshly made mini sugar doughnuts) YUM!!!!
Out here in Arizona for a work trip and found this place on Yelp and it definitely lived up to the reviews. Great food and great service from our Server Kyle! Definitely would recommend

The service was amazing!! We tried two appetizers, the Q rolls and then the artichoke queso dip and both of those were amazing. Everyone's food was great and the Mac n cheese was so good. All in all, definitely a place to stop by if you are in Phoenix!!!
Amazing food, amazing service, nice atmosphere. What else do you expect? Definitely coming back for more. Officially one of my favorite spots now after the first time.

OMG!!!  This place has THE BEST BBQ I have ever tasted and my husband and I eat a lot of BBQ!  We had the Q Rolls for an appetizer and they were different than anything we ever had but were good!  For dinner we ordered the Whole Hog Heaven plate which consisted (our choice) of beef ribs, spare ribs and double brisket and let me tell you, cooked to perfection, smoked to perfection and after 1-2 days left overs, still bomb.com!!!  However I did not care for the beans or mashed potatoes.  Not very tasty but the Mac n cheese was good and very creamy!  I highly recommend this place.  I live in So Cal and would make a special trip out to Az for this place!

We have lived in Phoenix for 10+ years and have driven by Bobby Q hundreds of times as we have driven down I-17.  Finally we stopped in yesterday and WOW!  The atmosphere, service (thanks Jo), and especially the food which was nothing less than phenomenal! My steak was better than any steak I've eaten at any major steak house. Ribs were incredible, and their sides are amazing. Great portion sizes, and you get a lot of food for their prices. The hard part was actually finding out how to get there from off I-17; the Dunlap exit is the key to success!  We cannot wait to return.

We discovered Bobby Q because it was recently highly rated nationally in the NY Times. The ribs and brisket were tops of the night - we ordered the sample platter with two ribs, two meats and 3 sides. The St. Louis ribs and Baby Backs both were perfectly booked and bathed luxuriously in an excellent barbeque sauce - my wife with regular, me with the hot version. Very friendly service, and lots of happy people. Joe's in Gilbert and Bobby Q in Phoenix... two great reasons to live in the Valley of the BBQ Sun. Highly recommended!

This was by far some of the best most amazing delicious melt-in-your-mouth barbecue that I have ever ever had. Fantastic looking restaurant. Fantastic staff. Amazing service. Everything was delicious. And very reasonable. I I highly recommend the two meat combo.

Great food and service. The baby back ribs and St. Louis ribs , along with the brisket are our favorites. We came the 1st time on Easter and couldn't wait to come back. The staff and atmosphere of the restaurant are very welcoming.

Being from TX I'm always looking for good BBQ! Bobby Q had amazing BBQ! Make sure you ask for Ashlynn. Her personality is not only 2nd to none I informed her that I was on the clock and even with a Saturday lunch rush she got my food to me in less time than it took for me to read the table tent. The mgr was also seen more than once roaming and making sure everything was perfect.  I don't normally post reviews but made an exception in this case. Very well done!

Me and my crew of 4 went here after a Cardinals game.

Pros:
-Large space
-Nice servers
-Huge selection menu, good enough to split between 2-3 people
-Sporty, had the games on
-Tasty sauces 

Cons:
-We were stuffed after just a few bites
-Very Very far!
-Mac and Cheese was underwhelming

I would only try Bobby Q again if were in the area but will not make a point to drive from the East Valley.

The most amazing bbq and restaurant in Phoenix. Do not let the neighborhood fool you! The atmosphere once inside is great and the workers are always on the ball and friendly. We eat lunch there once a week and sometimes on the weekend as well. The food is amazing and always fresh! I have to say that I have yet to eat something that I didn't like. 

Appetizers:Must have the Q-Rolls or the Spinach and Artichoke Dip
Sandwiches-Cant go wrong with the Brisket
Fully loaded baked potato is amazing!
Dinner-Filet Mignon or the Chicken Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes
Sides-MAC AND CHEESE PEOPLE! Corn or the Ranch Beans.

I think I should work for this company as I am very passionate about what they serve and the customer service.

IF you are looking for night life try the club that opens up after the restaurant closes. They provide bottle service and will even do balloons for the tables that you reserve. They have the most amazing street tacos that are served around midnight!

I hope that someone is reading this review and heading there now! Don't forget to try the amazing mini-doughnuts that are made fresh and served to you complimentary.

One of the best BBQ experiences I've had in a long time. Thanks for,the amazing food and terrific service.  Came from out of state and was here only a few hours, but I will go out of my way to eat here again.  Loved it.

Everything was great from A to Z....even scored some free sugared doughnuts upon arrival just by asking. Our seating was prompt even though we were told it would be fifteen minutes - we barely waited three...

our booth was awesome and so was our server Hunter...who was very kind, courteous and knowledgeable without being obtrusive or pushy. He made just the right recommendations and was very polite while engaging.

The winner of the evening was the moist and plump rotisserie chicken, accompanied by the two sides which were shoestring fries and mac n cheese. The chicken was to die for and made all the supermarket rotisserie chickens look bad...the chicken was not only juicy but it was supremely tender and melt in your mouth - too bad there wasn't more of it...

The only thing I didn't care for was the corn bread but that's not enough to knock off a star...

Good night !

Went here for a quick lunch on the way back to LA. Can't believe how great the food was. Got the 3(brisket,bbq chicken, st. Louis ribs) meats and 1 side with 1 cornbread. Everything tasted amazing, the brisket and the ribs basically melted in my mouth. Also had very great, attentive, and friendly service. Anytime I'm in Aizona, this is my place to be.

Stuck in the hospital in Phoenix last month and our amazing friends brought us a takeout smorgasbord from Bobby's...we hadn't physically been there in almost 2 years and the uber-high standard is definitely being maintained.

This place lives up to all the hype and then more.  So I called ahead to make a reservation.   We actually arrived 30 mins early and they still took us in right away--even with a full patio of people waiting to be seated.

Our server was very helpful and attentive.  We ordered the Hog Heaven and it was enough for us--5 people (2 adults and 3 kids).  

I usually am not too crazy about BBQ stuff, but Hubby likes this stuff....,I actually liked the food.  I would totally return when back in Phoenix!

It had been a while since the last time we had barbecue, so we decided to make an 8 PM Saturday night reservation at Bobby Q. We were very pleased with all the meats we sampled and the Yelp rating didn't let us down.

We had about a fifteen minute wait after we checked in at the host stand just after 8. The waiting areas were crowded and many people were waiting outside. I think a buzzer/text system would save some young ladies' voices and annoyance of the guests because when a table became available, the hostesses would yell out the name of the party at the top of their lungs while walking through waiting area.

We were served by Hunter and he did an excellent job of handling being triple sat with a total of 12 guests by treating the multiple tables as he should and serving all of us as one party of 12. He gave us a brief background of the restaurant also informing us that all the meat is smoked for over 20 hours using mesquite wood. The recommendations for food and beverage were solid. During the meal, my daughter did drop her fork on the ground and we requested on three different occasions for a new one and it was never brought to us.

For drink, I started with the Bobby Q's amber ale by Thunder Canyon Brewery which the caramel and malty flavor was an excellent pairing with the barbecue. Along with the warm cornbread to start, we were recommended the Q-Rolls ($10.50) which were a great preview of the meats to come ahead. The brisket was tender and moist wrapped in a crispy shell with a little kick added with a chipotle dip.

For entrees, my wife and I split the Whole Hog Heaven ($48) which was way too much food for two. All four of us could have split this meal. They were out of sausage that night so we went with the pork to go along with the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, and brisket. All of the meat was smoky, tender, and juicy. No tough, dry meat here. The sauce was pretty standard and served in a small pot which eliminated the sticky, messy bottles. My daughter and her friend split the Southern Fried Chicken ($14). I didn't get to taste any of the chicken, but they finished everything, which usually isn't the case.

We passed on dessert as everyone was stuffed, but the bag of doughnuts was a nice parting gift which I finished pretty much the whole bag later as a late night snack.

Food is way too expensive but fun atmosphere. It turns into a really cool nightclub after hours but every night is Latin night and a little diversity would increase business greatly. It used to be way better like 5 years ago. A lot classier of a crowd.
Oh my... You have to try the baby back ribs and the sautéed mushrooms are wonderful.  We always get it for take-out.
Havent been here in years really strict on dress code basically if your a girl who doesnt wear heels and dresses dont go

The food is amazing, you can 100% taste the fact that they smoke the meat for so long, it is a little expensive but I would say it is worth the splurge and leaving with your pants being a little tight. Only reason I'm not leaving a 5 Star review is just because the wait time for the food was a little long, but that can be over looked because the food itself was worth the wait.

Complimentary cornbread and donuts.

Nuff said. 

OK. There's more! Like the Ronco commercial..."But wait, there's MORE!"

We had trouble finding the front door. Looks it's sweltering hot and our brains were in meltdown. We entered the To Go door which is a very tiny room for take out service only. The lovely employee upon hearing our door troubles said we could come behind the counter and enter the dining room. What? We don't have to go outside again? Love her. She led us right to a perfect table and provided us with menus. Great service! Make it happen!

I was surprised and impressed by the upscale decor. Kind of reminded me of the House of Blues in West Hollywood...made to look like a shack from the outside but quite luxurious inside. Nice. 

Our server Kellee was Killer!!! I wanted to snatch her away. Oops, I said snatch. Anyway, the pulled pork sandwich with mac n cheese was Bobby Q perfection as was Rickie's brisket sandwich with shoestring fries...the fries...so so yummy! Sweet tea, actually, well, how do you say...should be called super, really, alotta, sweet tea. Sweeter than Paula Deen's pie. Wait. That didn't sound right. 

Bobby Q. I wuv you! 

P.S. Did I detect a little Velveeta in the mac n cheese? Me thinks so and ME LIKEY!

After reading several reviews about how good the brisket was I decided I had to try it. I went over on a Friday afternoon and sat at the bar. They had the lunch menu and their dinner menu and I noticed the lunch brisket was only around three dollars less expensive then the brisket platter. The bartender said that the dinner platter was a better value so that's what I went with. I opted for the fries and the coleslaw as the two sides. I have to say the brisket was amazing. Not only was it very tender but it was not at all dried out like so many other places that I have tried. Even people from Texas would be impressed.  My only minor complaint was the fries could have been crispier. I also have to say that I really like their ice tea as well. 

There are so many interesting options on the menu I deafly will be coming back to this place to try them out.  

I haven't been to Bobby Q's for a few years. The last time was meeting up with friends from work for a going away party. They had a special room in the back for us. The appetizers we had were very good.

This place has really nice atmosphere. It would be a great place to bring somebody for that first date. Service is also very good. When I was finished the bartender gave me a fresh iced tea to go. That was greatly appreciated on a hot day. 

Their busiest day of the year was Father's Day. I was there at about 2:30 pm and the wait was between an hour and a half and hour and 45 minutes long so I didn't stay but I knew I would have to come back soon. And I'm glad I did.

Had a great time with friends and family. The food was absolutely excellent: tender and flavorful. The brisket is a must.
Stacey, our server, was wonderful.
I highly recommend this place.

we celebrated my birthday all weekend.  we made the trek to bobby q on sunday. I ordered the brisket sandwich with mac and cheese and let me tell you about that mac & cheese..it was amazing. Mr H went with the chicken and brisket and for his sides: beans and potato salad.  
The food is sinfully delicious! I will NOT be coming here as often as I would like... I found it too indulgent. it is definitely a treat and worth trying! I love those little donuts they give you at the end!

The closest thing to spending an entire day prepping and smoking the meat myself.... minus all the work. Great food at a very reasonable price. Our server (Cameron ) was on top of everything. We will be back even though we live over an hour away!

So glad they opened back up!!! We first went to Bobby Q when we were visiting family in Westport and latterly ate there almost every day of our vacation.  When we heard they'd closed we were devastated. Well, we're back for s vacation and we're totally excited they reopened in Norwalk!!! The service at lunch was great and the food was everything we'd remembered! Can't wait to come back!! Anything and everything on the menu is amazing!

Totally impressed by this place! We stopped from out of town as we were passing through Phoenix. First off, the staff is fantastic. So friendly, super responsive, and kind. So kind. I've never been a huge lover of BBQ but after eating here, I can't wait to come back! The brisket and pulled pork.... YUMM. The coleslaw is perfect, and the baked potatoes are so perfectly loaded. My boys thought it was very interesting that there was ice in the urinals.... ha ha. The manager even took the time to explain the reason for this!
Seriously, I can see why this place is rated so high. I can't wait to come back!

A good friend of mine -who's opinion on Q I highly respect- was in town a few months ago and stopped into Bobby Q's (BQ), and he couldn't stop raving about it. I've been jonesing all week to come check it out, but I figured I'd wait until my wife got into town. Well, I finally got my chance and I was giddy as a school girl. I was actually able to make a reservation through OpenTable on the Yelp app, and I'm sure glad we did. Upon our arrival at 5:30 the place was already packed, but by thetime we left at 7 there was a hoard of people flooding out into the street--and for good reason! Enough jibber-jabber--on to the food! I ordered the Three Meat Combo and that comes with two sides and some of BQ's Cornbread.

Sides:

Mac and Cheese- This might easily be the creamiest, most decadent Mac & Cheese I've ever had. They use something similar to Velveeta Cheese to coat it, and I'm not slamming Velveeta. It's so rich I couldn't finish it. 3.75*

Pecan Coleslaw- I'm very picky about my slaw; I don't want it too creamy, sweet, or bitter and this was absolutely perfect! I also loved the crunch you get from the little pieces of toasted Pecan they add to the top--I'm definitely adding that to my slaw the next time I make it. 5*

Cornbread- Excellent mix of a Northern/Southern cornbread--it has the cakiness and slight sweetness if Northern, and the crust and stone-ground corn like a Southern; I could eat these everyday. 5* 

Meat:

St. Louis Ribs- These might be the best St. Louis Pork Ribs (other than mine) that I've ever had! The meat had a nice "tug" to it, but was still so tender, smokey and delicious! 5*

Beef Brisket- Juicy and flavorful this brisket was quite good--my only gripe is I wish it had a bit more smokiness to it. 4*

Pulled Pork- Another excellent job by BQ! Juicy, smoky and porky (just like me!) Everything you could want in Pulled Pork and then some. I piggled (sic) the whole lot of it! 5*

Dessert:

Sugar-Cinnamon Donuts- They give everyone at the table these tiny little donuts that they make fresh up front and they're fabulous; they had me at "Cinnamon". I guess you can just walk in and order a dozen for $3 if that's all your craving, too. 5*

Service & Ambiance- Good service from our server, Jessica. She was on top of things without being annoying. BQ is located in a building that looks like something you'd find in the middle of nowhere. The interior is mostly brick and wood causing the noise level in there to be deafening by the end of the night. They also keep it a bit too dark for my liking, but the decor is swell. 4*-service/3.5*-Ambiance

Value- The meals here are not a bad value, as my Three Meat Combo cost $22, but it's more than enough food for 2 people. Even my piggy self couldn't finish it--but guess what's for breakfast?! Snooch to the Nooch! 4*

I'm about to make a bold proclamation: I think BQ has *the* best BBQ I've ever had. I don't make that statement lightly either--after all, I have a reputation to uphold. I think this was easily the best meal I've had here in AZ, and that's saying something. I can't wait for my next visit to the Valley of the Sun so I can visit BQ again. If you ever find yourself in Phoenix, I highly, highly recommend making your way here--just make sure to make a reservation!

Love love love this place!! We had the whole hog platter. 2 meats, 2 kinds of ribs and 3 sides. We shared it between 2 adults and an 11 year old and still couldn't finish! It wasn't for lack of trying though! The hits start with the corn bread and roll on from there! The sides were just ok, I'd love to see fried okra, but let's face you come here for the meat!! We had baby back ribs, beef ribs, brisket and pork. The baby backs were TO DIE FOR! Falling off the bone with just enough yummy crunchy bark. I thoroughly enjoyed every bite! I highly recommend you take home a jug of sauce to impress your friends at your next back yard gig. Did I mention the tiny hot fresh donuts they bring with the check?! Yumm! Our server Lexi was super knowledgeable and the service was much faster than anticipated on a busy Friday night.

We were her Apr 16, 2016 with a business group of eight.  Service was excellent.  Brisket was fork tender. The O-Rolls (?) appetizer was awesome.  The next time I drive to PHX, I'll return for take out.

First off, I want to say how amazing the food is here! I have never ordered something I didn't like. My favorite item would have to be the Hot wings appetizer. I love the sauce they use! 
Secondly, the staff has always been attentive and made sure my night was well taken care of and that I always had something to drink.
Lastly, I had incident happen tonight that was handled so wonderfully! The manager made sure I came out of there with a smile on my face by having the meal paid by them. At first, the incident had me so mad but once the manager spoke so kind to me, my anger went right away! I never had someone care so much at any restaurant.

I will undoubtedly be a forver returning customer!

If you enjoy great atmosphere, food, and staff, go to Bobby Qs! You definitely wont regret it!

Thank you to all that made my dinner date amazing!


A very pleased customer.

My friend Kate M. had mentioned that she had wanted to have lunch here sometime.  Today, the stars aligned and we (wife and son) drove down here to meet Kate and her husband for a late lunch.  This place has always piqued my interest, and honestly, I'm not sure why I never had lunch/dinner here before.  We drove down and met them at 2pm.

Kate and her husband were already there and grabbed us a table and high chair for our son Bill.  They had ordered Some Q-Rolls (basically an egg roll stuffed with smoked brisket) and some drinks already and offered me up a Q-Roll.  These things were good!  They serve them with chipotle and a bbq sauce.  I could definitely see myself eating a whole order of these things.  

I had read some reviews of this place and it sounded like most people enjoyed the ribs.  Who doesn't like ribs?  I decided to go with the 2 Rib Combo (St. Louis and baby back) which came with 2 sides.  I chose ranch beans and french fries for my sides.  Had a Diet Pepsi to drink.  My wife ordered a brisket sandwich and some mac and cheese for her side.  Pretty much ordered the fries and mac and cheese for our son.  You will have to read Kates review about what she and her husband ordered ;-).  Before they bring out your food, they give you a basket of cornbread.  This stuff was great!  I ate 2 pieces of it and could have ate more.  Anyways....on to the main dishes.  Here is how everything was...............

Rib Combo-  Delicious!  These ribs were so tender they fell off the bone.  I know some BBQ purists will say that ribs should not fall off the bone, but I don't give a shit...these ribs were delicious!  I ate the baby backs first.  They were awesome!  They came covered in minimal sauce so the meat really stood out.  I dug straight in with my hands and would just pick pieces of meat off the bone and savor every bite.  They were delicious and I can see why so many people order them here.  After the baby backs, I got into the St. Louis style ribs.  These were not as good as the baby backs, but they were still pretty damn tasty.  They were cooked so well, that even up at the cartilage portion, there was minimal of it and you could pick through and get every single little morsel of meat.  All that was left on the plate was pretty much bones and a few pieces of cartilage.  These ribs were 5 star ribs!

Sides-  This is where I was a little let down.  I love, love, love some good beans.  I prefer some baked beans, lots of sauce, cooked well done so they are thick, and lots of scraps of meat throughout.  These beans had some meat in them, but they were "ranch style" beans and just alright....a little runny.  The sauce was good enough to hold them together, but I have had much better beans elsewhere and would not get these again.  The portion was skimp too!  It was like 5 spoonfuls worth.  The fries were really thin shoestring fries.  They were pretty good.  My son loved them...he loves pretty much any french fry.  They are his favorite food, by far!  The problem with really thin shoestring fries is that they tend to get hard/cold fast.  They were still pretty good though and I would get them as a side again.  Really big portion of them, too!

My wife gave me a piece of her brisket from her sandwich.  It was legit.  She thought that her brisket sandwich was a little bit too plain/boring though.  The side of mac and cheese was good.  Really cheesy, Velveeta type mac and cheese.  Decent portion size too.  Not sure why the beans were such a skimp portion.  Everything else was hooked up!  Oh yeah..when you are done with your meal they provide you with some free mini donuts.  A bit skimp (3 tiny donuts for 3 people), but free so I can't complain.  They tasted like a lemon pound cake, deep fried and then rolled in sugar.  I could mow down a dozen!  They were delicious!  I just wish they maybe gave you 3 per person...then we would be talking!

Service was great!  They had multiple people servicing our table throughout the whole meal and everyone was on point!  I think even the manager came by to ask how everything was.  Conversation was great, too.  It was the first time Kate and her husband met my wife and son.  A good time was had by all!

Will I be back?  Yes, at some point for sure.  The ribs were absolutely fantastic, and with the right choice of sides, this is a damn fine BBQ meal and a potential 5 star joint!  It wasn't the cheapest lunch ($63.00 after tax/tip), but for my first time here, the amount of food,  and the people I was with, it was worth it!   I'm sure I will be back before too long.

Great place!  Wanted to try something different. How often do you get a chance to eat BBQ!  Very friendly and great staff.  The pulled pork was out of this world.  We tried the combo platter and tried a little bit of everything.  We will be back.  Don't forget to mention YELP for your 10% discount.

Visiting Phoenix for the first time and stopped in for dinner on the way to my hotel. The first thing I tried was the complimentary cornbread and butter- OMG, it was delicious!! I had the beef rib and sausage plate- I wasn't blown away with the sausage, maybe because I'm a Texas girl and have had better but the beef ribs were impressive and so tasty. The meat was tender and flavorful. I shared the Mississippi Mud Pie dessert with my friend and it was fantastic- so chocolatey!! the staff was super friendly as was the manager. I thoroughly enjoyed this place, in fact so much that when I return to Phoenix next week, I will stop in again!  Oh, and the little fresh, warm donuts they give you after your meal with the cinnamon sugar, GET OUTTA HERE, they're divine!!!
Wow.  Best macaroni and cheese I've had outside of Chicago's south side.

Do you want great, smoky brisket, but to order off of laminated menus handed to you by impeccably polite servers? Do you want authentic ribs, but not want to get your hands dirty? Are you curious about BBQ, but aren't sure if it's still conceptually owned by Confederates?  Do you prefer your pork sandwich in a dimly lit museum-lodge instead of at a splintery wooden table outside? Do you wish you were at Hillstone? 

Then Bobby Q is the spot for you! It's giant, civilized, organized, sexy, and capable of hosting massive private parties! It has no trace of the down home, no frill, authentic, dirty, traditional BBQ sentiment I love. Bobby Q combines two culinary traditions (Southern barbecue meets steakhouse vibe) without much organic intersection, providing a nice way for the bourgeoisie to enjoy BBQ, sans flies/plastic cutlery. The food is good, but the hike in price for out-of-place frilliness? Call me a stickler, or a hick, or a hickler, but the glamification of this otherwise humbly glorious cuisine doesn't quite move me.

I saw the sign for this restaurant off the I-17 freeway and later found out that this place catered a dinner for my wife and her colleagues at Grand Canyon University.  I had to try it out.  Since I was meeting a friend from high school who has lived in Phoenix for over 30 years now, I suggested we try this place and he was excited about going.  I know that if a local is excited to go somewhere in their "backyard" it must be good.
I ordered the bbq brisket and it was the bomb!!  Very tender and tasty.  Wish I could  have had more than one meal there, but it's something to look forward to on my next trip there.

This place has blown every other BBQ restaurant out of the water, including any family members bbq! I don't know how I will ever go else where. Got there and the wait was over a hour. With the amount of people waiting and from what we've read (and the distance we drove) we were definitely waiting. We didn't have to wait the full time. Our waitress was super knowledgeable about her stuff and got our orders taken and served in no less than 15-17 minutes (quite possibly faster!). The mana her walked around, seemed cool. Stopped to ask us how things were, excellent mister man! And then the complimentary sugar donut-churros sealed the deal and made me a fan for life! Try it out!!

Got a lb of brisket and lb of pulled pork last weekend .. Everyone loved it. These guys always come thru with good food.  As mentioned in other review I'm picky about my BBQ and these dudes do it right

(4 stars for my overall smokehouse favorites, 5 stars for PHX up to this point) 
On my continual quest for savory smoked, grilled and BBQ goodness, I decided to stop in. I initially entered the "Q Lounge" to check out the Happy Hour which obviously has a huge following and offered a HH buffet and numerous drink specials. While interesting and entertaining, I wasn't feelin' it so after about an hour, I wandered back into the main restaurant. Taking a seat at the bar I ordered up a rather potent and tasty Margarita and looked over the menu. 

Decisions....this looked promising. The wonderful smoke aroma mildly permeating the restaurant gave me further hope that I was getting into something good. Opting for the 2 meat combo with brisket and sausage with roasted corn and mac n cheese on the side, I was looking forward to the meal. 

Served relatively quickly, I stuck my fork into the mac n cheese. I was told it had 5 cheeses. It was quite rich with a very Velveeta like palate and a slight tang of cheddar. The corn was truly roasted, cut off the cob and served up neatly in a bowl. The brisket was tender, smokey and amazing. Well marbled, not too lean and not too fatty. The smoked sausage was not overly smoked, well seasoned and with just enough bite (I will have to try the jalapeno variety next time to compare). 
The serving size was plentiful. And I had enough left over for the next day! 
[Still not Rudy's....my quest continues.]

One line: Excellent Steak and BBQ Ribs, good portions, MUST GET the Mac N Cheese!

Bobby Qs is one of the best BBQ joints that I've eaten at. 

Reservations: Open Table or you can call in. We were running late b/c of the 101 closure so we called in and they were willing to push our reservation back for us. 

Parking: Two private lots. They even have a guy standing outside to direct you to the second lot if the main lot is getting full. 

Drinks
Ordered the Bobby Q seasonal draft beer and my friend ordered a drink the waiter recommended: some mixed drink that came in a pineapple. Both were good. My friend really enjoyed the novelty of the pineapple. 

Food - Both Entrees 5 Stars
We ordered the two ribs combo and chose St. Louis and Baby Back ribs. The meat on both was fall off the bone tender. I think I prefer the St. Louis ribs though. They seemed to have a little bit more flavor. The spicy and regular BBQ sauce that they served on the side was excellent for dipping the meat in. 

We also ordered a 14 oz. ribeye steak. The aged steak was also really tender.. the kind of melts in your mouth deliciousness. They didn't season it with very much so it is an excellent steak if you enjoy the unadultered taste of meat. The quality of meat here is indisputably excellent. 

Sides:
Mac N Cheese(5*)- MUST GET! The cheese was unbelievably creamy. I'd recommend that everybody choose this for one of their sides... so good that you really don't want to share. 
Shoestring fries (4*)- good crisp fries to dip in the bbq sauce
Roasted corn (3*) - my friend really liked the roasted corn.. i thought it was just roasted corn.
Mashed potatoes (2*)- tasted a little too processed, too smoothed... I think I would have liked a little gravy but at the same time it was too salty and galicy.   


Service: (4-5*) Just the right amount of attention. 
Our server Daniel was really attentive and had some good recommendations, e.g. the drinks and mac n cheese. They were also pretty good about keeping the water glasses full. I guess part of the goal of the restaurant is to have the manager visit each table... which she did. It was very brief but I guess it shows an extra level of service?  I'd also say the service was excellent b/c I forgot my hat and they set it aside for me at the hostess area to be picked up the next day.

Little weird: On the check the pre-calculated/recommended  tip amounts were 18%, 18%, and 20%. I just found it odd that they didn't include the 15% mark and they included 18% twice. 
 
This place is a little pricer... but well worth it if you got the cash. 

P.S. Apparently there is some club/lounge in the actual restaurant. The decor, candle lighting and everything was right... the only detraction was the loud music and bass that could be heard through the wall. It wasn't unbearable but if you're here on a nice date you might want to request to be seated away towards the left side of the dining room.

Let me start by saying this restaurant is way too expensive. BBQ is supposed to be cheap and dirty. With this being said the lunch prices are reasonable. The BBQ sampler with ribs, brisket, and pulled pork with one side ran about $14. The ribs were definitely the standout of the meal. They came off the bone clean, were very tender, and had a nice smoky flavor. The pulled pork rivaled the ribs, and may have actually surpassed them in taste. The brisket was tender, but was lacking the flavor of the other two meats. It also seemed a little off in color as it was as it was much lighter than most I have had. Mac n' cheese was my choice of side and it was deliciously cheesy. I could devour bowl after bowl of that goodness. Also worth a mention is the donut they bring you after your meal. That thing, albeit small, was fresh out of the fryer, covered in sugary sweetness and an unexpectedly nice ending to a solid meal.
Great staff, huge portions, excellent prices. Not to mention some of the best bbq and sides I've ever had. A can't miss spot in Phoenix!

On a visit to Arizona about a week ago I stopped by here for lunch before flying home. This is a nice barbecue restaurant that has an attractive interior along with a bar area. The hostess seated me and it took about 10 minutes before a waiter showed up. The restaurant was about 1/2 full and the waiter said he didn't see me seated. I ordered the smoasted chicken plate with beans, cole slaw and cornbread along with a salad. The salad arrived first and was good. What I didn't like was that the entree arrived just a few minutes later and I hadn't finished my salad and I am not a slow eater. I hurried to finish the salad because I didn't want to food to get cold. 

The chicken was average size and looked just like chicken that I cook on the grill. The cole slaw had pecans on it and was very good (4). I liked the beans too and graded them at a 3.5. The salad was good also and I gave it a 3. I liked the chicken but felt it only deserved a 3. Not bad but I have had many examples that were better. That's why my overall score for the meal is a 3.

Perhaps my tardy waiter and the fact that the timing of the service was off were a fluke. I believe this is a good restaurant and probably is closer to a 3.5 or maybe even a 4. However that was my experience.
Every time I have been to Bobby Qs I have had a great experience. Our server ZAC was awesome, especially for it being his first week! Thanks for great food and great service!!

I'm not sure why we haven't been here before but it is fabulous.  Prime rib was done just right and the filet mignon was perfect.  Atmosphere is very fun, and you can make reservations online.  What's not to like!!

My husband and I thought we would try a new bbq restaurant for our anniversary and was very upset with our choice. We were told the meat was smoked for 14 -18 hours by one waiter and 6 hours by the bar tender which we were a little confused by. We ordered the family meal so we could taste multiple items from the menu......we were not impressed at all. The meat did not have a smoked taste to it at all. It tasted like the meat was boiled and maybe  smoked for an hour. Very disappointing. The bbq sauce takes like a cheap sauce you can got at the grocery store. The mac & cheese tasted like they made it with the kraft cheese that comes in the plastic. Yuck.....The best part of the whole meal was the donuts at the very end. I do not  recommend this restaurant if you are look for some bbq. We will not be returning.

It's been a long time since we have had some good bbq. We gave this place a try due to the outstanding Yelp reviews. Let me just say...thank you Yelpers! The restaurant itself is large and has a good amount of parking. The inside is very nice with dark lighting for a nice setting. We were there today about 2 o clock so it wasnt too busy but I can vet this place gets packed! They do have a bar and they had a nice fire oven that you could see chickens being roasted through the glass. 

We tried the Q rolls for an appetizer and they were very good with the chipotle ranch dipping sauce. For an entree my wife tried the pulled pork sandwich and I had the sampler with chicken, brisket and ribs. Both dishes came with a side. We tried the mashed potatoes and gravy and the mac n cheese. Both sides were creamy and delicious! The meats in the main dish were very flavorful and the bbq sauce is good. We really enjoyed the corn bread and the donuts they give you for dessert. 

Sawyer was a great server!

Successful yelping. It was our first time in Phoenix/Arizona and we were looking for a dinner spot. This place is well-deserving of its 4.5 star rating, all around great experience. 

Shoutout to our server TOMMY, he was awesome and helpful, went extra mile to provide good service. For starters we had the signature Q Rolls...so bomb especially dipped in bbq sauce.  Also tried the two rib combo with the baby back and beef ribs - the baby back ribs were truly fall-off-the-bone, both were good and I'm usually a fan of beefy ribs more.  Also had to try the catfish fillet (breaded & comes with 2 large pieces), which was good too.  I think we liked everything we ate. All entrees/combos come with homemade cornbread and 2 sides each. The CORNBREAD was definitely a highlight of the meal! Some good sides were the potato salad, pecan Cole slaw and roasted corn.  

I guess they always hook you up with complimentary donuts for dessert here too! ALL IN ALL...GLAD WE CAME TO BOBBY Q!

This place is amazing for BBQ or just coming in to have a drink.  I had the half slab ribs with skinny fries and beans. My colleague had the brisket with beans and coleslaw.  Service was friendly and the manager paid us a visit to see how we were enjoying our dinner.  I had their old fashion which wasn't amazing, but suitable.  The beans are great because they add chunks of brisket.  I'm a big fan of skinny fries too and they were good. They gave us some complimentary miniature cinnamon donuts which were addicting.

First time at Bobby Q's today, even though I live less than 10 min away. Killer cornbread. Had lunch platter with pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket. Pork was good. Liked the sauce. Chicken was juicy and tender. I'm Texan and BBQ is in my blood, so re brisket was "just ok." No bark on it and it was a little dry. Roasted veggies were good side for lunch, though I'm sure the Mac n cheese would have tasted fantastic. Will be back.

The food and service was amazing. At 830 on Wednesday night they asked us if we had a reservation that's how crowded they get. My husband did have the pulled port platter and the portion did look a little small compared to my baby back ribs. I got the full rack of ribs. It was amazing amazing! Their frozen lemonade is nothing special don't waste your money if anything it is too sweet!! 

Ask for more cornbread and you can get your drink to go.

The best Baby back ribs in town.  Cornbread to die for and strawberry lemonade that makes my mouth water.  Great staff, excellent service, amazing Food.  One of my favorite places to take friends when they are in town.  A Must try for any foodie!
Chicken quesadilla and the pulled chicken sandwich are good here. While I prefer Pork on a Fork to Bobby Q's, this is a pretty good place to get your BBQ fix.

Updating to add I've now brought more family to this restaurant. I've spent quite a while talking this place up, and thankfully it did not disappoint!
My aunt thoroughly enjoyed her baked potato with pork, my mother enjoyed her brisket sandwich, husband enjoyed his steak, uncle liked his pulled pork, and I was not disappointed by my beef brisket platter. Portions are great and the taste is amazing. 
We had q rolls and queso dip to start. I already knew I loved the q rolls, and while I liked the dip, it wasn't stellar (to me). My husband liked it though. 
My toddler got chicken tenders with fries and seemed to enjoy it, though she liked the bread from the queso dip more. 
I loved the Mac and cheese again, though my mother said it's not as good as her sister-in-law's...which I haven't tried, so I still love this one. 
I also tried the ranch beans. While they were pretty good, they're not my favorite. Some seemed undercooked. My husband thought the same. 

Nobody had room for sweets, so that's my goal next time!

Why aren't these guys at the Best in the West Nugget Rib Cook-off?? Their ribs are literally, physically, whole heartedly, ballistically, supercalifragilistically fall off the bone tender. The meat was holding on for dear life but didn't have a chance. I ordered a full slab just for myself. Mmmhmm pick up your mouth from off the floor, I sure did. AND....ANDDDDDD, when they give you your bill they bring it with fresh, just fried, pipin hot mini donuts sprinkled w/sugar!! 

If you're in the Phoenix area and want some bangin BBQ, take yo a55 to Bobby-Q. You'll be glad you did.
Best barbecue food I have ever had.  It's more of an upscale barbecue restaurant which is unique. Whenever I am in Phoenix it is a must that I stop in and get there barbecue beef brisket sandwich.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: parking lot. 2 minute wait with reservation. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: very nice waitress. Very clean for a BBQ place. This place looks cool. Feels like a secret shack but its clean and decorated very well. Seats wee comfortable. The manager even came out to say hello and if we needed any thing. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: BEST BBQ I have ever had! Everything was soft, smooth, and melt in your mouth! The brisket is a MUST TRY! And make sure you get a burnt end!!! I've never had a better bite of brisket than that burnt end. Even after I ate the burnt end my mouth was watering for more. The mac & cheese was extremely creamy and delicious. The mash potatoes were also extremely creamy and delicious. It's very rare that I like mash potatoes without gravy but this was amazing! There wasn't even bacon bits on the mash potatoes and it was still delicious! Pulled pork was so soft it almost had the consistency of the mash potatoes. Ribs fell off the bones and were delicious. Fried chicken fillet was very crispy and juicy and was covered is delicious gravy. The only thing that wasn't for me was the BBQ chicken. The Sunday family feast could feed more like 2 normal people. The free mini doughnuts at the end were hot, fresh, and delicious as they fall apart between your fingers as you pick up the super fresh sucker that was fried probably 10 seconds before it got to you. Simply put, food here is amazing and was worth the $40 taxi ride there from the JW Marriott Dessert Ridge and the $40 taxi ride back. 

_____

Overall Experience
5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
BEST BBQ I'VE EVER HAD!

So I've never actually eaten  there , but my job took me to the kitchen several times   (delivery, of linens ) ,  the smell of their snooker is amazing !!! I plan ti get there with the Lil woman ASAP  The hostess was very friendly and helpful the 1st time I went there. 4 stars pending actual ingestion  of the great smelling food. They ARE  rated the best BBQ in the US

I have been passing by this place for years during my visits and never bothered to stop. That was a mistake. Everything was perfect from start to finish. Even the food that I didn't think was perfect was good. I had the ribs and I tried the pulled pork and brisket. PERFECT. The taste was awesome. It was smoked, but not overly so...Tender...DELECTABLE. The beans were good...different...Texas style, but a little sweet. Mac & Cheese was perfect. OH my...The cole slaw was AWESOME! The corn was overcooked to me. It would have been nice to have just a bit of crunch. I wouldn't get the corn anymore, but hell there are so many more sides. The apple pie was oh...so...good. The doughnuts were..to..die..for...And the service...PERFECT!

we went to bobby q's a couple of weeks ago. they have amazing bbq! we got the  sampler and enjoyed it very much! we happen to sit right in front of their large chicken rotisserie. they smelled amazing! we will try that next time. we can't wait to go back! amazing food!
Oh yeah I can see why this is a staple in AZ sorry I didn't have any pics my food was to god I devoured it.

Great BBQ! Thanks for the recommendation, yelpers!

Austin (our server) gave us great suggestions. We had the baby back ribs, brisket, and Mac and cheese. All awesome!  

Would definitely be back if I ever came through these parts again.
The best BBQ joint I've been too! The BBQ sauce is great and the meat is so tender. The service is great and the location is well kept.

Bobby Q = heaven

I think it's safe to assume that everything on the menu is good because everything I tried here was delicious!!! Even their drinks are yummy. Tried the pineapple surprise, sweet tea and strawberry daiquiri and enjoyed all of them. The cornbread is perfect; especially when you add butter and honey on top. It was so good I ate two of them straight out of the fridge the next morning for breakfast. The side dishes are awesome, especially the mac and cheese and roasted corn. The barbecue is juicy and flavorful. I didn't even add barbecue sauce to my meat because it was just fine without it. You can even finish off your meal with free, yes FREE, donuts. Bobby Q, I love you.

The brisket and Mac and cheese..... YUM! They slow cook the brisket for, I believe, 18 hours and it's so incredibly tender and flavorful. The Mac and cheese also has  quite a few different cheeses... Including velveeta? YES PLEASE.
Personally, I think the cornbread is a little dry and the steak sandwich was just a huge disappointment. I really don't think that one slice of garlic bread and a hunk of steak makes a sandwich. And yes, it's ONE slice of garlic bread... I just don't see that as a sandwich.
The mashed potatoes are great, make sure you get extra gray cause that's the best part.
If you want something as an appetizer, happy hour is from 4-8 and their 50% off... The brisket quesadilla and spinach artichoke queso dip with garlic bread are the best ones on the menu if you ask me.
Give this place a shot, it's got great reviews for a reason. Just don't get the steak sandwich. Hahahah
Came from Cali to watch the Dodgers but I never thought I would fall in love with the bbq best place I've ate at great service and great food no BS!!!

I went to a beautiful wedding at Desert Foothills, which was catered by Bobby Q's. Absolutely incredible BBQ. I had the beef brisket, pulled chicken, ribs, smoked sausage and mac and cheese. The ribs and the sliced smoked sausage were AMAZING. So so good. I was in a nice pretty dress, fully planning on eating delicately....one bite, and I was out of control.

My girlfriend from Oregon and I had a delicious meal at Bobby Qs restaurant tonight. Initially, we had a minor situation with the menus each having different prices. The manager was very gracious and offered us the lower-priced menu.  Very professional and very friendly. 
LeeAnne was our server and she was a 10.  ??My girlfriend ordered a steak sandwich. The steak was grilled to perfection with a glazed caramelized sauce that brought out the steak's flavors. It was thick and juicy and so flavorful covered in grilled mushrooms served with onion rings so tasty I ordered one to go.
Their potato soup is almost a meal in itself. It is so flavorful with cheese and bacon and chopped onions and potatoes I could've eaten another bowl instead I got one to go.
Bobby Qs gives you a small bag of homemade donuts to thank you for enjoying their restaurant. Give it a try for sure. 
Second review:  treated friends today to Bobby Qs for burgers and steak sandwiches. Kyle served us and he was beyond on top of keeping us satisfied. Actually I was the one who got treated today.  Manager Taylor himself took care of a minor problem I had with my steak. He solved the issue as fast as humanly possible.  He gave me the BEST customer service ever in any restaurant I've eaten. Food so wonderful; service the same.

OMG the little donuts were melt-in-your-mouth amazing! The baby back ribs were great - meaty and tender. The grilled veggies on the side were smoky and yummy. The service was attentive without being pesty. Even my dirty martini was well done!

This place is weird because half of it is trying to be a Vegas style night club and stays closed most of the time except weekends. Such a waste of space that could be used to fill tables through out the week instead. My dad really likes this place. The atmosphere is great and most of the food is good but I have had better BBQ. Anyone can grill or "smoke" some meat and slather BBQ Sauce on it and trick most people into thinking its great BBQ but the true test is in the brisket and the brisket here is substandard at best.

Wow, this place was amazing! The service was fantastic - friendly and timely. The cornbread to start was delicious, and everyone enjoyed their entrees. I had the juicy southern fried chicken, smothered in a delicious gravy, with roasted corn and mashed potatoes on the side (both sides were exceptional!). I also had a bite of the brisket sandwich - so good! I love the cinnamon donuts as a parting dessert. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could.

I was out here for work with my coworker working offsite. A couple of facebook friends recommended this place to eat. The bbq here was sooo good we came here twice. I did the 3 meat combo beef ribs, st louis, and brisket with sides of mac and cheese and roasted corn. The sauce on the meat was perfect not too sweet and not too overwhelming, they do give you a jar for added sauce and a option to add their spicy sauce (highly recommend). The meat falls right off the bone and melts in your mouth like ice cream. The mac and cheese was so good it had melty cheesy hearty goodness to it. And the roasted corn was ok, due to im a corn on the cob type of guy. The concept of the restaurant may look deceiving, but once you walk in is like walking into a 4 star restaurant. It gave the presence of comfort with immaculate service. Even the manager that was working both Wednesday and Thursday even recognize us and gave us that welcoming feeling. Definitely a place to come back to when visiting Phoenix. Thank you Bobby Q staff for an awesome service and great food. 5 stars all around.
This place claims to serve Saint Louis barbecue spareribs. I know Saint Louis Saint Louis spareribs are a friend of mine. These were NOT Saint Louis spareribs!
just wanted mention since on was on the site, NO ONE ever contacted me!!!!!!!!!!

They had such amazing customer service. The food was amazing! They had bought the mac and cheese and when they placed it on the table it touched a little ketchup. They went a bought a new one out when they didn't need too! They have awesome dessert as well!

Now here is a place that knows how to make some outstanding barbecue. Have lived near this place for awhile and was always curious how good was it. This place from the time you step in lets you know that this is a true barbecue place. Between the atmosphere which just sets the mark for a very nice place and the smell from when you walk in. Took a friend here, I ordered the barbecue brisket and my mistake was I should of ordered it with sauce just flooding out of the sandwich. My friend ordered the ribs which were so tender that the meat easily came off clean from the bone. I loved how they put sugar on the rims of the glasses for the lemonade. The staff was very friendly and explained that everything is handmade and the meat is cooked for 20 ours before coming out. You haven't had real barbecue until you have come to Bobby Q's.

10/12/14
This used to be a Bobby McGees, which the waitress will probably tell you its your first time there.  The BBQ is some of the best I have ever had in my entire life!  Little speedy, but  not unreasonable & well worth it, if you are taking someone out for a nice dinner, you will be sure to please!   

They have outdoor and indoor seating, and a dance club setting.  It still retains some of its vibe from when it was Bobby McGee's, just modern.   To be honest, this change in format was the best thing that happened to Bobby McGees, because it was starting to feel stuck in the 1970s.  Bobby Q's is just plain awesome.

I highly recommend them!

Update 12/31/17

My review still stands, but be aware that I have noticed since my last review that the crime activity in the surrounding area has become remarkably worse.

I absolutely love this place!  Best bbq experience I've  had in the valley. Great meats,  sauces and sides. Gotta try the mac n cheese!  Just when you think you can't possibly stuff another bite in your mouth,  they bring out a bag of fried mini donuts tossed in sugar with your bill.

Hungry for BBQ?  Run, don't walk, to this place!  In from out of town and gave it a shot based on YELP.  Place was a huge hit with the entire family.

Great food...some of the best BBQ we've ever had.  Brisket rolls (Q rolls) as appetizer were fantastic.  We got the family deal for $28 on a Sunday and we had plenty of leftovers.  Cinnamon Sugar donuts (free) for desserts were a hit.  

Service was fast and friendly.  We were seated quickly and all of our food and drinks ordered came to the table fast.  Decor is perfect - rustic but a little  upscale.

Highly recommend doing reservations off their website before going - there was a big wait by the time we walked out on a Sunday.

If we could give 6 stars we would - best restaurant experience we've had in years!!!

I've had BBQ in California, Texas and Kansas, Booby Q is the best I've ever had . Fall off the bone short ribs with amazing flavor, beef ribs were perfect, even their grilled veggies were the best I've had at a restaurant. Way to go Bobby ! Oh ya, and thanks for  helping me meet my wife in 1992.

The husband and I went here last weekend to celebrate the beginning of my break and to get a juicy burger. The restaurant is cute, kind of themed, and the service was friendly. They smoke their meat for 18 hours and you can see their chicken roasting from the dining room. They start you with some pretty good cornbread. For entrees we split the burger with bacon and bbq sauce and the pulled pork sandwich with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese... very healthy. The burger was tasty, not the most amazing burger ever, but solidly good. The pulled pork was better, definitely flavorful and good with their spicy bbq sauce. Both sides were pretty mediocre, I didn't like the mac and cheese...tasted like velveeta and the mashed potatoes were gluey. When we were done they brought out a little bag with a couple doughnut bites in it.... yum! I would come back here to try some more of their Q.

This place is a Solid B.  As a guy from KC I feel qualified to say they have great BBQ.  Those rolls and brisket are really good.  The place is a pretty nice restaurant and I hate nice BBQ places.  The prices are pretty high and truthfully you could do better for less money.

Stopped for dinner and took a seat at the bar. It was my second time there and we had the best service by Shar. She was extremely friendly and attentive. I was very indecisive but after going with Shar's recommendation I got the filet (added mushrooms) and the mashed potatoes and it was BOMB. Wait there is more...she asked if I wanted my mushrooms sliced or whole. What?? Seriously?? I've never been given an option on mushrooms before, pretty awesome. I tried the Bobby's mule--twice lol it was the best mule I've ever had. Overall, I was super impressed and are excited to try out their new biltmore location our server told us about.

My family and I ate here Saturday night.....based on the reviews of Yelp.
We were not disappointed, as a matter of fact, we were pleasantly surprised with every aspect of our evening.  When you arrive at Bobby Q's, the outside makes it feel as if you are about to walk into a dive.  However when you turn the corner and walk in the door, that is not the case.  Very nice ambiance throughout the entire restaurant. They had wonderful mood lighting! I love low mood lighting!  Our server was very friendly and helpful.  Our meals were excellent.  My husband got the Chicken Fried Chicken and I got the Top Sirloin.  We started with the corn bread, which was delicious!  I don't care if it feel apart at least it wasn't dry!  My top sirloin was cooked a perfect Medium and seasoned exceptionally well.  I really loved it and I love steak.  Surprisingly the roasted corn was one of my favorites of the night, I don't usually gobble up corn when I get it with dinner, but man, this was some heavenly corn!  My husbands chicken fried chicken was perfect.  Pounded thin, with a light crispy batter, I hate to say it, but it might have been better than Texaz Grill's chicken!  It was tasty.  My son got the oven cooked pepperoni pizza and it was a large portion for the $4.00 price tag, he even took some home.  Our food was excellent, there wasn't one thing we didn't like, the food was hot, the service was great, the atmosphere was great, we will return!

Bobby Qs. Bobbbbbbbbby Qs. Where do I start. The service, always great. Manager/owner always stops at your table at least once to see how it's going. They don't even give  a second thought to fix the smallest complaint if one exists. The ribs are number one with the smokehouse burger(no salt) a close second. The shoe string fries love accompanying both(again no salt). The corn bread nicely introduces you, then the Q rolls or pizza with brisket fully loaded helps fill a section of your stomach up, and the entree knocks it out. This place has made it so that every other bbq place sucks lol. Go here order the ribs or burger and tell them to hold the salt. Enjoy

To be honest, I had never been to or even heard of Bobby Q's - and I have lived about 2 miles away for almost a year now. However, the boyfriend and his family are fans and we decided to go eat here this last weekend for the boyfriend's birthday. This night also happened to be the same night of the "Phoenix Hurricane" so we were happy to see the power was on, but boy were they busy!

Something I have always found helpful: "Never eat at a restaurant that's not busy."

We had to wait for almost an hour for a table for 6, but we knew that going in and just waited on the patio. I don't know if they are always that busy, but it seemed the waiting area could definitely have more chairs or space for that term of wait. And if the weather happens to not be so agreeable, like that night, they could use a bit more coverage so patrons aren't getting soaked. 

Anywho - onto the meat - literally. We were sat and started salivating over the menu - all sounded and looked good (I order via Yelp photos). We each ordered something different and there was a lot of sharing going on. One in our party was happy to hear they still offered the Crab Legs dinner, so take note if that's your fancy. We ordered the Rotisserie Chicken meal with (2) sides: mac and cheese and a loaded baked potato. Everything was delicious and satisfying and was plenty of food - I could have probably taken some home - and all for $13. In my opinion, this place has great prices. I expected, with the look and feel of this restaurant, to be a bit over-charged but I was pleasantly surprised. 

Boyfriend ordered the Brisket meal with (2) sides, and dang that meat was tasty! We loved how it came with sauce on it, unlike a lot of these places that are serving you sauceless, dry meat and you have to add it yourself. We also asked for extra and we loved how they brought us our own 'jugs' of regular and spicy (we used up all of the spicy) sauces for the table. 

I cannot remember our server's name, but she was awesome. The definition of what service should be in a busy, family style restaurant. We had a lot of requests for her and she was being asked for this and that left and right by almost every member of our table and she handled each one with patience and grace - I was impressed. And I am rarely impressed by servers lately. 

If it was pouring, and half of the city's power was out, and we had to wait on the patio for an hour for a table - I would still come here and eat again. I am actually looking forward to it. 

OMG those donutsssssssssssss. Make sure you get some. 


That 'nightclub' they have though...
Over rated and over priced.  I have been in a hole in the wall much better places. The manager came to check the service as a job and not genuinely.

There's no reason you should not go to this restaurant. Their food speaks for itself, my ribs fell off the bone and were absolutely delicious. The lemonade (frozen) blew my mind.
I went for my birthday and had a group of 12, the staff was unaware of this and still put us in a private room and my water cup was never empty.

This place was rated one of the top bbq spots in Phoenix. My partner and I went there when we were visiting Phoenix. It was Friday night and the place was popping. I thought we would have to wait for a table but luckily we didn't. Our server was very nice and knowledgeable. He told us a bit about the place. Food and drink wise...I ordered a watermelon cooler. I thought it would be sweet but it was kind of spicy...in a good way. I had the steak sandwich and my partner had the brisket sandwich. And it was cooked to our liking and the meats were tender. We also got free cornbread which I thought was very nice. The waiter didn't have to give it to us but he did. And my partner and I were both in food comas at the end. I wish they had other locations other than the Phoenix area. But we are definitely going back.

By far the best ribs I've ever had. Split the $52 Whole Hog Heaven platter with my wife. Two rib choices, two smoked meat choices and three sides. It was awesome. Their good rating on Yelp and a hankering for ribs before we boarded a plane back east led us to Bobby Qs and we're thrilled it did.

Haven't been to this place since the 70's when it was Bobby McGees never really thought about going to Bobby Qs decided to try it a couple of weeks ago l was very impressed the food was great and the prices were  resonable the manager Taylor was there at the door busy with employees and greeting customers, I was wearing a Navy t-shirt and he asked me if I was a veteran I told him I'm wearing it because my grandson is in the Navy he thanked me and told me to tell my grandson thank you for his service, after enjoying our dinner and receiving our bill I noticed that we were given a 20% military discount, that was a nice surprise and made me feel very proud of my Sailor it was a great evening great dinner. My wife and I went back for dinner again just a few days ago and again was met by Taylor and friendly employees Taylor again was very professional and made us feel very welcome and the waitress was awesome I don't remember her name but she was great. We will be making Bobby Qs a regular dinning spot.

This place is DELICIOUS! My husband's company threw a party here and they sat our massive party on the covered patio which was decorated with hanging lights; the ambiance was enjoyable. We kept them busy ordering different cocktails and appetizers and the servers were informative and upbeat. The spinach dip was a favorite and I remember a tasty shrimp cocktail that I no longer see on their menu. Dinner and desert were phenomenal. I had prime rib and sampled a few different deserts, all delicious. I also decided to have my co-ed baby shower here. I called a month ahead to book a private room, but when I got there they put us in the main dining area. I objected and they ended up moving us to the "club portion." It was cut off from the rest of the restaurant and turned out well. It's a great place to entertain large parties.

So we've run the gamut of dining opportunities here at Bobby Q's - Lunch, Dinner, Take away.  And each and every time, H-E-A-V-E-N on a plate.  Service is prompt but not rushing.  Nice without being pretentious.   Casual and welcoming atmosphere.  And the food - simply yummy.    If you have the kidlins with you, they have plenty of kid friendly foods.  It's a great place and we've never been disappointed!
Best brisket ever! Tender, moist and juicy -- not fatty. Excellent pulled pork, tasty sides. We'll definitely be back.

Came here on a whim. The outside is very deceptive but the inside is pretty nice, great atmosphere and mood lighting. The food though is the key here. In one word, spectacular! I got the brisket sandwich with Mac & cheese. So so so good!  The brisket falls apart it's so tender, and really doesn't need a sauce. The Mac & cheese is gooey, creamy & hot. The husband had the BBQ chicken and he inhaled his. Just a great meal.
Very Yummy BBQ here. You can smell it from the parking lot. It is in the middle of the neighborhood, but don't doubt it! You get mini donuts at the end of your meal.
Barbecue is the best. Everything here is good. Mac and cheese here is my favorite! Love the corn bread too...

This isn't your typical bbq place, where you wear bibs and there's country music playing and bbq sauce flying everywhere - that's how we do it in Texas. At Bobby Q's, its more formal; there's a nice ambience, there's a full bar, and you eat with forks and knives. 

The Pros:
The great service
The 10% off by checking in on yelp - yay!
The complimentary cinnimon sugar donuts at the end which are HOME MADE - dayum, those things were awesome
The pineapple drink - its a real pineapple filled with a ton of alcohol but guess what? It tastes like juice...which means its dangerous. Drink at your caution.

Cons
Their sides could be better - The mac and cheese was way too thick and unfortunately, didn't match the rave reviews. 

Another interesting fact - there's a club next door so you can get your grub and then dance it off
Absolutely delicious! The platters can feed two, their house salad (usually basic) had bacon and cheese on it, the patio was awesome, and free donuts Togo!

I don't know what all the hoopla is about this place.  I'm pretty particular about my BBQ having grown up in Dallas; so I'm partial to NE Texas BBQ, and this ain't it.  I suppose it appeals to a broad spectrum of diners which is what it takes to fill a restaurant.  Recent visit had the brisket, chicken and links.  Brisket was ok, chicken-ok, link not very good.  The mac and cheese was stellar, rest of the sides were mediocre.  The doughnuts at the end of the meal is a very nice touch.  A little pricey for a BBQ joint.

I noticed that the owner/manager of Bobby Q is frequently on this yelp page, so I really hope he gets to this review because I had a fantastic dinner at Bobby Q's Sunday night. The food, ambience, and everything was great, but what really set this place over the top for me was our server, Anthony.

So if the staff over at Bobby Q's ever reads this, I just want to let them know how impressed I was with Anthony's service(enough to toss him a $10 tip on a $20 check, it'd be more but a starving student can only give so much haha). He was not only attentive and helpful but was very friendly throughout the night. Coming by at the most opportune times to offer us water refills, extra sauce(warmed sauce, fancy!), and even suggested different items on the menu that he thought we'd like better(which we did!) Such a great guy and really made a huge difference in our dining experience.  So if you ever get the chance to stop by Bobby Q's, ask for Anthony and toss him a huge tip as a thank you after you have one of the greatest dining experiences of your life!  Haha.

All that aside, the food at Bobby Q's was great as well. We got the three meat combo with Beef Ribs(great), Baby back ribs(my personal favorite), and beef brisket(a tad bit dry, but still good) with Mac and cheese(amazing!) and shoestring fries(also good) as the sides. Everything was great, and the fact that we didn't have to wait an hour like at other BBQ places was another huge plus as well. The food came quick, was piping hot, and they even split it onto two plates for us because I was splitting the food.

At the end of the dinner, they gave us some cinnamon donuts to-go with our meal, which was the real cherry on top of everything. Loved this place, will definitely be bringing friends here for BBQ nights, and I could go on for days about the great service from Anthony.

I was visiting my friend in Arizona this past May, and we were looking to get some barbecue. She had never been here, so we decided to check it out for lunch. We both ordered the platter sampler ($16) that came with a variety of items. I got the brisket, ribs, and pork with a side of fries while my friend got the sausage instead of the pork. The sausage was a little spicy and a tad on the drier side (still good though), but everything else was excellent. The ribs were especially good - the meat was tender and fell off the bone easily. At the end of your meal they give you free mini donuts which was cute.
Interior is nice and spacious, there is outdoor seating, and service was great. According to my friend it was a little pricier, but I'm used to LA/NY prices, so I thought it was a deal considering I still had leftovers after eating my fill. If I were ever in the area again, I would definitely go.

The Corn Bread was the BOMB and the the RIBs were even better.
I'm a fan of Tony Roma's RIBs and there is not one here (yet?) in Phoenix, so I tried this place and will be back again. The mashed potatoes were ok. and so was the Mac N Cheese as my 3 year old tore that up. My 8 year old tore up the RIBs and bone almost, lol.
I wouldn't recommend Sunday's though as it was PACKED and took longer than anticipated. So if you're hungry and it's not Sunday, I recommend this place.
The area is NOT my favorite place to be as I used to live literally on the same block (neighborhood) and it's kind of ghetto (IMHO).
Lost 1 star for the Sunday wait and location.
Best BBQ in Phoenix.  Jessica our waitress was friendly and very helpful.  A clutch go to dinner where service and food is amazing.

Love this place! Unpretentious. Good food and great service. The home made donuts are addicting. They give you a lot of food so make sure you leave room for the donuts.

T would take the donuts on the golf course!

Had a fun night I was turnt 
Went on a Thursday.
Bad thing was right before 
Closing time someone started
 a fight huge fight and most of us where told to leave. Which was fine cause I didn't wanna get shoot!


Wants to update my review to say sorry for my complaint. This is the same location but at night they turn this place into a nightclub this is where the altercation happened.

Just had lunch here for the first time. It was excellent! 
It was an hour drive for me but worth every minute.
Service was fast & friendly. Chelsea took excellent care of this first timer. I ordered the two rib combo with baby back & St.Louis. My sides were beans and pecan Cole slaw. Everything was hot and fresh. The meaty ribs did fall off the bone. I was licking my fingers after the couple of bites. I like it when a manager stops at your table to make sure everything is ok, nice touch. A little spendy but you get what you pay for and in my case it was actually 2 meals. I feel sorry for the other bbq places in the valley that I thought were good...Bobby Q kills 'em.

This place has some great BBQ, there's no other way to put it. The serving size they give you per plate are huge, you'll more then likly be taking some of your meal home with you to enjoy later. The brisket is what i would suggest, its amazing.

The food was decent, though I've had better barbeque (their sign says something like "Best barbeque in the U.S."
The one dish that stood out was their grilled corn.  It's cut off the cobb and had a sweet flavor.
We noticed that about 1 in 3 patrons were grossly overweight, perhaps their servings are  more than one person should eat (we split the 3 meat dinner).

Let's start with the waitress. Could she be more enthusiastic? Probably not. She was great. Described the food like she was ordering for herself. Then the cornbread. Wow. Best ever. Period. Everybody ordered something different so i won't include all the details, just the highlights. Mac n' cheese. EASILY the best I have ever eaten. Let's talk ribs. My daughter will not touch BBQ sauce. She helped me gobble my ribs down with great enthusiasm. Fall off the bone might be an understatement. Service was great and surprisingly, the price was more than fair. If you are a BBQ fan, this is a MUST TRY.

Definitely order the Q- Rolls as an appetizer. They made me think of a barbecue egg roll. So good! Right as we finished off those, the waiter dropped off 2 sweet, warm, delicious cornbread cakes. The fried chicken was good, but not great. The roasted corn and mashed potatoes were very good. Potatoes came without gravy and I would probably ask for some next visit. My husband enjoyed his steak. It was cooked perfectly and tender. The coleslaw was was good, as was his very cheesy Mac and cheese.

I'm officially changing my name to chimchurri shrimp!
The best shrimp I've ever ever had.   Holy shr#mp!

Wait staff was great- and manager Michelle was very nice and welcoming.  If you're a foodie- this is your church!
Best steak & lobster in Phoenix. Our go to restaurant! Service is A+, great atmosphere prefect for a night out.

I am very impressed with this spot the ribs were outstanding the coleslaw was perfect and the Mac and Cheese was incredible. I cannot wait to go back and try more food there. Austin our server was great he checked on us all throughout the evening. If you have a chance to try this place don't cheat yourself treat yourself to some good eatin'!!!!!

This place is da bomb, although priceyl!  For two people, plan on spending close to a bill ($100).  My bf and I split a rib combo plate.  The food was simply divine.  I also ordered a drink which came in a pineapple.
