Let me just say that I am not a BBQ kind of girl. My husband is a BBQ fiend so I tend to make some concessions for him. Bobby Q's was one of those concessions. Thank goodness for that because I love this place. Luckily for me, there are things here I would eat such as the grilled salmon ($17) and chimichurri shrimp ($16). And the sides, good heavens, the sides are so damn good. The only ones I ever get are the sweet, buttery corn and the mac and cheese. Neither are healthy (the corn is extremely buttery) and the mac and cheese is extremely gooey...just the way it should be! I am a sucker for a good mac and cheese and then when you factor in the best corn bread I have EVER eaten, I am a goner. Good lord, you would think I am hungry the way I am writing this review but I promise I am writing this on a full stomach. No, but seriously, if you like corn bread, you have to try Bobby Q's corn bread. It's ridiculous. Then at the end of the meal, they give you these sugary donuts (the granulated sugar) that just top off a great meal. If you go on Sundays, try the Hog Heaven. For $29, you can feed 3-4 people. It has pulled pork, beef brisket, baby-backed ribs, bbq chicken, two sides, and corn bread. I do think the sides are not enough for four people compared to the amount of meat you get. We ordered it last night and had enough meat for 5 people but enough sides for only 2 people. They did give us 6 pieces of corn bread, though. Either way, it is a GREAT deal. 

The interior is very nice with dim lighting for a possibly romantic feel. It seems kid-friendly and we haven't had any issues bringing our almost 3 year old here. We have also always had good service. The prices are on the higher end but as I mentioned the Hog Heaven on Sundays is a very reasonable deal when eating out. Hmmm, I think another visit this week is in order....

Yelp did NOT lead us wrong.  
My husband and I live about 200 miles north of Phx., so when we come down we like to go for a nice meal.  We like to try new places, but the last three or four have been bad.  This time I went to Yelp to find a few possibilties.  We decided BBQ was the flavor of the day.  Bobby Q;s was the second listing by ratings,but they had an impressive number of reveiws, and they were close to our stops for the day.
Okay, on to the meal...It was fantastic!  The lunch menu is fairly priced for what you get.  I went for the most expensive thing( $13.00), a 3 meat sampler plate.  I ate way too much, but it was so good.  The hubby got the smokehouse burger,  he loved it, talked half the way home about how good it was.  He grew up near Memphis, where BBQ is a staple and he loved the BBQ sauce.  The cornbread cakes were a great starter, and the doughnuts they gave us for a finisher were all the dessert we had room for.  
Last but not at all least, Jo did a wonderful job of taking care of us and answering any questions that we had.  
We will be back, probably next trip to Phx.
Good food good company and great server. Cameron was so cute and had was very patient with all my #none of this" and  "dressing on the side" demands. I will return

Bobby Q's is an excellent place for family dinner. Workers are very friendly from the start and makes you feel very comfortable. Corn bread is delicious! By far the best barbecue I've had so far in Arizona. To top it off they give you free old fashioned donuts as treats to take home. Add in reasonable prices and you've got a pretty great place. I highly recommend their Q rolls!
Their Prime Rib is terrific! Service was great and Manager always comes over and asks how everything was! Love this restaurant!

Corn bread was really good and the mac and cheese was so creamy. Had the pulled pork sandwich and really enjoyed it. My husband has baby back ribs and they were fall off the bone good. The atmosphere is really cool.  Will definitely be back.
Excellent ribeye , ribs and brisket . Potato salad was very good , coleslaw not so much . Grilled veggies to die for . Service is second to none Ashlynn was awesome , very helpful .

I don't write reviews normally because it is just my opinion and everyone has one, right? Well, looks like things do change.  My husband and I went to Bobby Qs today on the advice of a friend.  I love BBQ, my husband not so much.  But....he gave it 5 stars and I'm all in.  

We ordered the Whole Hog meal to share.  I ordered a house salad to share as well.  Garrett, our server, was PHENOMENAL! watching and close by but not hovering and in your face.  He gave a great history of the place, was prompt, polite, funny.  Garrett even split the salad into 2 bowls for us, without my asking.  

Honestly when the meal came, we thought Oh thats not alot...well, we brought home a packed box of leftovers.  Beef ribs were tender, juicy and sauced perfectly.  Baby backs were even better and the pulled pork was mind numbing.  Even the sides were delicious..good compliments to the meal not an after thought and plenty for 2 people.   Bbq ordered out is so hit and miss...BobbyQs was nothing but homeruns!! 

This is definitely a place we will return to again and again...not only was the staff great, the food fantastic, the prices right....these people understand good Southern Sweet Tea. That tops it for me.

They would get 5 stars if the female staff were more attentive to EVERYONE at the table and not just my husband, Forgot my drinks multiple times but were constantly refilling his. Then she just kept trying to engage him in a conversation and actually started flirting with him ( playing with her hair and PUT HER HAND ON HIS) We left immediately and i was EXTREMELY upset.

Best BBQ in the valley! The brisket is my absolute favorite and its so tender. The ribs are really good as well. The price of the meat platter dinner (not sure of the name) came with so much food. Im sure it could feed a good 5 people.
Food is pretty good, service is decent. There isn't much better BBQ in the area, a little pricey but the environment it's fun.
Amazing food and bbq. Service was awesome and the price was good for the food. Beef ribs are the best big and full of beef. St. Louis ribs come right of the bone without a problem.

The best BBQ in this town !! the babyback ribs fall of the bone! steaks are freaking great because they use walnut and mesquite to cook the meat with, The Ribs & Brisket are smoked for nearly 20 hours. I have yet to have a bad meal at any of the locations. They Have veggie burgers at the 32nd St location ! The servers and staff just treat me special

Everything about this place is perfect. Eating here is really an experience. I've ordered the whole hog on several occasions, which includes a variety of meats and feeds about 3. Be sure to ask for extra bbq sauce, as multiple types are available. Also donuts at the end are a nice touch.

Food amazing, service wasn't the best for us.. Maybe a new waitress.. Drinks were empty and we sat waiting for things and our check for more than an appropriate time. But we all loved the food and will go back. Expect a long wait if you go during the weekends!! We waited a hour on a Friday night and had gotten there at 6:45.

They have a club inside that requires fancy dressing of you want to go. Sounds fun. I was with my family so that wasn't in the plans. 

The area is a little creepy but again the food was SO good!! The inside reminded me a bit of a Papadeauxs style. Check them out, you won't be disappointed in their yummy food.

Caveat Emptor--- If you like REAL BBQ this is not the place for you.  The first clue was that the place slathers it's food in sauce as a rule, not an option.  I have no idea how they can smoke their meats for up to 22 hours without having any noticeable hint of smoke.  And don't tell me that, "it has a smoke ring so it has to be good"(that's just a natural reaction of nitric oxide).  The brisket was bland, the beef ribs had essentially no meat, the pork ribs had a little flavor, and the pulled pork was downright appalling and stringy and flavorless.  

Sides of grilled vegetables were flavorless and bitter.  The pecan coleslaw was bland, and the pecan part was just a sprinkle of untoasted pecans sprinkled on top, and the ranch beans were very vinegary (a welcome bit of flavor)

I have no idea how this place was voted a best BBQ place in the nation unless it was by a bunch of people that have no tastebuds, in fact, I would rank this as some of the worst I've had in the nation.  

This place needs to up their game, Phoenix has BBQ that is infinitely better and at half the price.  

The service was fine, but the management is a bit overbearing.  When you need to toot your horn about how good you are to every table when they sit, it really shows that you're not that great, greatness speaks for itself.

Bottom line, my family will not return, and will never recommend that anyone else does.

Please search out any small local BBQ pit and get some real food with real flavor.
Best BBQ in Phoenix! Everything we ate was amazing! We will be back whenever possible!

Wow, this place is amazeballs! I've been to some of the best BBQ joints in the country (Bogart's, Pappy's in St. Louis and Kreuz, Smitty's, Black's in Texas) and this is not far behind at all! Plus, the service couldn't be much better. 

Ambience was great and a tad dark with a bit of a rustic feel to it. Too bad it was cold outside that night or we would have eaten out on the patio. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with a side of potato salad. Before that came, we started with a complimentary corn bread which was one of the best corn breads I've ever had. It was warm, sweet, and almost cake-like in texture. Pork from the sandwich was moist and not stringy at all (which is often the case in a lot of BBQ places). The flavor itself was smoky and there was just enough sauce so that the taste of the meat still took center stage. Potato salad was great too and had just the right amount of mayo. 

Once we had finished our meal, we were given a bag of complimentary mini donuts to take home. Wow, free cornbread AND donuts? I'm completely sold! I've tried a good amount of restaurants since moving to Arizona about 2 months ago, and Bobby Q is definitely in my top 3.
Best BBQ I have ever had.  Great food, great service, and they even hand you a bag of freshly made donuts for a to-go treat.  This is what eating out should be.
Went on a Sunday and got a family type platter. It's good, reasonably priced, and 3 people can comfortably eat from it.

If you want some tasty BBQ and a fun atmosphere this is the place for you! Highly recommend making reservations as this place was crazy on a Thursday night. We were seated right away and our server explained all their specials and drinks to us. She got our drinks started right away but there were so many people here this night that our appetizer came before our drinks. This was not a problem though, as our family was just enjoying hanging out together. 

All of the meat was so delicious. Smokey, moist, and flavorful! Also that mac and cheese was delicious! Portions are huge so expect to take half your food home, we love left overs so this was not a problem for us. I will say after our entrees came out our server seemed to disappear and it was difficult to order dessert and get our check. 

All in all this was a great place for some good BBQ, definitely come ravenous!

I was born and raised in Texas, so I have been searching for good barbeque in Arizona since I got here a couple years ago.  This place is the real deal, and SO much better than the crappy chains like Dickey's.

I came in for lunch last week and got a cup of the ham and bean soup to start with.  It was yummy!  Delicious broth, plenty of thinly sliced ham.  I also ordered the sampler lunch of baby back ribs, barbeque chicken, and spicy sausage, with a baked potato as the side.  The ribs were heavenly, I didn't even bother to pick them up because the meat just fell right off the bone so I used a fork.  Perfect with zero gristle.  The sausage was pretty good, a little dry but nothing to frown about.  The chicken was okay, but barbeque chicken isn't really my thing, I only ordered it for variety because I didn't want three pork dishes.  The corn bread that comes on the side is pretty good, it's very light, somewhat sweet and falls apart as you pick it up.  The baked potato was alright.

Coming for lunch here is definitely the better deal,  the three meat sampler was maybe $12 (sorry I can't remember for sure) and came with one side plus cornbread.  The three meat sampler at dinner is $21 with the same amount of food except you get an extra side.  Pretty criminal if you ask me.  So even though the bartenders at dinner are really lovely, I'd rather come in for lunch and pay half the price for the same amount of food.

As a bonus they also give you a paper bag of fresh mini cinnamon-sugar donuts with the check, although good luck finding room for them!

Excellent food excellent service. Best Barbecue in town. Love the donuts too. Abby was a great server. Will definitely eat returning to this place.  For me it is pricey but it is worth every penny.  Very filling
Pricey but worth every penny. I had a carzy pineapple dink that made the whole night perfect.
Went for another visit and am raising my prior rating due to more ample servings this go around. Also, the Yelp check-in discount was good to have too!

After seeing that over 130 people had already reviewed this place I almost decided to not post but I felt like with the quality of food and service that we received it would be unfair to not do my part to pump this place up.  

We showed up for lunch and were greeted immediately upon entering.  We sat outside on the patio and there were a few comments from my fellow diners about how comfortable and well decorated the place was. 

The service was great.  Very attentive and efficient.  She was right on with the drink refills and did everything with a smile.

My brother had the pulled pork sandwich and managed to finish it, but just barely.  His girlfriend did the same.  I decided to try the sample platter consisting of sausage, ribs, and chicken.  I was not sorry.  The sausage was very tasty but wasn't overpowering.  The chicken was done with plenty of flavor and not at all dry.  The ribs were great as well.

I couldn't finish the plate so I get to enjoy the leftovers tonight.   There's nothing better than enjoying a meal, then being able to enjoy it again!

Don't forget to mention yelp to get your 10% off.  And enjoy your thank-Q's when you leave.
Hands down, some of the best slap your mama bbq I have ever had. Simply amazing. The server was awesome, energetic, and fun to boot. I will make it back...

I'm baaaackkkk! And all is still great. Service and food.
The service really shined on this visit. The food just speaks for itself. Just go. You can't go wrong.

There donuts and corn bread is to die for ! I will just drive sometimes for this items ... 
there baby back ribs are super juicy and well flavored . I have also experience there night fusion and Ambience and can tell you there drinks are also full of all the good stuff. The martini taste like martini . The beers are nice and cold !!! Great place ...

This was one of the best lunches I've ever had. My colleague and I stopped off to enjoy lunch after our meeting. We ordered the smoked brisket in a roll for the appetizer which was absolutely amazing. I had the brisket for lunch. I thought it was really good as well.  But over done as it was falling apart when you touched it. The baked beans were off the chain! Def recommend going here. You'd love it! Try the Bobby Q pale ale. Perfect!

First of all, kudos to Bobby Q's staff. Absolutely EVERYONE was super friendly and attentive. I was waited on in some way by at least 5 different members of their team, at least 1 of whom I believe was the manager. Everyone smiled and made eye contact, and they all seemed genuinely concerned that my needs were being met, and that I was getting what I wanted. I was immediately greeted with a smile when I walked in, and smiled at the entire time I was there. I really did experience 5 star service.

The ambiance was casual, rustic, and interesting in its own way. 

The bartender came right over (you guessed it - with a big smile) and when I indicated that I had not been in before, she immediately explained about the lunch menu and the various options in just enough detail. She left me to fill my drink order while I considered my choices. 

I decided on the Platter Sampler, which allowed me to choose three kinds of meat, a side and cornbread. I figured that this would give me a chance to check out more than 1 item. Of the sides, the roasted corn was the most appealing to my tastes. I also ordered their shoestring fries. I don't have the capacity to consume large amounts of food, but with that long a drive, I wanted to try lots of things, even if I couldn't finish them.

A few minutes later, I overheard a couple of gentlemen at the end of the bar ordering meatloaf. Wondering how I had overlooked that, I studied the menu some more, but didn't see meatloaf anywhere. When I asked, the bartender indicated that they periodically have off menu specials. Since I had come so far, I ordered the meatloaf (only $9.99) to go.

My food came out very quickly, and there was a lot of it. Portion sizes were generous. I had opted for a combination of Brisket, St. Louis Ribs, and Spicy Smoked Link Sausage. 

The roasted corn was not corn on the cob, although the dish was topped off with two slices from the end of a roasted ear of corn. The off the cob corn had kernels that looked like they had seen fire. The juice that the corn was in had a good solid smokey flavor to it. I had anticipated and would have preferred roasted corn on the cob. To my personal tastes, it wasn't great, but it also wasn't bad.

The shoestring fries were perfectly cooked, thinly cut, skin on, and nicely salted. It was a HUGE order that came out in a little pail. I could have made a whole lunch out of the fries alone! I hardly put a dent in them.

Turning to my platter of meat, I was somewhat disappointed overall. 

There were several slices of brisket. It was extremely moist, almost mushy as if it had been cooked in liquid, and there was no smoke ring. I've lived and eaten all over the country, including Texas and the Carolinas. I have had good smoked brisket, and this bore no resemblance. It was more like pot roast or meat you would find in stew, with no smokey flavor. In fact, the corn had more smokey flavor than my brisket. I would not order the brisket again because I think this must just be the way they have decided to prepare it. Maybe lots of people love it. Maybe they've never had better. I didn't like it.

The sliced link sausage was missing the usual coarse texture of sausage, with the textures of fat and lean. The mouth feel was as if it has been boiled, or in liquid at a sufficient heat to cook the fat out of it. That left the texture sort of like moist cardboard. The flavor coming through wasn't bad, but the effect was like nicely seasoned boiled cardboard. (It took me the entire drive home to figure out a truthful way to describe it.) Perhaps this batch had just been sitting in warm moisture too long. I'm going to go back and read through the reviews again to see if I'm the only one who experienced this.

The St. Louis Ribs saved the day for the meats. Except for being a bit fatty, and a general lack of smokey flavor, they weren't bad. Not great, but not bad.

The good news was my take-out meatloaf special. I swear my portion of meatloaf was nearly 2 pounds! It was also tasty! It wasn't what I expected as it had more pungently savory ingredients than I am accustomed to in meatloaf, including a degree of heat, although not excessive. It was topped with a generous portion of golden fried onions, and accompanied by a huge serving of skin on mashed red potatoes! The only downside for me was the gravy, which I am grateful came in a separate container on the side. I'm not a fan of tarragon or thyme or whatever it was loaded with. Lots of people at the bar were eating it, but I didn't notice whether or not they used/ate the gravy. Simply a matter of preference I guess.

Please consider this review with a grain of salt. I've traveled and eaten extensively, but I'm not a critic. I just know what I like. You may love what Bobby Q's has to offer. The only thing that I am really sold on is the wonderful customer service. I'll also throw in that they appear to have lots of regulars, and that lunch appeared to be a bustling affair with no lack of diners.

The St. Louis style ribs here were on point. Very tender, very smoky, very much reminded me of the ribs I had at Pappy's Smokehouse in St. Louis, MO. The one knock on it was that it was a tad too salty, but I'm not one to complain about a little salt. They were so good we impulsively ordering a SECOND rack of ribs, only to realize that we were too full to continue soon thereafter.

The Q-Rolls stuffed were amazing as well, especially with the chipotle dip. Imagine a buttery pastry wrapped around smoked brisket, and you get the Q-Roll. If you had to get one appetizer, get this.

The best part is that they give you free donut holes at the end of your meal!

This quite popular BBQ joint in North Phoenix is easy to miss off the freeway, but once you arrive you wondered how you could have ever missed it!  

This restaurant has a simple menu, fair prices, wonderful Happy Hour specials and FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts for all!!  (Get an extra bag to go!)

You can't go wrong with anything you order here.  All meats, chicken and fish too, are moist, tender, seasoned very well and are very filling.  My favorite side dishes there are the macaroni and cheese (da bomb!), Pecan Coleslaw (yes...Pecan!) and their shoestring French fries, with BBQ Sauce as a dip!  

That's all well and good, but what keeps me coming back is their BRISKET!!  Hot damn!  Lean, tender, juicy and addictive!!  You'll be dreaming of Bobby Q Brisket in your dreams that night!  Their Brisket, Ribs and PRIME RIB (ahhh) are the top three sellers at Bobby Q! 

They have a WONDERFUL lunch menu, but what I like is that they don't skimp on serving size for lunches.  You get a ton of meat and normal size side dish.  You just pay a few dollars less.  That's always good. 

Don't forget the FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts at the end of your meal.  Grab an extra bag of them as you leave.  I've also seen people grab a bag of them as they go in as well!  No one there will tell you that you will spoil your meal by doing that so have at it!

This was an interesting find. Upon arriving in Phoenix, i obv checked yelp to see what the best eats were. Based on the reviews, this seemed like a no brainer. 

Its basically an off the highway stop for grub. The outdoor eating area looked more appealing than inside. The service was great but i just wasnt crazy about the bbq or drinks unfortunately. We shared the Q rolls and a both ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The Q rolls tasted like they were from Applebees and the pulled pork just wasnt juicy at all.  The mac n cheese was actually pretty good. Portions are pretty large also. 

The drinks were 95% mixer. They give you unlimited cornbread which was different than your average. It was a circle of  soft and buttery goodness. They also give you free donuts at the end of your meal. These were the winner for me. THEY WERE SO GOOOOD! 

However, the service was great! Our waiter was very attentive and offered if we wanted more cornbread and whatever else we needed. 

I unfortunately would not return here again. It just seems like people like it cause its a convenient "real food" stop on the highway. Its definitely not the best bbq iv ever had and it is certainty not worth the hype. If i do return,  itll be for those damn donuts!
This is our go-to BBQ place in Phoenix!! The BBQ is amazing, the decor is inviting, and the service is great! We come here as often as we can!
Great food, actually i think it is the best BBQ in town. Will always go there if there was any special occasion. But be prepared that it is always a super busy, at least every time we had been there.

Was in Phoenix visting from California, so we decided to check out Bobby Q restaurant since it was near our hotel (marriott). I was impressed by surprise.  I wasn't a big fan of the cornbread and my margarita but overall the food was good. Their Amble ale beer was good as well. Will return on my next visit

I've been to Bobby Q's three times now. I don't get how they are Yelp top 100. It is ok but not fantastic. 

My roasted corn last night was clearly previously frozen corn that had been heated up.

They forgot my sweet potato fries and had to be reminded three times to bring them out. 

The chicken and brisket were fantastic. 

BBQ sauce was ok.

Decor and atmosphere were cool! 

Nothing special or super cool on the cocktail list. 

Definitely make a reservation on the weekends. They are crazy busy and the wait is long if you just walk in. 

Honestly, just about any BBQ place in Texas is comparable or better than Bobby Q's. If you want BBQ it is good but nothing special.
Best brisket in town.  Garrett our waiter was one of the best waiters I have ever had.  He was very attentive and friendly.  The food came out quickly and was delicious!

I ordered take-out on a business trip: fire roasted rotisserie chicken w/ mac&cheese and a wedge salad

Chicken was falling off the bone delicious. I'm a health nut, and although I know bleu cheese dressing is "better" for you, this stuff tastes so incredible you would never know.

Not the low-key hole-in-the wall kind of place, but still seemed fun for a chain-like dining experience. I would certainly go back.

I've been a lot of places to eat and this place by far is now tied for 1st place on my places to eat! The atmosphere is great, the service is awesome, and the food is absolutely wonderful. I recommend this place to everyone. I hope they gets on the uber eats app so I can enjoy them more often!
Great service, great food. Come try it. Loving the brisket and there potato salad is to die for.
Make a reservation this place gets packed. Great food and drinks!!! The dessert donuts are delicious!!!

I've been here a million times and it just keeps getting better. The place will amaze you. I am a huge fan of the decor and ambiance. The service is excellent. Our server was Kody, super cute and nice young guy! He was on point with his recommendations. The food is fabulous. Bobby Q is a must for all you carnivores before you die. They are known for their Baby Back Ribs and St. Louis Ribs but everything else like the rotisserie chicken is very savory. Lastly, their signature donuts are the best! Omg I love those donuts

Solid food choices, great happy hour beer prices, and lots of room for large groups, Bobby Q's is one great place.  I had the 3 meat combo with baby backs, beef ribs, and brisket.  Ribs were tender and moist, and the brisket was fall-apart good.  My only complaint would be the sweetness of the BBQ sauce, but then they provide you with a spicy option at your table when the food comes out, so problem solved!

Bonus, when you check in on Yelp you get a 10% discount off your bill.  And props to our server Emmy, who did a great job dealing with 6 wise-ass baseball fans and kept our whole meal running smoothly.  I will DEFINITELY be back to Bobby Q's on future visits and I highly recommend it!

Just as delicious as it was five years ago! Jessica was our waitress and took excellent care of us! We split the hog heaven and almost finished it. The brisket melts in your mouth! And the doughnuts...no matter how full I am they are a sweet finale!!

When you hear about barbecue, you have to mention Texas and Kansas City. Well, this dude lived in Texas and Kansas City and tasted incredible BBQ in old Texas and ''legendary burnt ends'' at Joe's/Q39 in Kansas City. Probably nobody has told you that Bobby Q in Phoenix delivers kick-ass to-die-for morsels of world-class brisket! 

I came to Phoenix getting ready to enjoy a conference, catch up with good amigos, eat good Mexican food and of course, In-N-Out burgers!! The latter two didn't happen. However Bobby Q happened. It was the best food I have eaten in a while. The wonderful knowledgeable friend Mark H invited me here. This place is about 25 minutes driving north from Downtown Phoenix. Atmosphere is lovely with available patio seats. The staff were the most pleasant and friendliest! For me, if you want to test a BBQ place, get the brisket and see. They served sweet corn bread which was scrumptious! I'm glad my shyness stopped me from devouring Mark's bread. When that naughty brisket came, initial impression was OK.. There was no charred marks or anything. But once you bite the first morsel, you're transferred immediately to another world...It was the most tender, juiciest, tastiest brisket I have ever had so far. I will stop here. 

Next time in Phoenix, try brisket at Bobby Q you must! I can't thank the awesome Mark H enough for this. To Bobby Q chefs, owner, staff, thank you so much! Keep up the smile; keep up the solid work!

Delicious!!!  I had a pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw. Not too much sauce but they give you some on the side of you want more. Spicy and regular. Fun decor and good music. We'll come back for sure and sit and the bar. Several good beers on tap. Tommy our server was great, he took really good care of us.

Yay..my first review!

Bobby Q will not disappoint you. This place has a spacious parking lot and street parking which makes coming here pretty convenient. The hostess was pleasant and our waiter was very patient with us.

I highly recommend the St Louis style ribs. All the ribs are cooked for 10+ hours so they fall right off the bone and melt in your mouth. If you're looking for something much bigger for 2+ people to share and want to try a variety of items, Whole Hog Heaven is for you! Keep in mind the name, because that's exactly what you're getting. It's a heavenly plate of four types of meat along with three sides. We got mac n cheese (good but not great), shoe string fries (yum!), and roasted corn (ok).  *sigh*..I'm still stuffed thinking about it. 

Oh, don't forget to mention Yelp and get 10% off!

Some great barbecue here. We had the pulled pork and brisket sandwiches and both were pretty much perfect. The mac and cheese is straight up magic. This place is a bit of a mad house though. Always seems to be a crowd and a bit of a wait, but their food is worth it. The staff was on point, providing great service all around. I particularly liked the dinning room atmosphere. Barbecue should be simply and delicious, and that's what you'll find here.

The atmosphere is unique, unlike other bar-b-que places I've been to. The patio is much like a garden patio at a home with brick walls and plants high enough to block the traffic / side street noises.  The indoors has a rustic, yet, elligant patio feel to it with the brick walls and rustic wood ceilings.  The furniture is again, more of a patio feel than a typical bar-b-que restaurant.  The noise level was not too loud that you couldn't hear people at your own table. 

The food was wonderful! Although my husband said their burger was too greasy, that was the only downfall.  My brother and I had the St. Louis ribs.  The way they caramelize the bar-b-que sauce on the ribs is great. They aren't runny with sauce dripping down your hand. The rib meat falls off the bone and easy enough to eat with a fork or picking it up. 

The sides were great. I had the macaroni and cheese which was definitely homemade. Not runny and not too dry. The cheese flavor was not too strong either. 

 I would  be prepared to wait a bit for a table because they appeared to always be busy. Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would go back again!
Excellent fall off the bone baby backs, perfectly grilled veggies and an outstanding coleslaw .  Highly recommended and fast!

BBQ to remember! This was really very good. I had two beef ribs and brisket. The meat was smoked and tender. The BBQ sauce was delicious. The sides were creative and tasty. This is a destination restaurant. I would go out of my way to eat here.

A little on the pricey side for BBQ, but the food and ambiance here are great. Looks a little more upscale on the inside than what I had expected...reminds me of something somewhere between Charleston's and the Keg. This is a pleasant surprise, especially considering the location.

The portions are huge, definitely big enough to share (which helps with the cost) and there are probably going to be leftovers depending on what you order. I have sampled most of the BBQ on the menu and it is all delicious. They bring a carafe of mild and regular sauces to the table so there is no shortage of sweet-tangy-saucy deliciousness. Good selection of side dishes. I especially liked their cole slaw -- not too wet, not too sweet.

The server brings a little bag of fresh mini donuts sprinkled with cinnamon sugar at the end of the meal. They are pretty incredible!!!

Good food, I wanna say decent service.. Waiter came by and commenced by greeting us and took our drink order, he didn't come back. Instead another younger kid came over and said "hi I'll take care of you, the other guy got flustered and is gone"! We didn't ask why or what but you must admit that's a bit weird no? 
Anyway this new waiter kid was good, he did take good care of us in the end :) 
Um the food was ok, good, decent, average.. No negative remarks about the actual food or even the place. I guess the only downfall is that it's located In a ghetto-esque neighborhood. And also they are overpriced. To me they are charging as if they are a fine dining spot, which they are not. It's a casual restaurant in a Not so great location. So yea no.  I might go back for a mai tai one day as That was the highlight of my evening there. Thanks.

My reviews are pretty much good and some of the places I don't care for ; never really in between , so I apologize .  Bobby Q is AWESOME! My husband and I drive by when going to the airport and its always strikes curiosity .  My husband picked me up from the airport and we decided to give it ago.  The restaurant was much nicer than expected and cool atmosphere actually.  My husband had the bobby q burger which was yummy and the beer battered fries ...delish. I ordered brisket and baby back ribs with the intention to have leftovers, The brisket was perfectly cooked , so moist and flavorful. The Ribs ; perfect Smokey flavor and fork friendly.  If you ever questioned on whether you should check it out or not...JUST DO IT !

Definitely liked this place. After my cousin convinced me to come here (because I'm not a huge fan of BBQ) I was pleased. I ordered the country fried chicken. It comes with mash potatoes and choice of one side (I chose Mac&Cheese....I know two starches). The cornbread is complimentary, super hot and yummy. My friend ordered the baby back ribs with Mac and baked potatoes (2 starches again). I tried some of her ribs and they were really good, falling off the bone good. I definitely would come back when I visit Arizona. I would love to try the pulled pork or the beef brisket. At the end of your meal they give you a bag of complimentary donuts that resembles the taste of churros. 

My waiter was really nice and very attentive to us as we told him it was our first time dining at the establishment. The manager even walked over to us to make sure everything was fine. The staff appeared to be really nice and courteous.

Im from KC so my standards for BBQ are high. Bobby Q's isn't pretty bad BBQ. I had the St Louis ribs and the Baby Back ribs for lunch. Both were full of fat and grissle. To much BBQ sauce. I could not finish eating them

The service was not that good.  I think we were doing the sever a favor eating at one of his tables.

It's an All American BBQ joint... with an adjunct, weekend Latino dance club.... Yeop.

What you MUST order:

Appetizer: Q- Roll
Side: Mac n Cheese
Main Dish: Anything

Alcoholic Beverage: Shipwrecked.... only need one for the WHOLE table

Try to sit outside, really nice atmosphere.

Fish Fry Fridays during Lent (comes with Two sides for $10.99)! And don't forget to tell the waiter about the Yelp 10% off Discount! AND you don't even need to order dessert because they give you FREE Cinnamon and Sugar Donut Holes!

Unusual thing is that on Friday and Saturday nights there's another side of the bar that opens into a club. Does NOT affect the dining experience.  Our Cabbie told us it was SUPER GHETTO, we'd probably be mauled immediately upon entrance, and possibly beat up by thugs- not the case. Very safe.

Very solid experience!  This is a well put together restaurant.  Decor and ambience are very comfortable.  Place is very clean with a good energy.  Management is very visible and seem to spend a lot of time checking on there guests to ensure satisfaction.  

We had the the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  The fried chicken and gravy were excellent.  Good flavor all around and crispy crust on the chicken.  Chicken was moist and flavorful.  Gravy was also tasty and mashed potatoes were very good.  Mac and cheese was just ok. Not bad.  We also ordered the baby back ribs with a green salad and corn.  Baby back ribs were excellent fall off the bone, tender and juicy. The salad was very fresh, good size with tomatoes onions, cucumbers, croutons and homemade ranch dressing. Yum.  The only disappointment was the corn. It was mushy and swimming in greasy butter like sauce.  They need to change this one up.  Fresh corn on the cob with seasoned butter to the side would be a better option and a more worthy accompaniment to the rest of the delicious food.  

Service was spot on throughout, but getting check closed out was a bit slow, but not much to complain  about.  All in all a pretty great experience.  We'll be back and excited that they will have a new location soon at 32nd and Camelback!

came to bobby q's and split the lunch platter with a friend. we got the brisket, ribs, BBQ chicken and mac & cheese and added a side of mashed potatoes. i appreciated that they split everything for us in the kitchen and then sent out our order on separate plates at no extra cost; nice touch! everything was freaking DELICIOUS and i highly recommend the brisket. my only sort of issue was that the side we added was $4 and it wasn't a large portion at all. BUT for $10 a person including tip, we were able to try a couple different things and leave full but not too full so i'll call that a win. i will definitely be back to try dinner and to sit on their gorgeous patio when phoenix doesn't feel like the surface of the sun. it also looked like they had a good HH!
Outstanding meat!! Great place to eat. The service was great. Awesome hot mini doughnuts after the meal!!

We had a large party on Saturday night and were promptly seated when at least ten guests arrived.

I ordered the Firebird Rotisserie Chicken with potato salad and grilled vegetables on the side.  The chicken was perfectly cooked with moist breast and dark meat.  We also enjoyed their famous homemade cornbread.  My buddies went straight to the red meat, which I looked at with envy.

I definitely will return here.

We were in town to visit my nephew at GCU and figured he was tired of eating the typical college diet of cup-o-noodles and cafeteria food so we looked for a good place to eat nearby that could satisfy the hunger of five very hungry men.  After reading the other reviews we decided to treat him and his roommate to some real food.  We were not disappointed.  We started with appetizers that were brisket filled Q-Rolls (A twist on the egg-roll).  All I could say was WOW/AMAZING. The platter we ordered included brisket that was so moist that it literally melted in your mouth.  The baby back ribs fell off the bone and the pulled pork and beef ribs were flavorful and cooked perfectly.  Best BBQ west of Kansas City. And the Mac and Cheese as a side, well...don't tell my mother (sorry Nana), but it was the best I'd ever had, and I've had a lot of mac and cheese in my day.  And the corn bread....The best corn-bread I have ever eaten, and I'm usually not a fan. I probably ate more than I should have, but hey "when in Rome".  My father (Apa) is a big BBQ fan and this will definitely be on the list of places to stop and eat at when we go back. Great service and ambiance as well.  The waiter and manager checked on us regularly and took care of us as if we were locals.

I was a little tentative about a BBQ place in Phoenix but after reading the yelp reviews i decided to give it a chance! The ribs are amazing, ok the food was amazing, I would say the pieces of brisket I had were good but not Texas brisket! Could have been the cut I had but the ribs were "slap yo momma good"!!! I had corn and Mac and cheese as a side, the Mac is super cheesy borderline overly cheesy but the corn was good! My kids fries were very good too! Love the corn bread and we are awaiting our donuts! 

I will be back although it seemed a bit pricey for bbq but they also didn't serve it on paper and plastic, they have real plates here! Lol!

One of my favorite resturants in Phoenix. Their baby back ribs are incredible way better than any ribs I've had in a long time dont get me wrong my step dad can cook the hell out of some ribs but this joint right here deserve all 5 stars plus more. Came here for a girls night and i very impressed from the atmosphere to the food...

What is the point of having a reservation system if you are going to make reservations wait for their table. The whole point I reserved was to avoid the wait. Food is great and all but service? They really need to work it out better.
Great BBQ, I ahd the brisket and it melted in your mouth. I would love to try them for dinner and have some beers! I will be back here for sure.

Top-notch, enthusiastic waiter who understands customer service; outstanding food!  An expansive menu with big satisfying portions!  Very clean and organized restaurant, which tells me management takes pride in this establishment.  My only negative comment:  the young girl taking us to our table was quite rude.  If the hostess/greeter was welcoming and friendly I would rate 5-stars on a first visit.  For those residing in the East Valley, it is worth the trip!

The food and service here was amazing! Made a pit stop for some food before heading to the airport after hiking havasupai and was very happy with the outcome. Shannon the manager made sure to stop by our table and introduce herself which we appreciated, our server (i think her name was Natalie) did a GREAT job with recommending food unlike most restaurants where they tend to lack that. The food was so good! We can't wait till our next trip back to arizona this is definitely a place worth going to! From the service to the food to the free donuts at the end!

the mai tai is the BEST!!!
the mach and cheese omg is to die for so thick and creamy super cheesey. everything on the menu is just pure bliss.

Back in the 70's this was THE spot to go before/after prim when it was Bobby McGee's Conglomeration.  Waiters in costume, bathtub salad bar and the best disco !  We loved it then, took our son when he turned 17 (13 years ago) and the place always had a soft spot in our hearts.  Then it changed with the times and became Bobby Q's BBQ.  The hubby and I had to try it after all our times there in high school, college and beyond.  We were very pleasantly surprised at the change and delighted with the food!  The BBQ us terrific and shows how their slow cooking technique pays off.  I love the fries and the salads are good too.  A nice stiff cocktail arrives when ordered and the service is mighty good.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are HUGE!  The crowning jewel are the hot little biscuit dough donuts like Mom used to make with cinnamon and sugar; served in a paper bag.  A great family spot with rich history.

I have eaten here twice, once for dinner, once for lunch.

When I came for dinner I was impressed by the food (especially the mud pie) and the service; but this last time coming in for lunch, I had such wonderful service and food that I had to say something.

The hostess greeting was quick and super pleasant. Great!

The waiter, Jacob was patient and more than happy to explain the menu and answer questions. Great!

When it came to changing our minds on stuff, he was completely professional and did not make us feel bad at all!! Totally great!

Also, when we had a question about the bill, he was good enough to listen to us and take care of the issue. THAT, was fabulous customer service!! Thank you Jacob for being the highlight of our visit! I will definitely go back there - hopefully when Jacob is working!

BTW - the food was absolutely delish!!    :)
Darn good BBQ. Not nearly as good as Bryan's Black Mountain BBQ in Cave Creek, or Little Miss, but solid for Phoenix.

Ok, I'm a BBQ fan. St. Louis, Chicago, Philly, Memphis, Texas I love em all. I have often dragged my wife on BBQ treks for hundreds of miles. With that being said I have to begin by saying that Bobby Q has EXCELLENT BBQ. Tender, smoky and chock full o' flavor. I have been here multiple times and have never had anything that disappointed me...until last night. An event so treacherous and diabolical that it prevented me from rating them with 5 stars. The horror!

The in-laws were in from the East Coast and we decided to take them there for dinner. Everything was smashing and up to par as usual until dessert came. Now I have to go on record as saying that I always loved the heaping pile of scrumptious peach cobbler that they serve on the dessert menu. So much so that I convinced my table of 6 to order 3 since they are usually large enough to share and stunningly delicious. Every time I go to Bobby Q I finish off my meal with it and love to complain to my wife as I waddle out of the building (in the grand tradition of glutinous American excess) that I ate too much and my belly hurt. I was looking forward to lamenting my fate yet again last night. But alas, I was in for a shocking turn of events and was dubbed a deceitful liar by the entire table. 

To my horror when the cobblers arrived, they were measly, sickly, ill-prepared portions and a pale shadow of what they were on previous visits. We were plagued with three bowls of undercooked (as in practically raw) peaches that tasted like they were straight from a can and a soggy, undercooked thin square of "crust" sitting on top as an afterthought.  This flavorless absurdity could only have been more demeaning if it were capable of speech and threw dated insults at us. It literally looked like they dumped half a can of uncooked peach slices in a bowl and threw a wet piece of thin white bread on top. All three servings were like this. Now on EVERY occasion in the past the cobbler was gigantic, actually was cooked and warm, had a delectable FULL crust and tasted like it came out of Gramma' Cobbler's oven fresh. To this peach cobbler bizarro universe doppelganger I spit at thee and thine preparer. Bah I say. BAH.

Of course, we complained to the waitress who was nice but said she didn't know that it was any different from normal.  She went back to whoever prepared them and came back saying that the preparer said "they're the same as they always were" which either proved the preparer's incompetence or their willingness to shame the establishment with a bowl full of cobbler-like lies. Our waitress even said she talked to the manager who went back to speak with the preparer...but said manager never came out to either see the imposter cobblers or speak with us about it, which rates as quite poor customer service.  Overall, it left a dark mark on an otherwise belly -bustingly deeeelicious visit. Shame on you Robert Q, shame. 

So, I will still eat at Bobby Q. as their dinner fare IS fantastic (assuming there are no more obvious but blatently denied changes such as with the cobbler), the environment is cozy and the staff are (generally) quite pleasant. However,  I will be wary about ordering the dessert in the future and about the quality and integrity of their customer service skills. I would advise you to use the same caution.

This place reminds me alot like Lucille's smokehouse BBQ and grill back home in California. Actually it did alot! I loved it though! The whole restaurant was absolutely adorable and they had a gorgeous patio area. We went in for lunch so we didn't really get to try anything they specialized in. We both had pulled pork, & oh my gosh it was so good! And their steamed veggies were perfectly cooked. Our server was cute and very friendly. We were her last table I could tell (I'm a server myself) anyways she was still very attentive and polite didn't make us feel rushed at all. I'll definitely be back for dinner!

I  visit Phoenix frequently from Houston and I must say this place is one of the best. From burgers to ribs you cannot go wrong with any entrée at Bobby Q's. Tonight I tried the smokehouse burger and was extremely impressed with the flavor and quality. Portion size is it generous and the staff is top notch. I always look forward to my next visit to Phoenix!

Anyone that knows anything about BBQ and large chain restaurants knows that it is extremely hard to mass produce BBQ and still make it delicious. For this very reason I was skeptical about going to Bobby Q. Then I looked at the ratings and saw that the restaurant has a greater than 4 star rating. I HAD TO GIVE IT A SHOT! 

I ordered the full rack of ribs and loaded baked potato with mac and cheese on the side. WHOA! I must say that Bobby Q thoroughly impressed me! The smokey taste and tenderness of the ribs was out of control. Not to mention, when I was done, I was full as a tick! I actually thought I was the one in the back of the restaurant Q'ing it up on the smoker. But after I woke up from my daydream, I realized that Bobby Q is or SHOULD BE a staple in the greater Phoenix area. 

When I come back to Phoenix, this is definitely one of the restaurants that I will have to indulge in a repeat visit, just to make sure I wasn't in a dream of bliss and desire. 

Bobby Q's... Phoenix is supposed to be well known for Mexican food and taco shops, well, my friends, you have made your mark, I will remember Bobby Q's for BBQ!

Great service & lunch was amazing.  Ordered baked potato with all the fixin's (it was amazing) and the bartender made me tasty lemon drops.
 will go back again and again

It was good, not over the top great.  We had the smoked brisket.  It was tender with good flavor but fatty.  I had two slices that were pure fat.  I mentioned that to our server and it was shrugged off. The Mac and cheese was nice and creamy.  Veggies were just ok.  The best part was the little donuts they brought us at the end of the meal.  I won't order the brisket again. The atmosphere is really cool.  Enough so that I may try happy hour.

Omg some of the best food I have had in a long time. We ordered the Q rolls as an appitizer. This is basically a brisket egg roll, these were yummy. I ordered the 12 oz. Top sirloin,  I was a little disappointed that it was not quite the way I order it. The mac and cheese was just awesome. I dare say it was almost better than my dads. My husband order the sirloin as well and enjoyed it but didn't care for the shoestring fries. All in all a good meal.

Holy moly! This place did not disappoint and once again the Yelp reviews are correct! Service, flavors, portions, and the surprise brown bag of goodies at the end of our meal made this place onto my "I will return" list and it is highly recommended. Great BBQ!
Pretty damn good BBQ.  The cornbread that comes before the meal is also delicious.  I like that it is closer to where I live, because I usually have to drive further to get to a decent restaurant.
BBQ sauce was tasty! Atmosphere was very nice and good was served quick and tasted good. My only complaint is that I found some of the meat to be a bit fatty.
Came in from San Diego to watch the Angels play and the service this place was horrible!!!!!

I am beginning to think that the reason I love barbecue restaurants so much is the fact that I ALWAYS get two meals out of one visit.  That figures out, on average, to about 7-8 bucks a meal, and you can't really beat that for great food!

The husband and I decided to go here on Friday night, and the place was busy, but not so busy that we were able to be immediately seated.  Our service was fantastic.  I'm beginning to think that restaurants are recognizing our faces from our pictures because this was beyond good service.  Our server was super quick and very sweet.  Our food came out impossibly fast too.

The food was delicious.  I ordered the brisket platter, of course, and it was super yummy.  I got a big fat helping of tender brisket and two sides.  I chose the pecan cole slaw and the mac and cheese.  We also got cornbread with our meals.  The cornbread is really yummy, but strangely shaped into little disks.  The cole slaw was very good, with a great sweet flavor that was enhanced by the crunch of the pecans.  The mac and cheese was literally rib-stickin good.  It was the super thick and creamy kind that makes me weak in the knees.  The barbecue sauce served on the meat is fairly minimal, but they bring you plenty of extra so you don't have to worry.  

I would definitely come back here.  I loved the food, the service and the atmosphere.  I would definitely recommend this for good sit down service BBQ.

A roadtrip would not be complete without local BBQ and Bobby's does not disappoint!

Fancy smancy table service
Dark and cool with bar seating
Rotisserie chick and bragging about the ribs. Alex was friendly and rattled off drink specials. Other servers were chatting with friends at the bar and one, blond one dipped into her cleavage for something. I hope she washes her hands before serving up a meal. Now I look around, this is a breaking ground for hooters. Low cut and falling out. Not a fan of that. 
Bobby Q Amber Ale (Sonoran Brewing) is too light with a bitter bite. Not my type of amber but they tried. 
2 meats, brisket & sausage w/ mac&cheese and...the pecan coleslaw? What the heck for $18.  
Pulled pork sandwich $10
2 meat with pork and brisket 
Ranch House Salad
Corn bread (pucks) of sweet, warm goodness.

Sides were great! The beans with zest, the M&C takes me back to old school cafeteria, the potato salad was fantastic and the slaw was great with the pecan. 
Brisket was the clear winner from the table and we all loved the smoky sausage. The pulled pork was a disappointing third as it was dry. Good thing I went with brisket. 
Two thumbs up here kids. Well worth your time and money. Yelp check in brought a 10% off the total tab too.

Ordered the Combination of Half a Slab of Baby Back Ribs and Catfish, along with Baked Potato,  Mac and Cheese and Roasted Corn. Quite a complete meal that we shared it among 2 people and still could not eat all of it. The Baby Back Ribs were super tender and moist and as a cut each rib, the meat would just fall off the bone. The Catfish was good, would have been nice with some tarter sauce. The sides were average, not great, but not bad. The baked potato was loaded with butter, sour cream, chives and Bacon so that was a winner, the mac and cheese was good but when the waitress said that is their recommendation and the best side, I expected a little more. The Roasted Corn when we ordered expected a ear of corn roasted over a grill, but what we received was an inch of 2 ends of corn on the cob and loose corn kernels in a small bowl which could have been corn from a can.

Salmon Dinner was a generous slab of fish and was well prepared. It was grilled and had a good crisp grilled skin which was very good and it came with 2 sides which my daughter choose the mac and cheese plus vegetables. 

Cornbread is very good and the waiter was generous enough to give us another basket. 

At the end if your meal, wait for the sugar donuts! Served warm they are killer!

Overall experience was very good with service and ability to park while restaurant was busy.

The food and the staff here are amazing. Best prime rib I have had in a long time. 
Yesterday was my wife's 45th birthday and we had some guests that surprised her from out of town and we chose to celebrate at Bobby Q's on 27th ave. There was a minor problem with our wait time and our seating and I was a little upset. 
That did not last long. After talking to the amazingly awesome manager Taylor, he had us sitting at a perfect table and had two of his best waitresses Shauntel and Stacie waiting on us. Let me tell you that this was the best restaurant experience that I have ever had and I was truelly impressed. Taylor, Shauntel, and Stacie went above and beyond to make my wife's birthday celebration a very memorable one. The food was just as amazing as the staff.
I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for the best BBQ in Phoenix!!!

Called for a reservation...needed to wait an hour to get in, but I would rather chill in our hotel suite than trying to awkwardly stay out of the way, waiting for a table for an hour there. We got there and were instantly greeted and instantly seated! So far everything was fantastic! Our server, Carmela, came right over...and was super sweet, complete with great service through out our meal! I had a cup of baked potato soup which was good...not fabulous...but good. The corn bread, on the other hand, was amazing...not sure how they made it so perfectly...but I need it everyday! The brisket was excellent, the roni's and cheese was scrumptious! The shoestring fries...were shoestring fries...nothing special...but ultimately sides don't really matter! The portions were very generous, couldn't finish my meal...and I really wanted to! And then the little Thank Q donut holes were a nice, sweet little touch of dessert! Unfortunately, we live in CA, so we won't be able to come back...unless through some kismet, chance of serendipity we end up back at the second bbq heaven on earth!! If you live by here or find yourself at one of the nearby hotels, then by all means stop in for a great, hearty meal!

THE BEST RIBS I'VE HAD HANDS DOWN!! The meat was perfectly cooked and the portions are so big for such a good price! My bf and I shared a half rack of ribs and got two sides and were completely stuffed, all for $20! They even gave us extra corn bread as an appetizer! And free dessert! Love this place!

What a great place. The manager Laura greeted us and she was so friendly that it just set the tone of the rest of our lunch. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Had the sampler and the baby backs and if I had to pick, the pulled pork was our favorite. Corn bread was great as was the potato salad. Apple cobbler was great as well. Will definitely return if I'm ever in Phoenix again!

Wow... Where to start. Pulled up and the parking lot was packed. Almost turned around and went somewhere else but everyone I had talked to about this place said it was amazing food... And it was my birthday, so being a special occasion, we waited for a parking spot.

Got seated in less than 3 minutes. Only draw back... Right by the cooking chickens. Really the hottest seat in the place!  But it was a cold night so we didn't complain. And the table is right by the kitchen but it wasn't loud like most restaurants.

Ordered cocktails and an appetizer. Mine was supposed to be served in a pineapple but arrived in a regular glass. Kind of a let down. But it was strong and good. And that's where the issues stopped.

Ordered the Spinach Artichoke dip. SO GOOD! The tomatillo salsa that accompanied it was devine.

I ordered the Jumbo baked potato with brisket and my mom got the brisket platter. The brisket is so tinder and delicious it just crumbles. We asked for extra BBQ sauce and the server brought out the original and Carolina. Their Carolina is a red sauce and not a Carolina gold. Peppery and spicy. But good. We both preferred the original. More on the sweeter side.  Both ordered the Mac & Cheese and my mom ordered the Pecan Cole Slaw. Mac & Cheese was heavenly. And mom loved the slaw.

I have a walnut allergy so it sadly limited my desert fare. Ended up with the Bread Pudding. It was really good... But by that point we could only eat a few bites as we were stuffed and were taking home leftovers. 

The staff was very nice and spent time with us. And the GM spent time with us on the patio talking about the company history and transition to BBQ (we were long time customers of their Bobby McGees in California).

In summation.... GO!  You won't be disappointed! I've been back since to order the baked potato to go. Even better the second time around!

The restaurant was packed and even though there was a wait list we got seated right away.  However, we had to wait at our table a really long time and I think they forgot about us but the waiter apologized and gave us a free appetizer.  In terms of the food - appetizer 4, baby backs 5, spare ribs 5, chicken 4, sausage 3, mac and cheese 4, roasted corn 5, corn bread 4, potato salad 4, cinnamon sugar donuts 4.  Overall, really excellent barbecue.

My husband had requested BBQ ribs for our anniversary dinner so I searched yelp and found Bobby Qs. We live in Goodyear so it was a bit of a drive but worth every mile. The cornbread was warm and fresh, we had the Whole hog platter and have enough leftover for at least one more meal. The baby back ribs were melt-in-your-mouth good, the pulled pork and brisket to die for, the grilled corn sweet and buttery.  It is now our new favorite BBQ restaurant. Laura, the manager, was friendly and very warm.

Well I always heard about Bobby Q's and when I got a chance for a carry out I jumped on it...I should have went with my son and his dad. They had been there the night before so I munched on their leftovers when they first went (Flintstone beef bone)...man my mouth is watering just thinking about their beef ribs and corn. Awesome and Oh so good. Well I got their chicken (and mind you I was ribbed out from munching on leftovers). My son and his dad got the ribs again and when they came with my order (the chicken) I was very very very disappointed. So bad that I was trading it for just a bite of the rib. My son liked it and thought I was crazy but it just looked like 1 breast or cut thigh. I was looking for a two pc or something. Oh well. I enjoyed the corn, the cornbread and the gravy. All in all I will stick to their beef ribs when I go.
Great barbecue tucked into a not so busy area. I got the  pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese. Such a good meal and really cool place. I will definitely be back!

Amazing fall off the bone, pull apart with a fork, melt in your mouth BBQ. Had the baby back ribs and brisket. The ribs were very meaty and just fell of the bone, so tender. The brisket was also very tender and juicy. BBQ sauce was solid as were the mashed potatoes and mac n cheese. Some of the best BBQ I've had in a while!

Took an hour to get our food however the hostess apologized and complemented our table with free desserts.  Large portions are served and you don't leave hungry. The food was amazing and drinks were OK. I highly recommend the ribs, they're Soooo amazing! Another of our new favorites. The neighborhood was a bit sketchy though but ok.

I really enjoyed this restaurant! We went here for a group dinner and it was a bit loud and hard to hear everyone at the table, but the food was amazing! I thought the brisket was one of the best I've ever had, if not THE best. It was so juicy and tender and very flavorful. Also, the baby back ribs were also to die for. They give you corn bread to start that is super delicious and end with FRESH mini donuts that were just fried. I can't wait to go back!
